Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Pool and Grounds on the Perfect Beach!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara L
Reviews.Content: We were in Building 4 with a wonderful view of everything; the grounds, pool, beach and ocean. Our room was perfect. It was roomy and clean and quiet. It had an extremely comfortable bed and a wonderful big flat screen TV. We could hear the ocean waves from the room if we left the sliding door open just a little. From what we could see from the grounds, any room would have a nice view, just some are further away from the ocean. We had a couple of breakfasts in the Terrace Cafe and it was wonderful. When our TV remote stopped working, someone was there with a new one in minutes. Room service was wonderful also! I don't have a single complaint, except that the weather wasn't as beautiful as the room!

Reviews.Title: “Resort beautiful, Room awful”
Reviews.Author: SGV4610
Reviews.Content: The resort is in a great location. The outdoors is beautiful. That being said, the room did not live up to expectations. The room assigned was designed for a person in a wheelchair which isn't a problem; however, I hate to think of someone being stuck in this room. It is located next to a loud elevator that one can hear through the wall, even the ping of the bell. The sink leaked. The switch on desk lamp did not work. The lanai overlooked the roof of a walkway. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location bad room”
Reviews.Author: Radnuke
Reviews.Content: One of the worst rooms I have ever had! Sink leaked, room had no storage and was noisy. However, staff were nice but not very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get much better than this!”
Reviews.Author: Monk08
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great week at the Sheraton Maui. The location is the best on the beach, with great beachwalks to the north and the south. The people were fabulous, they could not do enough for you, even though the hotel was full. We switched rooms with no problem, when we found ourselves on the lowest level facing the tennis courts to a great room on the 4th floor. The rooms are a little dated, but very comfortable, you could be any Sheraton hotel and have the same room. The amenities are great - coffee maker and a little fridge for milk and cold white wine. I was there with my 12 year old daughter and there was plenty to do for both of us, from Yoga and Pilates, to a great run on either beachwalk, to just lying by the pool or snorkeling at Black Rock - we were never bored or hungry, with lots of places to eat. The food was a little pricey, but to be expected at any hotel. There were lots of dining choices both on the property and within a 10 minutes walk. Overall it was a fabulous vacation and with the free shuttle to Lahina, we didn't even need a car!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: laptopolivia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights using Sheraton points. The location is great- on the far end of the beach so it's more quiet than the other hotels down the beach. It's a nice walk along the boardwalk down to Whaler's Village. We saw a monk seal sunning on the beach. Our room had a nice ocean view- we watched the whales jumping out of the water from our balcony. The hotel is older and feels a bit dated. However, our room seemed to have been recently refurbished. It was rather large and nicely appointed. The pool is beautiful but it was too cold to comfortably go in for more than 5 min. During a warmer time of year I am sure it would be fine. It was difficult to get lounge chairs around the pool. The service could use some work- we sat out in lounge chairs for a few hours and not once did a server ask us if they could get us anything. We ate lunch at the Cliff Dive Bar once as we didn't feel like going anywhere. The bill came to $54.00 for 2 appetizers (pulled pork tacos and mahi mahi tacos), 1 daquiri and 1 iced tea. Hotel prices are always high but this was a bit much. The service was terrible- we sat there for 5 mins. before anyone acknowleged us and it took a long time to get our food even though they weren't very busy. Strangely, the prices in the gift shops weren't bad. Unfortunately we missed the cliff dive ceremony. It was raining the first night and they didn't have it and th other nights we were out for dinner. There was a coupon for a free tote bag in our room. It is really a ploy to get you to go to a time share presentation. We just got the free bag and didn't bother doing the presentation. There is a $25 per day resort fee to be aware of. They give you 1 free night of valet parking- make sure you get your car before the end of the free period or you will have to pay. Self-parking and internet is free with the resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui Resort & Spa - Exactly what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: mel_emerald
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at the Sheraton at the end of February 2012 for the start of our honeymoon. As we left the day after our wedding, the Sheraton was exactly what we needed after all the hype of a wedding! We were pleasently surprised to find we had been upgraded to a suite that overlooked one of the pools and ocean. What a view.... The staff were very helpful and freindly, always saying Aloha as they pass you in the corridor which is nice. February seemed to be a good time to stay as it was busy enough to have some atmosphere, but not so busy that you had to fight for a pool lounge or a seat at the bar. We ate at the hotel restaurant where the food was very nice. The Cliff Dive Bar was great. Right next to the pool area overlooking the beach. It provides the perfect location for a few cocktails during happy hour while watching the sunset and the ceremonial cliff dive which also occurs at sunset. We used the fitness centre which was fairly well equiped with cardio equipment as well as weight machines and free weights. The Sheraton is located at the end of a beach strip. It is the last hotel so people don't really need to walk down there unless they have a purpose so it was never really busy down our end of the beach. It is only a 5-10min walk to whalers village which has quite a few restaurants and dining areas that cater for breakfast, lunch, dinner and drinks. There are also a range of shops as well but not too many. We really didn't do anything in Maui expect relax and recover on the ebach and by the pool and it was exactly what we need. Quiet, but not boring. Just perfect. we were sorry we only booked for three nights. If we return to Hawaii (which i am sure we will), we would definatly choose to come back to Maui and stay at the Sheraton rather then head to busy Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Paradise Getaway”
Reviews.Author: mrdeyuma
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent almost a week at the Sheraton Maui Resort & Spa. We have visited other island resorts in the Pacific and in the Caribbean, but this one was spectacular. Starting with the Ka'anapali Beach Resort's executive assistant who booked our travel, the entire experience was absolutely wonderful. I needed a vacation and this resort property greatly exceeded expectations. We were given an oceanview room, and I can't describe the breath-taking view of chrystal blue waters each day. This was our first visit to Maui, but it certainly won't be our last. It rained some days during our visit, but never too much to prevent our walking on that beautiful beach or strolling around the historic little town of Lahaina. There were lots of shops to peruse. We chose to rent a car because we planned to visit the falls, but the Resort provided a free trolley to go anywhere from the property to Lahaina. Restaurants are in abundance, and they were all great. I know this sounds like an ad for the Sheraton Maui Resort & Spa, but it is not. Our experience was fantastic, and we will come here many times in the future.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite island!”
Reviews.Author: ConnieSears
Reviews.Content: All in all the hotel was okay. We were all inclusive. The room was not what I had hoped for. We were supposed to have ocean view and had a view of the tennis courts instead. The service at the poolside bars was not the best. I think they were overwhelmed by all the people. It took a very long time to get what we ordered. The breakfast buffet was great. They had a very good choice of things to eat. The location is fantastic as it is within walking distance to Whaler's Village. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute paradise!”
Reviews.Author: alixrose
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Maui was actually heaven on Earth. I could not fault one single thing about the hotel/resort. It is in the best location right at Black Rock which makes for excellent snorkeling! The facilities are world class and the staff friendly and helpful. We never left the resort other than to stroll along the beach front. Absolute paradise! A must stay!

Reviews.Title: “Just What We Hoped For!”
Reviews.Author: Danny D
Reviews.Content: For our 60th wedding anniverary, we hoped for a holiday to make a special occasion really special. Staying at the Sheraton Maui Resort did just that! The hotel and all its amenities were absolutely first class. With different sorts of dining facilities to chose from, including Japanese and pool side, and an especially well-equipped exercise room - you can run on the treadmills both inside and out on the balconies overlooking the ocean - you could put on extra pounds and take them off again at the same time. The inter-connecting swimming pools (features among the 10 best in the world) were always fun, and the pool-side service was great, including being able to watch the sunset torch-lighting ceremony with the Hawaiian divers taking off from the 60ft high Black Rock. The rooms were always spotlessly clean, the beds very comfortable, and having an ocean-view room even made waking up early a pleasure. All the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, and the service at the reception desk was very good. (The only small criticism is that if, because of your flight arrival time and the bus drive from the airport, you get to the hotel after 10:00 pm, there are no dining facilities available. So either pack an extra sandwich or prevail upon the night staff to rustle up a bag of peanuts, as they oblingingly did for us.) The Sheraton Maui is partnered with the two Westin Hotels at Kaanapali, so you can use your guest card to dine in their restaurants if you wish and have it added to your Sheraton bill - very convenient. There is a frequent courtesy hotel bus service between the hotel and the nearby village of Lahaina so you never need to worry about having to get a taxi to get around. Also within a short walking distance is the Whalers Village, with a whaling museum and a variety of shops and both short-order and full service dining rooms. This was our first trip to Maui but we look forward to going back there again and, again, staying at the Shreton Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Service is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: kintfam5
Reviews.Content: From the moment we were on the property, the service was great. Everyone is genuinely nice and happy to see you. No one seemed stressed out. From the front desk to the bellman to the housekeeping, everyone was very nice and accomodating. The pool area is much better and bigger/more spread out than the Westin. In fact, there seemed to be a lot of people from the Westin over here. But you can always find a chair. There is a policy that you cannot put your things on the chair to claim it for later. We've been a few places where you have to get up at the crack of dawn to claim a chair! Food at the hotel is mediocre. You're better off going off property. (I highly suggest Lahaina Grill--best food!) If you do stay for bar food, the menu at the MaiTai bar is better. Front desk was VERY helpful. We requested a junior suite and we had a clean, nice room in building 2 on the first floor. HIgher up would have had a better view of the ocean. They suggested we move to a larger suite on black rock. That view was great! We were not unhappy at all with the first room--THEY knew what we were looking for and suggested it for us. I thought that was cool. The Spa is amazing---have a glass of water, it is delicious! They put cane sugar, vanilla, and oranged slices in it. It's like candy! If you're debating which hotel to go to, look no further. Sheraton Maui understands ALOHA!

Reviews.Title: “Still the best location on Ka'anapali- but room quality varies”
Reviews.Author: MollyPaws1
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Sheraton Maui. Still think this hotel has the best location in Ka'anapli, but a few points that could use some work. We booked 5 days using Starwood points and were put in a standard resort view room. The room itself was fine, you could see the furniture had been recently updated, but the bathroom was another story. The shower leaked, the grout was moldy and the shower head looked like it had never been cleaned. If we had paid for this room (even standard rooms aren't "cheap") we would have definitely complained, although it probably would not have done much good, we were told the hotel was full at check-in anyway. We were also annoyed that housekeeping came in everyday to clean the room despite having the "Do Not Disturb" sign up. Other than that, we still really like this hotel. The location at Black Rock can't be beat. We enjoyed the spa, the Mai Tai bar (better than Cliff Diver Bar) and the pool. All in all, the standard resort view rooms (we were in Building 3) are fine for just a "room" and base for other activities and enjoying the amenities of the hotel. But for the full experience, I would recommend the Deluxe Ocean rooms in Building 6, the rooms are far superior and the views can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Beach Resort”
Reviews.Author: llhayes
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here and it was perfect. Our ocean view room was upgraded to a beautiful suite on the 2nd floor, one flight of stairs to the pool and beach. We could watch whales from our balcony. We also had a great view of the resort luau. We brought our binoculars and spent every day on the beach watching whales. The resort rents beach chairs for $12.50 each and umbrellas for $25.00 per day. Considering you can rent them from 8am to 5pm it's a great price for a day's entertainment. You can also rent chairs from other shops or bring your own. We liked the convenience of renting on sight and having them set up. The staff anchors the umbrella for you so it won't blow away. This is a great snorkel beach. You can rent all equipment on site or at any of the rental shops in town. We chose to drive the 10 minutes to Cheeseburger In Paradise in Lahaina for a moderately priced, delicious breakfast each morning. The restaurant has ocean views and a fun ambience with a friendly, fun staff. When in Lahaina be sure to visit the banyan tree. Amazing! While in town we could also get picnic supplies for the beach at Safeway or Subway. If you shop at Safeway be sure to apply for their club card for a price break. We bought a styrofoam cooler at Safeway, but you can also rent a regular cooler at any snorkel shop. We like Boss Frog's in the mall next to Safeway. The staff at the resort couldn't be nicer or more attentive. While the resort is beautiful, it is laid back and casual, come as you are. We had dinner each night at the Cliff Dive Bar. The food is delicious and less expensive than in most restaurants. The bar is right on the ocean so you can watch whales and see the sunset cliff dive ceremony. They also have live music and hula dancers each evening. It's just a relaxing, beautiful place to have lunch or dinner. We didn't fly out until 11pm our last day, but the resort still let use all the facilities and gave us a keycard to the fitness center so we could shower before we left for the airport. The center has everything you need to clean up after a day at the beach. If you are going to Maui for the beach (and you should be!) the Sheraton at Black Rock if everything you hope it will be. Absolutely perfect!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: Nancy R
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 9 day stay at the Sheraton Maui. The location is perfect and the beach is the best. We snorkeled most every day - crowded later in the day but still room to get out to the end of black rock. The staff was friendly and helpful. We were upgraded to an ocean front room (rather than ocean view) and were in building 4. We liked our location at the hotel - were on the first floor and would have preferred to be up higher, but it was very convenient to be there. Buffet breakfasts were included and were wonderful. If we went to breakfast later, there was a line, but it moved fairly quickly. The room was very clean - our maid did a super job. The bed and linens were very nice - towels a little thin, but okay and the shower was great! Would definitely consider going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Oceanfront Dream”
Reviews.Author: Caitlyn S
Reviews.Content: Stayed for our 4th anniversary for a week using points. Upon arrival we were greeted by friendly staff members who walked us over to our room. Our room was oceanfront and we could not have asked for a better view. From our balcony we were able to watch the cliff divers at night and the snorklers in the morning. We even saw whales and sea turtles from our balcony while enjoying morning coffee. Wish we could return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Darlene E
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Maui and as SPG members we were able to stay with our points. We requested connecting rooms with an ocean view and that is exactly what we were given. Front desk staff were extremely nice and helpful. Rooms were very modern and clean. My husband and 15 yr. old took a scuba lesson which included a dive and loved it. They also enjoyed some beautiful sights while snorkelling at Black Rock. My younger son and I enjoyed the beach but found the pool very cold. We had the breakfast buffet our first morning and although it was good was not worth the $95.00 it cost for the four of us. Lots of fantastic restaurants a short shuttle ride away in Lahina. Speaking of the shuttles they are fantastic and a great way to get around. Will definitely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A Piece of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: sungirl18
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a week at the Sheraton Maui, and it was absolutely wonderful. It was my first trip to Maui and I was in complete awe with how beautiful it truly is. The Sheraton is a fabulous location ; perfect beach, wonderful view and walking distance to Whalers village. I was curious as to what to expect when it came to some reviews concerning the dated hotel, and semi-mediocre service but we were very pleased with everything. Location: The hotel is set by Black Rock which is wonderful for scuba diving and snorkeling (I do not know first hand, but some friends were raving about how incredible it was). It is about a 10 â€“ 15 min walk to Whalers Village which has a wonderful variety of stores and restaurants (including ABC which sells beer, snacks, wine and hard liquor â€“ good to know as drinks can become quite pricey at the hotel). The beach walk is great !! We walked it every morning and it will take you along the beach for about a mile past all the other resorts and hotels There were several mornings that we were able to see whales not too far from shore (close enough to get pictures). Rooms: (We were in building 3 floor 5) We had the junior Ocean View suite and it was beyond perfect. We could sit out on the patio and watch the sun set. It was a spacious room with a sitting area which worked out well as I was awake at 2:00am due to jet-lag, and I would go and read while my husband slept. The room (mainly the bathtub area) was a bit dated, but really not too bad in the grand scheme of things. Only negative was we had 2 double beds which made for a snug fit. There was an ipod docking station which was nice. The bed was very comfortable as were the pillows and duvet â€“ so no problem sleeping. The room service menu had a good variety and the portions were perfect. We had dinner in our room one night and breakfast 3 mornings â€“ the presentation and promptness of delivery were excellent. The smoothies were delicious and the macadamia nut pancakes were fantastic ( I highly recommend them). Pool: Yes the pool is very cold. In the end you just become used to it. They have several small bean bags floating around which helps keep at least part of your body from freezing. The layout is very nice and sort of weaves itself around the beach area. There is a small slide as well as a hot tub in a grotto style setting. Pool Bars: There are two bars / restaurant areas by the pool, one at each end of the pool area (The Cliff Dive Bar and The Mai Tai Bar). The drinks are awesome! You have to try the Passion Mai Tai. At $10 a drink though they can add up quickly. The burgers are very tasty as were the fish tacos. The service was wonderful !!!! Cannot complain at all. The waitresses were very friendly and helpful and were always there just as your drink was ready to be refilled. Spa: I treated my self to the Queen Bee facial, and it was exceptional. I couldnâ€™t stop touching my face because my skin had never felt so smooth. The Spa has a wonderful atmosphere, very relaxing. I would highly recommend it. The Black Rock Steak and Seafood: We had dinner here on our final night. It took a very long time to be seated as it had started raining and the number of tables were limited when it came to availability. But it was worth the wait. Our waitress was excellent (very knowledgeable, friendly and attentive). For starters, I had the chicken consommÃ© with lemongrass which was so delicious, and my husband thoroughly enjoyed his salad. We both had the steak, which was prepared perfectly. It was a lovely way to end our stay in Maui. I highly recommend for anyone to stay at the Sheraton. It made for a heavenly get away.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it!”
Reviews.Author: Theresa O
Reviews.Content: As a flight attendant, I have stayed at almost all hotel brands. Starwood (Sheraton, Westin) are my go-to hotels when I travel for fun. Of course I expected a certain level of service and Sheraton Maui lived up to my expectations. The property is beautiful; clean and well maintained. The staff are pleasant. The hotel was full and luckily, my husband and I were upgraded to the Ohana suite. (YAY!) We had to give up our 'partial ocean view' room but it was worth it. We were given a suite on the ground level which I enjoyed. No need for the 'partial ocean view' when one can walk from our private lanai straight to the beach and pool area! There is a $26/day resort fee which covers internet/parking/activities. One activity I enjoyed was the introduction to SNUBA. That activity was completely out of my comfort zone but the instructor made it fun. I am glad I had the opportunity to try it. The hotel is a great location for snorkeling; it's the closest property to Black Rock. Kaanapali Beach is beautiful. The only negative was the bed- I found that it was not as soft and comfy as beds in other Sheratons in which I have stayed. Overall, a nice hotel that I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great place!”
Reviews.Author: prusteeby
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Sheraton. It was a great hotel,helpful staff telling us what restaurants to go to. The beds in the room were very hard. Didn't eat at the hotel so I don't know about the food. Very close walk to Whalers village. Well kept grounds. Housekeeping seem under staffed. I would go here again in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kaww0502
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon at the Sheraton Maui and loved our visit. The service there in impeccable, the staff is friendly, helpful, warm, thoughtful and caring! We had a room that overlooked the ocean where we would awake to the fragrant smells of the plummeria blossoms, the ocean breeze, the chirping of the birds and saw turtles swimming in the ocean below our lanai. What a beautiful place. We were right near Black Rock where there is excellent snorkeling. We were close to other hotels at Kaanapali to visit, see their gift shops, and dine in some of their restaurants too. We're also just a short oceanfront drive to Lahaina which was another fun spot to visit and see. It was suggested to us to take a short excursion by boat to Molokini and we had a fabulous time! We took an afternoon trip with Maui Dive Shop and had the best time snorkeling and getting a tour from the captain and his wonderful crew. We would highly recommend the Sheraton, Maui Dive Shop, and a fun drive to Hana. Maui is a beautiful place to stay and we plan on returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location location!”
Reviews.Author: kmts5
Reviews.Content: Black rock is a great spot. Get out early and snorkel before the crowds hit and enjoy a peaceful early morning swim with the turtles. The pool is nice but a bit chilly. We passed on the upgrade and did just fine w/ 2 adults 2 kids (w a rollaway) in a regular room. It was a bit dated (tub not shower) but clean and decent beds. We were lucky enough to get ground floor right near the pool pathway and tennis courts yet convenient to the lobby. You have to trade the view but we were rarely in the room but to sleep and change. Starwood loyalty pays off. The shower head is hand held and ours broke off, they were very accommodating in getting us a room to shower in ASAP so we could make our luau, and had it fixed before we even left for dinner. FYI, The new shower head was so much better, old one barely ran. The in-room coffee makers stink and Starbucks gets quite a line if you go later. The pool bar/restaurants have 2 different menus so vary what side you sit on. Overall a nice stay, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: BillyMaysHere
Reviews.Content: Even though I stayed in the Gilligan's Island part of the hotel (a ten minute walk to the beach/pool/lobby), I was afforded a georgous oceanview room with a view of the ocean and nothing else. Absolutely luxuriously appointed and spacous room. For the money, one of the values on West Maui

Reviews.Title: “sheraton”
Reviews.Author: 4oakley
Reviews.Content: I read that that the sheraton has a top ten pool maybe looks wise but the water is so cold that nobody wants to go in!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great pool n location for low key snorkling”
Reviews.Author: Defender09
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay here. They gave me an ohana suite for my upgrade as a platinum member. The suite is nice but not big enough for 2 adults and two kids. I asked for a bigger room but no luck. It was fine but not luxurious. What I love about this hotel is the pool and black rock. The pool is a very fun wrap around the bar/restaurant black rock type pool. It has waterfalls n a slide and a hidden hot tub. Its very kid friendly. Black rock is a low key snorkling option right off the property and we love it. Safe for my 6 year old and I. We saw a turtle!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic beach”
Reviews.Author: KanatatripperS
Reviews.Content: This was my favourite place on our whole four island trip. The beach was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Had an amazing time!”
Reviews.Author: Katy H
Reviews.Content: So close to the beach, we went snorkeling everyday and saw amazing fish and giant sea turtles on a regular basis!! UNREAL experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: jah1078
Reviews.Content: This is going to be short and sweet. The Sheraton Resort and Spa Maui is simply the best. Every detail that was needed for the week was handled with promptness and a smile. The beach is AWESOME and is a very short walk to a number of shops (Whaler's Village). My wife and I never had to wait for an elevator. It was freaky at times, we would walk towards the elevator, and the door would open with nobody on it. Beautiful grounds, spread out to not give a crowded feeling. Worth every penny. We didn't dine at the resort because we had a number of great recommendations from friends abotu local joints, but from what I hear, top notch. I can't wait to return to Maui and the Sheraton is where we will stay. Mahalo to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a pretty good location”
Reviews.Author: JesseKats
Reviews.Content: The hotel has nice rooms and a nice beach but blackrock kinda takes away from the beach since you cant walk up and down the beach both ways. I really cant complain about anything but there are nicer places to stay in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, staff not so good"”
Reviews.Author: morgan1876
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton for 3 nights. This was one of four hotels we stayed in while in HI. Others were in OutRigger Oahu, Fairmont Orchid Kona, and Mariott Maui. All hotels were very nice but I would have to say that the staff, besides the cleaning and maintenance staff, were not up to par. From the moment we arrived we could sense a weird vibe from the staff. The front desk person who checked us in had a bad attitude. We tried to have breakfast one morning. We were seated but no one ever stopped to ask what we wanted. We left the restaurant after 15 minutes, never having breakfast. Other days we made it easy by going to Starbucks. The hotel property is very nice and in a good location to walk to shops and some good bars.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: DocSpoon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Maui for a week. Grounds are just beautiful, as is the beach. We snorkeled several times at the Rock and saw lots of fish, but not the turtle. Had good food on the grounds as well as Whalers Village, which is a very easy walk from the hotel. We also used the shuttle to go into Lahaina and found this to be easy and convenient. We were able to park our rental car very close to our building, and in and out was a breeze for our daily excursions. Overall, we were extremely pleased with our stay, and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great customer service”
Reviews.Author: MarleneIllinois
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Black Rock and loved having the ocean as our front yard. We loved hearing the waves and watching the whales from the lanai. The front desk staff was very helpful. Noah gave us a warm welcome and Evelyn helped us out twice. The cleaning staff and grounds crew were uniformly friendly, always greeting us with hello or aloha. We went snorkeling from the hotel beach and saw colorful fish and two turtles. We didnâ€™t swim in the pools, but I did stick a toe in and it was pretty cold. We had the breakfast buffet three times, but I really wouldnâ€™t recommend it for the price. Two of those days, we had early tours scheduled and the hotel buffet started at 6:30. Other places opened later. The buffet costs $28 each and itâ€™s really nothing special. The fruit is very nice, but everything else is really standard fare. Watching the cliff diver from the bar area was very nice. Iâ€™d definitely recommend the hotel, especially Black Rock. Yes, itâ€™s a bit of a walk to the main part of the hotel, but you just canâ€™t beat the view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great resort”
Reviews.Author: Michael P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui Resort as part of our honeymoon, and were really impressed with the resort, and was an ideal location to stay for our honeymoon. Firstly the location, was probably the best out of all of the resorts all along this stretch of beach. Ideally located next to the point/rock into the beach, there was a nightly diving demonstration at sunset off the rock, and was fantastic that you could just swim off the beach with your snorkel and mask and be surrounded by tropical fish only 50-100m in. The beach is also quite nice in this area and great for laying on the sun or going for a swim. The Sheraton in conjunction with their Westin sister resorts provide a shuttle bus service (no additional charge as included in daily resort charge) which takes you on the 5-10 min drive into the township. For those that aren't aware, pretty much all of the main accommodation and resorts are located a few miles out of town....probably too far to walk, so rather than getting a short taxi or maybe a city bus, the free shuttle is a great benefit which is available to only Sheraton and Westin customers. The resort itself had plenty to do, but importantly was a great place to relax. There are a few poolside bars to enjoy, plenty of poolside chairs/lounges (also overlooking the beach which was right next to there as well) and some beautiful settings/lawns. The resort restaraunt was good for the buffet breakfast (which we had included in our package), but could also have our included breakfast at either of the nearby Westin resorts as well (which was nice for a change and different variety). We did have an issue with some equipment noise coming through our room which did impact our sleeping at night, however the resort was good about looking into resolving this and I certainly wouldn't want to impact on what would otherwise be a super review for the resort on the basis of an isolated incident in a single room (I would expect that no other room would have this issue so you should be pretty safe). Was certainly not the cheapest accommodation around, and whilst is an excellent place to stay, you do pay for it. We found the price of the rooms fairly high and the drinks etc at he bar were probably at the higher end (outside the daily happy hours), however I would expect this for a resort like this in such a great location. Would highly recommend the Sheraton Maui and hopefully we can stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best place on Maui”
Reviews.Author: bufflehead123
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. We've stayed on Maui in a number of places, and this is our favourite. The grounds, the staff, the beach, the view, the location - all are wonderful. It's true that the pool is a little chilly. And the only time I would recommend eating in their restaurant is for breakfast. But their outdoor bar/ grills have wonderful food.The pool is a lot of fun, with a river, a kid's pool, a mini waterslide, and a hot tub. The beach offers both swimming and snorkelling. For walking, you are right in the middle of "the strip", so you can walk the beach walk in either direction to restaurants,shopping, etc. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: karens_baker
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Maui was in a great location. It was an older hotel, but had recently been refurbished. We had to beg for a true ocean view room but we could see the whales from our balcony once we relocated. The spa was also wonderful and very in tune with bringing the outside in. A very relaxing atmosphere. We were sitting in the lobby on our last day waiting for the airport shuttle and saw a mother whale and her baby jumping and playing in the water right off the beach. It was just glorious! On the down side, we never could get decent pillows and 2 hamburgers with 2 glasses of wine in the bar on the evening of our arrival was $111.00. They should be ashamed of themselves on that count! That was our first night and we later learned that there were some very good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. Also have shuttle that will take you to other locations where you are within walking distance of somewhat less expensive restaurants.Overall, I would recommend the Sheraton Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: KDO123
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton on Kaanapali Beach is the perfect location. The beach is beautiful and you can walk to Whaler's Village where a variety of shops and restaurants are easy to find. We registered for an ocean view room, but we were upgraded to a deluxe ocean view room at no cost. We stayed in building 2 on the 4th floor. Lot's of steps as the only elevator was far away from our room, but a great view! The grounds are beautiful, but the pool was freezing! It was too cold to really swim. We would just jump in to cool off and get right out. Brrrrr! The beach was beautiful, but they charge a lot to rent chairs so we stuck by the pool and walked the beach everyday and got in the ocean. A ship was pushed on shore on our third day there so we were not able to use the beach by our hotel for the rest of the week. This was very disappointing, but mother nature was in charge of that. The free shuttle to Lahaina was great! We used it many times to get back and forth from the "downtown" area. Food and drinks are expensive. We had a hamburger by the pool which was yummy, but it was $19.00 for a hamburger and some chips. Soda was $3.50 with one refill. The room was very nice and clean. I would stay at the Sheraton Maui again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience but....”
Reviews.Author: RickNStl
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here three times now--the location on Black Rock in Kaanapali is great. Access to beaches is exceptional and you can snorkel Black Rock and even find Sea Turtles feeding. Nice pool (but very cold) and bar along the beach. The hotel seems to be in cost savings mode--the service was good when present but too often the staff seemed hurried onto the next task. Don't expect them to take time for the little things and you may end up calling the front desk multiple times (like we did) to have housekeeping items attended to.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sslipp
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sheraton Maui for 8 nights. We stayed in Building 2, with an ocean-view room on the 5th floor. We were offered an upgrade at check-in, first for a ridiculous $100+/night (we were already paying almost $250/night!). When we declined, the price came down to $35/night for the ocean-view in Bldg 2. We were glad we did it - the view was amazing, and the room was larger than the standard 'garden view'. No complaints about the room or the service - everything top notch. Food at the resort is overpriced. The breakfast buffet was delicious but at $30pp, there are many cheaper options around. Location is fantastic! Kaanapali beach is one of the best on the island, and the snorkelling around Black Rock is great. Pools & beach were not too crowded. Being near Whalers Village is also great - lots of food & shopping options. Hotel charges a $25/night resort free (seems that most hotels around do this) - it was annoying to have to pay extra but does include parking, internet, pool chairs, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Andy B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful. Right off the beach, nice pool area and gorgeous grounds. I really wish the staff had been up to the same standards. Of the six days that we were there, our trash was never taken out, our sheets were not changed and our room was not vacuumed. The cleaning staff basically came in and pulled the sheets up. Every place to eat in the hotel had extremelly slow service. Even the staff at the front desk was unhelpful. They couldnt tell us where to find anything on the island. Overall, it was beautiful, but there were three resorts within walking distance which I would highly reccommend over the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: WyeRiver
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the other end of the Island at $ Seasons etc I did not know what to expect at a Sheraton. I was pleasantly surprised. Great location and near the main town of Lahaina which is a must visit for shopping, food and hanging out with the locals. Hotel rooms are spacious and have everything you need, good balconies with most having a view of the ocean. Great bars, restaurants and sunset drinks a must do, beach is loveley - no surf however. Well worth a visit - it wont dissapoint

Reviews.Title: “Excellence”
Reviews.Author: epps97
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed at the Sheraton Maui and we can't wait to stay again. The rooms are beautiful and very clean. The staff is very polite and quick to help you with anything. Our favorite part about this hotel is the beach and the pool area. Snorkeling is wonderful here too. We tried the teppanyaki restaurant and the main dining room and the food was great in both. Another plus with the hotel is it's close to Lahaina which has a lot to do and the Whaler's Village is full of great shopping. Just can't say enough good things about this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not-so-great PR”
Reviews.Author: RainyOR
Reviews.Content: The location and room were great, but check in was slow and front desk staff seemed unfriendly. It was hard to figure out what to do with the rental car. We were told valet parking was free at check in land later learned we were charged. We got to the room and neither key worked, so we waited for that to be fixed, which took 1/2 hour. The next night the fire alarm went off at 3 a.m. so the building was evacuated. We stood out on the street for a while, and finally were told to go back to our rooms. No explanations, no apologies the following day. I think we at least should have gotten a free drink or something. The pool was chilly, but the ocean was warm and the pool staff people were very friendly. Loved the fact you could walk to so many other places to eat and shop.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip Maui”
Reviews.Author: PeterSurf
Reviews.Content: Went on a business trip to Maui and brought my wife who spent quite some time at the resort. The staff, rooms and views are outstanding. Nice dive spot right out front. My only complaint is the pool was a little cold. Overall great property.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, but a tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scorpioprincess
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this resort in 6 years, so our expectations were fairly high based on our previous experiences there. the check-in was, as others have commented, poor, with a 10 minute wait in a queue to be seen, and indifferent staff. No flower leis this time, nor the wonderful "aloha" greeting we had enjoyed so much in the past. Our room was in building 6, which had the benefit of a superb ocean view, but the drawback of being very isolated and distant from the rest of the resort. Instead of coffee cups, the Sheraton now provides paper cups and no cutlery, and the towels in our "deluxe" bathroom were almost threadbare. The bed was just ok. We had problems on one night with drunk noisy neighbours, and felt that our complaints about this to security were not taken seriously. On the plus side, the location of the resort is hard to beat. Just outside is terrific snorkelling, and my daughter and I were lucky enough to share the water with a family of 6 green sea turtles - just magic! We enjoyed the proximity to the other resorts of Kaanipali, which offer preferable dining options than are provided by the Sheraton itself. The swimming pool is terrific, with nice cabanas and shaded sun lounges available for hire if you wish. We can certainly commend the pool-side staff for their friendliness and helpfulness. We highly recommend the Day Spa at the resort - my daughters and I loved our heavenly facials and pedicures, and will always remember the charismatic beautician Kitten! We absolutely cannot recommend the constant harassment of the staff who try at every opportunity to sell the Villa Ownership program to you, offering what feel like bribes to go and see their sales pitch.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing visit to Maui”
Reviews.Author: djstravel44
Reviews.Content: This is my husband and I's first trip to Maui. We had a 4 night stay at the Sheraton Maui Resort, located right on the ocean. The resort is large and spread out. Our original room was located on top of a hill, a 5 min. walk from the pool area and restaurant. We wanted to be closer, so chose a different room, more centrally located. We also upgraded from a room to a suite, since they had more availability and were offering discounts. The suite was comfortable and plenty of room for what we needed. Only wish they had drawers for clothing and more vanity space. It was quiet at night, so had a great nights sleep. We also had the Preferred Star status, which included the breakfast buffet, which was very good! They had an omelette chef, and just about anything else you would want. We were fortunate enough to arrive right after a large group left, which made finding pool chairs a breeze. The pool temp was chilly though. I only took a dip once. My husband made it up to his ankles. The hotel is within walking distance of stores, restaurants, and other hotels/condos. There is a nice ocean walk/path you can take to these locations. The Sheraton also offers different activities such as snorkeling, paddle boarding, and can set you up with whale excursions and surfing. You didn't need to go far to do any of these things. The hotel beach ends at this rock cliff, which is nice for snorkeling and less foot traffic. The beach does continue on the other side of the resort, which is easy to access. We would definitely stay here again next time we visit Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Still the most cost-effective resort on Maui”
Reviews.Author: Northwesthiker43
Reviews.Content: The facility is still beautiful and well-maintained, with walk-in access to one of the best snorkeling sites on Maui. Unlike the various Wailea resorts, the Sheraton at Black Rock is still priced within reach of families.

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: adamnewcastle1
Reviews.Content: First the good, the Sheraton Maui probably has one of the best locations on Maui, and they KNOW IT! If you like snorkeling and swimming you are in the right spot. We saw more fish right from our hotel room beach than we did on the boat trip we did. The bad, like so many reviewers we were sad to report that the front desk staff was not helpful and in general appeared to be annoyed by us, annoyed by a tourist in Hawaii, go figure. My wife asked what room upgrades were available, she said "$25 per upgradge" She didn't tell us what that meant or even offer to show us the different room locations on a map. Maybe she assumed that we had been to the Sheraton Maui several times before. I think the rude front desk people are common in resort areas as weird as it sounds. So despite their lack of information we stuck with the lowest end room. We go to the room, which they didn't tell us how to get there, and we talked around with luggage for ten minutes before a grounds keeper finally helped us to find that it was a ground floor unit, overlooking the lovely maintenance barn with 2 full beds. Wow, I guess this is what you get when you book on orbitz and don't do the room upgrade. I called the front desk and indicated that my wife was pretty upset by the room and they upgraded me to an ocean view room for the low cost of $75 per night, haha only in Hawaii. I was okay with the upgrade fee but was annoyed that despite their very low occupancy (maybe due to the tourism economy being in the tank) they put us in their crappiest room. Sometimes I think hotels look down at guests who book with Orbitz rather than directly through them. The other annoying thing was the food. I have been to Hawaii before and I know food is expensive. I live near the Colorado ski resorts so I know that burgers can be upwards of $15 in those spots. But Sheraton took this way to far. $19 for a burger without cheese and $8 for a 12oz beer in a plastic cup is just too much. Needless to say we chose to dine in other areas in Lahaina town and Kapula where they were not trying to suck every dollar out of you. As I mentioned before, this was the 2nd time we stayed at Sheraton in Hawaii, and probably the last. They have just taken resort town tourist money making too far. Next time we go to the islands, and we will because we love them we will be staying in a condo type environment for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Another Day in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: KatherineAldon
Reviews.Content: We love this casual, laid-back resort so much. This was at least our 12th stay! It is poised at Black Rock, a popular scuba/snorkel beach spot, as all Hawaiian beaches are "public". If the crowd doesn't suit you, they have a huge pool that has a "lazy river" between a large pool and a smaller pool suitable for kids, and a modest rock water slide. The nightly cliff dive at dusk is so popular and you can enjoy a beverage at the Lagoon Bar while watching the sun set. The staff is friendly and eager to please. There is a beach shack where you can book all your island activities right in one place. We have never had a bad experience. This is the spirit of Aloha without the celebrity prices.

Reviews.Title: “Very good room on whale watching from balcony.”
Reviews.Author: Qrottyspj
Reviews.Content: Just got back a week trip from Maui. Been there number times. First time stay at this hotel. My travel agent packaged up, air,car and hotel deal. Little confusing when you arrival where is the front check in lobby. No line for check in. Friendly front desk explained the option for upgrade us from ocean view room, we booked originally to ocean ocean view room. We were told able to watched the whales from our balcony room. Spent $50 extra per day. Yes ! Indeed, we saw whales almost every morning from the balcony, very nice. Right off the balcony there is black rock sand beach. On the map showing one of good place for snorkeling. We did see many fish. And water was very clear. Room just okay. Bathroom to me just okay.shower water is bit small,take longer get ride off sand. Tub is not so clean. Tile is little yellow dirty. No glass cup in the bathroom, plastic cups. Like motel. No mini bar. Cleaning sheets every day. We both hate bed. Too soft. Our back was hurt. Pillow don't know how to put words into it. Not comfortable at all. End up slept without pillows. Toilet seat not comfortable to sat on it at all. I don't uauslly spent lot time on the toilet at all. We didn't spent lot time inside hotel. Spent one morning on buffet breakfast. Just okay. Not much of choice. Two people spent about $55. Hotel seems like offer yoga, and other entertaining. Didn't know about it. Until one morning passing throught , and saw. Wish front desk would explain more about what hotel offers. After all. I giving this hotel 3.75 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Don't plan dives with the water sports desk!”
Reviews.Author: Geminiph
Reviews.Content: Called this morning to book a dive package and was told be there at 12:30 or so as we were the only divers and booked a scooter dive. We arrived 10 minutes late and the instructor was furious and told us we couldn't join the group they now had . Also cancelled our scooter dive without notifying us. We carried all our gear through the extensive grounds to the beach to be treated like garbage. Thanks Steve for ruining our day of diving in Maui -

Reviews.Title: “ok time spent...expected better for the price we paid.”
Reviews.Author: Michala H
Reviews.Content: Extremely crowded, service was not great. Key wasn't working once took someone at least 10 minutes to come after a reminder. View of the ocean is great. lots of snorkeling opportunity

Reviews.Title: “Ah Peace!”
Reviews.Author: Eve O
Reviews.Content: Something about this place just made me relax. I highly suggest the Ohana suites. Your lanai will give you a perfect view of the luau show for free. The suite includes a bedroom with a sliding door. In the living room, the sofa folds out into a bed and their is a big Murphy bed that pulls down so you could sleep a big family very comfy in this place. The people were lovely and the service was good. Concierge staff was superb and can find anything your heart desires! Don't miss the diving ceremony at sunset each night - very cool stuff. Go to The Spa at Black Rock and book Gilles for an outside massage by the ocean. Warning - You may leave your husband after this! ; )

Reviews.Title: “The cliff Dive Bar”
Reviews.Author: otis94
Reviews.Content: The worst service on our 3 week trip.The view was great so was the music. Took forever to get drinks or something to eat. Don't bother going to bar watch the show from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Maui Vacation”
Reviews.Author: donotcomplain
Reviews.Content: I love the Sheraton, this was the second time we stayed at the resort and we were just as happy as the first time. As been said in many reviews the location is incredible, steps to some of the best snorkeling on Maui, I wish they posted signs on the beach about leaving the turtles alone, one mother holding a small child was chasing the poor turtle and the childs fins were kicking at it. From the hotel you can walk in both directions quite a while on the beach or the beachwalk and it's just beautiful. The room was clean, the staff was friendly, my only complaint is with the towel/cabana rental kiosks, everytime we went to get towels or rent a cabana on the beach they tried to sell us Maui Jim sunglasses (not even noticing that my husband was wearing a pair. I also am not a fan of the cabanas around the pool for rent, they take up desirable pool front space and most of the time they were empty with the lids up which also blocks views and sun from people in the "free," chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: HeidiluvrTx
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel & spa, I would definitely stay there again. Sunday's seem to be the busiest day, which is when we checked in, and they could only accommodate our kind reservation for two FULL size beds until the next day. It was a great room but for your first night as newlyweds, it was a little disappointing that they could make no exceptions. The concierge stated that we would get champagne and strawberries for the inconvenience but that never came. The next day they did give us a king room which had an amazing view, however, the door that lead to the adjoining room was not locked which we discovered when our neighbor opened the door and step in to our room. After requesting ANOTHER room change on our third day, we finally received a king, without an adjoining door and amazing view! The resort offers so many activities and tours which is great when you are visiting, just visit the Guest Services desks to book a wine tour, zip lining, snorkeling, scuba diving, etc. The luau was adequate but I would probably suggest the Royal Lahaina Resort's luau. The scuba and snorkel staff were AMAZING!! If you'd like to have dinner in Lahaina you will have to drive as its a good distance away. There is no laundry facility only laundry services. The reason we chose to stay here is not only because its right on the beach but also of the Black Rock. It is amazing for snorkeling, scuba diving and a gorgeous view. Many people choose to visit this destination so the fact that it's right outside of your room is great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, subpar room”
Reviews.Author: Mommyintheburbs
Reviews.Content: This resort has a fantastic location! It's steps away from great snorkeling, and within walking distance from shopping and great food. Unfortunately our room was dated. The lamps didn't work and the patio door was almost impossible to open...the bathroom needed serious remodeling too.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing honeymoon! Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: Islands0821
Reviews.Content: Have to start by saying, every day I think back about our amazing honeymoon here! We traveled to Maui for our honeymoon right after our wedding in mid-October 2011. It was always my dream to go to Hawaii for my honeymoon, so when my now husband and I started planning, I kept talking about Hawaii. There were some pricing concerns, though in the end I was told if I could find a comparable price for Hawaii as opposed to where else we were looking, it was a go. Big recommendation: use a travel agent! I found Caroline from Aldine Travel in Saint Louis, Missouri, and she is amazing (more on that later). I'll break the review down by the features/areas: Check-in: ***Key thing to know in Maui*** there is a difference between ocean-view and ocean-front rooms. Anywhere else I wouldn't think twice, but I had read about it enough to investigate. From my understanding, ocean-view means you may need to step out onto the lanai (and maybe turn your neck one way or the way) to see the ocean. Ocean-front means you should be able to see the ocean from the inside of your room. Yes, you pay a premium for ocean-front versus ocean-view but if you came to Hawaii for a view of the ocean, go with ocean-front. So for our check-in... We got the front desk around 10pm Maui time, so 3am Saint Louis time. We were excited to be here and a bit tired after the traveling. We had booked an ocean-front room with a king size bed. They only had double-beds and not in the ocean-front part. Frustrated we tried to talk to them about how we paid for ocean-front and how we requested a king bed and how our travel agent had called that morning to confirm all these details. The person at the front desk in the end put us in an Ohana suite for the night and said to come back in the morning. Ok... so the bellman took our luggage for us, and he was VERY kind to us. We get in the room and I start giggling...it's a suite with a double-beds. Oh well, I look at my husband and ask if he wants the bed on the right or left and laugh. The next morning I call our travel agent, Caroline, right away, and she was so kind and understanding. She got on the phone and five hours later we have the **best best best** room in the entire hotel. It's a suite, ocean-front, and the view belonged in a movie. The Sheraton Maui and Caroline did right by us. Which brings us to... The room: We paid for an ocean-front room, with a request for a king bed. We were given an ocean-front suite with a king bed in building 2 (facing the ocean, not the side part of building 2). Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful! Updated furniture, microwave, fridge, huge walk-in entry closet, murphy bed, full-size sofa, two arm chairs, two flat panel televisions (one in living room part, one in bedroom), safe, nice bedroom closet, great linens, comfortable bed and pillows. You could not hear any neighbors or hallway noise. Bathroom was updated with beautiful vanity area with two sinks, hair dryer, and all the bath amenties you need including aloe for a sunburn! Nice touch for Hawaii. :) There were two showers in the bathroom: one walk-in glass shower and a shower in the bathtub. If you're in a rush, not bad, otherwise we just rinsed our bathing suits in the tub and showered in the walk-in shower. Again, can't say enough about the view, so I posted pictures. You walked in and could immediately see the ocean. The lanai, wow! We had a table and chairs, and a chaise lounge. It was twice the size of the regular room lanai, since our room took up the space of two rooms. Simply perfect. Hotel staff: Overall very friendly and welcoming. Even with the room mix-up they were nice to us and you could tell that the hotel cared about taking care of the issue. They even sent up a bottle of wine and a cheese/cracker/fruit tray with a little note. It was refreshing that a hotel wanted to make sure everything was just right. These were truly professionals working. Also, a nice little touch, I noticed that midday there appeared to be security that would walk the hallways to make sure everything was in order. It was no obtrusive or anything, it honestly made me feel good. Location & Beach: Awesome location! We rented a car and we were really happy we did. The hotel is situated on the end of Ka'anapali Parkway, so you drive all the way down. There wasn't a lot of traffic going past the hotel because of this and gave it the feeling of being more peaceful and quiet. The beach was perfect and had some of the best snorkeling!!! The last day there, we swam with three huge turtles. You're not supposed to touch the turtles as it's a federal regulation, and people were generally good about this. It was an amazing experience. We also think that way in the distance we have seen whales, but we can't say for sure. It makes for a good story either way. :) Because of the Black Rock there are all different kinds of fish that make it their home, so a great array of fish. We even saw some kind of guided night scuba diving, which seemed really cool. We never made it to see the Black Rock diver, so we'll have to do that next time. **Tip** do NOT rent snorkel gear at the hut on the beach by the hotel, it's WAY overpriced. Walk down to Whaler's Village along the beach and you'll find near the restaurants a hut with snorkel gear. At most, we paid $30 a set for the WHOLE week. My husband even got prescription strength goggles without any issue. They need a credit card for deposit and you're all set. There were beach rentals, and we were a little suprised you had to rent a beach chaise lounge, but the beach is public so it makes sense. We were so thrilled we picked to stay in Lahaina. We considered Wailea, and after traveling there for the day to check out the beaches and hotels we were glad we stayed at the Sheraton. Wailea is oppulent and almost over the top in some respects. The beaches are more secluded and there were lots of families with small kids. Lahaina has great food, shops to browse, and a lots of art galleries which we loved. Also, we did a surfing lesson in Lahaina with Maui Wave Riders (highly recommended). Hotel Food: Highly recommend the brunch. They had a great selection of pastries, cold cuts and salmon, shrimp, egg station, waffles/french toast, etc. It was like a great Sunday brunch on the mainland, but you could have it everyday here. We had outdoor seating, as we requested. Yes, there were birds, but they were beautiful and they were there because guests would leave food for them, so it's understandable there are birds. Again, they were beautiful and not obstrusive, it's all part of Hawaii! :) We had burgers one night at the hotel bar since it was late and we had come back from a day-trip to Oahu. Burgers were great, service was awesome, and we played chess in the lounge area. Perfect evening. Pools: A great pool system at this hotel. They all seemed to interconnect and there were great little hide-aways. We found a spot with four lounge chairs, a small waterfall, and a small slide. We enjoyed the privacy and it felt like we had our own pool and slide. There were floating beanbags throughout the pool area which were first-come, first-serve. There was a hot tub, as well. To sum it up: This was the best trip of my life thus far. Not a day goes by where I don't think about Hawaii and our stay here. We were truly impressed and absolutely plan to come back and visit in the future. Thank you to everyone at the Sheraton for making our stay so awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Upsell. Upsell!”
Reviews.Author: GulfBlue
Reviews.Content: We have a great room. Views of the ocean that have whales outside. Paid premium money for the room and we have as yet no regrets. The problem is that every time we ask a question. We get up sold.We asked about the luau and were immediately asked, before being told about the event, if we wanted premium seating ? I have no issue with cost of things here. Everything is expensive. The attitude needs to change! Hope this will change before we leave!

Reviews.Title: “Postcard perfect resort”
Reviews.Author: Captain_Krabs
Reviews.Content: I went to the Sheraton Maui during Christmas break and this was one of the best stay I ever had at a hotel. The hotel is quite pricey, especially during Christmas break, so I was a little anxious about getting a bang for a buck, but I must say that the Sheraton delivered above expectation on every points. The location of the hotel is ideal. It is also next to the black rock which is a great spot to snorkel especially early in the morning. We saw marine turtles and spotted eagle ray. It was simply magic. You also have to jump 7m from the black rock as this is the tradition! The pool area was very large and there were plenty of sunchairs. It was perfect to relax as there was not too much noise from the kids. They also have plenty of beach towels, so you do not have to worry about bringing your own. The rooms were great as well with a partial ocean view and a small balcony. The matresses and beds were very comfy and they were quiet!! What a peaceful stay. The bathroom was convenient and clean! What else do you need? There are 2 main restaurants in the hotel, the "Black Rock Steak and Seafood" and "Dan". We were really not impressed by the steak and seafood restaurant which is very much over rated. I would not recommend to have dinner there. But Dan was simply excellent. I would recommend the Filet Mignon that was cooked to perfection and was so savoury. Just perfect! The cook was also very entertaining as he was cooking. If you want to have a romantic getaway, I would totally recommend to go there. There is nothing that will ruin your moment!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: kstar54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui for 5 nights at the beginning of January and had a wonderful time! Our check-in was easy, the room was quite large, and the service throughout the stay was very good. We are golfers and were out on courses all the time, so can't say anything about the beach or pool, but it all looked great. The location was good for access to restaurants, shops, and golf. A very special thank you to Bianca Rodas for making our anniversary stay memorable. I highly recommend the Sheraton over the Westin resort- nicer and larger rooms and much more attentive service. We did stay at the Westin ocean villas during this trip- please see that separate review.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: hamil249
Reviews.Content: I could not have been happier with our stay at the Sheraton. The location was perfect. We enjoyed snorkeling around black rock and strolling the beautiful beach. The staff was friendly and our room was comfortable. My husband and I received a couples massage at the hotel spa and it was by far our favorite massage we have ever received. Can't wait to go back someday!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: hhowell55
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough positive things about the Maui Sheraton. From the moment we walked in (we were only offered an upgrade to a suite once and when we declined she did not ask again) to the moment we checked out (2 1/2 hours later than check out time since they knew we had a late flight) everything was amazing. We stayed in building 6 in room 6511 and it was everything we hoped for. The first morning we woke up at 430a due to the time change and watched whales breaching in the moonlight from our balcony! Loved the breakfast buffet and were bummed on the days we had early morning activities and couldn't go. We were always treated as a valued guest and we never saw an unfriendly staff member. We have been to numerous beach resorts and this one was by far our favorite! We will most definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but for the money it could improve the little things”
Reviews.Author: Toppee
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel but when your paying $400+ for a room you expect everything to be perfect. Mostly it was but there was the occasional very minor gripe, like having to wait to be seated at breakfast and the limited eating/bars available in the resort itself. We couldn't believe that there was no bar open after 10pm and with limited options there is nothing else to do but go to bed! I think its probably better suited to famalies rather than solos or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Lance G
Reviews.Content: Went to Maui to get married. Coordinated the trip through Kay Ryan at mauikay.com Kay went the extra mile and booked us a room overlooking black rock (saw whales from our balcony), set up the room with rose petals leading to the bed with a heart on the bed, and beautiful flowers. Let's just say that the combination of the view and Kay's preparation exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Best Honeymoon Spot!”
Reviews.Author: Brittany S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly paradise on earth! The views are spectacular and the location is great. Our room was very nice and had a great view, but most importantly the ocean behind the hotel is magical. It's great snorkeling, as the water is packed with fish and there are frequent visits by sea turtles! Best yet, the hotel rents snorkel gear, so you don't have to miss a moment. Be sure to bring an underwater camera! The hotel is very clean and there are several restaurants right inside that are yummy, though a little pricey. I would recommend booking the breakfast meal package. We did not, and regretted it. We ended up buying cereal and milk from the gift shop, and people looked at us like we were nuts. The rest of the guests are definitely rich and many were snooty, but I had no problem with the staff at all. I also recommend to book a car from the onsite Enterprise, and also be sure to inquire about activities like boat safaris and sub rides (which you pay extra for). There is a link on the hotel website for activities.

Reviews.Title: “Do not come here if you are under age 50- Staff has no respect.”
Reviews.Author: Pinguinos91
Reviews.Content: Staff treated me and my husband like kids and acted like we couldn't afford events and spoke down to us. (I am in my 20's my husband is 31). They also gave us a room with 2 full beds even after we told them its our honeymoon. My husband makes very good money however after our experience here we decided to go out of our way to spend our money OFF their property. Avoid if you are under 50 they treat you like garbage if you don't have white hair.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort”
Reviews.Author: HulaGirl80
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights over Christmas. It wasn't our first choice to stay here due to the price being a bit higher than we would've liked but we booked our trip kind of late and being over Christmas, weren't left with much choice. Having said that, we were overjoyed with how it worked out because the Sheraton surpassed all our expectations. We stayed in a resort view room ( we were offered an ocean view for $50 extra/night upon check in but declined this as we knew we wouldn't be spending a great deal of time in our room). The room was clean, and the beds were so comfortable. The resort as a whole is BEAUTIFUL. Grounds are stunning and the resort is right on the beach. Loved the location. It is also just a short walk to the Whaler's Village Shops and a short drive to Lahaina. A complimentary shuttle bus does operate to Lahaina but we had a rental car. We didn't use the pool as we prefer the beach. But it looked beautiful. Also can't review the restaurants as we dined at Whalers Village/Lahaina and used the supermarket. What I found most impressive and the main reason I would stay here again is the exceptional and friendly customer service we received by all of the staff here. We stayed at 3 other hotels during this particular trip and the service of those paled in comparison to that of the Sheraton. So overall, I was very happy with our stay here and if we come back to Maui (and hopefully we will one day) I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Probably best hotel in kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: isdscuba
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. What you expect from a Sheraton. Got a discounted upgrade to ocean view room. Aim for Building 4 - closest to ocean and pool - long walk from building 6. Resort food very expensive so ate out in whalers village for lunch and lahania for dinner. Beware no food available after 10pm. Staff had a bit of an attitude problem - rude. Best location - end of beach, closest to snorkeling at black rock. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Best Islands of Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: almoe07
Reviews.Content: Comprise the best of location for other Excursions in Hawaii and see where the black lava had flowed and from here go to other Islands, where lava flows a bit of black, gold and white sand on one beach area minutes away on both sides of where it all flows into the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: DonZukek
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 30 years ago and again recently. Great location, still awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joyce U
Reviews.Content: We have been to maui 5 times, we have stayed at the Sheraton Maui 4 times on top of black rock and love to hear the whales at nite. It is private area of the hotel. The breakfast is wonderful and the chef makes omletts to order. The property is beautiful and open with lots of green space. The staff is curtious and helpful. There are many activitites to do, yoga, pliaties, massages, kayakaing, paddle boarding. We have stayed in the hotel next to the Sheraton for a wedding and we wished we would have stayed at Sheraton but thought it would be rude to leave our wedding party. This will be our 6th visit and are going back to the Sheraton. We go with friends and they try to get us to stay in a condo but we refuse because we love the sheraton. The snorkeling is the best on the Island, compared to other tours. Whale watching is wonderful there in the biulding on black rock because it is right on the water. We hope to make many more trips to Maui and the sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Dated”
Reviews.Author: lomarlomar
Reviews.Content: The strip in general is like Miami Beach-lite. The hotel is a bit dated and old but nice enough. The best thing going for it is the beach - best along the strip - and great snorkelling. I imagine it's ideal for families with kids.

Reviews.Title: “3rd visit to Maui”
Reviews.Author: B-Dog1969
Reviews.Content: On our 3rd trip to Maui, we stayed at the Sheraton at Black Rock. It was awesome just being steps away from some great snorkeling. We saw tons of fish and turtles at black rock. It was just a short commute in to Lahaina. We loved it. If you can, stay in the main building, not the section up on top of black rock. Great place for couples and families with teens. We ate breakfast there every morning and it was very good. We spent a few days just hanging on the beach, which we fun and very relaxing. I would definitely recommend this resort if you love to snorkel and if you aren't taking young children on your trip. We don't plan to take the kids (6 and 8) there when we visit in 2012, as they don't have a very kid friendly pool. Other than that, the sunsets and grounds are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation 2011”
Reviews.Author: Michele2100
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Maui Resort & Spa was the most outstanding vacation I have ever experienced in my life. I would vote this resort number 1 in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel near Whalers village and the beach”
Reviews.Author: AliD78
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 11am however were not able to check in until 3pm which is the stated check in time. Rooms were clean and spacious with big bathroom. Pool area is great, however hotel really needs solar heating the water is too cold to swim in! The pool bar is fantastic with great service, food and drinks. On checkout we were not impressed with additional tips/gratuities added to the bill although we already added tips on the checks when we signed each time. Highlighy recommend the hotel luau for a good night out...great food and show, is better than other luau's I have done. Overall a good experience and i do recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location,good value, low key”
Reviews.Author: rwa1939
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went with "older" children with their own room. I thought the rooms were very nice. We were in bldg. 6 which is by Black Rock and a bit of a walk but didn't seem that bad to us. The isolated location was actually very comfortable for us. Being our first trip to Hawaii we were told but still shocked by the price of food. The grounds were large,clean, not over the top and nice and quiet. Walking along the beach you could get to different restaurants and beaches to snorkel or relax.It was a good value, not super luxurious but clean low key and beautiful.Great views.

Reviews.Title: “Would we stay here again? Yes!”
Reviews.Author: samba18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui the week after Thanksgiving. We were not disappointed in the hotel. I loved the property and our room, which was in buiding 6 had an incredible view. I have to say, however, it did not start out that great. We arrived late at night and received a room on the ground floor. Keep in mind, we paid for an Ocean Front Deluxe room, and our view was of the hedge directly in front of the room. Also, it was a ground floor, which meant we couldn't leave the lanaii door open without feeling unsafe. I immediately called the front desk and they did not have a room available until the next day. We simply needed to have our luggage packed, and they would move it to the new room. And that is what they did! The new room was amazing. I quickly recovered from my extreme disappointment.You see, I called several times, after reading reviews, to make sure we had a King Bed. It didn't occur to me that we would be placed in an Ocean Front room without a view of the ocean. Keep this in mind when making your reservation. Also, the next morning they called to ask us to come collect a gift, which was a reusable shopping bag (they called it a beach bag) and a box of Caramacs. We used the bag every time we went shopping. You see, in Maui, they have banned plastic bags, so it was really nice to have a durable bag to carry groceries in. I did not, however, like the "hard sell" they gave for a time share. I am on vacation and I want my time to be vacation time. I was polite about this, but she seemed to push just enough to consider it a "turn off". So many of the reviews were helpful. I was prepared for the long walk from the room to just about anywhere! However, there was special parking for buiding 6 which was very close and there was always a spot available. Each morning I made the long walk to the Starbucks cart. Trust me, it is a long walk, but very enjoyable, with the views through the breezeways. At the cart you can buy Starbucks coffee. Additionally, they had pastries, fruit and a different breakfast sandwich each day. This is how we started our day, sitting on the lanaii, eating fruit and drinking coffee. It was far less expensive than the breakfast at the hotel, which we did not try. Like I said, the walk to anywhere was quite long, and I had to pass through construction in building 3. You wouldn't know there was construction going on if you didn't pass through it. We loved hanging out by the pool in the afternoon and never had a problem finding a chair. We had drinks and lunch there a couple of times. Be forwarned, it is very expensive, but the drinks we had were good. There are two bars, but only one of them were open at a time, and they had a different lunch menu. Our favorite was the mahi mahi tacos. We enjoyed our stay, the rooms were clean, the service was good and the employees were polite. I knew ahead of time that the prices were high, but it started to take a toll by the end of the trip. Other than a few drinks and lunch by the pool, and coffee at the coffee cart, we took our business outside of the hotel. It's too bad, because it is such a beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Uncaring Staff”
Reviews.Author: Leannepit
Reviews.Content: I was delighted when I first arrived at this hotel, we were upgraded to a suite and loved our room.
