But I was showering before dinner and was chased out of the tub by the largest charging cockroach I have ever seen! Soaking wet I slipped on the edge of tub and landed on my outer thigh. I am fine but shaken up by the incident. I called guest services and explained what happen and asked them to send someone to kill the roach that now was living in a wet towel in the tub the said ok and sent no one. We had to call three times before someone came. There was no apology no one called to make sure everything was taken care or that I was okay, nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Black Rock Restaurant At the Sharaton Hotel, Lahaina (Maui)”
Reviews.Author: Enzo L
Reviews.Content: Hey Folks, not sure how I should begin this.... Assuming that there are people out there paying about $ 1,500 for a night at Sheraton in Maui, we could assume a restaurant with an above average quality of food, and Hawaiian inspired love for details, but none of all these...Just paid $250 for two adults and one kid ending eating Spaghetti for Christmas eve. Firstly the food was cold, and not tasty at all, the service was of low average (next guest please..). This is not real Maui, and will never be!!!! Eat a Burger at any corner, this is much more fun!!!!!! Honest rater

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but needs work”
Reviews.Author: redsoxnation949
Reviews.Content: Choose this hotel strickly because of the beach location. Pool area needs improvement, pool was freezing and scuzzy jacuzzi wasn't working through out most of our stay. Maids completely missed our room twice during the week. Room furnishings had been recently updated nicely, would recommend paying the money for an upgrade to oceanfront (which was by no means oceanfront but more of a partical view of the ocean and black rock. Room was a bit larger which worked well for family of 4. Beds were lousy, mattress soft and skimpy bedding. Service at the beach restaurant was incredibly slow, so slow they comped our entire lunch on our last day. Aside from that, the beach is lovely and the ocean was warm. Keep in mind they have winter in hawaii also, it was windy our entire trip and rained on and off quite a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location”
Reviews.Author: tgdg558
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Maui for five nights with two teen agded girls for Chistmas week. Overall we liked it but did not love it. To begin with I used SPG points, I could not decide whether tot stay at the Westin or the Sheraton, ultimately after reading the reviews we stayed at the Sheraton only because they said the rooms are bigger there and we had four in our room. Turns out due to SPG gold status they did upgrade me to a deluxe room which is larger but the location was lacking in building two at the end of the wing. As you have heard this place is BIG, bigger than you can probably imagine. The workout room was a 15 min walk (no lie), which required a map, compass and flashlight to find from our room at the other end of the resort. ! We also ended up walking up five flights of stairs everytime we went anywhere because the elevator was so far from our room. I suppose we got our exercise which is not a bad thing but be aware. The pool was cold as many people have commented, really cold, so very few people went in, mainly young kids. The towel card system was a little of a pain but no big deal. Chairs were at a premium, we went down around 8am to play tennis and staked our claim then, if you waited you were out of luck. The tennis is good deal by the way; $60 per couple for four days all access and attached to the resort- take advantage if you play. Service was good around the pool overall and happy hour at the Cliff Dive Bar was a good deal with mixed drinks and beer for $4 each. We only eat a few snacks at the hotel becuase the prices were high but Whalers Village has great options in all price ranges a short walk away. We also stayed at the Grand Wailia prior to the Sheraton on the same trip, not a fair comparison I know but OMG is that place nice! We were spoiled and all of us could not help but compare (there was no comparision, the GW is the bomb). If you can swing it try to stay there even for a night, you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Where Paradise has its price”
Reviews.Author: MumsBua
Reviews.Content: Anyone looking for a romantic getaway at a drop-dead gorgeous spot in paradise - well, this is it. The hotel is located a few miles north of 'downtown' Lahaina, a beautiful facility with an even more beautiful beach. Staff and service at the Sheraton is good - not over the top good, but certainly a level up on some places we'd stayed on Oahu before. The room was very nice, clean and ocean-facing. Self-parking was free while we stayed there (and free valet for the first night). Across the street you got an ok golf course and Whalers Village is only a very short stroll away. For runners you can run along the beach south through Lahaina and further for up to 7 miles each way and for cyclists this is right along the West Maui loop (and West Maui Cycles is only 5, 6 blocks away in case you want to rent...) The Spa was pricey but good. The only downside is the cost of various add-ons: it's not exactly clear what additional value the $30/day resort fee provides and as other reviewers have noted renting a simple beach chair and an umbrella will cost anywhere between an arm, a leg and a kidney. So just make the best out of it and enjoy the beautiful surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Mahalo Sheraton Maui”
Reviews.Author: HLChapman
Reviews.Content: I love the design of this hotel and the beautiful landscape surrounding it. It's only steps away from an amazing beach called Black Rock, a great place for snorkeling or sunning on the sand. It's under new management since we last stayed there so I noticed a few minor changes. Children 12 and under no longer eat for free but you can purchase a meal plan for them. There is also a charge for some of the on-site activities for kids, such as lei making. We don't eat at the resort very often as it is very expensive but we do treat ourselves at least once to their amazing breakfast buffet. This is our third time staying at this hotel. By booking our airfare and hotel together on a third party website I was able to get a really good rate this time. We've never been disappointed with our stay at this hotel. It provides the perfect setting for a hawaiian vacation. Mahalo, Sheraton Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Another great week in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: npc2010
Reviews.Content: This is not my first review of this hotel or my last review. We have been fortunate enough to go to Hawaii for the last 9 years and at this hotel for the last 7 years .We ran into the same problem a number of people have at check-in, we were trying for building 4 or 5, our reservation was for building 6 and we were placed in building 2. Angelica at the front desk did a great job working with us, and we ended up in a suite in building 5, there was a fee for the upgrade, but the room was beautiful, powder room, living and dining room king size bedroom with a very large bathroom and a huge lanai. It was beautiful, the only problem was it looked out over the North coast and was not Oceanfront, if it did we would have had to move in ( wow are we spoiled only a view of the Northcoast, but we wanted oceanfront and that is what we recieved). Angelica had a back up plan for the next day a king room in building 6, oceanfront. What a view, turtles, whales in the distance and if you happen to wake up at 4:00 am or 5:00 am the most unbelievable view of the stars, it is beyond description. Sorry I am rambling, the rooms have been recently updated with new furniture, they are clean and very nice. A number of people complain about the walk from building 6 to the pool and beach, it is not that bad and once you see the turtles, whales and the stars it is well worth the slight walk. The grounds are beautiful. We rented a gazebo for 2 days during our stay, well worth it, relax walk over and snorkel at Black Rock, about 100 yards from the gazebo one of the best areas around ,hit the pool or just sit and read a book it is wonderful. The lobby area is fantastic, views from building 5 are like a postcard. Everyone we met had the Aloha Spirit, treat people with respect and it will be paid back tenfold. We would like to thank everyone for another great trip and we will be booking next year in the next few weeks. Looking forward to seeing you next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and could be better amenities”
Reviews.Author: Lynette0708
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location is perfect, my ocean front room is wonderful. Hotel shuttle to laihaina is very convenient. The main point is, all beach seats are for rent, no free one even for Sheraton guests... The price is USD25 per chair per day and USD 50 per paddler per day. Which results to the chairs besides pool which are free od charge, extremely difficult to find vacant. I stayed for six days and last day I had to get up on 7am to grab two chairs! What a pity! My another complaint is the water temperature of pool is freezing! Everyone must make a big big mind before really get into it... I even failed to swim in the pool in all these six days even for once!!! Can you imagine it?? The other thing aew all fine, I do love my room with a fantastic view of beach and ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal View”
Reviews.Author: Laura B
Reviews.Content: Based on advice from Noah at the front desk, we upgraded to an ocean front room and were treated to a phenomenal view during our 6 night stay (thanks Noah!) There were whales outside of our room one evening. It was amazing. We would definitely stay here again. The property is beautiful, the beach is great for taking long walks, and the hotel has a great pool and hot tub. The hotel takes advantage of the amazing views by carving out various lounge areas where guests can go to see the landscape or simply relax. The location is fabulous. It's easy to get anywhere on the island from here (well, except Hana, of course!). It's a quick drive to Old Lahaina Town, which is one of my favorite spots in Maui. The room was very pleasant, clean, and comfortable. We slept like babies on the signature Sheraton beds. We plan to stay here again on our next visit to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: I will cover the good first and this review is for the room we had - there looks to be better ones at this hotel. The grounds are very nice and well maintained. The room we had was 4408 and the view was nice - overlooking the pool area and had a view of the beach and ocean, but since it is billed as an oceanfront room - it was not - more of an oceanview room for it did not directly face the ocean. The concierge desk staff were efficient and nice when booking a tour we wanted. Well that about covers the good part. The room we had was small - I mean come on - this is a resort? The room was so small that the ice bucket and glasses are kept in the closet on top of the safe - that is just not right. There was only one chair in the room besides the one at the desk / entertainment center. There was not a microwave in this room. The only place to put your luggage was either on the bed or on the floor if you had more than one piece of luggage open at a time. The bathroom was small - only room for one person at a time - which normally is not a problem except there is no space outside the bathroom where another can get ready at the same time. As other reviews have said, be prepared to walk and find your way through elevators and breezeways to get to where you want (which is somewhat expected in a large resort). The parking area near the tennis courts is okay, but a number of the spaces are small and you will find yourself backing up and back to get centered between the lines. The lanai was spacious, but as for me not private enough - you can easily see and be seen from the balconies of the adjoining rooms. The only place we ate food from on the grounds was the Cliff Divers Bar. The food was good, but pricey - which is to be expected at a hotel in Hawaii. I checked out the breakfast buffet one morning, but it didn't seem to have what I would expect from a buffet for the price and I passed. Our room was dated, small, and even the wall decor looked cheap. Overall the experience was average and slightly disappointing when measured against other hotels we have been in on trips.

Reviews.Title: “great romantic vacation”
Reviews.Author: George B
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed everything at the sheraton Maui. the beach, the room with a view, the food, snorkeling, maybe we would not make the trip to Hama Road advised by the concierge, we found it totally overrated and we,d rather stayed in the hotel...sunbathing on the beach

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and location in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: evol327
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in August 2010. The Sheraton is a beautiful hotel in one of the most beautiful locations on Maui. Right in front of the hotel is the black rock which probably has the best snorkeling on the entire island. We swam with numerous turtles everyday as well as many beautiful fish. The beach is absolutely stunning. The Mai Tai Bar has excellent drinks and lunch food before going out to dinner elsewhere (we didn't have dinner at the hotel since we like to venture out). Overall, when we go to Maui again we will certainly stay here again as the location can't be beat! Lahaina is within walking distance where you can shop and visit various delicious restaurants. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Mom and daughters Get away”
Reviews.Author: diver01
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I decided to leave the men behind and get away from the real world to a wonderful Maui vacation. We picked up a car at the airport and drove to the hotel, about 35 min. It was a pretty drive, and as we pulled into the hotel, our dream get away started. We were instantly upgraded and luggage was taken to our room as we walked around the resort. The famous Black Rock of Kaanapali is right out side the hotel, and the snorkeling was great below it. We seen on our first snorkel 3 stingrays, 1 eel, 3 turtles and lots of fish. You cannot go wrong staying at this wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly!!”
Reviews.Author: staciaku
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton because it was one of the "team hotels" for the Maui Invitational basketball tournament. I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel!! It has a very open, airy "Hawaiian" feel to it. The grounds are beautiful, and our room was very nice and very clean. We somehow got an ocean view room, without requesting it - wow what a view from our balcony!! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I soon became a "regular" at breakfast and our waiters knew what I wanted before I ordered. The location is also great - you can easily walk to Whalers Village (10 minute walk at the most) along the wonderful beach walk for some wonderful shopping. There are many great restaurants to choose from along this walk, also. My ONLY "downside" would be if you are traveling with young children... compared to some of the other nearby resorts, the pool was not as child friendly, and it was VERY cold. We went to the Westin and Hyatt and they had slides, shallow play areas, etc... that we would have been happier with IF we had our two young boys with us (which we did not). Overall, I felt this place was a good value for Maui and recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel grounds”
Reviews.Author: Dana K
Reviews.Content: When we first got to the hotel, we were stunned to see the beautiful hotel grounds! Everything was kept very clean, and very green! It was breath taking! Upon check in, we were told that they didn't have any king beds available that night and that they would transfer us into one the next day. I was quite disappointed and then I overheard the guy next to me at the counter very upset over the same thing. Apparently, he was a starwood member and contacted them months, weeks and days prior to his trip to confirm that they have a king bed reserved for them (I think they were honeymooners). Since I booked through travelocity, I understood that I paid a cheaper rate for this hotel, but if I were in his shoes, I'd be just upset as he were! We stayed in building 3 on the first night, in room 3333. The view was blah. A tennis court and out hotel parking lot! They left us a message early in the morning the next day that they had our new room ready, and to leave our stuff for them to move around 11-12 o'clock. They moved everything and gave us a free upgrade to an oceanview room in building 4, room 4401. We had an amazing view!!! I was so happy! The hotel itself is amazing! The beach area is also considered one of the best on Kaanapali beach, and I can see why. It's got a great spot for snorkeling and the view of black rock in itself is beautiful! It's a short walk to Whalers village where we ate everyday for lunch and dinner. One of the great things about this hotel (or maybe it's just the time we went. Dec 8-15) is that it was not at all crowded. There was absolutely no trouble getting a lounge chair at any time of the day! If you go to the pool area around 9:00, you can pretty much find any space you want available. That was a bonus! Now, the hotel restaurants! They have definitely failed us! The first meal we tried was at the pool area (the cliff dive, I believe). Our waitress was so rude! Even though we were ordering TO GO so that we can eat by the pool. She was not the least bit friendly, and I cannot understand why after I have been beyond nice and polite to her! I figure it's because we are a lot younger than her. The food there was SOOOO overpriced and sooooo not good!!! It was very bland. I have never had nasty mahi mahi, and let me tell you, this was not good fish! We were upset because we spent $50 on a mahi mahi sandwich, and a burger for my husband. No drinks were even ordered! The next restaurant that we decided to try for my birthday was the black rock. It was on the fancier and pricier side. I was also very upset about this meal. I ordered a steak, since it is a fish and steak house. I ordered it medium well and it was literally red inside! It didn't taste raw, but it was not made the way I ordered it. The food there was also very bland with no taste! I can cook 10 times better than that and I don't consider myself a good cook. We also happened to find a beetle crawling around us in the restaurant which was a big turn off for me. I know and understand that we are in a tropical place and all, but this was the "inside" part of the restaurant. My advice is to eat at Whalers village. My favorite lunch spot is the hula grill. The food at those restaurants is cheap and tasty! I also advise you to buy your own alcohol or drinks at the nearest supermarket and bring with you to the pool area. We did that everyday and I feel like we saved so much money! Overall, I loved the hotel grounds as well as the pool and beach area. The rooms are nice and I suggest building 4 for your room. The only thing I didn't like are the restaurants at the hotel and I wish the staff can lighten up a bit. They're not too friendly, but they did give us an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place, amazing holiday”
Reviews.Author: h0liday-all-the-time
Reviews.Content: Everything was well taken care of at this hotel. We were upgraded to an ocean view room for an extra $70 a night and it was well worth it. The room we were in was facing the ocean and was immaculate. What we didnt like was the pool which is quite small for the size of this hotel and having to pay extra (in addition to a resort fee) for the use of snorkeling gear and beachside umbrellas and cabanas. But overall, a good holiday and a good hotel. We ate at the poolside bar which we found was quite pricey but whalers village nearby had plenty of great places with great food - especially hula grill (their fruit salads and mai-tais were to die for).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel, Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: MRuben01
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and had a great experience. The property is very nice and the location is unbeatable for the Ka'anapali area. The hotel is located on a great stretch of Ka'anapali Beach right on Black Rock which offers beautiful snorkeling/scuba diving right in front of the hotel. It is also less than a 5 minute walk to Whaler's Village shopping and dining center which is also very convenient. The hotel is well kept and the rooms are not fancy but are updated and quite comfortable. Every evening the cliff jumpers light torches on black rock and jump off into the water. Its nothing crazy but a nice little touch that makes you feel connected to a forgotten true Hawaiian spirit. Our room upon check-in was the last room along Black Rock and had a great view but awkward layout. The cable didn't work and they couldn't fix it so they moved us to a new room in which they upgraded us to a Jr. Suite. The room was huge and was really nice. The staff did a great job to make up for the inconvenience and we were very happy with their assistance. I am a Starwood Platinum member so that may have helped out with getting a room upgrade but it was very nice of them to offer an upgrade without me having to ask for it. Sometimes the large resorts do not recognize Platinum status as much as more business-travel oriented hotels but this resort was very accommodating. The only negative, and this is really picking here, is that the pool is kind of an awkward layout. It is quite narrow in places and feels a bit small despite its enormous length from end-to-end. There is plenty of room on the other side for a second pool and it would be nice to see even a smaller, adults only pool as main pool area can seem a bit crowded and overrun with energetic kids. Overall I would highly recommend this property for those looking for a true mega-resort feel in the heart of Ka'anapali. The property has tons of energy and really is a great location. The hotel is great for families with children both older and younger as there is no shortage of activities. It is also great for those who like the feel of being in a larger resort town as it is merely minutes away from Lahaina and there are tons of activities, shops, and restaurants in the area. For those looking for a quieter, romantic getaway I would say that this resort is not exactly geared towards you. I would have no problem returning to this hotel when I have kids.

Reviews.Title: “great choice for anyone visiting Maui”
Reviews.Author: najnad
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton has it all...big beach, snorkel black rock, spa, restaurants, luau, concierge, great rooms with great views, etc. When we checked in, we were told we could upgrade from our ocean view room to a recently remodeled ocean view room that was closer to the water (didnt overlook the resort before seeing the ocean)...we went for it and we very glad we did. Ended up in a corner room just above black rock...wrap around balcony with sliding glass doors...out one side you saw black rock and the beach and the other resorts in the distance...out the other side all you saw was water and the island of Lanai...laying in bed, it was almost like the view from a cruise ship! The breakfast buffet is wonderful, try to get a room rate that includes it....everything you want in breakfast, including made to order eggs. We tried a few other places for breakfast but the Sheraton won hands down. Get a massage next to the beach...no extra charge and was nice to feel like you are still on the beach instead of inside the spa. The pool area is nice and winding, so there are areas for everyone. The hot tub is secluded and large, very popular too...almost always someone in it. The concierge was helpful in suggesting places/events/etc. Avoid the timeshare offers...will just waste your time when you could be enjoying Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for in a resort”
Reviews.Author: ozmel88
Reviews.Content: We chose the Maui Sheraton because the snorkeling was right off the beach and it had a cool hotel pool. Â We were happy with everything. Had a great view and the price was reasonable. There weren't a lot of resorty activities but that was fine with us. I enjoyed morning yoga for a reasonable $10.00 - excellent although very hard to find so make sure you ask for directions. Other than that we just wanted a quiet break and that's what we got.Â  The shuttle to Lanai was free and we took it often to go to the supermarket, out to dinner or do a bit of shopping. There are two airports on Maui, either you pay more for the flight and land close to the hotel or get a cheaper flight and an expensive shuttle/rental car. We got a shuttle - if you do, make sure you expect to spend 45 minutes each way traveling to and from the airport.Â  It didn't seem like a big party spot. Â We weren't looking for a big party, just a few drinks at the bar so that was fine. Breakfast was excellent, definitely worth having as part of the package. Â When we went (Nov/Dec) the hotel restaurants weren't all open but we always seemed to be able to get something to eat somewhere. It was what we were looking for so were very satisfied with the Maui Sheraton.Â

Reviews.Title: “Very nice....”
Reviews.Author: Wilma58
Reviews.Content: Read a million reviews including all of the good and bad things about this resort. Our personal experiences begin here. We booked our room through the Sheraton website...and to those of you that got the run around about two beds/king/moving rooms maybe booking directly through their website did the trick as opposed to Expedia, etc. Yes, we received the "you can upgrade for $$", when we declined their first offer to upgrade we received a lower priced upgrade offer which we took for a beautiful oceanfront room in Building 6. When we arrived our room was not ready, so we were given complimentary drink tickets and a food voucher. We had cold items in our car, so the valet told us they had a cooler. When we returned from our free drinks, we found our cold items in a regular plastic tote. Not ok...Strike One. Once in our room, which was very nice, clean, upgraded, complete with coffee maker and refrigerator we moved in. Great maid service the first day.....she rocked. Getting to the room the first day was crazy...up and down in elevators. After a few days, it was routine, however, you'd better remember everything you need, it's a journey from one place to the other. Strike 2 - We went to book the luau....well, low and behold "I am sorry ma'am but that show is dark this week..." Really, not one person mentioned that at check in or prior to check in via e-mail or mail...and the conciere lady didn't give a **** when I told her that would have been nice to know prior to or at check in. We actually had cancelled reservations at the Hyatt to attend the one at the Sheraton only to find out that it was dark this week. Sheraton Maui....tell people when they check in what's not happening at your resort for the length of their stay....you'd think that might be prudent. Otherwise, most of the staff have been very nice. Your front desk, valet and conciere staff were the ones that were the least friendly...compared to the Cliff Dive Bar staff and the maid service staff that were so personable and enjoyable. The deeper you get into to the resort, the nicer the people are. Grounds are beautiful....prices are high....drinks are expensive but the view is worth the price. Breakfast buffet is outrageousy expensive for what is served.....consider ratcheting that price down a bit....really.... we should have paid attention to the reviews. Otherwise we are glad we chose to stay here....we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Service leaves a bit to be desired but the resort is stunning”
Reviews.Author: kelwez
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the Sheraton as part of our honeymoon package to stay for 7 nights from the 22nd Sep. When we arrived we were told that our Double room was not available and that we had to take a twin room. We had already had this happen to us in our previous hotel on our trip, so you can imagine that we were not best pleased. We are also SPG members. We asked to speak to a manager and explained the reason for our trip and that were SPG members and that we not find this level of service acceptable. We were told that there was nothing that they could do to put us in a King room that night - you would have thought that they would have upgraded us to accommodate this, but they didn't. We were given a room in building 3 on the ground floor 3108 with twin beds. Our compenstaion for this was a glass of champagne each! We were able to move rooms the following day (which meant that we could not unpack when we arrived) and we were still in building 3 but now on floor 4 room 3419 - with a view of the car park!! You would have thought that for the inconvenience caused that they would have at least given us a room with a decent view. Apart from the service from the front desk and the room, we loved our stay. The pool is lovely, never had an issue with getting a sunbed. We swam with the turtles at black rock, which was just amazing! We found the best time to go down was about 3pm and they were literally just off the shore. The only other issue we had was after we checked out, we had an invoice to state our room and all charges were paid for - they had accidentally charged drinks to our room on the invoice, but it had been cancelled off. When we got home we found that they had charged our credit card for this drinks and had not refunded it - we had a few emails back and forth before the situation was resolved. If we returned to Kaanapali I would rather stay at the Westin where I know they treat their SPG members with the courtesy they deserve.

Reviews.Title: “Family Oriented Resort With Great Beach Access”
Reviews.Author: racheldetroit
Reviews.Content: This resort is located on a great part of a public beach near a big black rock that creates a safe swimming cove. I'm afraid of swimming in the ocean but the swimming cove near this hotel was perfect for me and I was able to overcome my fear long enough to swim. The resort is very family oriented and I noticed a lot of families with babies and children. Since I'm single, if I come back to Hawaii again I think I'll choose an adults-only resort. Kids can be disruptive near the pool and beach, as well as restaurants. Overall this place was clean, quiet, and relaxing. I'd recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “best location, best beach, fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: CrownandGinger
Reviews.Content: i had read several reviews of this hotel before booking so I was very prepared and educated before our arrival. We booked a deluxe oceanfront room for 5 nights (Nov 19th - 24th) and was stationed in building #6 on the second floor by the corner where you are the closest to black rock and where all the snorkelling occurs. The cliff dive is to the left of your balcony. The room was very spacious, the bed was comfortable, the view outstanding and the bathroom had a separate toilet room. It had all the amenities of a 5 star resort. I know it is an older resort (around the 30 year mark) but they do a very good job of maintaining all those acres and keeping it exceptionally clean. It is a very large property so expect to do some walking. The only area that could use some updating or repairing would be the doors to the guest rooms. They need a new sweep and a paint job. When we return I would request a room in building #4 or #5. Although the rooms and view are fantastic in #6, and you have ample parking just a few hundred feet away, it was quite a chore to go back to your room if you forgot something. You have to use an elevator to go up to the 8th floor in building #5 and then walk down a hall to get onto another elevator to bring you back to the 3rd floor so you can get to the ramp to get to your building and room. Very confusing for the first day or so. Not conducive to the elderly or people with mobility issues. Keep that in mind! Check-in was courteous and quick. It was amazing as we figured we would have to wait a while before checking in. Our room was ready and I got exactly what we had reserved. We didn't have to wait at all. Actually, we really didn't have to wait for much even when the hotel was very busy as they were hosting several university teams for a basketball tournament. Pool area and beach were amazing. The water and beach are probably the best on Kaanapali compared to the others. We walked it everyday and it was the most calm right infront of the hotel. Snorkelling was an added bonus just off the beach. The drinks were on the high side at the pool bar (avg. $10 or more) so it was not conducive to having too many. It would have been nice to have a happy hour! The buffet was also included in our rate and it was the best by far compared to the other islands we stayed at during our 2 week vacation. Great fruits, well set-up and the food was kept cold to keep up with proper health food standards. It is also great having the boardwalk just in front of the hotel for the morning walk or a short trip to Whalers Village. We did not eat dinner at the hotel as we had made arrangements at the Lahaina Grill, Hula Grill and the Old Lahaina Luau (all very good). All I can say is that our experience was very positive and we had absolutely no complaints about this resort. We would return in a heart beat!! I hope you will be as satisfied as we were!!! Keep up the good work Sheraton!!!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Maui”
Reviews.Author: barrycr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I come back to the Sheraton every 5 years for our anniversary. This was our 35th anniversary. We always try to get the same room in building 4 overlooking Black Rock and the main pool. Over the years we have made many friends at the Sheraton, and on Maui. The Sheraton staff is always friendly and helpful if you need anything. They are on the best beach in West Maui with some of the best snorkeling at Black Rock. The hotel is currently undergoing a renovation of their rooms, so some of the floors are empty with some minor noise to put up with during the day, though for the most part you are not in your room during the day, so the renovation shouldn't bother you. They plan on having the renovations completed before the Christmas rush comes to Maui for the holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to come home”
Reviews.Author: 1cincy
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 7 night stay. Stayed in building six - deluxe oceanfront - highly recommend these rooms. Yes they are a little bit of a walk to beach and main building but the walk is not that far and you are constantly looking at the lush gardens or beautiful ocean during the walk so it was not a big deal to us. The room was so close to the ocean it seemed as if you could jump off the balcony into the ocean! The room itself was nothing spectacular but adequate with a mini fridge and microwave. A couple of negative points - the pool was big and beautiful but so cold that it was actually not even realistic to swim in it. It felt like someone put ice cubes in it. I spoke to many other guests who were also disappointed by this. Personally I didn't care since I was there for the ocean but my 5 year old daughter wanted to go in but it was just too cold. Hotel staff said the pool doesn't have a heater, which seemed odd to me for a resort of this size. Also I wouldn't eat at the poolside bars. The food is not very good and expensive. Don't get me wrong - most food in Maui was expensive - but this food was bad and expensive. Overall I really enjoyed my stay here. If you are looking to stay on a beautiful beach at a great resort this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: SU_46
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at this resort and had a fantastic time. The best part of the resort was its location and the snorkeling at Black rock! (Especially when you can see 2 turtles on your first day) We were upgraded to the ocean front rooms in building 6 and it was SO good. Although its a separate building the views are worth the small walk to the lobby. The front desk guy was extremely nice and helped us with this upgrade and threw in some perks too! The pool area was really nice and the black rock dive bar was fun in the evening. But we didn't spend too much time at the pool...(who needs it when you have the ocean a few feet away). The only thing that bothered me a little bit was the limited vegetarian food options at the restaurants...although you have lots of choices in Lahaina town I would have liked a little more options at the resort. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone who is looking for a true Maui experience!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Kristen S
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here about 2 weeks before the start of our honeymoon when we heard that our original hotel was under construction and getting bad reviews. We are SO glad we switched and stayed here! We would stay again in a heartbeat. We received a room upgrade to ocean view and it was just beautiful. Walking out on our balcony every morning and seeing the calm sea was so refreshing. The staff is super nice and go out of your way to make your stay comfortable. The bartenders at the Mai Tai bar are so great! They made our trip a blast! Great location- about 7 mins walk to Whalers Village, where there are shops and restaurants. Beach is absolutely gorgeous and the pool was super nice

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Hawkeyefantc
Reviews.Content: This place was great! The people were friendly and the location was perfect. We also enjoyed the snorkeling right off the beach! My daughter even saw a sea turtle! Wish I was there now!

Reviews.Title: “So Far Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Steenie11
Reviews.Content: Just Arrived yesterday , but So far it is a dream come true !! Our room is amazing ! The staff is so friendly and helpful. Drinks are amazing ! And ocean is crystal clear!! Aloha, i will write more when i return !

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in paradise”
Reviews.Author: Ashley F
Reviews.Content: This is a huge resort with the BEST beach in Ka'anopali. Pools are amazing (I couldn't find the jacuzzi though....), rooms are very nice, staff is extremely friendly and helpful, and the food and drinks are pretty good. I definitely recommend this!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on Kaanapali beach.”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl2207
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in October for 7 nights for our honeymoon, i spent a long time looking at all of the reviews of all of the hotels on Kaanapali and we were not disappointed, we are both travel agents and quite fussy. We just loved it. Our room was in building 2 and was just recently renovated so i did not see anything that looked out of date, it was a nice ocean view. The room was spotless. Check in was really easy and were greeted by warm friendly smiles. We did not eat at the hotel much as it was quite expensive we opted to go down to Whalers Village for breakfast each morning and then we would go into Lahania for dinner if we wanted some more options and there was plenty there. The pool and grounds were immaculate and the pool was so nice and not crowded at all and you did not have to put your towel on a chair at the crack of dawn just to get a seat. The beach was really nice and you can swim with the turtles there. I would definitely stay here again if i was going back to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui”
Reviews.Author: Bobss
Reviews.Content: Beautiful surroundings, excellent deluxe ocean front rooms, and great service. I have never been disappointed staying here any time of the year. This property is one of the most relaxing and enjoyable I've ever experienced!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous view and exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Natasha A
Reviews.Content: My partner and I purchased a 5 day package deal to stay at this hotel in April but decided we wanted to stay longer then 5 days since it took awhile for us to get there. The first few days of our stay,we had a what was called a mountain view. We had no idea just how lovely this would be. We were able to see a sliver of the ocean from our balcony but also had this amazing sunset view of the mountain behind the spectacular golf course. (We are golfers so appreciate a nice golf course!) We were sad at the thought of having to go to a not as fantastic room but the hotel staff immediately switched this and allowed us to stay in our room with the gorgeous view for our entire stay. We loved the luaus, hula dancers, and nightly extravaganza on the black rock. We are going back this summer and neither of us can wait. We highly recommend this hotel for its friendly staff, well kept grounds, and delicious food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Sheraton Maui!”
Reviews.Author: katikat1234
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I just got back from another great 7-night stay at the Sheraton Maui Resort (we were there almost exactly a year ago as well), and it was just as good as I remembered! Upon check-in, we were warmly greeted by the staff working at the front desk and upon discovering we were SPG members and also repeat guests, we were kindly offered a free upgrade to a deluxe ocean front room in building 6 (thanks to Irene and the other young woman working the front desk â€“ they were extremely friendly and accommodating at check-in!). The only catch was that the room had 2 double beds, and we had requested a king. We were pretty excited about the upgrade, so we decided to go ahead and check out the room anyways. We spent one night there and really enjoyed the beautiful view out of building 6, but asked the next day to be moved to a king-bed room. Irene kindly switched us to a gorgeous room in building 2, and we were extremely happy with the new room. We could tell it had been recently updated, and it had a gorgeous view of the ocean as well, while still being closely situated to the rest of the resort. The resort itself is immaculately kept up and the grounds are just gorgeous. We were told at check-in that the resort was almost completely booked, but the whole time we were there we never had an issue getting pool chairs or felt crowded while walking around the resort. This resort is also situated in a beautiful area and the snorkeling at black rock is amazing --- we saw huge turtles just float by and an assortment of gorgeous fish. We also enjoyed spending time at the pool each day and love the lazy-river type of set up. The only thing we found disappointing is that since our trip last year they have converted a number of the pool chairs into rental lounges that you have to pay to use. The entire time we were there we never saw anyone actually rent these â€œupgradedâ€� chairs around the pool. At a resort where guests are paying a premium and resort fee on top of the daily room fee, it is disappointing to see the resort nickel-and-dime customers with things like that. We didn't eat at any of the hotel restaurants, so I cannot comment on the food quality. Though, we did peek at the menu at Black Rock and it was very pricey, and you are definitely paying for the convenience of not having to leave the hotel. We spent time exploring all over the island, so ate most of our meals in Lahaina or elsewhere. If you are looking for a great meal no too far away, I would recommend Tropica in the Westin. We had an amazing meal there and it is very close - just down the beach walk to the south (they also have a fantastic happy hour!). We also spent a lot of time running and walking up and down the beach walk from the Sheraton. Although there are a number of other nice resorts in the area, the Sheraton really does have the ideal location and beautiful grounds. It is a great place for couples looking for a quieter, relaxing getaway. We highly recommend the Sheraton Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Best location & hotel on Kaanapli Beach”
Reviews.Author: LaurelMc
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights in November 2011 after staying at the Hyatt in October 2010, and we definitely prefer the Sheraton. The location and hotel are great with the best beach location next to Black Rock where the snorkeling is very good and easy, even for beginners. The large pool overlooks the beach making our beach to pool trekks very easy. Rooms were large and nicely furnished with a good ocean view. Our only complaint was the unclean hallways where we saw the same dirt for our entire stay, even after we let the front dest know about this. The cleaning staff needs a refresher course. We will be staying here again when we return and hope that this small complaint will be rectified by then.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, mediocre room quality”
Reviews.Author: majpreal
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed two nights at the Sheraton Maui because we had some hotel points to redeem. While we only paid the daily "resort fee" of $26 for the room, I'm going to review this as if we paid the standard rates advertised on your typical travel sites. First of all, the location of the resort is outstanding if you want to stay on one of the best beaches in Maui (Kaanapali) and enjoy excellent snorkeling (Black Rock). When you stay at the resort, you have the option of lounging by the pool or bringing a towel out onto the sand....whatever you prefer. And the snorkeling at Black Rock is fantastic for all skill levels. Of course, it can get a bit crowded, but never too bad. The pool area is also very nice and well kept with plenty of lounge chairs in both sun and shade. Their shallow pool seems to go on for miles with little grottos and channels along the way. We don't have kids, but I'd guess that they'd love the pool area. The shops and restaurants at Whalers village are also a short, pleasant walk down the paved path. So five stars for the location, but the real detractor for this resort is room quality. The decor is somewhat dated and the bathrooms are in need of repair; our bathroom had cracked tiles, countertops separating from walls, stains on the walls, etc. It was perfectly usable, just not in great condition. They aren't terrible, but for the price that they charge for rooms ($200 and up per night), I expect more. The bed was comfortable enough but the carpet was also dated and the "lanai" was barely big enough to stand on; let alone fit a chair on. Our room had a "partial" ocean view of North Kaanapali but also overlooked the tennis courts, parking lot and service area. As we walked through the resort, there are some sections where rooms are being renovated so the Sheraton is probably undergoing an upgrade and clearly there are some rooms with some simply amazing ocean views....but I'm sure they are expensive. The other thing to note is that you'll likely need to pay a $26 dollar per day "resort fee", which allows you to park your car and gets you some free wireless in designated areas like the lobby. You have to pay for wireless in your room. The resort itself is very large and it can easily take you 15 minutes to walk from your room to the car so if you are bringing a lot of gear, drop it off at the valet first. Again, location is outstanding, the grounds are nice and well kept but the basis of my review and rating is based on cost of rooms compared to quality. You can easily go North 5 minutes and find a 1 bed remodeled condo with full kitchen, laundry, ocean view etc...but some people like the resort experience more than the condo experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel & Dime Resort & Spa”
Reviews.Author: MidwestBoy
Reviews.Content: First the good... the hotel room was very clean. We had some friends who stayed in a condo. One set got stuck with a unit that hadn't been updated since the 80's; the other had a pretty nice place. So a condo could be rolling the dice. Overall I was definitely happy with the quality of the room and resort. The property is on a very nice beach and although I didn't use the pool, it was nicely laid out and looked like fun - especially for kids. Now the bad... do your own research before you come because the front desk does a terrible job explaining the layout, perks, and other options of the hotel (like the free shuttle that takes you down to Lahaina's Front St shopping area). It wasn't until our last day that we saw the list of activities that they featured everyday. Also, there is a $25/day charge (not optional) that covers parking and internet. We stayed in bldg 4 which ended up being about a mile walk to the parking structure (seriously). The biggest rip-off in my opinion was the $45/day rental fee (for the beach) for either a set of cabana chairs or for a set of beach chairs and umbrella. Lastly, the most ridiculous charge that they told us about was a $4 charge to have wine glasses delivered to our room. Overall I thought the Sheraton was nice, but I was tired of being nickel and dimed by the time I left.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: GaPeach81
Reviews.Content: Before booking the Sheraton Maui I researched Tripadvisor extensively. We booked a king bed in the cheapest room which I believe is the resort view. At check in we got a free upgrade to a partial ocean view. People should keep in mind this is not the Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton. Expectations should be realistic. I think around room was about 280-300/night. The rooms are clean. We didn't spend a lot of time in the room. The location is perfect. We snorkeled at Black Rock every day. The pool was wonderful. The bluest water I have ever seen in a pool. I really liked the 'lazy river'. One negative was the pool bar staff. Service was inconsistent. One day someone would come right away and take drink orders. Some days no one came. I would have to flag someone down. We didn't eat at the hotel so I can't comment on hotel food. We did walk to Whalers Village and ate at the restaurants there. Re: resort fee-I didn't mind it b/c we had a rental car and used the parking garage and we used the free shuttle to Lahaina town on at least 4 occasions so I didn't feel cheated by the fee. Also it looks like most Maui hotels have a resort fee so... For the price and location I would definitely return to the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Haven”
Reviews.Author: Shane A
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon. The room we were initially in was not that great, it was a garden view, did not block sound of children nearby and the people across from us left a pile of spilled cheerios or some other baby food out in front of our doorway every morning --- not very romantic considering the cost...however, we were able to switch rooms to a very nice ocean view with a corner deck. We ate breakfast there every morning and the layout was much better, sound was blocked and no spilled food! The dining areas are good to eat at if you are too tired to venture out. The pool is also fun with a sort of maze to work around. We also had massages at the spa which were THE BEST we have ever had. We were able to rent snorkel gear and swim with sea turtles at black rock, next to the hotel. We had a great time after our room change and I would love to return here for an annivesary some day.

Reviews.Title: “Upcharged to the poorhouse!”
Reviews.Author: 4kobe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from 10/22-29/11. We had booked an ocean-view room with a king-sized bed through expedia. Upon our arrival, we were immediately greeted with the news that we had a "garden-view" (i.e. "parking lot") room with double beds. The dour front-desk assistant finally perked up when she informed us that the last ocean-view room with a king size bed could be had for a mere $50.00 per night. We informed the front-desk person that the couple traveling with us had booked the exact same stay with expedia for the exact same amount and they in fact did receive an ocean-view room. Again, she didn't give a damn. We paid for the upgrade (what else could we do?) and went to the "ocean-view" room where we could barely make out slivers of ocean through the trees and across the massive courtyard. We also had a hideous rollaway bed that spent the night with us despite several requests to have it removed. On our last day, we asked for a late checkout and were charged $100.00 for staying four extra hours in the room. Our traveling companions made the same request and got the late checkout for free. We felt totally ripped off and will never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect anniversary vacation at this first-class hotel.”
Reviews.Author: knjmccann
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with our room, the friendly staff, the cleanliness and the wonderful buffet breakfast. The beach is fantastic. Our only complaint was that there wasn't a lunch place option other than the outdoor bar area. We would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for our wedding”
Reviews.Author: Casey S
Reviews.Content: We had such an incredible experience at the Sheraton. We got married there and we couldnâ€™t have chosen a better place to do it. We had 45 guests at our wedding and had many of them stay at the Sheraton. We all agreed it was the best place in Maui to stay and the guests that didnâ€™t stay there wished they had. The Sheraton has the most incredible wedding planner named Taryn there. She really does a nice job. We literally had the perfect wedding because of her and the staff. We couldnâ€™t find anything that could have gone better. We purchased the romance package while we were there and we would highly recommend it. The rooms are amazing. The location is wonderful. The layout of the hotel can be confusing. We heard a lot of people complaining about getting lost. Overall the Sheraton is the best place to stay and more than likely you will get great customer service. If you are looking to plan a wedding, know that at the Sheraton you can get an incredible wedding planner that comes with the package. We canâ€™t wait to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Yep, it's true, you get the run-around at check-in”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghMatt
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews prior to booking. I was torn between the Hyatt and the Sheraton for my honeymoon. I chose the Sheraton because of the better beach. So many reviews had warned of the run-around you get during check-in, but I felt confident that I could navigate that issue. Well, many weeks later after wedding planning, the wedding itself, and the long day of travel to get to Hawaii, I had forgotten all about the check-in games that I had read about. After waiting at the front desk while the clerk seemingly frantically sought for a room, I was told there no Deluxe Ocean Front kings available that I had booked, and I would have to accept their free "upgrade" to a room with Double beds right next to the pool bathroom. This was the first night of my honeymoon and I was not happy. They also made me an offer to upgrade for another $100 per night to a room with a King bed but still not as good as the room I booked (bldg 2 instead of the bldg 5/6 for ocean front). And as a privilege of receiving this "special rate" I had to commit to staying in that room all week. Then all of the TripAdvisor comments started coming back to me. I declined their high priced "upgrade" and took their free "upgrade" of double beds. I went to the bell stand and grabbed a luggage rack to unload the car. But I was toldthat I was not allowed to use it (even though they had 4 unused ones just sitting there). So my wife and I struggled carrying all our bags to the room. We got to the room, trying to relax into the Aloha spirit. Suddenly the drills and hammers began pounding away on the room directly upstairs. I called the front desk and there was no more drilling or hammering that day, but I still heard sanding and scraping through the remainder of the day. Anyway, the next day we were supposed to move to our new room between 1 and 3. They were to call us when it was ready. After no call, I arrived at the front desk at 4 and they still did not have a room ready. Remembering how long it took the first day, I asked for some drink coupons and told them to call me when they found an available room of the type that I had reserved. An hour later, still no call I went back to the desk. Finally a room. It was fantastic. It was twice as nice as the free upgrade and about the same as the $100 upgrade but much better views. It's a shame that Sheraton overbooks these rooms and plays the juggling act at check in. It puts an unfair burden on the front desk personnel and frustrates customers. I will definitely not be staying at this hotel again. I am a SPG customer and I used to try to stay at Starwood whenever possible, but this whole experience has jaded me.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: PdxTraveler44
Reviews.Content: We just spent six nights at the Sheraton Maui and absolutely loved the experience. There are already many detailed reviews, so I will try to add only a few things that might be additionally helpful to others considering this resort. I will keep my comments to the resort only, and not include outside activities. The Property and Grounds: The property is even more beautiful than the pictures represent - it is immaculate and simply gorgeous. The swimming pool was very clean and refreshing, and we loved floating on the bean bag chairs. I enjoyed having the "drink of the day" by the pool in the plastic souvenir cup. The beach is also very nice and not too crowded, but without shade or chairs unless you rent them. The snorkeling was terrific. We rented snorkel gear for $8 for an hour. This was perfect for us, and although there were quite a few people in the water, we saw many colorful fish and a large turtle right near the shoreline. Another guest mentioned that he was able to enjoy the fish without any snorkel gear at all, and had a turtle bump into him while standing in the water! The Service: From the moment we arrived, all staff were welcoming, friendly, and helpful. The woman at the front desk was very professional and helped accommodate our request for a room with a slightly larger balcony. The gift store saleswoman was always friendly and helpful with locating necessary (forgotten) items and a few souvenirs. The waiters and waitresses by the pool were terrific, although apparently short-staffed at times near the end of our visit. We became addicted to the complimentary snack mix with our drinks and found the birds entertaining as they helpfully cleaned up stray bits. The Room: We are fairly certain our room must have been newly renovated as it appeared to be in perfect condition. I had read that the rooms are "outdated" and in need of renovation, but we were very pleased with ours. It wasn't overly elegant but was simply very neat and clean. Housekeeping came each day and replaced the dirty towels we left out and made the bed. You can request the linens to be changed more frequently, but we were pleased with just the basics. While we were there, construction began on the floor below us, but we were not bothered by the noise. The room directly below ours was being worked on, but the workers kept the noise between appropriate hours of approximately 9 am and 3-4 pm. To be fair, we weren't in our room all that much except to sleep, so it might be more bothersome to others who might spend more time in the room. I at first requested building 4 or 6 when we checked in, based on these tripadvisor reviews. We ended up in building 3 which we would probably request again! The location and view were outstanding. I debated whether I even wanted to share this information as it could be better kept as a secret! We also talked with other guests who were very happy with building 2, which I had read was not so great. The bottom line is that any of the rooms with an ocean view should be great, and the details are likely just personal preference. A worker came by one afternoon to work on our wifi, which was already working perfectly. It appears that management is listening to the comments about room updating and lack of wireless internet service. There were active measures being taken while we were there to address these issues and we had no complaints. Restaurants and bars: We ate at the Cliff Dive pool bar the first night and enjoyed the atmosphere and live music. The food wasn't terrific, but not awful either. We had nachos by the pool one day and again it wasn't worth repeating. We were happy to enjoy the drinks and snack mix, and go to off-site restaurants in the evening that I had researched and had reservations in place. We didn't try the restaurants at the resort based on other comments here. We also opted to not have the buffet breakfast, again based on other travelers' comments. The first morning we purchased coffee, banana and yogurt from the Starbucks cart for $20. This seemed a bit expensive, so we stocked up on fruit and yogurt from the nearby ABC store in Whaler's Village. The fitness center seemed to have plenty of treadmills and other equipment - there were 2 treadmills actually out on the breezeway where one could run while gazing at the amazing view. We ended up walking each morning along the entire Kaanapali beach walk, which was enough exercise for us. I would recommend doing this earlier than later, as other joggers and walkers begin to crowd the walkway soon after 7 a.m. We also enjoyed walking back to the Sheraton along the beach at night following dinner. We loved the live music at the Cliff Dive bar during happy hour, and had fun watching a wedding reception in the middle of the grounds one evening. It wrapped up early and wasn't disruptive or overly noisy. As other reviewers have already stated, the Sheraton seems to be quite a step above all of the other hotels and resorts in this area. We stopped by the Ritz Carlton for comparison, and we still preferred the Sheraton Maui Resort. The pool at the Ritz did seem amazing, but in general the location and atmosphere of the Sheraton is much better. I have only one complaint: There are a number of "special chairs" with canopies around the edge of the pool that can only be rented. I never inquired about the rental cost, but it did irritate me that prime space was reserved for these chairs that were rarely (if ever) used while guests were crowded together in rows behind them. I would suggest either providing all chairs of this quality for no extra charge, or removing them entirely. There were cabanas for rent in other areas with views of the lawn and ocean, which seemed fine and worth the extra cost. This is only my opinion, but I think management should reconsider this practice.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not the aloha spirit!”
Reviews.Author: Fussey1
Reviews.Content: Arrived late in the evening Nov 6 booked for a king bed only to find we will be getting double beds. Married 29 years and never slept in a double bed! Beds small don't sleep two people comfortably at all!! Evening desk clerk told us 80 departures next day so no problem changing rooms for a king bed just call the front desk in the morning. Went to the front desk Monday morning to speak to a young lady who said nope can't help you I'm sorry but those rooms are taken. She proceeded to say just because you book a king size bed doesn't mean you get one, but she was so sorry and you have to keep that room even though you have a Starwood membership! Not very good customer service although she did say having a room with double beds and an ocean view was an upgrade. What a turn off. Today Tuesday and with some persistence finally moved rooms to king bed and ocean view. Thank god for staff like Trevor our bellman who was very kind and friendly service made somewhat of a customer service recovery!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: HMRoch
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Maui, and we can't wait to return. Our stay at this property was fantastic (Bldg 2, 4th Floor)! The check-in process was incredibly smooth, and the agent on staff that night made an immediate, positive first impression with his helpfulness. Other than breakfast the first morning, we didn't dine at the hotel as we like to explore and there are many great restaurants on Maui's west side. Black Rock is impressive but the beach area/snorkeling gets crowded, so we preferred to stay poolside and enjoy the gorgeous ocean views that way. Loved the extensive pool area, deeper water depth, poolside service including daily pineapple bites or aloe vera samples, and available chairs so running down early to reserve spots was not required. Definitely rent a car as it's the easiest was to get around with convenient self-parking available. So many good things to say - well manicured grounds, calm/soothing atmosphere, refrigerator in room, nice amenity products, etc. Definitely consider this property for your visit!

Reviews.Title: “You need to come here!”
Reviews.Author: jismithll
Reviews.Content: My family and I are currently staying at the Sheraton Maui. The hotel grounds are immaculate and stunning. The pool area has a very relaxing feel, but still very enjoyable for active kids. The beach off of Black Rock has excellent snorkeling and water play, but is too steep for boogie boarding. The staff has been very attentive and always ready to offer a friendly aloha greeting. Prices for food are high but comparable to other resorts and restaurants. Nearby Whalers Village offers some dining alternatives for more affordable eating.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all impressed....”
Reviews.Author: Dani R
Reviews.Content: I am here until Friday of this week. I have already had to move rooms because the hotel is that inconsiderate as to do construction during the day in building 3 that one can hear in their room. They move me to a new room, and make excuses for why they are unable to move my luggage for me. Say I have items n the bathroom. No items were in the bathroom. They don't adequately staff their reception desk so the one staff person there sits there and yaks it up with a newlywed couple while I sit there with heavy things I can't put down. The rooms are dated and the buffet at $27 is ridiculously priced. Just really unimpressed. Wish I had gone b.ack to the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “It's the little things...”
Reviews.Author: want2go67
Reviews.Content: Fresh (free) pineapple served poolside, a cup of snacks with your drink order, attentive & friendly poolside service courtesy of Claudia and Tonya specifically. Evelyn at the front desk was helpful in upgrading our room. Jeremiah; fun and friendly helping at the beach toy rental hut. The location is perfect, the grounds beautiful. Love the free shuttle service with 2 stops in Lahaina. I can't wait to return! The only issue I could see would be for people who have health issues walking much. It was nearly 1/2 a mile to the fitness center from our room! We are fit and were fine with it, but others might not have been. It is a huge property. Though the fitness center was sufficient with newer equipment & machines, I was a bit disappointed that there was only 1 yoga or pilates group class offered each day and there was an extra ($10) fee. It is an ideal location to offer a beach boot camp. I agree with other reviewers who complained about the breakfast buffet cost. Probably the highest we've paid at any resort, and not that extensive of a buffet. Skip the buffet and buy the $6 breakfast sandwich at the Starbucks cart. Just be sure to get there before 10:30. We witnessed several guests coming later and being very disappointed it was closed. **Tip: You may not need a rental car. Many tours pick up at the hotel. The shuttle runs regularly and makes 2 stops in Lahaina. Plan your itinerary and depending on the length of your stay, you may just want to hire an airport shuttle to & from. We didn't need our rental car (5 day stay) and could have saved over $200.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: AeRose52
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 9 day stay in Maui at the Sheraton. October was a perfect time to do as it was not so crowded! When we arrived, check in was very quick and easy. We did not ask for any upgrades as we had booked a Partial Ocean View and we aren't picky on rooms but when they found out we were Starwood members they offered us the "best room on the property" a Deluxe Ocean View Suite in the corner of Building 6 overlooking Black Rock for a very low rate. We stayed in that room for 3 days then they moved us over to a room a few doors down that was the same view without the "Suite" part of it. Amazing!! Building 6 was great as we had our own private parking lot so it was easy to get in and out. To get to the pool and beach it was quite a trek involving 3 different elevators but it was worth it for that view! They were doing the room renovations when we were there so lots of moving trucks and furniture in the parking lot but didnt bother us and we did not here anything. Also I read in the reviews that Wifi did not work in the rooms, only the lobby but it worked for us right away in both our rooms, no problem! Pool was fantastic and not crowded at all! The beach was also very nice, lots of snorkelers at Black Rock which we also snorkeled at. It was nice to have our Hotel right there and to not have to trek it down there from some of the other hotels on the parkway. We had the breakfast buffet one day, Black Rock dinner one night, and ate at the Cliff Dive bar but overall we went out to eat at Whalers Village or drove down to Lahaina. We took the shuttle once but it was extremely crowded going back and not everyone would fit on the bus. Especially the pickup after the Luau gets out around 8pm. We got out to go to Lahaina and no way would everyone fit on and the shuttle only comes once an hour for pick up. Easier to drive or take a taxi in my opinion. We were overall extremely happy with our choice to stay here and happier that we stayed in Kaanapali area than Wailea. We drove to Wailea for the day and the beach was nice and calm but it felt like you were in Orange County.. not Hawaii. We loved Kaanapali and Lahaina! Go to Ulalani's Shaved Ice in Lahaina.. the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: j0413
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic property, excellent location, very nice rooms and a great staff. This is our 6th time back at this hotel and we will keep coming back for many years to come. Mayrose the front office manager is the best along with her staff. Pauline who works in housekeeping is the best I've seen in my 25 years of traveling. They just renovated their rooms, nice decor, comfortable beds and plenty of room. I would highly recommend this hotel, we can't wait to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Dresch
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Maui was incredible. Upon arrival we were greeted with complimentary drinks and a private tour of the property. After checking into our room we were given a personalized note slipped under our door welcoming us to the resort, followed shortly by complimentary box of Caramacs. The room was immaculate, with jaw-dropping views of the ocean. Black Rock is an excellent location to snorkel and see turtles and a wide variety of fish. The property itself is situated on what seemed like miles of pristine beach on either side of the property. The resort staff are very friendly and customer service oriented and definitely conveyed the 'Aloha' spirit of the island. The resort also offers every activity imaginable and Whalers village is close by for shopping and dining. We will definitely be returning to the Sheraton Maui for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Went for a friends wedding”
Reviews.Author: Baumeial
Reviews.Content: Overall our week long stay was wonderful. The staff at the front desk and valet were very helpful and we were always greeted with an aloha. There were plenty of spots to relax down by the pool and the ocean is just steps away. The snorkeling at the beach is probably the best on the island and there were always turtles swimming close by.Also the beach towels the resort provides are above average. The shuttle service is nice for getting around lahaina and Whaler's village is just a short walk down the beach path and is full of shopping and restaurants. The only complaint I have is that one of my belongings went missing after our room was cleaned and nobody really seemed to care just saying if it shows up they will mail it. It looked like they were working hard to keep the room clean and possibly even treating each for bedbugs between guests as you would see a cart going around from room to room with what appearted to be some kind of pesticice.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Party of a Lifetime”
Reviews.Author: James G
Reviews.Content: Spent a week with 35 family and friends at the Sheraton and it was absolutely amazing. Everyone had such a wonderful time and the staff couldn't have been better. They were so accomodating and really made a difference for us and our guests. 5 stars!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: janeyLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We took an AA vacation and used A LOT of points to upgrade 2 levels from basic to an ocean view room. The view was really nice and the room quite a decent size with two teens. Despite only double beds, they were amazingly comfortable. The bathroom sink had cracks and the sink stopper pulled out and was disgusting - but we did not say anything. The toilet backed up as soon as we got there and was taken care of immediately. I thought the family would snorkle at Black Rock every day - despite giant turtles you could see from the shore- we preferred the beaches elsewhere. However, it was beautiful, and we took many long walks - best location. Eating was a disappointment - we had 2 free buffet breakfasts daily with the upgraded package. It was very so-so. The casual outdoor restaurants weren't tempting. Finally, the general atmosphere - The clerk who checked us in dismissed a question I had, and a rep for the sheraton membership group (blanking on the name), got her back up when I asked her about how many hours a drive to a popular spot was - "that's a question for the concierge". On the other hand, despite having read complaints, everyone at the towel kiosk was very nice. Net,net, I would certainly consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Black Rock Beauty!”
Reviews.Author: Mark E
Reviews.Content: Checked in on 10/22 for a 5 night stay. Although I booked through Travelocity, I am also an SPG Preferred Guest member and upon presentation of my card was upgraded to an Oceanfront room smack in the middle of everything! Was on the 4th floor overlooking the beautiful grounds with the pool and ocean in the backdrop with a view of Black Rock. Right next to our room was a lanai area/breezeway with 2 comfy chairs where we would sit to avoid the peak sun periods. As we did not rent a car, we ate most of our meals on site. At both pool bar grilles, service was courteous and efficient with good quality food (sandwiches,salads,nachos,etc). The breakfast buffet was a better choice than a la carte value wise with a varied selection of well prepared choices. On our final night, we had dinner at Black Rock Steak and Seafood with my wife choosing a filet and I a strip steak and both were probably the best steaks we've ever eaten! Great ambiance with tiki lanterns surrounding the outer tables where we sat. For dessert we ordered an apple/pineapple pie made in a 7" saute pan and flipped tableside (could have used a scoop of ice cream and a dash of cinnamon) that was delicious! Each evening the was a sunset cliff dive ceremony depicting a tribesman going through the resort and lighting tiki lamps (he would allow children to help him light and pose for pics). He would then make his way to the beach and over to Black Rock where he would dive into the ocean below. My description does not do the ceremony justice, but it's a nightly free show not seen anywhere else. For those without a vehicle, the resort offered free transportation to the sister resorts in Maui and into the shopping areas of Lahaina. All in all, a great stay at the Sheraton Maui and my wife and I both look forward to returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Location vs Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: PeterJForster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 9 nights in October 2011. We got group rates so seemingly represented good value but upon checking in we (a young married couple) were advised that only twin rooms were availabe so we had to sleep separately for the trip. Probably better than our friend who arrived a little later only to be told that the hotel was overbooked and was moved to another hotel. The rooms are large enough for an extended stay but really dated. The sink plug was broken in our room, but rather than fixing the problem, housekeeping just slid the over back into place. Likewise, the wardrobe doors didn't slide well as worcarpet was wrapped around the wheels - again housekeeping did nothing. Finally, there was no wifi available in rooms, which is really annoying when coming from overseas and therefore we didn't have 3G. That said the location and outdoor facilities are amazing and to a large extent helped us overlook the other issues. I would suggest to Sheraton that they upgrade this hotel, it could be amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ROLLTIDE8401
Reviews.Content: We arrived late one night and could see the airy lobby from the valet area. Beautiful entry and property! We received our room, partial ocean view but was not happy with it. We went to inquire about an upgrade and was able to upgrade for a nominal fee each night. We were placed in building 4 for the remainder of our stay. Man, that is the ideal building close to the pool and beach. Make sure you don't go in thinking that you are for sure going to get a free upgrade because you won't!!! Both the rooms we were in were very run down and in a desperate need for a make over. The cabinet that housed the refrigerator in both the rooms were chipped and looked horrible. This is not a 4 star property! However, it suited my needs for the week. The staff were nice but I did have a communication problem with one lady behind the front desk. We were inquiring about the shuttle and she gave me some vague directions about it being in the parking lot on the left. However, my husband spoke with another girl and she gave detailed directions on where it was. I would have never found it if I used the first girls instructions. The pool bar staff seemed to pick and choose who they wanted to wait on. I was only asked once the whole time I was out there if I needed anything. They seemed to only wait on the people that constantly kept a drink in their hand. More bean bags are needed in the pool area as well. Get out there early if you want a seat right by the pool. Housekeeping seemed to just make the bed each day. Not sure if any cleaning was going on in the room while we were there. Great Location if you are looking to be beach front. The beach just north of black rock is prettier, to me. Make sure if you are in building 3 or 4 to park in the side parking lot. It can be found on the service road, right off the turn around. Saved us so much time !!! Also,I saw on TA that the Wi-fi would be installed in the rooms by my visit and it was not. My iPad was useless all week! If this is a 4 star resort you would think they would have wifi. I'm not happy paying the resort fee when I did not use the Internet and only used the shuttle once!
