Had a great week, enjoyed staying here but would hope by the time we return they will have made major changes.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to go back to the Sheraton Maui Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Dale-Karen-Toronto
Reviews.Content: ***if you'd like to see more pictures of the view from our hotel room at the Sheraton Maui Resort, please check my direct blog link at: http://karen-is-here.blogspot.com/2011/09/sheraton-and-westin-kaanapli-resort.html Thanks for reading! :) My boyfriend and I highly, highly recommend the Sheraton Black Rock on Kaanapali beach. We stayed only on Kaanapali beach during our Maui trip, at both the Westin hotel and the Sheraton hotel. The Sheraton was a lot better. If you like to snorkel like I do, you'll see why. Black Rock is right where the Sheraton property is and I snorkelled pretty much everyday there and whenever I did, I would see about 5-8 sea turtles within 45 minutes. I got so close to so many (inches away) and I just love being in the water with them. And, very unexpectedly I also saw spotted eagle rays on my last snorkel adventure that trip right at Black Rock also. If you're into scuba diving they have scuba diving at Black Rock. I took my first scuba diving lesson there and it was lots of fun. We booked the scuba lesson through the Sheraton hotel directly and you may chose to read my review on it here: http://karen-is-here.blogspot.com/2011/09/my-first-scuba-diving-experience-in.html They also do night dives if you're into that. Sooo....we did book a premiere snorkel trip with a company called the Teralani. Save yourself the money and don't book it. The snorkelling at Black Rock is a whole lot better than the spots the Teralani took us too, plus its at the convenience of your hotel if you're staying at the Sheraton Black Rock (not to mention you save $$ not having to go with the Teralani or any other company offering snorkelling excursions) if you book with the Sheraton Black Rock, try to stay in building 6 if you want to be closest to the ocean view. We had an ocean view room and our balcony was facing right onto Black Rock. It was really private too so we had a lot more privacy than we did at the Westin since outside our balcony at the Westin is all the shopping from Whaler's Village. So, what's neat about building 6 ocean view rooms? We saw the best Maui sunsets on the privacy of our balcony. I included pictures of the sunsets I took from our balcony. It was just so beautiful. I was actually taken on a sunset cruise with the Teralani as well and honestly, the sunset cruise was nothing to cry home about if you're at the Sheraton Black Rock with an ocean view. I wouldn't recommend the sunset cruise if you have the ocean view room. Also, I saw sea turtles in the ocean right from our balcony at the Sheraton! Yay! Plus, the Sheraton has this torch lighting ceremony and Cliff Dive every early evening. If you had the kind of room we did, you could see the Cliff Dive from your balcony. But it's nice to see the torch lighting ceremony once closer in person on the beach of the Sheraton. if you chose to snorkel at the Sheraton Black Rock, you can rent snorkel gear at the Sheraton but it's overpriced and worst off, you have to return it by 5 pm the same day. If you have a car I highly suggest renting your gear at Maui Dive Shop (you could also grab a cab). There are a few locations and there was one within a few minutes drive from the Sheraton. The gear was newer, cleaner, and you can rent the snorkel gear for one week for the same price as one day with the Sheraton. They also have scuba gear rental at Maui Dive Shop. Hmmm...what else? Oh as for the service at the resort, well...I'm not sure why they really charge you the $25 resort fee/day. The service was not bad but it wasn't exceptional. We did have one mishap though One day the maid did not make up our room because she knocked on our door in the morning while we were still sleeping, so we asked her to come back later. When she came back 1.5 -2 hours later we were just busy in the room and asked if she could come back a bit later like in an hour. I guess she had a bad day or something because all we heard her say was "(insert profanity)" aloud through the door. My boyfriend and I were really shocked at such a rude response from the maid so we called front desk about it and they awarded my boyfriend some starwood points as a compensation for the misunderstanding....other than that, I believe that was the only mishap we had at the hotel. It certainly hasn't stopped us from wanting to go back to the Sheraton Maui Resort :)

Reviews.Title: “very relaxing resort with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jasmans
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort hotel for seven nights in October 2011. The resort has many different builidngs with many different types of rooms. I stayed in a Hana suite with had two double beds and a pull down murphy bed. The room was a decent size with a nice sofa and chairs to relax. The bathroom was quite nice with a walk in shower and separate tub along with dual sink vanity. The room came with a tiny dorm fridge and tiny microwave, both worked fine. I did see some other regular rooms in this resort and they ranged from very nicely upgraded to god awful. The only bad thing in the Suite was the A/C system had a motion detector on it. At night while sleeping (not moving) the A/C system would not run. This led to a warm room with stale air to try to sleep in. And if that is not bad enough, the door for murphy bed would completely block the A/C unit, so if you used the murphy bed you were guanteed to not have any A/C in the room at night. Starwood really needs to remove these motion detectors from their properties. The resort was completely sold out for the week, but the beach and pool did not seem overly crowded. You could still get two lounge chairs poolside at 10am. The resort is on the nicest area of Kanapali beach. The beach is very wide and deep with lots of nice sand. The water gets deep very quickly off the beach, but this makes for some great snorkeling. The blackrock at the end of the beach is very unique. It is quite fun to climb up and jump or dive off, or just fun to watch other people try it. The resort was very clean and well maintained, I did not notice anything broken my entire time. The employees at the front desk and poolside seemed very friendly and did not mind any requests I made.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: J3GP
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that we have been Starwood Platinum members for many years. We have enjoyed numerous Starwood properties, to include the Luxury lines. This particular trip we stayed at the St Regis on Kauai along with the Sheraton Maui. Both were over the top. We found the Sheraton on par with the St Regis in some categories and even exceeding in a few others. First,we would like to recognize and commend Evelyn at the front desk, who in many ways was responsible for making this experience so memorable. We have NEVER encountered or worked with someone like her, who went SO FAR out of her way to make sure every aspect of our room stay was so wonderful. She is a jewel!!! Many, many thanks!! Also note able were Summer at the concierge desk and Claudia at the Poolside. They were so friendly and hospitable in every way. Hats off to The Sheraton for having such a wonderful staff. As in past reviews of this Resort, we are always amazed by the beauty and atmosphere offered here, especially at such a GREAT PRICE. As one of the original resorts, it benefited by purchasing the largest, most scenic and best beach location. It is the most beautiful property on Kaanapali. The grounds are impeccable and gorgeous with large lawns, palms galore, the best beach, great rooms (currently going through renovation...of which we were beneficiaries),and a very relaxed Aloha environment. We visited many of the other facilities during our stay and were always happy to return to our retreat. This continues to be our favorite Kaanapali Hotel/Resort and look forward to returning again SOON!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE Service & Attitude - Never Again”
Reviews.Author: maverickgirl
Reviews.Content: STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!!! Stayed at this place for a week and it's got the WORST SERVICE. Pool staff was unattentive and took their time to take care of guests. When asked for service, the response was rude & arrogant. I gave feedback to the front desk and the manager and it seemed like they didn't care to hear it. This place is not worth the price paid and should be rated 1 star for service & value. I would never stay at this place again and don't recommend it. There are many other & better places to stay at - like the Westin, which I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: ph p
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is a wonderful resort in a secluded part of Maui. The ocean was crystal clear with multiple sea animals located right off the beach and volcanic cliff, which you can also dive off...the cliff, not the beach! There is shopping, restaurants, and surf lessons close to the resort. If you are on a budget, there is also a shuttle you can take into town where you can shop at a grocery store and chain restaurants such as Subway. The only downside to this resort is the price of everything at the resort itself. The drinks and food were expensive so be prepared if you plan on eating at the resort. Renting snorkeling equipment was also expensive so bring your own if you can. I would recommend this resort for honeymooners and those looking to relax. If you want to plan a lot of activities, the big island or Oahu might be a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel - i'd come back again.”
Reviews.Author: ctaylor0159
Reviews.Content: we went back in november of 2008 for our honeymoon & loved this hotel. great snorkelling (saw a ton of turtles & my husband accidently came face to face with one!), spacious rooms, beautiful grounds, big pool, & plenty of lounge chairs. plus, the area offers a ton of different things to do (stores, restaurants, etc...) unlike the waialea area where you are in the middle of nowhere. the beach was crowded, but not too bad. the big cliff with the guy jumping from the top every night was cool to watch. i'd definitely go back & recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet and clean!”
Reviews.Author: weluv2travel07
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying here. We had reserved an oceanfront room and was disapointed the first night, that the room was on the ground floor and the ocean view was obstructed by the garden hedge! We were upgraded the next day to an oceanfront suite. Very nice! 5th floor, end unit. Very quiet and clean. We had massages while at the Sheraton, and I would highly recomend this service! We did choose to have the massages inside, and not oceanside. We also started a "recycling/reuse" program during our stay! The magazines that we were done with, we put out with a note, "Free, Read and Pass! By the end of our stay, people had left santan lotions, microwave bowls, bamboo mats". It was really fun to see the goods reused for vacationers that were arriving, that could not be used by us who had to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Anniversary Gift”
Reviews.Author: dubuquemama
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two boys last year as we were celebrating our 10th anniversary. Five stars all around: large, clean, comfy rooms and great staff. We had a huge balcony with an ocean view from our room which was just steps from the amazing sandy beach. We taught our boys to snorkel here at Black Rock. We saw many beautiful tropical fish and every day we swam with the sea turtles. Each night we'd watch the tiki lighting ceremony and cliff dive from the beach. We got fantastic photos from our point and shoot camera. We ate a couple of times (lunch and dinner) at the Sheraton's restaurants, exactly what we expected: good service & good food. Renting boogie boards was easy, maybe next time we'll all try the paddle boards. The beach is a public beach but was not crowded mid-week, on the weekend it was busier. It was a short walk to Whaler's Village for dinner in the evenings. One night there was a native dance performance at the village to provide the perfect entertainment while waiting for our dinner reservations. Note: we did not eat breakfast at the hotel, since there was a mini-fridge we bought groceries and ate breakfast from our balcony. Nor did we attend the luaua. The Sheraton was a perfect anniversary gift to ourselves, one which our family will always remember.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience - HIGHLY RECOMMEND”
Reviews.Author: jamesandsusanne
Reviews.Content: Wow, what can I say. I spent two weeks at the Sheraton Maui with my wife and two children (ages 11 and 8) and it was fantastic. We had never been to Maui before and I'll admit having a hard time deciding where we should stay. I had read a lot of reviews of the hotels on Maui in the Ka'anapali area before deciding to pick the Sheraton and, well, what a great choice! The room (deluxe ocean view, 4 floor in the Hale Lahaina building) was amazing, the location was absolutely perfect, the hotel staff were genuinely friendly and extremely helpful. I had read some comments about the staff not being friendly there, but I never once saw anything other than friendly and helpful service. This hotel is by far the best one I have ever stayed at! Our expectations were exceeded in every way. If I was to say anything on the negative side, it would be that the price of the food and drinks at the hotel - and especially at the Starbucks that is located on-site - is pretty high. (I mean, $8.50 for two grande coffees, come one). My recommendation would be to either walk to Whaler's village or simply take the convenient shuttle service offered by the hotel and find something to eat in Lahaina. That said, we did eat at the hotel once and the food was good...good but pricey. The hotel has a nice little shop on site called Lamont's that offers reasonably priced sundries and souvenirs - a nice touch. That aside, the property is dream-like and the swimming and snorkeling right in front of the hotel, near blackrock, is really amazing. My kids and I saw many different kinds of tropical fish as well as a couple of honu (green sea turtles). Thank you Sheraton Maui for making this, our first trip to Maui, something we will always remember. The hardest part of the trip was having to leave the hotel...I can't wait to return. My wife wants us to go back now!

Reviews.Title: “Over many visits, a consistent performer in the Maui Resort market”
Reviews.Author: scrambler329
Reviews.Content: It is all about the location on this one. Next to Black Rock (great snorkeling), at the end of Kaanapali Beach (less crowded), spacious grounds (open feeling), and proximity to other businesses and services (Whaler's Village is a short walk). When you walk down the beach path you will feel what I mean by this location lends to a more relaxed atmosphere. The pool is great there. The rooms are nothing fantastic but still far above average. There is a bit of learning the lay of the land as it can be confusing how to get around the main building especially access to other lower floor areas. We loved the shuttle that takes to the other Starwood properties as well as Lahaina. Be sure to check your reservation by calling resort directly especially during extremely busy times as I have had to make them aware of any special requests again and also one time there was an overbooking. The staff has always been fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: cmsteph1
Reviews.Content: We just came back from spending 6 days of our 9 day honeymoon at the Sheraton Maui. This hotel is nothing short of 5-stars, first-class. We were upgraded to a deluxe ocean-view room due to capacity, so we may have been a bit spoiled, but honestly, the grounds are just beautiful, and the views are spectacular from any and every area of the hotel. Our room was clean, modern and well decorated. The view from our balcony was nothing but ocean, with the quiet island of Molokai off in the distance. It felt very isolated and relaxing. My only complaint with our room location was that it was quite a haul to get to the pool or lobby, with 4 separate elevator rides! However, there was a private parking lot for our building, just 1 short elevator ride away. There was never any shortage of chairs at the pool, and no shortage of beach space either. There is absolutely no need to rush down in the morning, which is so nice when you are on vacation! Poolside drinks and food are very expensive, and you are not allowed to bring your own down from your room. The poolside bars do offer happy hour specials though. We were a bit disappointed how late things open up around the pool, and how early they shut down. We had fallen in love with Mai Tais during our stay in Honolulu, and were excited to check out the poolside Mai Tai bar after we checked in. However they had already closed for the evening, at 5:00 pm! Overall things shut down much earlier in Maui though, as compared to Honolulu. That was a bit of an adjustment for us! The Whaler's Village is just a short beachside walk away (there is a pathway), and there is quite a bit to do there at nighttime. The Sheraton also provides a free shuttle to Lahaina, that runs until 10:00 at night, so we took advantage of that a few nights, there are several "hip" bars, restaurants & shops worth checking out down there. Overall, we really truly enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton Maui. It far exceeded our expecations, and was the perfect setting for our perfect honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Clare S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sheraton Maui on our honeymoon in January 2010. It was our first time to Hawaii and in our taxi on the way to the hotel (about 40 mins by taxi) we were greeted by the most amazing sunset. It was a sign of things to come! We arrived at the Sheraton just after sunset - a perfect time to arrive at this hotel. It was lit up with the warm inviting light of the tiki lamps and we were greeted on arrival with garlands of flowers. The hotel upgraded us to an Ocean Front room (we had booked ocean view). Our room was beautiful with stunning views form the balcony of the Black Rock, the sea and the lagoon pools and bar. The hotel's facilities are beautiful, and this hotel is very plush and exceptionally clean. The staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful. It is nice and quiet - the bars do close early at 11:00, so if you want a drink later than this you have to head to Lahaina. Lahaina is about a 15 minute ride away, but there is a shuttle bus which is free which runs hourly. We used this a number of times, but a taxi is only around $10-15. The upside of the bars shutting early is that it is very quiet and peaceful at night. There were some families in this hotel but there was a nice balance. I would say it suits couples and families and neither intrude on the other (and I don't normally like hotels where there are children!) The restaurants in the hotel are good. There is a nice range of food and it is all done well. I have to say it is not exceptional though and it is on the pricey side. Especially Tepanyaki Dan's, which is very expensive and feels like it is all over very quickly! However, this is Hawaii - it's not cheap anywhere!!! The beach is beautiful and the Black Rock is perfect for snorkelling. Word of warning though - sometimes the waves get very powerful we had an "incident" on the last day of our stay, culminating in my husband being tossed by a wave and breaking his hip. We thought that my husband had been very unlucky until we were told by a local doctor that the beach is well known for accidents due to the shelving sand. Do not let this put you off though - most of the time the waves were not that big, and sometimes it was very calm. Just have a healthy respect for the sea when the waves get big (there may have been an element of over-confidence in my husband's case ;-)) Anyway - the hotel staff were amazing and really supported us as my husband was in hospital for a week and then he had to recuperate for a few days at the hotel before we could go home. The hotel was near capacity but they found us a room with disabled facilities and really looked after us for our unplanned extended stay. They also sent us a card and a big bag of goodies to cheer us up. All in all a very memorable honeymoon, but for the right reasons. The Sheraton played a pivotal part in making our experience of Maui so wonderful and in softening the blow of the unfortunate incident at the end of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Memories”
Reviews.Author: ugadog
Reviews.Content: We inhabited the Sheraton Maui for four glorious nights and 5 days in mid-September for our 25th wedding anniversary celebration. We had stayed at neighboring hotels before and endured the long, arduous hike to snorkel at Black Rock, but we had never actually stayed at the Sheraton. Our ocean front room on the second floor was simply perfect. The view over the pool area to the beach, with the island of Lanai across the channel was spectacular. The location, just a few steps away from the pool, restaurants and lobby, offered the ultimate in convenience, as we struggled each day to perform very large quantities of nothing. The room, amenities, staff, and activities of the resort all exceeded our expectations. Valet parking is included in the first night stay. After that, for $5.12 extra you can continue the valet service. Our aging legs advised us to embrace this small sacrifice to avoid future pain and suffering, so we happily obliged. The pool was an enjoyable adventure and we were able to find shade under the umbrellas and palm trees every day, even the time we didnâ€™t arrive until almost noon (1 lonely palm tree was nicely waiting for our gratification). Of course, as the day progressed, the chairs had to be migrated opposite to the movement of the sun to maintain a seamless canopy over all body parts. If you are celebrating a significant event (or insignificant event for that matter), order a drink in a whole pineapple. In addition to the fantasy appearance and savory taste of the drink, it is certain to elicit comments and conversations from other hotel guests. Order it early in the day, as a â€œwholeâ€� pineapple is ironically a scarce commodity in a Hawaiian resort â€¦ the honeymooners next to us got the last ones in existence on our first pool visit. Unfortunately, the snorkeling at Black Rock was not nearly as good as we had remembered 10-15 years ago. As I recall there was a vendor selling little bags of fish food to snorkelers that may have contributed (you really think?) to the abundance of fish at that time. However, there were still sufficient turtles, fish and coral to make the effort worthwhile (well, aside from the leg cramps that we both enjoyed in the water and later at night). As with most upper end Hawaiian resorts, the restaurants were very good, but outrageously priced. We did the $29 breakfast buffet a couple of days and then drove down to Cane and Taro at Whalers Village for a more reasonable breakfast price tag the other days. Yes, Whalerâ€™s Village is just a short 5-10 minute walk along the beach. In fact, the concierge at the pool gave us a very perplexed look when we booked a UFO Parasail excursion and then refused to accept his suggestion that we walk to Whalerâ€™s Village for the lift off. However, we didnâ€™t rent the red Mustang convertible to let it sit in the parking lot. Furthermore, I defer again to the almighty ruler of the body, the cramping legs, which again demanded our obedience. Thank you Sheraton Maui for the wonderful memories!

Reviews.Title: “The Best location on Ka'anapali Beach, without a doubt”
Reviews.Author: celesteram
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this Sheraton for two years in a row, both times in building #6, or Moana. To us, having that view makes a huge difference in our enjoyment of this hotel. The rooms are plenty nice, not extravagant though. Bathrooms are spacious. I think there might be other areas of the hotel that would feel more crowded at peak times of the year. I was a little disappointed that our valet forgot the lei greeting, but no big deal. The check-in process went smoothly and quickly, and the lobby has such amazing views and fresh air that you hardly notice the time passing. Maybe it's the euphoria of arriving in Maui and hearing Hawaiian music playing that makes it special! We like building #6 also because you can self park through a gate using your room key, and not have to worry about tipping the valet every time you need your car. This is important to us because we stay on the go, sight seeing, hiking, dining out, and exploring. We usually take time to enjoy the pool, which is very nice and spacious. The beach is wonderful and the water is clear. We also enjoyed the adjacent beach just to the north, off the Royal Ka'anapali golf course and just south of Kahekili Beach Park and the Royal Lahaina Resort. The sand was very steep, going to the water, but the water was very enjoyable and uncrowded. Ka'anapali is a great section of West Maui, and we enjoy the proximity to Whaler's Village for shopping, as well as downtown Lahaina. Kapalua is a short drive north, and the drive around NW Maui is very do-able from this location. I like that the Sheraton perpetuates Hawaiian culture through hula lessons, lei making, weekly luaus, and Hawaiian art in the public areas & rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but VERY expensive”
Reviews.Author: TheHellers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights in late September. Had a wonderful time, it really is the best hotel on the beach, right up against Black Rock with some great snorkeling. We stayed in Building 6 above the Rock with view of Molokai, which was relaxing and quiet. Check-in. We got there at 2:30 for a 3:00 check in. Not a problem, we went to the bar and had a couple cocktails and left my cell phone number with the front desk clerk. At 3:30 we went up to the desk, I noticed my number had been crossed out and yet I never got a call. He said 10-15 minutes so we walked around the grounds. At 4:00 came back and they were doing a shift change. He left without saying anything to us. I had to find someone else and they said FIVE more minutes. On the couple other occasions I had to talk to the front desk I found that they weren't overly friendly and just going through the motions. But you don't deal with them everyday and I wasn't going to let them ruin my vacation, just a disappointment. We did the breakfast plan (tip/tax included), excellent food. Had dinner one night at the restaurant and it was great. Service at the restaurant was always superb. Inside Bar area. Bleh. Not inviting at all. Usually empty, we only went once. The bartender was more interested in watching a reality show. Just not a cool place to hang out for drinks. Beach Bar area: two beach bars that close early (one at 4pm, huh?, the other at 8) so there isn't anywhere else to have a drink near the beach on this property after 8. Bartenders nice, but not all that personable compared to the Royal Hawaiian in Oahu and other places we went. Pool - Excellent area, nice to relax by although we are on the beach so we didn't understand why people hung out by the pool every day. More a place to refresh for us at the end of a beach day. Beach - Great location, some amazing snorkeling (turtles swim right by you). Cost - They will get your for EVERYTHING and it's not cheap. Want a chair, pay for it. Want an umbrella, pay for it. I'm paying a lot of money for your hotel PLUS a stupid resort fee and you charge me? Just make me prove I'm staying there and give me one. Ridiculous. Luckily we were bequeathed two store bought patio chairs by someone leaving so we used for the week and then gave them to someone else. Wonder how long those have been passed around, LOL. Towels were free but you have to have a card to get them. Then they'll ask you if you want to buy sunglasses while you're getting the towel. Yes, I'll buy overpriced sunglasses from you since the ones on my face while I'm talking to you are not noticeable enough. You get the drift, any chance to squeeze an extra dime out of you on their already expensive resort with a ridiculous resort fee they will try and do it. Now, I'm not complaining as much as warning you if you stay here (I did give this hotel four stars). It's just bothersome but won't stop your enjoyment of the beach, sun, cocktails and all the other fun you will have on Maui. It's just the way of the world now. But their front desk staff could use some customer service training, that is for sure. Coming from the Royal Hawaiian, where service was top-notch, this was disappointing. I'd stay there again for sure, the Sheraton Maui, probably not. Steve

Reviews.Title: “Wonder stay in Maui”
Reviews.Author: amazon55
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Maui. Got a fantastic ocean front room in the 6000 building. Worth the price. Beautiful view. The room had a great bed and good amenities. Property has a very nice pool and sits on the best beach on Maui. The Black Rock is very good for snorkeling. Rent gear from Boss Frogs or Snorkel Bobs for good prices. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Ocean front is worth the extra bucks. Eat at Merriman's in Kapalua, Roy's in Kahana and Honu in Lahaina All are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Built on Black Rock, the ancient spirits are part of the ambiance!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara S
Reviews.Content: They will tell you the Sheraton Maui could not be built today...it is nestled into the ancient lava of Black Rock and there are powerful Hawaiian legends about the area. But what a breathtaking location! Steps from the gentle Kaanapali Beach with Lanai oh, so close. In the other direction Whalers Village offers shopping and lovely resorts line the shore. The rooms are lovely, but I think the best part of the room is the lanai with a table and two chairs. Sit for a bit and feel the sea air, watch the folks on the beach, and hear the almost always gentle surf. The bathroom had a good set-up and a tub with plenty of hot water. The staff is excellent and the food first-rate. I hated to leave!

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: MrsPicky72
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the Sheraton Maui Resort (Sept 8-12, 2011) to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. We arrived around 11:00 p.m. (highly recommend SpeediShuttle if you don't have a car) and had no problems checking in. The hotel is pretty quiet at this time of night and it smells beautiful since there are flowering trees and shrubs everywhere. However, we were not greeted with a lei (as everyone imagines their first visit to Hawaii to be) nor did we have help with our luggage (although we didn't ask either). We did get a lei made of shells the next day but we had to ask about it since they were hanging behind the front desk. The Aloha spirit was missing here (except the front desk clerk that helped us change rooms the next morning - she provided top notch service and I wish I remembered her name). Room: We were very disappointed with our original room because it was not up to the Sheraton standard that we are used to (Room 3503). The carpet looked dirty, the bathrooms were outdated, and the lanai was so small there was only enough room for one little chair and table (no space for a partner). Working in health care I always do a bed bug check before we unpack and thankfully didn't find any signs. Unfortunately, our room did have termite issues. The night stand had huge gaps filled of termite eggs. I'm not sure if they were dead or alive but upon closer inspection we noticed holes all over the night stand and we're not sure why the Sheraton would keep this furniture around? We called the front desk and explained our disappointment. They said they'd find us a new room but had to wait until the morning. We did find two little bottles of sparkling wine in the room for our anniversary which was nice. The hotel kept their promise and moved us the next morning to a much nicer room that has been updated more recently. We had to give up our king size bed for two doubles but it was worth it. The new room (2118) had a garden view on the first floor just steps away from the beach. The location was perfect! The beds are extremely comfortable and the linens were clean. It had a big flat screen TV that allowed an iPod hook up to watch movies. The bathroom vanity was gorgeous with a nice marble countertop. Another nice feature was a separate closet for the toilet so you had privacy while your partner got ready. Food: We only ate at the hotel once because of the price. We had the buffet breakfast our first morning because we didn't know our way around yet. The food was very good but the price for two people plus tax and tip came to approx. $70! That is crazy so we never ate at the resort again. They also have a major bird issue around food so don't be surprised to see birds sitting by your table waiting for you to leave your food. Drinks are $10 which is pretty common around this area. My suggestion would be to find out when all the happy hours are in the area and go to Whalers Village for breakfast (Cane & Taro has amazing eggs benedict and fruit smoothies plus the price is right). Everything is extremely expensive at this hotel but luckily it is easy to walk to Whalers Village where you can find an ABC Store for supplies (we loved these stores because they are everywhere and reasonably priced) and a variety of restaurants. However, the hotel does offer some free activities that you should partake in like learning the hula, watching the cliff dive ceremony at dusk, shuttle to Lahaina, etc. We didn't stick around the hotel much so I can't offer comments about the other free activities. Property: This is one of our favorite things about the Sheraton - its location on the beach. Snorkeling at the black rock with giant sea turtles was a highlight of our trip. It's amazing how friendly they are and will swim right up to you. My husband learned to paddleboard at black rock but the rental was very expensive ($35 per hour). The grounds are beautiful and parking is included in the $25 per night resort fee. We were disappointed that wireless internet was only available in the hotel lobby and it is extremely slow. There is an internet connection in the room but we only travel with iPods/iPads. They have a great pool with lots of chairs and thankfully don't allow chair saving. The torch lights at night really add a nice ambiance. It's a very beautiful resort. Location: While staying in this area, my husband took in some great surfing lessons down the beach for $70 (1.5-2.0 hours of instruction) - and they got him up surfing! Some of our favorite places include Yogurtland (after a hot day on the beach), Leilani's for Happy Hour Mai Tais (shout out to Ian - best bartender ever), and Hula Grill for coconut calamari. The Whaler's Museum is also cool (check out their payday and fine info). WARNING: Check your room charges the day before you leave. When they switched our room they started charging us a much higher rate even though they said the upgrade would be free. We were overcharged approx. $1,250! When I pointed out the error to the front desk she said she would have it corrected. I asked to have it corrected now so I could have a copy of the revised invoice. She seemed bothered by this (even though no one was waiting) but I'm glad I waited. It took her a really long time in the back to get it corrected (20 minutes or so). When she came out, we were still overcharged by $400. Everything finally got corrected after another long wait but we're happy we worked it out before we checked out. Overall: We loved the resort but not the price of food or rentals. We actually would have spent more time at the resort if their prices were more reasonable ($11 for cereal?). Would I go back? Maybe, if the price was right but I'd likely rent a condo in the area instead. Oh yeah, we saw a night stand being hauled out the back the next day so hopefully it was the one from our first room.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price! Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: dmsnider
Reviews.Content: My husband just got back from 10 days Maui. We spent the first 5 nights in Wailea and 4 nights in Kaanapali. We should have stayed all 9 in Wailea, instead of staying at the Sheraton. We've stayed in Kaanpalali before, so we wanted to stay again. We hadn't stayed at the Sheraton but I knew the location. The pro's of staying there was the snorkeling at Black Rock and being close to Whalers Village for other restaurant options and shopping. Lahainia is only a 10 min. drive. Also, if you play golf, there are 2 courses there. The view from our balcony was great. The con's were a room upgrade was $50 a night, no in-room Wifi, very small out-dated room, small closet with the room safe, so no room for shoes and on top of the safe was the ice bucket and glasses, paper cups for coffee and plastic cups in the bathroom. The pictures of the rooms on the website didn't look anything like our room. I usually take pictures of our rooms because I'm a scrapbooker but I didn't take any of this room because there wasn't anything special about it. I don't think our floor got vacuumed either, saw the same dead flowers on the floor for 2 days until I picked them up. The breakfast buffett was almost $60 for 2! We went to the Cannery and had a great breakfast at LuLu's for a reasonable price. No discounts of any kind for staying there or being a SPG member. The drinks at the Cliff bar weren't very good at all. I don't want a strong drink but I would like a little taste of the rum in my Lava flow which was like a slushy with no flavor. I thought that maybe it was just us until I talked to severaly other guests at pool who had the same complaints and I didn't bring it up until they said something. It wasn't like the hotel was packed, it wasn't busy at all. We could of been upgraded w/o paying the extra $$. The front desk person at check out was rude. I wanted a copy of our bill and she said it was sent to our email. I said I hadn't read my email yet, (it was 6:45 am) and she repeated rudely that it was sent to our email. The difference with the 2 hotels we stayed at in Wailea, (the Grand Wailea and the Marriott) and the Sheraton, were; we didn't have to pay extra to have an upgraded room, even though I booked a garden view we were upgraded to an ocean view, free of charge! Bigger rooms with Wifi, real cups and glasses. Discounts at the Marriott breakfast buffett, $17 per person. Plus, the Marriott gave us a discount card that could be used at restaurants and shopping on the whole island for our entire stay. We got $40 off our dinner at Humu at the Grand Wailea, excellent dinner. Great service at the adults only pools at both places. We had to have valet parking at the G.W. but it was included in our resort fee, plus they gave us cold bottled water every time we got into our car! I was so disappointed in the Sheraton! I won't stay there again and wouldn't recommend it, either. For what we paid at Sheraton we could have stayed in Wailea and had a much better experience. Marriott and the Hilton, (Grand Wailea) really have it together, the Sheraton should take some lessons on service.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Robert V
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there with our two sons who were celebtrating their biirthdays (13&10). It was the boys first trip to Maui and what an amazing time. We were upgraded from an Ocean View to Deluxe Ocean Front room. The minute we got to our room the boys opened the slider to the balcony and were greeted by a dolphin passing by Black Rock outside our room and then a Sea Turtle. BLack Rock is a great place to snorkel and see Sea Turtles and many other aquatic life. The pool is nice and never felt crowded (have been to Las Vegas, talk about pool crowds). We stayed in building 6 which is the furthest building fromt he lobby (yes a bit of a hike to the pool, beach or lobby, but the exercise would do anyone good and we didn't mind it. Keep in mind, I carried a large dive bag with 4 sets of fins, maskes, snorkels and assorted items). The Luau at the Sheraton was great and my kids loved the games before the main show. Only drawback is the resort fee in my book. We did use the parking, but never used the internet. Perhaps they could do an ala carte option. All in all, I will be back and would reccomend to anyone. Staff was very friendly and accomodating. We never ate at the resort, except for the luau (too many other options and we were doing a lot of sight seeing.)

Reviews.Title: “Location is the Sheraton's only saving grace”
Reviews.Author: Klaura12185
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent seven days here for our honeymoon. I knew there would be resort charges and assumed all would be worth it since hey, it's Hawaii. Well aside from the location on the beach, the good did not outweigh the bad. The food at the cliff dive bar is is sub-par at best, and I'm being nice, as I suffered from food poisoning the day after eating potato wedges there and ended up losing a day of my honeymoon to an upset stomach as a result. We did not bother eating anything else from any of the restaurants as a result. You're better off buying food from Safeway but check if there's a microwave in your room. We asked for one and ended up PAYING an additional $35 for a microwave. UNBELIEVABLE!! How dare they make us pay extra for something that is standard in every hotel I have ever been to! We didn't bother eating at their nicer restaurant due to the nickel and dimeing. The $25/night room charge is a robbery. There is no wifi and we were forced to use our phone data. I keep hearing in the management responses that this will be fixed by the end of the year, but what good does that do for me now? I live in Northern Virginia and you only honeymoon once. The management should at least reduce the resort fee until this is updated according to my husband who is a hotel manager and has worked in the hotel industry for over ten years. As I mentioned the location is this place's only saving grace, along with Monica at the concierge desk who helped us schedule our honeymoon activities with the money we received though our honeymoon registry with Starwood. She was wonderful. The pool and the grounds are very nice and well kept, and the luau at the Sheraton was great. The nickel and dimeing of everything else ruined the overall stay. Yeah the resort fee supposedly covers self-parking, "free" wifi, fitness center, towels, and whatever management claims but what about if you didn't rent a car, or use the fitness center, or in our case, had no wifi for the room? On top of that we did not rent any snorkeling gear from the resort, and went to Boss Frogs instead. We got a killer deal on gear as well as an underwater digital camera for a week. Again the positives are in the Sheraton's location. It's close to the whaler's village which has great restaurants and shops. Try Cane and Taro's. They have excellent sashimi and fish entrees. Also found a sports bar in Lahaina called Lulu's which was great since we're football fans and wanted to watch Monday Night Football. Again all this is close to Ka'anapali where the Sheraton is located. However there are other resorts in this area, so I would suggest giving those a shot. As I mentioned we live in Northern Virginia so it's unlikely we'll return to Maui or any of the islands soon as it is an extremely long trip but if we do return anytime soon it will not be to the Sheraton. If I'm to pay resort fees then it better be for things that actually are there. Having to pay extra for things that are standard in any other hotel as well as losing a day to food poisoning due to food consumed at the Sheraton, thankfully did not ruin the overall experience as we enjoyed our activities, especially the road to Hana.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Loved it! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Eurofriends
Reviews.Content: After 4 flights in 24 hours as we approached the Sheraton Maui via taxi we started getting excited. Upon entering the lobby we were immediately drawn to the spectacular ocean views across the resort. It looked so serene and brilliant blue that we got goose bumps. Maui is amazing and the resort is terrific. Hotelâ€™s positives - Wonderful location - Beautiful resort - Picturesque scenery - Black Rock & the beach made stunning backdrops for all activities (& associated photos) - Short picturesque walk to Whalerâ€™s Village shops & restaurants - Great jogging path along the water - Pool area is gorgeous - The luau was excellent. We got some fantastic photos as the sun was setting behind the dancers & then later of the fire twirler, & the food was very good - Free shuttle bus to Lahaina & other hotels, restaurants & shops. We didnâ€™t have a car so the shuttle was appreciated - Excellent service at check-in & by the concierge - We stayed in an ocean view room on the 4th floor nearest Black Rock. The view was amazing, we were thrilled with the roomâ€™s location & the fact that it was quiet. Great blockout blinds so you didnâ€™t have to rise with the sun unless you really wanted to! - Spotlessly clean rooms, corridors & the resort in general - Beds are very, very comfortable - Excellent bathroom, large modern room with a big balcony Hotelâ€™s negatives - Service in the restaurant for breakfast was slow (but thatâ€™s because almost everyone staying at the hotel was there at the same time), there was never an issue with the amount & variety of food available. However breakfast at the restaurants in Whalerâ€™s Village (15 minute stroll) was also excellent (& much less expensive) - Service in the restaurant for dinner was slow even though there was hardly anyone there - The onsite bars all close early, so be prepared to have any late nights elsewhere (by taxi) - Pool area gets busy; shade can be hard to come by. The cabanas are available for hire at $60 per day - The relatively high resort fee is charged to every room every day & incorporates towel hire, the shuttle and parking etcâ€¦.The Sheraton should look at reducing the fee for guests who donâ€™t have a car & arenâ€™t using the parking We cannot wait to come back to this fantastic hotel in its sensational location.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton, Maui, HI”
Reviews.Author: Yorktown_NYJane
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely beautiful and offers everything to make your stay wonderful! The ocean views are magnificent. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The staff was welcoming and helpful. The restaurant has an ocean view and the buffet breakfast was varied and delicious. The hotel is very spread out, so the walk to and from your room can be a challenge.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hornblowertwo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui Resort and Spa from 9/6 to 9/16. After a long day of traveling we were warmly greeted at the front desk by Shawna. We asked if we could get an upgrade to our room. She suggested a Junior Suite on the ground floor in building 2 at a very good price, so we took it. Shawna was very sweet, kind and honest with us. When we were done at the front desk we turned around to find Andrew with our luggage on a cart ready for us. Andrew gave me a shell lei and then he gave me another shell lei to give to my wife with a kiss. Andrew gave us a tour of the entire hotel along with a handful of discount coupons for us to use during our stay. When Andrew opened the door to our Junior Suite, it was everything that Shawna had said it was. We found the room to be clean, well maintained and just beautiful. The entire hotel from our room, and including the grounds, the pool, the restaurants, and the spa were perfectly maintained and beautiful. We always would receive a warm and friendly Aloha from all the hotel staff, including the grounds keepers. We may have never seen housekeeping but we always knew that they had been to our room by how organized and clean the room was when we returned. Every morning we would open the sliding glass door and relax on the lanai looking at the green grass, swaying palm trees and beautiful ocean. We couldnâ€™t ask for anything more. Upon check out Shawna was there to give us a warm hug and invite us back to stay at the Sheraton again. Our entire stay was perfect from start to end. Just a note to first time travelers to Hawaii, all hotels charge a resort fee that is not included in the room price. This resort fee is collected at the end of your stay. So please, do not give the hotel employees a hard time about this fee.

Reviews.Title: “Its was great!”
Reviews.Author: Mechy T
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with the service we received from the moment we arrived, the bell boys were so pleasant, desk service great and we even got 2 mini champagne bottles as complementary for our 16th anniversary...that's was funny!...The rooms were ok...the veiws amazing even though we had a mountain view we were able to have a partial beach view...plus how long you stay in the room to look at those views anyways...there is so much to do around, forget about staying at the hotel! ....the pool and bar areas were nice, but the prices were insane...bring your own drinks and snacks.....not worth the money you pay ...Great places to eat in little downtown "Mixed plate" authentic Hawaiian food, wonderful breakfast! and happy hours starts at 3:00 pm - 7:00 ish...not that bad!...DO NOT make reservations with Expedia (they are cheap but with cheap you get CHEAP services)...make sure to take the trip Road to Hana (but make sure to make reservations to stay a day there.....there is too much and so many cool things to do there= is worth it)...and take the back road back to Lahaina...Helicopter ride is a MUST in Maui...and have fun!!...visit the Blow hole just a few miles down the road you came from the airport...go up the little mountains and second left...awesome!!... WHAT WAS THE DEAL WITH THE RESORT FEE ?? $25.00 PER DAY?? holy cow!! we were hardly there and cost us like $285.00 for 5 day!!! OMG!...This Hotel needs update...too old decoration. Is OK i guess...

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Bob709
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Maui Resort and Spa was fantastic. It was without a doubt, one of the best resorts that we have stayed . The rooms were great, the staff were exceptional. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a place to go and relax. The pool area was super. I cannot say enough about our stay there. I would go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent true Hawaiian hotel”
Reviews.Author: lana90025
Reviews.Content: Beautiful true Hawaiian hotel. Perfect location on beach. Great service. Warm and friendly. We left Marriott Wailea early to come here and so glad we did. Great location to shops and restaurants. Walking distince. Wailea area was too Isolated and quiet and too fancy, who wants to shop at Chanel and fancy stores in Hawaii? Kanapali area is the perfect balance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: Globetravels123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for the third part of our honeymoon from September 12 to September 17. We had an amazing time at this resort and loved the location! This hotel is situated on the best part of Kaanapali Beach and right next to Black Rock. The beach area was large and the snorkeling here was amazing. We swam with sea turtles 2 out of the five days we were there. The hotel was within a five minute walk to Whaler's village. The resort is beautiful with tasteful furnishings and an open air layout. The service was excellent, as the concierge in the lobby helped us book a tour that went to Haleakala to see the sunrise. She also provided us advice regarding on the road to Hana and a handy tip sheet. The also hotel sent up champagne to help us celebrate our honeymoon. This hotel is the priciest hotel we stayed at during our honeymoon but it was worth it! There was a $25/night resort fee, which included parking and internet access. We rented beach-side cabanas for $46 a day. We only got the cabanas for two of our days there. The Mai Tai bar was very pricey but I had one of the best burgers I've eaten there. We didn't eat at the breakfast buffet or ate at any of the restaurants at the hotel as they were too expensive. We walked to Whaler's Village or drove to Lahaina instead to eat . The hotel itself did not seem very busy at all and seemed like there was enough room for everyone to get a quiet spot to themselves. We did not use the pool or stay around the pool area, although it was a very beautiful pool. I would have given this resort a 5 out of 5, however, at check in, we were disappointed to find out that there were no rooms left with a king sized bed, so instead we were given a room with two doubles, even though we booked months in advance and we had mentioned at time of booking that we were honeymooners. We were moved to a room with a king sized bed two nights after we checked in, but would have preferred not having to go through the trouble of repacking and relocating. It was a bit of an inconvenience. On the bright side we did get a bit of a better view being on the ocean side but it was a room on the first floor of the hotel minimized our view of the ocean. I would definitely stay here again. It was a great place to spend the last part of our honeymoon and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: kathp320
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel, rooms were clean, location on the beach great. Just a short walk along to Whalers village for a good food court and some great restaurants. The staff were helpful and beach and pool area great. Only problem was I was on a tour with no transport so had to take shuttle bus to Lahaina but these ran quite regularly and were free.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location,best Place to stay if your in a Hotel in Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaK7
Reviews.Content: Cabanas at the beach,great snorkeling,Black sRock is right there .....gauranted Turtle seeing and the Sunset ceremony amazing....Always recomend it for Friends!!!

Reviews.Title: “Are you looking for romance.....Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_Titan
Reviews.Content: I am quite meticulous in choosing hotels - and as my wife and I were returning to Maui to celebrate our wedding anniversary, extra research was put into this trip. I had concerns after reading the mixed reviews concerning the Sheraton, but as I have had great experiences in other Sheratons around the world, I booked this hotel from 10-17 Sep. If you are looking for a first-class resort - that oozes romance - on a beautiful beach, with fantastic sunsets, great (modern) rooms, an awesome pool and an attentive staff - this is it!! I will never forget, laying in bed (with the patio door open) and listening to the sound of the waves crashing against the beach. More importantly, my wife loved the place - for the reasons mentioned above - and I am the greatest husband in the world (in her eyes)....lol If you want romance and somewhere special to take that special someone in your life - the Sheraton Maui Resort in Kaanapali is the place for you. You will thank me later!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tpre2004
Reviews.Content: Expect your first nite to be in a different room than you booked, but you get moved the next day. Just leave the resort and go into Lahaina to eat. Food and drink prices are rediculous. Stop at Safeway for snacks, drinks, etc. for the mini fridge. A must is finding Sensae sushi restraint. Especially Friday or Saturday nights after 10 p.m.when they have kareoke and half price sushi.

Reviews.Title: “Hits and Misses”
Reviews.Author: ML_2011_2011
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were having our 2 year wedding anniversary and decided that we would stay at the Sheraton Maui to celebrate. When we got to the hotel and checked in, the first thing we noticed was that the check in staff was not that friendly. It was also at that time when we found out that we were getting two double beds, as opposed to a single queen/king bed. During the booking process, it was stated that we would get a single bed, however the staff had indicated that there we were no more left and that when they do get a room with it, they would contact us. So we thought, ok, let's just play it by ear and see what happens. Well, when we got to our room, guess what, we were placed right next to the elevator, and I mean literally right next to it. We could constantly hear the elevator go up and down, and it was impossible for anyone to stay in that room and still be sane. We complained to the staff about this and they put us into another room, but the fact that the put us in that room is beyond inconsiderate. Folks, this is a room that you will have to see to believe. After our second day we asked the staff if there were any rooms opened with a single bed and they told us no. At this point we were just going to make the best out of this trip and just ignore the room situation. The thing is, I'm a Starwood Preferred Guest member and have stayed in Sheratons/Westins all over the world, and have always been satisfied with the staff, rooms, etc. However, this incident with the room was a total miss. On the other side, the hits of the trip is that it is close to snorkeling; no need to swim over corals or jump off a catamaran. Basically if you were to walk over the shore, dip your head into the water, you'll see fish. We say this huge sea turtle that was feeding near the rocks. Quite an experience. The beach is also pretty nice. So...overall I would give it an average rating due to the room situation. I was really disappointed in that. They could have done better. However, the location of the beach and snorkeling can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Our Anniversary at the Sheraton was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Jamie F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 6 days here in Sept.2011 for our Anniversary..It was by far the best trip we've had...very relaxing..although they said this wasn't their busy time ( which was ideal to us)..The Beach was wonderful, the pool was great...Very clean rooms and grounds...shopping and other restaurants and resorts were in walking distance. My husband Para-sailed and snorkeled and the Luau was lots of fun and the food was delicious! We definitely will visit again...It was hard to leave! The only negative would be the rooms were kind of small,,but hey all we did in the room is sleep and shower..you don't want to waste a minute of this beautiful resort...Perfect Location ! Fun in the sun!!! Would highly recommend the Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for our honeymoon but Westin is better”
Reviews.Author: RC999
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a about 4 days here in Sept 2011 for our honeymoon. Overall, the property is quite nice as it is located next to some great snorkelling (black rock) and the grounds are well taken care of. Perhaps it was because we went in September, but we never had any problems finding two seats at the pool (even in the afternoon) and it did not seem to be overcroded. PROS: - Located right next to Black Rock where there is great snorkelling (saw turtles and a wide variety of fish) - Nightly torch bearing cliff diver at around 6:45 PM - Very friendly staff --> speak to Gim Lim at the concierge as she is very helpful with booking/suggesting activities. CONS: - No free wi-fi in room (only LAN wired in the room) - Long walk from the parking garage to the lobby and then to the room areas - Towel card swapping system which limits you to two towels

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer A
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 10 nights on our honeymoon. It was absolutely beautiful in perfect location to restaurants, shopping and of course the beach! The snorkeling outside the hotel was amazing, no need to even book an excursion to go snorkel anywhere else! The service was great and we were upgraded to an ocean view which was just gorgeous! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort for Honeymoon!!!”
Reviews.Author: ak112
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui Resort for our honeymoon in October 2010. There were many other couples staying there for honeymoon at the same time. We even made friends and went out to downtown Lahaina for dinner/drinks at Kobe and dancing at a club one night! Insider tip: Not many people know about Club Timba, which is located at the end of the downtown Lahaina restaurant strip area....it was truly an amazing experience....it's located right along the shores and many wedding reception dance parties are usually held there in the evenings! As for the resort, it was fairly large with a nice relaxing pool area and very easy beach access just a few steps from most rooms. All you really want in a honeymoon is some peace and relaxation along with a nice, clean room to rest. This resort definitely delivers in all areas! We booked through Jennifer Lodge at Unforgettable Honeymoons. She matched the package price that we found with Orbitz (with discount code) and beat it by $20 per person. In addition, she arranged a wonderful gift (bottle of champagne and picture frame) for us upon arrival along with an upgrade to a deluxe oceanview room even though we booked for the cheapest Gardenview room originally. We thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of the resort. The food service poolside was amazing. We loved the refreshing drinks with the spicy munchies they provide complimentary at the bar with every drink! The Mahi Mahi fish tacos are to die for!!! One negative note: Throughout our trip we noticed a few ants here and there crawling near the bath tub and sink area in our washroom, but we didn't really think much of it since we were on the ground floor and it was a tropical destination. However, on our last night, we noticed a fairly large number of ants in our closet. Some of them were crawling onto the hangers and our clothes. We called the front desk about this. They sent someone right up to spray the area. They also offered to put our clothes in the laundry and have them ready in time for our departure the next morning early. In addition, they offered a $100 credit to use for dinner at their restaurant that night. We both splurged and ordered the double lobster tails (I believe they also had a late night 2 for 1 or 50% promotion going on at the time in their restaurant!) Other than that minor inconvenience, the trip was amazing. Well worth it!!! We didn't snorkel, but if you enjoy that, I heard it was amazing.....some people apparently saw sea turtles really close by to the shore by Black Rock!

Reviews.Title: “Great beach....hotel needs some updating!!”
Reviews.Author: Sunchu0318
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 6 night stay at this Sheraton. We booked the hotel using Starwood Points and heard great things about it on Trip Advisor. When we arrived the staff was very friendly and we were upgraded to an Ocean Front room. The view was spectacular as was the beach in front of the hotel. The problem with the hotel was the room which just seemed old and outdated. Everything just seemed dingy and didn't match the amazing view we had. The house keeping was terrible. They seemed to only make the bed and pick up the towels. They don't vaccum because there was dust bunnies and leaves in the corners of the room that were there all 6 days. They also didn't pick up empty water glasses, condiments or silver wear from the one night we had room service. They just left it there the entire time. One night we got back to our room and they left a note saying the room was locked so that they couldn't get in to clean. This wasn't true because we were out all day and you can only lock the room from the inside. When we called house keeping for towels they apologized for not cleaning the room and said it was because we had our do not disturb sign out (this was also a lie). The person who brought us towels apologized for not cleaning our room and said it was because they were too busy that day. We literally got three different stories in 30 minutes. We had the breakfast buffet and were not crazy about it but a la carte costs the same as the buffet. They have a Starbucks cart where they also sell breakfast sandwhichs and pastries so that was perfect for breakfast everyday. The hotel grounds and lobbys were really nice as was the beach. There is great snorkeling right off of Black Rock but it is very crowded. They rent out snorkeling equipment at the hotel which was convenient. The pool seemed small and there weren't many umbrellas so we just spent our time at the beach. We paid $45 for the cabanas because there are not beach chairs provided on the beach by the hotel. The $25 resort fee covers towels, internet access and parking etc. but the rooms don't get internet access. You have to go to a public lobby to get wifi. Also, they give you two cards to trade in to get two beach towels. To get the cards back you have to give the towels back. This and the wifi were irritating. I asked for 4 cards when we checked in so that we could get 4 towels at a time. Overall this is an average hotel because the room is not very nice but the location and the beach are amazing. We still had a great time because we didn't spend much time in the room at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: prasad0923
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my family for 5 nights and I really liked this hotel. This hotel has ocean view rooms in the building by the reception but the rooms are about 100-150 yards from the beach. There is lawn and some pools in between the rooms and the beach. They have another building behind the black rock that have the ocean front rooms but its a bit of walk to get to the restaurants and the beach. There is no beach by these ocean front rooms. The views from these ocean front rooms are spectacular, especially the sun set. The pool area gets crowded at times. No complimentary water in the rooms for SPG Platinum. Rather, you would get a couple of coupons that you can exchange for water but you have to walk all the way to the reception area and so I never tried. I recommend this restaurant for family and kids. The beach itself is awesome. I walked down the beach looking at some of the other hotels along and felt that this hotel had the best beach.

Reviews.Title: “Ka'anapali Sheraton Maui Resort & Spa”
Reviews.Author: Traveler201NewJersey
Reviews.Content: Set at the foot of the legendary Black Rock .This resort overlooks Ka'anapali beach on 23 acres lush gardens and the blus pacific ocean.This 4star hotel & spa offers the best laui in town.Every evening at dusk they have a tourch lighting ceremony with a cliff diver. This is really spectacular. The rooms ath this resort are alll great.If you visit this resort and stay you must have a spa day it is the best...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, great staff, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sarah1216
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel! The staff was very helpful and friendly. The location was great, just a short drive from Lahaina. The nightly cliff diving ceremony was awesome. Clean pool, great beach access, clean rooms. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property but SO CROWDED!”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethBH84
Reviews.Content: We stayed here February 2010. This was my our fourth trip to the Hawaii Islands and we've stayed at some lovely hotels and this was our LEAST favorite place by far. That being said, the property at the Sheraton was beautiful making our experience that much more frustrating. CONS: It's biggest drawback would be that it sits in a cluster of hotels and also on pubic beach property which makes it incredibly crowded. Our first day there, we went out to lay by the pool around lunch time and there was ABSOLUTELY no where to lay out. As a result, we were forced to grab a seat at 7/8am every morning if we intended to sit by the pool. I'm not sure if this was a result of busy season or if there were just beach trespassers (i.e. non-hotel guests) sneaking onto the property. Regardless, I've never had this issue at any of the other big hotel chains (i.e. Hilton in Kauai, Turtle Bay Resort in Oahu, Sheraton on Big Island, Hilton on Big Island), on the other Hawaiian Islands. In addition, the hotel staff was not as personable as the other hotels either. I think this was mainly due to the fact that there were so many guests (and maybe not enough staff) that they didn't have the ability to be overly accommodating to every guest, as we had seen at the other hotels we stayed at in Hawaii. In addition, our hotel lanai was a joke! Again, I'm not sure if we just had bad luck or if all the Lanai's were this small, but our Lanai was only big enough to house one chair and thatâ€™s with no one sitting on it. My husband and I NEVER went outside on our Lanai the entire trip (4 days) because there was no room for us. This was probably the biggest disappointment about this property because we absolutely LOVE having our morning coffee (and afternoon book readings) on the Lanai. So that pretty much sums up our trip. PROS: As I mentioned previously, the Sheraton is a beautiful property. If you came to shop, there is a lovely shopping area within walking distance from the hotel. There is also a nice area right off the hotel where you can go snorkeling. All this being said, my husband and I both prefer seclusion and relaxation on our trips to Hawaii...so perhaps the hustling and bustling of the Sheraton may be right for some individuals, but it was definitely not our cup of tea. Our lesson learned â€“ we will never stay at any Hawaii hotels that are located on public beach access or in a cluster of hotels again...as I think this encourages a busier and more crowded atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: LeahB444
Reviews.Content: I think this was hands down the best hotel we've ever stayed in, the rooms were nice, the resort was maintained beautifully, and the location, that made this hotel! Not to mention the deal we got booking through priceline! They provide a complimentary shuttle to downtown Lahaina so it is very convenient to go to dinner or a luau and not have to worry about taking out your rental car each time! Just steps from the beach, it was so peaceful to wake up to the ocean every morning (we had a great view even though it was only considered partial ocean view). I would highly recommend this hotel. The staff were accommodating, everything felt new, it was clean, you couldn't ask for a better spot to spend as a jumping off point for exploring Maui! I wish I could go back right now!

Reviews.Title: “GORGEOUS AND HEAVENLY STAY A+++++!!!”
Reviews.Author: babielo
Reviews.Content: As a first time visitor to hawaii, it took a lot of thought on which area and hotel would be best suited for me. Sheraton hotels has always given me positive experiences in their other locations, and i trust in the quality. One of the reasons why i booked this location is becuase it's situated on kannapali, rated one of the best beaches in the world, and the beautiful scenary. The hotel is also build on black rock, which is very attractive to fish, and sea turtles. When we reached our hotel, we were prompted quickly by the staff and a welcoming "aloha" with a seashell necklace. We walked through an open hallway to the concierge and realized the whole hotel was "open". The sun, breeze, and hawaiian music just surrounded the space. It was breathtaking and had a huge "wow factor". This is coming from a jaded new yorker who doesn't get easily impressed! We had booked a 5 night 6 day stay, in the deluxe partial ocean view, and the concierge upgraded our room to one that was on the top of the entire hotel.. A deluxe ocean view? We had our own private parking lot access and when we got to our room, i literally screamed with happiness. It was what i dreamed of, an open bedroom with a balcony views of the mountain, the resort, and ocean sunset. Soft breezes, flowers on my balcony, and birds chirping were so suureal. The maid for our room was impeccable, she replaced all towels, sheets, organized our room everyday. We even got free boxes of mac nut chocolates and tote bags, almost everyday. Haha. There are some small negatives about the hotel, however.... The original hotel was built in the 70's and since then they had renovations and expansions. There are different parts of the hotel and directions were confusing to find. It took us about 10-15 min to figure out how we can get to our room, the room number didn't coorelate with the floor number, and there are bridges to other sections of other buidings. To make up for this, they have impeccable decor and scenic points with benches in the hotel to overlook on the beautiful beach. The hotel bar, pool, performances were also top notch. It impressed me to see gardeners working everyday to keep flowers and foliage on top condition. There were flowers on every tree, every pine was well groomed..very impressive. The only other small negative is that, even though there are 3 places that serve food on the grounds, they somehow rotate in their operation time. There was a time where all the restaurants were closed between breakfast and lunch. That's kind of weird to me, considering its mid morning... I had an awesome stay at this hotel and would recommend this to anyone taking a trip to maui. I was so sad to leave!! I was so happy with this hotel that i've signed up for the starwood american express to become a preferred guest. Thanks for the dreamy, impeccable vacation sheraton! Mahalo! I have a video from our hotel room, to see it, click here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MHM9W13aFww

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn B
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a family vacation at the Sheraton. From the moment we checked in, we knew we had found the greatest hotel in Maui! Evelyn at check in worked so hard to make sure our room was to our liking when we arrived and she gave our 6 and 8 year old souvenirs when we checked out to keep them company on the plane home. The service, location, views and amenities make this hotel truly exceptional. Thank you for such a memorable Summer vacation - we will see you again!

Reviews.Title: “Best pool and beach at Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: DrMitch
Reviews.Content: I have been to Maui several times and have stayed at: Kapalua bay hotel, Kapalua villas, Grand Wailea, Grand Hyatt, Royal Lahaina. I would rate the Sheraton Maui as the best of these hotels. I was attending a conference at Grand Hyatt but decided to stay at Sheraton instead. While each hotel had their plus/minus, Hyatt was dirtier than most (especially the pool which smelled of urine) and the beach was not very good. Located just west of Lahaina, Kaanapali is a long sandy beach fronted by at least a dozen very large resort hotels. On one end is Hyatt. On the other is Sheraton. Sheraton actually strides black rock; a large, black lava extrusion jutting out from the beach. Black rock apparently factors into Hawaii legend. So it is a mystery to me how Sheraton ever obtained permission to build on it. But build they did. The hotel sprawls along the beach and up to and over the massive black rock. Despite the extremely large and busy resort, the staff treated us as if we were their only guests. The hotel is amazingly spotless. The gardens are well maintained. The pool is formed like a river with small water falls. One end is a sort of adult pool and the other a childrens pool. There is one tiny hot tub on the property. We stayed one night in a regular garden view room (bldg 3). Room was nice. Usual rectangular box shape. Well maintained and clean. We were upgraded the next 12 nights to an ocean view in bldg 6. Room was roughly same size as our first room. However, bathroom was very large with marble top, chrome fixtures. The ocean view was looking west along the other side of black rock. What sets apart Sheraton from the other hotels on this stretch of beach comes down to the snorkeling. For some reason the other portions of the beach are a bit murky and smell of algae. Black rock has surprisingly good underwater visibility (perhaps 75 feet) and great fish, coral. This is surprising because there are not only lots of swimmers but lots of kids jumping off black rock. But black rock has something else; lots of turtles. Very large turtles. These turtles (some about 4 feet long) swim within feet of shore and seem to have long gotten over their fear of humans. In fact turtles seem to demand the right of way otherwise they will swim right into you. I cannot overemphasize enough about the undersea life visible right off shore. There is a board walk starting at Sheraton and ending at Hyatt. Because of the configuration of the walkway Sheraton had much less pedestrian, pass through traffic than the other hotels. We ate once in the restaurant. A buffet breakfast. Very expensive and the food was so so. Mostly we ate pick up a few things from the coffee cart (long line because only one person works the cart). They do have the annoying "resort fee". What you get for that (not that you have a choice) is: Maui newspaper, car parking, and wired internet in the room (which worked very well). I believe that there may have been some free use of the room phone but who uses wired phones nowadays? There are areas around the hotel with wireless internet. Cons: Pool was not heated. Also, while there were enough chaise lounges for anyone that needed one, there were limited number that had umbrellas. Not good, as one can get roasted rather quickly in the tropics. Pro: Nice pool otherwise. Best beach for snorkeling, swimming, diving. Great staff. Very clean. Tip: Black rock divides Kaanapali beach in half. The east side is where about 90% of visitors swim. However, as I learned staying at the Royal Lahaina, the west side of Kaanapali is an incredible unspoiled beach that stretches for miles. Fish are not as plentiful as around the rock but is can be a relaxing place to spend some time. The hotel does not have a free shuttle to/from airport. Best to pick up a rental at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back.. someday”
Reviews.Author: sahnchoi
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here in June 2010, so this is a late review, however, I remember how great this resort was very well. We arrived late at the resort, at around 10 PM. The guys at the front desk said "We've been waiting for you!" and greeted us with seashell necklaces, which was a friendly gesture (and a nice keepsake.) I was stunned at how nice the inside of the resort was. Very clean and spacious. We went up to our room, the room was very clean, but I felt it could have been cleaner. I don't understand why people complain about how old this resort is, it looks completely new! Anyways, we were in Hawaii -- I didn't care about the room. During our stay, we were at beautiful Ka'anapali beach where we saw turtles, an occasional dolphin, and a beautiful school of fish. Snorkeling was very fun, also, make sure you jump off Black Rock, you'll regret it if you don't. The pool area was clean and great for children. Whaler's Village is only a 5 minute walk, they have quality shopping and Yogurtland. If you haven't been there, go. Overall, this was a great stay that wasn't very expensive, I hope I come back here soon.
