Reviews.Title: “The location is what makes this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SunKissedBeach
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Maui, and the second time we stayed at the Sheraton. We used Starpoints and stayed for free for a week, and the location at Black Rock is second to none. In terms of location, on Maui, Ka'anapali is the place to stay, and the Sheraton has the best location on Ka'anapali. Now, here's the lowdown. Like all Starwood properties, the location is absolutely top-notch. On the other hand, the hotel nickle and dimes you at every opportunity. The staff, while friendly, did leave something to be desired on occasion. We had booked an ocean view room in advance, but when we arrived at the hotel, we were interested in upgrading. However, we wanted to see the second room before we decided to spend the money. The guy at the front desk said we couldn't see the room, so we decided to stay with what we had booked. We loved it, but we found the customer service less than optimal, to put it mildly. Later in our trip, at the Grand Hyatt in Kauai, we went through the same thing and the service at the Hyatt could not have been better. Another example of the nickel and diming was when we brought leftovers back to the room. I called down to room service to ask if we could get plates and silverware. I was told that not only was there a 45 minute wait, but there was a $1 charge just to deliver plates and silverware! Particularly obnoxious at the Sheraton, as at all Starwoods, is the fact that they charge you an arm and a leg for beach chairs. We passed on the charge, instead renting beach chairs in Lahaina. The chairs cost us less for a week than what two chairs would have cost us for a day. Here's an example of what the Sheraton is really all about. We received a phone call telling us that as Starwood Preferred Guests,to please come down to receive our free gift. Our free gift was a box of chocolates you could buy for $2.99 at Walmart or Long's Drugs. Thank Sheraton! To top it off, we then had to listen to a sales pitch for the Westin condos up the beach that they can't sell because of the lousy economy. What a waste of time. The woman was trying to get people to sign up for a tour of the condos, which we declined. What a waste of time! To summarize, my wife and I are Starwood Preferred Guests, on our second trip to the Sheraton Maui, and we had told the hotel numerous times that we were traveling for our 10th wedding anniversary. In honor of all this, the hotel gave us a $2.99 box of chocolates. Before this trip, my wife and I were exclusive Starwood travelers, as we even have the SPG credit card. However, the customer service here was so lousy and the service at the Grand Hyatt in Kauai was so great, that our eyes have been opened to other hotels. At the Hyatt, we received 15% off at the spa, a complimentary bottle of champagne, complimentary dessert at a hotel restaurant, and a free cabana for a day. Probably the most annoying thing at the hotel has to do with beach towels, a policy I can only describe as so stupid, whoever came up with it must have done so as a joke, thinking no one would agree to it. You have to give a card to get a towel, and you only get one towel. The towel guys leave at 5, so if you want a fresh towel, too bad. You just need to hold onto your dirty towel until tomorrow, because you can't get your new towel unless you turn in the old one. Who knew towels were so expensive they had to be guarded so carefully? Also, be prepared to have the towel guys try to sell you Maui Jim sunglasses every time you try to get your towel. It's not that I wouldn't recommend the Sheraton Maui. The location is fantastic, the grounds are beautiful, and the convenience to Lahaina is great. However, the service and nickel and diming was very disappointing, especially since we had such great memories from our honeymoon. You can stay at the Sheraton and have a great time, which we did, but go there with your eyes wide open.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, ambiance, staff and location - we can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Ann L
Reviews.Content: Everyone looks for something different on vacation. Yes, a little bathroom remodeling would be good and yes, the coffee at breakfast is undrinkable (thank goodness for the Starbucks cart). The bathroom, however was clean, bright and fresh, the large room size accomodated the 4 of us easily and the lovely ocean-facing patio where we spent the most time when in the room aside from sleeping far outweighed any minimal defects in the bathroom. All of the staff from the valets to the front desk to the wait staff and housekeepers bent over backwards to please. The common areas were all open, airy, clean and well-manicured. Our 10 and 11 year old kids loved the pool. The huge beach area was clean and not overly-packed. The beach area just steps north of the facility, on the golf course, was especially uncrowded. One of the major reasons we wanted to stay at the Black Rock area on our 3rd trip to Maui was to have easy access to the ocean and turtles/fish who reside there. Within 30 minutes of check-in, we were snorkeling with our underwater friends and had a great time. Don't forget to also snorkel at the beach area just north of the hotel. Literally steps away from the tennis courts. And having a premium scuba company, 5 Star Scuba Diving, operating right on the premises was a super-bonus. I highly recommend them and scuba instructor Ty Burnett who is a jewel. He certified my 11 year old and introduced my 10 year old to diving in - he was a huge reason why we had so much fun at the Sheraton. He has years of experience, plenty of patience and I hgihly recommend him and 5 Star - as a dive instructor myself, and having certified hundreds of divers, I can attest to his abilities. We also loved the easy access to other Ka'anapali resorts just down the walk, where we surfed and parasailed. The Sheraton is at a great location being a bit up the beaten path but with easy access via a 10 minute walk. Nice luau too. Our family had such a great trip and the Sheraton was a big part of that experience.

Reviews.Title: “BEST LOCATION FOR SNORKELING!”
Reviews.Author: merjoe
Reviews.Content: Although the Sheraton is not the newest or nicest hotel on the Kaanapali Strip it is certainly the best location for snorkeling. The beach was large and guests from the other local hotels (hyatt, marriott, westin) would all walk down to the sheraton because of the fabulous snorkeling at Black Rock. The minute we entered the water we were surrounded by amazing Green turtles, Manta Rays, Eels,. and incredible fish. It was so fantastic we didn't have to pay for a snorkeling trip since we had a better assortment of sealife right off our beach. I highly recommend this hotel if snorkeling or scuba is your thing. All equipment is available at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: lob
Reviews.Content: My DH and I stayed here for 10 days (3 additional due to Irene canceling our flights back home). Upon arrival be were upgraded from a resort view room to an ocean view room on the 8th floor in the building on black rock. The view was stunning and the room was heaven. The room was enormous, with a living room area, wet bar with fridge, sink and microwave and a separate sleeping area with a king bed. There were 2 lanais one much larger than the other with a table and 2 chairs. The bathroom was also quite large with a separate water closet. The grounds are very well maintained as are the interior common areas. The property is large so if you have difficulty ambulating (or you prefer not to walk any distance) then this may not be the place for you. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Angelica at the front desk was a gem! The pool was beautiful and there were 2 bars within a short distance from our loungers. Cold/frozen fresh pineapple chucks were passed daily poolside. We had snack type food at the bar- it was adequate. We were offered a distress rate due to Hurricane Irene and were permitted to stay in the same room. We were offered use of a hospitality room on our last day since we had a 10:30pm flight. Is this the Four Seasons? No but it doesn't claim to be. If you want the Four Seasons then you shouldn't be staying at a Sheraton. If you want a lovely resort with very good amenities and a fabulous location (with a free shuttle into Lahaina) then this place cannot be beat! We will absolutely return. The $25 resort fee covers the internet service (ethernet cable was provided in the room), parking and the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Worn out”
Reviews.Author: ATNT
Reviews.Content: Poor Quality Poor Rooms, not really impressive. Location is reasonable. Spa treatment for facial is very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Prefer Wailea!”
Reviews.Author: lhenry1998
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty lavish when you arrive, because of the way the lobby looks at the ocean, but the rest is pretty average. Upon checking in we got upgraded from a standard room, to a Deluxe Ocean View on the 8th floor, two rooms away from the Penthouse, or equivalent. If it weren't for the room, it would have been a 3-star rating, because of the childish/gimmicky pool situation, and the difficulty of getting from our room (on the black rock/cliff) to the lobby. To conclude the trip, I much prefer Wailea, and staying at the Four Seasons, it is DEFINITELY worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Angela T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui Resort & Spa for our honeymoon. As it was our honeymoon we decided to book the Delux Ocean Front room and found a deal for $648 AU per night (inc breakfast). It was simply not worth the money! - We couldnâ€™t see the ocean from our room unless we actually stepped outside on to the patio. - The room was small, furnishings were nothing special. - Breakfast was good but not great. - The restaurant on site has below average food. - Pool was OK (average). - Beach in front of the resort is nice... however the resort charges you a ridiculous amount if you want to hire their sun lounge chairs. Overall, it was a pleasant stay but didnâ€™t meet our expectations. I believe Maui in general has overpriced accommodation, My advice is, hire a car and find better accommodation!

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Honeymoon...”
Reviews.Author: mcgon1979
Reviews.Content: I had chosen this resort Hotel primarily because I thought the location looked beautiful. Right at the end of Ka'anapali beach. I was a bit concerned that the score seemed average. Out of the 30 or so hotels in the area it scored in the middle somewhere. I decided to delve deeper and read all the reviews before deciding. It seemed there was no particular reasons why it didn't score very highly. I decided to go with my gut and chose the hotel for my honeymoon. I emailed the hotel a couple of times prior to our trip and asked if it be possible for a specific room that I thought would be ideal for our needs. It overlooked the beach and the grounds and had beautiful views of the sunset and cliff dive ceremony each evening. The hotel of course cannot guarantee room but did assure me they would make a note of this request and do their very best. We travelled from Ireland and were exhausted when we arrived. We had been up for 27hours straight. Dublin, London, LA, Maui.... but... it was worth it. Even though the airlines lost our cases for 2 days haha. Still worth it. We checked in quite late, maybe 9 or 10pm and the staff were very nice. They offered a tour of the grounds to help orient us, but we were too tired so had to decline. The check in process was swift as I think the check in lady must have seen how tired we were. Everything was ready and we were on our way to the room within 2 minutes! The lady also informed us that the resort fee had been taken care of and also supplied us with complimentary breakfast vouchers. This turned out to be a really really nice extra as the breakfast setup was amazing. It set us up for the day each morning. Chef on hand to make imlettes with a smile, excellent choice of hot foods, excellent choice of fresh fruits and baked items. Very attentive staff on hand with OJ and coffee and a smile. It really became a centrepoint to our day. A great start each day with smiles and good food. 10/10 for the breakfast setup. If your not sure about paying for the breakfast each day I would 100% recommend it. I know buffets can be hit and miss, but this one is a hit! anyway... back to my story. We arrived at our room, and it was the exact room I had requested, on the top floor of the building I had requested, overlooking the sea. There was a very nice note congratulating us on our honeymoon etc. This would be a good point to say that the condition of the rooms is excellent. I had read the hotel was last updated in the early 2000s? but it looks top quality. Nice furnishings, nice HD TV with plenty of channels, excellent air con, a good size cooler/fridge/icemaker, and plenty of storage space. Oh, and a BIG safe, not the 6inch high half size ones, but a full size one which was also nice. Iron and hangers and all the usual you would expect. Our room had two balconys(Lanai?) but we only used the one that face the sea mostly as the other one was overlooked by some other rooms. This was fine, the other one was just a bonus really. The bed is really comfortable and I slept 9 hours each night, uninterrupted. Beautiful. So peaceful. Opening the balcony door in early morning at sunrise and all you would hear is the gentle lapping of the waves. We went for a morning swim at Dawn most mornings because our sleep cycle ended up being 9 or 10pm till 6am. This was fine though, it was great to get early starts and get down for breakfast for 7am. I would recommend a morning swim if you are awake. We saw a green sea turtle swim right under our feet while snorkling in the morning. My wife saw a Ray one morning too. So, a couple of things to help with your trip. Whalers village is only 5minute walk at most. Maybe 200 or 300 yards from hotel. I had heard people say it was a drive only etc. Are you crazy? :) It's right there. 5minute walk. Yo can drive though if you want to buy alot of stuff and don't want to carry it back. plenty of parking off the Ka'anapali parkway. It has 40 or 50 shops. Tshirts, Jewelry, ABC stores for beer/suncream/groceries etc and McDonalds, and some restaurants, and everything else you would need. It's very nice. Second point, I would recommend a car. I assume most would have one anyway as Americans seem to go everywhere by car, and I think its was 95% americans at the resort and in the area in general. I only saw 2 other Europeans. I guess its a long way to come.:) The reason I would recommend a car? Well there are some lovely beaches that I thought were even better than Ka'anapali beach and they are only 10minutes drive north up the coast. Napili bay being one. Plenty of street parking once you get up there by 1030 or 11am. If you try and arrive inthe afternoon you will have ZERO chance of finding parking, s make it a day trip and go in the morning, and have lunch there at the Napili beach hotel restaurant, which is very reasonably priced and has wonderful menu and views of the bay. There are also some other more private beaches along the same road. Explore. :) We also drove to visit the Haleakea crater one day. We didn't bother with the sunset/sunrise though as it was too much to get up at 3am to start driving etc, or to drive home at 8pm in the dark. So we did a day trip. Leaving hotel at 730 and arriving at the summit about 3 hours later. The views were spectacular, 10,000ft. Up above the clouds. I know people say it is cold etc, so we took hoodies but didn't use them. Sure it was obviously colder than sea level but not as cold as I had expected. We were fine in our shorts and T-shirts. Mind you, we are from Ireland so what we think is cold is probably freezing for someone from California etc. :) We also visited Maui Ocean Centre on the way back in the afternoon as its on the same route. Well worth the steep admission fee. You should put aside at least 2 hours for the visit. so much to see. We booked a Catamaran trip from the pool attendents office. They were very helpful and rang the catamaran people and set it all up. It seemed price at 120usd each, but... it was worth it. It wa son the Terelani 2 and the staff on the boat were excellent. The price included an all yo can eat lunch f salad and burgers and hotdogs freshly BBQ'd on the boat, plus an open bar with cocktails and beers (once you were done snorkling for the day). I had a great time, and considering the trip, all the equipment included, the lunch and the 3 or 4 beers I had, all of a sudden 120 seemed like great value. We also then did the highway to hana drive another morning. Left at 7am, and got home at about 9pm at night. It's a long day, but so worth it. We bought an audio CD in boss frogs rental shop that tells you all about the drive as you do it. Each track is linked to am ile marker so you can hear relevant info as you drive, very nice for 8 or 9 bucks. well worth it. We bought sandwiches in Piea, the last town before the highway starts proper. Good move, I would have bought more sandwiches as its along drive. We stopped along th way for photos of course. At the end of the highway to Hana at the seven pools, we parked and did the walk to the waterfall. It was almost 2 miles of uphill walking, but.... the reward was magical. Through the bamboo forrest I had heard so much about and then out to see the highest waterfall I have ever seen in my life. It's beautiful. Like something out of avatar or lost. :) anyway, get a car as Maui has alot more to offer than just 2 weeks by a pool. Even if the hotel is wonderful. Always enough space, always enough sun loungers, and the staff were always genuinely friendly and warm. Aloha spirit is alive and well at this hotel. Every member of staff I interacted with, from gardeners, to room attendents, to bellhops, to barmen, to breakfast staff, were the embodiment of the Aloha spirit. They are a credit to the hotel and make it a warm place to be not just a glitzy luxury hotel with no spirit. So thats pretty much it really. I'll attach some photos I took.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away if you want a quiet vacation!”
Reviews.Author: JulieBalt33
Reviews.Content: Unless you're looking to stay at a run down, overpriced, glorified day care, do NOT stay at the Sheraton Maui. The rooms are very worn down, the towels are just big rags (super thin), and the staff was less than accommodating while we trying to enjoy our honeymoon... No room upgrades were offered or available, no late checkout available, the list goes on. Overall, unless you get an amazing deal, I would look elsewhere to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...stunning view!”
Reviews.Author: saintf
Reviews.Content: I last stayed at the Sheraton Maui 30 years ago and loved it. It's been totally revamped since then and is better than ever. The pool area is magnificent and the new blocks of rooms up on the cliff have an uninterrupted view of the ocean looking out towards the Islands of Lanai & Molokai....the sunsets from every room are stunning. The beach has beautiful white sand, swimming is safe and for those that snorkel and scuba dive, you're in for a treat! Whalers village just 5 minutes walk along the boardwalk is a great place to shop and eat. We had a great 10 day stay, wish it had been longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with great service”
Reviews.Author: eric m
Reviews.Content: We arrived pretty tired after an early flight out of PDX into OGG. We found the place quite easily and asked if we could check in early. My wife and I were upgraded from a garden view room to an oceanfront room. I asked if there was a charge and they informed me that it was a free upgrade for our honeymoon. We were pleased to find a clean room with two small bottles of sparkling wine. I'm bad at identifying those sort of things. The bed was extremely comfortable. The resort is also very quiet at night. I didn't eat at the restaurants because I heard they were pretty expensive. Sorry, I cannot recommend or not recommend them. Want a possible upgrade on your honeymoon? Book with Journey Travel. If the Sheraton has an empty room, they may be able to give you an upgrade for no additional cost.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully relaxing stay!”
Reviews.Author: kahiau
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD NEWS: We live in Honolulu, hadn't been to Maui in 5 years & had a great vacation. The widespread openness of this vast Starwood property doesn't feel like you're with mobs of tourists, even at 80+% occupancy. Spent one morning at the meandering pool, floating along in a beanbag chair provided by the hotel...wished they could've cut the hedges a bit so I could see more of the ocean. Loved the Hawaiian music wafting throughout the property. Our room #3534 was on the 5th floor, had a great ocean view just barely above the trees. Room was spacious, clean, had iron & ironing board, k/s bed very comfy with pillows that felt like lying in a cloud, & an empty mini-refrig for you to fill ( Safeway & Longs are 3 stoplights heading toward Lahaina).. Turn off the A/C, open the glass doors & let the sound of the ocean put you to sleep...ahhhhh. Hotel is within walking distance of other Kaanapali hotels & Whaler's Village, along a paved beach walk. Our friends snorkled by Black Rock & saw lots of fish, 3 mantas (no, they're not those nasty stingrays), & turtles. Golfed at Kaanapali's Royal Course - great condition, lots of bunkers, windy, interesting greens, GPS on cart but no tips how to play the hole (darn!)...no course restaurant at this writing, but beverage cart will tide you over...Took the windy drive past Kapalua on a mission to get Julia's banana bread in Kahakuloa Village - beautiful vistas of mountain & ocean, with about two-mile stretch of single-lane road which made me glad I wasn't driving. Advice: Be patient, hug the side of the road & pray! If you're up for more adventure, keep going to the art gallery at the Point - nice stuff, make sure you look into the gorgeous valley in back. THE BAD NEWS: A daily $25 resort charge is added, which includes self-parking (get a car), Internet, pool toys & towels, etc...Hot tub had one jet working (it's the one farthest from the steps)... No venting fan in bathroom, so leave the sliding glass doors open & put those ocean breezes to work....Hair dryer handle had sticky dried-on hair goo, & didn't start until the RESET button was pushed a few times...Funky in-room coffeemaker makes 2 cups of coffee without a carafe, so you gotta be alert & change up the cups before the first one overflows (a reflex test before you've had your coffee in the morning!). Had to leave & go back to the real world...shucks!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Deejaykay38
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was a little worried about booking our room at the Sheraton. Some things in the reviews we read, did happen to us. We booked at partial view ocean room. We go to check in and the front desk lady said we would get a room that was facing the back the of hotel facing the mountains. Now I'm confused on "partial ocean view and mountain view" needless to say, the lady at the front desk says " we can upgrade you for a fee". I didn't fly 2800 miles to see mountains. So we upgraded. The hotel is breath taking!! Clean, beach was awesome. Rooms are dated. Housekeeping didn't come to our room twice. We had to call down for towels. Our pay per view was out the entire week we we're there. Breakfast buffet was great. I would book it with your reservations. Luau was awesome. Didn't like the 3 phone calls for timeshare hustling. It got annoying!! I would recommend this hotel to friends, but I would warn them on what rooms they book and be careful on the "upgrades"!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room with a view!”
Reviews.Author: brisk_51
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent wanted us to stay at the Westin but it didn't have as good reviewson Trip Advisor as the Sheraton Maui. This place is Maui at it's finest. Beautiful property, outstanding service and just the right amount of luxury. We were super happy with our choice and will go back ASAP. Trip Advisor scores again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome 30th anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: GoLoo
Reviews.Content: We booked our 1st trip to Maui through a travel agent in Grand Rapds Mi. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip and stay at the Sheraton. Our trip package came with breakfast vouchers, so we were able to start our day with a fantastic breakfast buffet. all our servers were great as was each breakfast. we enjoyed the whole experience at the Sheraton, from the beautiful grounds to the smiling employees who were always willing to help with any questions we had. the beach out front of the hotel was great & we enjoyed snorkeling right out our hotel. My husband couldn`t get enough of the whale watching right from the beach also. We walked the path to Whalers Village & beyond several times. Although we didn`t get the room we had booked (king bed) they did give us a suite, ocean view with 2 dbl beds. the room was very large & had a micro & fridge. My husband decided to pay for the valet parking and was very glad we did, it was very handy to have our car wating for us when we got to the lobby. They also were very helpful here in giving us directions and suggestions for restaurants. We used the shuttle 2 times to Lahaina and this also went great without a hitch.the pool area was great too, and we never had a problem finding a chair. We would for sure stay here again if the price was right & included the breakfast. buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: smr289
Reviews.Content: We were made to feel very welcome as soon as we arrived and were offered an upgrade for a small fee which we accepted. After a cold bottle of water which was much appreciated we were shown to our room and it was amazing! Room 6302 which was a corner suite in a quiet spot with sea views that went on forever! Wow! The staff were always friendly and no request was too much trouble. we ate at most of the restaurants on the property and they were all quite good. The grounds were gorgeous, pools were lovely although very busy. Loved it, loved it, cannot wait to go back soon I hope.

Reviews.Title: “Value not here”
Reviews.Author: sue_dnyc
Reviews.Content: For the price paid they should be more reasonable with other amenities. For example breakfast for 2 can run you 70 bucks. The Wi-Fi is around 13I agree with other reviews that I have stayed in much cheaper hotels and had free wi-fi! - ridiculous! . No laundry area but you can get your underwear washed for 3 to 4 bucks. Movie rental (for my kid) - $15-17 for fairly recent movies! Room Service prices are like 17 for an omelette, 39 for a chicken dish, I think surf and turf was 54 - then you have to add $4 room service charge to that! They have a captive audience and they know it - you have to drive off of the site about 10 minutes to get to food. The only deal was valet parking at 5 bucks a day! I also did not like it for my kid. Don't get me wrong the views were nice and black rock is great and all the other things but I think this hotel is geared towards adults - who have MONEY!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: LaurenBeth8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. Perfect location. We stayed in the suites that overlook the Black Rock. We had a perfect sunset outside of our room every night. There was AWESOME snorkeling right off of the coast. There were 3 sea turtles there in water so shallow, you didn't even need to be snorkeling to see them. The pool was beautiful and the food and drinks were great. I can't wait to go back and would definitely stay here again. If you are going to Maui, buy "Maui Revealed". It is the best travel book and gives a really good details on a self-guided drive along the road to Hana (which was my FAVORITE thing on the island).

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: SnookieToronto
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton at Kaanapali beach was great. I read many reviews before my husband and I booked our honeymoon and we decided that the Sheraton was the best value for money on the Kaanapali beach strip. I think we made a good decision. While the rooms are a little out of date (as mentioned in many reviews), the hotel service was excellent, the location was great and the proximity to Whaler's Village provides access to many restaurants. We really enjoyed snorkelling around Black Rock. When people comment that it is some of the best snorkelling on the island, I would agree. On one of the afternoons during our stay, a pod of spinner dolphins passed off the top of Black Rock which was amazing. Great hotel, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain”
Reviews.Author: angieyeh13
Reviews.Content: ... since I didn't pay for it, but room 2121 smells like urine mixed with strawberry pear air freshener. So I called guest services and I told them about my problem. They suggested it might be coming from the pipes, but they didn't send anyone up. I had to call two more times before a housekeeper came and all she did was spray the bathroom with air freshener. I also had to ask her to leave the can of air freshener even though I asked for a can the first time I called guest services... I thought it might be a problem through out the hotel, but when I stepped into my cousin's room right next door, it was fresh and had no urine smell. That was my main problem and that no one did much about it... So just avoid that room... The location is great, we didn't eat at the hotel so I don't really know how the food is, the bell hop was very helpful and nice, and the cleaning lady came everyday but one day. Black rock is beautiful and the tiki torch lighting at night is pretty cool. The hotel resort is pretty much dead at night. I can see everyone's night turned on by 7:30 including mine since I was also in my room by then. The resort is nice and huugee compared to all the other ones we walked by except for probably the Hyatt. There are a lot of people here, but if you have a car you can just drive somewhere more remote. Overall it was nice, but I do wish my room didn't smell like someone urinated all over the room..... At the bottom I marked the internet as not being for "free" since technically it's not. It is part of the resort fee though which includes parking, internet and some other stuff that I can't remember. I guess the resort fee is worth it since parking is $20 for other people... but shouldn't parking be for free? ...... well i dont know but the resort fee is $25/ day whether you like it or not!

Reviews.Title: “swimming with sea turtles every morning”
Reviews.Author: castelloSardinia
Reviews.Content: thias hotel is the best choice you have in maui... the location is perfect.. it i slocated at the black rock beach that is the only place in the area where you can actually snorkel. some huge sea turtles are local to that spot so it is great fun swimming so close to them. the children were crazy about that...of course this spot of the beach gets also crowede prettu soon so if you do not like the swimming pool or crowds if walk 2 minutes outside the hotel on the other side of the "black rock" you are going to find a very long stretch of golden sand and you are going to be pretty much alone. the sea then is cristal clear water... again perfect location if you want to relax on the beach under the sun. ROOM the hotel is big but it is not a maze.. you get easily oriented in 15 minutes rooms were nice maybe a little small but overall nice, the food was also very good we dined at the hotel a couple of times and it was alright all the staff was very friendly .. special thanks to caroline at the water sports desk... she has been so nice to us... than you! the hotel is then 5 minutes walk to the whaler's shopping center... nice but not great.. there is a free shuttle bus that will take you there... and 10 minutes drive from lahaina that is much better... i would definetely go back and recommend the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: KathyArcher
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the Sheraton at Kaanapali Beach. From check in to check out, everything was perfect. We were upgraded to a Deluxe Ocean Front with a lanai that opened onto the most pristine view. The room was immaculate and well stocked with plenty of towels at all times. The beds were very comfortable and the sheets and duvet were exceptional. The pool at this hotel is unbelievable - we could barely pull my daughter out every evening! The hotel is located at the prime location on Kaanapali Bay and the nightly cliff dive is beautiful. The snorkeling in front of the hotel is awesome - we even swam with turtles!! We did not eat at any of the hotel restaurants but had a pleasant nightcap at the Link Bar. Customer service was excellent everywhere we went in the hotel - from front desk to pool side. When we arrived home, I noticed two charges that did not belong to me on my bill. I called the hotel and they immediately looked up the charges, noted that it was in fact a mistake made by another guest and took it off the bill! We can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Three Weeks in Maui”
Reviews.Author: bffchic22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the opportunity to stay here for nearly a month when my in-laws decided to treat all their kids and spouses to a vacation here fore their 30th anniversary. ROOMS We all stayed up on Black Rock, which was quite a trek to and from the beach/pool area but totally worth it! All of our rooms had incredible furnished balconies, with views almost entirely of the ocean. Nearly everyday we would see two sea turtles right off our balcony, and humpback whales swimming in the bay. Even a couple of rainbows. Just gorgeous. The beds were comfortable, bathrooms spacious (water closet with door so both shower and toilet could be privately used at same time). The room had a small kitchenette; microwave, small refrigerator, and cupboard space. The TV hookups are not blocked, so we brought an XBOX to watch movies on at night in the room so we didn't have to pay for them through the hotel (15$). Free wi-fi (well technically I believe it's rolled into the resort fee), and free parking. Carpets could use replacing and the electrical outlets were fickle, but besides that, nothing to complain about. POOL There was definitely a shortage of beach chairs around the pool while we were there. Towel game in full force! We would set our towels down on our way to breakfast in the mornings and by 8AM there was already not much choice. Cabanas can be rented for 40$ a day, the in-laws did this often, which was nice as the wait staff would come by with water pitchers and cups all day long. Pool was clean, large and fantastic. There's a kid section, waterfall, floating bean bags up for grabs, a lazy river with a small water slid, and a deeper area that was used mainly by adults. Also a hot tub, but children were rampant here! About 6 or 7 kids splashing in there everytime we went, so I wouldn't recommend it. BEACH The beach was fantastic but could get extremely crowded. If you're looking for seclusion on your holiday, this is not where you will find it. Snorkeling was incredibly popular along Black Rock, but with good reason as it's very beautiful. Hawaii experienced a few heavy rains while we were there which caused the water to be very silty and difficult to see in so skip on snorkeling after a rainy day. The water was warm and pleasant with a nice sandy beach, but waves could be rough at times so be mindful of little ones. Lots of paddle surfing going on. Beach volleyball was the biggest letdown for us as we love to play during our vacations. The net was set up only one day of our 24 day stay! FOOD The resort has one option for breakfast, and a couple for lunch and dinner. We had originally planned to prepare a lot of meals in our room since we were there for so long and food in Maui is pricey, but it was hard to resist! We hit up Safeway on our way to the hotel from the airport. Breakfast is okay-we had vouchers for free breakfast (tip not included) but without that I don't think we would have went, we probably would have opted to just eat fruit and bagels in the room. Teppanyaki Dan's was satisfactory, ate here twice, can't beat the Japanese food we get in Seattle though. Be sure to make reservations. Most days we would end up ordering drinks and snacks by the pool, which were not worth the price. Chicken kabobs were undercooked on two occasions. Drinks were in small plastic cups. I would recommend walking down to Whaler's Village for more options as they have a nice food court there. SERVICE Excellent! Loved talking to Kimmy everyday by the pool to get recommendations for dinner and other activities. Everyone is very friendly here. We were waited on by Walter at breakfast everyday and he was great too! I guess it's a testament to how great they are that I remember their names after 7 months :) Front desk was nice, didn't deal with them much but check-in was easy. TIPS -Rent a car! This was priceless as it afforded us the option to eat at many other restaurants on Maui. It also enabled us to see other sites like Dragon's Teeth and Iao Valley. -Eat at Pineapple Grill! We ate here twice-for my in-laws anniversary dinner and my husband's birthday. Both times were fantastic! Great views, service and food. -Use the free shuttle to Whalers or LaHaina. -Dinner and magic show at Warren and Annabelle's was great! -Rent snorkeling gear in one of the nearby shopping areas for about 15$ a week. -At least once while you're here check out the cliff diving ceremony at sunset. -Humpback whale season is December through May, if here during this time I highly recommend a whale watching cruise! We saw about 7 humpbacks and two dolphins plus a beautiful sunset. Plus, keep your camera ready at the beach at the Sheraton. We saw a whale fully breach (launch its entire body out of the water) twice while sitting at the pool bar!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Maui”
Reviews.Author: rmittenCt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in one of the very best locations in Maui. The grounds including beach and pool was very nice. The restaurants were nice but a little pricey and wish they had option to get brewed coffee earlier since had Starbucks stand which was nice. They have a culinary tour by head chef that is great. The rooms could use an upgrade since were very limited on closet space and draws to store clothing. The bathroom also had limited shelve space to operate effectively. I had a reservation which included king size bed but only offered room with two double beds since all that was available . They provided other options but at a significant cost so stayed there which thought as Starwood member and fact was 30 year anniversary would have done more. Overall very nice hotel but hotel did not go out of way to make you feel special like Outrigger Reef in Waikiki did.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Location”
Reviews.Author: DCRickH
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Maui in Lahaina is set on a beautiful bay next to black rock. Phenomenal snorkeling (lots of fish and turtles), a great pool, and a nice beach. Its easy to walk down the beach to several area restaurants, and the Sheraton is a quick drive to many things. The building itself is kind of old, but that's how they got the best location in the area. Our room was lovely (we upgraded to a corner suite with an awesome view), even though the furniture was a bit dated. But based on the location, price and overall experience, I won't hesitate to book the Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel , great room ,nice staff , but why the sharetime fuzz??”
Reviews.Author: Jay Jay O
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one week , and are considering another stay . First i must say that the location is awesome . We had a sun + room and it had an extra balcony we really appreciated. The breakfast buffet was excellent and the staff always helpful and friendly. We arrived the hotel after an 15 hour trip from Norway so we were pretty tired when we got there. The first thing we got thrown at us was a lot of fuzz of there sharetime apartments. We said NO to two members of there staff the first night , before a voicemail with the same message came to our phone. Anyways we got pretty tired of it and got a very bad first impression of the hotel , luckily that impression changed after a weeks stay ;)

Reviews.Title: “We are going back asap!”
Reviews.Author: howiemaui
Reviews.Content: Great package deal from expedia after a lot of research. I saved a couple of hundred dollars which in retrospect should have spent on the flight. More about United Express/Skyway later. The Sheraton at Black Rock was awesome. The grounds were beautiful and spacious. Plenty of room for everyone. I looked at all the hotels while we were there, especially the Westin. I almost booked that hotel but glad I didnâ€™t. Very nice hotel but the grounds were very compact making me feel claustrophobic. Also the 2 hotels next to the Sheraton had major remodeling going on and for me any price deal wouldnâ€™t have been worth the hassle. Theyâ€™re grounds were no comparison to Sheratons. Our room accommodations fit our needs. On arrival we were given a room with double beds in building 2. They told us we would be moved the following day to a room with a kingsize which we were. Building 2 runs perpendicular with the beach so your view is over the main courtyard and beachfront with a view of blackrock. We werenâ€™t in the room that much but when we were we stayed on the patio. Iâ€™d like to comment on staff but they were pretty transparent. We really didnâ€™t need anything from them. Front desk was extremely helpful the couple of times I spoke with them but we really didnâ€™t need them. My wife went to the spa and told me theyâ€™re staff was really top notch. She has been in that business so for her to say that they must have really impressed her. Also the staff at the enterprise car rental which was right on the property, was great. We just rented a car one day for the trip to Hana. We used the shuttle one day to go downtown. A little walk to downtown from Hilo Hatties but not bad. Great burger at Cool Cats. We also tried Cheeseburger in Paradise on another trip. It was packed but they had 2 seats at the bar and we walked right in. Bartender was great and we ate dinner right there. Snorkel early at Black Rock prior to 10am and youâ€™ll pretty much have it to your self. After that got a little crowded but still ok. After lunch I would walk around building 4 to the golf cart path which takes you to the other side of blackrock. Maybe 1 or 2 people there but basically you have a long stretch of beach all to yourself. Great snorkeling but water a little rougher on that side. Its also the side I saw the large sea turtles that live around the rock. I am ready to return! As for the flight, first plane out of Love Field was 2 hours late causing us to miss our connection in Denver. We were suppose to fly from Denver into Maui but now had to connect to LA then Maui. Of course the Denver flight was late which made us late into LAX. We arrived and went 2 gates over to board our flight. We didnâ€™t realize United had booked us on a Delta flight 2 terminals over! We had to run the whole way and luckly a young lady on a golf cart took us part of the way. Otherwise we never would have made it. Instead of getting in Maui at 3:20 that afternoon we made it around 9PM. That day was shot. And youâ€™ll never guess but on the way back in Houston we boarded our flight only to be told due to maintenance we would have to change planes which cost us another hour. I requested a partial refund and United offered me $150 off my next flight. Weâ€™re going to Vegas next month and with the coupon the flight came out to $307 with a connection in Denver. Got on priceline and found AA flight nonstop for $269. United taught me you get Less then what you pay for! Iâ€™ll never fly United Again.

Reviews.Title: “a little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: leanneandrew15
Reviews.Content: A little disappointed with our stay for the price we paid for our room. Room was pleasant nothing that did not work or was broken just seemed very tired. Asked that linen be changed daily this was not done sheets where just turned up the other way. Room was certainly not vacumed during our whole stay as when we arrived cheesel ( chip) under table - when we left it was still there. Amenities where great and so where most of the staff. Shopping was what we expected for resort and activities where there if you wanted. Can't say I would return useless refits to rooms. We stayed in ocean view room at the north end of the resort so maybe they are coming up for refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel---what you'd expect from Sheraton...”
Reviews.Author: CeciSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for 3 days and this was our second visit. Room had our basic necessities---comfy bed, flat screen tv, partial ocean view and mini fridge. Kids enjoyed the lazy river and hanging out at the beach. You can rent a mini pseudo cabana for $40 (all day) or park yourself by the pool. Real easy to find seats and staff was friendly. Wristbands to use the pool are the norm, so don't be surprised by the pool patrol. Didn't bother to have the buffet this go round since we weren't impressed the last time and felt it was pricey. Instead, you can walk beachside to Whalers Village very easily and order from the food express court. They have a McDonald's express, Chinese food, Mexican food and pasta/pizza. Food was very reasonable and I would recommend the caesar's salad with shrimp--it was only $9 and tasty. There's also a variety of restaurants along the way that have early bird specials or specials on certain days of the week. We paid a $35 one-time fee to Sheraton to rent a microwave and it came in very handy. We'd have leftovers for breakfast so that we can start our day with a quick jumpstart. Purchase water and yogurts/fruits at the Lahaina Cannery Mall safeway to save time and money. Resort fees + taxes are within the range of what other hotels are charging ($20-$35 per day). Only downer is that the area can get very windy starting in the early afternoon, so I'd suggest to visit the beach in the earlier hours if your schedule permits. I didn't take advantage of the kids club, but I think they offer a program that partners with the Westin Hotel. Fitness Center is small (3-4 treadmills, 1 bike, free weights), but you can jog along the beach paved path if jogging along the beach isn't your thing. The paved path gets pretty busy, though. I rated excellent for the value because I secured the hotel by bidding on priceline.

Reviews.Title: “This resort has it all and is beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: jdm113
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic! My wife and I stayed in a Deluxe Ocean Front room in building 6 for 7 nights. These are without a doubt the most beautiful views in all of Kaanapali. The Sheraton resort is a very well taken care of facility. The rooms areâ€¦ nice, the grounds are incredible and the beach is soft white sand. They said they were booked full for our stay and we never once felt that it was too crowded. Not by the pool or the beach. Staff are nice and helpful. Lots of positives from beginning to end of this trip! The rooms are nice. Really nothing to complain about. They are well kept and cleaned thoroughly. They just aren't over the top wow" inside but the view is amazing! But the beds are very comfortable and they provide all the basics anyone would need to stay. We chose to eat 90% of our meals outside the resort and found that Maui is no more expensive than going out at our local restaurants at home. The resort has hefty prices but is convenient. I recommend a car as it comes in handy for the day trips around the island. The location on Black Rock is some of the best snorkeling you will find. We swam with multiple turtles, spotted rays and eagle rays. An amazing experience. It is also an easy drive to anywhere on the island. I searched very hard to find the perfect place to stay on Maui. From my experience I can without a doubt say the Sheraton Maui is an excellent choice for anyone looking for an all around great vacation location. From check in to check out we loved every minute!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Eagles2012
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights before moving south to the Grand Wailea. Big difference in the two hotels, but so was the price. Upon checking into the Sheraton, we were shown to our room by Andrew who was very friendly and helpful. We had connecting rooms which were the deluxe ocean view. The view was extraordinary as was the location of the hotel. We were doing several activities in Lahaina, so it was convenient. The rooms are in desperate need of an update. Sink and tub took forever to drain, but besides that rooms were adequate. One day our rooms didn't get cleaned. They promised us they would be cleaned by 10:00 am the next day. We got back to our room at 3:00 that day and they still hadn't been cleaned. They came right away to clean them and the rooms were cleaned promptly thereafter. Beach was crowded, but nice. Great snorkeling, nice pools. Food was expensive, but that was to be expected. It's like a maze to get around. Overall nice hotel, but needs some work. Location can't be beat! They do try to get you to buy into their timeshares with the lure of a free gift. They will call you about it. If you don't want to participate, don't.

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful location in best area of Maui.”
Reviews.Author: Erno1968
Reviews.Content: Excellent location; they charge you for everything. Food is $$$ and average. The location and scenery compensates for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & service, OK accomodations”
Reviews.Author: maureen_swanson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Maui for 10 days this past June. We chose the resort based on it's location on Maui and recommendations from those that had previously visited. The Sheraton is on Kaanapali beach in West Maui. It's about a 30 minute drive from the airport. It's also only a short walk to Whaler's Village where you'll find shopping & restaurants. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. There are a number of conceirge's on hand to accomodate the number of guests that are coming through. I was a little underwhelmed with our room. While we didn't spend too much time in there anyway, for the amount of money you're spending I expected something nicer. Toiletries were OK and the bathroom could use an upgrade. Overall, it is still a nice hotel but again, I guess I just expected more. The grounds, however, were beautiful. Flowers and perfectly manicured grass all around. The pool appeared to be well maintained as well (only issue is there never seemed to be enough lounge chairs at the peak of the afternoon!). The beach is public so it also became crowded at times but it's a great spot for snorkeling. I would definitely recommend the Sheraton Maui to someone thinking of staying in West Maui. Just do your homework and think about what you really want to spend your money on. The higher price of the Hyatt may be worth the extra $ if you're looking for something for upscale...of course there's always the Grand Wailea or Four Seasons in Wailea of you really want to spend some cash!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: svd92708
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right next to Black Rock so there's a great beach and access to fine snorkeling right in front of the hotel. It's an easy walk to Whaler's Village and other resorts along Kaanapali Beach. There is a lounge on the eighth floor of the building right next to Black Rock that is very comfortable. There's always a breeze, and the views are awesome. All of our encounters with the staff were positive. They were consistently helpful and friendly. We had a late flight and the hotel could not offer late check-out. but they gave us pool towels and access to the fitness center so we could spend the day at the beach before cleaning up for our flight home. My gripe with this hotel is that they only give you one pool/beach towel per guest. You can't cover a hot chaise lounge with a single towel. The pool does get crowded but we were always able to find a spot to enjoy the water and the sun.

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect . . .”
Reviews.Author: nojoha
Reviews.Content: we got an upgrade on arrival to building number six which is on one side a bit far away from the pool area, but on the other hand perfectly quite and since temperature was perfect we slept with open windows. Our request to change to a higher level in the same building was actually no problem, but when it was at the time to change to room the Sheraton behaves more like a cheap motel. Finally our room move costs us 3hours of a sunny afternoon which we preferred to stay at the pool instead of waiting in the room to get the information. We were promised to be called back soon but even after 30 minutes (3x) they couldn't confirm us where our new room would be. So the whole process was about 3hours . . . Also on check-out they lost again their good reputation as we requested for a bell man 30 minutes prior to departure. We asked to have him at the room at 10 a.m. but after 10:10 there was still nobody there. I mean, is it really that difficult to be on time for a luxury hotel? The pool was/is actually nice, but also there I have to mention some points where Sheraton may could (should?) improve. There are way to less sunshade's and the cushion's on the sun chair become incredible hot. O.K., may I'm too picky, but again - we're talking from a Sheraton! To close with the "good things" beside of the upgrade was the really nice breakfast buffet, a very nice pool area and even I've not stayed in any other Hotel at Kaanapali I still would consider the Sheraton as the best.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely LOVED it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kagaboo
Reviews.Content: Went there for our honeymoon for 8 nights and it was great. It was in a great location and the beach was awesome. The room was really clean and nice. We had a garden view and partial ocean view, and when we got there the first day, we saw a rainbow. So gorgeous.... Maui is so beautiful. The pool was great and we were always able to find a lounge chair. The drinks and the food were great, little pricy but its like this everywhere in Maui. If you plan on eating by the pool, try Fish Tacos.. it was one of the best! Also the beach was nice especially being next to the Black Rock. We also went to their luau which I thought was good. Its a luau.. if you've never been to one, its good to go but the food is luau food which is not the greatest food. You go for the experience and it was nice! I was debating between Hyatt and Sheraton. My friends told me Hyatt had a great pool but I'm glad I chose Sheraton. I would love to go back to Maui and stay in Sheraton again. Oh and the service is great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: tink4748
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here in 2005 and we were going to try another hotel for this trip, but we are sure glad that we didn't! We had a such a wonderful time! The hotel grounds are beautiful and the pool is great! I enjoyed floating on the bean bags and the watermelon and pineable that was passed out by the pool attendants each day was a nice touch! The beach is great and the snorkelling at Black Rock was amazing. We were upgraded to a ocean front suite and the sunset view each night were great.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: Strawberry333
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I came here in June and thought this was the best hotel in Kaanapali. It's clean and has a beautiful lawn and pool area, and it also is located in the best spot on the beach. It's right next to the Black Rock, which is great for swimming and snorkeling, and it's the prettiest section of the beach. It's also a very short walk to the Whaler's Village, which was convenient. We walked down the pathway connecting all of the hotels, and we were happy with our hotel choice. The Westin looked nice too and seemed to have a better pool, but we were more interested in the beach, so we were happy with our choice. I do have a couple of complaints though. Although the rooms were clean, the door to the bathroom is a sliding door that, for some reason, was not created in such a way that it shuts completely. That means that the bathroom door was always slightly open, no matter how much privacy I wanted to have in there. One other problem were the restaurants. The food quality was low and the food was way over-priced. Just walk 5 minutes down to the Whaler's Village and eat there instead. Other than that, we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect location! We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Travelers4MA_8
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Hawaii, first to Maui. We had a deluxe ocean front room with a beautiful lanei and LOTS of space. We have 2 teenagers, and we never felt at all crowded, even with a 12 day stay. The fridge and safe were very convenient, and there was even a cabinet next to the fridge where we stored food we bought. We were able to have breakfast in the room every day and that saved money and got us out the door fast. We loved the outdoors feeling to the entire resort. The service was excellent, and we loved the location at Black Rock - excellent beach and snorkeling. We could (and did) walk to Whaler's Village for lunch and dinners, and the garage was very close to our room as well. All in all a perfect place to stay. We will definitely stay here any time we are in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reviews but a real winner!”
Reviews.Author: kcin41
Reviews.Content: We researched a lot for a hotel to stay at while in Maui before settling on the Sheraton. After reading mixed reviews we decided to try it out and are glad we did! The property is beautiful in the perfect location, right beside Black Rock which has great snorkling and slightly isolated from the wind. The property was beautiful with a great pool. The Black Rock restaurant wasn't great so I would venture elsewhere (Tropica at The Westin is amazing and you get a 20% off coupon from teh Sheraton to go there). The food prices were extremely expensive but comparable to every other hotel so just be prepared to spend a lot on food. The free parking was also a major plus since you're already doling out for the resort fee, it's nice it is included. There is lots of white sand beach right behind the pool area which isn't the case as you wander further down the strip of hotels towards the Hyatt. We really enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton and would reccomend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Jazz-June
Reviews.Content: I agree with some of the other posts that the hotel didn't provide some basic amenities that are usually provided at this level of hotel (i.e. slippers, plastic spoons and forks, cotton balls, robes...). However, the easy access to Black Rock and the wonderful pool really makes up for all that. We unfortunately got a first floor room with no view at all, but we didn't spend too much time in our rooms anyway..

Reviews.Title: “snorkeling, pool and beach!”
Reviews.Author: sammyStamfordCT
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Sheraton Maui Resort was wonderful. We had an ocean view room centrally located (building 3) which was great for our family. We could sit on our lanai and have a beer before dinner while listening to live music and watching the sun set. The snorkeling is wonderful here although VERY busy during the day. We went out snorkeling before breakfast on 2 of the days and there were only a few people. We saw turtles, eagle rays and a huge variety of fish. The turtles get very close to the snorkelers and there are people who feel that seeing a beautiful sea creature isn't good enough and they have to try and touch the turtle. Thankfully MOST people are smarter than that! We found the hotel to be centrally located to other beaches that were better for boogie boarding. We used the shuttle service to go into Lahaina and it was reliable. The breakfast buffet is VERY expensive but we had it included for 2 days of our stay and we didn't need to eat lunch on those days. The buffet offers a wide variety of food choices. I highly recommend the Sheraton for a vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon of My Dreams”
Reviews.Author: DWAlexander
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Maui Resort & Spa made our honeymoon experience very memorable. The grounds are absolutely beautiful. We had a partial oceanview room that made the stay even more romantic than you can believe. The hotel staff was friendly, accommodating, and helpful in every way. We enjoyed the beautiful beach, watching the cliff diver each night, attending the awesome luau, and strolling hand in hand on the grounds. There is even a shuttle service to the other properties and local shopping centers with great restaurants and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice Place but not a good value-”
Reviews.Author: paulyd04
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd trip to Hawaii- 2 previous with family, this one now was my honeymoon. All in all Maui is a nice place and is a fun vacation and we will probably be back but will probably not stay at the Sheraton again because we just felt like it wasn't that good of a deal. This doesn't mean it isn't nice- the pool area is fantastic, the scenery, view, all amazing- it's just you have to pay out the @#$ for it. I know part of this is Hawaii in general but this seemed to be another step above that- plus there are ammenities that this hotel doesn't offer that really make you scratch your head... Here are some pros and cons.. Pros- views are incredible- even the cheap rooms seem to have good views. We stayed on an ocean front deluxe room and had a panoramic view. Also all the staff (minus the concierge) seemed very friendly and greeted you- but this is also hawaii in general- people are extremely nice. Food was good but very pricey. Pool area is very nice (one of the reasons why we stayed here) Cons- first the decor is heavily outdated- rooms are in major need of an update and this is part of the reason why you don't feel like you're getting your money's worth. Also- the pictures online show more furniture in the rooms than what's really in them! Small tub shower- we stayed in the room right below a suite and it was a crappy tub shower?? PLUS- NO WIFI in the rooms AT ALL- NOT EVEN A PAID OPTION!??!! I've stayed at hotels 1/10th of the price that have wifi! There are hotspots around the resort but those barely work as well. Another major con- the prices. For an 80 minute couples massage they charged us $400!?!? Plus the breakfast buffet (while pretty good) was about $75 for just 2 people. All in all it is a nice place but when we return to Maui we will try and find a place that offers more for your money. I think there are better places here in Maui that offer that. Plus I think I overheard this place is getting a major update very soon so we might try it again after that.

Reviews.Title: “Where has the Sheraton vibe gone?”
Reviews.Author: Bigbear66
Reviews.Content: We are mid way through a one week stay and are really disappointed. We have stayed at Sheratons in many different locations and the normal feeling is low key luxury with an accent on customer service. Sadly the Maui property scores low on either. We attempted to have breakfast in house the first day, too many customers, too few seats, too few staff all of whom seemed stressed. We went to the bar by the beac, I was served beer in a plastic cup with a hole in it that spilled into my lap, the server reluctantly replaced it with the comment 'you will dry off quick' hilarious eh? We had some fruit but realized that there was No cutlery, no plates not even a spoon in our room so we called and asked for something to eat off, the response? It will take an hour we are very busy and there will be a $4 charge for delivery! Pretty ordinary when you are paying hundreds of dollars per night and you are a SPG member. This is a beautiful location but we can not believe how under resourced and lacking in basic amenities the rooms are. Look elsewhere if you are coming to Maui. Ron & Lyn

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui--we'll be back someday”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoMolly11
Reviews.Content: Stayed July 12-19 at Sheraton and had a great time. Room was a disappointment but we moved to the room I expected to get the second day so, Thank You Sheraton! Husband snorkeled Black Rock every morning after the walk on beach and coffee on lanai. Staff were friendly and helpful and everything is well organized, i.e., getting towels, renting cabanas for beach and valet parking first day. Never had a problem finding self park during stay. This hotel is located perfectly and walked to Whalers Village many times. The pool was inviting and never had problem getting a lounge if early in day. One hint--we left muffins in room on dresser and get a few little friends--put in fridge and all was OK.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Futuremauian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui from July 2nd to the 6th as part of a two island package with Pleasant Holidays. I have been to Maui about a dozen times and always wished I was staying at the Sheraton. This time I did, and it was spectacular. Upon check-in, we walked to our assigned room to see what the view would be. Unfortunately, it faced the tennis courts so we went back to Reception and asked for a change. (I leave my luggage in the car at hotel check-in so I am not dragging it around). We were cheerfully re-assigned (at no additional cost) to a room on the ground floor facing the pools and ocean. It was very nice, and clean as well. The beds were really comfortable too. From our lanai, we could watch kids jumping off of Black Rock into the ocean. There was also a small waterfall and tiki torches about 10 feet away, adding to the ambiance. Our next step was a trip to Safeway for snacks, "liquid refreshments", sunblock, etc.. When we got back to the Sheraton, we drove around to the end of the property and located the small parking lot there, which was more convenient to our room than the parking garage or even valet. During our stay, we remarked repeatedly about what a pleasant and elegant hotel this is to visit. The pools are warm and comfortable for lounging, and the ocean around Black Rock is so good for snorkeling and turtle viewing, that it seemed like too much effort to go visit other beaches. On July 4th, the hotel set up booths, activities, and a jump house for kids on the expansive lawns between the hotel and pools. The efforts they made on behalf of their guests makes me understand why this hotel draws such a huge number of repeat guests. I know I will be back! We never had any unhappy encounters with employees or other guests. Everything was just about perfect! Note; be sure to take the elevator up to the 8th floor in the front building on Black Rock. There is a balcony and "wi-fi living room" there for all to enjoy. You can see the rest of Kaanapali Beach in both directions! A final note: Food & drinks are predictably expensive, so we tried a number of restaurants off of the property. Standouts included the Okazuya & Deli at 3600 Lower Honoapilani Rd., suite D, in the Times Supermarket Center, about 2 miles from the hotel. Excellent Mahimahi in lemon-caper sauce. It is a takeout place with tables in front. Also, Aloha Mixed Plate, located on the waterfront, just as you arrive in Lahaina. Go early! We missed "Da Kitchen", and "Fish Market Maui". They're on my list for next time. Mahalo! Aloha! Enjoy your vacation!

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful place on earth.”
Reviews.Author: Christa86
Reviews.Content: Roughly 20 years ago when my brother and I were little kids, my family made the trip to Maui. We always remembered it as the best vacation we ever had and vowed to someday make it back and this June we finally did. It lived up to all expectations. The hotel, the pool, the beach, and black rock were all spectacular and truly paradise. Our first day there I took a morning jog along the Ka'anapali boardwalk and checked out every hotel there and was pleased that the sheraton was BY FAR the most beautiful one there. The hotel was immaculate down to every detail. Even the young men who worked by the pool as a part of maui beach activities were incredibly nice and helpful. Especially look out for Patrick Peterson, he gave us helpful tips every step of the way on how to enjoy our stay without breaking the bank. Hopefully we'll be back again soon and it won't take another 20 years!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location for an unforgettable getaway”
Reviews.Author: TheBoss271
Reviews.Content: Aloha! I just got back from my exciting trip to Maui yesterday and have decided to write this review now before I shrug it off and put it in the "to do" pile. I have read a great deal of reviews on here prior and during my trip and found them extremely helpful and I hope this helps another person. My experience with The Sheraton in Maui was such a positive one. The location and the staff were an enhancement that added to the beauty of the island. Check-in was easy and fast. Noah Berkley was kind and curteous and made the start of the trip great. I upgraded from a resort view to an ocean view, for a cost, and I am so happy I did. The room was very spacious with a million dollar view. The furniture and decor were a bit old, but I understand they will be updating in a few months. At the end of the day it made no difference to myself and my partner, we spent most of the time we were in the room either asleep or looking at the ocean. The location of the Sheraton is ideal for those looking for great snorkeling. We got up at 6am everyday and went snorkeling at Black Rock. Between 6am-10am there are very few people there and at times we were the only ones snorkeling in the cove. There were tons of fish and the visabiltiy was superb. When taking a break from the ocean, their pool was equally as relaxing. If you get there before it gets busy it is wonderful to read a book or listen to music. You get a view of the ocean and all the aquatic activities that go with it. Joy, The Sheraton's concierge, was very helpful, super sweet and helped me with dinner and lunch recommandations. Thank you Joy! I also want to commend the cleaning staff! Everyday our room was meticulously clean and spotless. They did a wonderful job! I am not one for massages, but I did go down to the Black Rock spa and received the most relaxing massages from Kioto. She was very friendly and nice and had me melting! While they have high speed internet, wireless would be better. This isn't the nineties anymore. My only complaint about the whole place was an employee named Caleb who was down with the towels. I was returning my towel and waiting for my card for about five minutes when he turned around and said to me very rudely, "What do you want?" I brushed it off, but the next few times I had to deal with him through the week he was equally as rude. One rude employee could not bring down this perfect vacation though. My partner and I had the time of our lives and will definitely return in the future. Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot!”
Reviews.Author: MassGuy2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon in July and loved the hotel. Beautiful grounds, nice pool, right on a great beach. Staff was nice. Great location, right on Kaanapali beach. You can walk down to the Whalers Village for some different resturaunts and bars etc. Shopping right there too. They also offer a free shuttle to downtown Lahania which is awesome. Canâ€™t beat that. They allow you use of the sister hotels that are right there (the 2 Westins) which is great. We had breakfast at them all during our stay. Room doesnâ€™t have wireless internet, Ethernet cord connection only, which was OK. One complaint is that the pool bars close too early. One closes at 4pm and the other at 8pm. I donâ€™t really know why, such a beautiful area to sit at night and have food and drinks and they literally shut the doors on you. The Westin pool bar is open much later and has a happy hour from 8-10pm so we went there instead. They noted when we checked in it was our honeymoon (we didnâ€™t tell them must have been a note in the computer) and I guess that got our expectations up that we would be getting a bottle of champagne or wine or something, but nothing. Not a big deal, just we heard so many stories about hotels doing things for you on your honeymoon and when they said that we thought we were in luck. Oh well. I would suggest staying here to everyone. Love the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Egglesh
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday from our trip to Maui and stay at the Sheraton Maui. First, let me comment on the Kaanapali area and beach. It is a spectacular area and, in my opinion, the best place to stay, on the west/north side. As many other reviewers have stated, you just can't beat black rock and the snorkeling. We saw several large sea turtles each day.... Even saw some, in the ocean, from our room. The beach and water is beautiful. My family and I took several walks up and down the beaches of Kaanapali. We paid particular attention to some of the other resorts that we were considering. Nothing compared to Sheraton, in opinion. Most didn't even have a beach. Also, we couldn't find a pool or grounds that that were as meticulous or expansive as Sheraton. Others just seemed packed in tight with lounge chairs right on top of each other. Every square foot of property seemed developed. Conversely, Sheraton is wide open with manicured lawns, palm trees, etc... There were only a few minor issues but nothing even close enough to cause us to rate our stay less than five stars. Probably our biggest issue was with an older gentleman working the towel cabana (John I believe). Unlike the rest of the staff, he was pretty rude and not very friendly. The first night we arrived, we checked out a couple towels and strolled the beach. My son and daughter strolled around the pool and decided to take a swim. When my son returned, to retrieve his towel and flip flops, they were gone. For a ten year old, he was pretty upset that his new flip flops were gone. When my wife explained this to John, he was very rude and seemed to imply that she wasn't being honest. Through out the week, I visited the towel cabana several times (without my wife, as we took turns) and he was just not a pleasant person to deal with. Again, everyone else was wonderful. Also, we would've loved it if they piped in some Hawaiian music, in the pool area, as other resorts did. It just puts you in a different mood. And people would probably stay longer and spend more money! As others have said, everything at the resort is expensive. However, there are great options at Whalers Village and Lahaina. Many people recommend Walmart by the airport, which we did. However, there is a great supermarket called the Times Supermarket on Lower Honoapiilani. Great selection and reasonable prices. By the way, pick up some beach chairs and save from having to rent them daily. Be sure to do The Old Lahaina Luau.... well worth it! We thought Maui would be a once in a life time trip. However, we had such a great time, we are already considering coming back next year. And we won't think twice about returning to the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Dream location!”
Reviews.Author: Mike O
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our Honeymoon, June 19 2011 for the entire week. It was unbelievable! Free upgrade to ocean-front room helped (just was nice to the front attendant), every staff member (aside from the concierge) was EXTREMELY helpfull, friendly, offered advice if asked and attended to your needs. It was a dream honeymoon, couldnt have pictured it going any better. Beautiful hotel, bedroom was nice, open, comfortable. We grabbed some water, breakfast from the grocery store which cut down on costs, since the room had a fridge, made everything convenient. if you have the chance, stay here! great pool, awesome view of Black Rock, decent snorkling but jumping off black rock is a must, I dove off the 30' cliff - it was fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with beautiful beach”
Reviews.Author: collaim
Reviews.Content: I had a great time in Maui. The beach and the pool areas are very relaxing. Although I had an issue with my room the second night I was there, Rachel was wonderful and very hands on in helping to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. She made sure that I enjoyed my stay. I will definitely consider staying at the sheraton next time I am in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SuziOzz
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic. Swimming at the beach out the front is great. The water is so clean with great visibility for snorkling. Saw the resident turtles and many fish. Rooms were clean. I would have liked a jug as I couldn't make a decent cup of tea without having a coffee taint from boiling water from the coffee machine. Grounds were very well manicured. Location is great for a stroll up to Whalers Village for dinner or browsing the stores. Went on a snorkel trip with Teralani which was a great day. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, will visit again.”
Reviews.Author: MojaveJim
Reviews.Content: This was our family's first vacation to Hawaii and I'm glad we picked the Sheraton Maui. The Black Rock location is awesome, excellent snorkeling right outside your door. The meandering pool is fun for everyone. Tip, rent a gazebo for a day, only $75! Nice shade and sun combination. We ate off property most of the time as it was just too expensive to eat here. We did have the breakfast buffet several times. Pretty standard, good omelets. We had an ocean front room, but with two 'full' size beds which are smaller than queens. Kind of tight and we aren't big people. Nice TV, wired internet was fair. Our only big gripe was the maid service. out of 6 days, One day they just didn't come at all and another one they came around 7:45 pm. Then other days they were done by 10 am. The grounds are immaculate and the staff is very friendly. We got Lei'd upon arrival, lots of 'alohas' the entire visit. Our teenage kids really liked it and so did we. 4 out of 5 stars for small beds and lax maid service. Otherwise would've been a 5.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort...Fantastic Island”
Reviews.Author: snorkeljunky2
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 9 night stay at the Sheraton Black Rock. We had a wonderful time! I have been taking some time to write a thoughtful review. I will review the resort first and then give you all some hints and tips based on my experiences in Maui. First off, we flew to HI from VA and that was an EXTREMELY long day!!! We arrived at the hotel at about 3:45pm their time which was our bedtime in VA. I had read some reviews that ragged on the folks at the check in/out counter. I have nothing but compliments for this bunch of ladies. Our check in was flawless and they let us check out at 12pm instead of 11am due to our late flight out that evening. On to the room.
