We traveled as a party of five, 3 in one room and 2 in another. Our rooms were side by side as requested. The rooms are not outstanding by any means but were very clean and fresh. Some of the furniture was "dated" as other folks have mentioned, but again, nothing to complain about really. I did have one peeve about our room though. The patio door was VERY hard to open. I am 6 ft 3 in and 290 lbs and it took all my might to open it sometimes. We were in Bldg 3 on the first floor. This was a great location which was close to the lobby and the pool/Black Rock area. We found a parking lot right behind our building which was a great time saver. The grounds of the resort are amazing. NO trash, lawns that looked and felt like putting greens and beautiful flowers everywhere. One other minor complaint pertains to the pool and HOT tub. The HOT tub was VERY HOT!!!! I like them hot but this one was on the verge of pain! I would guess 104-105 degrees most of the time. Ironically, the pool was VERY cold!!! Shockingly cold!!! Funny enough though, the temperatures in Maui the whole time we were there were 81-87 with breezes most days so yeah, I guess the pool should be a little chilly...dunno. We had no issues with the towel cards. After the first exchange, you just dumped your old towels in a bin and they give you new ones....easy as that. We ate at the poolside restaurants several times. The one closer to the lobby was more like standard bar food (cheeseburgers, pork tacos, chips and salsa, etc). The one closer to Black Rock served a number of "healthier" items which I liked better. Highly recommend the fruit BOWL --lots of fresh fruit and the Turkey/Avocado wrap--yummy! Both places were pricey but good and convenient when you are too tired to go out. My son and I ate the breakfast buffet on our last morning before flying out. It was high quality but $24.95 per person...YIKES!!! We knew all this going in so we were ready to "take it in the shorts" for food. I highly suggest going to the Safeway for drinks,snacks, breakfast food, etc. Sign up for their Safeway membership! Its free and saves you a ton of money. Their bakery is amazing! We ate at Lulu's one night (next door to Safeway) and their are some fast food choices inside the Cannery Mall (again, next to Safeway). A bit farther toward the airport is Lahaina. There are a number of places to eat there. We loved Moose McGillicuddy's and Cheeseburger in Paradise was good too. There is a neat little Gellato shop next to the Cheeseburger. Try their Pineapple flavor--amazing! Onto the excursions---Our first one was with Atlantis Submarine tour. I had declined this choice in St Thomas before because I thought it would be "cheesy". $99 per adult/teen and worth every penny. The staff was hilarious and they kept us laughing 90% of the time! We saw a Spotted Eagle Ray and a White Tip Reef Shark--very cool. The next day we went on a helicopter tour of Maui. This was the highlight of our trip! We saw 80 to 90% of the island. We saw Oprah's road to her home....the home was not visible...We went over the volcano on Maui and into several old crater openings. If you get car sick, you might want the think twice about doing this. 3 of us (me included) got a bit green at the very end when we circled inside of what looked like a 20 foot across hole in the top of a mountain. Our last trip was a day to Pearl Harbor, the USS Missouri and a tour of Honolulu. We flew over to Oahu, were picked up by bus by our tour guide and he shipped us to Pearl Harbor. This was a great experience! I learned soooo much! The tour of the USS Missouri was cool too but it was very hot and we were getting tired quickly...The rest of the tour was Waikiki Beach and the Punch Bowl Cemetery. We got to see the parking lot where Hawaii 5-0 keeps their set cars and stuff. We wanted to take a trip over to the Big Island but it was sold out =(. We set up all of these trips through the concierge at the lobby area. Thanks for all your help! We chose the Sheraton because of all the great comments about the snorkeling. It was fantastic. You can walk out 5 feet and see fish all around you from above the water. I really wanted to swim with the turtles and they delivered. Hint, they showed up daily at about 11am and stayed for several hours. We saw anywhere from 2 a day up to 5 on our last full day. That was incredible!!! They will swim right with you in fact one swam right under me from behind. Just respect them and they will hang around you more. Some idiots boxed them in at the rocks and dove down to touch them all over. People are stupid....don't be one of them please. I hope this write up of my trip will give you some insight, ideas and general info you will need if you stay here. If my body can handle the flights, I will definitely stay here again. Amazing island and amazing resort. Thanks Sheraton for a wonderful vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Super Location”
Reviews.Author: stl82
Reviews.Content: My wife, and my son and his family stayed for 5 nights in June, prior to moving to the Westin Villas for a week. We had made the reservation many months ago using our Starwood points. We arrived a little after the rush of check-ins because we were delayed at the airport for awhile (my problem, not the airline or airport). So when we arrived at about 5:30, there was only one person ahead us for check-in. Check-in went great, everything was in order. I like the way the desk clerk personally escorts you to the bell stand. No chance to get lost or have a misunderstanding about where the room is located. While checking in we were offered an upgrade to an ocean front room (I think that is what it is called). Man, I am glad we decided to pay the extra. We had a room on the 4th floor of building 6 - looking right out on the ocean. We enjoyed the sunset while enjoying a drink on our lanai. Worth every penny of the upgrade. My son checked in a day after we did, and he got a room in the same building (first floor) at no extra cost. Talk about being friendly to the customer. Building 6 does have a couple of good and bad features. It very close ot the exercise room which was great. It has its own parking lot which is convenient, but it is too small to accommodate all of the cars. So people were parking in no parking areas, along the drive, etc. I noticed that these all had notes on them every morning but I didn't hear anything about cars being towed. Guess we were lucky as we found a spot every time. The downside is that Building 6 is located a good long walk from everything else. Up (or down) an elevator in Bldg 6, across a "breezeway," up an elevator, a long walk through another building, done an elevator and finally you are on ground level, near the pool. But -- the view we had was worth the extra walk. The room was good - nice bed, nice size, good lanai. Bathroom was ver nice, large, clean. No wireless Internet but the wired Internet was fine. The only complaint is that the chaise lounge in the room was the most uncomfortable chair I have ever sat in. Added some pillows and cushions from other chairs to make it usable. We ate the outside "Dive Bar" (I guess rather than "dive" bar) several times. Food was always good and service excellent. We had appetizers and drinks one night at the inside bar. Again good. Prices were a bit high but not so bad when comparing to other top resorts. For example, a Manhattan was $10, and they Maker's Mark bourbon. I only had breakfast at the indoor dining room. At $28 it was pricey but there was a great selection of fruit, juices, eggs and all of the other items expected on a buffet. A really great diversion during our stay was a tour of the kitchen followed by a cooking demonstration. We met the executive chef by the main dining room and were lead throughout the entire kitchen. Everything was open to us - all of the walk-in freezers and refrigerators, all areas of food preparation, the storage area where incoming food is stored,the staff cafe. We toured entire facility while the chef explained how everything worked. Then we moved to the on-site Japanese restaurant where the sous chef prepared fish, vegetables, etc in a cooking demonstration. Everyone there got plenty to eat. There was also a large display of local fruit which the chef discussed then provided samples for all to taste, plus we could take whatever fruit we wanted. All of this in about an hour at no cost! If you are at all interested in cooking or eating, this tour is worth it. The tours occurs a couple of days a week (I think) and you do not need to make reservations. One last comment. Like many others have said, the location within walking distance of Whaler's Village was great. We ate several times there (at the Hula Grill and Leilani's mainly, my wife and daughter-in-law had a bad experience at Cane and Taro). We found all of the staff to pleasant and helpful. The calls for the time share presentations were a little annoying but those who called were very nice. We did get a couple of shopping bags and boxes of candy plus a nice bag/backpack thing that came in very handy. I would not hesitate to return to the Sheraton or to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in the Lahaina area!”
Reviews.Author: the_ambler_rambler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here on my Honeymoon. This is an absolutely beautiful property, I couldn't think of a better Honeymoon location. All staff was fantastic, and we experienced nothing but first rate service throughout the duration of our stay. As far as our room, we had a great view, everything was very comfortable. The room was very clean. Also, very reasonable valet parking prices. Some of the bathroom fixtures seemed a little old/outdated, but nothing major. No free wireless high speed internet... :(. There is a great pathway that leads from the resort past the other nearby resorts as well as Whaler's Village. This makes for plenty of dining and shopping options for just about any budget. Finally, be sure to catch the torch lighting ceremony!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, but watch out for the fees!”
Reviews.Author: justinmelissa
Reviews.Content: Okay, this place would get five stars if it hadn't been for a big money error made during our stay. We had booked the cheapest room and already paid for it, not thinking we would be in the room that much. But when we got there they offered us an upgrade to the oceanfront room for only $50 extra dollars a night and we took it and gladly! So I gave her my card and signed the receipt. And it was worth it, the room was right there by the water, absolutely gorgeous. The employees were extremely friendly too. But the next day, my husband saw on our bank account that the hotel had charged us $1500 we kind of freaked out, since that was almost all we had in our account! The woman at the front desk was very blase about it, and told us that, because of our charge the previous night, the system assumed that we would be spending an average of $250 a day at the resort and put a hold on our card for the week's amount. We were stunned and told her we wanted the hold taken off, so she went and talked to the manager and came out and told us he was going to send our bank the paperwork to reverse the charges. To make a long story short, after many attempts at talking to the manager when our money still wasn't back in our account, we finally were able to talk to the guest services manager who was very friendly and the first person to actually be apologetic about the whole thing. She resent the paperwork just to be safe, gave us breakfast vouchers and a comped dinner. Our money finally showed up again, and we were able to continue our vacation. But the Sheraton really failed in customer service here. If we didn't have a little bit of money in my husband's business account, we would have had $15 to last us two and a half days in Maui. But the good parts: Great rooms, wonderfully comfy beds and pillows, amazing pool, beautiful beach.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, comfortable, wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: smolarjo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 8 glorious days at the Sheraton Maui. Checkin was fast, and staff was very friendly, helpful and courteous. We had a deluxe ocean view room which was awesome. Room was not luxurious, but was more than adequate. Coffee maker does not make good coffee however, but that's a tiny issue. You have a fridge and microwave in the room as well. Would love to be there when the whales are around as the lanai provided a gorgeous view of the Pacific with Molokai on the horizon. Really lovely sunsets! The beach is very wide, surf is minimal, water is WARM! We spent our time at the pool closest to Black Rock. This side is the "adult pool" Special thanks to Patrick at the pool, who made us feel at home, and provided suggestions for our stay on the island. Also thanks to Pono (spelling?), who's father happens to be the executive chef at the resort. My daughter did a night dive, the SCUBA staff was very knowledgeable Many sea turtles can be seen around Black Rock, the dive was well worth it. I would love to make a return trip to Maui and would definitely come back to the Sheraton Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, smaller sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: 5_OClock_Somewhere11
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel right on Black Rock as amazing. I bought some snorkeling gear at the grocery store down the street and saw more fish here than I did at Molikini. This hotel was built a long time ago, so the rooms are on the smaller size. I believe our ocean-front room was only 320 sq. ft. If I had to do it over, I would probably go with Building 6 and get the larger rooms, even though it is farther away. Try to get free breakfast included. Breakfast buffet is good for free, but way too expensive if you have to pay. Hotel had no nightlife when we were there, so be prepared to head back to room by 9pm.

Reviews.Title: “One of my best trips yet”
Reviews.Author: legs22
Reviews.Content: I have traveled through some of Europe and throughout the USA, however, the Sheraton Maui will rate above all of the places that I have stayed. I initially was very concerned about arriving to the Sheraton Maui due to having booked this trip all on my own, photos always tend to be perfect compared to the actual place. The only way to describe the Sheraton Maui was that in person it was even better than the photographs and the reviews! The hotel was beautifully maintained and in a great location to the beach and local shopping. The dining was good. The housekeepers were phenomenal at keeping the room perfect day in and day out, the front desk personnel were extremely friendly and helpful, however, one employee, Corey Mount in valet, went above the rest. Not only did he always have a smile on his face, he was personable and had impeccable manners, always addressing me by name, assisting me with finding 'local' places to eat, where to get snorkel equipment on a budget, and where to take surf lessons as a few examples. He made me feel like I was a millionaire walking through the Sheraton Maui on two dollar budget. I had a long list of things I wanted to do in Maui and with much assistance from Corey Mount I can say I did everything I wanted to while in Maui. I can guarantee that I will return to the Sheraton Maui in the near future and I have already recommended this resort to many friends and family. I can't imagine anyone being disappointed with this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Maui. I love Maui xoxo”
Reviews.Author: lizzyjbeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 12/6/11-16/6/11 with free room upgrade. Beutiful landscaped gardens. Top location next to black rock and short stroll to Whalers Villiage (no need to use local trolley/bus). Lovely clean room with partial ocean view. Comfy beds. Free in room safe. Large flat screen tv. We hired a car which was very useful unless you just want to stay at your resort. We attempted the 'Road to Hana", got half way and turned back. Not worth the trip, can be dangerous, we hired a mustang which was quite big for the road size. Even locals say it isnt worth it!!! We did lots of snorkling just off the beach and saw lots of different colourful fish and turtles. Go parasailing, amazing time and views of the island. The restaurants in Whalers Villiage are amazing - try Opah or moonfish at Hula Grill, it will melt in your mouth! We did not eat at the Sheraton due to price and menu choices. Lahaina town has great shopping and restaurants. Drive to see the oceanside blowhole heading north on the island, bit of a hike but worth it. Maui is beauiful, so much better than Waikiki. We even saw a night time rainbow which was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Kroos2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 5 yr anniversary with our 2 kids. It was ok, the location was good if you aren't there for the big waves but prefer to snorkel. Black rock is pretty but overall the Sheraton doesn't even come close to comparing to the hyatt, which is where we stayed for our honeymoon. Everything at the Sheraton including bars, pool, hottub close at 9. Very disappointing! There is even a poolside bar that closes at 4???? I thought that had to be a joke but no! The service was acceptable but the only place it was great was reppanyaki dans and our last day at the breakfast buffet we had a great server who informed us about the kids eating all day for $20, would have been nice if the front desk would have told us that when we checked in since we were there for 9 days! My last complaint is they are trying to sell timeshares now. They call from the front desk and say they have a gift for you and when you get there they give you a crappybag or a $3 box of chocolates and try to get you o go on the timeshare tour... Why waste any of your time in such a beautiful place listening to a time share presentation??

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel-few issues honest review”
Reviews.Author: dsprice03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here June 4-12 2011.We stayed in room 4409 We had been to Maui before and stayed at the Whaler. Check-in-- pretty quick and friendly. I do have an issue with the upgrade issue. Why do some people get a free upgrade offered at check in and some have to pay an extra 200.00 plus dollars for a better view??? I know they do give them free because people are constantly talking about it on Trip Advisor reviews!! It was obvious that the hotel was only partially booked and and had tons of empty rooms. I even asked. I think it is very unfair to just give it to some and make others pay for it. Upgraded room had awesome view but was kinda run down. Carpet was dirty. Just not what I expected for the price per night at the Sheraton. Bed was fine-so was bathroom. Buffet for breakfast was ok but not worth 27.00 per person. Conceirges were very helpful and friendly. So were all the staff we ran into. Pool was really really nice and of course there is no other beach better than the area there at Black Rock. Room was cleaned everyday and fresh towels left. This is a good solid hotel. But its not up to the price per night. and then to add 25.00 resort fee a night. Went Zip lining in Kapalua- had a great time. Very fun and safe. Went ATV trip with Waterslide- not really atv (you just drive up a mountain) and too cold on top of mountain to do the waterslide. Went to other side of island to Mendez Ranch to horseback ride- ride and views were incredible but you have to hope you get a good horse. (i did not). If you get a good horse you will have an amazing ride. Extra note- YOU MUST TRY CHESSEBURGER IN PARADISE IN LAHAINA FOR BREAKFAST-THE VERY BEST AND ABOUT $20.00 for 2 people DRUMS OF THE PACIFIC LUAU AT MARRIOTT BUBBA GUMP RESTAURANT IN LAHAINA- GREAT FOOD AND REASONABLE PRICES My husband and i are very active and are 56 and 52.

Reviews.Title: “Additional Charges are Ridiculous! DO NOT GO TO THE EAST PART OF MAUI!!!”
Reviews.Author: carm99
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best views and location, but the additional charages are over done. They will charge you extra for a beach lounge chair, for lounging in a "special" area of the hotel, and $15 if you loose your beach towel card. They will treat you differently, better or worse, depending on which room you stay in. We stayed in the nicer area of the resort, so we were only treated badly until they found out our room number (I hate to imagine the experience others would have with an average room). Also, they will put holds on your account if you charge anything to your room account. For example, if you buy a $10 drink it is times by the number of days you are staying there, so $10 x 7 days = a $70 hold on your account. We payed for our activities through the resort and they held nearly $5,000 on our bank account. Thank goodness we found this out before we went out on the town! Another side note- DO NOT GO TO THE EAST PART OF MAUI!!! This would be a big mistake if you do go to the other end of the island. The road to Hana is very dangerous because it is a one lane road that is used as a two lane. Not to mention it is on the side of a cliff. There are around 47 one lane bridges and it will take 3 to 4 hours to get off the curvely road from hell!!!

Reviews.Title: “This is the best resort, we've been here about 5 times & we're going back 8/25/11”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoNative60
Reviews.Content: Beautiful pool & beach location! get a room with breakfast included. Whalers Village is within walking distance. You can take the bus (looks more like an open trolley) to Lahina, no need to rent a car. Watch the torch lighting nightly while you watch the sunset & sip your favorite libation. Swim with the turtles, buy a cheep raft by the pool, just enjoy. We have been going to Maui every year for our Anniversary, this August will be our 20th. This is our favorite Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: Curiosity007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in June, 2011. It's a solid hotel/resort, and you definitely feel like your in Maui when your staying here. They have their own Luau so you don't have to go somewhere else, if you want to do that sort of thing. It's a good location for beach goers etc and within walking distance of whaler's village and within a few minutes by car to Lahaina. The concierge recommended a perfect restaurant for my 13th anniversary (Merriman's), and the following day they recommended Lahaina grill (both were wonderful). Aspects of my stay that kept it from a 5 star. I had booked a room that was ocean front which had the description of having a lanai with chairs and a table (so you can sit and watch the sunset etc), and I had asked a first floor room. When I had arrived they gave us a room on the highest floor with no Lanai, and the room was like a closet. I was able to get another room (I had to pay an extra 50 a night to do this) that had what I wanted. Not the end of the world but was not what I had booked. The new room I had was perfect for me, in an area of the hotel called Hale Moana, which had beautiful views and was away from all the activity of the pool etc, but was a significant walk from the front of the hotel (which I loved but others may find it a bother). Furthermore, it had its own parking lot (a huge bonus). Ok this may sound like a nickpicky but both rooms they had given me had a lot of chips from the furniture. Everything had chips, the chairs, drawers, lamps etc, and they just looked old and used, and for $400+ a night I would have expected better furniture. I guess the linens were good (which is probably more important then the furniture). One more thing that was a little against what they indicated that was included in the booking was they had free internet, however it was only available in "hotspots", not in our room. This ended up being fine since one of the hotspots had an incredible near 360 view of the area with a nice breeze so it was ok to leave the room for that particular hotspot.

Reviews.Title: “Good times.”
Reviews.Author: nikonkell
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sheraton Maui Resort Kaâ€™anapali in June 2011. We booked a resort view room through Expedia at a decent rate. When we arrived I asked if there were any upgrades available. I usually donâ€™t ask, but I decided to. The lady upgraded us to a partial ocean view for free. Once we got to the room I must say we were a bit disappointed, first of all the room was quite small especially for being a partial ocean view which most people would have paid more for. The balcony/lanai was not even a balcony. It was a foot wide, just enough to stand on and there were no chairs or table. We were very disappointed since we love to sit out there and eat breakfast and read etc... That night we decided we were going to ask if there were any rooms with a large balcony, we werenâ€™t looking for a free upgrade, just an equivalent room with a bigger balcony. The lady at the front desk looked and looked and finally said she could get us an ocean view room that was 100 sqft larger with a balcony at no charge. The only thing was we couldnâ€™t go into the new room until the next day. We were very pleased with this. So the next day they called our cell phone around 10:00am and said the room was ready. We got to the new room and letâ€™s just say we were very happy and that we were impressed with the Sheraton at this point. The room was much nicer and larger, the balcony was perfect. The view was awesome! To say the least they had hooked us up and done us right and we werenâ€™t complaining or anything, just looking for a better balcony. The room came with an HD-TV and HD service, a small fridge and Internet. Of course you pay a $25 resort fee, but the Internet and self parking was included in that so that wasnâ€™t so bad. The pool and hotel grounds were beautiful. They had free floating bean bags that you could use in the pool, they were first come first serve. The food at the pool was very expensive. The waitress came by the pool and asked if we wanted food, we looked at the menu and it was Taco Tuesday, two tacos and a beer for $18.00 Not my idea of a good deal or a Taco Tuesday deal. We walked to Hula Grill and had lunch. The pool area had nice lounge chairs with pads and large Palapa type umbrellas. They need to get more of the umbrellas since people were dieing to get in the shade often. The beach is great, lotâ€™s of people, but not too crowded. Overall, we were very pleased with the hotel. The rooms could have had a little more of the Hawaiian feel to them, but overall a very nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: RiveriaMaya
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed at the Maui, Sherton Resort the resort is nice but not over the top, no extra perks. Why you would want to stay there is because of location, you have the cliff diver every night. The beach is good you can swim with the turtles and see beautiful fish right off the beach. No night life or entertainment you have to drive or walk (short walk up the beach to Wharlers Village where there are shops and restaurants. They have great happy hour specials, where the hotel is very expensive to eat and drink. The perk of this hotel is just the location, you wouldn't have to rent a car if you did't want to, Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Relax and be happy”
Reviews.Author: bella1999
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at Sheraton Maui, Very relaxing, food was great, loved our walks along the beach. Loved going into town Lahania.

Reviews.Title: “Very tired resort in need of a spruce-up”
Reviews.Author: canadiantraveler50
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel for a week-end get-a-way with my partner of 10 years. We had trouble finding the hotel, very poor signage, only since I had been in Maui before did I know where the general area was. We had arranged a suite, as we celebrating 10 years together but as we arrived early no room and by the time we got into the room, very disappointed with the view, ocean view? only if you stood on the bed on tiptoes to see over the walls. Air/con was not working, guest services very slow and unresponsive to our requests for a room with working a/c or at least a better room. The restaurants had poor choices for vegetarians and even thou we mentioned in our reservation we were celebrating our anniversity, no acknowlegement from Sheraton. We are 10 year SPG members and it was the first time we have been treated this way. The resort itself need an update and some fresh ideas on customer service. In spite of all this we are still loyal SPG members and will continue to stay at Sheraton etc as this is one of the great reward programs.

Reviews.Title: “Found it a bit disappointing unfortunately although we would go there again.”
Reviews.Author: francesrose
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here with my husband about 20 years ago and having such happy memories of the resort and the friendliness of the staff I was only too happy to recommend it to an American friend when we decided to have "girls only" holiday as neither of our husbands is now able to travel. The long trip from Australia meant that I was fairly tired when I arrived and I was dismayed to find the attitude of the staff was pretty offhand and disinterested when I booked in. They were too busy having conversations amongst themselves to worry about some old lady who was almost ready to collapse after 28 hours of travel to get there. Of course, they didn't know all that but they sure weren't interested! The room was fine and the beds very comfortable but the cleaning service was very erratic. Some days we were almost hunted out of the room in the morning, other days no cleaning occurred until late afternoon, and one day no cleaning occurred at all. No clean towels, no sign of a visit from cleaning staff so we had to ask for someone to come. This was not met with much interest and we got clean towels but that's all. It would not be my first choice to stay there again and I am very disappointed as it was my friend's first visit to Maui and I had expected it to be better. On the first night we were there we needed somewhere to eat so we just went to the restaurant at the Sheraton and were somewhat taken aback at the prices!! Next day we discovered Leilani's on the beach and were so well treated by all the lovely staff there we went every night of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “First SPG Property which doesn't Follow any SPG Rules”
Reviews.Author: TorontoRocky
Reviews.Content: I have been a SPG Platinum member for 10+ years and have never been to any location worldwide including Honolulu where I was not treated according to the rules and beyond. This property was quite disappointing as room upgrades were disgusting, staff was very tough and what surprised me the most was when I asked for a 4pm checkout and was denied. I was told that it was based upon the availability. I have never heard that before and some of the SPG properties have actually accomodated me until 6pm as a courtsey if I ever had a late night flight. Most of the rooms have limited views and I recommend there sister property Westin next doors. This is my first negative review of a SPG propert in 10 years:-(

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Jekka_1
Reviews.Content: I wanted to comment on the pool attendant. note I forwarded to Sheraton.. I really wanted to reach out and send a quick note regarding one of your outstanding employees, Patrick Petersen. Patrick is such a great part of your team. He goes above and beyond in accommodating the pool guests and he has such a great rapport with everyone. Patrick definitely kicked our experience at the Sheraton up a few notches. Many thanks to this great hire!

Reviews.Title: “Stay next door unless you like to be treated like cattle.”
Reviews.Author: UkBobsgirl
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel, but we were treated like cattle even though we are members of the hotel chain frequent guest program. We had no help when requested, the staff were surly, everything is additional charges, food and drink were way overpriced, waitstaff were ignoring us, kept coming up with 'out of stock' of all of the reasonable priced wines to the point of being ridiculous. I even had to ask TWICE to just get the candle lit on our table. There is an important concept in the service industry: Essential nonessentials, and this place has missed the boat on all counts. We stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel the week before, and we felt welcome and as if they wanted us to come back to their property. Everyone had a genuine smil as if they loved their workplace. The KBH understands their customers are on holiday and want to be treated with respect and care. So for less money and a better holiday, we will return to the KBH, NOT the Sheraton Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amirjali
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, well kept property overall. Pool was also nice, right on the beach. Luau was great. Parking was the only thing that was a pain. Our building was close to the "Black Rock" which is on the northeast side of the property and the hotel has only one garage which is on the southeast side of the property. But overall, hotel was great. There is a walking/running trail which can be accessed from the backside of the property by the tennis courts and it runs along the beach! Great for morning runners.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down best spot on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: cheber
Reviews.Content: Just spent ten days at this resort and loved it. This was our third time staying here in the past 12 years. The great news is: very little has changed in that time. It's just as good now as it was the first time in 2000. We stayed in Building 6 which features magnificent ocean front views. Saw turtles swimming outside our balcony almost every morning as well as the occasional pod of dolphins. By Maui standards, it's reasonably priced for a full service hotel. Tried several of the restaurants and all were good - the breakfast buffet being the highlight. Lot's of other good restaurants within an easy stroll along the beach plus only three miles from Lahaina where there are plenty more places to eat. Tons of activities right nearby including Golf (two courses), Scuba, Cruises, Jet-Skiing, Para-sailing and Zip-lining (most of which we did). But, when you're in Maui, it's all about the beach and this place has the best beach by far on the island. Large private sand beach, framed by the famed Black Rock, and one of the best spots for snorkeling in Hawaii. Within just a few feet of the shore, you can find Rays, Sharks, Turtles, Eels and a wide variety of tropical fish. We took a Snorkel cruise during out stay and saw nothing that could compare what we had right under our noses at the Black Rock beach. If you're looking for an ultramodern, high-end, five-star resort, head for Wailea and prepare to empty your wallet. If you want the essence of a great Maui vacation, try the Sheraton. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveler123451
Reviews.Content: Our family went for our 4th visit to the Westin Ocean Villa Resorts, which we really love to do. Since the Sheraton is a sister property, and they had a good dinner deals at the Sheraton, we decided to try the Sheraton Steak and Fish House. Our waitress was great, great setting and the seafood dishes were pretty good. However, my wife had one of the worse steaks she ever had. Probably should stay away from steak there. She should have sent it back. The bizarreness began when trying to get my car. I had to go to the front desk to pay for the parking. I was literally in line for 30 minutes to retrieve my car with no end in sight, since they had one night person that was either really slow or dealing with lots of problems. I would still be there I think if my wife did not go to the parking desk, that took pity on us. At one point, a manager type came out to help someone with a problem, and when she was done, I said I have been waiting 20 minutes just to pay for my car. She literally turned around and ignored me. A real cold shoulder. Any rate, I am Starwood Gold and stay at Starwood hotels, but will never step into that Sheraton again for any reason. We had also planned to try another restaurant at that Sheraton, but cancelled. Normally I would not publically complain, but when a manager just ignores you and leaves you to rot in a slow, slow line with one desk clerk, I think that is worthy of a public comment. That shows there is something not right at this hotel in my mind. This is the first Starwood property where I would never stay. Compared to the Westin just down the road, the difference is dramatic. Frankly, the place looks like it should be torn down and rebuilt.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking Grounds! Amazing Value!”
Reviews.Author: PhDAndie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 8 nights at the Sheraton Maui and from start to finish the whole experience was amazing. First off, the Travelocity package rates for this 4* property were actually cheaper than the 3* condos and hotels in the area. When you subtract what we would have spent on a flight alone, the room ended up costing $125 per night. Can't beat that in Ka'anapali! Upon check-in we were offered a free upgrade from the most basic resort view room to a Deluxe Ocean View room in building 5. The room was spacious and immaculately clean, the furniture looked like it had been recently updated, and the view was amazing! Microwave and fridge came in handy for making breakfast to enjoy in the lanai. As other travelers have noted, this room is not close to the lobby - but who goes on vacation to spend time in the lobby? Our room was essentially on top of Black Rock and a 30 second elevator ride from the beautiful winding pool (it is not just a square watering hole like most of the hotels on the Ka'anapali strip). No the pool is not heated - but it gets ridiculously hot in Maui and I appreciated being able to cool off! The resort grounds were absolutely stunning. The public beach directly in front of the hotel was crowded on weekends, however, we were able to walk 5 minutes to the other side of black rock and avoid the crowds (and still see lots of fish snorkeling). Whaler's village was a convenient ten minute walk, and a great spot for happy hour! The hotel shuttle was air conditioned, always on time, and a great option for getting into Lahaina. My only complaints (and these are very minor) are: (1) It can be hard to get a spot at the pool because guests put their towels on the beach chairs in the morning and then don't come back until the afternoon. This is against the hotel's stated policy and the staff really should be cracking down on it! (2) There are no reasonably priced food options on site, however that was to be expected. We did eat and drink at the Mai Tai Bar and the Cliff Dive Bar a few times and the food and drinks were quite good but at $10 per drink and $16 for a sandwich it's not something we could afford to do every day. Having walked through several of the resorts on both the North and South sides of Black Rock, I definitely feel that we got great value for our money here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, ask questions at check in to ensure the best room for you”
Reviews.Author: mccallister88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton for a week. We booked the resort view to save on cost and, as the other reviews stated, were told we got the free room upgrade at check-in to a deluxe oceanview. Two things to keep in mind: when you book through sites like Travelocity, you are not promised and cannot request a particular type of bed. We were told it would be two double beds whether we took the upgrade or kept our original resort view. If a king bed is important to you, book through the Sheraton site, though you'll pay a lot more money. Second, when they offer the upgrade, ask questions and don't be afraid to make requests or refuse the upgrade. We were given a room on the ground floor at upgrade, which I did not want as it offers no view of the ocean. I asked if there was anything on another floor, and was given a 3rd floor room, which we were satisfied with. Upgrade rooms are a bit larger and are also right behind where the hotel's luau takes place - fairly noisy, but over early (from 5ish-9 pm) and appears to take place only twice per week. If you go out to dinner and take a walk, it's not even a factor. Huge, beautiful resort grounds, rooms could use some updating, but were not bad by any means. Housekeeping does okay, not great, but sufficient. We ignored the "free gift" messages on our phone as we knew it was a time share presentation ploy. If whale watching is important to you during whale season, go with a hotel with more floors, like Royal lahaina or The Whaler. Snorkeling here is fantastic, but crowded. We swam with 6 giant sea turtles every time we went out! Walking distance to Whaler's Village so you don't have to deal with parking - a big plus. Starbucks stand in the lobby in the mornings- another big plus! Overall we were pleased with our stay and with the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mybeau
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five night stay. The location is exceptional. Easy access awaits you to the beach, pool, Whaler's. The service we experienced was also exceptional and the staff friendly. Loved the Cliff Dive Bar, music, sunset, cliff diver and the Maui Mojito. The hotel grounds, pool, bar area are very well maintained. Our room (first floor Bldg 4) was just fine. We also enjoyed a room upgrade. Mahalo, Sheraton. We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Ok I'm returning! Woooohoooo”
Reviews.Author: Marene
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton in Jan 2009 and absolutely adored the resort....loved the staff, pools, room and views so much that I have made many recommendations to friends and colleagues and many have traveled over to experience the Maui Sheraton. Today I just booked my return for Jan 2012 and although it is a long way away....I could just burst! The gardens, the views, the pools, the free shuttle into town, the snorkeling, the proximity to Whalers village, the wonderful ' happy hours' watching the sunset and the cliff top diving...you are right there! I have traveled to Maui many many times but this is the best!!! To read the reviews now and hear the upgrades will be completed in Dec...I just can't wait!! See you on the 7th.....I can't wait!!

Reviews.Title: “I love the location.”
Reviews.Author: luvallhawaii
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Sheraton Maui. I was not thrilled with my last stay but decided to give it another go as I really like the location, it suits me well for how I vacation in Maui. The service at the Sheraton was very good throughout my trip. (Claudia and Tonya at the Mai Tai bar are really great.) It seemed to me like the service was improved from my last stay. Many people comment on how expensive food or drinks are at the Sheraton and other places in Maui, etc. First of all, it's Hawaii, things cost more. Second of all, I paid fairly close to the same for the food and drinks I had in Maui as I would at home when going out to decent places. I plan for all costs when planning for my trip, so I guess it's no big deal to me. I think it depends on how you vacation. I say don't worry about it and just relax and have fun. However, I will admit that I don't love the resort fee being a separate charge, I would prefer if it was worked into the cost of the room. (And Sheraton, if you read this, no need to tell me what's included, I already know. I just don't like how it's separate; tuck it into the cost of the room!) The room was clean and the grounds are very nice. The rooms are in need of refreshing. Not terrible by any stretch, they just seem ready for some sprucing up, they look a little tired. I booked an ocean view room and was upgraded to an ocean front room in building 6. The view was amazing, especially the sunset. If you like to sit on the lanai sometimes and just take it all in and relax, it's perfect. It is a bit of a trek from the lobby, the beach or the pool to building 6, (three elevators later) but the payoff is the view and how serene it is. I was on the ground floor and for future visits, I wouldn't stay on the ground floor, you have a little less privacy and traveling solo, I would prefer to be on a higher floor for safety reasons. I really enjoyed my stay, met some really nice people and had a very relaxing vacation at the Sheraton. I plan stay there again on my next trip to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great time...”
Reviews.Author: Love_the_Beach088
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to the Sheraton Maui of the memorial day holiday. We got a great deal on vacation though Orbitzs so we did not have high expectations given the great deal and some of the review on trip advisor. However, I must say this was a great vacation and cannot think of one thing to complain about. 1. Check in was great, quick and easy and recieved a wonderful view of ocean and king sized bed (what we had booked) it had a small balcony but was fine for two people. 2. The room looked just like the website, clean and had everything you needed. Also the mini refrigerator was larger than I thought had and room for snacks, water, soda, etc They provide shampoo, conditioner, body wash, loofa, lotion. The was always cleaned and tidy by the time we came back from the pool 3. Service - was great everyone was helpful. We asked for extra pillows and they delivered them to our room in 5 mins. We ordered room service twice and both times came quickly. 4. Beach/Pool - This was the best part of the resort!! The pool was big and clean and had two sections connected by a lazy river, which was fun to float on with the bean bags. (they have these floating bean bags which were fun and comfortable). The drink service was great and checked on us regularly. The beach in front of the Sheraton was best part of the Kaanapali beach. It was wide with clear water and the snorkleing was great around Black Rock. I had no issue with the towel cards that some have complained about. Also, I saw on Trip advisor alot of people complain about the wrist bands they ask you to wear around the pool however given that Black is so popular they had to find away to "police" non guests from just walking up and using the pool/chairs. I must rather wear a wrist band but have a chair and service around the pool area and the workers were very nice and professional when they apporach you to wear a wrist band. Also, had a message at the spa and it was THE BEST one I have ever had. This was a great place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort and excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Medicjch
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort! I cannot imagine staying anywhere else! Our room was not ready when we arrived, but the front desk gave us drink coupons and a discount for lunch to apologize for the wait. I wasn't expecting anything so I thought the gesture was very nice and set a good tone for the remainder of the trip. We had a room right next to the elevator and I thought the sound might be a problem, but we loved the view from the room, so we decided to give it try for a night. While we would hear the elevator during the day, it was not a problem at night. The room was very comfortable. We ate the breakfest buffet almost every morning and we thought that it was good. We ate lunch at both pool bars and the food was good.......I would recommend the pork tacos! Even though the drinks from the pool bars were a little expensive......they were really good! Snorkeling at Black Rock was AWESOME! I saw sea turtles almost every day. All of the staff that we encountered were friendly and helpful! This is a large resort, so the walk to the parking garage can be long, especially after a long day, but if it is that big of a deal, just use the valet. Overall, we simply loved our stay here and will return in the future. While this was a trip without the kids, I would have no problem staying here with our kids (and we probably will).

Reviews.Title: “Loved our Stay”
Reviews.Author: teera12
Reviews.Content: It's always a bit unsettling booking a hotel based on internet photos and so we rely heavily on traveler reviews too, therefore I had to throw in my two cents here. We were SOOO satisfied with the Sheraton. Could not have asked for a better location (beaches on both sides of black rock were beautiful and great for long walks in the cool early mornings and evenings). It's a short walk to Whalers village and other nearby restaurants. Every hotel employee we passed had a friendly smile and greeting which I really appreciated. The hotel feels very spacious and set back from the beach a bit and didn't feel cramped, crowded or claustrophic like some of the other hotels we passed. Yes, the water pressure was weaker and the room decor was a bit old fashioned but that didn't bother us at all. They didn't have a king sized bed room available when we checked in but we checked back with the front desk after the second night and were able to move (even got an upgrade to partial ocean view). Can't comment on any nightlife since we never adjusted to the time zone change and were asleep by 8pm anyways : ) If I ever get a change to return to Maui I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - not sure why there are so many complaints”
Reviews.Author: lcinva
Reviews.Content: We are frequent travelers, and at the 4 and 5* level have stayed in much less nice hotels than less. Maybe people paid rack rate and that's why they're mad? We got a great deal on priceline and we definitely got our money's worth. Very nice hotel - definitely sprawling, and if you are staying in one of the outer buildings it might be a 5 min walk to the lobby or something. I cannot believe people are complaining about this. Have Americans gotten so lazy/fat a 5 min walk is worth bashing a hotel over? In our particular building (3), we had no problems with the shower, furnishings, or loud neighbors. Felt like the two of us had plenty of space...and we came because I am 7 months pregnant with our first child. The bathroom wasn't too small for me and my belly. Haha. Funny that during our stays in both Maui and Kauai where we did plenty of snorkeling, the best snorkeling was at Black Rock right outside the hotel. Definitely more crowded mid-day, but we went sometimes multiple times a day and it never felt TOO crowded. We brought our own snorkeling gear so I can't speak to rental rates. All of the employees were super helpful and kind. One of the concierges in particular was really helpful at giving me a running route. It was a great six mile run along the ocean to go from the Sheraton to Lahaina and back on the beach path and then through some parks. I guess it is a quiet hotel at night...but aren't people in Hawaii to relax? Go to Lahaina or one of the other towns for nightlife. Even Whaler's village right down the beach path has stuff going on at night. I'm not sure what people expect the hotel to provide after 7 or 8pm at night other than a restaurant for dinner, but we liked being able to relax in our room if we had a long day out doing stuff without tons of noise or lots of parties. Didn't eat at the restaurants so I can't comment on quality...I always laugh at people who complain about hotel food prices. Seriously? EVERY hotel is going to have super overpriced food. That's why you eat out in town, or go to the grocery store beforehand at least for breakfast and snack foods. If you are going to be non-adventurous, or at least lazy enough to stay put at the hotel the ENTIRE TIME, then yes - plan on paying a premium for convenience. Speaking of, we didn't find any restaurants we would particularly recommend...but we also aren't big on chowing down either. Lots of times we ate fruit for dinner. The only thing I could complain about would be the internet hookup. At this point, lots of people travel with more portable laptops that don't have ethernet. Since we were paying the resort fee (which i don't have a problem with), it was slightly annoying that the only in-room option for internet was an ethernet hookup, which our iPad didn't have an adapter for. I have to believe many travelers at this point would be in the same position. More widespread wifi would be preferable. That being said, at least there was free wifi in the lobby which was fine....it's not like we're in Maui to be online all day. Overall, great stay. Don't be hesitant to stay here. Had I paid rack rate I might just be satisfied instead of impressed, but still a nice hotel. And, who even pays rack rate anymore anyway? Also, great pool. I think the best on Kaanapali from what I could see on my run.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Black Rock Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: jvllo
Reviews.Content: Let me first start with The Spa at Black Rock. Heather, the receptionist is the ultimate professional, and a beautiful hostess. We so enjoyed visiting with her prior to our treatments. She is definately an asset to an already class establishment. Chaka was my therapist, and she was EXCELLENT. I generally get 3 or 4 massages a month due to neck and back issues, and her treatment was as good if not better than "master body workers" here at home. The folks at the pool stand providing towels were so very nice and friendly too. Love the sun products they sell there. We had breakfast included with our package, and I so miss my papaya! What a lovely spread and venue for the breakfast buffett. We stayed at the Sheraton in Kauai just after leaving Maui, and there breakfast buffett sucked compared to Sheraton Black Rock. There was some sort of entertainment each evening around sunset, the photos at sunset from the 3rd floor by reception were awesome! The walkway that runs near the beach is a wonderful opportunity for a healthy walk without sand on your feet! I snorkled right off the beach and it was pretty cool. I saw the usual little fish that I enjoy, and also a turtle. All in all we found this to be the best experience in our island hopping vacation. Next time it's Denver to Maui to stay. Three nights here was not enough, and I can't wait to come back. I didn't even have time to get into the pool that winds around through the gardens! Very cool. The golf course right behind (or would it be in front) of the hotel looked really nice too.

Reviews.Title: “A PERFECT Stay!”
Reviews.Author: vaca-shunned
Reviews.Content: -Great location! Certainly the best in Ka'anapali, but maybe the best in Maui. -Fantastic beach right in front of the property (much wider than in front of other major resorts down the beach) -Wonderful snorkeling around black rock. I went snorkeling 6 times and saw at least 1 sea turtle every time! It's like a giant aquarium right out the door (lots of tropical fish around the reef). I also saw a turtle while Stand Up Paddle boarding in front of the resort. -Great pool. Very well done. Amazing landscaping. Didn't feel as crowded as some of the pools at other resorts in the area. -Within walking distance (down a nice walkway along the beach) to many great restaurants, cool shops, and attractions. Though we rented a car and explored the island, one could have an excellent vacation just enjoying things you could walk to or get to by shuttle form the Sheraton. -Excellent staff. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. EVRYONE! All of our needs were met. -Nice room. It was very clean. It had a large comfy bed and great views. We were in building 4. It was sort of far from the lobby, but very close to the beach and pool (plus closer parking by the tennis courts).

Reviews.Title: “Very AVERAGE hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsKaty1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a great part of the beach. However, being a Shearton my expectations were much higher for the hotel rooms. We had a partial ocean view room....very small and dated for the price. The worst part of the room was the bathroom.â€¦ The shower has NO WATER PRESSURE!! I'm sure this is not a big deal for men but women no what im talking about ;). The bathtub is really small as well. I booked the hotel for our wedding/honeymoon. When i went to the front desk to complain about the room...even though they had several rooms avaible to upgrade they wanted $100 upgrade per night for a slighlty bigger still outdated room. Also, we had requested a late check out at 2. They wanted an additonal $200 to check out at this time!! Crazy and on our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “85% great could have been 100% wonderful”
Reviews.Author: glitterwhip
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have written a review but I feel I should because people need to know some particulars when spending a large amount of money on a vacation. The Sheraton was beautiful, the grounds impeccable, very clean, directly on the beach, they upgrade you to a better room for free. The rooms are spacious and clean. The only thing I must comment on about the rooms; the water in the shower runs from warm to cold to hot to cold, not in that order but you get the idea. The rooms have been updated everywhere but the shower, the tile and tub need to be replaced, not bad but you can tell it wasn't updated with everything else. The staff at the self parking garage left alot to be desired. They were very rude and not helpful, if your key didn't work to lift the gate they became very agitated. The front desk staff was very friendly as we had to have 4 sets of keys made because of the parking garage incidents. The pool activites guy we dealt with was Austin a very nice young man. If you want a gazebo by the pool, which is very nice to have, the rent for a full day is $75, Austin was nice enough to inquire about renting for half the day from 1 to 8pm and got us what we wanted for $40, he was extremely nice and great to talk with. The spa was nice, very expensive but if you get 2 treatments you get 10% off of the total. Inga, the massage therapist was phenominal, very basic though, shower, robe, massage room partially open air. A couple things I think people should know. The snorkling is great there when you can get in the water without being right on top of someone. Rent your snorkle gear in Lahaina it is much cheaper, around $10 a day compared to $8 an hour from the resort. We ended up going to a spot the guy at the dive shop suggested, Napili beach it is a public beach but is spread out I had no problem snorkling there, lots of sea turtles and fish, the turtles are very acclamated to people so they will let you swim with them. GO TO Safeway on the way to the resort. Everything is super expensive, we had 2 iced teas, 2 cocktails and an order of pork tacos (2 tacos with chips and a very small cup of salsa), $8 for tip the total was $63!! I am not cheap, in fact I am willing to spend good money on food but this was ridiculous. The breakfast buffet is pricey also $27.95 per person comes with coffee or O.J. I was shocked at the price but was extremely satisfied with the food. They had a full breakfast items from fruits, yogurt, muffins, bagels,bacon, sausage, potatoes, scrambled eggs. Also an omlette station was excellent, the breakfast buffet was great. I had an unbelievable omeltte at Moose McGullicuddys in Lahaina a must try place. While I am on food I will tell you that Cheeseburger in Paradise in a must, right on the water, friendly staff, great Banana smoothie. Leilani's at Whalers village for a nice sit down, white napkin dinner, food was wonderful. The locals swear by the Mixed Plate, there are several locations, local food. It was ok not great, could have skipped it. Of course Hawaii is expensive since everything must be imported in so figure on everything being double what you would pay for it on the Mainland. All in all it was a great trip would love to go back the ocean is wonderful, the scenery is spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “No Wifi in Rooms, though they charge you for internet.”
Reviews.Author: gizm0sm0m
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice, if a bit boring. Full of couples and not much else. I was part of a couple so I didn't feel out of place, but whenever there's too much of a particular demographic I feel it sucks the life out of a hotel. I like to see a mix of kids, families, couples, old folks, teens, etc. We had a resort facing room that we booked on Priceline. The room itself was very nice. Lots of room, comfy beds, totally quiet, nice balcony. The resort grounds were very pretty and we enjoyed lounging by the pool areas. The restaurants were overpriced, but you have so many choices in that area you never have to eat there if you don't want to. The self parking worked out well as there was a lot very close to our building. In and out was easy using the room key. My only major complaint with this hotel is that they charge a $25 a day resort fee for internet/parking yet you can only connect to the internet via a wired connection in the room. We could not connect with any of our wireless devices (ipad, macbook air, phone) and had to sit in the public areas anytime we wanted to connect. That's ok if it's free, but I hated that we were being charged for a service we couldn't use in our room.

Reviews.Title: “I take it back....”
Reviews.Author: spe739
Reviews.Content: Ok ... The hotel made it right. That is what wa important. Changed me room and gave me a little champaign in the room. That's all it took. Now we're both happy and now we're enjoying the best hotel on yhi side o the island... Seriously- it is by far the nicest.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay...”
Reviews.Author: shwi
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in mid-May at the Sheraton Maui resort and had a wonderful time. We booked and paid in advance for a partial ocean view room but when we checked in we were advised we had been upgraded to an oceanfront suite in Building 6 (from memory, room 6111). Hooray! We had asked for an early check-in and when we arrived at around noon, our (upgraded) room was ready to go. The room was huge and had a king sized bed, microwave oven, bar fridge, coffee maker, chaise longue, writing desk and ample wardrobe and drawer space. The bed was so comfortable. We both enjoyed some really decent sleep for the first time in ages. Just to note that whilst we generally had a peaceful stay, I was woken in the early hours once by the couple next door "enjoying" their stay. So perhaps the walls are quite thin. Most days our room was serviced promptly; there was only one day when it wasn't done until late afternoon. Also, if you want turn-down service, you have to specifically request it from the front desk. The bathroom (with separate toilet) was also enormous with double sinks and a shower over a full-size bathtub. Towels and robes were plentiful and comfy, and the toiletries were good. Airconditioning was quiet and effective. It seemed to switch itself off if the sliding door to the lanai was open. The ground level patio (aka lanai) had a round table and two chairs plus a lounger. The lanai opened directly onto a grassed area accessible by other hotel guests so i didn't feel comfortable leaving the sliding door open overnight. The resort itself is enormous and spacious and offers direct beachfront access. The pool winds around the resort and offers a good mix of shallow and deeper parts. The jacuzzi is a bit small for the size of the resort - it would fit just 6 people comfortably. That said, perhaps there's not much call for a jacuzzi in Maui but the weather was quite poor most days we were there so it was nice to warm up after a dip in the ocean. The best part of our stay was swimming with the Green Sea turltes right off Black Rock. The absolute best time to see the turtles is very early morning. Most morning we were out there snorkelling by 7am, if not earlier. We were rewarded by seeing 5 (5!) sea turtles all swimming together just off the point of Black Rock. What beautiful creatures they are. Lots of cool tropical fish too. We hired our snorkel equipment (very good quality) from Maui Dive and Surf in Lahaina ($25 for the week) and they have a concession at Whaler's Village too. Other places charge up to $100 (!) for the week, so choose carefully. We ate breakfast one morning (very expensive, average quality) and ate at the bar one evening (food okay, again quite expensive). Other than that we ate out. The poolside bar made the best mojitos i drank anywhere on Maui or Oahu, and I drank quite a few! Definitely try one. We appreciated the courtesy shuttles around the Kaanapali area and also into Lahaina. They ran quite regularly and saved us lots. We caught a cab home from Lahaina one night and it cost $20 with tip. Smokers note: the smoke-free policy is rigourously policed. The security patrols were frequent, even at our secluded end of the complex. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton Maui and would definitely return. The room was confortable, the staff were friendly and pleasant and the facilities were good. Slight downsides included: - small jacuzzi - grumpy older pool-towel guy (no towel for you!) - being served cocktails and beer poolside in plastic cups. What the?! - the poolside bars close by 8pm and that main bar at 10pm. Um, why?! - similarly, room service closes at 10pm. - it's a long, long walk from building 6 to anywhere! - we didn't find out we could access the Internet free of charge from the hotel library for 45 minutes/day until the day before we left. - it rained every day, but there's not much the Sheraton could do about that! I'd recommend this hotel to anyone seeking some luxurious relaxation in a tropical island paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Best snorkeling on the island right outside the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Hscw
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights at this hotel. Make sure you get an ocean view or ocean front room because the view is great. If you snorkel, make sure you go out around the tip of black rock and way around the other side. We saw eel, a manta ray and lots of turtles. We also watched a dolphin swim off shore. Rent your snorkel gear from an off property company like Boss Frogs which charges $35/week versus $15/day at the hotel. The views up by the fitness room are great for pictures. Make sure you also get a rental car. Check out Front St. for lots of little shops and great places to eat. The hotel is beautiful but the rooms are not great. They are nice and big but they need updating and we had bugs in the bathroom. However, the pool and beach are so good, that we spent very little time in the room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I expected”
Reviews.Author: bullett76
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton was a nice hotel, however the service is not there. All of Hawaii's beaches are public so even though your're right on the beach everyone in their mother is as well. BlackRock is very popular for the snorkeling and swimming with the turtles which was great, but staff go around and give guests wrist bands to know who the correct people are using the pool and stuff, but no one bothered to tell the family of twelve in front of me using the rinse shower which is only meant for guests. I Requested an early checkin, got there at 1, checkin was at 3. Was told the room was not ready. Totally understandable it's only a request. They took my cell number and told me that they would call me as soon as possible. Well by 345 I went to the desk and inquired what was going on and she advised me that the room had been ready and that she did not know why I was not called. She advised me that she would send A BOTTLE of champagne to the room, nice. 1 hour later (2) .49 cent bottles of split of champagne (the small bottles) arrived to the room which were horrible. During our stay housekeeping was sporadic. Some days no soap, or bath mats, other days just decaf coffee and no regular. The evening where we received no soap I contacted the desk and requested some. An hour and a half later I called to see where the soap was and the subject who answered the phone was shocked that it had not arrived. On our 2nd to last night stay the room next to us decided to have a party in their room in which I had to call the hotel's security twice for. I was in the business for some time, and if it came down to guests having multiple problems with a room, the problematic guests were asked to leave. This went on from 8PM til 1am in the morning. I'm not usually one who will write these kind of responses, but this one needed to. The reason being, when I went to check-out in the morning, I was advised that I hoped I enjoyed my stay, and that I would be back. I told her that I did not enjoy my stay and that I would not be back. At that point the clerk should have inquired what went wrong with the guest's stay, and even contact a manager to speak with the guest to see if the complaints were legitimate. All I got was I'm sorry. This is why I would not recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, 45 mins to check in....”
Reviews.Author: Wizard760
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ Sheraton Maui twice before. Also a starwood gold member so I stay at Sheraton brand often. Upon checkin, we were informed there were no more King beds available although that is what I booked. I was told since I used a third party to book I had no guarantee for bedding. I had booked a Partial ocean view king bed. I asked for a manager and was finally placed in a partial ocean view king. Calling this a partial ocean view is one of the most mis-leading statements ever. The opposite side of the hall is ocean front so how can this be partial? By hanging your head 3 feet off the ledge and looking around the corner you can Partially See The Ocean. The room is very bland and white with no water pressure in the shower. The bathroom was set up for midgets with a 3 foot counter. Bad experience all around, be sure to avoid or you will be next

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, disappointed with their service”
Reviews.Author: VanBeachy
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at the Sheraton Maui, so I was definitely impressed with the hotel when I arrived. I want to say that the positives definitely outweighed the negatives, but I was extremely disappointed in their lack of service in a situation. We had bought some groceries to put in our room fridge to help with the cost, as well as have food for when we travelled to the Haleakala Crater. We had left a bag of groceries out on the counter filled with bread, bagels, and munchies. When we woke up at 2:30 am to leave for the crater sunrise, I noticed that our bag of groceries was missing. So, I called the front desk and their response was that there was nothing they can do and if it was housekeeping I should have noticed the day before. My response to that was that we were out exploring the island the whole day and we came back to the hotel and went directly to bed as we had to get up at 2:30 am!! So after some back and forth, she agreed to talk to the manager in the morning and get back to us. So, off we went with empty stomaches and no place open to get food. We returned to the hotel at noon with no message from the manager, so we had to call again. My boyfriend was transferred to a couple of people with a couple of snarky comments like, 'How big was the bag of chips that was missing from the room?'. We finally got talking to someone who was apologetic after we explained to them the story and asked us what we wanted in return. We said that it isn't about the value of the food, it is about the inconvenience of having a bag of food mistakenly taken from our room, having to deal with this sort of conflict on a vacation, and obviously the fact that we were without food on a very early and long drive. She said that she would prepare a bag of food and send it to our room. About 4-5 hours later, a bag came with two waters, 2 juices, 2 small bags of chips, a box of chocolates, and two stale bagels. I was insulted!! First off, its the Sheraton and that is pathetic. Second, we should not have to recommend to them how we should be compensated, but obviously we should have. This situation was dealt with so poorly from beginning to end. To be told that there is nothing they can do about it, then having to follow up with them, be transferred from person to person, and then be compensated in that way, is unacceptable. I would think that they would offer a free breakfast, seeing that we didn't have one that morning due to their staff taking our food. But apparently we have different ideas of what customer service is. I am a pretty easy going person and I believe in karma, so I took this as a lesson learned about this hotel and said that i would pass it on to you. I let it go and enjoyed the rest of my vacation with fresh bagels from Safeway :)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel offers what most of their guests are looking for”
Reviews.Author: Dave's_reviews
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton seems to be the place where upper-middle class suburban Americans go for their Hawaiian vacations. And this hotel caters to their needs. The beach is nice (as the first hotel in the planned Kaanapali resort, they got the best beach), the heated lagoon pool is pleasant, the beach bars have good drinks, and there's plenty of decent (but expensive) food in the hotel restaurants. Rooms vary quite a bit (the hotel seems to have been built in stages over the past 45 years), and some rooms require a substantial hike from the front desk. But ever room I've had at the hotel has been nicely furnished, with some water view. As mentioned, the grounds of the hotel are nicely manicured, with large green lawns predominating. On a previous visit, it seemed like they had a more active entertainment program, especially for the kids, but they do still have some sort of daily Hawaiian-themed activity (lei making, hula, etc.). Every evening, a cliff diver lights the tiki torches and jumps off Black Rock (not THAT entertaining, but if you have a mai tai iin your hand . . .). There is excellent snorkeling around Black Rock, especially if you have the nerve to swim around it. The surf is usually calm, especially in the morning. But you should know what you're doing, and perhaps bring a flotation device if you're not an excellent swimmer. My wife had to "rescue" a woman who wasn't strong enough to swim back. There are no lifeguards patrolling. I think "rookie" Hawaii visitors will like staying at this hotel, but if you're the more adventurous type, you might find it a bit dull or sterile. I'd personally recommend soaking in a couple of days of Hawaiian sunshine and finding a more "off the beaten path" place (a house or cottage rental, perhaps?) to complete your Hawaiian vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Memories to last a life time!”
Reviews.Author: WorkmanFamily
Reviews.Content: We just left Sheraton Maui Resort and Spa yesterday and I must say it would be hard to find anything bad to say about this beautiful property! The service was awesome. Anything we needed was provided with a smile and there was always someone there when you needed them. The property itself was gorgeous. The grounds are expansive and immaculate, the room was clean and spacious (we upgraded to the family suite with separate bedroom and huge bathroom... it was well worth the extra $75 per night), world famous Ka'anapali Beach and Black Rock are just steps away and the pool is expansive, refreshing and had many secluded areas to hang out in if you wanted a little privacy. We took the snorkeling trip to Molokini but the best snorkeling of our entire trip was right here at Black Rock. We saw two huge sea turtles and a ton of other sea life. In regards to a few of the negative things posted by others: 1. Yeah stuff here is expensive... Even the grocery stores... You're not at WalMart. 2. Some complained about the staff???... I found them to be awesome across the board. 3. I even heard people say the pool was too cold!.. Really???... In Hawaii??? I though it was perfect! In all I was very satisfied with everything at the Sheraton Maui! From the moment we arrived until the valet brought us our car at check out we were treated like royalty. Thank you Sheraton Maui for making our vacation spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms need updating, pricey”
Reviews.Author: nctraveler55
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel to me was the location. Located right on Black Rock, the hotel had amazing snorkeling right off the beach and was just a short walk to Whalers Village and the yummy Hulu Grill. There were rainbows just about everyday and this being whale watching season, you could see whales right off the coast most days. My husband and I stayed here as part of an awards trip with his company. We have traveled to many places in the Carribean and Mexico and I think we had the same opinion as a lot of other people who have traveled a lot: the trip is very far if you're coming from the East Coast and it is very expensive once you get there. For example at the Cliff Dive Bar, the "special" for lunch was two pork tacos and a draft beer for $17. There is a rental fee per day ($40 if I recall correctly) for the beach chairs or cabanas (beach chairs with a canvas cover). Hotels that have towel cards are also frustrating. You can only get one towel per person and you have to keep track of turning the card in and getting it back by the end of the day. Another thing that drove me nuts was there was only free wifi in the lobby. We probably would have enjoyed Maui in general had we'd stayed for more than a week because there is so much to see and do around the island. Since there were company functions to attend almost everyday, our time was limited. Definitely carve out time to make the trip to Mama's Fish House. We had a late flight the day we were leaving so went there for lunch before the airport and it was incredible. For the hotel, the rooms needed updating badly. We were in a standard suite in Building 2 which had a ok view. The bath tubs were small and the room had very standard decor like you would see in any Sheraton in the US. The spa was just ok for recently undergone a renovation but either we weren't offered or they didn't have shower facilities. I kept waiting for them to tell us to slip into our bathrobes and enjoy the steam room or sauna but that never happened. We finished our massage all oily and were escorted to the front desk to settle our bill. Most of our food was buffet because we were with a big group and dinner was good with just a standard breakfast. There is absolutely nothing to do at the hotel at night. The whole place seemed to have shut down around 10:00pm with no bar to hang out at and have a night cap.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: kevinf_30
Reviews.Content: As most newly wed couples do, they go to Maui to celebrate their honeymoon. Well...that's exactly what we did! I wanted to treat my wife to a romantic getaway that she would remember for the rest of her life. One of the main ingredients was finding a hotel that would be breathtaking and memorable. The Sheraton Maui Resport & Spa delievered on everything we asked for! The location was fantastic, the service was friendly and look of the place was brilliant! The only downfall to the place was the room was smaller and not as lavish as we expected...but what can you expect when you don't get the most expensive room right? Long story short, I highly recommend staying at this resort especially if you're willing to dish out the cash. Of course you are...who goes to Maui without opening up their cheque books? Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - with one caveat”
Reviews.Author: VancouverOilerfan
Reviews.Content: From an experienced traveller, this hotel is excellent.
