Pros: The best location on Ka'anapali Beach, right in front of black rock with a choice of waves or calm, rocks or sand, cliff jumping or snorkelling, shade or sun, just unbeatable compared to the other resorts in the area. We saw sea turtles, as well as many varieties of colourful, large tropical fish while snorkelling directly in front of the hotel. Pool area is very laid back. Some quiet music playing, great sandwich/appy bar, great idea with the lava rock and waterfall grotta area. Very lovely. Beautiful afternoon live music leading up to and after the black rock diving ceremony. Gorgeous views from most rooms, looking out over the stunning beach/ocean views. Building #4 is your best bet for the standard ocean view room - you will have an amazing ocean view looking all the way down the beach. Rooms are spacious and well laid out. Dated? No, not really. Not everything can be brand new, and these rooms, while probably a few years from a refresh, are far from "tired" looking. Beds are fantastic. I haven't slept this well in years, and it didn't hurt to have the sliding door slightly ajar while the waves lap up against the beach as a nice sleep aid! We literally have contacted the hotel to determine the brand of mattress and pillows so we can buy them for our own bedroom back home! Lanais (balconeys) are huge. We had four full sized chairs seating four adults plus a table on ours one evening, with no space issues whatsoever. Property is gorgeously Hawaiian in a classic, understated fashion. Plenty of teak wood accents and soft coloured rock and stone, including a pleasant sandy rock pool deck - a pleasant change from most resorts' grey concrete. It took a day or two to get your bearings as the resort is quite large. The grassy lawn adds to the laid back, uncrowded feel of the whole environment in and around the property. We checked out the Westin down the beach twice and it always appeared loud, crowded and crammed in, although it as well was a nice looking proprty with a much more extravagant pool layout (if a little busy). Staff was superb, as the Hawaiians generally are a happy, friendly bunch. Check in took less than 3 minutes for two couples - a welcome efficiency after a long flight/drive. The complimentary chocolate macadamias and lei's were a nice touch to help us slip into "Hawaiian Time" right away. The hotel tram came in handy a couple of times to get to and from the Whaler's village and the other hotels. Driver will ring his bell at you as you're walking down the road, ask you where you are headed and offer you a ride. Again, nice touch. Restaurants on site: The steak house offered a first rate prime rib experience in a relaxed, lovely atmosphere lit up with tiki torches and soft lighting reflecting off cherry wood decor and tropical burbling brooks. Wine list very good. Food, very good, service, friendly, prompt, and never more than a few feet away. Conciege - very helpful in finding us availability for the whale watching/sunset cruise. First choice was sold out, and they found us another, excellent catamaran - the "Gemini". Cons: If you are a night owl, you will find this hotel decidedly quiet by about 10:30pm. We arrived at around that time, and were ripe for a sit down cocktail, only to find the entire place was shut down, even the "late night" bar. But no biggie - early mornings in Hawaii are brilliant, so we just got with the program and became "morning people" - up at 6:30 and asleep by 11. It really is the best way to experience Hawaii anyway. But if you insist, there are restaurants and bars open much later just a stone's throw away at the other hotels, Whaler's Village or Lahaina. All in all a superb, relaxing vacation with very few complaints. We would recommend to our friends and will certainly be back to this exact location when we return to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: prisonpsych1991
Reviews.Content: The setting of the hotel was beautiful, and the meandering swimming pool was great. It was very slow the time we were there, and we were upgraded to a deluxe ocean view room. The staff were all very welcoming and helpful in making suggestions for nearby restaurants. We wanted to check out late, and they allowed us an extra 1 1/2 hours. If you pay the resort fee, they give you "free" internet and parking. It doesn't make any sense not to get it, unless you have no car and no computer! Pretty much a perfect stay..

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've ever visited!”
Reviews.Author: amkopp
Reviews.Content: I reserched high & low... & cannot believe how pleased my husband and I were with our stay at the Sheraton. Expectations were SURPASSED! We've traveled a lot... and this was the best overall hotel we've ever visited! It was beautiful, but not stuffy like many expensive resorts. The location on Kaanapali Beach was perfect. We visited many hotels on Kaanapali and Wailea- the Sheraton beat all the rest! STUNNING views. Snorkeling was awesome. Grounds were immaculate. We were upgraded (one thing I'd read from others reviews)- we had a resort view, and ended up with a delux oceanview room! The hotel was busy, and it took almost 45 minutes, but we did get a GREAT ROOM!! We hardly wanted to leave the resort. We didn't eat any meals here due to the high prices, but did get some snacks at Safeway in Lahaina (kept them in the fridge)... & ate other meals in nearby Lahaina. We left our 18-month-old at home, but know she would have loved these grounds! The nearby Whaler's Village was great for meals & "light" entertainment (it wasn't too big). The closets were really big... & we had like 20 hangers! When does that happen at a hotel? Usually you get 4! WE WILL BE BACK! :) Oyster.com has the best photos of this resort... but even those hardly do justice!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dondy59
Reviews.Content: We will be back!! Sheraton Maui is AWESOME! Clean, friendly, and beautiful. Yes it is expensive to eat at the resort daily... But, you are only 5 minute walk to Whalers village and a 5 minute drive to Lahaina... If you do not rent a car, there is a free Kaanapali shuttle on the hour to Lahaina.. We will be back... Bldg 4 Ocean Front, 6th floor... Can't beat the views!!! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “One of best places we've stayed in Maui after four separate visits, we have found our place.”
Reviews.Author: Lockhartfamily
Reviews.Content: Incredible everything, beautiful beach access and views. Sea life of plenty right out in front of the hotel, whales, turtles, tones of fish and even the odd monk seal. The rooms are clean and the grounds rival any of 5 start elite properties around Maui and the friendly service was great. We've found a place we will call home next time we go back to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Yoges in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Strutherland
Reviews.Content: I just returned from our Maui trip wife my wife and 2 friends of ours. We were back and forth on where to stay and decided on the Sheraton. We upgraded to the ocean front room and didn't exactly know what to expect. When we arrived we were pleased to see we were placed in building #6 which is located on a cliff about 30 feet above the ocean. We had a top floor room with king bed and fantastic views. You are away from all the noise surrounding the lobby and pool. The only downside to the room was the 5 minute walk to the lobby or pool area and the 3 elevators you needed to take to get there. But, it was worth it-we saw turtles and fish from our balcony daily and the sunsets were unbeatable. The rooms were nice, comfortable beds with nice pillows and comforters. Bath was roomy and clean. I don't know about the guy a few reviews down that gave them a negative on the rooms, we were happy with them. The hotel location is perfect if you are into snorkeling. Black Rock is considered the best place on the island to snorkle. The pool was big and not to crowded, the beach was also very nice. Hint--go to the beach just north of the property by the golf course. It is not very crowded and the water is great. For dining, the hotel was average. Only 2 restaraunts and a outside pool bar. Food was pretty overpriced ($11 for cereal). We spent most dinners in Lihaina or at Whalers Village which was a 5 minute walk down the beach. At Whalers Village you will find Yogurtland (Yoges) which we enjoyed almost nightly. All in all, great clean hotel with friendly service and outstanding views.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Maui”
Reviews.Author: lsadler
Reviews.Content: After reading lots of reviews and considering the Hyatt and the Sheraton we decided on the Sheraton. For us it was the location and we were not dissaponinted. We stayed in the rooms on the cliff facing the ocean. It was a bit of a way to get to but well worth it as almost every minute of the day, from our balcony, we could see whales in the distance. Being away from the main part of the resort was great as we were on our honeymoon and we did not hear the activites going on at the resort. During our stay we saw beaufitul sunsets. dolphins, turtles and loads of fish - snorkelling off the beach is a highlight..

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: wyrm12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Kauai and Maui for our honeymoon, 5 days on each island. At Maui we stayed at the Sheraton because we liked the location and heard good things about the beaches nearby. The location is really good as it's right near Black Rock and very close to good shopping and restaurants. However, the hotel itself is disappointing. We booked a queen bed but by the time we checked in, all they had was a room with two singles (again, this was our honeymoon). After spending about 40 minutes with the front desk (the lady who helped me was very nice), they said they would move us to a queen bed the next night. Sadly, that's not even the most disappointing thing about this hotel. The hotel grounds are huge and spread out. So it could potentially take you forever to get from the check in desk to your room (and it did). Want to visit the gym? Forget it, you need a car to get from one end of the hotel to the other. Parking? There's a self-parking structure, which again can take forever to get to, and is very small and crowded. And yet that STILL wasn't the worst thing. The rooms were awful. This hotel hasn't been remodeled in years and it shows. The bathrooms have a separate small room for just the toilet, with no ventilation so it smells like body odor. And remember, we had two rooms and BOTH rooms stunk. Maui is amazing and we still had a wonderful time. But I'm sure we could have done better for the price. This experience makes me wary of Sheratons generally.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great. Comfy and adequate.”
Reviews.Author: lyketotravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the night on a quick staycation. If it weren't for the special I got, I probably wouldn't have picked the place. In other words, rack rate for this place ain't worth it, specials it's ok and worth a look. The pool area is huge and very inviting. The hotel rooms are comfortable and in good shape. The check-in was bit slow(I waited nearly 20 minutes), but they were nice. Best was the parking valet. Upon check-out, they offered me a bottle of water and had my vehicle to me in 5 minutes. VERY friendly. Nice location on Ka'anapali Beach next to Black Rock. And the free internet was a nice change from the standard Starwood rip-off offers. Rooms had lanai's, and look updated. Nothing special though. The bed was very comfortable and the place was morgue-quiet even though they had a convention that week.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you are visiting Maui with kids”
Reviews.Author: Fasttimes_NYC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a 5 nights stay at the Sheraton Maui. The hotel is on an old mature property and has been well maintained. The grounds are well maintained and so are buildings. Bottom line for my review is: I would only recommend this hotel to families coming to Hawaii. If you are not bringing your kids with you, I would suggest another hotel or even another island. For families, the hotel is great with a small lazy river, two pools, and a small waterslide. My wife and I were not here with our kids so therefore the hotel was just ok for us. Additionally, the hotel seems to be a hot spot for corporate sponsored events. This is something you should watch out for if you are planning a trip here. Rooms: The rooms are pretty nice for a Sheraton. In some cities in the US the rooms in the Westin are comparable. They are clean and look as though they have been updated. We had an ocean front room on the second floor. It had a nice view and you could see the ocean in the distance. Our room was quiet but my wife complained about the bed each night. She would wake up stiff in the morning from the hard springy mattress. Pool: The pool was nice and we sat by the pool most days. I should note that the pool is crowded compared to other resorts we have been to around the world. This is the type of pool where you will be sitting directly next to someone else and you will hear everyoneâ€™s conversations. So if you are looking for some R&R by the pool, bring your headphones. There are two pools, a shallow one and a deep (8 ft) one. There is drink service around the pool area so you can get a beer or cocktail while lying around. There is a guy walking around to check you are staying at the resort and giving out wristbands. For some reason people seem to dread wearing the wristbands. I personally think people need to relax put on the wristband and drink a beer. The guy who gives they bands out is the nicest guy working at the hotel. Beach: The beaches in Hawaii are all public beaches so you will not just have hotel guests on the beach. For some reason, most of the people at the hotel seemed to stay around the pool. Overall, the beach is nice but the small size and course sand are some negatives. You will find much nicer beaches all over the Caribbean. You can do some snorkeling off the beach near the rocks, but there are too many people out there for my taste. You are better off taking a snorkeling boat trip available through the hotel or one of the many vendors near by. Bar Scene: There is no bar scene whatsoever here. All the bars seem to close very early and it is difficult to find a drink after 10pm. The best bar we were able to find was the Hula Grill in Whalers Village but it also closes very early. If you are looking for a nightlife, donâ€™t come to Maui. Oahu is your best bet. Location: The hotel sits in a pretty good location about 45-50 mins drive from the airport. From the hotel you can plan whale watching, which I highly recommend. We did it and love it. You can also schedule day cruises and snorkeling trips. This area of the island does not have the high-end feeling of the Wailea area if that is what you are looking for. The area where the Sheraton sits in Kaanapali feels very touristy to me. It is one of those planned resort areas with 5-8 hotels and timeshares lined up surrounded by a golf course. It is close to the shops and restaurants in Lahaina. My wife and I enjoyed walking around Lahaina looking at the tourist shops, getting a drink, and some food. Restaurants: The food and especially fish in Hawaii is excellent. We ate dinner each night outside the hotel area. We went to The Banyan Tree at the Ritz Carlton the first night. The food was excellent, as was the view. We went on Wednesday since it was half price wine night. Another night we went to Lahaina Grill in the little town area of Lahaina. The food there was also excellent. The third night we went to a Luau Party hosted by the Sheraton. The food was good and we enjoyed ourselves. The last restaurant I can remember was the Sansei Seafood Restaurant in Kapalua near the Ritz Carlton. This was some of the best sushi we had in a long time. For lunch each day, I recommend the Hula Grill in Whalers Village. This is a short walk from the hotel and has great food and drinks. Happy hour starts at 3pm for those who are interested!

Reviews.Title: “Words can't describe our wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: coachreyes55
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were guests April 2-April 9, 2011. It was an absolutely wonderful experience from check in until check out. We stayed in Building 6 and each morning we would sit on the balcony, drink coffee and watch the dolphins and whales. The breakfast was terrific and we always had great service. The omelettes, eggs benedict and fresh fruit always got me off to a good start. I really would like to commend Judd and the concierge staff. They really did their best presenting tour options and Judd hooked me up with a great tee time at The Plantation. I also played the Ka' anapali Royal Course which is conveniently located across the street. The shuttle to Hilo Hattie's and the Lahaina Cannery mall was punctual and accomodating. My wife really enjoyed being within walking distance of the Whaler's Village as well. The bar staff was great and the sunset setting awesome. We went snorkeling and on a whale watch boat and never left the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Culture of arrogance and apathy. Rude and disrespectful service.”
Reviews.Author: Wiscotravfam
Reviews.Content: We cut our stay short due to the incredibly rude, arrogant, and inconsiderate staff. From the start, we could tell this hotel excelled in poor service. At check-in the front desk person had poor skills and a lack of personality, and made it very clear they do not appreciate guests. When we went to our room, we found someone in it! Incompetency reigns! We called the front desk and they were baffled, and could not figure out what happened. Took forever for them to resolve this. Seemed to imply that this was somehow our fault?? Made us wait... (it was a simple solution - just deliver keys to us for the room next door). They sent security to check to the ID of the person in the room, who as a paying guest with room keys on her 4th night?? Really? Later, that same security person harassed my 11 year old son for resting his arm on fence while we tried to watch a whale. Really? Scolded for resting an arm on a fence? From there it went downhill. We tried to avoid the front desk at all costs, but when forced to interact, their insolence made it intolerable. We met only one person at the front desk who had a clue, the rest were untrained, rude and very unprofessional. The rooms have not been updated in a very long time, and we expected a higher level of cleanliness. After 4 days of poor service mediocre rooms, we left and went to the Hyatt, where the service was exceptional and we felt incredibly welcome! What an amazing difference. Professional, friendly, helpful. Not rude, curt, arrogant or unhelpful. The only redeeming quality of this property is that a few of the servers in the restaurant understand excellent service. They should kick the front desk workers to the curb, and bring the servers up to work on the desk, and to greet guests and create a welcoming environment. Would not recommend this property and advise against staying there. We will not return - ever.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LoveMauitoomuch
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Sheraton for 7 nights. It was my husband, myself and our 15 year old son. This was our second trip to Maui. We stayed here 5 years ago. So after looking for places to stay we ended up back at the Sheraton. It is a little on the expensive side as far as hotels go but we loved it. It is a great spot right on Black Rock. If you want to walk out of your room and right on to the beach to go snorkeling this is the place for you. We love snorkeling and I wanted to just stay close to the hotel. Seeing the island last time I didn't feel the need to drive the whole island this time. Black Rock is the best place to snorkel. Early in the morning is the best time. If you go out around the outside of the rock into the open and hold your breath and listen you can hear the whales sing. Wow! Highlight of our trip. Rooms are nice and we had a great view. They will upgrade you for free when you check in. If your a starwood member the rooms have a perfect view of the ocean. If you stay here you should experince the swimming pool. Love it but alot of people put down their towels to save their chairs and then come back whenever they want. You are not allowed to hold chairs but some guest due. I think it is rude. Food here is of course expensive. We had a small refrigrator in our room. We ended up buying lunch supplies at the local grocery store and made sandwiches for lunch and also bought something for breakfast then we only had to spend money of dinner. There is a resort fee here which makes no sense what so ever. To me that was the biggest thing, just include it in the price. So if you want to have a nice vacation with a clean room, nice swimming pool and the beach right there and don't mind paying a little extra this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Love it even more!”
Reviews.Author: kohalala
Reviews.Content: Maui is gorgeous and the Sheraton sits on a beautiful section of Kaanapali Beach at Black Rock. We love this hotel (5th time returning guest), the staff, and the laid-back feeling (not pretentious...just comfortable). Special shout-out to Caleb (very professional and knowledgeable) at the beach activities desk! Another fabulous vacation! We will return, of course!

Reviews.Title: “It was "ok"... overpriced, inconvenient layout”
Reviews.Author: vanellya
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton for two weeks for our honeymoon. Airport shuttle: no complaints, however upon return they were waiting for us at another entrance other than which we were dropped off from, and we waited for an hour until we finally called them to see what was going on. Arrived at the hotel, very nice grounds, and were told that we were "upgraded".. so of course we were very happy.. they upgraded us to "ocean front", but when we asked if it was a king bed (IT was our HONEYMOON), they said that was another upgrade? and that we would be getting two double beds.. so we ended up PAYING more, for what really wasn't an upgrade at all! we were put in the furthest building and it was like a maze to get from our room, to any other part of the resort. We were not a fan of this layout at all! Rooms were cleaned daily, no complaints there.. but the room itself was average. Nothing to write home about, and our ocean view was "ocean slash side parking lot" view.. I was quite upset that we paid so much for it!! It was such a cunning tactic. Breakfast was included in our package, but got quite old quick. The food was the same each morning, and towards the end, we were dreading going to eat there. There was also a bit of a wait to be seated. The beach was beautiful, but marred by the fact taht we had to RENT chairs to sit on them! To me that is unacceptable. I get that it is a public beach, but WHERE are we supposed to put our stuff! we had to leave our stuff on the sand, while watching it and take quick dips in the beach.. it was really annoying. There were also snorkle rentals, which were also overpriced. The pool was also nice, and had a small slide - no real complaints there. They did come around giving us wristbands, which I put on my bathing suit so I wouldn't get tan lines. The hotel provided a free shuttle to Lahaina where we would go for dinner. That was convenient. Black Rock restaurant - decent, but very overpriced! They also had a cafe on the pool which had lunch items which were also overpriced! The spa was great - got a couples massage on the beach... a definite plus. We also did the luau, which was decent as well, but not much in terms of shows or a nightlife!! I felt like most people were geriatrics, waking up at 6 am and sleeping at 8pm! Would I go back? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mrcrash
Reviews.Content: Don't believe all of the negative reviews. My wife and I didn't know where to stay so after reading all the review we choose the Sheraton Maui. It as a great choice. This resort is right in the heart of the Kaanapalli beach area. The beach is only 20 feet from the pool. There are snorkling kits to rent and other activities right here. This hotel was clean and and the staff was helpful. Remeber this is Maui things are pricey here. Try the Piiholo Ranch zipline . We were pleasently surprized as there were not millions of screaming kids here. The Luau on property was fun you have to go to one in Hawaii. Pacific Whale Foundation cruise was great saw over 10 humpbacks.

Reviews.Title: “In Need of Capital Improvements”
Reviews.Author: babs020_11
Reviews.Content: The Maui Sheraton is in a good location, however the property is in desperate need of a major renovation. Compared to neighboring hotels on the strip, the Sheraton's public areas are not beautiful or impressive, like the Hyatt or Westin nearby. The property is large. If you are in a bldg 6 room, you must take multple stairs / elevators-- a real hassle. The people were friendly. Service was 'Just OK'. Would stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Wonderful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kyopoboy
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel on Ka'anapali Beach for our trip with 2 small children, 2 adults, and 1 senior. We considered a condo on Ka'anapali, but came to the realization that we wouldn't really be doing any cooking and the amenities at a nice hotel would be worth it. The location is about perfect as the beach is very wide in front of the property and comes up against Black Rock which is great for snorkeling. Although it was fairly windy, the waves were not too big and the body surfing/boogie boarding was great for my 8 yr old. It does get a bit crowded on the beach, but since it's a public beach there's nothing that the hotel can do about it, and it highlights how popular the location is. We had requested two connected rooms, but were only able to be accommodated with two adjacent rooms. Not a big deal as we had wonderful ocean front rooms with great views from the lanais across the main lawn and pool area into the sea with Molokai in the distance. The rooms were quite spacious and clean, with nice amenities like a full mini fridge and LCD TVs for the kids. The breakfast buffet was quite expensive, but convenient the first morning, and we ended up getting up and going into Lahaina most mornings to search out a few breakfast spots. The pool is great as it isn't just a typical rectangle, but rather a winding rocky pool with waterfalls and a small slide, which was much more interesting and fun for the kids. We didn't do the luau, but the kids took part in the lei making and hula lessons. There's also whale watching excursions on large catamarans that launch next door through Trilogy Excursions, which was a great experience. Overall, it was a great trip and the hotel was exactly what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical relaxation”
Reviews.Author: LAR60
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my 50th birthday. I wanted to ride bike down Haleakala. After much research of accoms on Maui, we opted for Sheraton as it seemed Black Rock had some of the best, easily accessible snorkeling right on beach. There is really no coral but the waters abounded with fish from only a foot or two off the beach. There was a little swell but nothing dangerous. We regularly swam out towards point but not past it. We arrived early afternoon and Erick - a very friendly and informative member of the concierge staff showed us to a beautiful double ocean view room. He also gave us suggestions of other snorkelling spots. Our room wasn't right on beach but view across gardens, pool, swaying palms beach and sunset over Lanai Island all seen from our relaxing lanai was hard to leave at the end of our stay. We did have noisy neighbours with a screaming kid, but we did not come to stay in our room all day. Our room was spacious and I think the bathroom may have recently been renovated. Our room was spotless every day. My only complaint was that the bed was too soft - I have lower back problems which were excacerbated by it. I had a brilliant full body massage at the spa - my back was sore after we bumped over ocean in dive boat the day before. Samantha has magic fingers and understood my ailments perfectly. She fixed my back enough to last the remainder of our holiday - another week involving much activity on Oahu and Big Island. The grounds are beautifully manicured and the pool area is very attractive. The pics of pool on website do not do it justice as it winds through the gardens allowing for numerous secluded spots in which to relax. If you're into kids clubs where you 'dump' your kids then I agree perhaps not as attractive for some young families but our 16 yr old son loved it. (Also know that when he was little he would have loved it, too). There are fresh water showers at the beach's edge where one can clean sand off before heading back to room. (We travel with our own snorkel gear, but one can hire gear by the beach). We enjoyed how the resort is spread over a large area - it doesn't feel closed in and its great to go for a walk esp after large meals. We found breakfast to be delicious and the range of foods was spectacular. Fresh fruits abounded and the service was friendly and efficient. The longest we waited for a table was probably about 5 mins. We had dinner one night in the Reefs Edge lounge and enjoyed a light, tasty dinner. Most nights we ate out at either Lahaina or at Whalers Village (best meals at Cane & Taro). My actual birthday was our last day/evening of our stay here and so decided to book dinner at the Black Rock Steak & Seafood Restaurant. Would have liked to try the teppanyaki but it was closed for renovations. Unfortunately it poured rain all day and evening and the restaurant was more busy than any other night. Sadly our 7pm booking became a 7:20 sitting , our order finally taken at 7:50pm and food arrived at 8:45pm! The food unfortunately was the worst we had experienced during the week - fish dry and chewy steak tough but son enjoyed pasta. There were lots of cross customers. The staff (not many there) were trying their best and didn't stop apologising. It wasn't their fault. Management should consider that they do not sit customers at tables half an hour before a booking is due to arrive. Our usual experience at restaurants is that we are informed if the table is booked for a later time so that we are aware that we must leave by then. It was the only dampener to our stay. We are not fans of a resort tax but one can hardly complain as it is very well publisized. As we had a hire car for our stay, we enjoyed free parking. Our son is a mad, keen gamer and enjoyed the free wi-fi in the evenings. It was useful for us too to stay in touch with home and to double check websites of tours we discovered whilst there. We actually took advantage of the free ph calls a couple of times, too. We were lucky to have a special rate of 3 nights for the price of two. We stayed for 8 nights. Should have stayed 9. Breakfast for two was included. This was provided by vouchers. As we had a few very early mornings where we did not eat breakfast at hotel, we were able to use our spare vouchers for our son so never had to pay for breakfast for him. All the concierge staff were very helpful and suggested some lovely dining in Lahaina (try Kimos and if you're into burgers, try Cool Cat). We even dodged the time share spiel. We were not disappointed with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LetsGoBucksOHIO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui from 3/12 to 3/22 and loved it! We had a full ocean view from building 6, and it was incredible. The staff was incredible as well. Our bellman the first night we arrived, Jeff, was very helpful and welcoming after such a long trip to get there. He gave us tips on local places to eat, and even gave us a quick ride down to Whalers Village in one of their golf carts. Everyone we encountered on the Sheraton staff greeted us warmly and made us feel welcome. The hotel common areas and grounds are very beautiful and well taken care of. The beach is amazing too. We had a package that included the breakfast buffet. It was very good also. As other reviewers have mentioned, you can use your breakfast tickets at the Westin as well, and they do have a larger selection and seating area. We ate down there a few times. We got room service one night so we could watch the sun set over the ocean from our balcony, and it was good food, and plenty of it. We could have split one meal between us. Please don't hesitate to stay at this hotel. It was a wonderful experience for us and we can't wait to go again!

Reviews.Title: “They Love Happy Guests!!”
Reviews.Author: miltdebp
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome vacation after a slow start. We arrived on Sun. 3/6/11. We had reserved a partial ocean view through Expida.com. We got there & they advised it was partial ocean, but no part of the ocean was to be seen! We were overlooking the mountains. We upgraded to ocean view for $25/day. We stayed for 10 days. We received a handicap room, you could see the ocean, but the room was not roomy enough for 10-day stay. We were moved to another room & we were very happy!!. Our bell hop Trevor was outstanding. He couldn't do enough for us during our stay. He was my husband's go to man for questions. He went above & beyond for us! We didn't get the name of the front desk lady (tall w/dark hair). . We received outstanding service from Connie Green. Pool service from the waitresses was excellent along with pool attendants (Jenny). I received a massage from Laurie @ oceanside. I can tell you she is awesome! an from security was awesome too! He knows why! We were in Maui during the sunami & the Sheraton did an excellent job of keeping us safe & informed. We will be returning to Maui & The Sheraton next March!! Poppe's NY

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: Steve111111_11
Reviews.Content: My experience started with us arriving and being told that we couldn't get a room with a king-sized bed because we booked through Expedia. This was very disappointing after 9 hours of flying plus is was my significant others birthday. Real nice sleeping in separate beds...thanks Sheraton. We were moved the 2nd day into a king room but that is still unacceptable. The rest of our stay went fairly well until the last night when we were evacuated from our room due to the tsunami. The entire staff seemed ill prepared to handle such a situation and it didn't seem there was a clear plan in place. All guests from floors 1 and 2 were placed into the ballroom on the 3rd floor and given a sheet and a blanket for sleeping purposes. We came to find out later that tsunami evacuation procedures recommend being on the 4th floor or higher. We spent the entire night from midnight until 7am there and finally decided to just go back to our room despite not being told anything by the staff. We were to check out that day so I called the front desk to request a late check out seeing as we had slept on a concrete floor the whole night. They were not willing to accommodate that request which was very disappointing. I understand that an act of nature is out of their control but the way they chose to handle it was downright unacceptable. I brought this up when I checked out and told them I was very displeased with the response I got. They were more concerned with their incoming guests than they were with the ones who had spent the entire night dealing with potential disaster. I made the comment that it would've been nice to get some sleep and the guy working at the front desk responded, "well I was here last night too". I pointed out to him that it was his job and he was being paid for it while I was a paying guest at the hotel. Had they not handled this situation so poorly I probably would've recommended this hotel but can't due so in good faith after being treated so rudely by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “What ocean view??”
Reviews.Author: Oon_JS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 2 nights at Sheraton Maui. Our chief dissatisfaction was that our room was supposed to be with "ocean view" but when we checked in, we were given a room where not only was there absolutely no view of the ocean from inside the room, it was on the ground floor. So when we opened the curtain, instead of seeing any ocean we see a lawn with a half naked man walking outside about 10m away. On taking our issue with the front desk, we were told that we would see the ocean IF we stepped out to the balcony, and were given some baloney that Ocean Front was a higher rate, and for the rate we paid, that was the so-called Ocean View we got. For the record, we paid about USD570 a night (no breakfast), which makes it more expensive than Shangri La hotel in downtown Tokyo. They switched us to another room, telling me that it would be a better view (real ocean view this time?), but it turned out to be just on one floor up higher, and still the same facing where you would see basically the hotel building on the other side when you look out. Not sure why they designed the hotel layout this way - basically the corridor walkway had the best view facing the beach and ocean, and the rooms at least in the building we were (building 2) basically faced rooms in the opposite building. Since we were misled that we would be having 'ocean view' and now did not have any, and the hotel's 'Ocean Front' rooms were already booked out so they have 'no choice' (otherwise Westin Maui was an alternative nearby) we basically started our holiday in Maui and week in Hawaii on a bad experience. The duty manager said she cannot adjust the rate now because we paid through a third party travel site, but did give us complimentary breakfast for 2 days for which we used 1. In summary, the dislikes (-) and likes (+) are: (-) No ocean view from room despite paying for one (-) The 3rd floor is actually the level which you drive your car in, and where reception is on. Eventually we were put in room 2310, which is on the "3rd floor" but it is actually like ground floor, because 2nd floor and ground floor were even lower (-) Car park building not very accessible from the hotel. Essentially you have to walk out all the way to the main road and then walk in to the car park. Not sure why they didn't just open a side entrance to it when it is side by side (-) Air conditioning unit in the room was noisy (-) Low water pressure in the shower (-) Nobody helped us with getting our luggage to the front desk when we unloaded from the rental car at the driveway, and vice versa when we checked out; valets were probably more interested to earn tips parking your car in the driveway (-) Internet access in the common area was just 1 terminal with no seat (+) Hotel restaurant helped us to cook a few fishes that we caught from a boat fishing trip, despite being busy with a corporate event (took a bit of cajoling). The charge was USD25 per person which is fair Overall we had a much better experience in Sheraton Langkawi, and also in Hotel Renew in Honolulu.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely in every way”
Reviews.Author: at57
Reviews.Content: We stayed nearly a week at this facility. Our suite was spacious - king bed, sitting room, kitchenette, huge closets, Murphy bed, 2 sliding doors to balcony. Enforced quiet hours after 10pm so you can hear the waves crashing onto the shore. Beautiful grounds, friendly helpful staff with genuine "aloha spirit." Would love to stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful location sneaky business”
Reviews.Author: hawaii5057
Reviews.Content: rooms were just o.k.nothing spectacular.listed as ocean view but ours was far from it.was told by front desk that rooms were quote"luck of the draw".i did have a perfect view of the tennis court though.hotel was located on a beautiful part of the beach with great snorkeling which was awesome.biggest problem i had was when i checked out.they hit my credit card with a $25.00 a night resort fee.i questioned it and they told me it was for free parking,(we paid 5.00 a day for valet)free wi-fi,(didnt use)and free local calls.i asked how can you say any of that is free if you are charging for it per night?i was told its just something we charge all our customers.sneaky business gets you reviews like this.sorry

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic all around”
Reviews.Author: karpet313
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton was just fantastic. The service was friendly and abundant. The grounds and hotel were spotless with fabulous views. The pool was terrific and not terribly crowded even though the hotel was sold out. We could always get two chairs (with shade if needed). The Sheraton staff really shined during the recent tsunami. They alerted us promptly that we needed to move to the lobby area as a precaution. Security came by twice to ensure we heard the announcement and we were in the process of moving (it was midnight). When we arrived, the staff had really made the best of a tough situation...they opened up some of the large conf rooms; in addition to having tv's set up, they had food and drinks ready. There were blankets and pillows as well. Next time we are in Maui, we'll be returning to the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view”
Reviews.Author: Lilly155043
Reviews.Content: I would recommend anyone to stay at the Sheraton while in Maui. We were in building #4 and had a partial ocean view. Our room was clean, the staff were very friendly, the decor was nice and not outdated and the view from the lanai was amazing. In my opinion, it was worth the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: luedtkme
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton March 4-March 10 for our honeymoon and I couldn't be happier with our experience! The hotel staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. When we arrived John and Cory helped us figure out where to go and showed us to our rooms and offered a ton of great suggestions on things to do and places to eat. Very helpful. Our room (deluxe ocean front in building 2) was absolutely wonderful. The location of the hotel is by far the best location on Kaanapali beach. We spent a few days just walking the whole strip of the beach and we both agreed that we were in the best location - close to shops and restaurants and the beach here was nicer and much larger than the beach by the Hyatt. We had the breakfast buffet included in our room, I think it was a promo they were running, and I would highly recommend it. We were able to eat as much as we wanted every morning (fresh fruit, pastries, eggs, pancakes, bagels, bacon, ham, etc.) and because of this we didn't really need to eat lunch and saved some money that way. The hotel has absolutely beautiful grounds and a nice pool area. My husband and I are pretty laid back, low-key people and we felt like this was the best hotel for us. Not a huge "party" hotel, but provides enough to do for all types of personalities. If we ever make it back to Maui, we agreed that we would definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “RIPPED OFF AND RUDE”
Reviews.Author: JANDJBRISBANE
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed a the Sheraton Maui and we were charged twice for our stay, once on March 1st and again on March 2nd.I have provided proof of this to the sheraton showing they have been paid twice on my credit card statement and they are refusing to help and blaming amex AND TELLING ME TO TAKE IT UP WITH THEM WHICH IS RIDICULOUS. the staff at the resort are not friendly and paled in comparison to the fabulouse service we had at sheraton moana waikiki. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with hotel, not the room”
Reviews.Author: DrKPax
Reviews.Content: In preparation for my honeymoon, I studied many hotel reviews on Maui and picked the Sheraton for its many positive reviews and relative affordable price. Unfortunately, my wife and I -- just married and having endured a long semi-uncomfortable flight -- found that though used a very popular and prominent third-party website to book the room and flight that our reservation was more of a "request". We booked (and paid for) a king bed many months before, but upon arrival we received a room with two double beds! My newlywed wife was very disappointed and as her husband I felt that I did her disservice. We were told that if we had booked directly via the Sheraton or Starwood website that our room would have been guaranteed. The Sheraton staff offered other nearby hotel options but my wife and I found that those hotels also could only offer us a room with double beds. Otherwise, the Sheraton was an outstanding hotel: great location, the widest and best stretch of the Kaanapali Beach, the Black Rock Restaurant, the large pool and perfectly manicured grounds. The other nearby hotels could not compete with the Sheraton with regard to evoking the ideal romantic honeymoon environment. If it was not for the superb service and environment, I would have poorly rated this hotel because of the room issue. So if you're going to Hawaii during a busy time, I would recommend against using third-party travel websites and book directly to get the room you want. It's an unfortunate story that my wife and I will share: double beds on our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Whale Watching from the deck!”
Reviews.Author: italygoodness
Reviews.Content: Terrific service, staff, food, and setting! The 600 building over the Black Rock (where they do the nightly cliff dive) is very special, especially during whale migration season. Simply insane viewing of whales breaching, frolicking, and spouting all day, morning to night. If you are coming to Maui for whale watching, you almost don't need to go on a boat if you have a great view like this. Klint Kolbu in the Catering Dept. is just a beautiful person, so kind and helpful, I highly recommend special events here at the property. Great pool, more like a lazy river setting without the current. Private beach, easy access to Whaler's Village and more...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: SantaMonicaFamily
Reviews.Content: We are scratching our heads about the reviews that found the staff at the Sheraton "cool" or unfriendly. That was not our experience at all. Quite the opposite - we found every staff member warm, helpful, and generous with their time. Our 9 year-old daughter loved the hula lesson, and crafts. Grace, the hula dancer, was so kind and friendly with the kids and adults alike. The front desk staff gave us the scoop on where the locals eat breakfast (No. 1 BBQ in the nearby town - fabulous hole-in-the-wall food). Thanks to staff recommendations we went horseback riding, took a submarine ride, had a hike in the extraordinary Iao valley, and visited the Up Country. In short, everyone went out of their way to be helpful and kind. As for the hotel itself, it exceeded our expectations (which were lowered, in part, because of some of the rather negative reviews on Tripadvisor). It was lovely, very attractive in design and finish. It felt like a high-end Thai hotel, and a big step up from some of the concrete boxes along the beach. The location is first-rate, with good snorkeling (though watch out for the currents and no lifeguards). My daughter spent hours and hours swimming in the pool and winding waterways on the hotel grounds. Honestly, what's not to like about the place? Well, the $28 breakfast buffet for one, which we simply avoided. Just how much breakfast buffet can any human eat? Instead we simply drove the three miles into the town and ate in excellent, cheap and locally-supported places. We did eat from time to time in the hotel, and had several poolside drinks, but doing so much would have burned through our budget (and we preferred to do other things with our money, frankly). What else? The hotel's Lu-au looked a bit lame, so we opted instead for the Drums of the Pacific at another hotel down the beach, which was recommended by several local dancers, and was indeed a good show (we got big discounts by sitting through a timeshare-style presentation - I wouldn't recommend that to anyone! Oh well, we all make mistakes). In conclusion, a lovely, tasteful hotel, beautifully designed and renovated, with a real Asian rather than concrete-block American sensibility; friendly staff, who will offer excellent suggestions if asked (we actually found the front desk staff more helpful at suggesting "local" cheaper options than the concierge folks); nice clean and tastefully decorated rooms; delightful grounds; great pool; fabulous location - best location by far of any hotel on the beach. It was, in short, a brilliant vacation. Thank goodness the complaining doomsayers on Tripadvisor were off the mark. This place is amongst the best hotels we have stayed, in decades of international travel all over the globe. It's a jewel. As is Maui. We are already planning our return, and will absolutely stay at the Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “A great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: sunnysherri
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had just stayed at a VERY expensive hotel, prior to our visit to this Sheraton. We were pleasantly surprised with the TERRIFIC ocean-front room we had at the Sheraton. We were also VERY pleased with the cleanliness, the grounds, the view, the flowers, the restaurants, the pool, the service, and the location. We've stayed at lots of hotels, and this was truly a terrific experience. What a great bargain! Beautiful sunsets. Great nightly "cliff-dive" event, too!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: ERdoc911
Reviews.Content: It's right next to the black rock, good snorkeling, you can climb the black rock and dive off it if you want. They upgraded us to an oceanview room. Overall, a great experience and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “In one word...Heaven.”
Reviews.Author: SeeksSunshine
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazing. Definitely what I pictured for a honeymoon hotel. The room was unbelievable and the hotel staff could not do enough for us! At check-in, the valet was great (even though we had few bags) and the front desk was SO nice and excited to have us staying with them. Our view from our room was beautiful and out into the ocean. The pool bar was really fun as they had nightly music (acoustic guitar/singer) before the rock diving ceremony. The restaurant and pool bar food were really expensive and rich, but so was all the food from the resorts we stayed at. We talked to the valet staff and they were awesome at giving us places to try. Downtown Lahaina was GREAT! We went to ask the Concierge about Road the Hana, but they were both busy with other guests. By accident, we ended up at the Starwood sales table (for time share, etc). What a lucky accident! I think his name was David (he went to college in New Mexico, but came back to Hawaii after graduation). He was AWESOME! He gave us tips and tricks that we never would have found on the Road to Hana if it werenâ€™t for his suggestions! We had the best Pad Thai weâ€™ve ever had (thanks to Jenâ€™s Thai Food) and we able to explore the Lava Tubes. Seriously, even though the room was great â€“ the staff made it â€œdefinitely recommendâ€� in our books! We could even see the Black Rock cliff diving ceremony from our room (deluxe ocean view). We will 100% stay at the Sheraton Maui if we ever go back. Beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but not the friendly atmosphere expected from a Hawaii vacation.”
Reviews.Author: mustang4088
Reviews.Content: The hotel and grounds are beautiful. Of course everything on these grounds is overpriced. We think that maybe there were alot of time share units here. The whole atmosphere here seemed to be cool and impersonal from the other guests to most of the staff. The bartenders are all business, not very friendly. The towel hut people barely acknowledge your presence, with the exception of a woman returning towel cards who was very friendly and bubbly. Porters and valet were great. Dinner at Black Rock was a disaster because of the propane smell from the torches and when we mentioned this to the waiter he said they have had complaints, we asked for the manager who did nothing. We then had to ask to have our dessert at another table.

Reviews.Title: “Total Paradise”
Reviews.Author: LeslieA71
Reviews.Content: This resort was so beautiful! The resturants were great but a little expensive. Enjoyed the 8 min walk to Whalers Village. The beach was breathtaking! Snorkeling off of Black Rock Cliff was soal renewing! I enjoyed the snorkeling there better than the $100 trip to Molokinni Crater. There is a huge sea turtle there everyday, I swam with it every afternoon. The rooms were clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui on allsinglestravel Hawaiian Adventure was an excellent resort for our group”
Reviews.Author: traveltheworldsingle
Reviews.Content: I just came back from overseeing the operations of a group staying at the Sheraton Maui resort as part of the annual allsinglestravel.com Hawaiian Adventure. This is the 2nd year in a row we have chosen this resort for our group's stay and both I and our passengers have been thrilled with this resort each time. (we had previously chosen the Kaanapali Beach Hotel for our groups on Maui, which while having an equally ideal location, the Sheraton has more amenities and our passengers have found it to have a more lively, fun atmosphere, both by day and at/after sunset) Its location is perfect. Our passengers were able to enjoy beach walks as well as walks along the boardwalk that connects the hotel to the Whaler's Village shopping complex, where guests can find beachfront restaurants with local bands playing both Hawaiian and mainstream pop music, as well as a collection of shopping opportunities, all less than 5 minutes walk from the Sheraton. Our passengers also raved about the pool area. This year, the Sheraton added one new feature to an already fabulous pool area. The addition of what can best be described as "waterbound oversized bean bag chairs" was a big hit among our passengers. The resort provides these free of charge to hotel guests, allowing guests to float leisurely from the main pool through a winding path under palm trees, past small waterfalls etc. The 24 hour outdoor jacuzzi with another mini waterfall was also a nice touch. Another new feature that the Sheraton Maui added this year that was a big hit amongst some of our passengers was the "Link at Sheraton". This is their new internet cafe (a feature offered at many Sheratons, but which is especially well designed at the Sheraton Maui, with large picture windows looking out onto the resort grounds facing the ocean, so guests could go online, without feeling like they were in a box , as is often the case with most hotels' "business centers". The Link at Sheraton also featured large flat screen TVs and a bar to liven up the experience for those wishing to go online during their stay. Another unique experience at the Sheraton Maui that our passengers loved was the nightly free Cliff Diving show performed at sunset each night. This was a great experience as our group (and really any hotel guests) could gather at the tiki bar for drinks or a bite to eat and enjoy watching a local Hawaiian light a series of tiki torches and then climb a small cliff (called Black Rock), then ceramoniously extinguish his torch and finally, dive into the ocean below. The last thing we really loved about the Sheraton Maui was its access to other nearby activities. Only 5 minutes away was the Kaanapali Zipline office from which we checked in for the popular zipline adventure which our passengers all raved about. A mere 2 minute shuttle ride or a walk on the beach boardwalk took us to other hotels on the same beachfront, where various shows are offered nightly (we took our group to the Hyatt for their Luau one night, via the easy 2 minute free shuttle connecting the hotels on Kaanaplai Beach - FYI, the Hyatt's Luau is in my opinion better than either the Marriott or the Westin Luaus which I have personally seen as well and I would reccommend the Hyatt's luau to anyone staying on Maui.) Another shuttle also connected the hotel to the town of Lahaina, only about 10 minutes away, where our passengers enjoyed a variety of dinner and shopping options (this shuttle operated regularly for only one dollar per person) Other tours picked up right along the beach, so passengers could enjoy a snorkeling tour, a whale watch tour or other tours, with a mere 5 minute walk along the beach boardwalk to the awaiting catamarans for these tours. Overall, I and our passengers have been very pleased with the Sheraton Maui in the 2 years we have taken our allsinglestravel.com groups there and we intend to use this fabulous hotel, ideally located, again and I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for either a relaxing stay on Maui to simply soak up the hotel's amenities or an action packed stay on Maui with easy access to a wide variety of excursions by both day and night. .

Reviews.Title: “Noah made our stay....!”
Reviews.Author: viveslesvoyages
Reviews.Content: We arrived during whale season and were amazed at the numbers of whales we saw blowing and diving from the check-in area. At 11 a.m. we did not expect our room to be ready, and it was not. But Noah at the front desk told us he would try to find another room for us. We mentioned that we had made Platimum SPG status a few months ago and had yet to upgraded to a suite. Noah disappeared into the backroom and returned a few minutes later to tell us that although it had taken some convincing, his manager had agreed to upgrade us to an oceanfront suite overlooking Black rock. We were thrilled! The suite not only had a huge patio with lawn chairs and a table for 4, it had a view to die for where we could watch the black rock diving ceremony and the whales in the ocean. It was heavenly. The rest of the room was also very comfortable and the service from the other personnel at the resort was equally good. We received Alohas from everyone. Downsides were that both our fridge and TV had to be replaced because they were broken, and the food at the poolside bar was overvalued for the quality, but overall the stay was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: yellowdog90
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently stayed at the Sheraton Maui for 10 nights. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a beautiful ocean view room just steps from the beach / Black Rock. The room was very spacious. Bathroom / carpets could use cleaning. Beds / pillows were very comfortable. The grounds were impeccably maintained. We were disappointed by the excessive cost of food on the resort although there were many offsite options nearby. Snorkelling at Black Rock was very good - we saw several large sea turtles and a variety of tropical fish & coral. We could see humpback whales from the beach. Overall, we enjoyed our time at the Sheraton Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, but nickel and dime you for everything.”
Reviews.Author: nikhilwiz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the beach and is beautiful. The pools, bars and service was excellent. The concierge, in particular, was awesome - he helped us pick great places to eat and visit. Having said that, the 'Road to Hana' guide that was given to us had the wrong Mile Marker for the last few stops (the 7 pools!), which had us making multiple U-turns on the windy highway. Complementary valet on the first day was a nice touch and helped us relax (the parking is a mile away). The hotel wasn't too crowded when we were there ( Jan/Feb) and we didn't have to line up and/or wait for anything. While our room was spacious and clean, the bathroom was very small and the wife felt it was icky. I'd expect a much larger bathroom (and a standing shower) in a resort which is charging >$200/day. We had a great experience at the hotel, but ended up being more expensive than we had planned for, mostly due to the additional per-day resort fees ($26) that were tacked on and lack of reasonably priced dining options. The in-resort dining options were extremely expensive and we had to look elsewhere (whaler's village is nearby - walking distance) for reasonably priced dining options. The hotel bars all closed at 10pm and there's no good bar open late anywhere in walking distance. The gym, which is included in the resort fee., is located 4 buildings across, forcing you to take 2 different elevators to reach it. The parking is the same. This was not convenient at all, especially when we had a baby (and associated luggage) along. They wanted $25/day for a microwave. The resort has a Luau, which is average at best, especially if you have seen others like the one in the Polynesian Cultural Center on Oahu. The hotel prices the Luau at $99, but you can watch it for $29 for the cocktail only (no dinner) option. We even saw folks watching it for free by sitting on the lawns right outside. The daily Cliff Dive show at sunset is organized by the resort and is free for all to watch. The hotel is on kaanapali beach, right by the Black Rock, which is a gret snorkeling location. This is a great location. Whalers village, where all the good eateries and bars are, is a 5 minute walk away. Our Whale watching boat took off from there as well. The resort has reasonably priced snorkel and cabana rentals on the beach. The Lahaina town is nearby and has great places to eat, although street parking is extremely tough to find. Paid parking is very pricey ($20/2h). Tijuana's, a mexican bar down the street, is sketchy. Don't bother. One thing to watch out for is that the nearest doctor is 90 miles away on the other end of the island. It may be a consideration if you are travelling with kids, etc. Don't dine at any of the hotel's restaurants. The Cliff Dive bar is OK. The others are way too pricey. Just walk over to the Whaler's Village instead for better options. If you can drive, drive over to Lahaina and head over to Cool Cats - they have the best burgers in Maui and friendly service. If you have to watch a Luau and don't want to drive anywhere, watch the in-resort one and ask for the cocktail-only option. There are cocktail-only whale watching tours which are cheaper leaving you to grab dinner elsewhere. Ask the concierge for what you want to do and how much you are looking to pay. They will usually find you a good fit.

Reviews.Title: “Comments from a chemically-sensitive business traveller:”
Reviews.Author: 3311kd
Reviews.Content: Location: great for exploring West Maui. Amazing snorkling. Great/fun pool for keikis, decent number of well-presented 'Hawai`i cultural' bits. You can find the rest in most guide-books. If you are chemically sensitive, MAKE SURE you call and ask that your room be cleaned only with water first and sheets/towels are run through with NO detergent/softener, only water. Their cleaning products are designed to kill everything they touch (can't have critters in our guest rooms!), and the residue bowled me over. The housekeeping manager was fairly accomodating (Bobby Shin), Mahalo!, but while the cleaning residue in the "only other room available" (??? capacity was 50%!) was better, it was right next to the elevator and the ding-dong of every floor arrival was very audible. I finally aired out my room. "Mountain-view" rooms are NOT quiet, the traffic noise from the highway is very noticable. As is the bus/truck traffic from the loading dock/turnaround. No screens on sliding glass door (no surprise), and no just 'fan/vent' option on A/C unit. Luckily the 'low' a/c fan setting is very quiet, but no way to get fresh air w/o other critters. But they've sprayed so heavily few critters are actually left around here. And, they spray OFTEN. If you're really sensitive and wise, call ahead to see what days of the week they'll be spraying, and ask them to avoid the area around your room. Worth a shot. Hotel's showing its age, but it's *fine*. Charges for internet access and parking are now replaced by a no-options $25/day charge. So if you come w/o computer and w/o car, oh well. I was here for a workshop, no desk and the only chairs are awful for typing in (probably good for relaxing, but armrests were in the wrong spot). I dragged in one of the chairs from the lanai, it was better, and propped my feet on the other chair, but this is not a room set up for business/work. Cable for internet was provided, which is good in terms of connections being fairly stable, but confining to where you want to use it. I wish I'd brought my 25-ft cable with me... gluten free/food allergies: most resturants on-site had OK dishes available, make sure to have to waitstaff double-check w/ kitchen. Room had a fridge, I bought a cheap plate & cup at the local Long's, and HIGHLY recommend the Lahaina Farms (Opposite from the Safeway) for gluten-free/organic options.

Reviews.Title: “The very best location for snorkelling and beaching it!”
Reviews.Author: PrincessBooBoo
Reviews.Content: Loved it. I wanted a place that I could hang out at the beach and that my husband would have easy access to snorkelling. Having Whaler's Village within easy access for shopping was an unexpected bonus. Also, checkout the museum at Whaler's Village.

Reviews.Title: “It was such paradise I didnt want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Exploreitall
Reviews.Content: This is our second year in a row staying at the Sheraton Maui Blackrock .Again we were more then satisfied with the resort and would definately come back again. The grounds are truly magnificient green and well kept.The beach is the best that we saw along the kaanapali resort shoreline and so close.We received an unasked for upgrade to deluxe ocean front building 2, which was greatly appreciated,although the mountain view last year was slendid as well.We had no desire to stay in the building up on the rock as all amenities are farther away, the view from our room was spectacular enough.People will come from other hotels to snorkel and dive at blackrock and we were right on that beach. ..There is a little shopping villa <whalers village> within walking distance on a beach walk.There is a free shuttle that takes you to lahaina for restaurants and shopping /tours and even some history.I cannot say enough good things about this property. The restaurants are very pricey,but thats maui for you.Cliff diver bar has a guy cooking for you till 7pm or so and although limited fair it is good<especially the flat bread pizza>and our son ate with us there a few times. Did not bother to try the steak restaurant or the japanese as the main courses were about 40 to 50 dollars. The buffet in the morning is 28 dollars.while we were there we visited 3 times my opinion is skip the buffet if you do not have coupons for it. .2 days we had cold hard waffles.no choice of pancakes or frenchtoast.They had a chef make omeletes.which were very nice but not worthy of 28 dollars.first day we had a really nice server.The rest were adequate.I think the hostess needed some customer service review as she never greeted us warmly. Go into lahaina or whalers village for eating .The starbucks cart at the hotel cost 3.75 for a small coffee.Cannery mall starbucks 1.50 Also go into lahaina for tours.Expedia was awesome on the wharf. Even though went off property to eat and get tours I would not hesitate to stay at this property again .

Reviews.Title: “OMG, best Holiday in maui or anywhere to date”
Reviews.Author: oceanpurrls
Reviews.Content: Thanks Sheraton Resort. First anyone reading all the reviews before booking or going ti maui , we did this to. We tossed up before booking either to stay here at the sheraton or the Westin--After when we where in Maui and walking to the Westin and visiting I hands down prefered the sheraton. The Sheraton is amazing. We read all reviews, either great reviews or pople who complained. Here is our experience We where on holiday starting January 25th for 7 nights . When we arrived the Hotel staff rights away offered to take our luggage etc. at front dest the staff where extremely freindy with the nicest smiles, as all the staff we found at the Sheraton where while we where there. . We where up graded to the most gorgeous room ,actually a suite overlooking what I call the ocean and pool. We overlooked also the luai show as our suite faced it directly, it was a amazing suite , we loved it. We want to also thank the Sheraton as we had mentioned it was our 25th Anniversary we where celebrating and to our surprise a bottle of champain was brought to us with wine glasses-- just a pleasant added surprise.-- thanks Sheraton ***** The grounds at the Sheraton are amazing, the beach is never to crouded and if you want to rent cabana's or umbrella;s they are always available. We rented a Cabanna and it was awsome , they put it exactly where you want ,the staff are so gracious. The Water is crystal clear and all sandy on the beach in frontof the Sheraton , hardly any rocks in the water which was certainly to my likeing. I certainly enjoyed this as I like to see what is in the water LOL , it is the most beautiful water and so crytal clear. . My husband Loved snorkelling by the black rock as he saw many fish and turtles. It is a awsome beach , not crouded , lots of room ---it is perfect for sun tanning , swimming or snorkeling.. The pool I just loved, lots of room and many private areas which I loved and took full advantage of . I felt like I had certain parts of the pool to myself, It was just just ourstanding. The pool has floating bean bags you can lay on and float though the pools with, just the most comfortable items to use. I almost fell a sleep on one -- LOL there is also a pool just perfect for kids if you have them, I dont but noticed this section, just wonderful. The Buffet breakfast is AMAZING, amost to many chioces, from fruits chioces, to meat chioces, to crepes, bagesl and pasties etc.. OH dont forget about the chef who will make you your own omelet--now how is that for a full breakfast, it is the BEST !!! We had this everyday included and most times there was some differnet items in the buffet , Staff where extermely wonderful in the service of the buffet . Hands down to them all. The Sheraton is a 5 minute walk to the Whalers Village, there is shops to wonder in or food to eat, nice place close to go to . As we walked we checked out all the Hotels, nothing compared, actually some needed reno's such as whalers hotel etc...Westin hotel is nice but to big and wasnt as nice as I had expected when I walked though it, so I am so happy we choose the sheraton over the Westin. The shertaon also has a free shuttle that goes to the Cannery mall and lahiana town, perfect to visit for shopping and great dining areas. nice to have this shuttle , we took advantage of this a few times while we where there. Off course we love bubba Gumps for the shrimps, LOL awsome Check out the pool bar, great nacho's -- and drinks. Overall our expereince was OUTSTANDING Staff where super freindly Hotel suite was very clean and just marvelous, hotel maids where super feindly and sure cleaned our suite well pool was beautiful and kept sparkling clean beach is wonderful for swimming or snorkling--I think one of the best areas to snorkel in Maui by black rock. the ground are kept up and are just beautiful Food is fantastic -- the breakfast buffet is outstanding We rate the Shertaon as one of the best Hotel resorts on Maui , this is our second visit to Maui Thanks Shertaon, we cannot wait to return next year , our visit was our best to date and the weather was perfect the whole time with no rain, just all sunshine Thanks again Sheraton, I hope others will read our review as we cannot understand the ones that complain -- really we dont after we now have expereinced this Hotel Karen & Glenn Pratt

Reviews.Title: “Best & Closest to ocean waterfront in Maui”
Reviews.Author: CanadaKids
Reviews.Content: We stayed in oceanfront deluxe rooms in building 6 and they are so amazing because you are so close to the ocean and can hear the waves all day. This is our 2 nd stay in 3 years and the location is fantastic. The pools are fun but a little chilly. The service is good and the hotel staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: jdiemom
Reviews.Content: First of all, Maui is an incredible island. So clean, visitor friendly and lovely, so I will preface this review by saying that I'm tainted by my love of this island. I read many reviews prior to going and actually felt a little reluctant booking this hotel... "mould spores"... yikes. However, from my very first impression, this hotel impressed me over and over again. Rachel at the front desk was incredibly friendly and helpful. Our room was upgraded to building 6, which is a bit of a hike, but definitely worth it! There is nothing between you and ocean and for our entire 7 nights we were regaled by turtles and whales swimming right outside our lanai. It was incredible! Fitness Centre: I worked out every day in the fitness centre and never had to wait for a machine. I went both in the mornings and at night. Their machines are good quality. They have a good assortment of weight machines, 4 eliptical trainers, 3 treadmills and 4 stationary bikes. The view is not great, but that would be my one and only minor drawback. They are equipped with flat panel screens, lots of towels and change rooms (which I didn't use, since the fitness centre is very close to building 6). Black Rock Steak and Seafood Restaurant: We ate one meal here and it was incredible. If you only go there once, make sure to try the calamari, it melts in your mouth. My husband and I both said it was the best we've ever had. The Crab Cakes were also melt-in-your-mouth delicious. The service was a bit strange, our waiter kept forgetting things and leaving us for long periods of time, but to be fair, he was only "called in" and not a regular server there. In the end he seemed nice, but it took him a while to warm up to us. Pool Area: We LOVED this area. You got a "towel card" and the towels were nice and big. The chairs all had nice cushions and, best of all, there was never a fight to get a chair! They were plentiful at all times! The area itself was immaculate, they must have amazing "grounds crew", we were SO impressed! The pools were well designed. We had a lot of fun following the labyrinth of interconnected pools. Kids would love the set up! Beach: While having breakfast in Kona, we enjoyed a conversation with a local who told us her favorite beach was the one right outside our hotel. Literally miles of beach. It was lovely. It is also well known for it's great snorkeling. We enjoyed viewing many different kinds of fish around the black rock. My husband used the "Business Centre", called "Link", every morning. He found it sufficient, but there was one really strange thing about it: no phones! He found that a little tough since he connected mostly with a calling card, but everything else was very good. On our last day, we had a late flight. My husband has "Gold Status" with Starwood Hotels, and they really did go over and above. They needed the room by the standard check out time as the hotel was nearly full, but we had an early excursion, so we were gone by 6 am. When we returned they had moved all of our things to another room so that they could honor the 4:00 late check out. We felt that this act really summed up our entire experience at this hotel: it was over and above our expectations and we would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: Happy2travel18
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the prior reviews on Trip Advisor, we had realistic expectations for this resort. In fact, we were pleasantly surprised by the facilities and grounds. Our room was standard hotel room size, with nice furnishings, a large balcony, and a wonderful view! Breakfast buffet was included (we walked down to the Westin 2 mornings and used our vouchers there- they had a larger selection of options). Front desk, valet, and concierge all very helpful. Restaurant service not as consistant. Convenient location- we were able to walk along the beach side sidewalk to other restaurants and shops. Liked that the Sheraton was at the end of the walk- did not feel as congested. Overall, a positive experience during our 5 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great whale watching”
Reviews.Author: washboy
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice time at this resort. Grounds are very well taken care of. Room was not new, but kept up very well. Clean and comfortable. Whale watching off the beach this time of year was spectacular. Saw many large whales jump out of the water. Very nice beach location, access to other hotels and shopping area with restaurants, shops. Needs a cafe or restaurant/bar that stays open longer than 10:00pm. No food available after that except gift shop, which was open until 11:00pm. Biggest drawback was the attitude of employee's at the beach activity (towel dispensing/beach services) booth. Seemed to be more interested in selling sun glasses than helping guests. Also, some ot the male servers at the Mai Tai Bar had a bad attitude. All others very pleasant and helpful. Extra charges such as resort fee per day and fees for lounge chairs on the beach a little too high. Beach chairs should be included in fee.

Reviews.Title: “The view was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Ames31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui 1/16 - 1/22. We had a partial ocean view and luckily had the 5th floor in Bldg 2. It was a marvelous view from our entry door back to the mountains and the walls must've been fairly thick as we only knew we had neighbors when we were out on the balcony. We ate at the Black Rock restaurant night 1 - food was good, service was good. Will agree with a few other reviewers that say the food is expensive at Black Rock - but hey, you are in Hawaii, you almost have to expect a 15% - 20% increase over mainland prices. The torch lighting ceremony was entertaining and I love the live performers for happy hour. Fabulous way to spend your late afternoon, in the pool, floating around and listening to live performances by local artists. Whaler's Village is a short walk away for dinner, sundries and shopping. I bought a beautiful piece of jewelry at Dolphin Galleries and was pleased with the purchase. Leilani's was one of our last dinners and we greatly enjoyed it. Teralani was the company we used for our snorkel/whale watching adventure. Captain Jay and the staff made it a great experience and I felt we received great value for what we spent. They BBQ the meat for lunch on the boat and the information shared on the whales was great. The room at the Sheraton was always clean, always plenty of towels and the staff always had a smile and an "aloha".

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: TheGambleFamily
Reviews.Content: We just recently went to Hawaii for the first time, electing to spend 3 nights in Maui at the Sheraton, got a great package deal through another site with a Deluxe Ocean View room that included an upgrade to Deluxe Ocean Front and breakfast for 2 every day. The deluxe ocean front rooms are on top of black rock and we ended up in Building 6. I know alot of the reviews complain about the long walk to the main building but its not bad, maybe 5 minutes? It is a little confusing with the 3 elevator rides but come on, its not rocket science. First off, check-in was quick and easy, everything from the 3rd party site carried over including the Deluxe Ocean Front Upgrade so we were into the room in no time.
