That particular area has its own parking lot, we never had trouble finding a spot. Room was gorgeous, it was not outdated, and the bathroom was also very nice. The view from our room was -INCREDIBLE-, we saw whales on multiple occasions from our Lanai and even a school of spinner dolphins playing one day. The breakfasts there were good, not great, but far better than any "Express" chain or the like. Hot items were plentiful, service was quick from the wait staff, and the buffett changed daily. We never encounted long wait times for seating but we eat early (6:30AM-7AM) right when it opened. Sitting on the outside tables watching the sun slowly light the sky was marvelous. The pool area is nice, its no water park dont get me wrong but its big and has a nice lazy river. Beach access was also very easy to the beautiful Kaanapali beach. In general, the grounds were very well kept. The whole place is very "open" and flowing, we were always pleased with the room cleaning and they never once accidentely woke us up or came in while we were in the room. The ONLY complaint I have, and it really peeved me off, was I prepaid for my package and everything except the daily resort fee and incidentals should have been covered. Well imagine my surprise when I get my room bill the night before checkout and its almost a thousand dollars? Then i check my credit card and see they've been trying to ding it for 4 GRAND in charges for the last 2 days (they were declined, thanks God). So I had to go to the front desk the morning of checkout and show the front desk clerk the bill and she said we asked for an upgrade?? I showed her the upgrade to Dlx Ocean was included and she went to make a copy of my paperwork and then they figured out they "were billing the wrong room". And no one knew why they had tried to hit my card for 4k in charges so I just let that go. But that could have seriously messed up someones vacation if they had help up alot of funds that were being used for the trip. Another than that small snafu, wonderful property. Oh, note - Sheraton, come on, no wi-fi in the rooms? Its 2011..I can go to almost any other property and have WiFi in the room. PLEASE upgrade your property to wi-fi in all the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: kholly18
Reviews.Content: We booked a week at the Sheraton and had never stayed at this one before. We were very impressed with the attention to detail. They always greeted us by our last name and the staff was great whenever we needed anything, especially the valets. The valets would greet us every morning with our car, ask us where we were headed and if we needed directions. One night they even gave us a coupon for a free dessert at the restaurant we were eating at. The location is great. You are right on the beach, can watch the sunset from any of the west-facing balconies and they apparently have pretty good snorkeling right in front of the beach. (We didn't snorkel, but heard it was good). We did not eat at the restaurants though, they were out of our price range, especially for what you get. There are lots of good little restaurants within walking distance though...(I recommend CJs for breakfast or lunch). Rooms were nice. They definitely were not "new" but were kept clean by housekeeping and we had a fridge in our room so we could keep water/beer and some food on hand and the bed was great with plenty of pillows and very comfortable. I'm pregnant and have a hard time sleeping...this bed made it easy. All the rooms I saw had balconies, which was a nice touch also and the hotel is the only hotel I've ever stayed at where they give you body wash instead of just a bar of soap and also leave you a travel size body wash puff. The thing that I didn't like at all was the connectivity to the Internet. They have wired internet in each room, but it was quite slow but they do have a large business center with some computers. I guess you're on vacation in Hawaii so why do you really need Internet? Also, the hotel charges a "resort fee" of about $25. Not really sure what you get for that, but it doesn't seem to be negotiable and all the big hotels in Hawaii are charging this.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice But Would Pick Somewhere Else Next Time”
Reviews.Author: mariareier
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an ocean view double room. I chose this resort because several travel books said it was a good place for kids. Compared to the other hotels we walked around, the Sheraton is NOT a good place for kids. The so called "family frieindly " rooms were nothing but suites, just like any other hotels have. And they are double the price of a standard double room. The pool did have a nice little slide for the kids and a little kiddie pool area. But this was nothing compared to the other hotels we walked past, they were like mini water parks. Other than that, this hotel had nothing else kid geared for kids. This is why I do not understand why it was listed as a good place for kids. The Hyatt and Westin both had fish, birds, waterfalls, etc....everywhere. I would say this hotel is reallly more appropriate for couples....it was very quiet and elegant, and out of the way. Rooms - the condition of the room was great, beautiful, clean, modern, good beds, great TV. I do think the shower/tub area is outdated and needs to be upgraded. It was still acceptable though, just obviously did not "go" with the rest of the room. I will say this - we checked in very late, 7 PM, and the only double room they had left was one right by the elevator. He said they were overbooked. and he offered us one of the suites instead for $200 extra per night which he said was a huge discount. since they were usually double the price of our double. He let us look at both rooms and decide. We decided we could not afford the extra money for the suite and the double was wonderful if we could have one not by the elevator (noise, etc....). Well, there was no other double so we got stuck with that one. And I was a bit disappointed he did not give us the suite at no extra charge. Since he hotel was "overbooked", I bet it either ended up empty, or some single businessman who checked in late ended up with because they had no more double rooms. The bell on the elevator ended up being a big annoyance......it sounded like our doorbell being rung constantly every AM beginning around 6, then every night around 10. We were on vacation...and wanted to sleep in, but could not. Finally called the front desk on the 2nd night and asked if the bell could be turned off. They said no. My husband asked for a free breakfast or movie to compensate for the inconvenience...they said no. We were paying $400 a night for this hotel and they could not give us a free $13 movie one night? Balcony - we had an oceanview room but because the balcony had a solid concrete wall, then shrubs planted, it was hard to really see the ocean when you were sitting down. I think this is a poor design, other hotels had either clear glass balcony walls, or think poles where you could see though it. It really was not what we were hoping for. The free shuttles to other hotels and Lahaina were great.....but - the Sheraton was way far north. There was noting further North that you'd want to go to. And most of the hotels offer this same free shuttle. I would choose a hotel further south next time. It would be a much closer walk to Whalers Village and you would not even need the shuttle. Black Rock - I also chose this hotel because it was right at Black Rock which was a great snorkeling spot. We were afraid to snorkel. The water was very rough, waves big, and there were big rocks everywhere. It may have been that coming from Hanauma Bay it seemed rough to us. I would not recommend this hotel. For the high price, they had even less to offer than other hotels that we saw that probably would have been cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at perfect location, will definately stay here again”
Reviews.Author: peppermint81
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Sheraton was really good. We visited in 1st week of December. The room was big and clean. It was suppose to be a "deluxe ocean view" room. The view was good. The grounds were well maintained. The restaurants are too pricey, we never ate here as the reviews were not good. The location of this hotel is THE BEST. The best family beach is Kanapali, good snorkeling spot at Black Rock, and driving distance to Safeway, Lahaina downtown and all shopping malls. Its very convenient. We really didn't have any issues as other reviewers have mentioned. This is a really big hotel. The room cleanliness/state really depends on the staff cleaning it. Our room were clean. They do charge a mandatory 25$ resort fee. I would have preferred that they had already added it in the hotel price when we did the booking rather than asking it for at the check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: GoddessStefanie
Reviews.Content: I love Maui!! The Sheraton at Black Rock lagoon is the best hotel in the Kaanapalli/Lahaina area. The lagoon in front of the hotel always has turtles in it and the snorkeling is right there - just wade into the ocean with your gear on. We had dolphins playing in the ocean just past the end of the rocks. The location of the hotel is perfect for a walk to Whaler's Village for shopping and dining or you can head the other way on the beach and be by yourself on the most gorgeous beach anywhere. While I agree that Hawaii is not "cheap" - the amazing seafood and the awesome selection of restaurants assures you that you will never go hungry. I cannot wait to come back and bring the kids!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort on Maui, unfortunately some service issues”
Reviews.Author: zephyr221
Reviews.Content: This resort is beautiful and is the most unique of the three Starwood resorts in Lahaina. I like the fact that it's family-run for somet time and it's not a cookie-cutter hotel. The grounds are beautifully landscaped and the beach at K'aanapali is beautiful. I was sad to see the economy definitely took some tolls on the property (the koy fish are no more), there's no club lounge, etc. Unfortunately during this stay we had a pre-arranged upgrade from the GM that was given to someone else by the time we checked in. So our romantic getaway started in a room with 2 double beds. Not so romantic. We had to deal with a very rude and dismissive manager on duty. Later, another manager was apologetic and moved our room and gave us breakfast vouchers for the trouble. I'd definitely go back... I write off the bad service as a one-off. It's a great property.

Reviews.Title: “Mold Sickness in the Maui Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: tropic1953
Reviews.Content: My wife and I usually stay at The Sheraton Resort &Spa when we visit Maui. Usually the trip goes very smoothly and my wife and I enjoyed our stay at The Sheraton. However in December 2010 we stayed for 9 days and after the first night I had a sore throat and it just got worse from there. By the third day I just slept and woke up more tired than when I fell asleep. The Cleaning staff was asked to address cleaning of the A/C unit, I also asked the Front Desk to have their Maintenance check the A/C unit, But neither happened. I became so ill I just wanted to leave early and go home. WE HAD TO CANCEL ALL OF OUR ACTIVITIES. Upon checkout I spoke briefly to the manager who tried to convince me it was lava dust, fog and so on. She was not even interested in looking into the room but did make alot of reasoning to convince herself that no problem existed. This will be my last experience at The Sheraton Resort an Spa on Maui. I have been to the emergency room twice since I have returned and now am now going the a pulmonary specialist. After coming home I looked up "Mold Sickness in Hawaii" on the internet and found out this is a common problem, especially now when all the rooms have a low occupancy problem and they turn off the A/C when not occupied leaving longer periods for mold to grow in the moist, warm environment. IF YOU HAVE ALLERGIES OF ANY KIND-DO NOT STAY AT THE SHERATON RESORT & SPA ON MAUI. MY WIFE DOESN'T HAVE ALLERGIES AND SHE ALSO BECAME EXTREMELY ILL AT THE END OF OUR 9 DAY STAY.

Reviews.Title: “most likely wouldn't come back”
Reviews.Author: shaker4
Reviews.Content: lots of little glitches that just take away from the vacation, to being put in a room with two double beds versus the king bed booked, to having a welcome card in someone else's name in our room, to having the fruit and cheese for said person taken from the room, the dirty tub and seat cushion, to only being able to get one drink to take away at the bar - guess your spouse needs to be glued to you, to the 'try for a free gift at starwood' to only find out someone had already removed the card so we were SOL Guess we aren't coming back

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for a Wedding and Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: rlacha
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel from Sheraton Wakikiki and could not have been more pleased. It took 30 minutes from the Kahilui Airport to the hotel in a rental car with wonderful panoramic ocean views along the way. At check-in, we were upgraded to a partial ocean view room (as a Starwood Preferred Guest Member). The rooms could use a little cosmetic upgrade, but for only needing the room at night it was ideal. The property is located in front of Kaanapali Bay with Black Rock a short swim away. The beach is public, however it's mostly used by the hotel guests. We went after Thanksgiving and had plenty of room on the sand. Not worth renting the beach chairs, just take your hotel given towels! The hotel is surrounded by great golf courses, with a PGA one in Kapalua only 15 minutes away. The pool area is pristine with a great lazy river that seems to go forever. The pool side bar is great for snacks and it has a daily happy hour at 3:30 - 5:00 and it's a great deal, considering that the food at the hotel can be pricey. With that said, we had a WONDERFUL wedding dinner at the hotel's main restaurant and the service from Bruce was top of the line too. For all those foodies, I recommend you take the private tour of the kitchen which is offered every Tuesday afternoon and Chef Brian even gave us a cooking demo and let us sample local Hawaiian fruit. SUPERB ATTENTION TO DETAIL from his staff! If you come here with day-to-day plans on being active, throw them out the window now! You'll only want to relax by the beach or pool, while taking in the laid back Hawaiian style. Lastly, Whaler's Village (mall) is a very short walk along the beach from the Sheraton. A great place to grab some Hawaii Cookies, drinks or go shopping. Lahaina is a short 5-minute drive and there is a Safeway, Starbucks, Long's Drugs and anything else you may need is there too. With closing if you are in Lahaina there are two place you MUST GO TO: Ululani's Shaved Ice (best in Maui, don't let anyone else fool you) and Aloha Mixed Plate (very affordable and delicious Hawaiian food). I hope these tips help you, we sure enjoyed this place!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: geekma
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Sheraton in November waiting for our week at the Westin Villas to begin. Loved the location, food was expensive and so-so, the room was on the small side, but all-in-all a good experience. Will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Very picturesque”
Reviews.Author: HOnestABE18
Reviews.Content: This place has some beautiful views. The view from the lobby is just absolutely gorgeous. The location near Whaler's Village is really nice for meals (a very pleasant 10 minute walk at the most). We went to Dukes, which is a 30 minute walk to the North for breakfast (highly recommended). Very friendly staff at the Sheraton, including the maids. They are obviously a part of the team that makes one's stay here very enjoyable. Visit the Concierge's desk shortly after arrival. They can be very helpful with ideas for activities and meals. If you have a bellman help you with luggage, you'll get a wealth of free information (excluding the tip of course!). Parking is free and they had plenty of spaces while we were there during our 5 day stay. Internet is free from your room. Well, parking and internet are included in the resort fee ($26.00 or so), so it isn't really free, but take advantage of the services offered. We were not upgraded, which several of the postings said happen to them. Nevertheless, the garden facing room was very nice. Nice sleep, except for one night that our neighbors decided to stay up late outside on the patio and talk up a storm. I was half asleep, but too tired to complain. You can't beat the location. The torch lighting at night and dive off the cliff are a nice way to start the evening. Snorkeling at Black Rock is the best. Short drive to Lahaina for shopping and more restaurants (less than 10 minutes). The time share presentation (which we went on) offered through the Westin/Sheraton is about 3 1/2 hours, so don't be fooled by the "90 minute" timeframe. While not a real hard sell, you will be there for a while, but I did find it interesting. Overall, a great location and I'd certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with very quiet surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Tonyquattro
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the summer of 2009 and the hotel was brillient. We only went to relax so we can only advise what it is like from our views. Lovely hotel with lovely surroundings. You can walk into the sea off the beach and swim with wild turtles.........amazing!!!! Don't forget your mask and snorkle. There is a very small village with in walking distances, for fast food, shops and a 2 restaraunts with great food. You can also get the shuttle to Lahaina, which has alot of restaraunts and and bars etc. One disappointment.......everyone has to pay a $25 per day per room resort service charge!!!! What a load of Bull Sh#T, but trust me, you aren't getting into your room if you don't pay it. Rooms were great with plenty of room, nice bathroom. I would still recommend this hotel as it's a lovely place

Reviews.Title: “There is only one place to stay in Kaanapli, Maui...Sheraton at Black Rock!”
Reviews.Author: threekars
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing and has plenty for kids of all ages! The rooms are amazing with spectacular views. The beach is beautiful and private with the best snorkeling on Maui. Lahaina is just minutes away with plenty of shopping and dining, but you can walk just two properties down the beach to the Whaler's Village for the best shopping and dining! Fantastic seafood. This property is so clean and the spa is to die for! My husband and I have been to this property twice in the last five yeras and we just got back from spending the week with our whole family. Our daughter is 9 and we could not get her out of the surf and the pool. My nieces are 16 and 19 and they had a blast shopping and paddle boarding. Great family place!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: kdoyle196
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort and plan to go back. Had two connecting rooms for our family of five. The location is excellent with access to Black Rock, boardwalk, Whaler's Village shops and restaurants, golf courses on foot and Lahaina by shuttle or car. Little foot-traffic across the beach since it dead-ends at Black Rock. Never too crowded (over Christmas time!) and no problems finding chairs at the pool. Lovely resort and a perfect size for having activity options without being a mega-resort. Lots of families and newlyweds but not overrun with young children. Rooms were a generous size, updated and very clean with fabulous views over the pool and ocean. We were given a room upgrade to ocean view which was much appreciated. Beautifully landscaped and well-tended. Rooms were immaculate after cleaning. One issue with parkiing card not working and desk staff were unhelpful to our son (early 20's)- they could have easily resolved ID issues by calling up to the room. Otherwise, staff were friendly, professional and helpful. Room has small fridge and microwaves were available at front desk (we did not get so not sure if there is a charge)

Reviews.Title: “Both got ill probably due to airborne mold spores from the hotel AC”
Reviews.Author: Tropic53
Reviews.Content: We suspect we both got mold sickness from the AC unit in our room. We asked the maid and the front desk manager to check the AC in our room, but no one ever did! My husband has been very ill for several weeks now. He has been to the ER twice lately for severe shortness of breath. The hotel manager denied this has been a problem, but our research showed that airborne mold sickness has been a real problem both in Oahu and Maui. We both were so sick, we were barely able to get back home!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!!!”
Reviews.Author: vapor278
Reviews.Content: amazing place.. it is really cool to come home and find a picture of the resort you stayed at on the cover of a calendar of beautiful places!!! if you go make sure you say hi to "V. W."

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place but be careful with room selection”
Reviews.Author: KnightLight631
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve been on Maui before and in terms of value have to give this resort three stars. I had a bottom garden room without much of a view. We had some noisy people in the room next to us that wasnâ€™t appreciated. I suppose I have to blame myself though for not asking to move. But the grounds are beautiful and location is wonderful at the end of Kaanapali, â€œDig Meâ€� beach and next to Black Rock. The pool area is fantastic and the service was really good. I did think though that the prices were high for food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: mahalowannabe
Reviews.Content: Could have stayed many other places but really wanted to stay here because we had been to sunset dive & snorkeling at Black Rock on our last visit 4 years ago, & we thought this property was beautiful. It is. The setting is lovely & so spread out that you are not always on top of other guests, like at some other resorts in this area. Unfortunately though, we had questionable service impressions. We were upgraded, which was great, but room was not ready for over an hour after promised delivery time & we had to check back with them. Towel attendant was totally rude. Just having arrived late in the afternoon, we had no idea what the towel turn in time was & we were very flippantly told we would have to carry our dirty pool towels with us if we wanted clean replacements the next day. Hauling dirty towels to see dive at sunset ceremony was not cool. No time to get to room & back. I did report this & the person I spoke with seemed to understand. The Mai Tai pool bartenders were very nice & worked really hard to ensure guests were pleased. Nice view from bar stools with catamarans off on the distance. The room itself was clean & cozy. Bathroom was not as functional as others we have had, with everything including closet in the bathroom. Lanai was very dirty upon arrival, but they did clean when requested, then it was very enjoyable. A lot of sand & kids in the pool. Floating bean bags were fun though. Beach seemed much more crowded and dirty this time, & unfortunately although we saw a lot of fish while snorkeling , the coral reef seemed really stressed compared to others we saw. Will probably not stay in the Lahaina /Ka'annapali area again, but would stay at the Hyatt again if I did. I would recommend this place to families only.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing- Only Complaint: Pool was freezing”
Reviews.Author: amansayal
Reviews.Content: Amazing. I can't even explain in words. If you like warm pools this is not the place for you. The pools are freezing. FREEZING

Reviews.Title: “Great grounds, but the room was dark and plain”
Reviews.Author: Hali-traveller
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sheraton Maui on Priceline, so we were given the bottom-of-the-barrel room type. I've stayed in garden-view rooms before and sometime preferred them as they tend to be quieter and have pretty views, but this one overlooked a concrete service breezeway. Because it was ground-floor, it really seemed like a basement apartment and was very dark, even midday. The bathroom was average size but really needed to be freshened up and updated. Nice bathroom amenities though, and the robes were appreciated. The grounds of the resort are beautiful with strolling pathways and lots of plants. The pool is fantastic and probably the best thing about the hotel. I would have thought it was one of the best I'd seen, until we went to the Westin and saw theirs! Some directional signage would be a good idea though since it is sometimes difiicult to get your bearings and find things like bathrooms or the towel kiosk. The beach is wonderful with a great view of Black Rock. We didn't snorkel here as we did a snorkel cruise on the Gemini (very highly recommended). We saw the cliff dive ceremony twice but didn't get pictures either time. The first time my camera battery died just as the diver was climbing to the top and the second time a bunch of kids were hanging out on the top of the rock while the ceremony was happening so the shots were obstructed. The location of the Sheraton is very convenient, both for walking and driving. We used the beach walk path a lot to get to other hotels, restaurants and Whaler's Village, and we also used the shuttle service to go in to the Old Lahaina Luau (so fantastic). The shuttle worked out really well for us although the pickup location at the hotel needs some explanation. We were told by the bellman to go down to the end of the driveway to get it there, but what he didn't tell us was that you have to go into the little circular driveway off to the side into what looks like an abandoned secondary reception desk. Sit on the bench and the shuttle, marked "Westin" will come for you. There are multiple pickup spots in Lahaina, none of which are marked either, so a little map would really be handy. As we had a rental car, we parked, first using the complimentary valet service and then once we got situated in our room, started using the self-park at the back of the hotel (by the tennis courts). It was very convenient to our room and we never once had a problem. We only had drinks at the resort, no food, so the only thing I can comment on are the high prices, which we came to accept. There is no booze sold in the gift shop at this resort so if you want bevvies in your room, you'll need to get them off-resort and bring them with you. Something else to note is that as a Sheraton guest, you also have signing privileges at the restauarants at the Westin and Ka'anapali Beach Resort. Service here was pretty good, at the front desk, housekeeping, bell desk and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer service ruined it all”
Reviews.Author: Harvard_Wang
Reviews.Content: It's very unfortunate that I have to write this review in this manner, as I had no issues with the hotel for the most part, until the last day, and from there, the bad experience just seems to drag on... The day that we were checking out, my wife was not feeling too well, and asked if I could go get her a cup of hot tea. As it was mid-day, the hotel restaurants were closed. I went to the front-desk and asked if they could help me get a cup of tea. I was first told to go down to the bar, which I did, and the bartender told me they had no hot tea. I went back to the front desk, where concierge said she would call for a food services manager and they would bring one to me. I sat and waited for about 5 minutes, went back to the concierge to ask again, where I was told that she got "too busy" and missed the call from food services. She called again and was able to get one of the service manager to the front desk this time, where I was told again that it could be obtained at the bar. I followed the food manager down to the bar, where she asked one of the bartenders there to help her with getting me a cup of tea (as she was fairly new and did not fully know her way around yet), we waited for a couple of minutes while the bartender simply walked around tending to other guests while completely ignoring us. Finally the service manager took it upon herself to look in the back room of the restaurant and was able to get me a cup of hot tea. The entire ordeal from start to finish, to get ONE CUP OF HOT TEA, took close to 30 minutes; all the while my wife was feeling ill. Unfortunately, there is more. I booked my trip through Costco, where one of the perks stated with staying at the Sheraton was a $100 resort credit. Upon check-out, my final payment was $236.66. When I brought up the credit with the front desk, they said okay, and said they would charge me $136.66. Upon my return, I checked my credit card statement, and noticed that in addition to the $136.66, there was another $100 charge on it. I called the hotel THREE TIMES now to try and have this corrected, and so far, nothing has happened. Each time I am told they would "look into it right away and get the $100 credited back to my card", but absolutely nothing has happened so far.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: MikeW_CO
Reviews.Content: This is a long overdue review....my wife and I went on our honeymoon back in June this year. We were blown away by Maui and the Sheraton. I'm an SPG platinum member, but booked our whole trip (airfare, rental, and car) through Orbitz for 7 nights. I contacted the resort ahead of time, and confirmed an upgraded room with points, not to take any chances. Definitely recommend doing that if you want a nice room! When we got there, we were overlooking black-rock on the top floor, with a great room. The other reviews are all correct - when you stay over there, you're a good 5-7 minute walk down to the beach/pool and to the restaurants. However, you feel like you're the only ones on the island and its a perfect spot for honeymooners. We were treated well for being platinum guests though. We had the free breakfast buffet, which was incredible! The pool was nice, crowded at times, and definitely had to play the towel game to get some shade. We rented cabanas at the pool a few times, which were a little costly ($40 if I remember correctly), but worth it. The beach was awesome, and so was the snorkeling. We also drove into Maui quite a few times for dinner, got massages at the spa which was great, and went zip-lining near by! In summary, a perfect honeymoon and I'd love to go back to Maui some time, and would absolutely stay at the Sheraton again. We walked over to the Westin but it seemed like a much more family oriented resort with a lot of kids, where-as the Sheraton had much more honeymooners.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Mini-Vacay”
Reviews.Author: sexydentist
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned home from a short trip to Maui. We both agreed that the Sheraton was an ideal place to stay. As you arrive, enter through the main entrance that says "Kaanapali Beach Resorts." This driveway leads you to several of the resorts, including Sheraton. You will pass a beautiful golf course and The Whaler Village shopping center, on the way to the hotel. When we arrived, valet was very welcoming and offered to answer any questions we had. I was able to check-in slightly early and it only took 5 minutes to check in. I booked an Ocean Front room and was upgraded to a Deluxe Ocean Front room. Room 6408. Building 6, 4th floor, southern most section of the building. Ok, yes, it is far from the main parts of the resort, but the pros out-weigh the cons. Building 6 has it's own private parking lot, so waiting for valet is unnecessary. The building is very isolated, quiet, and private. The deluxe room is 100 square feet larger than the other rooms and also has a convenient microwave. Being on the far south wing of building 6, we had a "million-dollar view" of the Pacific Ocean, Black Rock, and Lanai/Molokai. Most of the time, the only thing you could hear was the ocean. So, of course, the disadvantage was the distance to the beach & resort pool/restaurants. From the 4th floor of building 6, we had to take an elevator down to the 3rd floor, cross a breezeway to building 5, take an elevator the 8th floor, cross another breezeway, and take another elevator to the 1st floor. The breezeways are scenic and it's a good workout. Just don't forget something in your room! We had a breakfast buffet included with our package. The ocean/pool views from Keka'a Terrace were so pretty to see in the mornings. There's an omelet station, other warm breakfast items, fruits, pastries, etc. I liked how I could sprinkle chopped macadamia nuts and coconut shavings on my pancakes! Not spectacular, but lots of variety and nourished you until lunch. Vicente was one of our very friendly and attentive servers. The Cliff Dive Bar was a great place to get drinks and appetizers while we were at the pool or beach. $7 cocktail drinks at Happy Hour. Tasty buffalo wings. Their Maui Mojito was one-of-a-kind! Awesome place to hang out (especially to watch the Cliff Dive Ceremony at sunset). On our first time there, Linsey was a great server! The Reef Lounge has Internet computers and a printer. They have a late Happy Hour from 8-10pm. $7 martinis and local beers. There's also a Starbucks kiosk for you coffee junkies. But get there early because I think its only open in the morning. Its on the same floor as the check-in desk. The beach rentals at the resort were very expensive! Blackrock Rentals charged $20/day for a snorkeling set. If you walk 8 minutes down to the Whaler Village, you'll find Maui Dive and Surf Shop (next to Leilani's at the Beach restaurant). Snorkel rentals are $8/day. The resort pool was fairly clean. Water was cold but refreshing if the weather is hot. You have to give "towel cards" to be able to check out pool towels. You also need to show proof of being a Sheraton guest at the pool kiosk, so you can get a yellow bracelet to swim in the pool. Get there early or you won't find a chair. Ahhhh! The beach was gorgeous! The sand is very soft, unlike in Waikiki. Blackrock is a great place to go for beginning snorkelers and scuba divers. The water is very calm and the fish are friendly. My husband and I saw many schools of fish. Another snorkeler saw rays! The beach in front of the Sheraton can get crowded because tourists from other parts of Maui also like to go snorkeling/scuba at Blackrock. Contrary to some of the other reviews, our room was cleaned every day, in the afternoon. The cleanliness was decent. I checked for bed-bugs, the moment we stepped in our room. No bed-bugs! However, I saw a cockroach in a breezeway, but what do you expect in a tropical setting?! The Sheraton grounds are so sprawling and are kept so beautiful! Compared to the other resorts, I really liked Sheraton because it never felt crowded (probably because it's so spread out). It's location next to Blackrock make it convenient for snorkeling/scuba-diving. The resort tends to get really quiet after sunset. Very peaceful. Aloha Mixed Plate (in Lahaina, on Front St) serves up some good local food. Leilani's on the Beach at Whalers Village has a delicious Crab & Shrimp Melt and Hula Pie dessert! Try the Seared Ahi Steak w/ caramelized onions and wasabi aioli at Fish Market Maui. The ABC Store at Whalers Village has cheap sundries and souvenirs. My husband and I did the Zipline Eco-Adventure (sign up online or at their kiosk/suite at Whaler Village) and UFO Parasail (sign up at their bright green umbrellas right on the sandy beach in front of Leilani's restaurant). Really great people run the activities! We booked our trip through AAA/Pleasant Holidays. They always give the best package deals for Hawaii! Thanks to my travel agent Eric Lasley at AAA! His customer service is impeccable! It was a perfect mini-vacay with my husband!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome with very minor tweeking”
Reviews.Author: jdpower56
Reviews.Content: Positives: whale & turtle watching right from room - Amazing Clean, well presented , friendly staff Opportunity for improvement: Pool areas & service stay open until diver completes evening dive Pool bars have a "carry 1 drink rule" - check your demographic, I see extremely few "one ofs", hence it should be a 2 drink limit so I can bring my spouse a drink without making two trips

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: DebfromNCarolina
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Maui, but the first time we have stayed at the Sheraton. All of the hotels on Kaanapali beach are amazing, but we liked the Sheraton the best! Our room was large, with a very comfortable king bed and large balcony with amazing ocean views. The grounds of this hotel are the prettiest I've seen and the location simply can't be improved on. The endess pool was wonderful-it never felt crowded even though we were there at a busy time (Thanksgiving and the Maui Invitational Tournament). Although we didn't eat often at the resort, the food we had was excellent-great breakfast buffet in the morning and a wonderful Thanksgiving buffet. (When my husband expressed disappointed at the lack of cooked green veggies at the buffet , the chef came out and offered to cook some especially for him. Now that's service!) . We were able to watch the sun set nightly from our balcony, as the torches were lit on the black rocks and the Cliff Diver took his sunset dive. Unforgettable! We try to go back to Maui every few years for Thanksgiving and the Tournament, and the Sheraton will be our resort of choice in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely captures the Aloha spirit!”
Reviews.Author: PrincessM7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our honeymoon. We absolutely loved it! We booked a partial-ocean view room, but to our surprise had (what we think) was an ocean front. We could see and hear the waves from our bed! It was truly amazing! I felt that everyone really captured what Hawaii calls "the Aloha spirit." Each and every staff were extremely friendly, always greeting us with an "Aloha" and a smile. The resort was clean, rooms were spacious. The pools were great, although very cold. We did not get a chance to try the spa. The nightly cliff dive was relaxing to watch during sunset at the poolside bar. They have cocktail hour from 3-5pm. We had the breakfast buffet included with our stay. There was a large variety and everything was delicious. We did not get a chance to try any of the restaurants (one was closed), but I'm confident that they were just as good. They also had a deal where every third night was free, so we paid for 4 nights and stayed for 6 (not bad!). The location was great, right on Kaanapali Beach. There is a path from the Sheraton to Whalers Village (shopping area/restaurants), which is about a five minute walk. Front Street (shops/restaurants/luaus/surfing) is less than a 10 minute drive. And there are lots of other restaurants and shops (including a mall) within a 10 minute drive as well. I would highly recommend staying at the Sheraton in Lahaina if you plan to visit Maui. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful week in paradise”
Reviews.Author: npc2010
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic week at the Sheraton Resort in Maui. This is our 5th stay at this beautiful property and it gets better and better. Check in was nice and easy, valet parked the car, bellman grabbed the bags and we were off to our room in a golf cart. We received room 4610 and let me tell you it was perfect. We had two balconies one facing the pool and the other facing the ocean and Black Rock. It was an incredible view. Slight problem with the A/C, called the front desk and it was fixed in ten minutes. Everyone at the resort could not have been more pleasant everyone had that "ALOHA SPIRIT". Breakfast was included in our room rate and the food was great. Variety and preperation was great. Concierge helped us with a snorkel trip and set up a tee time for golf, arranged for club rentals for my wife and I from a local vendor who delivered the clubs direct to the hotel. The location is perfect, we snorkeled Black Rock almost every day saw sea turtles, tons of tropical fish eals and rays. Pool was great, rented a gazebo on two of our beach days. Whalers village was just a short walk away and gave some nice options for dinner. Would like to go on and on about local restaurants and side trips but I need to go back to work to pay for this great trip. Thanks to everyone at the Sheraton for making this another special trip. We will be back next year the week after Thanksgiving can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found!!”
Reviews.Author: JamesW44
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write this review since we came back from our honeymoon and have just got round to it!! My partner and I were married in Las Vegas and decided to have our honeymoon at the Sheraton Hotel, Maui. My wife had previously stayed at this hotel some four years previously and loved the hotel and the island of Maui. It was a bit of a brave decision to return for our honeymoon (would I like it as much as she had done??). But she didn't need to have worried because I loved this hotel and location just as much as she did!! The Sheraton is a wonderful hotel, really luxurious and in possibly the most perfect location in the world. The hotel grounds are perfectly manicured and simply beautiful. The room was clean and modern with a very comfy bed. The pool was gorgeous - lots of different sections and areas to make it interesting. The dining rooms were also fantastic, we especially loved the indoor - outdoor dining experience. Our breakfast was included in the hotel price which we were very pleased about. The breakfast was awesome - everything you would ever want for breakfast!! The location of this hotel is wonderful, built right on Black Rock. We spent lots of time snorkelling around the rock, especially early in the morning when it was very quiet and saw fantasitc marine life. Our last day was the best when we swam with three green turtles, loads of colourful reef fish and eagle rays - it was stunning - all within 100yds of the beach!! I would just like to take the opportunity to thank the Sheraton Maui for making our stay and our honeymoon such a wonderful experience. Maui certainly has that ability to get into a persons soul - I think it is the beauty of the island coupled with the contentedness of the local people. We certainly can't wait to come back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly employees, but some misses”
Reviews.Author: travelnchica
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fabulous for snorkeling. One of the best locations for snorkeling in Hawaii is just steps away, which is super convenient when you are traveling with a toddler. My husband and I took turns watching our son while the other watched him. And, when I think of the huge effort it is to drive to a snorkel beach with a little one you really value location. Here, we woke up at 8 a.m. got dressed, grabbed some towels and hit the beach before 9 a.m. While later on our trip when we went to Hanamanu Bay in Oahu we had to wake up at 6 to get dressed, pack our stuff, get lunch and snacks, get in the car, drive, park and then carry all our stuff to the beach to get to the beach by 9 am. Huge difference. My vote is for location when traveling with small kids. And, then the pool was nice. I thought it was strange at first since it's more a meandering stream. It just looks visually different then an olympic size pool. But, my son loved it. It was fun roaming the pool. They had a hula dancer one afternoon. Another day they had a lei making class, and that man was soo friendly. Even with all the family activities, I did not see that many little children. The hotel seems to attract lots of early risers, who are out running and walking. We lucked out and got a free upgrade to the ocean view room that overlooked the pool. It was amazing view to wake up to! That view is all I remember about the room. I know there were minor things to whine about but they all pale in comparison to the view. Three weeks later I don't remember what the were. Most reviews are accurate. This place was not the fanciest place. But, I don't care about the lack of granite counter tops more than a fabulous location. I would say this place was near perfect except I was upset that one day housekeeping did not come to clean. We did leave our "do not disturb" sign was up past the late morning but I called and told them we were leaving and please come now. They never came! I called and complained and all I got an apology. But again after a free upgrade to an ocean view, I will still say I would come back here in a quick second and hope that I get that view again for a garden price.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME location with wonderful rooms, facilities, and service!”
Reviews.Author: juliette1417
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our time in Maui and loved every minute of it. The property and rooms are gorgeous and the location could not be better. The snorkeling at black rock was amazing and we saw tons of fish and the giant sea turtles. I was very impressed with the staff and service- especially Jun at the Mai Tai bar. I would recommend this place to ANYONE during a stay in Maui, the property is arranged so that it's perfect for everyone from families to couples looking for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Returns - It Keeps Getting Better”
Reviews.Author: 60993Rustygolf
Reviews.Content: We have been at the Sheraton 3 times now (once with extended family) and you can't beat the location, the facitities and the staff. Our every need was met - from golf arrangements, sunset cruises and the spa. We have stayed at hotels and condos up and down the Kaanapali shore but have found our favorite with Chip Bahout and his staff at the Sheraton. It is amazing how many beatiful pictures you can take of a single site,

Reviews.Title: “Great location..mediocre service and facilities.”
Reviews.Author: m1m2smom
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our Hawaii vacation last nite. We travelled with 3 other families. The Sheraton, Maui has a great location, but the bed bug bites and the way the staff handled the issue will leave a bad taste in our mouths forever!! 3 people in our group(from 3 different families) got bitten and were told our rooms would be checked out and they would get back to us, but we didnt hear about it later. Our children wanted a snack(croissants or such) with their milk, hot chocolate around 4.30-5 pm and we couldnt get anything! Poolside service was good. The restaurant has limited food choices and the food was not worth mentioning:-( A hotel of this calibre ought to have a 24hr coffee shop, especially since so many families with young children come here, and also considering how high their rates are! Great location, mediocre service and facilities.. D.K San Jose Ca

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING Resort!”
Reviews.Author: katikat1234
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from a week-long stay at the Sheraton Maui and LOVED the resort! I just cannot say enough for how beautiful the grounds are. The pool is fabulous and everything is kept in spotless shape. The staff was very friendly and helpful any time we needed anything. The only slight glitch in our entire stay was that we had requested a king bed, but ended up with 2 doubles. Since the hotel was 100% full the first night of our stay, we had to settle for the 2 doubles, but were switched to a king bed room the second day through the remainder of our stay. We booked a "garden view" room, but were put in a mountain view - absolutely beautiful views of the mountains and also a partial view of the ocean! The beach outside the hotel is fantastic as well, with great snorkeling. It is also a beautiful walk along the beach if you take the boardwalk either north or south of the hotel. There is close shopping and eating locations in Whalers Village, which is just south of the hotel. Also, if you are looking to take pineapples home - take a short walk to the Westin hotel lobby, located just south of the hotel. There is a stand there selling pineapples for $20 for a box of 6, much cheaper than the $45 that other outfits wanted. All around it was a great vacation and a fabulous resort in a fantastic location!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Destination”
Reviews.Author: To10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sheraton Maui Resort & Spa for our honeymoon and we definitely made the right choice! We were upgraded to a beautiful oceanview room as soon as they found out we were on our honeymoon and the staff was very friendly throughout our stay. The resort is stunning with very well kept and clean grounds, and the beach is by far the best in the Lahaina area of Maui. We'll be visiting Hawaii again next year and won't hesitate to stay at the Sheraton Maui Resort & Spa!

Reviews.Title: “The best beach in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Maui0505
Reviews.Content: We love this location of the hotel since we can do a lot of snorkeling at the black beach. It is the best location in Maui for snorkeling and you can enjoy all your time here.

Reviews.Title: “Best beach in Maui”
Reviews.Author: bozworth99
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel, situated on the best beach in Maui for swimming and snorkeling. I certainly felt it was worth the 4 or 5 star rating. The setting and landscaping was the best of any hotel I have seen yet. The pool was beautiful with waterfalls, a slide, and grottoes. On site restaurants were fine, but I preferred the local fare in LaHaina. Walking distance to Whalers' Mall and shuttle bus every 60 min. to downtown shopping and eating. The beds were very comfortable. Staff and service was impeccable! The clock radio was not working, and we had a new one delivered within 5 min.!

Reviews.Title: “"We have upgraded your room for your Honeymoon but it has 2 double beds"!”
Reviews.Author: sottilared
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Hawaii, we spent 5 nights at The Kahala on Oahu (thank god we stayed there first) I would have left Hawaii if we started out the Sheraton in Maui first. We are not your typical honeymoon couple in our 20's, we have traveled extensively through our lives, (staying at many Sheratons) and waited a long time for this event. The trip was booked through a travel agent I have used for many years. As we are checking in the young women advises us that we have been given an upgrade however the room has 2 double beds, IS THIS A JOKE we are on our honeymoon, I realize only one of the 1000 other couples your have checked in this year that say that, but come on. After looking at various rooms and 2 hours later, speaking to a manager that could care less, we check into the 'double bed' upgraded room. The next morning the useless manager contacts me, after spending 10 minutes on the phone with me wasting my time they are moving us to building 6. (all a waste as my travel agent contacted them to move us immediately, as I advised them to move me to another hotel.) We booked golf through the concerige 2x that never called us to confirm the tee-times I needed to follow up with them. The food was average, however the breakfast staff were very friendly I felt sorry for them to be at such a proorely managed hotel. We had dinner at the hotel and our server was the friendliest giving us suggested on what golf course to play in Wailea. The Luau is overpriced go to another hotel. When I would say hello to the staff through out the hotel they never looked or said hello back to me. I HAVE TO PAY TO RENT A CHAIR for the day at the beach, the pool chair people are on top of you! crazy. people come to all the other hotels to snorkel at the beach I felt like I was at the Jersey shore, everytime I returned to my towel from the water someone would be right next to me, am I invisible, do you see there is an entire beach hear? I actually really Hated Maui, and will never go back again, all we met where peoople from the west coast with timeshares and 2nd homes. Go to the 'Big Island' and visit the volcano for a relaxing time. Our last morning we are woken up at 7am to 2 women screaming next door off there balcony about the view, room etc... We spent over $1000 with the conceriage booking helicopter tours, luau etc, not even a thank you at check out. nor the staff person checking us out, didn't ask how our stay was etc.. NEVER AGAIN DO NOT STAY

Reviews.Title: “Had A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelChampDaMan
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Maui and, when I booked this hotel, it seemed a great value as part of a package deal and it was. We were upgraded to a better room when we arrived, from a mountain view to an ocean view room on the 6th floor. We had a great view of Black Rock, the ocean and the pool area. The snorkeling at Black Rock was great with lots of sea turtles that would swim up to Black Rock to eat every day. The snorkeling was actually better at the hotel than on the snorkeling tour we took, however, I still recommend taking a snorkeling tour to get out on the water and see some different fish. The pool was a really great pool with a lazy river. The rooms were very nice and clean. The location was excellent and just a short walk to Ka'anapali, which is a nice area to eat and shop. Our only complaint is that at around 10 pm when we first arrived to the Sheraton I asked if they needed my credit card that I used to book the trip. I was told to just bring it down to the front desk whenever it was convenient. We were off doing Maui stuff the next day and within 48 hours of arriving we had received 2 voice mails on the room phone while we weren't there and a written notice that our hotel purchasing privileges had been revoked. It was just kind of annoying since I had already offered up the card. If it wasn't for this we would have rated this hotel a 5. I would definitely still recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location- Not So Terrific Maintenance & Service”
Reviews.Author: EasyBigFella
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui in 2002. Loved it from top to bottom and side to side. The 3 nights we just spent there last week... not so much. It is absolutely true that the location at Black Rock is easy on the eyes, and great for snorkeling. It's also true that the grounds/ landscaping are beautiful. The current shortcomings are maintenance and service issues; carpet stains, seat cushion stains, gouged wallpaper, scuffed up furniture, and indifferent front desk people, cold restaurant hostesses, jerky beach chair rental guys. I will say the restaurant wait staff and housekeepers were terrific. We had been considering an additional 2 nights at the Sheraton, or heading down the coast to the town of Wailea (where we hadn't been on our first trip to Maui). With that in mind, we went to the front desk and expressed our dissapointment in the downward trend that the hotel was taking. The woman at reservations offered not one apologetic word, and obviously couldn't care less whether we stayed, or checked out. So we checked out. The Wailea Beach Marriott Resort & Spa was happy to have our business, and made sure we knew it. Aloha spirit was abundant, and the recent renovations were stylish and spotless. Thank You Sheraton Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own food, drinks, chairs; Old Sheraton spirit is gone”
Reviews.Author: xskywalkermom
Reviews.Content: Haven't stayed here since the remodel. Old Sheraton had such personality which I feel they've lost. Bldg. 6, the only ocean front, very expensive, soundproof,limited parking & long walk to everything. Rooms not worth price, just not classy enough to charge a St. Regis fee. EVERYTHING so overpriced for setting, I felt embarrassed for the hotel/staff. 98% of staff gracious & friendly. Grass area should have chairs/tables (?) to relax, such wasted space. Learned more from pool concierge in 5 min. then 5 visits to Lobby desks. Beach should be more information available & accessible/friendly. Chairs readily available to guests-prices posted. Maybe lower $40 wood chair cost. Flight arrived on time, 8:30 pm. NO FOOD available after 10pm on premises. We had to check in & leave to find a grocery store. Could they not have cheese/fruit or sandwiches availble? This must happen every day, very poor aloha spirit on their part. My 4th stay at this hotel, my last.

Reviews.Title: “Not where you want to stay”
Reviews.Author: Nystateomind
Reviews.Content: I found most of the staff to be rude and unfriendly. Beds were uncomfortable and the room decor boring. Many rules and regulations. Would not recommend it here

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: igetfuzzy
Reviews.Content: Over July 4th weekend, we had a very comfortable stay at this hotel. We had a regular partial ocean view room with a king sized bed. The room had a balcony and nice patio furniture for relaxation. Overall, no complaints and we had a wonderful long weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Highest Rip OFF Resort Fees on Maui $25/night”
Reviews.Author: PDXStocks
Reviews.Content: This Platinum SPG member was somewhat shocked when the desk clerk tried to SELL me an upgrade to a suite. Obviously the management has trained their staff well to say to their Platinum members, "we have a nice upgraded room for you." When you reply, did I get my Platinum Suite upgrade the staff member will say, "I have you already upgraded." I have run into this before. The management at this property will do anything they can to increase revenues. I called in a manager and asked her to explain what was happening. She then offered me a suite, but then talked me out of it saying it had no view, first floor, and was just a little larger room with an extra Murphy bed. I requested a suite upgrade in building 5 and then was flatly denied even though on both nights of our stay there were suites in building 5 that were dark (no lights) throughout our stay. These suites have great views but the hotel isn't about to upgrade you as a Platinum unless you're willing to part with additional dollars. SCAM. The hotel itself has a wonderful location, BUT it is old and dated. Really old and really dated. Sheraton constantly advertises the $6 billion + they have spent upgrading their properties, but NOT here. Other than newer carpet and an LG flat screen HD tv, our room was plain and boring. The physcal property is kept up and maintained but has not been updated like other resorts. It's simply old and aging with a terrific location on the beach which allows Sheraton for the time being to sit on their laurels and let guests put up with the quality in return for the location. The pool is the most boring of any major hotel on Kaanapali Beach. The chairs at the pool are in one of the smallest physical areas of any major hotel on Kaanapali beach. The chairs themselves are also of low quality and nothing nice. Towels in the room were of the worst quality we have seen at any hotel this year. I actually grabbed a staff member in the lobby and asked for new towels telling him that what was in the room, threadbare, frayed and thin should have been discarded a long long time ago. Two hours later new towels arrived, but in barely better quality than what we already had. I've never stayed at a Motel 6 or Best Western, but these were of such cheap quality that I would expect to see them in properties that don't even merit a rating. I wonder if other guests have noticed or care. And now for the resort fee, which is the highest on Maui. Yes, even higher than Hyatt Regency and the Ritz Carlton. Having stayed at both properties previously, I would encourage all guests at the Sheraton to visit the Ritz or Hyatt to view their hotels and ask to see their rooms. No comparison whatsover. The art work alone at these hotels (Sheraton has hmmmm...NONE) is phenomenal. So what do you get for your "resort fee" of $25? OH MY GOSH, free unlimited telephone calls! You mean I don't have to use my unlimited minutes on my cell phone? I have died and gone to heaven. AND I get to make toll-free calls also without paying a telephone charge. Aren't we all excited??? Now at least at the Westin down the beach you get free water for your resort fee. NOT here. It's only $5 a bottle. Ok, so you also get a free shuttle service if you want to visit one of the other Starwood hotels, BUT do not plan on using their pool, thats strictly a NO-NO. They only want you to visit their other properties on the "FREE" shuttle if you want to use their restaurants. Yes, dear guests, it's about revenues. What else do you get? Well the shuttle will drive you into Lahaina if you like. Since we have a rental car like about 99% of the guests on Kaanapali Beach, we don't need to be on a shuttle schedule, we can just get into our car and go. But wait, it's better than an infomercial. You also get internet service!!!! Yippeee, you don't have to use the free computers in the lobby, if you have your computer the internet is free. Now who cares if you're a Platinum member with SPG and the internet service is already included as a benefit of your status. Can you say, "RIP OFF." This is a huge scam in my opinion. There have been class action lawsuits on this charge in the past and I would hope another class action plaintiffs firm takes up the issue. It comes down to revenue. The hotels are struggling in a down economy to keep revenues up. They don't want to raise room charges, which is the fair thing to do, because it might impact occupancy rates, so they stick their guests with a "resort fee" that is high enough to increases daily rooms rates the equivalent of 5-10% and the guests don't run. I for one, don't have to put up with this crap. As a Starwood Platinum member my status is obviously not valued by the corporation. I'm not going to pay a resort fee for services I don't always use or services I already receive for free as part of my Platinum status. I would encourage guests who don't need the check-in or nights towards their status to boycott as I am in the future the properties that charge the resort fee. It will be fun to find the best hotels without resort fees and who knows I might just find another frequent stay program I enjoy better in the process! If enough guests balk at the fee it will go away. Furthermore, this particular property isn't that nice. Location is wonderful, but it's at best an ower to average quality experience. For $300 a night that Sheraton claims is a highly discounted rate I'm feeling like I overpaid. I could have just as easily Pricelined this for 1/2 of what I paid and had an equal if not better experience. With the many nights per year I'm in hotels, I don't need the extra check-ins and I'm not going to cater to Starwood ripping me off $25/night, the highest of any resort fee in Hawaii, so that they can jack up their revenues. My realtor just booked a multi night stay at another property through Costco and the normal "resort" fee was completely waived, so booking through certain travel providers may also help guests get around the "resort fee". Would I recommend this average property as a Platinum SPG who they tried to sell a suite upgrade? NOPE, unless I was paying a lot less per night and no resort fees. Mediocre doesn't cut it in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Pool, beach & Grounds were the best”
Reviews.Author: reddog58
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Sheraton Maui for three nights during a nine night Hawaiian Honeymoon vacation. Right off the bat, they upgraded us to a full ocean view room which also had a great view of the grounds. Even right after a windy night which left some debris lying around, they cleaned up in minutes. Always saw people picking up and keeping everything nice for the guests. As for the pool, probably, the best one I've seen and used with all it's twists, turns and small water slide & falls. My wife & I spent quite a bit of time in it. Otherwise. meals at the open air breakfast buffet were great, room was spotless and staff was friendly and professional. Loved it there and definitely want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton is a Fantastic Hotel that Exceeded our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Counselor4444
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are in our early 30's and stayed at the Sheraton Maui from 8/26-8/30 . We had been to Maui 3 years ago and stayed at the Westin, where we had a great time. Considering that "Westin" is supposed to be a bit of a higher end hotel, we were very surprised to find that we liked the Sheraton even more then the Westin. I am a frequent Tripadvisor user and read many, many reviews and did a lot of research before booking at the Sheraton. This hotel exceeded our expectations and this will probably be our hotel of choice in the future. After arriving at Kahului airport, we picked up our Alamo car rental. We had pre-reserved a convertible there. We were surprised to find that they wanted to charge us extra for having a spouse on the rental agreement. So, we didn't add one of us to the agreement. When we went to select our car, all of the Sebring convertibles were in bad condition. The convertible had many exterior scratches and the inside was horrible- cigarette holes in the carpeting and scraped paint on the dash and doors. It operated fine, but Alamo should replace these vehicles. We then drove to Ka'anapali Beach. This is probably one of the most beautiful 45 minute drives anywhere. We booked at the Sheraton using Priceline and because we were Starwood members, we were given a room upgrade upon check-in even though the hotel was 98% to capacity. We were each given a small shell lei at check-in, which was a nice gesture. Instead of checking in at the front desk, you check in at the bellhop stand. You are required during your stay to visit the front desk to give them a copy of your credit card and if you do not, they will call your room frequently. We were immediately whisked off to our room which was in building 3, which faced the pool and the ocean. The view was amazing. Our room was much, much bigger then our prior room at the Westin. Bedroom furniture was in fine condition as was the bathroom. This is not a 5 star hotel, so do not expect ultra luxury accommodations. But it was clean and well maintained. The lanai (balcony) was also much larger then the one we had at the Westin and to give you an idea of the size- it could have fit about 5-6 chairs on it. The TV was a decent sized LCD. Under the TV was a small fridge that fit our gallon size milk, a full size bottle of apple juice, some beer and wine. So, plenty big. The in-room safe was also a great size and easily fit our laptop (we have a 14" widescreen laptop, but it would fit bigger). Lots of drawers and cabinet space. The king size mattress was not the most comfortable for me but my husband had no complaints. We did not have any meals included in our room rate and we knew from our prior trip that the best idea is to stop off at the Safeway supermarket in Lahaina on the way to the hotel for breakfast foods, drinks and snacks. This saves money and is convenient. We picked up a gallon milk (approx $5), cereal (Multi Grain Cheerios were $5 but Cinnamon Life was $8- food and groceries are very expensive in Hawaii because everything is imported), juice, soda, water, beer, wine, etc. We also got smart mid-way through the trip and bought pre-made sandwiches at Safeway and put them in our fridge. (Huge ones to feed 3-4 people cost $9). This was great for lunch. We ate breakfast everyday on our lanai looking out at the ocean. Once for lunch we were lazy and ordered from the pool bar. Burgers and sandwiches were $14-18- pricey. I had the pulled pork sandwich which was very good. My husband had the flatbread pizza (which was an appetizer for $9) which he said was ok and was plenty big. We went to the gym at the hotel a few times. It is small but well equipped- a few bicycles, treadmills and ellipticals. There was some free weights and some weight training equipment. It is a bit confusing to find. TIP: Even if you don't want to go to the gym, walk there one day. There are some beautiful views along the way. The pool: beyond fantastic. Sadly, the hotel does a very poor job of photographing such an amazing pool. I thought it was only going to be one round areaâ€¦. Instead it is fairly large with lots of waterfalls, narrow lagoons, a deep section, a children's area, and even a slide (which both adults and kids loved). Contrary to other reviews, pool chairs were always available at any time of day. BUT if you want a chair in the shade, you will need to get to the pool by 10ish to reserve a chair in the shade. Even though the resort was 98% full when we were there, the pool was never crowded and we enjoyed the pool immensely. There is one hot tub towards the middle of the pool area- it is a bit hidden and we didn't find it until our last day. The hotel gives out wristbands to use the pool each day (you get them while you are sitting by the pool). This ensures that only Sheraton guests can use the pool. They verify both room number and last name to get a wristband. When you check into the hotel you get towel cards which you exchange by the pool for towels. You must turn these cards back in when you checkout. The beach: soft sand, very light ocean current. Fantastic snorkelling at Black Rock. You only have to snorkel out a few feet to see fish. Although if you are a good enough swimming to swim out to black rock point, you'll see even more fish. Water was a tad cool, but still comfortable. Water was crystal blue. Excellent visibility. The hotel does not give you beach chairs, so we left all of our gear on chairs by the pool and went to use the beach. Bring your own snorkel equipment if you can (or buy some at the Costco or Kmart by the airport before coming to the hotel), or rent in Lahaina. It is much more money to rent snorkel equipment at the Sheraton. If you want a beach chair, you have to pay for it. So, instead we would leave our items on chairs near the pool and go to use the beach. Always leave any items of value in your hotel room safe. Hotel grounds and miscellaneous: Again, even though the hotel was so full, we never noticed. The hotel sits on a very large piece of property so no one feels crowded. The grounds are well maintained with lush foliage. Staff was very friendly. The hotel gives each room 45 minutes of free internet access in the business area located on the lower level below the lobby- you can use this to print your boarding pass if the computer by the lobby isn't working. There is also internet access in all rooms but you need to use the room's network cable (no wireless internet). There is a $25 resort fee per day. This is mandatory and includes 1 valet parking, unlimited self-parking, in room internet access, and use of the gym. The parking lot on the left when you enter the grounds is only designed for compact cars, which makes parking rather difficult if you are in a convertible (which we were). We found parking much easier on the roof level. We were then informed towards the end of our trip that there is another small outdoor lot by the tennis courts by Building 3 that we could use. It was much more convenient but smaller. We didn't use the tennis courts, but there were 3 and they seems new and very nice. Hotel layout: While the grounds are beautiful, the buildings were clearly not built at the same time. This led to a very disjointed feel when moving from building to building. Often times you have to go up and down levels as you move through buildings since not every level had access to the adjacent building. For instance, we were on building 3, level 2. We had to go up to level 3 to cross to one building, then up to 8 to another and then down to 7 where the gym was. This was a little confusing at times, but most of the breezeways are outdoors with some nice scenery. Check out: check out was just as easy at check in. We had a late flight and were able to use the shower in the fitness facility after we checked out before our flight. On our prior trip we did the molokini/turtle town snorkel (great), Old Lahaina Luau (great), bus up to Haleakala (rained so we couldn't see sunrise) and the drive to Hana. So, this time we did a bunch of activities on our own- one day we drove to Kahului, then to Iao State Park to see the Iao Needle, then down to Wailea. In Kahului we ate at Da Kitchen- they serve the famous mixed plate lunches (mixed plate- you get your entrÃ©e with a scoop of rice and a scoop of macaroni salad). I will post a review. Iao State Park was nice and did not take up too much time. Gorgeous views up in the mountains. We then drove down to Wailea to see what the resort area was like down there. We parked at Polo Beach and used the public beach in front of the Fairmont. We agreed that we liked Ka'anapali beach much better. Maui Swap Meet: Every Saturday there is a small flea market at the Maui Community Center in Kahului. You pay .50 per person to enter. There are produce stands, crafts, t-shirts, etc. The produce stands are great- make sure to buy and try some local produce including apple-bananas (baby bananas that taste sweet like apples), great mangoes, and other assorted unusual fruit. The swap meet on Oahu is much bigger and better but if you are only staying on Maui, go here for t-shirts and souvenirs. We ate lunch and dinner at a variety of places: Leilani's on the Beach, Pacific-O, Da-Kitchen, Lahaina Pizza Company, Moose McGillicuddy's. I will post separate reviews for these places. Shopping: We went three nights to Lahaina. You can take the Sheraton's free hotel shuttle or drive. We drove and had no issues finding parking. You can get free parking on the main strip in Lahaina or pay $6 to park in a lot. Lots of silver and gold jewelry shops, souvenirs, t-shirts, art, etc. We found this to be the best place on Maui to buy gold jewelry (you can haggle). Tons of restaurants here. Tips: -If you plan on eating breakfast in your room, pack some disposable bowls and utensils to save money on buying them in Hawaii. You could even consider packing a box of cereal. -Use Tripadvisor to find less expensive restaurant alternatives -Definitely eat at some restaurants that are mostly used by locals- you'll get better value and get to experience some great island cuisine -Try new foods- Mixed Plate, Fresh Fish, Shave Ice, etc. -Try to avoid buying food at the hotel to save money. -Bring inflatable rafts/toys (rings, balls etc) from home and blow them up on the beach to save money. This is great fun for kids and adults. -Buy your own snorkel set (mask and snorkel) before coming to Hawaii or buy one at the Walmart or Costco or Kmart in Kahului before you go to your hotel. You can buy a set for $10-$20. You can rent them in Hawaii, but it costs the same, if not more and its always best to have your own set. (Fins are also good to have but not necessary if you don't have the money) -Bring an underwater disposable camera in your airplane carry on bag and have the airports hand check it so the film is not destroyed. Enjoy!!!! (We did!)

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location (Kaanapali Beach, Lahaina, Maui)”
Reviews.Author: TravelingLightly
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton in Lahaina, Maui was our first stop on a three-island honeymoon. We spent 6 days, 5 nights at the hotel. Our package included a daily breakfast buffet and the steep $25 resort fee which included things like parking, WiFi, and free local calls (within Maui). Check-in was a breeze - no credit card needed. Just show an ID, and get your room key. (If you make room charges later, they'll ask for a credit card on file.) We started off on the wrong foot when the power went out in the entire resort, just 20 minutes after we got there. All we wanted to do was shower & sleep after a long flight, which was nearly impossible in the pitch black. Wish they had given us some notification of what was going on, but they did not. We saw employees placing glowsticks down the hallways to give a little bit of light. Thankfully the power returned after about 90 minutes and we were able to get our act together. We still have no idea what happened or why they thought glowsticks would help, BUT everything was great after that! Breakfast buffet was excellent, with a ton of choices: fresh fruit, homemade baked goods, choose your own omelet station, bagels & lox, a rotating selection of french toast, pancakes, etc. And the bacon was hands-down, some of the best bacon I've ever had in a restaurant. Not to mention that the setting for breakfast, looking out onto the manicured gardens, the pool, and the ocean, was just superb. The hotel grounds are beautiful, but the best part is the pristine beach it fronts. Kaanapali Beach, just steps from our hotel room, was one of the nicest beaches we've ever been on. It takes the cake for swimming and snorkeling with its warm, clear, and calm water. We saw all sorts of fish, sea turtles, and coral just by swimming a few feet out. The beach was a nice, safe place for children of all ages. The only downside is that everyone knows about this place, so it can get crowded. As a backup, you can explore the beautiful pools at the hotel, which are almost as enjoyable. The Sheraton is also convenient to the town of Lahaina, with a shuttle bus that takes you directly from the hotel into town. There are great shops, restaurants, a museum, and the nice Banyan Tree Park in Lahaina. The hotel has activities such as yoga, pilates, hula dancing class (more for the little ones), intro to scuba, intro to snorkeling, etc. Some require an extra fee. It also hosts a luau which we did not attend, but caught glimpses of from our room. It did not seem as nice as the one we attended, the Old Lahaina Luau. Overall, the hotel excels because of its location on the beach, close to town and convenient to the highway to travel around the rest of Maui. The grounds are well-kept and the pools and beaches make it a must-see.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Sheraton Maui”
Reviews.Author: Oldsurfer250
Reviews.Content: My wife and I bought a 3 night stay at the Sheraton Maui at a silent auction for the Friends of Missing Children Hawaii. We used it for our honeymoon. We were upgraded to a beautiful suite. I have never been treated so well. All the staff remembered our names. The restaurants and bars were great. Everything in Maui is pricey, so the prices were pretty standard to other restaurants, but the food and service was excellent. The pool, beach and grounds were very nice and very well kept. We hardly left the resort. We met some other couples and had a great time. Thank you Sheraton Maui Resort and Spa and Friends of Missing Children Hawaii. We had a wonderful honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with best location on Kaanapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: cruzrmomma
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! It's a bit spread out, but not a big deal. Food options pool side a bit limiting, only one salad, a boring chicken ceasar. Nice staff, pushy salespeople in the lobby trying to sell Westin timeshare, so avoid the 'welcome gift' of a flimsy bag, unless you want to do the tour. Rooms are large and comfy. Total 70's' timewarp in the rooms, takes me back-love it! Nice to have fridge and microwave. maid service prompt and good. Best beach, nice pool with some fun little swim throughs. We toured other properties-would choose this one even over the Westin, felt very Hawaiian! Thanks for the great stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: SpikeDaisy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton in a garden view room for 8 nights recently. The location is perfect, in front of one of the best beaches in Maui and great snorkeling right off the beach.
