The grounds are immaculately cared for and the pool area was our favorite hangout in the morning. We walked around other hotel grounds in the area and really felt that the Sheraton was by far the nicest. The rooms were tastefully furnished and very clean. The garden view was very pretty and we were glad we didn't pay for an ocean view room. We really didn't spend that much time in our room to justify the upgrade cost. In addition, there are so many places in Maui to take in an amazing view it seems silly to pay for it. The service was courteous and efficient, we had a key issue and an A/C issue during our stay and both issues were resolved in less than 10 minutes after we notified them. Overall, a wonderful stay and we wouldn't stay anywhere else if we return to Maui. Just a few tips on restaurants to try during your stay: We really enjoyed Mala, Pineapple Grill, Seahouse for breakfast, David Paul's Island Grill, and Pacifico. Also, make sure to try Ululani's Hawaiian Shaved Ice.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley Stunning!”
Reviews.Author: MrsFEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights. Gorgeous hotel, including the rooms, grounds and beach. Nice pool with jacuzzi. Beach is good for snorkelling but beware the waves are very powerful. Knocked me flying several times! Some days were calmer than others. There is a sea turtle that comes to feed on the moss on the black rock and we saw him every time we went in. Im not a very good swimmer so I rented a snorkelling belt from the hotel and it was well worth it. Apparantly it is cheaper to rent one in town. I think I will buy myself one to take with me on future holidays. We went to the beach bar just about everynight to see the cliff dive. The sunsets were stunning and obviously different everyday. The beach bar serves snack foods and there are a couple of restaurants and an indoor bar for when the beach bar closes (8pm). There is a path along the beach to the whalers village. This is not what we expected, very loud and commercialised. We had a couple of meals here. Was ok for shopping during the day tho. There is also a free shuttle bus to the local town, Lahaina. This is worth a trip. Much more 'Hawaiian'. We found the bars and restaurants very expensive so most of the time tried to catch the happy hour where we could.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jomt
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from one of our yearly trips to Maui. I must say that I read all the reviews as I always do which plays a part in deciding where we will stay. Throughout the whole trip I kept asking my family, "How could anyone complain about this hotel?". Sure nothing in life is completely perfect, but this hotel comes close. When we checked in I asked to be upgraded to an ocean view from our reservation of garden view. They said it depended on availability and sure enough we were upgraded. I do agree that the view makes a difference, but there was no guarantee we would get it. My advice is to pay for what you want just in case you don't get upgraded. You should not be upset if you don't get upgraded as that is not what you booked. It was icing on the cake to be upgraded. Next time I wouldn't risk it or count on it and just pay outright for the upgrade, just in case. Sure no one likes to pay a resort fee, but any nice hotel charges for these. Get over it! Yes the food can be expensive, but again, that is expected. You are staying at a luxury resort, on vacation. Plan on paying for these extras and don't be disappointed. There are no hidden fees, it is just the way it is. If you don't like it, stay elsewhere. I don't think the resort is too spread out as some have said. I can't really complain about anything. We have stayed at the Westin and the Kaanapali Alii so we are use to nice resorts. I must say that this is one of the nicest and I definitely plan on going back. The beach is great, the snorkeling great, the pool very tropical and not ordinary. The rooms are spacious (for a hotel, and non-condo) and there is a refrigerator which you don't often find at hotels. To save money you can buy some sandwhiches or the like for a meal or two. In reading the last review, who cares what the parking garage is like?! That's not your room. I just don't understand some of these complaints and believe me, I can be very picky. We had a small problem with our room (plumbing issue) but Laura DeMott was very receptive. Sure some staff are friendlier than others but again, if someone is not over the top nice, is that going to ruin your trip?! In sum, all I can say is I am counting the days (and I've only been home 2 days) until we can go back. I absolutely love the Sheraton Maui and I can't possibly see why anyone would not feel the same way. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: San Diego is best
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stopped at Walmart near the airport for supplies before heading out to the Sheraton-an easy 30-40 min drive. There is also a Costco & K-Mart in the airport area. After a pit stop in Paia for fish tacos (as seen on "Diners, Drive-ins and Dives"), we arrived at the resort just before sunset. The 1st day of valet parking is included in the $25/day+tax resort fee. If you don't get the car & self park after that, it's $5/day. You can pick up your room key right at valet parking, along with a shell lei greeting. We, however, requested a king bed and were given 2 fulls, so we headed to the front desk to see if we could make a change. The young lady there (I think her name was Jenny or Lindsey) was wonderful. The hotel was at 95% occupancy but she was able to switch us to a king room after 1 night. Off we went to room 3428 for 1 night. Now, the resort is really spread out-we were in bldg 3, 4th floor, room 28 which looked directly across the lawn to the ocean and Lanai. Spectacular!! The room itself was great, nice bathroom, the usual mirrored sliding door closet, flat panel tv & a large dresser which housed the mini-fridge plus drawers for clothes. The balcony was roomy enough for a small table & 2 chairs. Except for the 2 full beds, it was perfect. Day 2 we switched to room 4202 (bldg 4, 2nd floor, rm 2). This room is on the corner of bldg 4, directly over the spa, so it was angled a little. The view was partly towards the resort, and partly down the Kaanapali coast-still a lovely view with a roomy balcony. All the same room amenities but the smaller closet was inside the bathroom, which was sometimes inconvenient for 2 people. In either room, we never heard any other guests except when sitting on the balcony. Both rooms were nicely maintained. We met a couple who snagged Sheraton Preferred Guest status and were given a room in bldg 5 which looked out over the ocean to Molokai. It was a little trickier to get to, but they said the view was worth it. Speaking of tricky to get to, the fitness center had all the basics once you found it (down the hall of bldg 4, up the elevator to the 8th floor, down the hall in bldg 6, to the elevator & then down to the 7th floor.) The wonderful discovery along the way was the rotunda on the 8th floor. Beautiful views, especially of the cliff diver at sunset. It is also the location of yoga & pilates classes some mornings ($10 fee). The breakfast buffet ($27 pp if not included in your package) had a nice variety, but nothing to really rave about. Everything we tried was good, not great, but good. We ate dinner in the Black Rock restaurant (expensive but good), the Reef Lounge (less expensive, more casual & also good); snacks at both the Mai Tai & Cliff Diver Bars poolside (recommend the chicken skewers). Longboard Ale $7 per plastic cup or Coors Light $5; other beers in a can plus all the tropical drinks with umbrellas $10+. We enjoyed the pool, which everyone agreed was on the chilly side of refreshing. It is generally around 4-5" deep, with shallower & deeper ends (for kids & scuba school). There's also a "lazy river" which meanders nicely around from one end to the other, a welcome change from the standard rectangular pool. We took the shuttle (included in the mandatory resort fee) into Lahaina, which stopped at the Cannery Mall, Hilo Hatties & Lahaina Center (across the street from the Cannery Mall). There are grocery stores at the 1st & last stops and Front St. is just a stroll from Hilo Hatties. The resort had Hawaiian cultural activities daily (around 11-12 noon) , poolside near the Cliff Dive bar, such as lei making & hula lessons. We took a "behind-the scenes" tour with executive chef Brian who taught us how to make quick crab wontons & decorative pineapple carving. Thanks, Chef!! Whalers Village is a short stroll down the beachside sidewalk for more eating & shopping choices. The Westin is just beyond that. As for the mandatory resort fee, which seems to be a growing trend in the industry, just include it in the room rate when comparing different resorts. We have no complaints, much to compliment and can't wait to return. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location! Beautiful grounds.”
Reviews.Author: pennyhoney
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing. How do they cut the grass so short? My husband, 2 year daughter and I bought my parents here. We walked along the beach to Whaler's Village, and everyone concedes the Sheraton is much more luxurious than the other hotels. Westin was nice, with their fat koi, black swans and pink flamingos. But the grounds were jammed packed with the pool and animals. Sheraton's grounds are spacious and wide, it was just beautiful. I just love the fact that the ocean is RIGHT THERE! I needed to impress my 72 yr old dad....and this did it. I booked through Pleasant Holidays, and paid $1800 for two for air, hotel and car. When we arrive, we were told we were upgraded free from the Garden Terrance to Mountain View. I read some people got free upgrades from Garden to Ocean, but that didn't happen to us. I inquired about the ocean view upgrade, and was told it will be $150 extra per day for Bldg 6. We declined, and settled on the 3rd floor in Bldg 3 facing the mountains and golf course. The view was very nice, but of course, I was jealous of those who got the ocean upgrade. I really wonder how some can get the ocean upgrade for free. Room service was good, up until the last day. They came in at 930am, and we said we were not ready. We put the card out, and from 2 to 6pm, we went to the beach. They never came to clean the room. When I called front desk, they immediately sent someone up to give us new towels...so that was ok. The sitting area of Bldg 5 is amazing. I recommend everyone go there and sit and enjoy the view there. The parking structure near Bldg 1 and 2 is gross and old. We parked there the first night, and that location made my husband very disappointed. Dank and old. The 2nd day, we explored the better areas of the hotel, and he was much happier. The pool is very nice. Not your regular rectangle pool, but a meandering one with a little slide. My parents loved it. I loved the fake waterfalls, and we took pics that made it look like I was at the real waterfall. Black Rock is great for snorkeling. We saw giant turtles!!! My husband jumped off the Black Rock. I recommend you buy an underwater camera to film/capture everything! I will recommend this hotel if you stay at Ka'anapali Beach. The other hotels except the Westin along the beach is old and gross...

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: calicathy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Maui for our 20th anniversary for 5 nights at the end of September. I got a great deal on Travelocity and booked the best hotel I could afford with the least expensive "garden view" room. Upon arrival we were given a free upgrade to an ocean view room! The only down side was that it had 2 queen beds instead of 1 king, but that was fine with us. The room and view were absolutely amazing, full view of the ocean on our own private balcony. We were on the 4th floor front and center. The grounds here are beautiful and the pool is incredible, a winding lagoon with waterfalls and even a small waterslide. The pool bar is so much fun, we felt like we were in paradise. The best part for us was the beach in front right on Black Rock. We brought our own snorkel gear and as soon as you step in the water, you feel as if you've stepped into a tropical aquarium. We saw tons of fish and farther out one day was a group of 4 stingrays that swam right under us! The next day we swam with giant sea turtles for hours right on the shore! Another great thing about this hotel was the trail that leads to Whalers Village just a short walk away. We ate there every night, The Hula Grill and Lailanis Grill were so affordable and right on the shore. Our biggest problem was we just didnt want to leave. We are already saving for our trip back, just gonna take a while because we are going to bring the kids next time! Thank You Sheraton for a trip of a lifetime!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: Blakely57
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton during our stay in Maui for 5 days. We had a great time here and were very impressed and pleased with the hotel. I had a very difficult time deciding where to stay, we were deciding between The Sheraton, The Westin and The Ritz. We went to both the other properties to look around and we were very happy with our choice. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The grounds are beautiful, clean and well maintained. We were upgraded from our garden view room we had booked to a deluxe ocean view room. The room was great we were on the top floor and the view was wonderful. The only thing that seemed a little dated was the bathroom. It was large but the tub/shower wasnâ€™t the greatest. I donâ€™t remember what the price difference was between a garden view and ocean view but if we hadnâ€™t been upgraded we probably would have been disappointed with the room. I didnâ€™t think I cared about the view â€¦ I was totally wrong! Breakfast was included in our room price so we got a deal on it. It was fairly good and it was convenient but I would not pay $25 per person for it. There wasnâ€™t that much variety from day to day and food was never really hot. There are plenty of places in walking distance to eat so getting breakfast would not have been an issue. The beach at the hotel was great and we really enjoyed snorkeling here. We saw tons of fish, sea turtles, octopus, sea anemones ect. Most of the coral is dead around here but thatâ€™s probably from all the people we saw walking all over it and grabbing onto it to get up on the rocks. The only real negative I can say about this place is all the extraâ€™s they want you to pay for. The $25 resort fee for use of the internet and gym is ridiculous I have never been to a hotel where this isnâ€™t included in the cost of the room. The internet in the room isnâ€™t even wireless! They also charge for use of chairs at the beach itâ€™s a beach resort Iâ€™m not really sure why you have to pay for a chair. There rental equipment fee for floats and snorkel equipment is very high as well. You can buy your own for less than it would cost for you to rent for a day. I would have preferred to pay more money for the room upfront than have to pay resorts fees and to use chairs at the beach. Overall would defiantly recommend this hotel to others, please feel free to contact me if you have specific questions about the hotel or Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, hotel and wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: light3572
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 12th anniverary here and first of all the hotel was in great shape and was not crowded. We had a 1st fl deluxe ocean front room in building 6. Now building 6 is the furthest building on the resort so if you are looking to be in the mix of everything this is not the building however this building has the best view of the ocean, Lanai and Molokia islands. So if you do not mind walking then this should not be a problem. Breakfast was plentiful with hot and cold choices. Staff was attentive and friendly. The beach and Black Rock was also a great way to relax and snorkel, swim and dive ("jump") off of Black Rock. It was windy the first day and the water was quite rough so be careful if you are not a good swimmer. All in all I would stay here again, in the off season.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST”
Reviews.Author: eggbert_tg
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Maui is actually a giant resort complex, and it is INCREDIBLE!!!!! If I ever go back to Hawaii again, I'd like to just go here and forget the rest of the islands. The complex is right on the beach and the setting has to be the closest thing to paradise that exists anywhere on earth. Seriously -- I doubt if there is a nicer place, anywhere! The breakfast is included and it is superb. The pool area is perfect. Note that there is a resort fee of $25 a day tacked on -- This was not included in the tour package we bought. The resort fee includes internet. The location -- Lanaia -- has unlimited sunshine. The hotel location is good for the other things to do on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Average+”
Reviews.Author: ginauf
Reviews.Content: Though weâ€™ve traveled the world, this is our first trip to Maui, so we werenâ€™t sure what to expect. When you pull up to the resort, it definitely has impressive view and a beautiful lobby. The first night has complimentary valet, so they parked our car while we checked in. Check in, however, was quite a lengthy process â€“ we waited a solid 15 minutes in line during our check-in and when it was our turn, our room wasnâ€™t ready. The upside of this is that they upgraded our room so we didnâ€™t have to wait for our assigned room, so it was worth the 15 min wait. Since we booked a honeymoon stay, they included a private label â€œSheraton Maui cuveeâ€� bottle of champagne in our room. The hotel itself is ocean front and an amazing view. As far as snorkeling goes, itâ€™s ho-hum. The water is crystal clear, calm, safe, and warm enough to hop in in October, but the much touted Blackrock has little/no live coral and a few schools of the same fish, much like the rest of the onshore accessible snorkeling spots that we scouted around the island. My husband did see 3 sea turtles while paddle boarding ($30/hr to rent the board) and some other guests mentioned that they saw some eagle rays from the shore around dusk. Know in advance that you will be doing some walking. To get from building 6 to the lobby/where breakfast is, it takes 3 separate elevators and several breezeways to walk to and from. We workout daily, but this could be a problem for elderly folks. The grounds and pools are very nice and beautifully manicured - there is a section for kids so you can avoid that if you don't have any in tow. There is even a tiny in-pool water slide (maybe 2-3 foot drop) to entertain the little kiddies. As far as the room goes â€“ it smelled weird and someone woke us up every morning by smoking in front of our A/C intake. Cigarettesâ€¦just what you want to wake up to in paradise. Not the hotelâ€™s fault, but maybe some signs could be posted. The ocean breeze can't be beat though - that was fabulous. The bathroom was a decent size, but the paint was peeling off the ceiling in the shower, so definitely not top notch. The bed was comfy, enough closet space, safe, ~32â€� LG flat panel TV, a wicker lounger, a small ocean facing balcony, and a small fridge was all in the room. Lots of little birds, including quail, were chatty in the morning â€“ something both my husband and I loved. There is wired internet in the room with about a 4 foot cord â€“ not sure why they just donâ€™t make the place wireless, but there are hotspots throughout the property. Access was included with the $25/day resort fee (which also included gym and parking). We booked a package which included breakfast vouchers, which you can use as the Sheraton, Westin (next door), and another Westin down the street. There is a complimentary shuttle that will take you between the resorts and to Lahaina on an hourly basis. We ate at both the Sheraton and the Westin next door and the Sheraton breakfast was the clear winner â€“ it was way better, but with a garden view. The Westin next door won the ambience award for breakfast as we ate facing the ocean. We ate at the BlackRock Restaurant for their post 8pm BOGO dinner. The service was really slow, no bread plates, the server forgot to ask for our drink order until after our dinner was served, and the food was average (mine was really salty). Since it was a BOGO deal, I couldnâ€™t complain, but if we were paying full price, I would have talked to a manager. Parking was an annoying ordeal at night â€“ there isnâ€™t enough of it near our building (6) so you have two choices, park in a loading zone and get a no-fine hotel â€œticketâ€� or schlep yourself back to the front desk and the hotel will then valet your car for free that night and golf cart you back to your room. It was definitely frustrating after a night on the town. Overall, an average experience. I think if I returned to Maui, Iâ€™d either go really cheap on the hotel stay since we donâ€™t spend much time at the pool or dial it up and stay in Kehei, Wailea, or Makena at one of the nicer resorts on a nicer (seemingly less touristy if that is possible) part of the island.

Reviews.Title: “10 yr anniversary”
Reviews.Author: danada97
Reviews.Content: excellent place to spend my time unwinding. after a 12 hr flight i was surprised to hear we had been upgraded from our garden view room to a deluxe ocean front room. snorkeling with turtles was a highlight for the trip as well as the luau. breakfast buffet was amazing. I truly have no complaints about the sheraton, i will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jkno77
Reviews.Content: First off, we have never written a review on Trip Advisor but we enjoyed our stay here so much we felt it would be beneficial to other travelers looking into this resort. The hotel was magnificient, clean, not crowded, well staffed, the list goes on and on. The beach is beautiful and snorkleing is great, although just around Black Rock at the "Airport Beach" as the locals call it may be the best snorkeling there. The only negative thing I can say is the food and drinks are very expensive but then again, everywhere on the island is the same. If you are looking for a local food joint that is good, on the beach, but inexpensive, go to Aloha Mixed Plate next door to the Old Lahina Lua. You won't be disappointed. We will definitely stay at the Sheraton again if we ever get the privilege of going back. It was a perfect vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Never underestimate the Sheraton Maui"”
Reviews.Author: sandyliret
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with the hotel - the cleanliness, staff, amenities were more than adequate. We were hesitant at first because it seems "generic" but the purpose is to see the sights - not stay in the room - although it was inviting with a double balcony over the beach rocks, pool, and able to watch the luau and hear the music from the room. Cannot say enough about this facility and the people who are employed. OUTSTANDING...... Ana at the front desk was wonderful, Alnu and Grace for the luau tickets went out of their way to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but would not return”
Reviews.Author: Gemma_8_1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was large, staff were friendly. we booked a standard room but were upgraded at check in and had a room with an ocean view. Room was clean and spacious but the bathroom was a bit dated, and the bed was a double, so wasnt very big for 2 of us. We did have 2 double beds but only used one of them, would have been better off with 1 king or queen bed as you usually get in america. Pool was nice but wasnt very clean, one day walking to the beach we saw a dead rat on the path. Hotel was in a good location near to shops and restaurants and great snorkelling from the beach. You can buy cheap snorkelling equipment in the nearby ABC store, instead of paying the high prices at the hotel. I wouldnt stay here again because of the high resort fee of $26 per night, you also have to pay for sunbeds on the beach but there were plenty around the pool. Food and drinks in the hotel were expensive, we ate lunch there a couple of times for convenience but the food wasnt very good, definately not worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: surfgrl_10
Reviews.Content: the sheraton maui resort is a beautiful place to spend some time in maui. it is located on the picturesque kaanapali beach, prime location. the scenery is beautiful. in addition, concierge services were excellent - good for directions, suggestions, and bookings. all in all, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and luau”
Reviews.Author: ViaggioUSA1
Reviews.Content: We spent the entire week at the Westin Maui at Ka'anapali and unexpectedly had to stay an extra night and were forced to do so at the Sheraton because the Westin was booked. I admit I enjoyed my day and night at the Sheraton thoroughly more than the Westin. The Sheraton's location is better, with a better beach with clearer water and a coral reef with world class snorkeling right there. The grounds are fabulous and the hotel buildings are more appealing -- by comparison the Westin's facilities looked dated and in need of a renovation. The Sheraton's room (we had a oceanfront 3rd floor, two double beds) was meticulous. The Westin crowd is older and snootier -- the Sheraton's crowd is much younger and more, dare I say "middle class" but it was a wonderful place. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND the Sheraton's Luau -- in fact we attended it earlier in the week while we were at the Westin and were delighted with the food and entertainment. The only minor annoyances at the Sheraton were the pool card/deck chair "nazis" who patrol aggresively to make sure only residents are using the facilities and wearing bracelets and the coffee shop that is open for barely 2 hours a day. We ate at the Tepanyaki Restaurant on the grounds and it was fabulous -- highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach, disappointing rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ene-Liis
Reviews.Content: Love the beach, saw turtles on the first day. The pool is pretty good and everything is clean. We requested a king room, but were given 2 doubles. Requested a change and told to come back in 2 days. Came back in 2 days and told to come back the next. Starwood membership means nothing here. Pretty irritated by the run-around and feel like I'm in the middle of a 50's TV show sleeping in separate beds because the ones provided are too small. Seems stupid.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a couple”
Reviews.Author: shangmail
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel on expedia in a package including air and car rental. I got a decent price since I booked everything together. The stay at Sheraton was pleasant. We stayed for five days and went to most of the places on Maui. After we arrived, we spent most of our time to go around the island. On the last day, we decided to stay on the beach behind the hotel. We found this is the best beach on the island, smooth sand, low wave, very good place for swimming and snorking. If you are dying for beach,this is the place to go. There is a Safeway in a nearby plaza. The seafood kimchi is quite good. We often bought some in the morning for lunch when we were on road. The hotel was originally built for Japanese tourists. It was re-modeled in recent years.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't change a thing!”
Reviews.Author: Leigh_1610
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Maui and stayed at the Sheraton to celebrate our anniversary. We booked an ocean front room and we're pleased to discover upon our arrival that we had been upgraded to a deluxe ocean front room. Our room was in one of the buildings on the top of Black Rock, which meant we had quite a hike to the pool or beach. But the view from our room was breathtaking and worth every extra step it took us to get to the pool! Besides the beautiful scenery, if you stay on Black Rock, you have your own parking lot which was very handy. The room was very clean and we had no problems with noise. The elevators were amazaingly fast and seemed to be always "waiting" for us on our floor. Our reservation came with complimentary breakfast which was a fabulous way to start the day. The staff was extremely friendly and quite helpful in making recommendations for our excursions. We never had an issue finding a place to hang out around the pool, although the umbrella spots were taken by 8:00 am. The beach was very clean and was a favority spot for snorkeling, which made for some heavier traffic in the afternoon. I can't say we had anything negative to say about our experience at the hotel. It was fabulous and I would go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Met & Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Gandalf98
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 16 day trip to Hawaii - our 3rd trip. One of the highlights again for us was our stay at the Sheraton Maui on Kaanaplai Beach. We had an oceanfront room (6408) in the Moana bldg right on Black Rock. Though pricey, overall is was a stellar experience again. The views from the room are exceptional. Our Delta Vacation package included the breakfast buffet which was outstanding! The only recommendation would be to add screen doors going out to the lanai so that you could leave the glass door open at night at listen to the surf. Also highly recommend the Old Lahaina Luau while on Maui

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel - great stay”
Reviews.Author: lisalucchesi
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Sheraton Maui hotel for 9 nights as part of our honeymoon and really enjoyed our stay here. The hotel and surrounding grounds is impressive, right on the beach and with a good sized pool. The buffet breakfast is great and the hotel provides a free shuttle bus to the old lahaina town on an hourly basis for a good range of restaurants and shops - which are cheaper than in Kaanapali. Whalers village with selection of shops is also only 10 minutes walk from the Sheraton along the beachfront walkway. We had a ocean front room (upgraded from ocean view) although the view was obscured mainly by the trees but we could still see the ocean. the rooms are a little dated however, clean and spacious, the service great, we were always well attended do and we had no issues. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very ordinary - great location, great facilities, poorly managed”
Reviews.Author: andyha
Reviews.Content: We should have known it was not going to start well, when the transfer bus was sent to the bottom entrance and there was no one to greet us or help with the luggage. Even when we checked in in for 11 days and received and appreciated but expect upgrade (because of the length of stay) there was no offer from reception for assistance. We tried to organise dinner on a few occassions (only ended up eating in the hotel 4 times) but no one seemed to take responsibility. When we did deal with the staff it was like they were doing us a favour. The Mai Tai Bar (around the pool) is only open till 3pm. The staff seemed embarrassed by this and I found it amazing that you wouldn't do everything to keep guest in the hotel and not going elsewhere. We ended up eating at the Whalers Village or in Lahaina - both places worth going to with better management then the Sheraton. My wife and I noticed that items were still on the floor for days and that the bed was rudimentarily made. We decided to leave these in place - not removed in 11 days. Which is why we did not tip housekeeping. I tip well in Australia and wherever I travel but to assume you can load 15-20% onto guests when you are already charging excessive amounts and then receive average to poor service - why would you tip? We didn't get great sleep but that was partly our mistake. Don't take the offer of 2 double bed room even if in a better location. Two adults cannot sleep comfortably in them. In summary - average service, unclean rooms, poorly managed but a hotel with so much potential.

Reviews.Title: “I love This Place”
Reviews.Author: Howardd1955
Reviews.Content: First off this is my second stay at this hotel. It is simply the best. The beach is fabulous, right on the Black Rock. The pools are great and the rooms really comfortable. Amazing beds. The staff bends over backwards to service you. The only downside is if you are a smoker, you need to go to one of two locations to smoke. If you are not a smoker, no problem. The other thing is nightlife in maui is very limited, this is for sun and beach fun.

Reviews.Title: “Would return but hotel cuts corners”
Reviews.Author: Onmessage1
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a wonderful vacation and would definitely go back, if only because e Sheraton's prime location on Black Rock can't be beat. That said, for the money, this hotel does cut some corners: 1) The towels by the pool were small and thread bare; 2) Aside from main meals, it is really hard to get food or snacks. You better hope you don't want a cup of Starbucks after 10:30 am because the lobby coffee cart closes and you need to head all the way out to the pool bar and it ain't Starbucks; 3) If you do want lunch, you need to go to the pool bar and you basically have a very limited menu of burgers, etc. Nothing inside; 4) The main pool bar (the one actually by the pool) closes at 3 pm; 5) At breakfast, which was not crowded, it sometimes took 5 minutes to get coffee because there was an apparent shortage of help. If you keep in mind these shortcomings, and consider the lovely location and nice people, it's still worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good trip to the sheraton. would return.”
Reviews.Author: thedzoo
Reviews.Content: So my wife and i came out for our 16th anniversary with no kids. We were upgraded to ocean view in building four which is the best building to be in. We found checkin to be seemless ,very friendly and the bellmen were the definition of Aloha. First night free valet is a must for this resort and im glad to see this is their policy. Rooms: The rooms are small and very basic. But they do well. the beds are very comfortable. We needed more pillows and were quickly accommodated. We had an amazing view of the beach and of black rock from our balcony. In fact there were 3 weddings done right below our balcony. The rooms fit our needs well. Only minor complaint is the tv service. literally takes 5 seconds to flip from one channel to the next ..but in hawaii we dont watch much TV:) Food. :We had good experience on the whole. We never did the breakfast buffet as it was a zoo everymorning just to get in, not our idea of relaxing vacation. Very glad we booked it without the breakfast option. We had a fridge in our room and had yogurt fruit and granola for breakfast. cereal some days. picked this up at safeway in lahina and worked well for us. had a few breakfasts down at hula grill in whalers. A must do!! We had a great dinner in the steak restaurant and the teryaki skirt steak was one of the best I have ever had. Service was outstanding this night. They also have a starbucks coffee cart that was very convenient for some coffee and quick snacks. Our biggest negative was the dinner under the stars program. We booked this very expensive dinner ahead of time and picked our menu. we sat in a quiet place along the beach. The food was lacking and the service was really bad. We were left at one time between courses for 45 minutes. We were very disappointed. HOWEVER the management responded promptly to this complaint and took care of our unhappiness. They were professional and genuinley wanted to remedy this night for us. We left very satisfied. This should not keep anyone from experiencing this resort. problems do occur and its all about how management handles them. This resort is managed very well and they will go out of their way to make it right. Pools: One pool setup as a wandering river with some large areas. pool service was good. and food from the pool bars was very good. drinks are expensive. but then all food and drink in hawaii is:) they will go around and give you wrist bands. who wants a wrist band tan line. we just attached them to our suits. This is annoying but we understand why they do it. with the best location on kaanapaili you will have pool crashers. We never had a problem finding chairs. although sometimes ones with shade were all taken.Pool is gorgeous and fun. no a huge one like the westin or hyatt but it serves the resort well. general resort. Parking is an issue at this resort if you comeback late. I hope they address this. they need another garage closer to the resort or offer valet free with the resort charge. A little bone of contention. the resort fee included the resort shuttle. however because of the maui marathon they did not run the shuttle for some days. So where was the partial credit? The resort is pretty, but not stunnning. No animals and no fish even in the ponds they have. I can see how some would find it boring but we did not. The resort catered to all ages well. there is no nightlife but we were not looking for that at this resort. There was live music at the pool bar in the evenings which was nice. we did not attend the luau because we did the old lahina luau. This is a big resort to walk around but some of the complaints about how far you have to walk are strange to me. i like a resort that is spread out like this. It never felt crowded even when full. I would rather have that than the craziness of the westin. kids. did not bring ours this trip but would have no hesitation about bringing them here. Seems like kids would have a great time. beach.. the best on kannapali. please note that snorkeling here is hit or miss. Somedays its cloudy. some days when the riptide is rolling this can be a very dangerous place to be. saw 4 rescues and trips to the hospital while there. I even got to play life guard and rssue a a man that was only 30 ft from shore but couldnt make it. I grew up in the ocean in santa cruz and those who are not familiar with the ocean should really ask or slowly check it out themselves. That being said the clear calm days here are amazing. I had 7 turtles around me at one time. saw a spotted ray and many fish especially out around the corner. the turtles are very close to shore so in the breakwater dont step on them:) closing. know that everything in hawaii is expensive. We had a great time but we can see why hawaii tourism is suffering. We will go back but we spend a lot of time in the Caribbean and we love it there more. Even in mexico, riviera maya, we find the service and hotels to be of a higher caliber with about a quarter of the cost. Only thing hawaii offers us better is the beautiful mountains and better weather. I would love to see a renaissance of hawaii and see the resorts a little more competitive on price points. You do have amazing restaurants in hawaii as well. Merrimans is a dont miss. The mountains and waterfalls and hiking are the clincher for hawaii. nowhere will you find this better. the hike to waimoku falls out of the 7 pools is a must. We will be back to hawaii in two years as we are villas owner at the westin villas. If we come back we would not hesitate in the slightest to stay at the sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “This was our second stay since 2005 and...”
Reviews.Author: Nor-Cal-Sulli
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay since 2005 and we found this hotel to be a great choice. During both trips we stayed in the delux ocean front rooms. I believe these are the best rooms as they are right on the ocean with uninstructed views of the ocean and no walkway in front of the room. The reims are nice but simple, nothing fancy. The patio is awesome as it is right on the ocean. We loved these rooms on both our honeymoon 5 years ago, and recently with our 2 yr old. The only downside to these rooms is they are a bit of a walk to the rest of the resort, but we don't mind since we like the exercise. Another plus is this hotel is on the best beach with the best snorkeling in Kannapalli. The pools are great also, with a kid friendly area. Another plus is the close walk to the best resteraunts and the whaler village shopping mall. The service is nice, but don't expect 5 star service like a Ritz or Four Seasons. Overall, we go to Hawaii evey year and we find this to be a great choice in Maui and usually a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great for honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: SHByun
Reviews.Content: Got an upgrade from our room, so the room was very spacy. The beach view was great and the breakfast at the balconies were great. A walk to the whalers village takes no longer than 10 min. Parking for our rent car was free and it was a great trip here compared to the traffic jamming trip on honolulu. I'll recommend~

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: papfelod
Reviews.Content: Great location with beautiful beaches and 4 gorgeous pools. Excellent staff. If there is any complaint it is not with the hotel, just the number of infants that were there. I was surprised to see that many infants at the resort. Anyway, they have an adults only pool if you want to get away. Other than that and I would have liked a bit larger room. By the way, there daily brunch is unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but Not-So-Special Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RCBaird
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last October on our first trip to Hawaii. After spending our first few days on north shore of Oahu at the Turtle Bay resort--which we loved--I was a little disappointed in the Sheraton Maui. While it's in a good location for snorkeling and an easy walk to Whaler's Village, the hotel seems a bit worn and drab. Most of the rooms are set back a good distance from the beach, so you don't feel like you're right there on water, Then again, I'm comparing this to our stay at Turtle Bay, where I would re-visit in a heartbeat. The food at the Sheraton was also nothing to write home about--not bad (except for our dinner at the Japanese restaurant on premises), but not memorable either. The breakfast buffet did not have much variety from day to day, and the birds were everywhere in the morning. After a while we grew accustomed to them, but I can't help but wonder how healthy it is. For dining, there are many and better places to eat at the Village nearby. I will say that the staff were always very friendly and helpful. There's a very good concierge service, and as long as you don't go to the restaurants expecting the staff to treat you like royalty (which some guests seem to think), you'll always find smiles and friendly service. All in all, we enjoyed our stay, but if and when we go back to Maui, I'll stay somewhere else. If it's your first and only trip to Maui, you might want to look elsewhere. I give the Sheraton at Maui a positive recommendation, but with reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Three days into five night stay... don't think I can recommend this place”
Reviews.Author: psullivan76
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Maui is a beautiful resort, but once you get past the looks, I'm not sure I can recommend it. We're three days into our five day stay and we're having a great time in Maui, but the hotel keeps getting in the way. For example, we have a beautiful room overlooking the ocean, but parking in our building simply is NOT available at night. This is the case every night, so if you want to go out to dinner and come home after 9, you WILL end up parking in the garage on the other end of the lot. The internet didn't work for the first two days of the trip, and is intermittent at best. There is only wifi available in certain "hot spots" of the resort. For these "amenities", we're paying an extra resort fee daily which is tacked onto the rate. That's b.s. A twenty minute walk back to my room from my car at 10pm is not an amenity. And now, at 3:30pm, we've returned to our room to get ready for a dinner luau reservation except... woops... housekeeping hasn't gotten here yet. I had to track down a cart just to get two clean towels so I could take a shower. The pool is awesome (and CLEAN) and they have a lazy river which I enjoy. And the staff is friendly. The beach is convenient. But there are certain basic things I would expect even from the cheapest of motels and when an expensive Hawaiian resort can't deliver them... I find myself disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach Location”
Reviews.Author: sarahlynae
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here during the last part of April 2010 along with my parents and sister. We arrived in Maui earlier than expected and went to see if an early check in was possible. Unfortunately our rooms were not ready (no big deal we were early) they did offer us drink vouchers to use while we waited. After enjoying the sun and a tasty beverage at the bar we went to check into our rooms. Much to our surprise both rooms we had booked were upgraded to partial ocean view (we had paid for garden) which was fantastic. While the rooms are starting to show some signs of age, they are very clean and fairly well maintained. The rooms did feature a mini-fridge which is large enough to hold water and some beverages. The valet parking is fairly affordable ($5/day at the time we were there) however, it is just as easy to self park for free. The reason that this hotel is so great is purely the location. Situated on Black Rock the snorkeling is top notch! We were within three feet of two large sea turtles and saw a plethora of fish of all colors! The nightly cliff diver at the hotel is not to be missed! The grounds are well maintained and offer close proximity to the Whalers Village Shopping Center. They have plenty of activities going on at the hotel (most you have to pay for) including yoga in the mornings. The swimming pool is a lagoon-style shape which wraps around the grounds converging in a larger main pool. The pool was hardly ever crowded and often times quite cold. We never had trouble tracking down a lounge chair and the hotel provides beach towels to use. Overall our trip couldn't have been more relaxing and the property is beautiful and in an AMAZING location on Ka'anapali beach. If you aren't looking for the conveniences of a condo (ie. kitchen) I would highly recommend the property!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Wast Your Time or Money Here - We Got Ripped Off”
Reviews.Author: JasonKiesel
Reviews.Content: We got a great package deal (airline, hotel, car) on Orbitz for what we thought was a great price. We booked our vacation well over 3 months in advance. After arriving at the hotel, my wife and I were told that the ocean front room we booked (and specifically upgraded to) only had two (2) double beds, not the king size bed we had specified. Say what? Well, it turns out that this hotel does not "guarantee" the bed type requested, and since this hotel was at capacity we were simply out of luck. What's the point of requesting a bed type if you're not going to get it? I definitely would NOT have booked the room had I known this (they know this too which is probably why they don't tell you). The woman at the front desk - Krystle - was of absolutely no help either. She simple went through the standard script and wouldn't give any reasonable explanation as to why they have this insane policy. Customer service? Major fail. Oh yeah, the ocean front we upgraded to? Not an ocean front in my book. We can barely see the water from our balcony. And to top it off, our refrigerator is broken and one of our lights keeps flickering. My advice to you - if you want to guarantee you get a king bed (or any bed size specification for that matter), go somewhere else. The Westin next door is amazing. We're booking there on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui Sept 2nd -8th”
Reviews.Author: mauimarshall
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. From start to finish, excellent aloha. Bellman, front desk, room services. You get what you give and we felt relaxed and valued from everyone we encountered at this Sheraton. We visited several other resorts around Ka'anapali and really felt like the Sheraton was the most Hawaiian in its layout and feel. I never felt like there was a lot of people there and I never heard the wild herd of kids you sometimes do at a place like this. The pools were very nice and I never noiticed them full, but since it is Maui we were out and about most days. We did spend Saturday the 4th entirely at the beach using the Sheratons rollout cabanas. Highly recommend, well worth the 40.00. That day as well I never felt like there was a lot of people there. Room was clean and very comfortable. the lanai was real good sized and the view from 3206 was great! Very comfy bed. But the beach and it's location to the resort is the star of the show here. Big awesome turtles right there at Black Rock and Ka'anapali now ranks as my favorite beach. It was nice to not have to drive anywhere and just stroll out to it. Location, location, location. Whalers Village is a short easy walk from the Sheraton as is Kahekili Beach. They put this resort in just the right place. I can't imagine anyone having a bad time or not loving this place...thanks so much sheraton for your lovely caring aloha. I can't wait to return to you. Future days on Maui will always be there!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gan1812
Reviews.Content: We landed at the Sheraton on Aug 29th and were pleasantly surprised that we were upgraded to an Ocean View Room in Bldg 3. The view was fantastic and made the stay that much more enjoyable. The best part of the hotel is the snorkeling. Walk out of your room in your snorkeling gear and just jump into the water! The water is very clear and calm. Lots of sea turtles and colorful fish to see. You could skip a trip to other snorkeling spots around Maui if you stay here. The room itself was unremarkable, but was clean with comfortable beds. Cant ask for anything more. Used the valet at $5/day and it saved us a great deal of trouble from having to lug our stuff to the car and back. The pools were nice and my son had an absolute blast we did not have to fight for pool side chairs like others had indicated. About the only thing i had wanted and did not get was a late checkout. But we just hung out pool side and used the shower at the gym before our flight. All in all a good experience and would certainly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “A Lifetime of Great Memories”
Reviews.Author: HappilyMauid322
Reviews.Content: The mission was to have a memorable wedding & honeymoon in Hawaii. The mission was accomplished and a lot of it has to do with the great staff and beauty of the Sheraton Maui Resort & Spa. The Sheraton is in a great location in Maui. Itâ€™s close to Lahaina & Front Street which is great to visit for dinning, shopping & drinks. Itâ€™s also in walking distance to local hotels & shopping centers. Our deluxe ocean front room in the Hale O Ka Moana section had a clear unobstructed view of the ocean. It was an amazing! We sighted whales, sea turtles and got plenty of alohaâ€™s from ships in passing which kind of fun. Having morning coffee on the lanai to the sound of waves & pretty birds was awesome. Sunsets were romantic. Everything about the view from our room was excellent!! The location of the room was perfect for our wedding/honeymoon. Itâ€™s a distance from the main areas of the resort but it was worth the walk or drive just for the view and the privacy. We really appreciated our wedding manger Michelle Chang for all her help in planning our wedding. We had an intimate ceremony for two on the Black Rock Lawn. It is a lovely location I think it might be one of the best spot on the grounds to have a wedding. Following our ceremony, we enjoyed a very romantic Dinner under the Stars. We received great gifts & little unexpected extra treats for our honeymoon night and our stay in general, thanks in part to Michelle. All the arrangements made for our special day will give us a lifetime of great memories. Overall we thought the other staff members were very friendly. We enjoyed the service at the Mai Tai Bar and all the bellmen and cleaning staff were very helpful. The beach is great. Have to do the breakfast buffet every day. Unfortunately we didnâ€™t go to the Spa at Black Rock but that just gives us something to do next trip. When we arrived we felt welcomed and when it was time to go we didnâ€™t want to leave. This was our first time ever in Hawaii. It was a truly special time and we canâ€™t wait to visit the Sheraton Maui again for our anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location & grounds; nice rooms; staff could be more friendly”
Reviews.Author: plricotta
Reviews.Content: The location and property are what sells this hotel. Black Rock for ease or great snorkeling can't be beat. 2 parents with teens 17,15,13, stayed in room 2218. Nice location overlooking grounds. Room was 50sqft larger than traditional double. Could put our clothes in drawers and table tops and store luggage in large closet to get it out of the way. Lanai was large and comfortable. Hula dancer was friendly and talented. 2 piece band after hula was good. Parking well monitored with room key. As lovely and spacious as the grounds are, the overall expanse of the facility makes it hard to explore its features or even visit restaurants for a quick breakfast. Cliff diver ceremony, and diver himself, overrated. Restaurants too expensive for family of 5. Staff, in general, much less friendly that the Embassy Suites on Oahu. No personal touches here, good coffee too far away from room, in room coffee is lousy, like at all hotels. Denied late checkout due to capacity crowd that night, but extended fitness room shower facilities before red eye. That was very nice. We would stay again, but primarily due to Starwood points and great snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: “excelent stay”
Reviews.Author: Johanna777
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sherraton for our 15 year anniversary. The hotel was excelent. The rooms were clean and beautiful. The decor is not a glitzy hotel but a elegant Hawaiian style. We had a ocean view room that was breath taking. I also stayed on the Wailea side of the Island and we preffered the Kannapali side better. The pool was very well kept, as were the grounds on the property.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not a great choice for couples without kids.”
Reviews.Author: texanaussie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year and loved the location but were quite disappointed with the overall quality of the rooms and service/ amenities. We arrived late and wanted a drink and a snack but the bar closes at 10:00 and there was a mini fridge, but was empty. We went to breakfast the next morning and were happy to sit at the outside deck area, only to be descended on by an army of leaf blowers and lawn mowers. The beach is nice, but the pool is inundated with noisy children and even though there is supposed to be an adult pool the rule is never enforced. We drove to Hana for the day and ended up spending a night at the Hana Maui which I think must be the best hotel in Maui, but is quite far away. The Sheraton is probably a great resort for families, but it's not the best choice for couples without kids.

Reviews.Title: “amazing views!!”
Reviews.Author: BlackpoolRlh
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel with my family, it has one very big pool that partly goes around the grounds. the hotel is on the beach which has snorkelling and diving facilities. we did the snorkelling and the anmont of different fish, turtles, etc was amazing concidering it was so close to the hotel. Every night the hotel has some form of entertainment such as, hawaiian dancers...the sometimes get part of the crowd up to dance..only if you want to though, spit roasts, you can watch the cliff diver go around the resort lighting all the fire lamps then he runs up the cliff and dives off. The range of food is fab it has everything from a bar on an island in the centre of the pool which does basic day food (the burgers are a big recomendation) , they have a buffet restaurant (amazig breakfast :) ) for all meals. the staff are very friendly and cant help you enough. In total one of the best hotels ive been too :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice beach, but pretty average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BostonTraveler000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently visited there as part of our honeymoon, and overall the Sheraton is a decent hotel. Given the other hotel options in the area, I think I would stay at a different location if I go back to Maui. Here are our pros and cons: Pros 1. Nice beach! Soft sand and calm waves, made this beach one of the nicer hotel beaches we saw 2. Convenient location. It is close drive to the popular Front Street for dinner/shopping/drinks and walking distance to local hotels and shopping centers. They also have a free shuttle to Front Street. 3. Nice lazy river style pool 4. Comfortable bed (other room amenities are pretty average. Not super modern rooms and not very large for our rooms â€“ we had a room with a king bed). Cons 1. Unfriendly staff. Overall, the front desk and other staff werenâ€™t very welcoming or friendly. We tried to chat with the front desk folks during check in and they pretty much did not respond at all. 2. â€œSelf parkingâ€�. Your $25 dollar a day resort fee includes self parking (valet is extra), however when you get home in the evening after dinner there were never any parking spots. We have to drive around to all the different lots or valet the car most nights. 3. Beach/Pool amenities: - You get 1 card per person good for 1 towel and 1 towel only. It was annoying to have to remember to bring the towel cards and to turn them in by 6pm or else you have to hold onto the towel until the next day because the towel booth closed down - There are no beach chairs or pool float rentals included. Why isnâ€™t that part of the resort fee? 4. Almost nightly our key cards stopped working and we couldnâ€™t get into our room or parking lot. We had to go to the front desk to get our key cards changed 4 out of 5 nights we were there. 5. Confusing layout. We got lost daily trying to get between our room, the fitness center, lobby etc. You had to keep taking different elevators/stairwells and walk across different hallways and take different elevators and stairs to get places.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for making our honeymoon magical!”
Reviews.Author: JaclynO
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our two week honeymoon in Hawaii from New York. We stayed one week in Maui (Sheraton), Kauai (Hyatt), and 2 days in Oahu (Sheraton). By far, our favorite was the Sheraton in Maui. The first day we arrived we were greeted with Lei's and informed we were upgraded to an ocean suite. The ocean suite was amazing!! It was right over the ocean with a fabolous view of Blackrock. The service was impeccable. The snorkeling was amazing!! Breakfast buffet everyday was a must. We decided to explore other hotels (Westin, etc.) ..nothing compared to the Sheratons privacy. We just wanted to thank the Sheraton (Maui) for making this the most memorable vacation of our lives. However, we do NOT recommend the Sheraton in Oahu-actually I wouldnt even bother going there unless you want to shop or go to Pearl Harbor (in which I do recommend). Sheraton in Maui and Oahu are a worlds difference. Hyatt in Kauai was breathtaking-but we always remember our ocean suite at the Sheraton in Maui and their amazing beach! Our road to Hana was cherished!! When we go back for our anniversary we will make sure to spend our time at the Maui Sheraton!! The O'Hagans

Reviews.Title: “Love the Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: ckdevane
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton @ Black Rock for 3 days and I wish it could have been longer! The property is beautiful, spacious, green & lush, and friendly to a fault! Our room was upgraded to an Ocean view in building 6 - which was the perhaps the only possible downside of our stay - to walk to building 6 from the main lobby is somewhat of a hike...so you just had to leave your room in enough time! Other than that, we really enjoyed our stay We participated in the Luau which was entertaining and reasonably good food (which in our opinion 'if you've seen one, you've seen them all' - we snorkeled at Black Rock, enjoyed cocktail hour, got a discount at the Hibachi restaurant which was just like any other Hibachi restaurant so maybe steer clear of that. It truly is a charming property and we would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent week in Maui”
Reviews.Author: rhoughta
Reviews.Content: This resort is really in a prime spot. We arrived late at night and within the first ten minutes we were upgraded to an ocean front deluxe room and driven in a golf cart directly there. Incredible grounds with wonderful 360 degree views, pristine snorkeling at Black Rock and a friendly, helpful staff. I'm not much into resort spas, shopping and on site dining, but if you like these things, they have ample options for you to spend your money on. There are plenty of great places to eat and drink with a more local vibe in Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointing hotel - Avoid it if you are on honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Skipster101
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel as it was part of the Starwood chain and expected it to be in the same line as the Westin. We were on Honeymoon but we were very disappointed overall. On arrival we didn't get any lei and the hotel seems to have a serious lack of Aloha spirit which really shows in some of the staff. We felt like we were a number and not a guest at their hotel. Our 'Deluxe Ocean Front' room came with a part view of the car park in building 6 - we were placed on the SPG level as we are members but our room was the furthest room away from reception. Believe the other posters who say it is FAR away - the hotel spreads quite a bit and it did take 3 lifts to get us to our building. After complaining about our room we were moved to a much better room (the next day) which was another 'Deluxe Ocean Front' which we had paid for. It had unspoiled views and partial views of the Black rock which was very nice. With regards to the Deluxe Ocean Front room which is larger than the other rooms - however the only difference inside is that you get a microwave!! Only problem is you don't get any cutlery, plates, cups, glasses etc. When we asked reception about this we were advised that we should go to the restaurant and ask a member of staff for them which we did. We then took the plates, cutlery and glasses to our room - we thought this was very odd that we had to get them ourselves and that they are not in the room already. Pretty awful service! In the rooms there is the basic shower gel, shampoo etc but no real extras - you have to ask for them and they "may" be charged. The bottles of water in the room are charged also. On the positive side - the beach at black rock and black rock itself are gorgeous and excellent for snorkelling!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: yakimawinelovers
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 1100,checked w/ the desk to see if we could check in early and BONUS! We were able to check in ANC we were given at upgrade to an ocean front! Next, lunch at the Mai Tai bar- $17 hamburger and $10 hotdog and in general, mixed Hawaiian drinks are $10. The room was great! A wonderful Lanai with table and chairs- we bought our own tequila and mix for margaritas, then enjoyed a wonderful room service dinner when we the reset restaurant, Tappan Dans was closed on Mondays! There is close shopping and a very nice beach that I would call a "baby beach" as it has gentle slopes and waves. There is nice snorkeling around Black Rock. Try going by 8a to see more fish. We went at 2p and saw several fish plus a turtle! Swim at least 15 feet away from the rock and go around to the R side as that is where most sea life is. I read some comments that it was dangerous or scary.... I did not get that impression, but I am a good swimmer. Finally, we went to the spa. Two of us had pedicures by a Amanda- she is fantastic!!! My husband had a massage and absolutely loved it (did not catch her name). It was a little spendy, but it was a treat and most enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Great beach but didn't really like the room”
Reviews.Author: Nellie_Nestle
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Maui Sheraton resort for 1 week in April. The location is absolutely fabolous, and the beach iself was amazing to snorkel. I would say that I definetly liked those two parts of the hotel and it made my stay there. I was very dissapointed with the actual room due to the fact that we found a cock roach in ur bedroom on the second night. That sort of made us paranoid every night looking for the cock roaches. We are not sure how it came in because the balcony was closed, so we are guessing it came from the vents. We were even more dissapointed when we notified the staff about it at the reception they did absolutely nothing about it. Didn't offer us a new room, didn't give us a complimentary meal - NADA ! The lineups for the restarurant in the morning was absolutely outrageous. I am not sure why because there appears to be so much space in the actual dining room. I think they picked a bad place for their buffet set up. WE were going to try the japanese restaurant but after the cock-roach-a-rama we were a bit grossed out. So overall the pools + the beach is great, but the hotel itself is not worth the price imo. The condos we stayed in at 1/2 price in Kona were better.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: aloha35
Reviews.Content: I did lots of research before booking our stay in Kaanapali and I feel as though I got exactly what I had expected - for the most part. I called Starwood MANY, MANY, MANY times and was quoted a wide variety of rates. Do your research to make sure you get yourself the best rate. The grounds are really beautiful and very well kept. The pool was nice and never overly crowded. If you wanted an umbrella/palapa I would suggest getting to the pool a bit on the early side. The location was near both the snorkeling at Black Rock and the restaurants/shopping/entertainment at Whalers Village. The Starwood properties (Westin/Sheraton) offer a complimentary shuttle btwn hotels and stops in Lahaina which is really a nice service to have. I was far from wowed by any of the service here - and I am not picky! We checked in after the late flight in on Delta and our room had already been assigned to us, so there was not really a discussion regarding upgrades/views/etc. I have both AAA and Starwood, so I am always hopeful they may throw ya a bone. I got exactly what I had paid for - garden view. In the end we were happy w/our location because its a big place and we wanted to be near the pool. The "kids" working the valet/bellman were goofing around at arrival. The entire crew we met at arrival was a little goofy. I was expecting more from the room. Things were worn(especially the shower curtain and shower head) and the housekeeping was very average (but this is a four star resort). They need those signs you hang on your door when you are all set and ready for them to clean. Housekeeping walked in twice when I was on the phone with the airlines. The beds/linens/pillows were all very good, and the place was quiet through out the night. We loved having the fridge in the room. I would have to say the housekeeping staff was the friendliest of them all - always giving an "aloha" as we would pass. Oh... the lovely resort fee. You will hear many people complaining about this around the pool/restaurants/etc. Its really a joke, just like baggage fees in the airlines they have found a way to make a few extra bucks. Those few extra bucks can really take a toll overall on a vacation. The "free" internet is not wireless and has to be used at a table with squeaky wicker chairs in the corner of the guest rooms. The resort fee does NOT cover getting to use a beach chair down on the sand/beach. Its does begin to feel like nickle and dimeing after awhile. We rented one chair for one day and the service at the rental cabana was horrible. We were next in line to rent after standing in line for sometime when they decided to start serving people out of another window. When I pointed out that we had been waiting and were now being "budged" by five more families it was "sorry" with a shrug. When asked for the return procedures at the end of the day I got another snotty remark about making sure I leave them a few dollars under my chair for hauling it away. They give out wristbands daily by the pool which I liked. It was very well enforced. We got to know some of the staff passing out the wristbands and they were very friendly. The pool area was more relaxing and not wild with kids which was plus. There were lots of kids there, with a great pool, but it never got loud and wild, especially compared to some of the other mega pools down the way. They also check room cards when people are trying to use the shuttle which I also thought was great. It really was a little piece of paradise. They have some "tweaking" to do, but overall we enjoyed our stay. Bring your snorkel gear, a floatie and you're all set for a beautiful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Casual and Elegant At The Same Time”
Reviews.Author: deepbluebabe
Reviews.Content: We really liked the Sheraton Maui, mainly because we were upgraded to a beautiful ocean suite! Ours was a one-bedroom in the Hale Lahaina. It had a separate living room area, a wet bar and microwave oven. The room and the property were very well taken care of. We enjoyed the beach and the lagoon with the whirlpool. There was fun and entertainment at the pool bars in the evening. And the sunsets over Kaâ€™anapali Beach were gorgeous. The service was not perfect, as we ordered lunch at the Cliff Dive Bar and it took what seemed like forever to get it. The view was beautiful, but there were tables full of children all around us, so it wasn't as enjoyable as we would have liked so we didn't go back there. It's expensive to stay there and eat there, and the spa is no exception when it comes to expensive. But the Spa at Black Rock is very pretty and relaxing, and we both enjoyed the stone massages and I really enjoyed the sole smoothie foot massage. We had been to the Big Island earlier and stayed in an inexpensive but very nice place, knowing we would be splurging at the Sheraton. It was worth the money because we left feeling relaxed and pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay - positives and negatives”
Reviews.Author: M&CMother
Reviews.Content: I grew up in Hawaii and visit regularly but have lived with my family on the East Coast for 20 years. We visited Hawaii for two weeks and spent three nights on Maui, staying at the Maui Sheraton in Kaanapali. Overall, it was a pleasant experience. We arrived in the late morning and asked if we could check in early - we weren't able to do so but they said we could leave our bags and go to the pool area, which we did. Apparently, the hotel was sold out while we were there, but we never got that sense, except with respect to the pool area, which does fill up by mid-morning. We were upgraded to an ocean-front room, which was very nice, though others have pointed out that the rooms face the ocean, but are pretty far away from it (past hotel grounds and pool area). Gym was small, but never over-crowded when we were there. There are no stores on the hotel grounds, except for a convenience store, which is rather unusual for a Hawaii hotel but no problem with us. The location beach-wise is wonderful - we snorkeled one day and it was amazing, high point being a turtle swimming by about 2 feet from us (turtle was followed by 80 other snorkelers!). Hotel, hotel room and grounds are very nice; sprawling nature, which others found inconvenient, tended to give everyone more space, I think. The downside was the lack of a Hawaiian vibe, other than the location. The staff we encountered in the lobby, and at all the pool and beach restaurants and kiosks (towels, snorkeling rental, etc.) were not from Hawaii and none too friendly or helpful - little aloha spirit there. To get that, we ate dinner next door at the Kaanapali Beach hotel, where the staff seemed like they were all from Maui, and there was a local menu and live Hawaiian music every night.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, but don't eat there!”
Reviews.Author: War-chique
Reviews.Content: I am not going to tell you about the hotel. It is a good hotel in a very good place with wonderful beaches, excellent snorkeling, etc. There is enough reviews of that kind here. What I would like to share is a pretty strange and sometimes unpleasant experience we've got at two restaurants located on the property: "Black Rock Steak and Seafood" and "Teppan-Yaki Dan". Both are extremely slow in service, fish/seafood dishes are far from being decent for an island in the middle of Pacific Ocean, steaks are relatively good for a small island, but far below average in the US. Price-wise, both eateries are pretty weird: an average bill for dinner for two (appetizer, main course, two glasses of mediocre wine and two cups of tea) can easily reach $150-200. If you try to share your dish, they have $20 Split Plate Charge for you! Dan is a sorrowful parody on both authentic Japanese teppanyaki and Benihana. Breakfast is served at Black Rock Steak and Seafood which changes it name for morning food function on "Keka'a Terrace". Don't allow this little trick to fool you. It's the same place: slow and overpriced. With the tip you will pay $25 for 'Continental' or $35 for a breakfast with an egg. This is for the buffet. A la carte will cost you the same but you will spend your entire morning in dining room instead of enjoying the beach. Simply, these guys consider you trapped on their property and have no choice rather than to be a victim of their restaurants. The nearby Whalers Village provides you with the same kind of hospitality: 40 min wait for a burger. Recommendations: go to Farmers Market at 3636 Lower Honoapiilani Road, Lahaina, and buy fresh fruits, juices, and diary, and make your breakfast and lunch yourself. For dinner - drive to downtown Lahaina (5 min from the hotel) and find the dining place you like (from Ruth's Chris Steak House to Italian to Chinese, to whatever).

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: tonahahu05
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Maui Hotel was spectacular! Our stay there was unforgettable! It was our first time ever in Maui. My husband and I stayed there with our 2 kids. Initially we were supposed to go in June 2010 and we reserved our trip 9 months in advance. However, our 4 year old son was hospitalized for 2 weeks the day before we were to leave. Our first trip included an Ocean Front room. After my son left the hospital and recovered we rebooked the trip for the beginning of August and all we were able to afford was a Garden View Room in the back. As my son had to have minimal exposure to the sun, we were disappointed. We wanted him to have a great view of the ocean and sunsets as I knew I would be spending a lot of time in the room with him. I shared my story about my Son with the front desk manager and she upgraded us to an Ocean Front room! All I can say is WOW! The room was phenomenal and had a direct view of black rock. Luckily we were able to very easily find lounge chairs with umbrellas by the pool which worked out perfectly for my son. The snorkeling around black rock was amazing! We saw lots of turtles. The beach in front of the Sheraton never got overly crowded so it was perfect. Our room was clean, looked new, spacious enough for all 4 of us and the beds were super comfy!! It was really nice too because we had a refrigerator in our room. The staff was incredibly gracious and accommodating. Even after our 4th day there, one of the staff we had seen from the first day said hello and remembered our names! Honestly, I canâ€™t imagine anyone saying anything bad about this hotel. Next time we go to Maui we will definitely be staying at the Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: NR1234
Reviews.Content: We are a couple in early thirties and a three year old girl. We stayed here for a week in July and it was quite awesome. The resort is right on Kanapalli Beach and adjacent to Black Rock. The room was fantastic and so were the pools. We were upgraded to an oceanfront room. We do not know if the experience from other rooms in any less great. If you want a getaway in Hawaii with not too much crowd but wonderful service, views, beach and other amenities, we would highly recommend Sheraton Maui for that.

Reviews.Title: “The Sheraton is good value and is in a...”
Reviews.Author: roadrunner039
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is good value and is in a good location but has some deficiencies. The whole complex was quite spread out so we had to take 3 separate elevators to get from our room to the beach even though it is meant to be an ocean facing room. There was not enough parking so we were forced to park in restricted areas but received warning messages in the morning. We went on a night dive just off the beach at the sheraton (black rock - great dive - giant turtles) but found that there was no food after hours. I thought that was the whole point of hotel room service. We also went to the luau hosted at the Sheraton. It was good but not sure it was worth the money. We went to the luau as a group and for some reason, the Sheraton concierge tried to charge us for the whole group - it is not like we were the organizers or made bookings on the group's behalf or anything. I think they were worried that they wouldn't be able to collect all the money - but that's no reason to randomly pick out two guests and impose all the charges on them. They are trying to resolve it but i still have no idea why we were made to pay for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel but would stay somewhere else next time.”
Reviews.Author: justinetn
Reviews.Content: I would probably give this 3.5 stars if I could. I mostly gave it 4 starts because of service. We stayed in building 3 (still here actually on the end of our trip) in a partial ocean view room. If I were to not go into the bathroom I would say the room was great but the bathrooms are in major need of renovation and that always grosses me out. Beds are comfortable but pillows could be better. I do love that they have a refrigerator though. Housekeeping was pretty good except for I actually had to ask for more bars of soap because they wouldn't restock. Also, the spa products that they put in the bathrooms are poor quality in my opinion. I ran out of body wash and used theirs and it smells horrible. I'll be buying some at the store today... Again, room would be great if I never had to walk into the bathroom. Pool is wonderful but the pool bar closes at 3pm which is crazy because there are still tons of people there who are dying to spend their money on drinks and food. And the drinks are fabulous! Nachos here are amazing as well as the potato wedges. The people at the pool who walk around giving you armbands (and the servers) are great! We enjoyed chatting with them every day and they gave us good advice as to where to go and what to do. Rest of the service is fine except they lost my son's SCUBA card that we had to have overnighted to us. It was delivered to the hotel on Monday around 11pm (gotta love online tracking) and they finally found it on Tuesday night (they called us after 10pm when we were sound asleep in our room).
