I'm not sure why it was so difficult to read the guest name and room number written in large lettering on the envelope but apparently it was. Overall our stay here was not bad at all but I would probably choose another hotel if we ever come back.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible trip made even better by a great hotel and its staff”
Reviews.Author: Kevinandtheclan
Reviews.Content: INCREDIBLE, We stayed at the Sheraton Maui in July and had the trip of a lifetime. It was great to see my 7 and 3 year old children have the same experiences I had in Hawaii when I was a child. My kids took hula lessons, made lei's, snorkeled, built sand castles, saw a hula show, walked the beach with their parents in the morning when all was calm and basically played until they were worn out each evening (all at the same hotel). The grounds were perfectly maintained, our room and the view from it were gorgeous(thanks Chip) and EVERY employee that we met had a great attitude which is unheard of in most hotels. My family has been going to Hawaii each year since the 70's and this is the first time that we stayed at the Sheraton Maui but it will definitely not be the last. My kids did not want to leave and nor did the parents.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed out stay”
Reviews.Author: ricken911
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via bidding on Hotels.com. Actually, I was targeting to get Hyatt at the first place however I ended up with Sheraton. Due to the trip scheduled for honeymoon, we were accomodated for the room upgrade to oceanfront view but with two twin bed. Our room was placed in building 4 on the third floor. It has great view with garden, pool, and ocean. The refrigriter is kind of noisy so that I had to turn off at night. Otherwise, it could impact my sleeping. We enjoyed our walking along the shore. There are so many luxury hotels nearby and one shopping center near Westin Hotel. The food in Kaanpali is not cheap but we realized some restaurants are still not that bad based on the tour guide we grabbed from airport. If you are in tight budget, you may consider staying in other places.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: OhioNicki
Reviews.Content: We stayed here ten years ago and we stayed here in March. The weather was "GREAT" and we had a room right on the point overlooking the ocean and we saw whales and sea turtles right from our baloney. This must be new rooms because they were not here ten years ago. The only thing is the beach is gone and the pools are ways crowded. This was OK with us as we had a "GREAT" room and no children with us. Also it was bit trying to get to our room/as it was set off by itslef from the rest of the hotel/and far from any of the restaurants/or parking lot. But again this did not bother us/as the walk had really nice views and was open air all the way. The spa was really nice but pricey for what you get. The food was really good/we had free breakfast and a choice of hotels to eat at. If you are going to Maui you must see/eat at Mama's Fish House....just make sure you call ahead/as it is crowded even at lunchtime.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: mfeigel
Reviews.Content: This is nice hotel with a great beach and nice location. Although our room wasn't spacious it worked out great, cause you are in Hawaii who is spending time in a room, think basic room. The view wasn't great also unless you prefer looking at Tennis courts versus the beach but again this got us up early to walk on the beach front. The beach is one of the best! It's also A very nice walk to great restaurants and shopping. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow....yeah wow. Nice place !”
Reviews.Author: wade17
Reviews.Content: I can't really comment on price. I used up all my accrued Starwood points to stay here. It was gorgeous and very close to Black Rock for snorkeling. We ate at 3 restaurants at hotel at some point during stay and enjoyed them all. Kids loved the meandering river theme of the pool. A very nice hotel. We stayed in the family suites and they were a great room for a big family. We did a boatload of excursions (zipline, helicopter rides, snorkeling, etc.) and the concierge service was fabulous at setting all of them up. Family had a great time doing all of them and it took less than an hour to get them all setup.

Reviews.Title: “Only Excellent Things To Say”
Reviews.Author: dajobe117
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Sheraton after 3 hours of flying and driving. My family was greeted by a nice lady who gave us all our own shell necklace (tacky but very nice). We proceeded to check in and were upgraded from our normal family sweet to an ocean front one on the first floor. The room was amazing five people stayed there comfortably. We could walk out the sliding glass door from our room to a sidewalk and be at the beach in under 30 seconds. The location is right at the black rocks where professional cliff divers dive at every sundown, and the entire beach in general was amazing. The only negative was that it is about a third of a mile to whalers village, but the walk is nice so it is no bother. The service was excellent, everyday the room was spotless upon arrival after a day at the beach, even though service can be waved for a $25 bonus towards a sheraton restaurant (a nice bonus). My family also recieved two free boxes of chocolates from the hotel, one for filling out a survey and another just for staying. Overall, I give this hotel an A+ and recommend it to anyone staying at kaanipali.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, good service, great view of lanai!”
Reviews.Author: ilove2trav3l
Reviews.Content: Green focus - Cups are made of CORN not plastic! Beautiful pool which the view of lanai island! Great staff - I had sun poisoning so I couldn't enjoy the sun as much as I wanted but the staff tried to make my experience enjoyable. They gave me amazing lunch experience and pina coladas..FREE!!! We ate everyday at the restaurant. The ambiance is great, oh man, the lobster & lava cake is good there!!! Walking distance to the shopping center.

Reviews.Title: “Maui lodging is Good”
Reviews.Author: SusanN10
Reviews.Content: "Maui Lodging, Thank you so much for what you did to make our family vacation such a success. The in-room goodies and treats added to the fun we will never forget. Everyone had a great time and are talking about going back, Thank You, Tom, Penny & Family

Reviews.Title: “wishing I was on the next flight back to Maui”
Reviews.Author: aquacaliente
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton from July 17-24 2010. This was our first trip to Hawaii and we fell in love with the island of Maui. We were traveling with our 10 year old son. The Sheraton is 45 minutes west of the airport and we checked in at 10 pm. Check in was easy as we were the only people there. Our travel agent got us the free breakfast buffet deal, which we received on check in . Our room was an ocean view, which had 2 double beds and a beautiful view of the ocean and beach in building #2. My husband was bummed about the double bed but the mattresses were extremely comfortable. The Sheraton had recently changed their kids program which was now the Starwood Preferred Guest program. For $15 a day you got a wristband which entitled your child to a free buffet breakfast, free pop and lunch at the Mai Tai or Clff Dive bars, and free supper at the Steakhouse. As we got two breakfast coupons per day for our stay and the buffet cost $15 for a child it was a no-brainer to go for this as it basically gave us a free lunch for our son. We spent our time divided between the pool area and the beach. The pool was a great temperature and had a kids area and a regular area. We hung out by the Mai Tai bar which only opened 11-3 and served drinks and lunch. The prices were high but you were getting pool side service. I recommend ordering the Pineapple Royale which is not on the menu but is a hollowed out pineapple filled with the drink of your choice (mine being the drunken monkey). The beach is beautiful but the surf is much stronger than the east coast of Mexico. In our first hour on the beach my son and husband lost their sunglasses never to be seen again and I twisted my knee when I was knocked over by a wave. My husband snorkeled by the famous black cliffs and saw an octopus, sea turtles, and many colorful fish. I was told by other snorkelers that the action by this hotel was as good as the tours one could purchase. If you want to you can rent umbrellas for the day on the beach or a cabanna by the pool. You can also rent snorkeling equipment and boogie boards at the resort but if you take the short drive to Lahaina you can rent these for a fraction of the resort prices. We enjoyed our meals at this resort; the breakfast buffet had a great selection of fruit, pastries, and hot food and an omelette station. We also had supper at the steakhouse which gave an excellent steak/seafood meal. I wanted to go to the Japanese restaurant but saved that for another trip. In summary I have nothing bad to tell you about this resort. The service was good (but better in Lahaina), the rooms were clean and comfortable, the pool was well used by my family and the beach was wonderful. I went to the old Lahaina Luau instead of the resort luau and from what I observed the old Lahaina luau was more authentic. If I could catch the next flight back to Maui, I would be there in a heart beat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton was paradise except room service”
Reviews.Author: ChattyLA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at sheraton from July 24th for a week. Check-in was very smoorth and went to our room in 10 minutes. We stayed at garden view and I am glad I did. We really enjoyed staying at sheraton through out our stay. Very comfortable beds, very helpful guest services, friendly concierge services. Attended sunset luau, while the performance is outstanding, the food was awful. Not worth a price. The first two days the room cleaniness was outstanding and then from 3rd day it was reducing. The day before we checked-out, they just did the bed but not the bathroom and rest of the room. everything was the same way we left. And the inroom interner service didnot work at all. We didnot really care because we stayed out mostly. Other than that I would say, sheraton exceed my expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Beautiful Location --- what more could you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: travelingmamaCA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 7 nights in May 2010. Resort was clean, grounds immaculate. The views from the resort were amazing. Great entertainment at the poolside bar -- cliff diving ceremony was very cool! My only complaints are that the resort pool closes at 8pm. At least it does in May. Seems a bit early. Location is fabulous with wide open views of the Pacific. The Sheraton is positioned right at the end (top) of the walkway that connects all of the hotels on the strip in Ka'anapali. Great for a morning, afternoon, or anytime walk. We walked this multiple times daily. Very convenient to Whaler's Village and all that has to offer. The food at the resort was very typical of resorts of this level - quality was not quite up to the prices charged. Yes the resort is spread out, so it takes some time to go from here to there, but we didn't find it to be a problem. We traveled with our kids, ages 1 and 3, and although the pool didn't have all of the fun stuff offered at the Hyatt or the Marriott down the walkway, it was still fun and they loved it. This was one of the most relaxing vacations I have taken since having my kids, and I'm sure the Sheraton played a large part in that!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: liquidworldvideo
Reviews.Content: We made our Vacation reservations through AAA, I arrived at the Maui Sheraton 7/19/10 2:10 PM, at first I was a little upset because we were tired from traveling and wanted to get to our room, but they would not give us a room until the 3:00 PM check-in, So if you plan on going there be aware of this. Also keep in mind there is an additional $25.00 per day parking charge they will Valet park for an additional $5.00. They did have free WIFI at 2 locations the main lobby and the 8Th floor lobby of building 4 the rooms did not have WIFI, but did have internet access if you plug your laptop into the room network cable. We got our room and although it was a small room, it had a double balcony which gave us twice the walking room so that was cool, the room and bed were very nice and comfortable, we had an Ocean View room which is not the Ocean Front room, we had a side view of the Ocean, garden, and pool, which is were all the action is anyway. The pool is HUGE and the water temp is comfortable, I felt like I was at a small waterpark, it has small winding connecting rivers, a small slide and waterfalls between the pools, I could spend all day in the pool and be happy, I went Snorkeling right off the beach, the surf was calm, swimming to the right near Black Rock there were several colorful fish and 3 Green Sea Turtles feeding off the plants that grow on the rocks there were several people swimming with the turles and they were very friendly, I guess they are used to the people. We also wanted to do a helicopter tour, so I called the Helicopters direct to try and save money, but they actually quoted me a higher price than Expedia in Lahaina, so we ended up booking with them they must get a major discount off the flight services, they booked us with Hawaii Helicopter, which turned out to be Blue Hawaiian Helicopters which quoted me $310 the day before for the same flight I paid $228 thru Expedia Check out time, we were there 8 days and had to checkout at 11:00 AM our flight didn't leave until 8:50 PM but the front desk said we could enjoy the pool and the beach till we were ready, they gave us a card to get into the fitness center were we could change and wash up after the Beach and freshen up before our flight, this same card let us out of the parking garage. We didn't leave until 5:00 PM, I guess that makes up for the 50 minute wait checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Great snorkeling”
Reviews.Author: assured105
Reviews.Content: Beautiful setting and great location on Maui's Ka'anapali Beach. We arrived just in time for the nightly cliff dive and sunset over blackrock - truly magical. Our room was one of the Lahaina family suites overlooking the luau and ocean. Perfect for a family of four. Better snorkeling than Molokini crater. Great service from all the tipped employees - the front desk employees were not as helpful. We were there for a week and daily maid service was a little sparse, but overall the room and resort were very clean and pristinely kept. The Cliff Dive bar was an awesome place to watch the magnificent sunsets. Calm ocean, great snorkeling, warm water, and great clientele.

Reviews.Title: “The best if you like the beach and snorkeling”
Reviews.Author: colombian
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not the best but they are clean. The resort was full when we stayed and the property is big enoght that you dont feel like in a community park with pool. The beach and the black rock snorkeling are the best features I think. We snokeled and swam with dolphins, turtles sting rays and all kinds of fish. I also loved jumping from the black rock. Overall if I go back to Maui I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Rituals Inspire Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Georgia L
Reviews.Content: We are here at the Sheraton at Black Rock, in Kaanapali, Maui. The hotel is very nice. They have a daily ritual of lighting the torches throughout the hotel property and then a cliff diver climbs up to the top of Black Rock, and lights the torches there - and then dives down into the Pacific Ocean. Very cool! Our room overlooks the pool and ocean area - and we can watch the cliff diving from our balcony every evening. They have a Luau Mon, Wed and Friday nights. It's really extensive - a four hour production. Really very nicely done. We snorkeled right off the beach around the Black Rock - and saw two sea turtles and lots of beautifully colored fish. Not Mexico or the Virgin Islands - but for the Pacific Ocean, the snorkeling was pretty good. Just a short walk away from the hotel is Whaler's Village, a shopping area with several nice restaurants, including Leila Lani's, and the usual Haagen Das, Yogurt and Starbucks. There are many interesting shops, including surf shops, furniture, art, jewelry, etc....it's fun to walk around and check everything out. We have really enjoyed our vacation here. We drove down the Hana Highway, took surfing lessons in LaHaina, and tomorrow we are going on a helicopter ride to Molokai, an island across the way from us. Tomorrow we are also taking Kite Boarding lessons. We have worked out every day in the gym. It's a well-equipped gym, although on the opposite side of the hotel from our room, so we get exercise just getting to the gym! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: Cinobrat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really liked the resort. For his birthday, I booked Dinner under the Stars. It was very special however may be considered pricey for some. My mother booked the Luau for him and it was really nice that we didn't have to go too far. This is not a resort for people to party at like Cancun, Cabo San Lucas and Vegas. It caters to families, business people, and local events. This is a major plus. If you want to compare cleanliness, check out next door. For a change we went to the bar next door and there was giant cockroaches scurrying across the bar. The only down side to the Sheraton pool area. They do not follow their statement about pool chairs being saved. Every day we saw people dropping their stuff on the chairs and then heading off to the beach to only return towards the end of the day. When on vacation you shouldn't have to get up at 6am to get a chair. I didn't like how the general public was able to stroll through the pool area freely and cut through to Black Rock. They used the pool restrooms as the public bathroom and they had disgusting hygiene practices. The poor cleaner had the terrible job of having to clean up after them on a continuous basis. They need to make a public access walkway that doesn't go through the resort. The Westin guests were the worst. The number of times I heard them make disparging remarks about the hotel and yet didn't hesitate to use the pool lounge chairs and services. We tried to use the Westin pool and were told immediately only for Westin guests only. We would return to the Sheraton and hope they change the public beach access and the pool rules.

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe accomodations and can walk to snorkeling, eating and shopping”
Reviews.Author: Y0ungSter
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel because we could walk from our room and go snorkeling at Black Rock, one of the best places on Maui. The room was large, beautiful and clean. The hotel is a short walk from Whaler's Village where we could dine and shop. We had an ocean view room and enjoyed sitting out on the lanai to see the birds and the ocean. The small refrigerator was big enough to chill drinks and hold food we bought from a local grocery store to make picnic lunches. The only downsides were that our room was close to an elevator, which you could hear running at night, if you wanted a beach chair, you had to rent it and the $25/day "resort fee".

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: TinaKutz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the Sheraton's oceanfront rooms on our most recent trip to Maui and it was fantastic! Our room was on the edge of the cliff at the Sheraton, and I would have to say it was the probably the best view on Kaanapali, with the best sunsets ever! The beds were comfy and our lanai was so nice we never wanted to go inside, and we had fun spotting turtles, too. The Sheraton's location is so good that we never wanted to leave. The snorkeling was great at Black Rock, especially if you go around to the left, past where the jumpers are. The turtles like the cliffs and we saw lots of fish and even an eagle ray. It was as good as Molokini, maybe better - certainly easier to get to! My daughter and son (15 and 18) loved the beach, we even got brave and jumped off the rock with the locals and tourists that line up during the day to take the plunge. I loved my morning walks on Kaanapali beach. The hotel has a good torchlighting ceremony, and the Cliff Dive bar is a fun place to sip a Mai Tai and watch the sunset but watch out!!! Eating there is really not a good idea - three not-so-good hamburgers and a couple of drinks ended up costing us $130! There's a pathway along the beach on both sides of the property to other hotels and to Whaler's Village, which is a fun place for shopping and food. The Castaway Cafe at the Kaanapali Villas (just past the Royal Lahaina, the opposite direction from Whaler's Village) was a great place for breakfast or lunch, too. Both locations were about a 10-15 minute walk from the Sheraton. Yes, the property is sort of a labyrinth, and it did take several elevators to get anywhere from our room, but, hey, the hotel was built in 1962 to fit onto a giant rock, so what do you expect!? It took a little sign reading to figure out where we were going the first few times but it really wasn't a problem. (Yes, the rooms have been rennovated and are very nice...) They also have yoga and other activities, check the calendar when you get there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Perfect Perfect”
Reviews.Author: judilbue
Reviews.Content: We are currintly sitting on our balcony, looking at the beautiful ocean. The staff here are so kind, they upgrades us to deluxe oceanview rooms, and they are sooo awesome. We are so relaxed, and very happy with this hotel.. I am very picky too, people, so take my word for it. This is a beautiful hotel. Thanks Maui Sheraton, for giving us beautiful rooms!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous tropical setting located near best snorleing on Maui--huge hotel complex”
Reviews.Author: shirleymarsh07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton in an ocean front room; the view was spectacular. We had an unobstructed view of the neighboring islands and blue-green ocean in front of us---clear enough to see fish and sea turtles swimming by from our 5th story room. The grounds and buildings are beautifully tropical, and the staff is friendly and helpful. We took our 8 and 10 year old children. The advantages of this hotel for children are: the kids can literally walk to snorkeling at Black Rock (on top of which the hotel is located) and easily snorkel or take a short walk to parasailing; lei making, hula lessons, and island crafts are offered to kids in the pool area----this is a must do----the staff member holding these lessons is fantastic; they have a water activities shack for renting water gear; at sunset each evening, the cliff diving ceremony is performed from Black Rock for all to see. We attended the Sheraton Luau on a Monday evening, and it was spectacular for children and adults. The disadvantages for children at this hotel are: from our ocean front room, we had to take 3--yes 3--different elevators to get to the beach each day; food, even in the outdoor grill area is pricey----we paid $14 for a hamburger and chips. I suggest riding the free shuttle to Whalers' Village and getting McDonalds or other fast food offerings for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth.”
Reviews.Author: jmehrer
Reviews.Content: My wife celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary at the Sheraton Maui between 7-7 and 7-14-2010. We received a free upgrade to an Ocean View room upon our check in which was quick and easy. I booked the trip through expedia which had the best price I could find for this trip. Our bell hop Andy was very friendly and gave us some great tips for the snorkeling and where to go to get any equipment we might need. The hotel is beautiful and the location at Black Rock was spectacular, we would walk out and get right into the ocean for our snorkeling, with plenty of fish and turtles around the rock. Andy recommended Boss Frogs in Lahaina for our snorkeling needs and we were very glad he did. Derek at Boss Frogs was very helpful and scheduled us on a snorkeling trip to Molokini which was wonderful. We sheduled the Frogman II cruise but were upgraded to the Quicksilver boat which was beautiful and the crew helpful, especially Thomas who gave my wife his towel when he saw she might be a little cool. We saw plenty of fish, some turtles, and quite a few dolphins. The lunch provided was great and the dollar drinks after snorkeling was a blast. We also booked our Road to Hana tour from Derek through Polynesian Adventure and it was spectacular. It was so nice not having to try and drive it myself and our tour guide Jeff was so friendly and informational. The shuttle from the hotel to Lahaina is priceless, we went into town about every night, and learned when the best happy hours were to help stretch our food dollar. make sure you go to Kimo's between 3 and 5, the calamari is $3.50 and was the best , they also have drink specials. If we didn't go into town we were at the Hula Grill in the whaler village which is a short walk from the Sheraton, and we sat at the Barefoot bar and listened to live music nightly. We rented a car one day from the Enterprise at the hotel and they bent over backwards to make it easy, thanks Kalea. I could go on and on about the wonderful Sheraton and when we return we will definetly stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every Penny!!!”
Reviews.Author: tisdad
Reviews.Content: Perfect location where you can do everything from there. The property is the perfect setting for an unforgettable Hawaiian experience.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui Wedding was Stunning!”
Reviews.Author: mommasandy
Reviews.Content: Our daughter and son-in-lawâ€™s wedding on June 11th, 2010 at The Sheraton Maui was stunning. The Black Rock Lawn was the perfect setting for our group of 44 people to watch them exchange vows and then enjoy cocktails and appetizers at sunset. We were afraid that it might be too hot but the lawn became shady just as we started (at 5 PM) , and there was a lovely ocean breeze. We were able to offer our guests some fantastic appetizers, including a Crab Puff and Stuffed Mushrooms which were both a big hit. After an hour long cocktail party we moved to The Coral Reef Room. One of the reasons we chose the Sheraton was that we could have a reception that lasted until 11:30 pm instead of an outdoor reception that would have had to end at 10 pm per Hawaiian law. The room is beautiful and required little extra decoration. The room size was the perfect size for dinner and dancing and the tall windows all around the room made the outside and inside seem one. Although some of the meals were not as we would have liked, the Sheraton Sales and Marketing Manager, Kristin Vines, made amends admirably. The stuffed chicken was the favorite choice of our guests. Although we had some bumps along the way with our wedding coordinator, Michelle Chang, she helped us pull off a wedding that was truly memorable. As with any service provider keeping copies of our notes and emails was helpful to us. Regarding the Sheraton as a location, we loved that most of our guests were able to stay five or more days there on-site with us, which allowed as all to enjoy many group events. The grounds are really the best in Kaanapali, in our opinion. Because the main section does not have really tall buildings and the grounds are spread out, it felt much more â€œOld Hawaiianâ€�. The beach was wide and the snorkeling right there was some of the best we experienced. The pool and outdoor bars were a great place for our group to enjoy each otherâ€™s company. The Sheraton arranged favorable room rates for the group and all of our guests seemed very pleased with their rooms. The extra â€œresort feeâ€� seemed excessive at $26 per day per room, but we did take advantage of the town shuttle and Sheraton gym which the fee covered. http://www.sheraton-maui.com/weddings/ DJ Dan Viola was a perfect choice for us as he played all the music we requested and never â€œtook center stageâ€�. He is a true professional â€“ great to work with from beginning to end. http://www.djdanmaui.com/ The photographer, Tad Craig, was also terrific. Some of his photos are truly exceptional. He treated the wedding like he would a friendâ€™s. He was excited, professional, patient and very talented. http://tadcraigphotography.com/ We opted to use our own florist rather than the one included with the Sheraton Wedding Package. The bouquets and flowers provided by Shelly at Country Bouquets were exactly what my daughter wanted and the level of communication was exceptional during the planning process. She went out of her way to make sure the flowers were there on time and she even added extra petals at no charge! http://countrybouquetsmaui.com/ The Minister, Rick Jackson, was arranged by the Sheraton wedding coordinator, Michelle Chang . He was a very good fit and did a lovely job of giving us a non-denominational wedding without too much religious reference but with great spirituality. Our group chartered the Gemini, a catamaran which left from the beach at the nearby Westin, for a rehearsal night get together. It was a wonderful group event with great food and lots of beverages, alcoholic and other. The price was reasonable and the staff was fun and provided great service. It was really special to have the whole group together the night before the wedding so that everyone could get to know each other. http://www.geminicharters.com/

Reviews.Title: “Beware: poor service, poor accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Noel85
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel for honeymooner! This is not a hotel that values its customers nor does it have adequate facilities to accommodate its guest. My husband and I went here on our honey and were sorely disappointed to find out that this is a family resort. The hotel website advertises and their employees confirmed that there is one portion of the pool that is designated for children. When we arrived there were children though out the entire pool; the staff told us they do not enforce that rule. The atmosphere of the Sheraton is not conducive to a romantic getaway. The service we received during our stay was consistently subpar. We felt as though we were in inconveniences to the staff rather than the reason that they were there. The hotel is run inefficiently which led to lines everywhere we went. We ate at two of the hotel restaurants and both meals were less then delicious. However we had breakfast there every morning as part of our package and the pastries where amazing. During every breakfast though there was an infestation of birds flying around us and landing on unattended plates. The first day we went down to the pool there was no seating available. When we asked the staff about it we were told we would have to get up early in the morning to reserve seats at the pool. So for the rest of our honeymoon I got up at 6:30 to put towels on beach chairs so I would have a place to sit latter in the day. If you so decide to stay here and you would like to utilize one of the two pool side cabaÃ±as call months in advance to reserve it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location on Kaanapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: MassCouple2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nicely situated group of connected buildings circling around the property, and up onto (and over) "Black Rock" (a volcanic ridge which juts out into the ocean). Many (but not all) of the rooms face the ocean in some way ... we were only on the 2nd floor, but had a great view of the ocean, Black Rock, and the sunset! The beach is beautiful, and it was great to spend the day in one of their portable "cabanas" (double wooden chaise lounge chairs with a canvas awning), but it (as well as the umbrellas) are rentals which are charged to your room. There is a pricey "resort fee" but doesn't include anything on the beach! It does include self parking in their garage, whether or not you have a car ... the "resort fee" is just a way to raise the room rate while publishing a lower room rate! They are a bit paranoid about their beach towels ... everyone gets a "towel card", which can be traded in for a clean towel, but must be returned to the beach stand to get the towel card back ... when you check out, you must return the card, or they'll charge you($20, I think) for the towel (the towels were a bit tired and not worth $20! ... but the towels in the room were even worse ... threadbare ... up to 5 years old (according to the tags on them) and not in keeping with a high-end hotel (they need to spring for new towels!). The breakfast is extra cost, and it's okay, but the birds have free reign of the dining area! We didn't eat dinner at the hotel, but there were several good restaurants a short walk down the beach! (We'd recommend making a reservation at the Hula Grill just before sunset). All in all, it's a very nice hotel, in a great location, and we'd recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Moxsd
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is an overall 3.5 star hotel, the lobby and grounds are an easy 4 star . I figure most people care about the rooms and experience, here it is. The rooms are like any other hotel, small, and views are based on what you pay.I spent under 200 a night my view was partial ocean and well worth it. The rooms while small are very clean, modern and overall a great experience. I could not ask for more, and the service is top notch. The experience is what makes this hotel great. The service leaves nothing to be desired and is non stop. I was on a honeymoon and had totally forgot I had mentioned it on my reservation, when we checked in a bottle of champagne was waiting. The bars, pool, and other workers are all very nice people and go out of their way to make your stay nice. I would say this hotel beats out the Hyatt and Westin, both of which I have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sophie55197
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for five nights. It has the best beach location on Ka'anapali - great swimming and snorkeling - and Black Rock makes for a beautiful backdrop for sunset. The beds are amazingly comfortable. The bell staff was very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. I loved the architecture of the hotel. It hugs the landscape and has wonderful open areas. Other hotels in the area seemed cramped by comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Had an Awesome stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hawaii888
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through Priceline Name Your Own Price and was paired with the Sheraton. After reading the reviews here I was concerned but my concerns were put to rest. We are home based travel agents and purposely did Not mention that to anyone as we wanted to see how everyone was treated. Knowing the check in policy we went to the Maui Tropical Plantation (a fun thing to do - tram ride - when you first get to Maui) and when we were done headed to the Sheraton. Upon check in which was easy we were taken to our room by Andrew (thanks Andrew!! You were awesome!!) who was very informative and friendly!! The resort is BEAUTIFUL!!! Some people will say worn or dated but please show me a resort on an island where there is sand and trade winds that doesnt have any wear and I say you will probably have to pay an arm and a leg for it..it was not bad at all. We were in Tower 2 Room 2306. AWESOME View of the ocean and part of the resort!!!!! Our room did have 2 double beds and my suggestion to the Sheraton Would be to update to Queen size beds,.,, but we made do with it. The beds were so comfortable. We had a box of Caramacs in our room when we got there!! Thank you!!!!!!! My favorite candy now!! Our stay was wonderful. True we didnt spend much time there but enjoyed it when we did. I remember reading a review of someone saying there was whistling around the door when they were there. I did see that the door was not cut properly so there is a space where the wind can come in (Maybe Sheraton you need to check out the bottoms of the doors and replace where necessary?) but it was not a problem for us at all. We self parked which was just fine. No probs there. Plenty of parking available. Our kids enjoyed making sand castles on the beach. The surf was a little rough so we really had to watch our kids but we still had a blast. Was cool to watch people cliff diving off of Black Rock. Enjoyed our stroll over to Whalers Village along the nice path that runs in front of all of the resorts and next to the beach. Incredible views of Lanai!! There are signs up that do warn you about your property on the lounge chairs. I did NOT see anyone though take anyones property. The pool was awesome. A very nice shallow area for little kids to play in and a neat slide if you work your way around to it. They did hand out wristbands after asking for your room number but that was no biggie to us. Everyone was so friendly...Linsay at the Cliff bar was awesome as well as Grace - the hula dancer - You were so lovely and gracious Grace!!! Mahalo!!!! We enjoyed the nightly cliff diving show. Had an enjoyable dinner in the Black Rock Steakhouse. There was one incident when we had to go to the Main desk to give a CC for room incidentals. The Sheratons policy is a little crazy...if you use a debit card they want to put a crazy hold on it and we had had to use our Credit Card for our car rental but after calmly talking with Noah...he was very helpful and did say there are a variety of ways of dealing with this. He was very helpful. To the Sheraton...this might be a policy you want to rethink as it may really anger people off but I can also see that you want to get paid for room service etc. Check out was easy. It was so cool when I was printing our boarding passes at the kiosk in the lobby there were 2 baby geckos (or lizards) no bigger than the size of a quarter in the keyboard. I was concerned they would get squashed but it was fun to see them. I Have nothing but great things to say about the Sheraton. Oh also the first night we were there our bathroom door got locked somehow (it is a button that you push on the inside). We called and maintenance came right out. Our kids had fallen asleep and the maintenance guys were sooo quiet!!!! I really appreciated that. It was a wonderful trip and I will definitely go back to the Sheraton the next time I go to Maui. Maui is beautiful...such nice people....MAHALO Lahaina Tattoo!!! Hano you were awesome!!! Remember to hang loose when you are in Maui!!! No worries....if you have a problem calmly talk to someone in charge! I believe that if you are calm they will help you out any way they can. I am so glad we stayed at the Sheraton Maui and Resort!!!!! Many many Mahalos to you!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bluescooter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Sheraton Maui Resort and Spa while vacationing in Maui. Upon arrival, we had been upgraded to a nice mountain view room. It was clean and quiet. The resort was wide open to the outdoors - such as the ballroom and the lobby- and many other places. It was clean and up to date. The breezes were refreshing. The pool area was pretty nice. The beach area, while public, was clean and fairly quiet and not too crowded. There are computers to use for surfing the net and to print out your airlines boarding passes. Prices for food and drink tended to be high. There was a daily usage fee of $25.00, and we weren't exactly sure what is was for. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. All in all, had a good time there. We would seriously consider going back again to the Sheraton if we visit Maui again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location and Perfect for a Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Cindyp183
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 2nd part of our Honeymoon (1st staying at the Sheraton in Waikiki Beach, Oahu). When we first arrived we were greeted with Lei's and excellent service! The grounds are very big and we were escorted in a golf cart to our hotel room in Building 6. Building 6 is located ontop of Black Rock and the View of the ocean is just Breathtaking (You will see in my pictures). Of course I've read other reviews and yes, if you are on the 1st floor of building 6 you will not really have a direct view of the ocean, so be sure to ask for your room on the 2nd or 3rd floor of the building. The rooms are a nice size with a larger bathroom area and nice closet area too! The beds are comfy with lots of pillows, but I just wished for the linens to be a bit softer. They weren't terrible, but a bit rough. To get to the lobby area, or the pool/beach area it is a bit challenging at first but once you get the hang of it it's not bad. You have to go through multiple elevators and breezeways but it's a nice walk after a good dinner! The pool area is so large there were always plenty of chairs and room to swim in the pool. The snorkeling is awesome around Black Rock so we actually bought our own equipment at the local ABC Store and rented flippers. I loved how the beach access was right there too, so we constantly went back and forth between the beach and pool. Just make sure you are wearing your Sheraton wristband for the pool area. There are also jugs of ice water stationed around the pool area which is nice for a quick drink without having to go to the bar. Which leads me right into the bar area, our only disappointing thing about the hotel. They have 2 bars by the pool, Mai Tai bar and the Cliff Dive bar. The Mai Tai is only open til 3 pm so if you are sitting by that section of the pool, once they close there aren't any more servers for that side of the pool. It's quite interesting that they close at 3 when most people are still hanging out by the pool. So if you want food/drink you have to go to the Cliff Dive Bar which claims to have a happy hour, but we never saw any happy hour specials? I think happy hour was from like 4-6 but there were not any food or drink specials, which usually happy hour means some sort of special. I heard the bartender say the same price for drinks that were already on the standard menu. So we didn't normally hang out too much for happy hour, but it is nice to watch the cliff dive cermony which can also be viewed closer if you go on the beach. The cliff dive cermony is every night so don't worry if you miss one night! It is certainly a cool thing to see while there! The location is great and is close to Whalers Village which has 3 restaurants and tons of stores for shopping. There are also a few snack shops too if you want frozen yogurt or shaved ice or even pizza! We often went to Whaler's Village to walk around and there is a nice paved path from the hotel to the village along the beach. If you rent a car while here (highly recommended), then the town of Old Lahaina is also about 10 min down the road which is very cute and great for restaurants and shops as well (on Front Street). One more quick thing is that the hotel has a resort fee, which we did not mind at all. Rather than paying for parking or internet service the fee is $25/day and includes that and much more. We were at another hotel that charged $15/day just to use their internet, so we thought this resort charge was fine (unless you don't have a laptop or a car so I could see why people would mind it), but if you know ahead of time, then you may as well make use of it!! We really enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton on Black Rock and would probably stay again unless we stayed in another section of Maui. It's quiet and very relaxing. The sunsets are amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “nice but busy”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel2034
Reviews.Content: My family of five stayed at the Sheraton Maui because we loved it so very much when we were there eight years ago. It was so quiet and relaxing the last time but now it is a busy hotel with quite a different feel. When we commented on this noticeable difference to an employee we were told that the Sheraton has decided that it is better to reduce the room rates to operate at full capacity . Our room was on the back side of the black rock.. We had to take at least three elevators and a few breezeways to the pool. On our last stay we had a suite on the opposite side of the property which I preferrred because we had a short walk to the pool, beach, and breakfast buffet. I consider the hotel itself in decent condition. Our rooms were clean, adequate and maintained. Some employees like the servers at breakfast were pretty friendly. The food here is expensive, $16.99 for a burger and a bag of chips if you want to relax and eat poolside. If breakfast is not included in the room charge it is $29.99 per person. The beach is nice and less crowded the further you go away from the black rock. Snorkeling in front of Black Rock is good but not great. The pool is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui Resort - REALLY BAD - STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: TAREVIEW02
Reviews.Content: If you want to have a good vacation, please stay away from this hotel. It is really dirty and old and has not been renovated in decades. Dont waste your money on this hotel. Not sure how this hotel qualifies to be a 4 star hotel. The faucet's and attachments in bathroom are rusted. Please see the attached pictures. The carpet was installed incorrectly, shoddy job in installing it. The closet door was out of the grooves, hence we were not able to open and close it - or use it. That kind of tells you a little bit about the upkeep of the rooms. I usually dont write reviews but, I thought it is important for me to warn other vacationers from making the same mistake that our family made. And if by any chance you have to work in the room, there is no proper table and chair for you to sit. You have to sit on the side on a wicker chair and work on a small crowded round table. No WIFI in the room, have to be attached to the cable to get internet. Which was o.k. but there should be a decent place for people to work. Hope this helped you in making your decision. The service staff is not helpful at all. They just say, this is not mainland. Thats how it is here. I just dont know how this hotel qualifies to be a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “With memories and affection for the Sheraton Maui Resort and Spa”
Reviews.Author: LoisPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: With memories and affection for the Sheraton Maui Resort and Spa from 2 years ago while celebrating our 35th anniversary I write. From the time I entered the open-air lobby with the beautiful views and the gentle sea breezes flowing through with the sounds of island music I felt the aloha spirit. The views on the front side of the ocean lawn with itâ€™s tropical foliage, the exotic flowers, the ocean and Kaâ€™anapali Beach, the Islands of Molokai and Lanai and the Black Rock. The back side with the magnificent mountain and the many rainbows. I was in paradise. We were upgraded from a King ocean view to a King ocean view suite. These accommodations featured rooms of rich wood tones, Hawaiian prints, a private lanai, flat screen hi-definition television with a large bathroom. I was impressed by the location along the beautiful Kaanapali Beach with the Torch Lighting and cliff-diving ceremony at Black Rock, which takes place at sunset. It also is the most quiet and private part of the Ka'anapali Beach yet within easy walking distance of the central shopping and dining area of the resort, Whaler's Village. Since it is spread out over 23 acres, you never get the sense that the resort is crowded. There always seems to be a place where you can get away from everyone and just breathe in the Maui air or gaze at night into the star-filled sky. Each morning we enjoyed the wonderful breakfast buffet on the Keka'a Terrace with the early morning sunshine and gentle breeze and the breathtaking view of puâ€™u kekaâ€™a in the distance and the wooden bridge over a fresh water koi by our outdoor seating. The days were filled with so much to see and do, though we were able to have a few hours to enjoy the beach and the Lagoon pool. The fresh pineapple and tropical smoothies were delicious. Dinner Under the Stars program features three enticing menus, a private butler, and your personal selection of the perfect dining location on the 23 acres of lush foliage and breathtaking ocean views. We chose the beachfront bungalow. It was a special evening for celebrating our anniversary. Our weekâ€™s itinerary was full Friday: Arrived in Maui in the late afternoon preparing for the days ahead. Watched the Black Rock torch lighting and cliff diving ceremony and walked to dinner at the Hula Grill at Whalers Village. Saturday: Awoke at 2:30 for the Mt. Haleakala Sunset bike tour. At the end of the ride we had brunch and walked around the town of Paia. Spent the remaining of day on the beach and around the Lagoon pool. We had dinner at the Plantation House in Kapalu. Sunday: The Road to Hana with dinner at Mamaâ€™s Fish House in Paia. Monday: Spend the morning shopping, seeing the Banyan Tree, and the old prison in Lahaina eating lunch at Cheeseburgers in Paradise. Afternoon at beach and Lagoon pool. The evening at the Old Lahaina Luau. Tuesday: Drove clockwise around the western part of the island with so much to see. Later dinner at Leilanaâ€™s on the beach at Whalers Village. Wednesday: Took the ferry to Molokaâ€™I for the day. Dinner at Longiâ€™s in Lahaina and the show at Warren and Annabelles. Thursday: Iao Valley State Park for the morning then driving back up to Mt. Haleakala. We wanted to hike down the volcano, but the fog was too thick. Dinner under the Stars at the Sheraton. Friday: Enjoyed morning on the beach and the Lagoon pool with lunch on Kekaâ€™a Terrace. With sadness it was time to pack and leave for the airport in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a relaxing holiday”
Reviews.Author: Davo_Fido
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at the Sheraton Maui with an Ocean Viewroom and we enjoyed it very much. We're used to a high standard of accommodation and we were happy with our choice. While not the most luxurious of establishments it was certainly very comfortable and well maintained and provided fair value for money. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived at 1:30PM so we were treated to complementary drinks and lunch at the bar which was nice. Other highlights were: 1/ A good sized room with a very comfortable king sized beds plus a choice of a soft or bouncy pillows 2/ An excellent location at the end of the beach at Black Rock. The swimming is very good with warm flat water and abundant sea life. I saw turtles just about every day 3/ It's also excellently located just a few minutes walk from a "Whalers" where there are many fine restaurants, take-aways and a grocery shop 4/ The grounds are beautiful and the view from our room over the lawn and beach to the ocean and the islands beyond was awesome 5/ The staff are helpful and sincere 6/ The complementary shuttle into Lahaina makes it easy to get there 7/ The gym, if a little small, has good standard equipment

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location...don't overlook the beautiful Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: CoronadoIslander
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's stay at this Sheraton property. Originally I was booked into the Westin (that's right, for some reason I failed to heed the warnings of other trip advisors.) As others have mentioned, the Westin was NOISEY and crowded, the staff was indifferent and our room smelled like mold...not a normal Westin experience. We stayed one night and moved to the Sheraton the very next morning. Evelyn at the front desk of the Sheraton was oustanding and went the extra mile to find us a beautiful room in building number 4 with an ocean view (although even the rooms that face the mountains seemed to be quite nice.) The room was clean and fresh and spacious. We had a nice balcony to sit on with chairs and table. A little fridge helped us keep beer, wine, and snacks cold. Next we met Trevor who helped with our bags. He spent a good 10 minutes talking to me about special off the beaten path things to do. (We took many of his suggestions and they were all great). Finally, I must commend Rhiki who worked the poolside resturant and bar service. She took my order and remembered it (Bloody Mary-no olives) and me two whole days later. I did hear overhear some other waitstaff expressing concern about their hours being cut. Although every staff person we encountered was cheerful and competent, if I were managing this hotel, these three employees would get as many hours as I could give them. They seemed proud of their work and are excellent representatives of Sheraton and Starwood. One thing to note, it is hard to judge the quality of the pool at this hotel from the pictures provided on the internet. Let me assure you the pool is lovely, plenty of chairs and places to find shade. At the Westin I was told by one bartender that we needed to have our pool spot saved by 7AM. At the Sheraton there were still plenty of seats available by 9:30 AM and many came open throughout the day. The beach access is quite convenient and good snorkeling right there. The grounds are quite spread out, the views are stunning throughout the resort, and there are many places to just sit and read or chill. There are various forms of entertainment and live music every night that was quite enjoyable. Excellent little computer center on site if you need it. We found it to be relaxing and mellow, as a trip to Hawaii should be. We opted to have breakfast included in our room rate and it was completely worth it. Food was very good. We like it so much we talked our friends into staying there when they come at the end of the month. I can't imagine you would be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location..Great beach”
Reviews.Author: dickdan
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 5 nights here for 1st half of our honeymoon. Great location. Hotel was completly open. No tight hallways. Our room was overlooking the pool and the beach. Ate at the Black Rock steakhouse first night. Very nice dinner at sunset. Got to see the lighting at Black Rock with the diver. The hotel is right on the beach. Rooms were a little outddated but nothing to complain about. Great place to stay at. Lots of shopping within a 10 minute walk

Reviews.Title: “We have stayed at the Sherston four times...”
Reviews.Author: outdoornutVentura_CA
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sherston four times over the last five years and in the past I would have given it a better review, but this time we were a little disappointed. For one thing we had booked an ocean front room, with the idea of being able to sit out ok the lanai in the morning and enjoy the view. The view was great, however the lanai was so tiny it only had one chair and no room (room 3060). I was dissapointed to learn that if I had paid less for our room we would have been able to sit outside and enjoy the view. Almost all of the hotel staff was freindly and helpful except fir the people at the pool desk, who left us standing around while they finished their personal conversations before telling us to walk around to the other side to turn in our towels, we felt as though we were an inconveince to them. One of the other things we had noticed was that a lot of the public areas, hallways, etc. needed some refeshing. Overall our trip wasn't bad and in the past we would have never even considered another hotel, but after our most recent stay we might. While the hotel itself let us down you still can't beat it's location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Travelers1982
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Sheraton, Maui in the last week of May for our wedding with about 30 of our friends and family. The Resort was absolutely beautiful, the location is great and we will definitely be back. The rooms were roomy, clean and modern. The resort grounds and pool are gorgeous and extremely well maintained. The only thing missing is some more reliable reception staff. Adam the staff manager was great however there were clearly communication problems between the other front desk staff. This should not put you off staying here though the other staff were great and everyone was very friendly. All of our guests had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding at Sheraton - best hotel we stayed at in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: KADOtravlers
Reviews.Content: This hotel grounds was by far the best in Kaanapali beach! It has such a great pool and the snorkeling was amazing (rent snorkel gear from a place off site for $10 a week though). We stayed at the Sheraton with 40 other friends and family. Th rooms were very nice and almost everyone got upgraded to at least a partial ocean view! One downfall was that I had to talk to three managers before an issue was resolved but besides that one issue the service was great. The fish toaco's by the pool and stuffed chicken in their restaurant was amazing. Overall the food was really great but I would recommend the Westin's buffet breakfast over the Sheraton's though. It was less expensive and more options. I had a massage by Emily and it was one of the best I have ever had! Well worth the money! My husband and I then traveled to Kauai and Waikiki. We stayed at 1 other Sheraton and 2 Westin's. This location, and hotel was by far our favorite! When we come back to Hawaii we will only go and stay at the Sheraton Maui! A little about the wedding: * went off without a hitch and was so perfect. Ceremony on black rock lawn and dinner in coral reef room. * chicken and beef were amazing, as was appetizers at cocktail hour. * don't waist your money on the over priced, tiny and dry steak (the only real complaint I had all night) * The wedding planner did a great job the day of the wedding but I felt she was un-organized beforehand. I had to tell her big details three or four times. I am a very laid back person and I kept thinking how crazy I would be going if I was detailed oriented.

Reviews.Title: “What a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: npc2010
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sheraton Black for the last four years, every November the week after Easter. What fabulous trips we have had. I apologize for not writing previous reviews, but it is amazing how you read reviews before you go, but never find time to write a review when you return. The hotel grounds, beach, and snorkeling are the best on the island. If you are from the Midwest, imagine waking up at 6:00 A.M. (time diff.), and walking outside your room with the sun rising and turtles popping their head out at Black Rock. We have stayed in buildings 3, 4, and 6. My wife and I prefer building 4. But if you are looking for an unspoiled view of the ocean, building 6 is your pick. It is a bit of a trek to the beach and the pool, but it is worth it, I would suggest a higher floor unless you are traveling with children. The pool is lovely and I would suggest a renting a gazebo one day on your trip it is a nice experience. At checkin we haved been greeted with leis (spelling?) and the bellmen escort you to your room. The Lobby is incredible it is the most beatiful spot on Kaanapoli Beach. The rooms are very nice and everyone tries to accomodate your wishes. Clif diving in the evening is special. Are there some problems, YES,, but if you work with the people at the front desk, they will try and help you as much as possible. W have booked our next trip for 2010 at the samw hotel, Maui is a treasure that should not be missed and the Sheraton has given us yesars of unbelievable vacations. See you in November.

Reviews.Title: “Just like the pictures - only reality is better! :)”
Reviews.Author: hypnoticrichard
Reviews.Content: I booked on HotWire, so I got a cheap rate and so I really wasn't entitled to anything but the leftovers. I then read the reviews and started to worry. After staying here 4 days I now have come to the conclusion that the people who take time to write reviews in many cases are the handful of the â€œhard to please with anythingâ€� crowd, or the â€œI am a natural complainerâ€� crowd. I have stayed at hundreds of beach resorts all over the word (see my other reviews) so here is what I thought: 1.)When I arrived I was greeted with one day of free valet parking. Nice! 2.)Remember, I booked on HotWire so when I arrived I asked for a king bed. She said none were available. I asked if any could be cleaned, and she called housekeeping. I had to wait an hour, but I got a king with a partial ocean view. All with a smile. 3.)The room was about the same as any other Sheraton, except the bed was rather hard, and not the lux level of mainland business hotels. 4.)The room was clean and well stocked, flat TV, nice balcony and easy to access internet that was reliable. We ran a travel router, made the room wifi and had no issues. 5.)Breakfast was awesome! But at $30 a person a little steep. A lot of people had breakfast coupons, so I imagine if you book at the Sheraton website, you pay more for your room but get the breakfast. 6.)The pools were awesome. As for no kids pool, the pool snakes from 3 feet to 8 feet, and clearly the shallow end (a football field away) has the kids, and there are plenty of coves, hideaways, and turns to escape any kids. This was not a real issue. 7.)I broke the coffee pot. Housekeeping was there instantly to clean it up, and with a new coffee pot. Nothing but smiles. 8.)I got the best massage ever in the spa, I was very happy. I have gotten a lot of resort massages, this was among the best. 9.)The sea and beach are wonderful. 10.)The best thing about this hotel is the location. You can easily walk to Whater Village to shop and get a decent breakfast for half the price of the hotel. Cane and Taro had much better food and service than Hula. 11.)Remember, I booked on hotwire, and resort hotels usually are heard to get a late check-out. But just to see if I could I went to the desk and although it took a bit of convincing, I got a checkout for after lunch... 12.)The condition of the hotel is similar to other ocean front 4-star properties. A few people commented on the condition of the property. I found it similar to all weather beaten hotels with lots of sand, surf and winds to take its toll. I went int the Westin, Royal Lahaina and Ritz, it was about the same... 13.)For those who have never been to Maui, it is VERY quiet at night. There is not a lot to do. Rent a car or you will miss a lot, taxis are rarely seen and things are too spread out on the island to afford taxi rides. We went one night to Mama's Fish House. It is about an hour drive, but worth it. Awesome place. Sheraton Maui had very attentive service in the restaurant, valet, concierge, desk and housekeeping. The grounds were certainly well kept and consistent with the other hotels on the island, and overall a great value. As for the $25 resort fee each day... well that is the parking and internet you would have paid at another hotel. Either way, its all the same money, and I run into this at most of the resorts I stay at, and in many places the fee is higher. I was here on a romantic getaway, I would recommend this to any couple seeking a quiet place to spend quality time swimming, dining, walking, and relaxing together. It was very nice. Remember, of the thousands of people who stay here each year, only a handful write reviews, apparently those who don;t get out much and have realistic expectations of what a beachfront resort hotel is all about. When I come back to maui this is where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: JAYMANIC
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out this hotel was one of the best experiences we have had period. The location was simple divine, the service exeptional. Everyone who worked at this hotel seemed to really love there job and it showed and that is the core of any hotel experience and this hotel delivers day in day out. You all made our stay at your hotel one of those truly memorable life momements that we will never ever forget. We will return one day, and that day simply can't come soon enough. thank you all ever so much.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, friendly, and highly recommened”
Reviews.Author: Trish088
Reviews.Content: Not one single complaint~! From the breakfast buffet to the pillows nothing disappointed. We enjoyed dinner at the steak restaurant (same location as breakfast buffet) and it was delicious. The pool is beautiful and resortlike. Convenient to beach and a ton of great shopping! Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “This resort is beautiful and sits on one of the most beautiful beaches I have ever seen, "Black Rock"”
Reviews.Author: PanagiotisNJ
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in Maui for our honeymoon, western Maui was literally on fire and we could not reach the hotel. After spending a night in Wailea, we made our way to the Sheraton Maui Resort & Spa. The property has recently been updated and it shows. Everything was clean and in top notch shape. The pool area was beautiful and the grounds were immaculate. The beach was one of the prettiest I have ever seen. Black Rock is an old "sacred" location to the locals and the Sheraton Maui even replicates an ancient ritual nightly with some dancing and a cliff diver to pay homage to the location. It is a great place for romance, but it is also family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Sheraton Maui”
Reviews.Author: kirnoel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved staying at the Sheraton. We wanted a nice hotel close to restaurants, shops, and the beach. We like Starwood hotels and the value we receive at them. The Sheraton was a great balance of tranquility and fun. The bars are great by the pool, there are plenty of lounge chairs at the pool, and there are not hundreds of kids running around. The grounds were beautiful. Not extravagant like the Westin but well maintained and enough for us. The service was incredible. Every staff member at the Sheraton Maui was courteous and extremely friendly. We were upgraded to an oceanfront room. The rooms are my only small complaint. They need to be updated but by no means are they old or awful as some reviewers have stated. Some of the furniture was worn and the bathrooms don't have granite showers, but we wanted the location more than a nice room since we were in Maui for sun and relaxation. The food is really expensive poolside (all the guests said the same) but the drinks were really good and pricing was comparable to other restaurants along Whaler Village. We would DEFINITELY stay here again. The location is the best in Kaanapali as it is right next to Black Rock and close to Whaler Village.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service Just Update Bathroom and Better Security at Pool During Late Afternoons”
Reviews.Author: jennifer76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 6/8-6/13. We had to sit in 3.5 hours of traffic due to a brush fire in the central part of the island. When we finally arrived at the hotel, the staff knew what he had gone through. The hotel graciously upgraded us to an ocean front room which was very nice. Here is a tip: If you want a good view of the pool and the beach ask for a room in either building 3 (a good view) or building 4 (an excellent view). I would have given this hotel a "5 out of 5" if it weren't for two things. First, the hotel bathrooms are a little too out dated. They have the old school shower/ tub white tile combo and a single sink. I noticed numerous tiles had been replaced. The second issue was keeping the locals out of the hotel pool. Signs are listed throughout the pool stating the pool usage is for hotel guest only. However, their is no enforcement by the hotel staff that I saw. I noticed numerous non guest families running around with small children yelling and splashing around. I heard one local state, that the staff turns a blind eye at them and always allows them in. Oh and one other thing, the resort fee of $26 a day was pretty ridiculous. Other than that it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Sheraton to Remember”
Reviews.Author: yuliya_kk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for a week of June 1 and I wish I picked a different property. I booked a tour through Expedia and the hotel didn't honor the "free upgrade" that was included in the promotion. The front desk gave a very hard time which I didn't appreciate at all (having two small children at my side tired after a long trip). I don't think they care at all, you are just a drop in the bucket. It took multiple calls to and from Expedia to straighten this out and then they offered to move us to a "deluxe" ocean view room TWO DOORS DOWN from our room. I thought it was a pretty mean joke as the rooms were identical. We said no, thank you. CONS: old, run-down property, chipped furniture, bathroom smelled weird, plastic bathroom counter top, the pool is so-so, drinks are super-expensive, breakfast buffet is the same every day and gets really boring (they only change the potato dish daily); KEY CARD WENT BAD ON AVERAGE 3 TIMES A DAY, ridiculous!!!! (and no, we didn't keep it next to our cell phones, credit cards, etc.) PROS: location was nice, beach was wide and not crowded, my son enjoyed the lighting ceremony each day; the room size was adequate for a family of four ( we had two double beds); view from the room (bldg 3) was great; fast checkout (no need to deal with the front desk). I would not go back though -- dealing with rude and unprofessional front desk is not a memory I'd like to have from any vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location on Ka'anapali Beach - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: GSH81
Reviews.Content: My wife and I planned a trip to Hawaii a year in advance using Starpoints. Our wants were a nice beach and a resort that wasn't a complete zoo (i.e. a bunch of kids running around or just really overcrowded). The agent from SPG suggested the Sheraton due to the beach and the fact that the Westin is more "kid friendly". While that sounded great, I've always viewed Westin as the superior brand between the two. Despite some last minute arguments/suggestions from a colleague to switch to the Westin, we decided to follow our original plan and stay at the Sheraton. We couldn't have been more happy with our decision. As a result, this review will have some focus on what we noticed as a difference between the two (Westin is three hotels to the south), We were upgraded to a Ocean View Junior Suite in building two (referred to as a "Ohana Suite" on SPG.com photos). While the room wasn't modern chic as you'd expect from a Westin, it was very much Hawaiian (or at least more "resort" feeling). While we didn't tour any of the Westin rooms, I can say that I've stayed at several SPG, Marriott locations where you wouldn't know if you were on the beach or in the middle of Tulsa if you didn't look out the window. In the room and on the large double balcony, the Sheraton Maui definitely has its own style... in a good way. Building two is situated between the ocean and the lawn, thus there was no restaurant/pool noise to contend with. The other two buildings (3 and 1) are slightly angled towards the ocean, but not straight on like 2. Thus we found the views and sounds to be really relaxing. The only drawback was that we were not close enough to hear the ocean waves a night, this is due to the distance of most of the buildings at the Sheraton from the water. The pool was good but not great, it was never too crowded but the poolside chairs were snatched up pretty quickly. There is a no "adults only" area, but the kids pretty much staying near the shallow end which is separated by a space occupied by a bar, pool attendant stand and garden. The beach was the highlight... Black Rock, the end of this side of Ka'anapali beach, is the end border of the Sheraton and it has the best snorkeling on the beach. People would come from all other resorts to snorkel around, so being the closest to it was a huge plus. While the surf wasn't as high in front of the Sheraton, it was the nicest area to plop a towel down and jump in to relax. Unlike the other areas to close to Whalers Village, there wasnâ€™t a bevy of tour/adventure ships coming in and out all day clogging the beach and spewing exhaust. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants with the exception of the poolside bar, which was okay. So I can't offer up any review on food. There are so many dining options on Maui outside of the resort that if you can you should explore. Our favorites... SanSei Sushi, China Boat (standard Chinese fare), Tia Juana's (great taco's), Mama's House (seafood). Comparing our experience to what we noticed down the beach... the Sheraton was less crowded (both pool and beach) and seems a little more laid back. We had a spa treatment at the Westin on our last day, and as we walked through the zoo of a pool area (and past the crowded beach) we were happy for the slower pace and more space that the Sheraton provided. If you donâ€™t mind crowds or have children and want more of a water park type atmosphere, check out the Westin and its reviews. If you arenâ€™t looking for a four/five star resort (not sure if there truly is one on Kaâ€™anapali), but donâ€™t want to stay at a dive, the Sheraton is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't even sleep in same bed on honeymoon...Wouldn't honor the king bed we reserved on our honeymoon.”
Reviews.Author: lucylue733
Reviews.Content: My husband & I reserved this hotel for our long-awaited honeymoon & they claimed they didn't have the king-bed room available that we reserved several months earlier. After reading other reviews, it is obvious that we are only one of many couples who were also denied the king room they reserved. We decided to take their "go green" offer to skip room cleaning for a day for a $35 credit at one of their restaurants. My advice, just have your room cleaned. The restaurants at the hotel had not-so-great food, worse service and outrageous pricetags. I would suggest going to Whalers Village, a short walk down the beach, to dine. The two restaurants there right along the beach had good food & more affordable prices. Our room was acceptable, but the mattresses were the worst. Totaly worn-out & the springs stabbed into our backs. Not what I expected for our honeymoon room. I guess I could have dealt with the bad mattress for a couple nights, but not being able to sleep next to my husband on our honeymoon upset me the most. The double beds were just too small to sleep comfortably with 2 people, unless you sleep perfectly straightened-out & don't care to move at all during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the Sheraton Maui Resort”
Reviews.Author: GingermomAllentownPA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton from 5/28-6/6. Before deciding on our hotel I did a lot of internet searching and read all the reviews about the 4 major hotels I was considering (Sheraton, Weston, Marriott and Hyatt). We went to celebrate our 15th wedding anniversary and had waited 10 years for this vacation. When we arrived we were immediately greeted and told our room had been upgraded to an ocean front room in Building 6. Having read the reviews about the views in this building I knew this would be the start of a great vacation. The only down side was that the king bed I requested wasn't available with the upgrade, we'd have 2 double beds. Not a big deal for us but if I were on my honeymoon I'm sure I wouldn't have looked at it that way. Our room was truly ocean front and was so beautiful, we had a view of 2 neighboring islands and Black Rock, slept with sliding doors open and fell asleep listening to the waves crashing against the rocks. The resort is kept beautifully. Someone always cleaning the outdoor areas, grass and plantings perfectly trimmed. Yes, there were times that it was hard to find a chair under an umbrella around the pool, but we also were fine with going down a little later in the day when the sun wouldn't be as intense and the pool area not as busy. We didn't eat at the hotel except to order snacks and drinks at the pool, not cheap but any of the resorts I listed will be just as costly. Same for the resort fee--they are all within the same range of $25/day. I think the Hyatt might have been a little less. Don't travel to Hawaii if you aren't ready to spend a little more for things. We waited a long time for this special vacation and it was well worth it. The staff were all friendly and would chat with you at the pool. Checked out the other resorts and none of them had the lawn and open space that the Sheraton had. Also liked that the area of the pool that was 8 feet deep was a little quieter--no really young children in that area. When looking at all the resorts I wanted one that felt like Hawaii, lots of open space with lush gardens and landscaping and not a huge tower building and the Sheraton provided that. Their tallest building is only 8 stories. Our room was large, spotless and the lanai had plenty of room. Had an area with a small refrigerator, coffee maker and a microwave and a cabinet for grocery items. They replenished the coffee, creamer, etc., every day. Have no idea what the other rooms looked like. Two suggestions: The hotel needs to make it more widely known that it is a totally smoke free facility. I never saw any such signs and there was not designated smoking area for guests who smoke. Husband and I don't smoke and don't care to be around it. A few days into our stay someone in a room near us was smoking--chain smoking--and the smoke kept blowing to our lanai and into our room if the doors were opened. We talked to the manager and he did move us to another room that same day. Unfortunately, the new room had the same situation. People lighting up on the ground level (we were on the second floor) and someone smoking a cigar. I don't think people realized all smoking was off limits. One other suggestion---would be great if there were some palm trees on the beach to help with some shade. Other than the smoking and no shade on the beach, which were minor issues to us in the whole scheme of things, we would definitely stay at the Sheraton again and recommend it to a friend. Also, Maui is very safe, and the island people are all very warm and friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “Disneyland in Maui”
Reviews.Author: TravelElixirofLife
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton wasn't at all what I thought it would be, based on what I've come to expect from higher end Starwood properties. I don't recall reading anywhere that this was such a family focused property - most of these types of resort Starwood properties are a nice mix - but with its "lagoon" pool with fake lava rocks, and Gilligan Island-style straw "umbrellas," it was a big focus for children and ended up feeling like we were trapped in Disneyland for five days. PROS: we're snorkeling fans, and the location right at both Black Rock and Ka'anapali Beach (and the caliber of the snorkeling right from your room) was great; beds were comfortable and the rooms were very clean. CONS: mandatory $26/day "resort fee" which, as best I can tell, paid for their inadequate (system frequently disconnected) wired internet service; cheap pool chairs and amenities; "mai tai" bar was a sorry excuse for a Hawai'ian resort bar (or any bar, for that matter!); expensive beach umbrellas; no adult pool. Do your homework, and make sure it's what you're looking for -- especially at this price.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location...”
Reviews.Author: NinthCircle
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Sheraton Maui. All in all it was a pretty good experience.
