The room was very comfortable, with a spacious patio and view of the pool area, the beach, and Black Rock. The air conditioning is good, and the system is smart enough to switch off if you prefer to have the patio door open. The location is hard to beat, with very good snorkeling out front, an easy walk to Whalers Village, and a decent surf break within walking distance. Good snorkeling trips and booze cruises load up right on the beach a few steps away. The pool is typical for a hotel in this area, but there is no area set aside for adults. In fact, we stopped using the pool at all when we saw a couple playing with their diaper-wearing baby in the presumed adult area. The bars are pleasant but they keep strange hours. This is not really a problem as there are many bars up and down the strip. Renting beach chairs and umbrellas is very expensive, and you have to go through the rental process every day instead of just renting by the week.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: KellyWeso
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a really pleasant stay at the Sheraton. We were warmly welcomed, and were lucky enough to be upgraded to an oceanview room (from a partial oceanview) with an awsome view of Lanai and Molokai! The rooms are simple (simply decorated, maybe a touch outdated) with comfortable beds. Only wish there was a screen on our door so we could have slept with the doors open. I specifically emailed ahead of time requesting building 6 (after ready many reviews). Glad we did! There is a parking lot right there, so convienient! AND another plus - parking is free at this hotel! If you enjoy snorkeling, this is a great resort! All you have to do is walk out to the beach and there you are. All around the black rock is beautiful coral, lots of fish, and plenty of sea turtles! There is also a nightly cliff diving ceremony, it's cool to watch. The pools and hot tubs are great (although a little more kid friendly that we would have liked) We were trying to stay at a hotel with not too many children, this was hard to find. If you want service poolside, you'll wait forever. The service at the Cliff Diver bar was great though, and in the middle of the pools. There is staff that comes around checking to see if you are a guest at the hotel. They give you a bracelet (annoying) I think because all the hotels iare right on the beach and the beaches are public so the Sheraton wants to ensure that only guests are using the facilites. I was trying to decide between here and the Westin villas, glad I chose the Sheraton. I walked down to the Westin and their pool was a zoo with no visable lounge chairs available. We ate at the Black Rock Grill - it was pretty good. Good service. We had the Buffet Breakfast every morning - Excellent Service and great food. Look for deals on the Sheraton website that include breakfast. We used the spa - ehh. Not that the massages weren't great, the facilites are LACKING. It's no frills - no sauna, no steam room, no hot tub just massage rooms. However, the staff in the spa is super friendly and they have cute jewelery for sale. They have a wonderful body scrub, too! Overall, this Sheraton provided what we were looking for! Don't expect the 4 Seasons and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer service--worst massage EVER”
Reviews.Author: coolwater1972
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your time or money booking the "Ho'o Malie O Ke Kai (soothing massage by the sea)!" The description makes it sound like a relaxing, decadent pleasure to get a massage in a private cabana by the pool next to the beach. The reality is the cabana is NOT private so you're just advertising for the spa. Since the cabana is not private, the masseuse had to work around my bathing suit. Even worse--the cabana was next to the kid's end of the pool. Screaming children is NOT my idea of a relaxing environment and there was a crowd of drunken college students right outside my not-so-private cabana having a high volume inappropriate conversation. When I complained to the masseuse about not being able to relax because of the lack of privacy and noise, he just replied that it was cheaper than a massage inside the spa. When I booked my room, I got late checkout (2 pm) as part of my package and booked my activities with that check out time in mind. I called the night before to reconfirm my 2 pm checkout and the clerk confirmed it at first. Then another clerk called me back and said I couldn't have my room past 1 pm because they had someone else checking in at 3 pm and needed time to get the room ready. I explained that I had a zipline tour booked from 9 am to 1 pm and wanted to check out after the tour so I'd have the opportunity to take a shower and pack my luggage. He INSISTED I check out in the morning before my tour and offered to store my luggage and let me use the shower at the fitness center. So I had to wake up earlier so I could pack and get out between breakfast and the tour. The one bright spot in all of this was the front desk clerk the next morning. When I explained to her what had happened with the man insisting I check out in the morning, she gave me another room which I could use until later in the afternoon so it worked out in the end, but the way it was handled left a bad taste in my mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: MissouriMotherOf2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Shertaon Maui May 26th - June 1st, 2010 as the second stop of our 25th wedding anniversary trip. (Our first three nights were AWESOME at the Outrigger Waikiki!). Let me preface this posting by saying that we are the most "low maintenance" people you have ever met - it has to be pretty bad for me to complain about anything. I did research for about 7 months before deciding where to stay and what kind of room to stay in. We knew that we were going to splurge and get ocean front rooms for the whole trip so that we could hear the waves all night with the door open. After reading many positive reviews, we booked a deluxe ocean front room at the Sheraton. I had done extentive research and didn't think it would be possible to be surprised by anything....well... after getting to the hotel early evening, we were told that we had a room with two double beds. Not terribly shocking because lots of people complain about that on this website. My husband went to the desk and they were able to move us to a king room. One of the "perks" that this hotel claims is that the first night has free valet parking - great right? Someone to park your car and get all of the bags in the room - awesome. What the bell desk told us was that since we were in Building 6, "it will just be easier for you to drive up there yourselves and get to your room". Nice. So we get to our room and it was exactly as I had expected. I had looked at many pictures and the room was perfectly beautiful, but we open the door to the lanai and listen - and wait and listen - and sit and listen......no surf. There was absolutely no wave sounds at all - this isn't something that I've read or heard about anywhere. We tried to look at the info in our room to see what restaurants/bars were open and there was no information - my husband called and the only thing open was the steakhouse and the bar. We went to the bar and there was no place to sit so they referred us to the computer desks and gave us menus. We shared a sandwich and went back to our room. I called the front desk and told her what was going on and she agreed to show us an Ocean Front room the next day. The next morning we looked at the room and immediately knew that this was a better fit for us - lots of wave sounds and a beautiful view of the beach. We booked our trip through FunJet, so I called them to tell them what was going on and asked how the room rate difference would work. They informed me that the hotel would bill them for the actual room that we were staying in and since it was a catagory lower, we would be refunded the difference - perfect. I spoke to the front desk when we got our room keys and we were told that because we 'pre-paid' we would be charged for the room we booked, not the room we were staying in. We would only get a credit if he hadn't already paid! How does that make sense? I told her that we would be happy if they gave us the difference in resort credit we were fine to eat there and spend the money there. My husband told her that if they gave us snorkel masks and fins for the week we would be happy! ha. - but there was no Aloha spirit here. There would be no adjustments. She even called our room later to let me know that she spoke to her manager and that there would be NO adjustments! Ok - thanks for the call. Unbelievable. I've got to say that the restaurant staff at breakfast was phenomenal - we loved them and they were so friendly and service oriented. We were there for two days of the pool deck repairs that others have discussed and it was awful, but lucky for us, it ended while we were still there. It also did not impress my husband when we sat at the pool bar at 2:45pm to order a drink and a sandwich and were told that the bar closed in 15 minutes! Yep - just as everyone has commented, the pool bar closes at 3:00pm - even on holiday weekends when it's packed. This place is beautiful and has great landscaping, but honestly, the service from the bell desk when we arrived and from the front desk personnal was so terrible that I would never consider staying here again and I would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service Experience! - Sheraton Resort & Spa, The Spa At Black Rock”
Reviews.Author: designgal1
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Maui I booked a spa treatment through the Sheraton Resort & Spa due to the fact our condo did not offer spa services. I called a day ahead to book my treatment, and specifically asked if I would be able to utilize the pool & facilities, as I was planning on staying the entire day. I was told by the spa staff (The Spa at Black Rock, which is located on the Sheraton hotel grounds), that I was welcome to utilize the pool and facilities of the hotel. I arrived the next morning prepared to stay at the resort for the entire day, and was approached by hotel staff not more than an hour or two after arriving. I was reading at the pool when the pool staff discovered I was utilizing the facilities as a spa guest, rather than a "guest" who had booked a room (they were handing out wrist bands in exchange for room numbers). I was then asked to leave, and informed the pool was "for paying guests only." I attempted to argue the fact I was a paying guest, and was getting ready to spend several hundred dollars at their spa, as well as was told by the spa staff, this wouldn't be an issue. Unfortunately, this meant nothing, and I was given the option of either going to the beach or sitting in the restaurant area. After being humiliated in front of a few dozen "guests", I went to the spa, hoping to alleviate the confusion. The staff coldly denied ever informing me I'd be able to utilize the facilities, insinuating I made up the conversation. I then attempted to cancel my treatment, explaining I no longer wanted to waste my money on my massage after the way I had been treated, and they informed me I was basically stuck. Their four-hour cancellation policy would actually "force" me to have my treatment or still be charged the full-fee. After being kicked out of the pool, treated like a vagrant, humiliated, and more-or-less called a liar, I started my massage in an outdoor room with construction and jack-hammers right outside my door. Needless to say I left my treatment several hundred dollars out, feeling more tense than when I arrived, and convinced I'd never be staying at a Sheraton or scheduling a treatment through The Spa At Black Rock again.

Reviews.Title: “What a overrated resort”
Reviews.Author: hopelessinseattle
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip 6 months in advance then to only find out that the confirmation info was bogus. They told me that the could not hold the rate anymore but after much whinning they gave it to us.. I had confirmed that I could get an upper floor bld 6 and then when we showed up we got the bottom floor which we were paying for ocean front but what we had to do was walk out 60 feet to see the ocean. The Tv didnt work....only one plug worked, the shower had no hot water coming out but the sink did. So we called up to the front desk and asked for another room. They assured me that everthing would work in the new room and that they would move us... After getting to the new room late that night only to find out that they didnt plug in the fridge and all the food had gone bad by morning. So then we get up only to find that the folks below us and to the side like to smoke. The sherton is a non smoking resort. After calling in they assured us that it wouldt happen again. For the next 5 days we could not use are Lani because of all the smoke that kept coming into the room. No help to resolve the issue. The management offered to move us because we were complaining.. how come they just didint move the folks out that were smoking. The Sheraton has no place to keep the butts so the smokers would throw them over the fence onto the Black Rock....how cool is that. The internet connection is only hard wired not WI-fi. The cord is only 3 feet long so you have to sit at the little table and use the computer. they could have given us enough cable to get to the leni which is 3 feet away. Sooo enough of the bad stuff. The breakfast was the best part. Great selection and just good food. The staff that did the rooms was great but the front desk was the worst but I would not want to work there and have to deal with people like me whinning eathier. The beach was great but the wind was always there. If you go to Lahina it was sunnier and no wind. The beach up from Kapalua was the best to snorkle. The luau was the worst. They did some great dancing but most of the entertainment was trying to get the folks on the ground up on the stage to make jokes of them. I didnt pay $180 to see this kinda of entertainment. We wanted a real Luau. We would go down to Mekena and stay there next time the weather was sunnier and there was not much wind. The Sheraton was over priced for what they offered and if you area smoker I would come here.....

Reviews.Title: “Definetely not Aloha spirit, arrogant and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: AraBrussels
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as a second destination in Maui for our honeymoon (before we stayed 1 week in Wailea/Makena and it was great!). It was supposed to be perfect, but on check-in it turned into a disaster. We had booked a partial ocean view with a free upgrade, but instead of that they offered us a downgrade! The room they gave us was much smaller and very different from the one we thought we had booked (prepaid 2 months before!), not even speaking about any upgrades. The staff at reception and their manager treated us terribly, they were so arrogant and instead of excusing themeselves and explaining that for some reason they could not give us the type of the room we booked, treated us terribly. We had the view of the tennis court, the balcony was so small that not more than one person could stay there and you could see the ocean only from one corner of the balcony leaning out of it :(. The bathroom was also very small and of course not the type in the pictures we were provided at booking. By the way, the shower was broken and water was only hot or boiling! After discussing 1 hour with the reception manager (what a waste of time) we were totally upset and finaly she offered another room next day. We accepted it, but we could not unpack and relax, because next day we had to move! Another room was OK, exactly like we had expected, but the spirit was ruined and they did not apologize or smth! They had a couple of conferences there on the day we arrived, so I supposed they had just given out all the good rooms, that's why they offered us to move only one day later, but they could have at least apologized! We travelled half the globe for this :( Hotel in itself is OK, although the staff (and not only at reception) definetely don't know anothing about Aloha. The beach is rather small and very crowded, snorkelling is average (there are some fish and occasionally you can see a turtle; in Makena you can see 4-5 turtles and it is guaranteed :)), hotel doesn't provide beach chairs. The breakfast buffet is pretty good, but the fruit choice is very poor and fruit tastes like nothing. You will have problems if American coffee is not your favorite, because at breakfast you can only get that. The location itself is not bad, it is close to Lahaina, which is full of nice restaurants and bars. After the unpleasant experience with the hotel, we chose not to spend anything in it's bars and restaurants, so all our dinners and lunches were elsewhere. In general I think this hotel is not worth even half of what you pay, so maybe check for other options!

Reviews.Title: “OLD AND CRUSTY - NOT WORTH IT”
Reviews.Author: Lilianne_10
Reviews.Content: First time TRIPADVISOR is WAYYYYYY OFF, i booked this hotel based on the great reviews and the location next to black rock booked a package through expedia the westin resort and spa was another choice at 40 bucks more but got terrible reviews on tripadvisor the honu kai was actually cheaper but complaints of it not being a resort with any amenities BIG MISTAKE the hotel is very outdated (try 1970-80s) the rooms are crusty and need repair small beds (doubles) rather than the standard queens cannot fit 2 comfortably for a good night sleep the hotel was practically empty and despite the package on expedia including a free upgrade, we were not upgraded. It ended up not making a big difference because you can see part of the ocean from moutain view rooms and the ocean view rooms are just as crusty and old the staff at reception (particularly one lady) was rude and unaccomadating no leis as we checked in at night the grounds are empty with lots of grass (golf-course like) with a small pool. went to the beach, chairs and umbrellas are EXTRA 20-40$ per day, what is the point of staying at a resort and paying 25$/night resort fee when all the resort amenities seem to cost extra??? Walked over to the Westin hotel, magical grounds, great pool, nice tropical landscaping, clean, modern, slides, closer to the whalers mall...we regreted our choice! black rock snorkeling was very good, and we swam with the resident turtles, but you could just walk down or swim down from the westin for that. the ocean was cold with a sharp drop off and big waves so difficult if not a good swimmer. For some reason there were always big black clouds over the sheraton with rain, and further down the beach (WESTIN) it was sunny!!! Honua kai will be our first choice next time on this part of the island as paying extra for fake "resort amenities " is a rip off. Westin looked magical as well We ended up buying our own chairs for 20$ and an umbrella for 8, and had to hold it up because of the wind. NOT RELAXING but still cheaper than sheraton gouge prices IN CONCLUSION: 1)RIP OFF (prices listed at 400$ a night on expedia) this is more the type of old outdated place past its prime that goes for 60-80 a night on priceline, with gross rooms to boot 2) snorkling at black rock good but can just visit for the day or swim down 3) restaurant staff were very nice but some reception/check in staff are mean and horrible 4)needs a multi million dollar makeover 5) quiet and dead at night went for a spa day at the grand wailea, we stayed there last time in maui, CHAIRS AND UMBRELLAS ARE INCLUDED, magical landscaping, a true resort!!! SHERATON IS NOT THE HAWAII YOU WANT TO EXPERIENCE!!!!! DONT trust the other reviews and get ready to be dissapointed like we were

Reviews.Title: “Still THE BEST at Kaanapali Beach!!”
Reviews.Author: TMiller150
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently for business, and remain both a Starwood Platinum and Marriott Platinum member with both hotels. My wife and I have stayed at the Sheraton Maui on 4 or 5 occasions in the past, and always enjoyed it - the location, atmosphere, and staff are true Hawaiian, and ana'ole (unsurpassed). I have stayed at The Westin Resort on prior occasions (with noisy elevators next to my room), and this past week, made reservations at The Westin Resort Villas (timeshares) at Kaanapali to try those out (disastrous - tired and in need of maintenance!). After one day there and no better rooms to move to, I came over to the Sheraton Maui to inquire about moving here for the remaining 4 days of our stay, and Evelyn at the front desk was wonderful, upgrading us to an ocean view suite. We checked in, were greeted by Ku 'Uipo who gave us both lei's and a traditional Hawaiian kiss, then went to dinner at the restaurant on-site. There, our waiter, Tony, remembered us from our last visit approximately six month earlier, greeting us by name! At the end of dinner, the staff brought us a special dessert of volcano chocolate cake plated with the words "welcome back Mr. and Mrs. Miller". The beach bar had equally wonderful staff, in particular, Linsay, who served us with flair and made the "tough decisions" on which drink we should have! We were also greeted by Grace, the evening hula dancer, who carried the warmth of the Hawaiian spirit that this property embodies everywhere. No "deferred maintenance" apparent here, the property is in wonderful shape, this should be your first choice on Maui. Thank you to all of the staff at the Sheraton Maui, a hui hoi!

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe Oceanfront Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGirl_212
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheaton for a week in May. We were so pleasantly suprised with the speed and ease of check-in. The staff seemed to understand that we'd been travelling for 12 hours and wanted to get to the beach as soon as possible. We received the upgrade to an ocean front room and were put in Bldg 6. The view was FANTASTIC and the room was neat and clean. We enjoyed the privacy, but note that bldg 6 is literally a quarter mile from the pool and restaurants and requires a gauntlet of 4 elevators to go back and forth from the main area of the resort. If you want to be in the center of activity, bldg 6 is not for you. Our package included the free breakfast buffet which was very good and very convenient. We were able to check-out thru the TV, which was a great time saver since we had an early flight home. All-in-all it was a great experience and we are talking about when we can return. The only downer was the pool: 1) WAY TOO COLD. If your going to have a pool it should be of a decent temperature otherwise don't bother. If you look on the web cam, you'll see no one is in the pool -brrrr The ocean is warmer. 2) It would be polite to inform guests that the pool will be under construction during their stay and maybe don't start the loud jackhammering until after 10am.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: ct-cruisers
Reviews.Content: I was here on a business conference. I was given an ocean view room with beautiful views of the grounds and ocean. The pool area is spread out with a lazy river connecting pools. The had a few bars in the area. Everything was open air. For breakfast I went to one of their restaurants and had to constantly shoo off birds landing on my table looking for scraps.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, true service in the "Aloha" fashion”
Reviews.Author: cloveSevern
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Maui Resort & Spa as part of a large group of business professionals who were traveling to Hawaii on a rewards payoff trip. The location had been selected by others, so I didnt research it much to determine the ratings etc. as I didnt have a choice in where we were going to stay. I can honestly say that I have never been happier. The location was perfect. The open air hotel was beautiful - decorated with gorgeous polynesian furnishings throughout - private beach right at your doorstep. The service was outstanding. Everyone greeted you as if you were royalty each and every day. The room was impeccably clean, modernly furnished, and best of all, it had the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. It was also equiped with a coffee maker (along with some Kona coffee) and a refrigerator/freezer, which turned out to be very convenient for chiling that bottle of wine we shared on numerous nights after spending endless days exploring the island (Road to Hana" - put on your list of must to do's) shopping at the local "Whalers Village" (conveniently located just a block or two away), and dining at the local restaurants. The breakfast buffet was fabulous with made to order omelets, fresh local fruits, everything you could possibly desire. I was truly surprised the hotel only has a four star rating when I finally checked. It deserves a five star rating. My husband and I extended our stay on a different island and stayed in a different hotel. I was thoroughly dissapointed, no coffee maker or Kona coffee, room was small and cramped, old, and truly did not live up to what we had experienced at the Sheraton Maui. Do yourself a favor - stay here. It is centrally located and truly awesome! We will return someday... Maholo!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, great beach, great services, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: allready
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Sheraton late (9pm is late on Maui) on a Friday night after travelling all day from Atlanta. The hotel upgraded us to a Suite with an Ocean view and a large Lanai since the room type we had booked was not available. The bellhop was great and gave us all kinds of tips on the way to the room, including where the closest grocery was located. We had a room with 2 double beds, a living room, a small fridge, huge bathroom w/ 2 showers and a queen size Murphy bed. We ended up sleeping on the Murphy bed after the 1st night because it was bigger and very comfortable. The breakfast buffet at the hotel was incredible, but very expensive ($60 for 2 people) so we only ate there the morning after we arrived. The pools were fantastic, I loved the way they were connected together and you could roam from pool to pool in the water. The resort was very family & baby friendly but we were never overwhelmed by children. The beach in front of the hotel is the best in Maui (IMHO). There is fantastic snorkeling when you walk in the water - we saw the local sea turtle Volkswagen several times. We also saw several large Rays which were unusual. Don't get your snorkel gear at the hotel though - it's much less expensive to rent for a week from Snorkel Bob's in Lahaina. Do pay attention to the Jelly fish warnings because they are there occasionally depending on the current. We rented a cabana lounge chairs from the hotel on the couple days that we stayed at the hotel all day and it was worth the price to have the option of shade. The Kaanapali area was a great base for our trip, there are great restaurants in Whaler's Village (Hula Grill was our fav) and it's a nice walk in the morning to go to the end of Kannaapali beach and back. Since the hotel food was expensive for lunches - we bought sandwich stuff and beer/wine at the Safeway grocery and made our lunches most days & it worked out nicely. It was a fantastic place to stay on a fantastic trip.

Reviews.Title: “Could Be Improved”
Reviews.Author: luvallhawaii
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Maui on May 4-12, 2010. This is my second stay at this resort, my first stay was in April 2008. I loved my stay here in 2008. However, my second visit left much to be desired. First of all, I specifically chose this resort based on my first stay because I knew there was an adult pool with good service and I was on vacation for one thing and one thing only...to lay in the sun at the pool and relax. Nothing else. So imagine my disappointment when on the morning after my arrival, the adult pool was closed with workmen all around. Now, note that nothing was posted in the hotel or in my room and nothing was mentioned to me upon arrival (much less prior to arrival) that the pool would be closed. I had to call, get transferred around to find out the details. When I was reminded that the other pool was still open (the kids pool) and I clearly communicated my dissatisfaction as I didn't want to be at a pool with kids who are loud (kids scream while in the pool) and offer a less than peaceful pool experience, I was told a guest manager would call me. No one ever called me. I did not enjoy my experience at the kids pool. The layout is small, cramped and the majority of the chairs are on the grass, which isn't ideal. All the chairs on the grass were wet each day and the rest of the chairs left limited options. There were screaming kids every day, however due to the time of year it wasn't as bad as it could have been. One server, Claudia provided amazing service remembering guests by name and giving excellent service. However, the remainder of the servers at the pool during my stay, have a lot of room for improvement. One server never once approached me despite my lengthy stay at the pool all day and one server forgot to bring me my drink until much later (she did apologize). More than one server is needed each day. The pool hours begin at 8:00, however one day the majority of the chairs were not set up until almost 10:00. There was routine landscaping going on and while maintenance is necessary, the sound and smell (gasoline) of the trimmers, blowers, etc was disturbing. I have not stayed in any resort where I had to experience this during pool hours. I understand the need for the wristband to ensure only hotel guests are using the pool, but it seems like there might be a better way than having someone walk around and disturb guests while relaxing in the sun or swimming in the pool. Some of the pool staff put on the wristbands without even checking room numbers and I witnessed a non-hotel guest get a wristband. What's the point? Seems pointless as it seems no one really checks accurately anyway throughout the day. The rooms are clean and the all white beds are great. However, the rooms are looking a little tired and dated. It's time for refreshing with new carpet, new furniture and a bathroom remodel. This includes the lanai furniture. I used a car service and expected upon arrival for the bell staff to take my bag from my driver, but that did not happen. When I went to the stand out front and answered yes that I wanted the bell staff to take my bag to my room, she yelled across the entrance to call a bell staff member over. That was not an ideal experience. They do offer seamless check in, but you have to stop by the front desk later to provide a credit card. Based on my 2008 stay, I had hoped the Sheraton Maui would become my "go to" resort for my annual trip to Hawaii, but based on this last experience, I am not sure that will happen. I don't spend thousands of dollars to not have the experience I expect. This experience left a lot to be desired. To sum up: -Adult pool closed with no notice, no price concession despite my unhappiness. -Being a SPG, I would like to think that there could be notice given for pool closures, etc to ensure a positive experience. At the very least, I expect follow up and price concessions when a significant dissatisfaction is voiced. Extremely unhappy with this. -Bell service upon check in could be more professional. Greeting guests as they exit cars, etc instead of waiting for them to drag themselves to the stand. -Pool service needs improvement, including servers and pool staff. -Rooms need updating. Hotel is starting to look aged. -The $26 per day resort charge is a joke. Either eliminate it or work into the price of the room, but it's a stupid charge that the Sheraton tries to justify, but frankly it isn't justifiable. Overall, I was disappointed and it's highly unlikely that I will return to the Sheraton Maui despite my plans to return to Maui at least once a year. I will most likely try out other resorts to try and find my 'go to" resort for my annual trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4qqqq
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. We had a wonderful stay. Upon check in they did not have the king size bed that had been booked. I was not surprised since I have read this from other guests but they said they would correct it in the morning. When we arrived it was 9:00 at night and couldn't tell our location since it was dark. When we woke up - wow, what a view! We had a patio room in building 2. I was more than happy to stay in this room and have the double beds. I have heard stories of up and down on the evelvators and I didn't want to deal with that. This room worked out very well for us. Not one elevator or stair case to deal with. This was nice! Only 110 steps to the beach and about 225 steps to the pool. Close to the parking garage too. More than happy with this room!! We took advantage of the "green" program and didn't have maid service one day. They gave us a credit of $35.00 towards dinner. We figured we would use it for dinner at Blackrock Steak. People kept saying how expensive Blackrock Steak is, and it was, but it was about the same as any other restaurant in town. Everything is ala carte and everything was pricey, but it seemed to be in range with all of the others. I was happy to have the credit. The stuffed chicken breast a extremely tastey. Our dinner ended up to be less expensive (using the credit) than it was at Mama's Fish House for lunch. Everything at the hotel is extremely pricey. Hamburgers at the pool grill were $17 or $19. That is beyond rude if you ask me. Tip: We went next door to the Kaanapali Hotel and had lunch at their poolside grill "Tiki Hut" (I think) and the burgers there were $8.00 -9.00. Much better prices and very good. A basket of fries (very large) was only $2.95. We couldn't even eat all of them. Go there. The pool was impressive. We liked how it was a lazy river effect. Very cold though. I'm not sure which was colder the ocean or the pool. We took advantage of both. One day the pool and one day the ocean, one day the pool and one day the ocean. Such choice we had to make. We snorkled a couple of times in the ocean next to blackrock. It was worth it. Saw some really colorful fish and a massive size sea turtle. I know sea turtle are all different sizes, but I was not expecting this size. That was great! The location of the hotel is perfect. Next to blackrock and also a short walk to Whalers Village. Restaurants and shopping! What more could a girl ask for. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “huge sprawling resort”
Reviews.Author: Solange72
Reviews.Content: As SPG members, we chose this hotel over the westin maui for our last night on Maui because of the nightly re-enactement of the jumping from the cliff at sunset ritual. We had a two double beds room facing an expanse of grass immediately fronting the ocean. We love walking so we didn't mind that the hike from our room to the main hotel area was a 10-20 minutes (depending on how much we got lost initially/distracted en route) hike through multiple corridors, stairs going down, stairs going up etc...The entire walk was lovely with interesting ocean views, flora and geological marvels along the way but...might not be appreciated by all. While attention to details at this hotel is pretty good, it is certainly not at the highest level for a luxury hotel: as an example, our ocean front patio had a couple chairs and a table but..unlike all the neighboring rooms, no chaise lounges. The swimming pool area is really a complex of multiple pools with islands for food/recreating in the middle. There are hamocks nearby. The pool was busy with loud, animated and lively guests of diverse ages and cultural backgrounds until a serious drizzle retired most hotel guests. The showcase dive from the cliff was dramatic/twillight zony and kitsch (voice narrative about ancient rituals accompanied by solemn music and drumming) but extremely enjoyable for my kids. Food at the hotel was fine but extremely expensive. Great Mai Tais (better than at the Moana Surfrider in Honolulu). The concierge desk was generally too busy and under-staffed for the long queue. There are many computers with internet access easily available in a lovely inside/outside location. Finally we were a bit disappointed that our request for a late checkout, usually easily granted in most starwood hotels because we are spg gold, could not be granted. Our plane home was in the evening so we took the hotel shuttle into town (a pretty convenient if not very frequent shuttle).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort with a few precautions”
Reviews.Author: testewart
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sheraton Maui on our first trip to Maui. This is a very nice resort, but educate yourself on how they rate a room. We booked a partial ocean view. Well, I guess if your really stretched your neck, looked past the top of a walkway below and tuned out the sound of tennis balls hitting the ground you could see a distant stretch of Kannapalli beach. This in itself was bad enough, but when I opened the sliding door to look at the balcony, my heart sank. There was a pie shaped balcony and only room for one chair and a small table. Not exactly what I pictured paradise it to be after travelling 5000 miles to get here.We only had to stay in this room for two nights out of our nine night stay on Maui.They did move us at my husband's request and for an upgrade fee to a to a beautiful room with two large balconies over looking the beach and Black Rock. If you are interested in an upgrade, you should contact the resort in advance and ask what is avaible and what deals they are offering. During our stay part of the pool area was closed due to resurfacing. We realize that this kind of upkeep is necessay and did not have a problem with the closure, but felt that guests should have been informed in advance of the maintenance. For the most part, we found the staff friendly and helpful. A rental car is a must to see the beautiful island of Maui. Whaler's Village is a short walk down the beach has shops and restaruants at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “nice enough hotel - black rock is the reason to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Pandora68
Reviews.Content: We had a few days here and thought the rooms were a bit basic - not up to the standard of some of the European Sheratons - but it was clean and comfortable, just not luxurious. I guess the hotel has been here a long time - as it has a great spot. The beach was sheltered and good - lots of fish around the shallows of black rock. Food wasn't great, but the breakfasts were very good by American standards - there was at least several fresh fruits on offer and lots of choice - but we paid $25 dollars a head for it! Dinner wasn't so great and there isn't much to do around the place. There were free computers for the kids to use which was appreciated - all the other hotels we stayed in charged for this. The pool is nice enough and the kids enjoyed the waterfalls etc. There is a pool bar but no fresh juices or much in the way of healthy snacks but most people seemed happy just drinking cocktails etc It is a safe choice and they can do adjoining rooms but I wouldn't stay here unless I was getting a very very good rate on the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views, staff, location - Great stay made for a great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: RobZonie
Reviews.Content: My family (self, wife and 12yo daughter) spent our first Hawai'ian vacation at the Sheraton Maui and absolutely loved it! The location was fantastic. I'm Platinum with SPG, so that may account for the room upgrade and amenities, but the room was fantastic! The view took our breath away - beach on one side, Pu'u Kukui on the other. Nice. The staff, however, made the stay special. I will never forget Ivy's warm welcome at check in, spoiling us with her graceful Aloha spirit! I've heard some complain that the restaurant food is overpriced, but I find that to be the case at any hotel of this caliber, and thought food was overpriced at a great many local restaurants as well. The beach area and concierge staff there were phenomenal and loads of fun! The pools were sparkling and the grounds were exceptional. Overall, a fantastic venue for our first visit to Hawai'i!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: PGHGirlieGirl
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect from this hotel and was BLOWN AWAY! So beautiful, lovely rooms (particularly for their age) and fantastic views. Staff was so helpful, breakfast buffet was excellent, pool was outstanding. We did stay in building 6 (we were "upgraded" for free, even though we'd requested building 3) and were so glad we did. Others have mentioned the long walk, but that didn't bother us because we were able to park our rental car in the building 6 lot, making it a shorter walk to the car for our many trips out. The walk to the beach was five minutes at most, and walk to breakfast maybe 8. The view of the water was great from our building! We also loved that we were on the first floor, and shared a fenced in "back yard" off of our lanai. No complaints - extremely pleased with our choice here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Beautiful Grounds!”
Reviews.Author: backtomaui
Reviews.Content: We stayed in building 6 in deluxe oceanfront room. The room was a nice size and the view was spectacular. It is a bit of a walk to get to the pools and beach, however it is a very pretty walk and we did not find it bothersome at all. Definitely worth the trade off of having such a spectacular view and a private parking lot. The pool was great - not too cold as others have said! Just refreshing. We loved the hot tub - they kept it very hot! We loved the location of the Sheraton as it was a nice walk to restaurants and shops (at Whaler's Village). Lots of good choices there. We had coffee and pastries each morning at a little kiosk (right outside the McDonalds) in Whaler's village - great pastries and coffee and about half the price of the hotel. Definitely worth the nice walk there! A couple things we especially liked about the Sheraton - 1) Although the hotel was near capacity, it didn't seem crowded at all. 2) Lei making - really fun activity they offer for I think $10/lei. We loved the guy in charge - darling! He was hands down the best staff member we encountered. All in all, we would definitely stay at the Sheraton again!

Reviews.Title: “All in all, a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kmod75
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 7 days/nights. Rooms - We had originally reserved a "partial ocean view" room. I didn't realize the room faced a mountain and the ocean view was blocked by palm trees. Basically, there isn't any ocean with this room classification. If you want any sort of view of the ocean, upgrade to the full ocean view or ocean side. I had heard the hotel was good about free room upgrades, but this wasn't the case for us. We were charged extra. Normally, I wouldn't mind this....but the hotel was only half full, so I was a bit disappointed. Staff - With the exception of charging us for a room upgrade with a half-full hotel, the staff was fine. Everyone was extremely nice and always had a smile on their faces. Grounds - The hotel grounds are very well maintained. Pool area is exceptional and the nightly sunset watch from the bar area is amazing. The property grounds really are top-notch. I'm very picky about this, too. Forgot, free internet and good fitness center. Food - Food is extremely overpriced here. But, if that's not a concern of yours, then you're good to go. The few meals we ate there were very good and you have PLENTY of onsite options. I'd probably recommend you explore some of the local cuisine off-site. Leisure - This hotel is actually part of the Blackrock ocean reef. GREAT snorkeling with plenty of sea turtles! Highly recommend this. Nightly Hawaiian sunset show is fun, too. Room decor - All the rooms have flat panel tv's and are very clean. They are a little outdated with their decor, but are still nice. They also have small fridge's so you can fill them up with water/soft drinks/etc.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Imonthego
Reviews.Content: My wife and I can't stop thinking about what a wonderful time we had on Maui at the Sheraton. We returned home on Apr. 7th from a week long stay along with my sister and brother in law. The hotel is Awesome....the grounds are absolutely beautiful...the location CAN'T be beat....and the service is right on spot. When we arrived, they greeted us at our car and welcomed us with a shell lei. They unloaded our luggage, checked us in and on our way to our room the bellman showed us the highlights of the hotel. The room for my wife and I had two double beds instead of the king we requested. We called the desk and they were very accommodating...they said it would be a couple of hours before a room opened up so they gave us some drink vouchers to use while we waited. We had a ocean view room and the view was great. We could see the lush grounds, the pool and out over the ocean. We could even look out across the ocean and see the whales blowing from their blowholes :-) Room was nice and clean and had a refrigerator to keep drinks cold as well as snacks. The whole hotel was beautiful with an open air style. We were able to walk to almost everything and if we couldn't they had a shuttle to take you to Lahaina where there was more restaurants and shopping. The staff was also very nice and attentive. Never met a negative staff member. I will finish up this review by saying that we have already started making plans to return to the Sheraton in March of 2011.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: kohalala
Reviews.Content: We really love this hotel. It has a perfect location (at Black Rock) and a very relaxed Hawaiian attitude. The service is, hands down, the absolute best. Everyone is so friendly. We were upgraded to an oceanfront room (small charge) which had an amazing view of Molokai, Lanai, and ,of course, the beautiful ocean and breeching whales! Our upgrade also included daily breakfast buffet and nightly drinks at the Dive Bar (fun). There is a reason we continue to return (fourth stay) and it is because the Sheraton Maui just never disapoints. Can't wait to return (hopefully next spring).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: StarboardWash
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect location on Kaanapali Beach. It is towards the end so you don't get a lot of cross traffic. It is spread out, but I think that's a benefit which reduces a lot of noise that you would hear at the Sheraton. Building 6 is a great location overlooking the water very well maintained and grounds are kept very well. service was good each day and staff is very polite the pool is better at the westin, but you get better rooms here.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel - not that great”
Reviews.Author: mslinh210
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location. I stayed here for my honeymoon. I was a little upset with the fact that they didnt treat us with any perks when we were celebrating something. when we got to the room there was supposed to be champagne and fruit. Im not one to B*tch about these things bc im a budget traveler but for our honeymoon we paid a little more and we just wanted the service know what i mean?We arrived late as well and thought we would get a welcome but we didnt feel welcome at all. I had a decent stay otherwise. beds were great! i slept well but something was still missing is all. I wouldnt recommend this place for a honeymoon but if you want to come for the beach or luau its great!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: CYD_Family
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Hawaii, and I'm so glad we picked the Sheraton Maui. Most important thing: location, location, location. It was great to just roll out of bed and grab our snorkeling gear and head out to the beach. Black Rock is fantastic snorkeling. The valet parking was extremely quick and easy to use. The hotel restaurants were upscale (and pricey) but the food was mediocre, so I wouldn't suggest dining in the hotel unless you absolutely have to. The room was clean and decent-sized. I would definitely recommend getting a room with a view of the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location - lovley hotel"”
Reviews.Author: ozziesBrisbane
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovley. It had it a wonderful pool for the kids and free daily activities which we loved. the nightly cliff diving is a must to see. Room was spacious and clean and luxurious. we ate at the hotel and found the food terrific. Service was great as well. Good location close walk to the Whalers centre for an ABC store and shops. Free shuttle bus to the partner hotels htough I was dissapointed that we couldnt use the pools there (espceially the westin) but we were able to chargeback restaurant bills.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great experience.”
Reviews.Author: slarph
Reviews.Content: We checked in early on a Monday, after having spent five days on Kauai. We booked with Starwood points, and as a Starwood Gold member, we were treated to a complimentary upgrade to an Ocean View room. However, we were told, for a few extra dollars a night we could be upgraded to a Deluxe Ocean Front Suite. We took the deal and enjoyed a suite on top of BlackRock, the lava outcropping that is the basis for some of the best snorkeling in the world. Definitely no buyer's remorse on the upgrade. Great views, great lanai, and very easy access to the pool, beach and even parking. Of the hotels on Ka'anapali Beach, the Sheraton seems to be the most updated, the cleanest, and seems to have the best pools and beach front. The Hyatt at the far end of the beach is a close second. The Westin is a third. Everything else is in a different league. The only complaint I have with the property is that the outside bar closes at 7:30pm. I have NO IDEA why. All the other big hotels seem to have beachfront or pool-front bars that are open later.

Reviews.Title: “Best Honeymoon Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: whydontweliveinhawai
Reviews.Content: We looked for several months for a good honeymoon location on Maui and found the Sheraton Hotel to be the best value for our dollar. Being only 23 years old, we were told that renting a car would cost extra, so we opted to stay here for the free shuttle and the beach location. The beach here is amazing...If you are looking for a beachfront experience, I'm not sure how it could get any better than this. The rooms are great, and we were given a free upgrade upon arrival to an ocean view room. The water is warm and clear, and there is plenty of good snorkeling near black rock. We didn't spend much time by the pool, because the beach is so great, but the pool is spacious and never looked crowded. The food at the bar was reasonably priced (for hawaii) and really good. The shuttles come every hour on the hour and are very dependable. We didn't ever feel the need to rent a car and took the shuttle into Lahaina 4 out of the 7 days we were there. One of the stops is right by the grocery store if you are looking to save a little money and make some lunches in your room. The service at this hotel is great, and the staff was always helpful. We wish they offered some 1 year anniversary deal because we want to go back so bad! If you are a young honeymooning couple this place is perfect. the only negative is the cost of the food at the hotel restaurant; it's good food, just extremely pricey. there is plenty of activities offered, but if your content with laying on a great beach in Hawaii, you will be happy with the Sheraton Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Our NEW favorite in Maui”
Reviews.Author: weathergirl29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui at the very end of Sept 2009. We were splitting our stay...3 nights in Kaanapali Beach and 3 in Wailea at the Grand Wailea. We had previously visited Maui in '07 and loved the Grand Wailea...but wanted to try a different part of the island. We're so glad we did! -Check in was very smooth, and we were taken to the Hale O Na Hoku part of the resort. We checked into room 5105 and all I can say is "WOW!!!" It was fantastic. This room was on Black Rock, and had a spectacular view. Double entrance doors led to a gorgeous foyer, huge bathroom with separate shower and tub, two sinks and huge mirror. Room included a wet bar, two televisions, a separate sitting area and two balconies. BEST hotel room I've ever stayed in, hands down!!! -Food was great (and I am very picky.) We had breakfast vouchers for the buffet each morning and ate twice at the Sheraton and once at the Westin (there is a stay at one, dine at all program.) The buffet was fresh, perfectly cooked, and plentiful. We enjoyed sitting outside and taking in the view while eating breakfast. -Pool is awesome! Gorgeous landscaping and lots of chairs. We were able to get a chair under an umbrella very easily, and would get in the water to cool off from the hot Hawaiian sun. The pool is a tad bit cold for my taste, but husband thought it was perfect. -Ate lunch poolside at the bar/restaurant and the food was very good...typical beach/pool fare. Thought the frozen drinks were well made and quite a bit of liquor for the price so I didn't mind the check. -Snorkeling at black rock is phenomenal. We've been all over the Caribbean and this was by far the best snorkeling we've done. Calm water, brilliantly colored fish, and helpful staff to rent out the snorkel equipment. Sad that we only did it the last day! -The Kaanapali area in general is very pedestrian friendly and the shopping area at Whaler's Village is perfect. Had dinner at Leilani's (wedge salad and steak) and it was a really well prepared meal. Bottom line, this resort was great! We're two 20-somethings without kids who vacation to get away from very demanding, high stress jobs and this was the perfect place. Only gripe...the 8 hour plane ride...and that is certainly no fault of the Sheraton!!! :) We'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: spacecraft10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton when we visited Maui for our honeymoon and we were very impressed with the hotel. The staff were very friendly, we were greeted promptly and checked into our room quickly. The view from our deluxe ocean front room was beautiful, mountains, water, beach, and of course black rock. If anyone is planning a trip to Maui, this would be a great place to stay. The food was excellent, we had buffet breakfast included with our package. There are two restaurants, both had excellent food, breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Accomodations, Decent Food”
Reviews.Author: jburning
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights in June of 2009, on our first trip to Hawaii. The main reason we picked the Sheraton Maui was three-fold, (1) It was located right on a great stretch of Kaanapali Beach, right by Black Rock, (2) it was about as affordable as a luxury hotel on the beach gets in Maui, and (3) a breakfast plan was included in the price. We originally booked an Ocean View room, which was upgraded by the front desk staff because they did not have a King bed available. So, we ended up getting moved to a Deluxe Ocean Front room, which, despite the name, are actually located kind of far from the beach itself. However, the lanai outside of the room looked out directly over Black Rock and the ocean, and the view was gorgeous. In the mornings, you could sit out with a cup of coffee and watch the turtles come to surface on the quiet side of Black Rock. The room itself was okay -- nothing spectacular. The beds were reasonably comfortable and there was a mini-fridge, which made eating/drinking a bit less expensive than it might have otherwise been. (If I have on tip for travelers to Maui: buy a supply of drinks and snacks, because dining on this island is incredibly costly.) The grounds are nice, well-manicured, but so vast and maze-like that it took us nearly 5 minutes of walking to get to the beach. Self-parking was easy from our location, as the Ocean Front rooms have private parking near the rear of the resort. Dining was decent. We ate at the breakfast buffet every morning -- there was a large variety of foods and the coffee was excellent; but despite the variety, it still got old by our final morning. We only ate on-site one evening, at the Black Rock Steak & Seafood restaurant, and I don't recommend eating here. It was overpriced and the food was mediocre. The staff, though we didn't deal with them a whole lot, was friendly and attentive, and I don't have any major complaints about the resort. Its biggest plus is definitely the location, as its probably the best stretch of beach along all of Kaanapali. If you love snorkeling, you'll enjoy the Sheraton's extreme proximity to Black Rock. My wife and I are likely coming back to Maui next year during whale season, but it's unlikely we'll stay here again. Not that it's so bad, but just that we'd like to try somewhere new, and we'll probably head south to Wailea. This hotel is a pretty good value, based on its location alone. Definitely head away from the resort to dine, though. I highly recommend the Pineapple Grill!

Reviews.Title: “Nice facility but average front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: RTW_guy
Reviews.Content: When you stay at a top of the line facility you expect first class treatment from the hotel staff. Unfortunately, it's just not there at Sheraton Maui. While they were accommodating to our requests, they just weren't friendly, and didn't go at all out of their way to make us feel like valued guests. Since we are Starwood Gold we were "upgraded" to a mountain view, but as it was right next to an elevator we had to move after the first night. We also weren't told the balcony on the room was so thin there couldn't be a table or chair on it. We had to find out on our own after a few days that it was MUCH more convenient to park in the tennis court lot rather than the parking garage. When I asked about upgrading to an ocean view the front desk wasn't clear at all, and it was only when I spoke with the time share person who had Starwood status in previous corporate life that I got the full and friendly answer. The front desk staff seemed like they were always doing other paperwork tasks, so their lack of connection may be due to conflicting management's demands. The hotel offers a $25 to $35 credit if you skip housekeeping. At first this seems like a nice gesture to offset the $26 required resort fee. However, the credit is not cumulative, and is only valid at 2 high-priced restaurants where guests are already offered a 20% discount. People who eat at those restaurants probably wouldn't value the discount. So the discount seems totally for the hotel's benefit as a way to up-sell people for the hotel's benefit. A $25 credit directly to the bill or that could be used for any non-room hotel purchase would be much more satisfying. There's a lot to like about the Sheraton Maui. The grounds are wonderful. As we didn't have an ocean view, we particularly enjoyed sitting on the chairs midway through the 5th floor of building 3. There's also a nice lounge area in the 8th floor of building 6 (the one with the fitness center on 7th floor). It's fun to watch the sunset and cliff divers at the same time. You can walk south along the resorts or north along the golf course and less developed areas. During our stay we were attending a conference at the Hyatt. We noticed that winds at the Sheraton were FAR greater than at the Hyatt, which frequently had no winds at all, while the Sheraton would have such strong winds that it was uncomfortable being outside. The Sheraton Maui did a great job of sending a pre-visit email, account statement by e-mail, and post-visit e-mail. Unfortunately the staff attitude didn't match the attitude of the e-mails. There was no request for a survey in the email or in the room papers. Perhaps it's because they really don't want to know what the guests will respond.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Sheraton Maui”
Reviews.Author: freetr
Reviews.Content: In March we spent a week at the Sheraton Maui. This is our 5th stay in 7 years. The hotel is perfectly located - close to everything and great access to swimming and snorkeling. The beach, the beautiful green landscaping and very nice staff make this a favorite for us. We will be back next year and we will be staying at the Sheraton. We have no reason to look elsewhere. We have always had Deluxe Ocean Front rooms in Building 6 by choice. The rooms are larger, are quiet, have close parking and beautiful views. In one 15 minute period we saw whales, dolphins and turtles from our balcony. The sunsets from our balcony were amazing. All hotel staff were terrific. Always polite and helpful. The rooms were in very good shape and the daily maid service was timely and thorough. We only ate the breakfast buffet (part of our room rate) and some bar food. Otherwise we ate off-property. The breakfast buffet was good and convenient but was fairly repetitive after a few days. They do have the best bacon. We would not likely eat this if it was not part of our room rate. The beach was certainly different than previous years - we had heard it was smaller but were startled by how much had been lost to the surf. It was still fine and we never had any problems finding a spot. It was a little windy and choppy while we were there and being up next to Black Rock was nice given the weather. If there was one thing to improve this property - it would be heat the pool during the winter. There were a couple of days that it was too windy to be on the beach and even though the air temperature was warm - there was hardly anyone in the pool. It is just too cold. I know it wasn't just me - everyone had the same comment. It really is a shame to have this very nice pool that doesn't get use. Somehow this review does not convey how it feels to stay at the Sheraton Maui. The grounds, the staff, the whales, the sunsets -- all of it is so special. We love it here and are counting the weeks until we can go back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful trip!”
Reviews.Author: chrisnsarah2000
Reviews.Content: We just returned home yesterday from an amazing 6 night stay at the Sheraton Maui. It exceeded our expectations, and after staying there, its hard for me to believe how this place ever gets awful reviews. We arrivied at 4:30pm on Saturday and were given a shell necklace, and our room keys. The valet, Andrew? immedialtely un-packed our car and gave us a quick tour of the resort on the way to our room, It was a beautiful ocean view room 3604, with a king bed just as we had requested. Also a surprise bottle of champagne was waiting for us to celebrate our tenth anniversary. We had vouchers for the breakfast buffet every morning as part of our package, and it was incredible. The food is plentiful and good, as was the coffee and juices. It was a real treat to eat breakfast every morning overlooking the beautiful ocean. We also tried out the black rock steakhouse one night and were glad we had the $35 voucher from declining housekeeping that morning. The barefoot bar and grill was also good. I really loved how you could walk over to whalers village right on the ocean. We went there nearly every day of our trip. The shuttle to Lahaina was also very handy. The pools and landscaping are out of a dream. Everything looked perfect, and everyone we passed always said Aloha. While we were there, the surf was very high/ rough, so I didn't get on the beach as much as I would have liked, but did rent a cabana from the beachside rentals one day for $40, and thought is was well worth it. Had great weather the entire stay, and could see many whales out in the ocean. Overall, a perfect first trip to Maui, in a perfect hotel. We already can't wait to bring back our two little boys in the future. There were lots of children there,but it wasn't overwhelming if you are a couple looking for time alone. Thank You Sheraton Maui resort!

Reviews.Title: “Ka`anapali Sheraton Resort”
Reviews.Author: Arizona_RoadRunner
Reviews.Content: Our week long stay at the Ka`anapali Sheraton in mid-March was one of, if not the best, vacations we have taken. This was a very relaxing place to stay. There were really no surprises or negative experiences. Keep in mind this is a resort, so expect to pay resort prices. Room: We were in a deluxe ocean front room that allowed us to see whales, sea turtles, and beautiful sunsets every day from our laini. The roomâ€™s location (6304) was one of the most remote on the resort, but still only a 5-10 minute walk to the restaurants, pool, or beach. Restaurants: We had the daily breakfast buffet on the Keka'a Terrace, which offered a great variety and selection. The made to order omelets station was a nice feature. We did not eat lunch (who could eat after the breakfast buffet!), but we did visit the Cliff Dive Bar daily for a late afternoon drink. The Maui Mist and Maui Brewing Big Swell IPAâ€™s were our favorites. Dinners at Black Rock Steak & Seafood and Teppan-Yaki Danâ€™s were very nice. The service food was both excellent; definetly recommend the filet mignon and mahi mahi. Beach and Pool: Although the beach was not very big from a chair to water perspective, it is long enough to provide space for everyone. We rented a lounge chairs and umbrella the days we spent on the sand, a good idea if you havenâ€™t had much recent sun time. Due to high surf and cloudy water conditions, I was not able to go snorkeling. However, the body surfing and boggy boarding was exciting! The pool area seemed a little crowded, but there is plenty of space to move out to the lawn area if youâ€™re looking for privacy. Plan on getting to the beach or pool early to secure the best spots. General Location: Within walking distance of several other resorts and the Whalers shopping center. Close to several towns (Lahaina, Kapalua) which offered a variety of shopping and dining options; if youâ€™re looking for an â€˜off the resortâ€™ experience. Golf, surfing, hiking, scuba, etcâ€¦ is also a short drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Maui Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: windsurfer5230
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day stay at the Maui Sheraton last week celebrating our 4th wedding anniversary. This was our second trip to Maui (our first was our honeymoon). The location of this hotel is fabulous - it is directly on Black Rock which is a popular snorkeling location. In addition many locals cliff dive off it which was fascinating (don't try this on your own!) The whale watching was fabulous too. The many shops and restaurants of Lahaina are 10 minutes away. We really liked the storage in the rooms (closets) , as compared to other hotels we've stayed in. We think the Sheraton might want to consider their double bed/king size bed ratio as we were placed in a room with double beds - but the view was fabulous. Overall, a great place for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: julia1211
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui for 8 days, from March 9 to 16. Our requested bed (king) was not available, so we were bumped up from a partial oceanview to a deluxe ocean front room in building 6. Still had two beds, but in a better location (parking wise) with much better view. Room was clean and comfy, bathroom had separate area for toilet, and our porch door opens to the lawn on Black Rock. Service-wise, the cleaning ladies did their job well, guest services were always there to respond to questions, front desk was able to give directions and change my money to smaller bills, and security was very prompt to respond when I left my room card and when I reported somebody who looked to be in trouble in the water. We were debating between staying here and the Makena Beach Resort in South Maui, and I'm glad we went with the Sheraton. It's close to Whalers Village where you can walk around and have a bite or shop without needing to drive. I also like that the resort offers free shuttle to & from Lahaina which came out useful when we went to the Old Lahaina Luau. It's open bar, and I didn't want hubby driving home after. Liked best & least? Food. The breakfast buffet was great. I definitely wouldn't pay almost $30 per person for it everyday, but it came with our Expedia package. Selections were plentiful and delicious, from cereals to eggs & bacon/sausage, to fruits & pastries. Great way to start the day. However, the dinner buffet at the Black Rock Steakhouse was blech. The fish, the chicken and the ribs were all too sweet. Good thing we had the $25 discount by declining cleaning service for the day. Will we be back? Probably not. But that's not a reflection on the property. There's so much world to see that we don't do repeat visits. Would I recommend the Sheraton Maui to a friend? Definitely! Thumbs Up!

Reviews.Title: “Maui is great, sheraton hotel not so much”
Reviews.Author: Trvlcrzy0220
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in Maui at the Sheraton hotel for my honeymoon. I wish we stayed somewhere else and listened to Fodor's Hawaii where they said their customer service is horrible. Needless to say that was true. When we first arrived they didn't have a king size bed for us! We got stuck with two double beds for three days and then they switched us to a king size bed after when they had availability. We were so unhappy being that it was our honeymoon they should have went way out of their way to make sure we had a king sized bed. To top it off the shuttle bus that they make you pay a resort fee for wasn't running the one day we wanted to use it! This hotel is not worth what you pay for! I will never stay at a Sheraton hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Returned from Sheraton Maui”
Reviews.Author: baileyman
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from an 8 day stay at this hotel. We arrived around midnight, extremely tired but the check in staff and bellman were quick and pleasant. We stayed in building 6 in a deluxe ocean front on the ground floor - exactly as requested. On this note I feel I really need to add clarity to some earlier comments posted by other reviewers. The walk to the pool/beach is not 15 minutes. In fact I timed it and the longest time was 5 minutes and I am in my 50's and not exatly physically fit. The ground floor units are great because you have a large lanai plus the open grass area to use as your "front yard". The view from here is also good, we could see whales while sitting on the bed. The breakfast buffet was fine - most days wait was about 5 minutes for a table and only a couple of days waited 10 to 15 minutes - not bad considering it was spring break. The other point I need to clarify for folks is the condition of the beach. Yes, it was shocking to see how much smaller the sandy area was - note it is smaller it has not disappeared. Still room for beach chairs. Two things though which bothered us though was 1) the pool was freezing at all times - even on hot days when there is absolutely no breeze. We tested the water in other pools in the ares and the Westin and Hyatt were cold as well, but some of the cheaper 2/3 star type places were heated! 2) You can no longer rent tanks for diving from the dive shack on the property - even if you have all your own equipment you will be charged $80 per person for the full deal. This is ridiculus - even if Sheraton has outsourced this operation (which I believe they have) they should have a minimum service agreement for that operator in relation to expected services to be provided to Sheraton's guests. This is the only hotel that we have stayed at with on site dive operater that didn't offer basic tank rental. We have now stayed at this hotel 3 times and it unfortunately would be our last because of the last 2 issues which is too bad as otherwise the hotel and staff are wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Starwood Shines Again!”
Reviews.Author: PiratesSayARRR
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th trip to Maui in the last 3 years. I had not previously stayed at the Sheraton, but close by at the KBH and the Westin and I think the Sheraton is the best of these 3 hotels. We arrived at 4:30pm on a Thursday and were immediately greeted by a friendly Valet attendant and shown to the check-in desk located at Valet. We were told that we were upgraded from a partial ocean view to an ocean front room in building 4. The room location was fantastic...although it was on the second floor so it was partially blocked by plumeria trees I didn't mind at all. Service throughout our stay was excellent. Staff were always friendly and attentive. Happy Hour at the Cliff Dive Bar was quite reasonable for resort prices. A couple of things I will comment that can be improved: 1) Charging $27 for a to go box at the buffet is pretty unacceptable. It would cost the same if I sat and had breakfast and went to the buffet multiple times. 2) We were told by a Starwood rep that we could pay for spa via points and services cost as little as 700 points. The spa said we had to first pay and then use points upon check out. The rep could have been more up front about this in the beginning. These were two minor issues that didn't disrupt a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “I'd gladly stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoToTheWorld
Reviews.Content: I arrived at about 7:30 pm on Friday, Feb. 26 for a 7-night stay and I wouldn't say I got off to a great start as the woman at the check-in counter was anything but pleasant (a smile would have been nice). But the spacious and breezy lobby made up some for the cold encounter at check-in. And fortunately, things got better from there. Overall, I found that most of the staff was very friendly. I was there for the tsunami warning and I appreciated the effective and calm communication from the staff, the fact that they went room by room to ensure that people knew where to go, and the fact that they set up a free buffet of food and drinks for guest while we waited it out. Rooms - I was impressed with the room. I was traveling with a good friend and we had 2 doubles and I thought the room was pretty well sized. It had 2 beds with duvets, 2 dressers each with 3 1/2 large drawers. The closet was pretty large too with a good size safe (probably large enough for a laptop but I didn't put mine in there). There was a flat panel tv (37"?). The bathroom was also pretty big and had a shower/tub combo and a door separated the rest of the bathroom from the toilet. I wouldn't say that the room's huge and there's not much in the way of a work desk, but I was on vacation and just wanted a decent enough room - I wanted to be outside as much as possible. As for the look of the room, it looked pretty up to date for me - the carpeting, furniture, etc. seemed new or at least very lightly worn and the A/C worked well. Whether all rooms are updated I could not say, but I was happy that our room was nice and up to date. And the maid service was very good. Our first floor, garden view location was nothing beautiful, but I paid only $200/night and figured I'd create my own views. Driving around the island, walking around the hotel and driving up to Haleakala solved any concerns I had with our room location and view. In any event, no matter where you stay at the hotel, you will have to walk quite a bit. The property was very spacious - ok with me since I love to walk. We were closest to the main parking lot so that's where we parked. It was never full so don't worry about getting a spot. As for internet in the room, it is high speed, but not wireless. The cord is pretty short so you will have to use your laptop in bed. I've read some complain about the speed but I thought it was plenty past enough and I never had the slightest difficulty with connection speed. Food - The only meal I ate was at the breakfast buffet. It's fine if you like a lot of food, and the pastries were decent but it's certainly not worth the approximate $30 tab - average at best omelets, and otherwise standard and mediocre heaps of classic buffet food. The buffet tables are also set in an oddly lighted room separate from dining tables and this didn't help make the food look appealing. I also had breakfast at the Westin and Hyatt buffets - the Hyatt had the most beautiful view but I found the food at all 3 buffets to be very similar (as were the prices). The pool area - The pool is really beautiful. Wide at parts, narrow and winding elsewhere, and overall huge and nicely landscaped. There's a very, very small slide . . . not like the much larger slides at the Westin and Hyatt (hence, fewer children at the Sheraton). The water temperature was always chilly - sometimes very, very cold. However, I spent most of my time in the warmer ocean water. Although seating right around the pool is a little limited, we always found plenty of seating in a soft, grassy area (pictured below) right near the pool which offered quick access to both the beach and the pool. They require you to use a towel card at the pool, but if you want an extra card, they'll give you that at the front desk and I didn't find anyone employed by the hotel to be particularly concerned about the towel cards. I was more annoyed that they'd always give you a paper wrist bracelet at the pool to ensure that only hotel guests are at the pool. It was just a little too impersonal to me. The beach - The beach is pretty washed away but there's room for some lounge chairs. But I enjoyed just sitting in the grassy area in lounge chairs between the pool and beach and snorkeling and swimming or going in the pool when I chose - it only took 30 seconds to walk to the ocean or pool from this area. I snorkeled several times and was a little disappointed the first couple of times. The water was just so murky. Then one day the water was so clear, like a bathtub and I saw a few turtles, an eel and so many colorful fish. You just have to keep trying I suppose. It gets a bit crowded but you just have to swim around the curb of the black rock (just make sure you have fins and are a good swimmer) for the best snorkeling spot and some beautiful coral. They sell underwater cameras in the gift shop for only $10 (shocking). The proximity to Black Rock makes the Sheraton location so ideal for me. There are few locations where you can snorkel right from the beach with easy water access and have such excellent snorkeling. Fitness room - It's fine, nothing great. There are a few weight machines, a few treadmills and a few ellipticals, a couple of bikes, dumbbells and televisions. There are also locker rooms and showers for guests who have later flights. I inspected the Westin fitness room which was much nicer, with a great view of the ocean and more machines. Location - if you're choosing a hotel on Ka'anapali Beach, it seems to me that you have some pretty nice choices. I really liked the fact that the Sheraton seemed to have fewer kids and more adults than at the Westin and Hyatt. I'm pretty sure this had a lot to do with the large water slides at the aforementioned spots. Whaler's Village, a short walk away has a few restaurants, some fast food, and some decent stores. There's not a lot of night life on Ka'anapali Beach, but Lahaina is less than a 10-minute drive and there's a little more activity there.
