Having driven to Kapalua and Wailea, I'd say we chose the right spot for both relaxation and some night life. Resort fee - Yes, the $26 resort fee is a joke (supposedly goes toward parking, internet fitness - kind of like having to buy tires separate from a new car), but oh well. I think it's a scam to make the hotel seem less expensive and this is too bad . . . it makes the hotel look bad. But overall, I really enjoyed my stay at the Sheraton and if/when I return to Maui, I'm likely to choose it again. I prefer the Ka'anapali Beach location and the Sheraton was the right hotel for me. I will say that although the Westin looked like a nicer hotel from the outside, I preferred being closer to Black Rock and having a more adult atmosphere for this vacation.

Reviews.Title: “In my opinion, this is THE place to stay in Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: Travelhabit
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 nights at the Sheraton Maui in Kaanapali, having chosen it from TripAdvisor reviews (thank you!) I wanted a place just to hang out and relax after my hubby left for the mainland and I had some spare time. I hadn't been to Kaanapali to stay in a hotel in all our years of coming to Hawaii -- approx. 25 visits to Hawaii -- so was anxious to try it and to check it out as an area for possibly having our grandkids come stay with us. First of all, you have to be pretty pushy to get what you want here, but once you figure it out, it is a very nice property, by far the best I saw along the Kaanapali "strip". I booked an Oceanfront room, but the room I stayed in the first night really just looked over a large lawn and the pool area beyond to the ocean. I noticed -- and was told by my bellman -- that Building #4 was really oceanfront, and asked to be moved there. Wow, what a difference! These rooms shouldn't even be in the same category; I can't believe they charge the same. The lanai in Bldg 4 was 2-3 times bigger than the one in Bldg 3 (and the upper floors of Bldg 3 don't really even have lanai's, just about 18 in. of decking, enough to fit just one chair, as this was the first room they put me in and it was completely unacceptable). And the rooms in Bldg 4 are truly Oceanfront. So if a lanai is important to you, be sure to ASK the hotel by calling directlly. The 800# agents have no clue. I was there during the only tsunami warning in nearly 50 years, necessitating a full evacuation of the entire Hawaiian islands' seashores. It was really something looking out at Kaaanapali beach at 11 AM on a gorgeous sunny day with absolutely no one on the beach at all. The big wave never materialized, but I was impressed that the hotel offered free lunch to all their guests as a gesture since we couldn't get out of there until the "all clear' was sounded in early afternoon. They did seem a little shell shocked about the whole event, and I did rail on them a bit about the fact there was absolutely no information at all in the rooms about what to do -- I heard the sirens going off at 6 AM. I googled tsunami on my cell phone and called my hubby back in the states, as he knows all about these things working with the Oceanographic folks. The pool area and nearby bar are really nice, and I loved being able to swim in the "lagoon" type pool. The towel situation is ridiculous (towel cards, etc.), but I've found that pretty endemic throughout the hotels in Hawaii nowadays. The beach is wonderful, and I can echo other posters about the quality of snorkeling, including seeing several turtles very close to shore. I've snorkeled in many places in the world, and this was definitely very nice, considering I could just walk out of my room and onto the beach -- and there I was! Be sure to bring your own snorkeling gear if you can. If you're staying 5-7 days or more, it's worth it to buy your own. The double, canopied cabana that you can rent for $40 is truly decadent. Skip breakfast at the hotel; it's ridiculously expensive and about a C+ in quality. A quick shuttle ride/drive/walk to Duke's north of the property about 3/4 mile is well worth it. There are other breakfast options nearby as well. Re: drinks, I also brought my own rum -- Maui brand rum is great -- and mixed it with my own purchased mixers like passion/guava juice. Do this and you'll save a bundle on drinks from the bar. Eating recommendations nearby: Try Kimo's in Lahaina, Roy's in Kahana, Lelani's in Whaler's Village just a short walk away for dinner. And then there's the wonderful Duke's too, part of the same "network" as these other restaurants. I think the trend towards resort fees is insane. Their $25 + tax a day bought only parking and wireless internet access. Who needs the internet when you want to escape????? BTW, they do have computers you can use for free next to the bar downstairs. I finally discovered them on the last day. There's nothing that tells you in their literature that they're there. All in all, I would return here, but I would be very hard-nosed about where they put me on the property. The staff is friendly if not overly efficient, and seemed to bend over backwards to make it a pleasant stay for me. I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: spazod
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton had a great location and that is the reason we stayed. The snorkeling at Black Rock was great! We saw lots of fish and sea turtles. The nightly ceremony at the Black Rock was fun to watch. We were there during whale season so at sunset we would see all sorts of pods of whales across the horizon, absolutely amazing to see! The rooms at the Sheraton are nice, comfortable bed, nice flatscreen t.v. and balcony. The pool was really nice and big. However, we spent most of our time on the beach. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants due to the price. We went down to Whalers Village which was only about a 10 min. walk where the prices were much cheaper. The resort fee is was a complete rip off, essentially we paid $26 a day to park, for the fitness center, and for towel service. We knew the fee before booking the hotel, so we really couldn't complain. Town of Lahaina has lots of great restaraunts and shopping so we spent a lot of evenings there. Highly recommend renting a car to tour the island.My husband and I got married in Maui and we went back for our 5 year anniversary. We got married on a beach called the Secret Cove or Wedding Cove. A great little secluded beach to visit and right next to Makenna beach which are both absolutely beautiful! Recommend hitting the local Walmart which is near the airport to load up on beer and snacks. We saved a lot of money by buying our own beer and wine and bringing with in insulated mugs on the beach. We also bought a cabana to use on the beach. Saved us $40 a day as that was the price for renting a cabana and/or chairs and umbrella. We were able to bring home the cabana as it was in a compact portable bag, so we can use it on future trips. Some of our favorite restaraunts included: Mama's Fish House, Kimos, Tijuana, and Bubba Gumps. Site seeing: Road to Hana is amazing! Absolutely beautiful green foliage and an adventure like no other! We did a helicopter ride of Maui, no other way to see the entire island and waterfalls. Maui is a beautiful island and a trip you will never forgot!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing late June 2009 stay”
Reviews.Author: pilot0201
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for the first half of our honeymoon in late june 2009. We arrived just as it was getting dark outside. We rented a car and check in was very easy and were greeted with a shell lei. We stayed in the building on top of black rock. We arrived to our room and were somewhat disappointed with the view as our balcony actually was on ground level and a small fence partially blocked our view. We called the front desk and asked if we could be moved to something a floor or two up and they were very helpful and we were moved to another room the next day. We would have stayed in that room as being able to walk out onto the small bit of grass from your balcony was great but we wanted a bit more privacy considering it was our honeymoon. The views from both rooms were breathtaking. The only downside to that area was that it did take two elevators and a few minutes of walking to get down to the beach. It was well worth it though as it was quiet the entire time. The food was excellent and drinks were amazing. Food and drinks were slightly expensive but to be expected at a hotel/resort. Those saying too expensive obviously do not travel very often. I did find though that if you have a drink made you can have the drink topped off with a shot of 151 for cheap.... more booze for the buck. You have to do breakfast at least once as it was spectacular. One tip on breakfast is that there was a coffee stand that opened up in the morning right next to the lobby that served breakfast sandwiches that were cheap and amazing. The lion coffee was outstanding too. The beach was more then we could have asked for. My wife enjoyed the beach and sun from the two person lounge chair with shades. I enjoyed snorkeling around black rock and rented the snorkeling gear right next to the pool. When renting the snorkeling gear I was given the sales pitch for the dinner/sunset catamaran cruise. We decided to do it and it really wasn't too bad price wise considering food and drinks were included. We walked down to where you are picked up by the boat. It was spectacular. It is certainly a must do. Tip.... it was windy and you should plan accordingly. Make sure to bring camera/camcorder as you will capture some amazing pictures. The grounds were well kept and rooms were very clean. The staff was very helpful and nice. The cliff diving from black rock was a blast to watch. We finished our honeymoon by staying in waikiki at the Hilton. Here is a small comparison of the two. Waikiki also had amazing views and slightly cheaper rates. The difference was the service and atmosphere. We were glad to stay in waikiki as we got to do some of the usual touristy things.... but whenever we return to hawaii we will be staying at the Sheraton Maui. We told both hotels that it was our honeymoon and we received a bottle of champagne at the sheraton and at the hilton in waikiki we were told.... we dont offer anything special anymore for honeymoons. Waikiki was crowded and touristy while sheraton maui was incredibly relaxing and we never felt crowded during our entire stay. Overall this is an excellent hotel and one to come back to time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Sheraton Perfect for my 30th”
Reviews.Author: WyoShred
Reviews.Content: I stayed 7 nights at the Maui Sheraton for my 30th birthday in 2009 (5/1-5/7 2009). My BF and I arrived after 8pm and were given shell lei's by the Valet parkers. The gal at actual check in was not friendly at all. We carried our own bags to our room, and only used Valet the first night. Room was standard even with a free upgrade. NO Lanai which was a disapointment. Though the view was great as well as how easy it was to get to the beach and our car in free parking. The breakfast buffet was pretty pricey but in my opinion worth the money. We ate breakfast in Lahaina twice and felt we paid the same for less food. I didn't try any other meals at the hotel. Overall here are my pros & Cons CONS *Daily resort fee really only includes parking and towels-EVERYTHING else costs $$ *NO WI-FI -plug in worked fine *NO LANAI (in our room) *Concierge(s) are way too busy..I waited over 10 min. on 3 different occasions to get help booking a facial..I actually ended up going to the Hyatt concierge!! LOL *beach gets EXTREMELY crowded after 10am *pool area crowded and lack of chairs *Pushy guy at towel / acticity cabana ~ STOP trying to sell me Maui Jim Glasses~I swear he is a rep for Maui Jim!! PROS *LOCATION!! *Snorkeling in the early morning was really exceptional (7am) *maid service was timely and considerate *Beach was perfect for all people all ages *very friendly valet staff *beautifully maintained grounds including Tahitian gardenia, Plumeria and Hibiscus *Free 30th bday drink! All in all this hotel was great for my trip. It was a very last minute and overall I was happy with my experience at the Maui Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location of Maui”
Reviews.Author: youngnan
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Sheraton is the location. Probably the best location in all of Maui: its end of the beach is wide and the waves large and fun; the sand is perfect; black rock is fun. Also, the views from a lot of the rooms go up Kaanapali and are great. Maybe if we hadn't had as nice of a view and some rooms don't appear to have great views, we would not have liked it as much. Inside it is just typical nice hotel. The balconies are large. Everything is clean and the beds are as advertised very comfortable. We had a great time and we have stayed at the Maui Hyatt and Ritz Carlton and we had the best time at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “A good option”
Reviews.Author: HawaiianStyle808
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful room was clean and had everything you could want. Only downside was the breakfast buffet. Overpriced, Crowded and the coffee was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous location & a beautiful property... with a couple issues”
Reviews.Author: SDNative73
Reviews.Content: My fiancee & I got back last week from a week-long stay at the Sheraton, and because I used the feedback provided on TripAdvisor to choose our hotel, I wanted to share our experience for future travelers. The hotel is beautiful and, in my opinion, situated in the best location in Kaanapali. It's located right at Black Rock which has excellent snorkeling and a very nice beach. And the hotel is just a 10-minute walk along the boardwalk to the Whaler's Village mall, with its shops and restaurants. And because of Black Rock, there are not a lot of tourists and shoppers walking by and through the property at most hours of the day (unlike the Westin, for example, which is located next door to the mall). The grounds are maintained very well, and the pool areas are accommodating and clean. The fitness center was modern and more than adequate, and luau was fantastic! I also got a massage at one of the poolside/beachside cabanas (as opposed to one inside the spa), and it was very well done and relaxing--with the sounds of birds, waves crashing, and the wind blowing. And we have no complaints about the friendly staff. For these reasons, I would recommend this hotel, particularly for a couple celebrating a romantic occasion (as we were). However, we did have a few issues with certain aspects of the hotel, and that kept me from giving it 5 out of 5 stars. First, if you do stay there, avoid the breakfast. It's over-priced and the buffet selection is very limited (probably less than a third of the items offered by Starwood's signature hotel in Vegas, Planet Hollywood). The most disappointing part of the buffet was the "freshly squeezed juice", as it said on the menu and was reinforced by our waiter: it was definitely not freshly squeezed, and it was pretty bad! A few other issues that bothered us: one of the pool bars closed daily at 3pm, even if it was still crowded with guests lounging by the pool. Even the waitress who was serving us didn't understand management's decision there. (We could still walk over to the other pool bar to get a drink, but it was not very convenient.) The Starbucks coffee cart closed down daily at 11am; after that there was no decaf available on-site unless the restaurant was open (and it closed down between lunch & dinner). Finally, there was no business center in the hotel, so unless you bring a laptop, you won't be surfing the Internet while you're in Maui (but then again, you're in Maui, so not that big of a deal). So, there were a few minor flaws, but don't let them scare you away--the Sheraton Maui is a first-class property and definitely worthy of a stay!

Reviews.Title: “wow! An absolutely perfect vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryAutumn
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maui staying at the Sheraton. We were upgraded to a deluxe ocean view room that looked over the Luau (building 2). The room was gorgeous. At night time we slept with our patio door open because it was so quiet and felt very safe. The people were extremely friendly who worked there. We never did eat on the resort, but ate at Whaler's Village (Hula's Grill-VERY GOOD) and in Lahina. We loved the location-snorkeled at Black Rock a few times,swam in the ocean and sat by the pool once-which was very refreshing to swim in on a hot day! We had no complaints and loved every minute of our 10 day vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel in Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: JillandScott
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels in Maui but this is my favorite. The beach is great and snorkeling around black rock is super convenient. Stay in building 6 if you can where the views are better and parking is right in front so you donâ€™t have to use valet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but very outdated hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelpal28411
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our three day stay on Maui based on the reviews on trip advisor and the price, since hotels in Wailea were extremely expensive. I must say that, upon arriving, it was not what I expected. It looked more like a motel to me, than a hotel. Doors were all on the outside, just like a motel. I was not impressed with the room or the bed and definitely not the view. Our view going into our room was of some type of plant or cleaning facility. It was an extreme eyesore. I wish I could upload the photo. (I will try to do so in the future). The balcony door could not be left open at night because the balconies were so close together that you could easy access the person's next to you by climbing over. This made me feel a little unsafe. I did not particularly care for the beach here as it is very narrow and small. I'm aware that it has won awards in the past but I did not think it was so great after seeing many other beaches in my travels. One positive is that it is close to Black Rock which does have a cliff diving service at sundown. That was cool to see. You can also jump off the rock yourself in the daytime and snorkel around the rock, which opens up to a large open area on the other side. There is no great access though and you have to swim around the rock to the other side or climb the rock yourself. Lahina was great for dining so we drove there every night for dinner. There are some very good restaurants there and we were glad that it was not a far drive to dinner. One that we hightly recommend is the Lahina Grill (pricey but worth every penny). We also were appreciative of our Concierge that helped us to book our helicopter tour and whale watching trip. She helped us to make the most of our time in Maui. Service was good from what we experienced. The gentleman that brought our luggage to the room spent about 45 minutes with us, telling us all about the hotel and the area. I must say that it gave us some great ideas on things to do and places to see, etc. This hotel prides themselves on service. The pool was as cold as ice. I did swim but I was freezing. Their snack bar outside did not open until noon which was odd since there were people out there at 8am looking to get a drink/water, etc. There were also very few chairs so I ended up on the grass near the hedges with ants all over my book. SPA: I had a pedicure here. It was very quick and looked nice but not much pampering for the money. Good in a pinch only. In conclusion, I don't think we would visit this hotel again. We will return to Maui but we will save up and stay in the Fairmont in Wailea next time.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING - Thank You Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: ykf
Reviews.Content: I am not sure where to begin (I apologize that it will be long). When we arrived after our very long trek from Toronto, I was ready to cry. We were not greeted by anyone. No lei, no 'hi', nothing! We had to carry our own luggage up and figure out where the front desk was. We checked in and were given a Mountain View Room - which was an upgrade from our Garden View Room (the person we checked in with - didn't tell us, I figured that out later). We arrived pretty late and were really tired so I didn't really look at the view. Our room was standard, nothing too impressive. I noticed mould on the paintings (yup, in a frame) and was just miserable. I was also a bit depressed that no one had said anything about us getting married on their property in a few days. We decided to go down and have dinner at Teppanayki Dan. Finally. I was impressed! GREAT Service and the food! The food was glorious!! I had a great time and the server was extremely nice. It was a great way to unwind from a 12 hour flight. We went to bed and when I woke up, I was greeted by the sun coming over the mountian and that's when I realized that despite some minor flaws, I was in Maui and was staying at a great hotel!!! And it was, the service became outstanding. Every waiter, every bartender, the help desk, room service - everyone was so welcoming. Our view ended up being amazing, and I literally watched the sunrise every morning from my balcony! Finally, our wedding day approached. (I should mention, our wedding was just the two of us). After a few minor slips with getting the marriage license, it was truly the best day of my life. The wedding planner, Michelle, was amazing, and I felt like she was a longtime friend by the end of everything. The scene was beautiful, and she helped us pick a great photographer and videographer. I could not have wished for anything else, it was the most beautiful day! We ended up having the Sheraton's 'Dinner Under the Stars' which blew our minds! The food was great, and it felt like we were the only ones on the beach. It was the most romantic dinner I will ever have, it felt better than a movie! I can truly say that because of Michelle and the Sheraton staff - I felt like a queen. We were given the royal treatment! (THANK YOU MICHELLE AND BRIAN) Needless to say, we were so impressed with this hotel. After the inital check-in, everything after was impressive. The grounds were taken care of, the hotel was always clean, and the pool was gorgeous! I did however (and I was glad given the nature of our stay) feel like this hotel was geared towards couples instead of families. I did not encounter many children during our stay, and I quite liked that. We didn't love the food at Keka'a, Cliff Dive etc. Strangely, it felt like cheap family dining. Not very impressive. Since I was having my hair for our wedding done at the Westin we decided to take advantage at the 'Stay at One, Dine At All' program and have lunch there before my appointment. WOW!!!! The hotel was modern and chaotic, I would've been very sad to stay there but the food was out of this world!! Tropica was like high end dining, and I thought it was strange since the Westin appeared to be more child friendly. We ended up eating at the Westin alot. So glad we were able to! (Oh! And after our wedding - our wedding planner had tucked in a card with our champagne that said 'welcome and "here's a little taste of Maui" to get us started'. At first we were confused but then I realized that it was in reference to the bag of goodies that had been there all week! We didn't know it was a gift for us but thought we had to pay for it! It would have probably made the first day better (it's the little things that count!) but we still appreciated it after! It gave my husband a good chuckle since he wasn't bothered with the little stuff all along). I loved the Sheraton. I loved Maui. I will highly recommend this to everyone I meet!!

Reviews.Title: “A touch of class Maui style”
Reviews.Author: DetroitBridgeguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Moana building in an oceanfront king at the end of January 2010. On our first morning we could hear whales breathing from our balcony. What a great way to start vacation after a very long plane ride. The check-in staff were nice and friendly. There was a small mixup in our room selection and they quickly ironed it out. The view from the Moana is of Molokai and this time of year you can see whales frolicking. The only minus is that the resort is a little spread out and its a bit of a maze to get from Moana to the beach and central areas. Small price to pay for the view. The beach is a little small but it wasn't crowded. A word to the wise: be very careful snorkeling out and around the Blackrock point. It is deceptively dangerous and unless you are a very strong swimmer and experienced snorkeler I would recommend a flotation device. Given that the reef is spectacular and the turtles are very used to people. The breakfast buffet and omelet bar were very nice and the buffet varied from day to day. The ocean front bar is pretty good with a great location. The on-site restaurants are passable but nothing to write home about. Skip the luau, try the traditional luau in old Lahaina instead. All-in-all the location, beach, and resort amenities were very nicely done and in keeping with the laid back style of Maui. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: MickeyPeanut
Reviews.Content: We had been to Hawaii multiple times and this visit was our favorite. We had a view of the ocean but we were in one of the further back buildings. However, the view was still beautiful. The Sheraton is perfectly located on the beach. Of the resorts located in Lahaina, the Sheraton has one of the best beaches. Note, not all the hotels along this beach coast actually have a large enough beach to spend the day on. It was perfect being by Black Rock. Each day,we would rent a chair (yes you have to rent them) and would spend the day snorkling. You can rent equipment daily. I suggest if you are going to snorkel most of your time there, to rent equipment elsewhere because it does it costly. We saw turtles (early morning or later afternoon), tons of fish and an occasional sting ray. The pool areas are also nice but once we discovered the beach, we spent most of our time there. At night, we would walk along the beach path and could see other hotels. About 5 minutes down the path is a small mall. Many shops and some restaurants (including McDonalds). It was enjoyable to walk this path - lots of beautiful sites. the Sheraton has a restaurant by the pools. Nothing fancy but nice. Lunch will run you about $12-$15 a person. There is also a fancy restaurant for dinner but we skipped it due to cost. The one bad thing about this hotel is the beds are extremely hard. Our backs ached by the end of the week. I would definitely stay at the Sheraton again because of its location on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Maui at its finest!”
Reviews.Author: ken4100
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Black Rock Sheraton during the end of January. We stayed in building Hale Moana in a Deluxe Ocean Front room. This building had some of the best views compared to the other 2 building choices. The Ocean Front Rooms are located on a giant volcanic rock peninsula that juts out into the water. Make sure to stay on at least floor 3 or higher for best views. The view from our room was nothing short of amazing! We could watch sea turtles swimming below and were greeted every morning by the sight of whales splashing in the distance. We noticed much more whale activity on bright sunny days. Make sure to bring your binoculars! Another bonus of the Ocean Front rooms is that you can park fairly close to the units to make walks to and from the car minimal. The room was very nicely updated and had plasma TV, refrigerator and microwave. The room was very clean and well kept up. The Ocean Front Rooms took 3 elevator rides to get to the beach but the view and privacy was well worth it! We found the food was a little on the pricey side so we ate many meals at the local CJ's Comfort Zone restaurant located just N on the main highway and brought our own soft ice chest to the beach. This hotel's common areas are designed "open air" so the cool "Trade Winds" are always pleasantly blowing through all areas. The decor of this hotel was very impressive and the staff was very attentive and friendly. This property has a paved sidewalk near the ocean we used to walk 5 minutes to the Whaler's Village Mall. The grounds of this hotel had tons of sweet smelling Plumaria and Ginger trees and were extremely well kept up. In my opinion, the beach this hotel is located on, Kaanapali Beach, is one of the best beaches on the island with regard to proximity to amenities and water/weather. The Black Rock peninsula this hotel is located on is an excellent snorkel spot with many sea turtle and fish populations in the area as well as an on-site snorkel equipment rental shop. Make sure to get your goggles sprayed with the no-fog mixture the shop has for fog free enjoyment. We really enjoyed this hotel and will be back. Swimming pool is a bit on the cool side but felt good after staying in sun a bit too long! Make sure to get the Road to Hana CD and drive this amazing road!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed on two islands, 4 hotels and this was our favorite!”
Reviews.Author: vamktpro
Reviews.Content: When we arrive late in the evening (plane delayed two hours) we learned that our room was two double beds, not the king bed we wanted for our 25th anniversary. The hotel was sold out, the Skins golf tournament was in town and the place was packed. The hotel did place us in a larger room designed for families. We wanted to change the next day and they were wonderful about that. However, Building 2 was so close to everything (parking, pools, beach, dining) we eventually elected to not move. The buffet breakfasts were wonderful, make sure to do this. The pineapple was so fresh it was amazing. We did not experience the issue with kids running around others mention. Likely it was due to going mid-January. We stayed on two islands at four hotels and always used this one as our benchmark. Hall sound was an issue, when guests left their rooms we could hear the doors slam shut all night. That was our only negative. Great beds, easy parking, snorkel off the beach and central to lots of restaurants. My favorite was the tropical themed pool winding around with the hot tub located ina secluded part of the pool. The atmosphere here was fantastic. We would go back if in the area again. Look for the free newspapers, they go fast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location....but”
Reviews.Author: Czern
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January, we've visited this hotel before. First, we were checked in by the valet stand, not very welcoming at all...Our luggage was transported by a terrific guy from Oregon, the rest of the staff should take a page from him. On our fifth stay here we found the hotel to be less friendly than ever before. Seemed like the pool kiosk staff had a real attitude, they were alot more interested in selling sunglasses than providing towels to the guests. They were running around the pool area handing out wristbands and the card system for retrieving a towel leaves alot to be desired. We were told when we left this hotel and travelled to another Island that the pool kiosk was contracted by a separate company, that may explain it. Every morning we got an annoying phone call from guest services asking us to participate in a luau, bbq or some other function which of course we would have to pay for. I could do without that, give me a list of activities at check in and if we want to participate we will. Also, we were charged 25 per day activites fee which seems over the top. We never did figure out if the two bottles of water were part of the deal or not. Seems at these prices, an activitiy fee is a bit much. I don't know about anyone else, but when we travel we appreciate a smile or friendly greeting and found that on two other islands this trip but not here.

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: chardj
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for 9 days at the Sheraton Maui in a deluxe ocean view room in Building 6 and loved every minute of it. The view was excellant. We woke up every morning to the sight and sounds of whales feeding their young. This was my first time in Maui and I hope it will not be my last time. I liked the fact that it was quiet and secluded in the area where we were located. We also slept with the door open on the lanai so we could hear the ocean and the whales at night. The rooms were very clean and the staff that we came in contact with were very cordial. The only complaint I would have is that the prices in the Restaurant (Black Rock Steakhouse) are way too expensive. It might have been half way reasonable if the price included your salad or vegetable or something. The grounds, pool and beaches around the resort were fantastic. This place is paradise. I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty on the Outside...”
Reviews.Author: kevin73737
Reviews.Content: We went to Maui looking for a great beach, sightseeing, exploring, and the nightlife. We're a young couple in our late 20's and we were looking for a relaxing, serene environment. This was not the place for that, but I think we were expecting too much. The pictures are so gorgeous on the site so we thought we were set for a luxurious time. We weren't really impressed with this place. Nice staff and all that, it just was a little, run down it seemed. Let me give you an overview. I will try to be helpful. Pros: The grounds are beautiful. Free drink upon check-in. Nice beach. Gorgeous at night. Check out the torch lighting ceremony they do in the evening. Don't miss the sunset. I hear the Sheraton has a great Luau, but most tend to say the Old Lahaina Luau is the better. The staff seem to be very friendly and helpful. They were able to help me when we had our phone stolen (not on the resort). The resort feels safe, the pools are gorgeous, the best thing about this place is the grounds. Lush vegetation, flowers, very pretty place. Cons: Not worth the price. If you like the corporate/hotel feel, this place is for you. It gets crowded, as most large hotels do, but they manage to keep things relatively quiet. It's a La Quinta/Holiday Inn room. No luxury at all unless you get out your checkbook and pay top dollar for a suite. Not cozy to say the least, but it's your average hotel room, for a more than average price. It's located in Ka'anapali which isn't really close to anything grand. The airport is quite a drive away. Sure you're on a nice stretch of beach with other hotels and a golf course, but if you're looking for the nightlife, stay in Wailea or Lahaina. Everything on the resort was over the top expensive. The drinks, the phone calls. It's to be expected, just don't use the phone or do anything on the resort. Advice: Don't eat or drink anything on the resort. Too expensive. Brink snacks to the room. Go to Old Lahaina Luau. Also, downtown Lahaina is THE place for the nightlife. Bring 5 bucks for parking. Go to Moose McGillicuddy's and have a beer and get the pork tacos. Drive the Road to Hana. It's amazing. Drive up to the Haleakala crate (10000 feet up) and get a look at the world from above the clouds. That was so spectacular. The "partial ocean view" is very partial. Either pay for an Ocean view or don't. Its not worth being in between for the prices they charge because you'll end up with a Mountain View room and a crick in your neck to see the ocean on the far left, or whatever the case may be.

Reviews.Title: “Typical 4-star hotel: Great service, nice rooms, beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: midwestmaven
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here as part of a group business trip. Upon arrival they have "seamless check-in" which means that you check-in at the bell hop desk instead of the lobby. The luggage is loaded onto the cart and your car is parked (free for first night!) immediately. We were shown to our room by a very informative bell hop who immediately corrected an error when we arrived at our room. We were given a room with double beds instead of the king we had requested. He took care of it within minutes and we were settled into the correct room. The room decor is nice, but the furniture is a little beat up... I understand that they are systematically upgrading the rooms, so this should take care of itself eventually. Housekeeping was impeccable, and I am VERY picky. The oceanview was truly ocean "view" as you can see from my attached photos. We were in building three on the fourth floor. The service in the restaurants was pleasant and prompt, as was the poolside bar. If I had to list a negative, it would be all of the noisy children at the pool. I have children myself, but left them at home so we could relax. There were a LOT of children here! If you are planning on peace and quiet, you may want to rethink this hotel. Perhaps we were there during a busy "child" time. The snorkeling is fantastic right off of the beach at the hotel...we even saw several sea turtles. You could also see whales from our lanai. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for business travelers and families. If you are looking for a romantic honeymoon spot... I'm not so confident.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Resort!! Best service and awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: happy123PhoenixAZ
Reviews.Content: If you are planning to visit the island of Maui---I highly recommend staying at the Sheraton Maui Resort & Spa. The resort is located directly on black rock--it is by far the best location on the island. The resort is located on Kaanapali Beach---everything is nearby, it is walking distance to Whalers Village, the beach is awesome and only minutes from the hotel is the quaint little town of Lahaina which has great shopping and restaurants. Believe me, I have been visiting Maui every year for the last 20 years---AND THIS IS BY FAR---THE BEST PLACE TO STAY! All of the staff is friendly and helpful. Do yourself a favor and stay at the Sheraton---you will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place in Maui, let me tell you why”
Reviews.Author: Connoisseurus_Rex
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel on two occasions. The first time, it rained the whole stay...argh...we knew we had to return. The second time I called and spoke with the hotel manager as I had met her the first time I was there...she was very polite on the phone and actually remembered me from the previous year. She was sooo apologetic about the weather when I was there on my honeymoon, that she offered to upgrade my room (if available) and gave my wife and I free breakfast...it was such a nice gesture. I love the location of the Sheraton...if you enjoy snorkeling, look no further....Black Rock is amazing...I have so many pictures...the sea turtles are HUGE and amazing to follow around...if you're into golf, the backside of the Sheraton is a golf course...if you want a gym, up on the hill behind the hotel is a great gym (the facility has one but I am a diehard workout fiend and needed more). if you want great dining, you're close to everything...excursions too... The service is very good and the staff quite friendly. It is a mellow place to stay...being a Sheraton and not a W or Westin, or whatever would make you think it is just average...well, that's simply not the case. The Sheraton Maui is a great place to stay and the price is right! Why spend all your money on a hotel room when you could be spending it on excursions or good meals? When I return to Maui (and I plan to again sometime in the future), I'll be sure to stay at the Sheraton Maui again...nothing beats waking up first thing in the morning and going for a nice snorkel/swim at Black Rock...you never know what you'll see! Go there...you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “PLACE IS GREAT JUST DEPENDS ON WHAT YOU EXPECT”
Reviews.Author: michaelAlbertaCanada
Reviews.Content: As you have read in other posts the hotel has its ups and downs...We stayed ocean front and it was amazing to see the whales and the turtles.We travelled with 5 year old twins and this is the one problem i had with the place.With having small children we need to be in the pool with them and the pool was frezzing...Not just cold....We Went to visit other resorts and used there pools and they were not as cold and i could swim with my kids. I Would have to say depending on what your paying and what your doing in maui..i would look around... tip...phone the hotel and ask there rate...always ask if breakfast is included....

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: ryrys
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed for 10 days. It was amazing. We booked the deluxe 1-bed room with ocean view and it was slightly below expectations, but not by much. The shower was great with a super large head, the bed was comfortable, and the view was amazing. We could sleep with the balcony sliding door open without getting cold or having bugs enter the room. Cable TV selection is poor, though, and moves are overpriced. Also, the resort charges a ton for daily useage ($25/day, I believe) and for the restaurants (spent $135 for a meal at the Black Rock restaurant for a meal which should have cost about $85). The grounds of the hotel are amazing and so large that if you are willing to walk, you can find some isolated, romantic spots to look at the sunset at night. Also, the pool was freezing cold and the ocean was only in the low 70's so you would expect the average sized jacuzzi which holds about 10 people to be packed, but it never really had more than 4-5 people at a time. We went and visited several other resorts in Kaanapali with the possibility of purchasing a timeshare, and only a few were comparable to the Sheraton. They were the Westin and Marriott. Our favorite parts of the trip were the location of the hotel on black rock, snorkeling in front of the hotel, walking to the Whaler Village (5 min walk) for dinner each night, running to Lahaina (3.5 miles each way), and crossing black rock and spending time on the more isolated beach on the other side of the rock. I even was able to walk about 10 min. down the beach each morning to the Marriott to bodyboard good waves on Kaanapali point. I highly recommend the hotel for couples looking for a romantic getaway. Definitely not singles, though. Possibly those with kids may enjoy it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Blah.....there are better choices.”
Reviews.Author: EasySmitty
Reviews.Content: Summary: I found this hotel/resort to be merely average in all respects with the possible exception of location, which I will get to below. My complaints with the Sheraton were all individually minor, but without anything that was truly excellent on the "plus" side (except arguably the location), I have to say I would not stay at this location again, especially with so many other choices on Maui. Location: The Sheraton is the "last" hotel in a string of hotels in the Ka'anapali beach resort. As such, it is located right next to the "black rock", a lava rock outcropping which juts out into the ocean. I did not do any snorkeling at the resort but supposedly this is a good area for it. You can basically walk right out of the hotel, rent some equipment on the beach, and walk right out into the ocean and snorkel, which is convenient. However, the black rock snorkel area is close to ALL the hotels in the strip - all you have do is walk 5 minutes down the paved beach path from any of the other resorts and you can take advantage of this "amenity." The downside to being at the "end of the chain" of resorts is that at nighttime, the place is really really dead. There's nobody walking around, and nothing going on. Some might prefer the tranquility, but I like to be right in the action. For instance, on my last night there, at 9:30, I walked from my building (#3) to the front desk to print my boarding pass. I did not see ONE person for the entire trip, which was kinda creepy for a place that can accommodate this many people. Nobody in the hallways, elevators, or visible on the grounds. There wasn't even anyone at the front desk, concierge, or valet! If you want to find the action, walk up towards the "whaler's village" where there are a whole bunch of shops, and a couple of popular restaurants. That's where everybody seems to hang out at night since there is nothing going on at the Sheraton. Rooms: My room (partial ocean view) in building 3 and the complex overall was looking a little bit "tired." I think the hotel staff is doing the best they with what they have - I saw them doing maintenance in many areas - but you can only do so much before it's time to strip it out and start over. What I mean by "tired" is that the carpets and paint are a bit worn, the furniture is scratched, and the tiling in the bathroom shows the age and wear of thousands of travelers. For what the Sheraton costs, I was also shocked by the small size of the room and lanai. Due to the curvature of the facade, my lanai started out about 3 feet wide on one end and curved down to 6 inches on the other. BARELY enough room for one chair. There are no desks in the room - only a rectangular table and wicker "lounge" type chair. This made it virtually impossible to set my laptop up in a comfortable manner. The fact is that the room is too small to accommodate a "work" type desk/chair and also a "relax" type chair, so they ditched the desk. I know you're supposed to be relaxing in Maui, but I'm sure I'm not the only one who would like a small spot to set up a computer. Another thing I found weird is that the towel rack is INSIDE the shower. Unless you take them all off the rack, dry towels on the top rack get damp while you shower, and wet towels hanging there to dry get wet all over again. Dumb. Bedding: The mattress was not the best nor the worst hotel bed I've ever slept on. My biggest complaint is that there was NO SHEET. Yes, the only thing they give you is a big fluffy down comforter with a sheet duvet cover attached to it. This makes no sense to me! Maybe the hotel management didn't notice but Hawaii is TROPICAL. Your choice is to therefore sleep on the bed with nothing whatsoever covering you, or swelter under the huge comforter. Even with the A/C cranked up to the max, the comforter was too hot and I my wife and I cursed it every night. Food: The hotel has one dining area. During the day it is the breakfast buffet, and at night it automagically becomes the Black Rock Steak and Seafood "fine dining" restaurant with the switching of menus - I will review the restaurant separately on tripadvisor. As part of my vacation package, I got free breakfast coupons for the buffet every day. The only thing good I can say about the breakfast buffet is that once you sat down to eat the view was nice. But the buffet itself was only worth it if it was free. The scrambled eggs were runny, the has browns greasy, all the "hot" food was cold, and there was nobody minding the buffet at all times to replace food which had run out. I ate there twice and only because it was free with my package. The rest of the days the thought of going down there in the morning to eat kind of repulsed me and I skipped the breakfast. If it's free, the breakfast might be OK for a family who doesn't want to leave the hotel and if the kids are bugging you to eat before swimming, but in summary, skip the hotel restaurants entirely if you are a food snob like I am. Exterior: The Sheraton resort is huge and sprawling. I think there are at least 8 buildings, and I may not have even seen them all. It takes some time to wander all the way through it, and to learn where things are. The exterior of the building is well maintained and architecturally interesting, and the grounds themselves are immaculate and lit by gas tiki torches at night. They have a great pool system, with various meandering "branches" of the pool that wind around, go under bridges, and meet up with small grottos. Kids seemed to be having a blast swimming around and exploring the pool complex. Staff: I had very little interaction with the staff after check-in, but my interactions were pleasant. On the rare occasion you'd see staff in the hall, they always said "Aloha" and smiled.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed!!”
Reviews.Content: After a long trip to Hawaii I checked into my room to relax and take a nice warm shower - only to find out they did not have hot water. There was no mention of this when I checked in, which would have given me the opportunity to change hotels. It was late the next day before the hot water was back on. I understand that problems do come up but felt that I should receive some type of discount for their lack of hot water. when I called the desk they said all they could do was credit me back the $26. resort fee. I paid $580. per night for a room without hot water and all they would do is give me a $26. credit! I emailed starwood/sheraton customer service to to let them know what had happened and all got back was a smug reply say they considered the matter closed. This is the last time I will stay at the Maui Sheraton

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, wish I could live there!”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelingAddict
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous at the mixed reviews for the Sheraton Maui, but I ended up having a great time. The room was always clean, no issues at all (we had the mountain view, which turned out to be a view of the tennis courts and...ocean!) We also never heard our neighbors. Parking was always plentiful, there were tons of space. The Starbucks cart is only open around breakfast time and charges $4 or $5 for a venti regular brewed coffee. Breakfast sandwiches were about $6. We had the buffet breakfast once (about $29 per person) but the food was hot and tasty. The made to order omelettes were huge! We didn't eat dinner at the hotel because we heard it wasn't that good (and it was pricey, nothing surprising there for hotels) but Whalers Village is a less than 10 minute walk away. There's Leilani's on the beach and Hula, 2 great places to eat there. The pool chairs were a bit hard to find because people reserved chairs w/ their towels (they were sometimes gone for a really long time), but by mid to late afternoon when we got back we could find 2 chairs next to each other. The beach was nice but it shrunk during the week because of strong waves every day. We rented chairs for $10/day, the umbrella was $20/day...expensive and annoying to pay for, but I like being on chairs so suckers like me pay for these things! Oh there's no beach alcohol / food service, but there's 2 bars on opposite ends by the pools. And...the waves were fun if you could swim and snorkeling was nice!! but if you're there, be careful if you snorkel where the teens jump off from blackrock...one of them landed on a snorkeler and there was a lot of yelling and fighting after that. So just keep a safe distance. The concierge was also helpful in booking tours. There's 3 of them, so the wait wasn't bad. All in all, I'd definitely stay here again! (oh the only complaint we really had was it was hard to find our way around the property...there weren't many signs around and lots of paths to choose from)

Reviews.Title: “Mold at the Sheraton Maui”
Reviews.Author: sadPalmSprings
Reviews.Content: We had been to this property many times in the past as location and beach are excellent. However, last October in the 6000 wing (North wing) at ground level we discovered mold under the air conditioner that had been there a long time and was well known by management who withheld the information from the guests and continued to rent the rooms knowing there was mold in a whole line of rooms

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel at a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Mme_X
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a very nice hotel with spacious, comfortable rooms, very good housekeeping, comfortable beds and AC, beautiful gardens, and most of the other things that you expect at a well-run business-class hotel/resort. There are some relativley small irksome things (described below,) but overall it was a nice stay. We'd return, but even though we got a good discount off the rack rate, I'd compare other properties along Kanapali Beach if we want to be in this area again. Room #4308 is an ocean front room with a gorgeous view up the beach. King bed; lainai; spotless housekeeping; nice shampoo/conditioner/lotion toiletries (we didn't get shower gel until the 4th night of our stay.) It was a walk from the lobby and parking lot, but it's hard to compain when walking by beautiful bouganvillia and birds. -- we didn't mind. They try to do a good job of managing the property. While the hotel was not that crowded during our stay, they do a good job of helping mind the manners of pool goers, i.e. if you are not at your towels for a while, they will clean them up and let otehrs have the chiars. This also prevents the selfish couples who claim six chairs for different times of day. There is a pool towel check-out procedure that helps and is not onerous. While more expensive hotels manage this whole thing differently, they are also twice the price here. We liked the walking path up the beach that allows you to explore both the beach and other hotels, dining spots, etc. The location at Black Rock was wonderful both for snorkeling, and providing a small area where the surf was not as rough as some parts of the beach at this time of year. Of course, there was lots of other resort stuff going on - tiki bars, cliff diver, water sports (for a fee,) concierge, etc. Of course, my main criticism is the unethical practice of the mandatory resort fee. This should always be built into the price of the room. It's nice when it includes things like free parking and local call, but truly annoying when they still nickel-and-dime you -- or more like $20 a day -- for a beach umbrella. Also: the internet access is relatively slow, and should be included in the room rate anyway. The breakfast was expensive and only okay, but the setting is nice. We found other spots in Kapalua and nearby areas on other mornings. Not sure what to make of it: while we were a bit early for check-in, they asked if we wanted an upgrade. It seemed that they were not well-trained in this -- upgrade to WHAT? Is this a guessing game? We have an ocean-front room -- what is better? Free breakfast? Suite? Do I have to beg for details? We kept our room and were very happy -- and it seemed ready quite soon. So -- nice stay, but there are other good properties on Maui. We also stayed at the Four SEasons in Wilea on this trip -- partly no comparison, given the price difference. FYI: Clint Eastwood was filming his latest movie in the lobby with Matt Damon when we checked out.

Reviews.Title: “A great trip for our anniversary!!”
Reviews.Author: mlamames
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Maui Resort was PERFECT! The room we booked was not available so we were upgraded to another room. We found this room to be perfectly fine however...we don't know what we didn't get either. The location is perfect! I can't imagine another location could be better. Black Rock is the place to snorkel. We would definitely stay there again. Frustrations: The buffet breakfast was good and plentiful but often the food was a tad cold but there were lots of choices of good breakfast foods to pick from. My biggest disappointment was the $25.00 DAILY resort fee. What a SURPRISE!! We booked a package which included air and hotel and assumed our "resort fee" was included...NOT the case. $25.00 + tax per day is a bit pricey for a daily resort fee and what is offered. The things offered are pretty standard. I mean shouldn't you be able to park 1 car where your paying to stay? And internet service...isn't that customary anywhere now days???

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: vwaldean
Reviews.Content: Even though I've only been to Hawaii once, this was definitely the right place to stay. Everytning you need is right here, from the fooe to the pools, but mainly the beach! It's right on Black Rock, the best snorkeling on the beach. I saw a turtle while I was wading in the waves! I will return. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location but average hotel”
Reviews.Author: melita1
Reviews.Content: A fantastic beach but the hotel is tuned for " processing" large numbers of tourists. Buffet breakfast was the worst we had during our three weeks travelling Hawaii and every evening there were loud corporate parties going on to well after midnight on the lawn in front of our room stopping any chance of sleep. We did not see any of the bugs reported in previous reviews but the rooms are looking old and greasy. Just about clean but not really clean. We discovered old beer cans and plastic bags from the previous occupants of our room when we looked under the bed.I would only recommend the beach but not the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The good goes with the bad”
Reviews.Author: deputychris
Reviews.Content: I have used trip advisor a lot but never posted any reviews. After my summer Hawaii trip, I thought I would start. And I would start with this hotel. I have always believed that if you wanted to, you could find something to complain about with anything, so I usually like to give the good with the bad. First the good. What an amazing location. You are right on black rock, and the beach is right there. Itâ€™s great. Just a quick swim to amazing views swimming around black rock. There is a small walking trail that goes all the way up the beach, to the shops and everything. Its nice being able to just walk down there and not have to drive the car, find a spot to park, ect ect. The location is good. I stayed in building 6, deluxe ocean FRONT (yes there is a difference between ocean view and front). The view was amazing! What a great room and a great location. The room was big for being a non-suite, and I loved the balcony right there on black rock. Downside to building 6 is you have to walk to get places. But unless you have a serious problem with your health and need a little kart to drive u around, you should be fine. Itâ€™s not as bad as people say. The Bad: Just remember when you book this place they charge you a $26+ fee everyday for â€œinternetâ€� and â€œparkingâ€� and â€œyogaâ€� and stuff like that. Well I saw the yoga and 4 people were doing it. Basically this is additional profit hidden as an â€œamenity feeâ€� which is crazy!!! It is way too high. I didnâ€™t realize how much of a sham it was until I was there. The internet in my room ran at about 5-10 kb/sec. Just a tad higher than dialup. No high speed at all. Parking, well letâ€™s just say if you are in building 6 (which has its own parking lot) and you get home around 11pm+, good luck finding a spot. Many people had to illegally park. I just kept parking in the â€œhotel cart onlyâ€� parking. Figured if they wanted me somewhere else they would build a space for me. Also they have this â€œquick check inâ€� where you pretty much get whisked right to your room. Ok in theory, but then they call you telling you to give them a credit card number for â€œincidentalsâ€� Well I donâ€™t do â€œincidentalsâ€� and I am on vacation and donâ€™t feel the need to walk to the lobby and give them my card for something I will never use. Hotel stuff is priced way to high. If they needed the card, they would have gotten in when I checked in. Well about day 3 into my trip, and I am in the shower and I hear my door open (I had the chain up).. I came to the door and itâ€™s the front desk coming into my room to find out why I havenâ€™t given them a card number? Also they disarmed my door key so my door wouldnâ€™t open? I was furious. I asked the manager of the front desk, who was the same young lady who came into my room, why she did it. She said â€œto check on you to make sure you were ok because you never gave us your credit card for incidentalsâ€� I said â€œask housekeeping. If I am dead I think they would know about it, they are in here every day.â€� She said she was sorry, but I would no longer be allowed in my room until I gave her a credit card number. She said â€œitâ€™s the computerâ€� (I hate this cop out) I said â€œyou programmed the computer to do that, donâ€™t blame it.â€� She said she was sorry and that was it. So that was my bad, pretty annoyed. When I checked out, she was at the front desk. She saw me, and walked to the back, leaving 1 person for about 7 people in line until I left... It was very funny! ï�Š What great service! Overall a great location, just make sure you give them your credit card number, even if the trip is prepaid and they donâ€™t ask for it when you check in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort - what you would expect in Hawaii and at a Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: dsmulligan
Reviews.Content: I was not blown away by the Sheraton, but it was definitely nice. I had been to Hawaii before and stayed at a Sheraton in Oahu and a bungalow in Maui. What makes this resort nice is the view! My husband and I were on our honeymoon and booked an Oceanfront View room. The room we booked was not available so they told us they would upgrade us and move us into a Deluxe Oceanfront room. However, these rooms are in a separate tower which seems to be an add-on to the other building. It was a far walk (we even had to drive there from the main lobby). After 1 night we complained and were moved into the original room we booked, which really was much better than the "upgrade" they gave us. Overall, it was a good stay. How can you complain in Maui?? The weather was great and the people very nice. The pool, however, was quite crowded and there was always a wait in the morning for breakfast. While we were there, everything seemed great, but then we went to the Fairmont Orchid on the Big Island and saw how much better a hotel can be!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gammagangster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui from Dec. 20-30. The hotel was clean, the room was very adequate and the staff was friendly and helpful. The beach and snorkelling was fabulous. The location is great. We walked to many restaurants (Leilani's, Hula Grill) and shopping (Whalers village) right from the hotel. The food prices are high at the hotle but overall the food was decent.

Reviews.Title: “My glass is half full review”
Reviews.Author: EdmontonFritz
Reviews.Content: Firstly I'd like to address the people that think they can stay in an expensive beachfront hotel and expect the food to be cheap....yes the food is expensive as well!. That being said the breakfast at Castaway Cafe (at the Kaanapali Villas, north Kaanapali beach) is very good,beachfront and reasonable. The 25 dollar resort fee, which includes parking and internet is not that bad at all compared to another places I have stayed in big cities, where you pay at least 20 dollars just for parking. Internet connections can also be pricey. On the topic of the beautiful,fun swimming pools, I'll just say that they were REFRESHING to say the least. We saw no bugs, especially cockroaches like past guests. The hotel being the oldest on the strip was still very nice, although the rooms are getting a bit tired. The grounds and location are second to none. All the staff that we encountered were very helpful and friendly. For a good rate we would stay again but not for their starwood preferred rate of 400+ dollars. Being starwood members, we got a late check-out, no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location, decent value.”
Reviews.Author: njsparty
Reviews.Content: The rooms and service are what you would expect from a Sheraton, which in my opinion, is very nice. The location is the highlight of this property. Right on 'Black Rock' made this place ideal for snorkeling from the shore as well as walking a few hundred feet from the room to the beautiful beach on Maui. Walking distance to the other resort and restaurants in the area. The food was good, if a bit pricey, as we expected with a hotel such as this. We did splurge for a private "dinner under the stars" which was very nice with great service and great food.. That wasn't cheap. The winding pool was a nice way to cool off, it features a small bar (or maybe two) however they didn't seem to be open a few times when we might have bought a drink as we walked or swam by. We also attended the Luau. Which was fun. It was our first Luau so we don't have much to compare it to. The food was tasty, the entertainment seemed a bit cheesy, but that wasn't surprising since we were attending a Luau at the Sheraton. The hotel wasn't cheap, and I wouldn't consider a great value, but you are paying for location and I had no complaints about the rooms/service/etc.

Reviews.Title: “beware - if you book this property thru Costco or other 3rd party you won't get your Starwood points”
Reviews.Author: redsoxnation949
Reviews.Content: Expected this property to be better - booked thru Costco and when I got home discovered I couldn't received Starwood points because I booked thru Costco - lost points for a 7 night stay - hotel is old and shows it - jacuzzi was plain scuzzy and packed with kids - need an adult only jacuzzi - pools were freezing despite numerous requests to turn the heat up - hotel charges a "resort fee" of $25/day plus tax, but you still have to rent your beach chairs. They also have a stupid card system for pool towels, which is a complete pain. I booked deluxe oceanfront and they stuck us out out in the boondocks of building six which I would not recommend unless you have nothing better to do then spend your time trekking thru numerous hallways & 3 or 4 elevators to get to the lobby, beach, pool. - a 15 minute walk. The rooms in that section also face Molokai, which is north, which means your room gets no sunlight ever. Rooms are dated and need renovation, bathroom is decent sized but also dated. Lanais are small and do not have lounge chairs. Grounds are overwatered so when you walk on the grass, for example to get to a hammock, you get muddy. Staff was not great either. All in all, disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Right on Beach”
Reviews.Author: Durwoody
Reviews.Content: The location of hotel is great. When we were researching hotels in Maui, we wanted something with direct access to the beach and we got that with Sheraton Maui. The room was nice and roomy, kind of standard 3 star hotel. There was a small balcony about 3 feet deep. We had a partial ocean view that encompassed a view of the pool. The grounds are landscaped beautifully, very tropical and exotic. The sand was soft and the water temp was wonderful. When we first pulled up the hotel looks nice, all open air. When walking to the building elevator to get to our room I was not overly impressed, it looked a little old. They need to do some upkeep, like paint the walls of the corridors leading to the rooms. They were scuffed and scratched and gouged in places. Even that sort of simple upkeep would make the hotel look nicer. Walking to the eating areas on the first floor was very lush greenery and plants. They have 8 restaurants/bars, some open only for limited hours (breakfast, only certain days, only evening hours), but there was many options. It was windy when we arrived and with the temperature of 80+, it was glorious. I LOVE windy and breezy, so I was in heaven. Even though it was overcast at some points, I had no problem with the weather. Valet parking is $5/day, well worth the convenience. Two days before the end of our trip, they began painting the corridors on our level. I was impressed at the upkeep since this was one of the things I noticed initially on arrival. The maid service was good and all the service personnel were friendly and courteous. I would definitely recommend a stay at the Sheraton Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and resort, so-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: emah
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Maui, and last time I stayed at the Kaanapali Beach Hotel and walked past the Sheraton each day on my way to Black Rock: it looked amazing and I really wanted to stay there but the huge price difference ($600 vs $200) meant that this was extremely unlikely. However earlier this year (way back in March) I got a starwood email with a half-price deal and decided to go for it - I booked a room for $299 a night for the first week of my holiday, and decided to move back to the KBH for the second week. I had a room in building 3, on the 5th floor, with a fabulous view of the other side of Kaanapali beach - I have never been over there, but it made for some great photos. The room itself was small and fairly basic, but it did have a fridge (no mini-bar) and one of those huge flat screen televisions and the standard comfy sheraton bed. it was very small - I had to move one of the chairs over to in front of the faux-balcony to make room for the suitcase stand (I live out of my suitcase, I don't unpack fully), but it was ok. The bathroom was likewise very small, but totally serviceable. The positives: the grounds really are fantastic, the lagoon pool is so much fun, the big fixed umbrellas are perfect for keeping you out of the sun, and the service out by the pool is friendly, attentive and professional. I really had a very relaxing week. I also appreciated the shuttle which takes guests into Lahaina, and the fact that the resort fee includes local phone calls and 0800 numbers and the internet. The not-so-positives: I felt a bit like a second class citizen: the woman at reception made a bit of a deal about my cheap rate which I thought was kind of odd, and on christmas eve when room service went room to room dropping off boxes of chocolates and bubbly as gifts from the hotel, i was conspicuously missed out which i thought was kind of mean. On the day I checked out when I asked if a late check out would be possible (I am a starwood member and usually this is no big deal), the receptionist told me that with my rate it wouldn't be possible (she said it very nicely and the rules are the rules but still, it made me feel a bit second class). The resort fee ($26.95 plus tax) is ridiculously high - who can use that much internet or local calls in a day? When added to the taxes, it added an extra $70 to my $299 rate - that is a pretty big extra whack. I had room service one night and ate lunch at the pool bars each day - the food was perfectly acceptable; it was much better value at the bars than in the hotel itself. I have now moved next door the KBH which has had a make over since the last time I was here - my room here is much nicer than my sheraton room, and the staff are just that bit friendlier but there is no denying that Sheraton has the nicer grounds. I want to bring my sister and her family over to enjoy Maui and there is no doubt that she would be much happier next door than here: I guess I just like the smaller hotel and the better value.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: MsChyna110
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated on the end of the northwest stretch of Kaanapali Beach. This is ideal, away from the walkway of tourists. The room was clean and the empty fridge was convenient. The breakfast buffet was disappointing, I recommend the drive to the nearby restaurants (CJ's Deli & Diner).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View with great staff/service”
Reviews.Author: maw0512
Reviews.Content: Great location and hotel! We had a wonderful time at Sheraton. We stay for a week. This is Second time to Maui and it's better than the first time since I choose Sheraton this time; with all the research from the web sites including gohawaii.com; between Sheraton and Westin, I decided stay at Sheraton. From the parking attendant to check-in front desk staff were very nice and helpful, she also answer all my questions that I had for the actives in/around the hotel. It's large hotel so it's a little confusing once you walking on your way to the lobby or to your room. We booking thru Costco, I paid partial ocean view but upgrade to the ocean front.......it was amazing deal with amazing ocean front room, right in front of the black rock. The room is little bit small, but who stay in the room all day long when you are in Maui? :-) Maid service was always on-time and the room is cleaning everyday. Restaurant staff are very cheerful and nice, our entire stay didn't experiencing any rudeness from the staff at all. I got the package that including daily buffet breakfast and it was worth it; If you book a room thru any web site but there's option of paying $20 plus per night add to your room but get a breakfast buffet at "Keka'a Terrace", I say do it (it's $26.50 per person without package deal) every morning with beautiful courtyard and ocean view....why not?! The same restaurant that it turning into a "Black Rock Steakhouse" every evening; the food is great, but it's really pricey for the dinner. But I remember every Wed, Friday and Sunday they have dinner buffet. Be sure check the menu before you walk-in. Whalers Village is few minutes walk from the Sheraton, it's great outdoor shopping center and restaurants there; Food Court is there too. Also there's free Whalers museum there too. Since Black Rock is in front of Sheraton, you don't need to go any farther for the snorkeling, rent the gear or bring your own, snorkel right in front of the hotel (save some $$ for snorkel); every evening, there's divers diving at the black rock. Be sure book your activities with pacific whale foundation (www.pacificwhale.org); they have great snorkel tours. Check out there web site; their staff are well trained and friendly. Kaanapali Beach is really beautiful and peaceful, we really enjoy the stay there. We walked every morning on the beach......very relaxing and amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!!!”
Reviews.Author: Watsituya
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Sheraton Resort and Spa Black Rock went out of their way to make ours a memorable first trip to Maui! We had a couples massage in the spa on our first morning, LOVED it!!!! Our room was in building 2 with a lovely ocean/sunset view. The resort just rambles on forever!!! My husband enjoyed the fitness center, although it was a tiny bit difficult to find. Lots of open spaces to just relax with a cup of coffee or a good book. The valets were super....always helpful and considerate. We only dined one time at the resort, since Maui has so many dining options, but the food was good. The pool was great and the servers poolside were so nice...we wanted for nothing!!!! We will return to this resort!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel if you can Deal with Non-Heated Pools”
Reviews.Author: mikealtman
Reviews.Content: We are finishing up our stay at trhe hotel whiclh is very pretty and with friendly staff. Wonderful vacation location but hotel management needs to change their policy on their pools. This seems to be the only unheated, incredibly cold pool in the area. No one goes into the pool except for the faint of heart. The ocean temperature is warmer than the pool water. We complained to the hotel and was told that they will never heat their pools. Some staff told us that this was the biggest complaint from vacationeers. We enjoy using a pool and having a freezing cold pool is just not acceptable at these prices. I can't imagine the dissapointment from kids who are staying here. The bathrooms also need to be updated but the bedroom area is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, perfect location, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: gr8nm
Reviews.Content: GOOD: Location, service, staff, views (ask for an ocean view room in building 4 on the 6th floor). Fish at Black Rock Grill was super delicious by sky-high priced. Cliff dive ceremony at sunset is unique and pretty awesome. For a resort that's +40 yrs old it's in quite good shape, the grounds are very nice. BAD: Prices. it's not cheap, but you pay for great location, good service, beautiful grounds. Pillows: why can't i get a foam pillow that doesn't feel like a brick? The best pillows are $6 at Walmart, why on earth can't these hotels get real supportive pillows that are not down (which are awful for my neck). Fridge in the room was super loud so I unplugged it. Pool is not heated and quite cold. No koi fish in water treatment by the restaurant...every resort in hawaii has that. Overall nice resort, if you have to pay more than $250/night I'd find some place else to stay if you get a deal, choose the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: NancyY4
Reviews.Content: Cockroaches, Horrible, and OVER priced. WILL not and NEVER stay there again!!!! AND Yet it was rated as 4-5 Stars Resort, What a Joke!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Maui Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: whitefluff
Reviews.Content: We just returned from one week (Dec 8-15) at the Maui Sheraton on Ka'anapali Beach. We had a great time! The hotel was wonderful! We got a package deal that included an upgrade to a deluxe ocean view room and daily breakfast. Both were great. Our room was in Building 2, 5th floor and it faced the quiet grounds and beach. It was a good size room, very clean, updated, king bed, very nice furnishings, quiet, absolutely no bugs of any kind. The staff were very friendly, helpful, and accommodating. Checking-in and -out were both easy. We self-parked our rental car and there was always more than enough space. We loved the open grounds of this hotel. It's spacious and calm, with lots of trees, but not overbuilt with huge waterfalls, slides, and shops like some of the others are. They didn't have Hawaiian music at the evening bar (it was jazz & "easy listening"), so we went next door to the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel for Hawaiian music and hula each night. The beach is great, though surf was a bit high for a few days. Snorkeling at Black Rock was OK, but because of the higher surf activity the water was a bit cloudy. We saw fish, big turtles and a manta ray. I highly recommend this hotel. This was our 15th trip to the islands. We've been to Maui, Oahu, Kauai and the Big Island and we usually stay at 4 star hotels. We have always stayed in the Wailea area of Maui and this was our first time staying in Kaanapali. We're glad we chose the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Been More Pleased - Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: IrieJames
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been more pleased with our stay at the Sheraton Maui. We did a lot of research on the Starwood hotels in Lahaina and elected to stay at the Sheraton because of its excellent proximity to Black Rock with great snorkeling. Here's the skinny: Accommodations: We had a partial ocean view room in building 2. Very spacious room including a fridge. I would recommend ensuring that you get a fridge in your room to store food and drink. We routinely bought water, beer and snacks from the Safeway down the road and stocked up. Beach / Pool: Very clean, couldn't go wrong there either. Restaurants: Black Rock: excellent food and service Spa: Had 2 facials and a massage there - excellent therapists....my wife said that it was the best massage she'd ever had.....and she's had a lot! Couple of tips: - Don't rent the cabanas on the beach - overpriced and we were comfortable laying out on our towels. - Be sure to stock up on extra food from the supermarket. Found the best deals for gifts (Coffee and macadamia nuts etc. at the local Longs Drugstore). - Be sure to try Bikini Blonde beer - our favorite for the week. - Do not use the valet service for parking. The parking deck is a very short walk and not worth having to tip each time plus the $5 valet fee per day. - Hit the beach early if you can as it starts to get crowded around midday! Overall, couldn't have been much happier!
