Reviews.Title: “Hotel was nice, but not nice enought for honeymoon.”
Reviews.Author: jenn4dex
Reviews.Content: The location was great, loved the beach, the pools were beautiful. The room we were given, an ocean view king room was so small! The hotel rooms were quite outdated and the bathrooms needed updating as well as the furniture and the outside patio furniture was kind of gross. I would have preferred a larger room and the staff offered to upgrade us to a deluxe room, though it was too far away and quite a hike to get back to the main hotel so we declined. The pool was great, though by the end of the trip, we realized most guests would put their towels down at 7:00 a.m. and not return until the late afternoon so we just started taking their seats otherwise you will not have a pool seat. There is hardly ANY shade near the pools or the beach so bring a hat and some sunscreen! The breakfast buffet was included in our price and was great! I had hoped the rooms were nicer especially for our honeymoon, and even our internet stopped working and we had to pay the service charge for that. This is an okay hotel, the grounds were gorgeous but not nice enough for a honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressive and horrible.”
Reviews.Author: batmancrusader
Reviews.Content: On the very first night of my stay at this hotel I managed to find a cockroach in one of my drawers, 2 of my room keys did not work and that the room was either too hot or too cold even after much adjusting to the thermostat. Not only is it expensive to stay at this hotel, the food menu is unimpressive and almost disappointing for such a huge hotel such as this, its overly expensive and unless you have money burning a hole into your pocket you should choose somewhere else to stay. It is cockroach infested, they will fly onto your table while your eating and those pretty tiki torches as nice as they are to the scenery you can unfortunately smell the gas they use to keep them burning wherever you sit. As well with the menu, its ridiculously expensive and the food is mediocre. The only good thing this resort/hotel has going for them is very possibly their pools which at least one is closed down at a time because of cleaning and most people opt to play at the beach. Not that it matters where you go to swim because when you come back the horrible staff will make sure that your needs come last, the front service desk was reluctant to help with my room key issue. This hotel/resort may be rated 5 stars but the service certainly isn't.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: angeleyes27
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to this hotel. I really liked it. I stayed in Building 4 with a fantastic view of the ocean and the whole beach area and pool. It had a nice lanai that was shaded and had flowers. It was convenient to both the pool and the beach. Since I was up in the early morning, one morning I could sit and stargaze. The pool was fun. You could swim from section to section. I bought an innertube at the beach services for $7 and floated around from pool section to pool section. The snorkeling at this location, I have been told is excellent. I didn't see it because I can't swim and the water was very rough while I was there. I only ate at the poolside grill. It may have been expensive, but the food was good enough especially for a family with children in their late teens. It was only a 10 minute walk to Whaler's VIllage which was great because there are more restaurants to eat at as well as having access to shopping without paying parking fees. I would stay at the Sheraton again. I found the service to be fine. I didn't have any issues with service.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: AliciaDF
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, splendid location right next to Black Rock with delightful snorkeling right off the beach - abundant, colorful fish and many honu (turtles). Very friendly, helpful staff. The breakfast buffet was a nice surprise - I had low expectations, but instead it has excellent variety and the food is fresh and well prepared - and absolutely the most delicious papaya I've had anywhere on the mainland or on other islands, served of course with lime wedges. Much less crowded and more relaxed feeling than the Westin or other hotels along Kaanapali; lovely, spotless grounds. Cheerful, helpful valets. Two tennis courts on grounds, hardly ever used so easily booked. You could have a more expensive stay in Wailea or Kapalua or even in Kaanapali, but why? Valet parking only five dollars a day (as opposed to 25 on Oahu), with the first night valet parking free. Self parking is free. There is a 25 dollar a day resort fee, but that's standard in Maui. All watersports equipment or activities available right through concierge or at the beachside. A terrific value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations and service”
Reviews.Author: Pete1127
Reviews.Content: We traveled from St. Louis and stayed at the Sheraton for our Honeymoon for 10 days. This was by far one of the best trips that I have been on. Upon arrival we were told we had been upgraded to a Deluxe Ocean Front in Bldg 2, but turned it down because it was two double beds. Our orginal booking of a Ocean View room in Bldg 4 actaully turned out to be a better view. We were on the 6th floor which gave a great view of the mountains and the beach/ocean. The room was clean and updated and the provided complementary champange. For the amount of time that we spent in the room it was perfect. The food was a little pricey, but worth it. We had Breakfast included in our package which I would recommend. It was nice to be able to get up and not have to think about where to eat. You also have the option of eating at the Westin since it is a sister property. The Breakfast buffet had different items each day, the fresh fruit was probably the best part. The Westin had a comparable breakfast option but a little more variety. We also ate one night at the Steak and Seafood restaurant on site. The food was excellent. There are plenty of options for food in all price ranges if you do a little research. The poolside food was probably the only thing where I felt was too pricey for what you got. After we discovered this we resorted to the Safeway grocery store and made our lunch. We used the pool and beach services each day. The pool is crowded and you have to get there early for a chair, but the staff was on top of moving towels is people didn't show up after a while. The beach rentals for the cabanas were 40 per day, but they also had the option of just lunge chairs for 20 dollars. We rented lounge chairs a couple times and it was worth it because the wind really kicks up the sand. The staff at the hotel was extremely friendly and the concierege was probably the most helpful. She made lots of recommendations for activities outside of the hotel and it all turned out to be a great experience. Housekeeping came in everyday and cleaned. A nice feature they offer is to forego housekeeping for a day and you recieve a $25 credit towards dinner at the restaurant. Overall it was a great experience and the property can't be beat for its location on the beach and the avaliable snorkeling at black rock. We would definately stay at the Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “Sunny and classy way to spend a December”
Reviews.Author: andrewj7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent an extended weekend at the Sheraton, on an amazing internet deal. The hotel is on the end of a strip of hotels, up against Black Rock, which is amazing for snorkeling Be sure to stay in one of the buildings close to the lobby, the others are a little further away. There's also a Westin and Westin villa's locally and those facilities are available to you too

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: CaliGirl2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 5 nights at the Sheraton Maui and 3 nights at the Hyatt Regency Maui (separate review.) We specifically wanted to stay at the Sheraton because of the location being on Black Rock. The snorkelling is pretty good there and it would save us from driving to other snorkel beaches. We booked a garden view room, but were upgraded to a 1 bedroom, ocean view suite because I'm a platinum member with Starwood. The room wasn't anything special, but it was clean and roomy. The furniture was a bit dated and we didn't think the beds were that comfortable. The bathroom was nice because it had a separate tub and shower and water closet. The room had an empty refridgerator with no mini-bar. The pool area was large and there seemed to be plenty of chairs for everyone. The pool is great for adults but I think kids would prefer the Hyatt or the Westin as they have more "activity" with slides and fountains, etc. The hotel does have lounge chairs with shade (for a fee - approx $45/day) at the beach as well as umbrellas to rent ($20/day.) They do not serve food or beverage on the beach but there are 2 pool bars that are close by.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location! This hotel was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: hyperchickmom
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights in Maui, but only one night at the Sheraton to enjoy snorkeling at black rock. This hotel is located right in front of one of the nicest beaches in Maui. We loved staying here due to the location! We booked the lowest price gardenview room since "view" was not on our priority for a one night stay. We were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to an mtnvw room top floor bldg 3. This was fine! We enjoyed the pool very much, and the hot tub. We had lunch at Lagoon Bar. Awesome sunset! Torch Lighting. We enloyed our walk to Whalers Village. Had dinner at Hula Grill. Highly recommend this hotel. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Place!”
Reviews.Author: RonRek
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Nov 13-19 on a Costco Travel package. This was a fabulous package that included alot of extras which brougt the cost of 6 nights down to about $1000. Wow! Breakfat buffet which was $26-28 per day per person was included and was a great way to start every morning with a top notch breakfast including an "omlett station" where a very friendly man will make an egg or omlett just the way you want. A very nice assortment of other breakfast items including fresh fruits and bakery. All were super yummy. The breakfast restaurant turns into the fine dining restaurant at nite. Had a nice dinner there but would only rate the meal good not great. Also a little pricey ($100 include in the Costco package). The japanese "cook in front of you" restaurant was OK. Cook was very friendly, food was decent, price was a little high but the soup was bad and NO dessert was included. Been to many of these type of restaurants and would say skip this one. Didn't use the pool but would have to say it was a bit small and underwhelming. Jacuzzi pool was nice and secluded. Room service was great. We were initially put in building 3 and did not like it. Building 4 was graet views and very convenient, would highly recommend building 4 with ocean view. Higher the better. Overall a great location with the nicest beach, OK pool and restaurant. Very laid back and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: zenlouisiana
Reviews.Content: We as a very large family group of 8 stayed at the Sheraton Blackrock November 15-22, 2009. This hotel has got to be located in one of the most beautiful settings in the world. The grounds are impeccable! The view from our "Partial ocean view" room on the 2nd floor in building 3 was very nice...every room has a nice-sized lanai. The over-all "feel" of the place is peaceful and calming. The beach in front of the hotel is very nice, we did not feel crowded and there are many amenities to rent. The beach is a very short walk from the main hotel. The snorkeling here at Blackrock was like snorkeling in an aquarium; seeing 3-4 Sea Turtles a day was common. The concierge service was spot-on and the staff was very helpful and friendly. The whole staff joked and laughed with us and all seemed sincerely concerned with our enjoying our stay. The pool is very large, with a fun slide and waterfall, it is very refreshing after a few hours in the saltwater. There was some discussion amongst our group about the pool closing so early. It does close at 8:00pm and the hot-tub closes at 10:00pm. I think this is to do with maintaining the calm and peaceful atmosphere. The pool bar (The Lagoon Bar) closes at 8:00pm also. So if you are in the hot-tub you do have to go into the main bar to get drinks. (I wore a nice cover-up and it was no problem). A couple of times, especially during the evening dive ceremony, our drinks seemed a little weak, but in general I have no complaints. The location is very close to the town of Lahaina where so much activity is to be enjoyed. We were so busy we did not get a chance to enjoy the spa. I would recommend this hotel to ANYONE who loves beautiful, peaceful, calm settings and loves to snorkel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: chesneygirl1180
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon. If you had asked me what I'd rate this hotel on our first night, I would have said zero stars out of five. We had a BIG problem at check-in. We were supposed to stay at this hotel from October 31 through November 7. However, I came down with the flu a couple of days before the departure, and we had no choice but to push the trip back a week. We had booked a package deal (airfare and hotel) through one of the big travel websites. Anyway, the travel website took care of rebooking everything for us. When we arrived at the Sheraton at 10:30pm (which to us felt like 3:30AM since we were coming from the east coast), they had NO record of our reservation. None. Our first reaction was to be furious with the travel website, we figured they had messed up and had not changed the reservation with the Sheraton. We sat there for 30+ minutes while the front desk and the night manager tried to figure everything out. I just sat in the lobby on a chair and cried. I was EXHAUSTED, and after almost 17 hours of travel, 10 of which were on the plane, I was ready for my room, a shower, and a warm bed. FINALLY, they figure out what went on - we were informed that big travel website.com HAD indeed called Sheraton to change (NOT cancel) our reservation, and someone in the "back room" had taken the call and didnt make the change. OMG!!!! For them to even tell us this blew me away. They put us in the crappiest, tiniest temporary room with two double beds, a shower with absolutely no water pressure, and a view of the parking lot. But, I didnt care, I cleaned up and fell into the bed. The next day, they checked us into the room we HAD originally booked, which was in building 6, with beautiful ocean views. Yes, Building 6 is a pain the neck to get to from the pool/beach/lobby area, but we liked our room so it didnt matter. Over the next 6 days, we thoroughly enjoyed the staff (so many "alohas" as we passed through the hallways), our room was taken care of VERY efficiently each day, it was always clean and fully stocked with toiletries and necessities when we returned from our excursions. The breakfast buffet was fantastic, lots of yummy selections. We never waited more than 10-15 minutes to be seated. The beach and pool areas were AMAZING, and we LOVED snorkeling at Black Rock. We saw so many neat fish and SEA TURTLES!!! The hotel itself is aging, yes, my mother stayed there in 1971, but the grounds are incredible. The other hotels in the same strip, except for the Westin, didnt look nearly as nice. Whalers Village was a nice walk, we ate at the Hula Grill one evening but were not blown away by the food. There's an ABC store there ( ;) ) and some nice stores. There is a shuttle that runs from Sheraton to Whalers/Westin, and Lahaina. We took advantage of the shuttle twice - once to go into Lahaina for dinner, and another time to go into Lahaina for the Old Lahaina Luau (highly recommend!). Sheraton really had to work hard to win me over after the glitch with our room that first night, but they did a great job in doing so ;) By the end of our week, I did not want to leave. If we ever return to Maui, I would not hesistate to return to the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Great location next to Black Rock and Kanapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: EdwardTylicki
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the location next to Black Rock and the beach. All in all a solid value for the price. The restaurants are mediocre and not worth the price. I drove to a local Japanese takeout place every night. You could also walk to Whaler's Village.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable time”
Reviews.Author: Mr.LeConte
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Sheraton and Maui in general. Got a rent-a car upon landing, highly recommended. Maui is very easy to drive around just as long as you know your highway numbers. Drive to the Sheraton was great, about 20 miles from airport. Check-in was very easy plus your first night valet is free. After that they have a free-to-guests parking garage. Arrived around 1p. but were given the option of waiting around for 2 hours for a much better and higher floor room. We took that option and were also given 2 free drink tickets. Rooms: We had room number 4410. Building 4 is great, our room over-looked the pool and ocean. We were on the corner and had 2 balconies. Both with tables and chairs. Our room was basic, but for whatever reason there was the 2 balconies. They didn't inter-connect, you had to go inside your room to access the other one. A short elevator ride down and we were at the pool and beach. Very nice location. Rooms were always clean, maid service great and very appreciative of tips given throughout our stay (hint-hint). You could also opt-out of a day of cleaning and receive a $25 discount at either of the two restaurants on premises ($35 if you book before 5p or after 9p.) Took advantage of that one night. Everything worked great in the room, never had a problem. Water temp. and shower pressure great. Only complaint with rooms was they could have done with a little color, everything was painted white. Pool & Beach: Great, both very clean. Snorkling amazing around Black Rock. Saw giant sea turtles everyday. If you want chairs, umbrellas, or whatever they have them to rent, cost us $40 for an umbrella and two lounge chairs which they set up. Pool was very clean, alot of nice areas and features. Nice hidden hot-tub. Two outdoor food bars. Plenty to drink and eat. Staff: Very freindly. Never encountered a rude person. Helpful, whether it was the maids or parking lot attendents. Receptionist were great as was our bell-hop. Food-Drinks: We had breakfast included in our package. Very good breakfast, buffet. Had a man making omelets. Ate at Black Rock Buffet, it was ok. Could have been better. Japanese steakhouse was very good. One complaint: very nice bar area in Black Rock Restaurant, but it closed at 10p. One night there was about 15 of us in there when they called last-call. Also, we had a wave of humidty in Hawaii when we were there, it seemed all the places we ate at had no air-conditioning. Some nights it was pretty uncomfortable. Over-all very good time. Rent a car and see some of Maui. We went on a zip-line tour at the base of the big mountain then went to the top and did some hiking. Very cool. Also, road to Hana. Incredible. Enjoyed Lahaina also, about 3 miles away, alot to do there, alot of restaurants. Lahaiana Grill, Longhi's were very good. Hung at Hard Rock some. Sheraton also has a shuttle that runs between their resorts and Lahaina every hour till about 10:30p. Very clean resort, great time over-all.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: PDXChick
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Sheraton Maui in a ocean view room in building 3 which provided us with a nice view of both the ocean and the pool. This hotel has the best location, it felt more secluded than the other resorts along the boardwalk, and really good snorkeling right in front of the hotel. I really enjoyed the pool. I liked that it wasn't a typical pool shape, it meandered around so it didn't feel very crowded. We booked through Costco, and it included daily breakfast and one dinner at Black Rock Steak and Seafood. Both were fine, but I wouldn't have eaten there if I had to pay. I really liked the check in process. You check in at the valet desk, and they valet your car for free the first day. The bellhop then personally escorts you to your room, and points out where things are along the way, it was very efficient. The parking garage was a bit of a hike from our room, but it wasn't that big of a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property - Will Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: MaureenJimmy
Reviews.Content: Great property. Huge property. First let me address Building 6 which are are sure to read a lot about. It is a personal choice. Do you want a 100% ocean view or do you want to be close to the lobby and pool? My husband and I definitely preferred the 100% ocean view with the 2 breezeway and 2 elevator trek to the pool. We could see Lanai and Moloaki islands from our balcony and watched the snorklers at Black Rock every morning from our balcony. No kids in Bulding 6 as well. Mostly all honeymooners and couples. Another choice we definitely prefer! I would stay on the higher floors in Building 6. I would not have liked the bottom floor if we got that. Sheraton is very accommodating. They have no problem changing your room. If you want to be close to the pool, don't book by views. Ocean Front is going to be Building 6. We loved the pool as well. We were there off peak in October so didn't run into problems with too many kids in pool. As far as restuarants at Sheraton being expensive - well obviously! You are in Hawaii at a resort. There are plenty of less expensive choices off the hotel site. But you are still going to pay more than you would at home so don't expect a $7.00 burger and fries. We loved the Hula Grill in Whaler's Village. Walking distance and shuttle that goes there. We would walk along Kanaapali Beach to get to Whaler's Village. Picture perfect. Rooms at Sheraton are comfortable and clean. Nothing extraordinary. Not plush and lavish. Staff is friendly and very helpful. Will give you directions anywhere you want to go. Don't expect them to know route numbers. They only know names of roads. We printed directions from the hotel's computer to get where we wanted to go. Will definitely stay again! P.S. Go parasailing with UFO parasailing. Sheraton concierage will book for you. It was great!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: EPBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Maui for 5 days on a recent trip to Hawaii. We were immediately greeted by friendly staff. We received a free upgrade from partial ocean to ocean front and were escorted to our room with help with our luggage. We were also given a tour of the hotel. The rooms are very nice, not over the top extravagant but perfect for what you need and expect for the price. The bathrooms are very nicely done. We stayed in building 6 which is definitely the furthest from the main part of the resort so it did take a few minutes and 3 elevators to get to the pool area but our building was extremely private and quiet. We had a beautiful ocean view and balcony. The pool area and main grounds of the hotel are beautiful and very clean. The concierge staff was EXTREMELY helpful and accomodating. All of the staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful, they made it a pleasure to be there! The beach at this hotel is beautiful and is steps from the pool. You can rent snorkel equipment from the pool area and walk into the ocean to snorkel at Black Rock. The hotel is also in a great location for restaurants in Lahaina. We ate at Mala Ocean Tavern, Sansei, Lahaina Grill & Pacific'O- all delciious!!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui is very SWELL with a fine beach; not ultimate kid spot”
Reviews.Author: carterlegal
Reviews.Content: We are (actually writing from room before leaving) in building 6 which overlooks the ocean from about 25 feet away. We almost moved to a family OHANA suite (cuz we had a 5 yr. old and 12 yr. old with us), but the view from Building 6 makes in-the-room time very enjoyable. The OHANA (family) suites are nearer to the pool and beach, but their view is not comparable to Building 6 (however B6 is a bit of a walk to beach and pool -- about 3.5 mins.); most are on first or second floor and you look at lawns or part of the beach. We did think long about moving to an OHANA though; ultimately did not ($200 more a night too). The pool is not overrun with kids --- to our dismay really-- and the beach seemed pretty kidless too. We sorta knew this before getting to Sheraton Maui, but couldn't really believe the lack of kids. WE play with our kids a lot so it wasn't a big deal, but if you want your kids to make fast friends at pool or beach I doubt Sheraton is the place for you. I played football with my son on the fabulous lawns and tennis on the courts for $13.00. We had a good breakfast every day (kids free, but adults super high $27 or so). You quickly start to see people over and over again and some waiters are very good at treating you like a good client; while others are sorta burnt out in my opinion. Overall very good and as far as I can tell the Sheraton is definitely the best layout and best looking hotel/spa in the Kannapali area. Close to everything too -- Lanahai (you must go here, we did about 5 times -- much better than Whalers village (up-scale shopping mall that lacks the small townhishness of Lanahai (sp?)) I would like to write more, but will end with saying you should really study the map of the resort (in-the-room time happens more than you think) and figure out if you want to look only over the ocean, pool, pool&ocean, nice lawns. Building 5 has some really good pool/ocean combos. Building 6 is all ocean. We did parasailing, Catamaran ride (sp?), lotsof ocean play, Luah (sp?), Road to Hana tour -- maybe should have driven ourselves, trips to Lahanai shopping, definitely get yourself a rental car if you are even remotely a drive-yourself-type person

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience in Maui at the Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: Ciaobella1216
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 4 hotels while we were in Hawaii and this was my favorite. The pools were so nice--very clean and not very crowded. I loved snorkeling by black rock. We saw some unbelievable fish and a turtle! My only complaint is that we found a giant cockroach in our bathroom. We were too afraid to kill it, so we called the desk and within minutes they sent someone up. (Keep in mind it was 5:30 AM--we were on our way to another location). The bug was never found but the guy said it is common. Other than that, i loved this place! We did the "go green" and had a delicious dinner! That is such a great idea.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful setting”
Reviews.Author: Goven
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a week stay at the Sheraton Maui. The location is wondeful. The grounds are beyond beautiful not only the landscaping but the cleanliness of the property. Except for one night staff who was a bit rude when we checked in late at night (especially when we ended up in a twin bedroom not a room with king bed) the staff were so friendly and helpful. Especially noteworthy were the conceirages, the housekeeping staff and the breakfast staff. Granted the rooms are dated especially the bathrooms but this is Maui who spends alot of time in their rooms when the grounds and ocean are steps from your room. The resort fee though is basically part of the room fee and should be included in the room rate as it is not like you can get out of paying it. And though I think a holiday is about getting away from "electronics" others do not see it that way and the internet provided is also outdated. I wouldn't use the spa again. There seemed to be issues between the staff and the services were expensive and not of the same quality that I have had in other spas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for relaxation, beach, and quiet walks!”
Reviews.Author: pakgirl
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Maui is a relaxing hotel located in the heart of Kaanapali Coast in Maui. The beach is perfect with warm waters and very little waves for swimming. The Sheraton Maui is very friendly for families with movie nights on the lawn chairs with popcorn. The entertaining Happy Hawaiian teaches the guests about Hawaiian culture and crafts. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome vacation”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaHappy11
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome stay at the Sheraton Maui. They were sold out so they upgraded us for free to a junior suite with an ocean view. Beautiful beyond compare. I know this is not a common thing, we just got lucky. And it was my birthday! We booked our trip through Costco, which offered an exceptional deal. I highly recommed booking through Costco. Food was good, we had the buffet breakfast every morning. We had dinner one night at the Black Rock Restaurant. A bit on the expensive side, but we had the Chef's special which included, salad, entree of steak and lobster and side dish for $46. It was a good deal since everything was ala carte. Can't beat the beach at the Sheraton and good snorkeling plus nightly torch lighting ceremony on Black Rock. I wish I was still there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but expensive!”
Reviews.Author: Travel4Fun56
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights for my daughter to participate in the Maui Marathon. This is a beautiful location with an amazing beach, however, you pay for it! The rooms are decent, but not worth what you pay for them... same goes for the food. The meal prices on the Sheraton Resort were very, very expensive. We have stayed at many resorts and we will definately return to Maui, but we will not stay at the Sheraton it's just not worth the price! I must add that the staff are terrific though, we were treated very well by all the employees at every level. I just know we could have had the same stay a lot less expensive!!

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of heaven...”
Reviews.Author: larakristine15
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this hotel, and as usual, our expectations were surpassed. We took advantage of the 1st day free valet service, and at the valet counter learned that we had been upgraded to an oceanfront room! Only downside was two double beds instead of one king, but they offered to move us as soon as one became available. Our room was on the third floor, (3328) centrally located, quick walk to the pool, beach and lobby! Flat screen in room with premium channels, comfy beds, nice but narrow lanai. We love the pool area, great happy hour drink specials! We took advantage of the Thursday outdoor movie night and the ukulele lessons offered by the hotel, they were great fun! My partner enjoyed a shore dive with the hotel divemaster, he said it was neat, saw a ton of fish and turtles, I had to take his word as I was too chicken to brave the waves. We also took advantage of their "green" offer, give up housekeeping for a day and get a $35 dining credit. Great for drinks and pupus at the Black Rock Steak and Seafood!

Reviews.Title: “great location, good property, could use better amenities and little more spiffiness”
Reviews.Author: welby2
Reviews.Content: I must be getting spoiled after spending three nights at Royal Hawaiian, the beach sand was full of cigarette butts and small pieces of trash, looked like Lake Michigan beach. Location was perfect for kids and they don't mind the imperfections. I always wondered where the old towels from all the Holiday Inn's and Hampton's went to when they upgraded. They are here! Internet connection did not work first day and the technician never showed up to fix, after complaining to get fixed second day technician come and found bad wire. It quit the third day after maid cleaned room, did not bother complaining again after that as was leaving. Just used my Iphone. Location can not be beat though, kids loved swimming with the turtles. They did replace the lamp that the end of cord burned off when my son was attempting to sort thru the maize of wiring to attempt to make the internet connection work. With better management this could be a better resort though. They charge by the sheet for anything you print off at their business center. One could buy a printer cheaper at Wal-mart if you need to print multiple sheets. Maybe someday this place will modernize with wireless internet. Is frustrating to see a place with potential and have hamstrung by penny pinchers. Don't stay here unless you get bargain rate as that is all the amenities you will receive also.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Etsie
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the Sheraton Maui. Overall an excellent hotel, beautiful location with unbelievable views. All of the staff we interacted with were very friendly. Were upgraded to "ocean front" in building 3 - great location - close to everything as this is a big property -and superb view of the ocean and black rock. Limited restaurants for a hotel this large - only have one plus a pool/ocean side grill with burgers etc. Breakfast buffet is excellent, best of the 3 hotels we stayed at on this vacation - but very expensive - so get it included in you package. Would absolutely recommend as what we think is the best hotel on Kaanapali Beach. Would also recommend staying in Kaanapali if you are going to Maui

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice: Book It!!!”
Reviews.Author: R_David_1150
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for 12 days at the end of September, and we could not have made a better resort choice! The Sheraton is a beautiful resort and they try (and succeed) at making it as good for you as they can. It is a large resort and it takes up a lot of land, so everything will be a small walk, but it's really no big deal. We stayed in building 6, so being there situated directly on the top of black rock is where you have the most distance to cover, but it is still no big deal. Really! The rooms are very well laid out, better than most your going to see. I wanted to make sure building 6 was THE best choice to stay at, so on my second day there they allowed me to inspect ocean viewing rooms in buildings 2, 3, and 4. Building 2: nice rooms, but the view is of a big boring grassy area, farthest from the beach. Building 3 was nice, looking at the ocean and nice rooms too. I liked building 4 as those rooms are angled to face the ocean, but my wife wanted building 6. They had the largest rooms of them all, and they all face directly at the ocean with a spectacular view! Later on during our stay, we walked down to the Kaanapali Beach Hotel to scope it out. My wife described it perfect as " the best Best Western you could find". Old buildings, run down, small rooms, broken elevator. The pool was probably special back in the 60's, but it's now outdone by most hotel chains today. NO bathrooms near the pool. If you didn't know where you were, you'd swear you were in a old Best Western. Kaanapali beach is the best and biggest beach on the island. Plenty of beach sand and room so your not so crowded. ALL the other guests in the hotels along this beach have to walk down to black rock to get GREAT snorkeling at Black Rock. You at the Sheraton have it outside your door, any day you want it. The pool at the Sheraton is nice, clean, and expansive. No kiddy slides, designed for adults (most of the pool and it's walking tributaries are 5 feet deep) If I had any complaint about this resort, it would be there is not enough shade around the pools. I called it the "quest for shade". You had to wait until someone left for the day and take over their spot in the shade under the pool umbrella they occupied. They could use way more shade since most of us staying there are not from Maui and need to get used to the intense sun gradually. Our booking included their buffet breakfast with the room. We thought the breakfast was absolutely awesome. The variety was great, the quality was great, and a chef prepared eggs anyway you wanted 'em. You can't go wrong. We ate such a big breakfast each day, we completely ignored having lunch, which also made dinner our only paying meal of the day. Sweeeeet. Do not second guess the choice to stay here. You will not be disappointed. Any of these top notch resorts are going to be pricey on this beach, so you may as well stay at the best one. People will have a bad experience with any resort, and they will write about it here, but you'll see bad write-ups no matter which resort you research. The Sheraton has only a few bad compared to how many great write-ups for a reason.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Great Property”
Reviews.Author: woodchips75
Reviews.Content: We were traveling on our honeymoon and stayed 10 nights at the Sheraton. The property is very nice with a great pool AND beach (it seems many properties have one or the other that is solid). The beach in front of the hotel is very popular but traveling late Sept/early Oct we probably weren't seeing it as crowded as it could be. The rooms are dated but clean (we were in bldg 3 - probably the most central location). The shower is hot with good water pressure. The staff is very friendly and helpful, particularly those who greeted us upon arrival, the waitstaff at the pool bars, the pool concierge group, and housekeeping. The $25 resort fee includes (non-valet) parking which is why I didn't classify the parking as 'free'. We were a little disappointed the rooms did not have wireless (it was only available in the lobby and restaurants). We did not have a computer but did have our iTouch and it would have been nice to have wireless in the room to look up restaurants, directions, etc. We were able to use the computers in the bar area on the first floor as needed. Kaanapali Beach is beautiful, clean and directly in front of the Sheraton. During the day, you will want to seek the comfort of shade so treat yourself to a beach cabana. Pricey? Oh yeah - but its practically a requirement unless you are used to the hot sun. If you are a pool person you have to get up early to get a shady spot. There are plenty of signs saying the pool chairs are for 'active use only' but we did not see this enforced and just like other resorts you've got those folks who go stake their claim then go back later. Yet ironically if you paid $40 for a beach cabana you had to be sure not to leave it for more then an hour, or it might get taken away on you. For a resort of the Sheraton's size, we found the fitness room to be disappointing. There were 3 elipticals, 1 of which was out of order, and despite the fact we were in there early, we found those machines almost always in use, as well as the bikes and treadmills. For a resort this size they probably needed double the space/machines. Lastly, we're self-proclaimed foodies and found the onsite dining to be a little disappointing. There are tons of great dining options off property and even within walking distances, so get out there and explore. The food wasn't bad -- don't get me wrong. Just not as good as it should have been for the price. Property Pros: Location Beach/Snorkeling Pool Friendly Staff On-site spa Cons: Restaurants No Wireless in rooms Fitness Room 'Multiple Reservations' (read below) Multiple Reservations: like many Starwood members probably do, we booked with points and paid for a couple of nights when we made our reservation. Well in their system this gets logged as two reservations. Despite multiple confirmations of our check-out date and length of stay with several individuals, the day our 'first' reservation came to a close we found our room keys deactivated. You might not think its a big deal but because we made sure many times to confirm our travel plans we found it really frustrating. As a Starwood member I urge them to synch up with their properties and address this. While reservations booked with a combination of points and cash may be documented in your systems as two reservations, to the customer we booked one reservation, and its a poor excuse when you are standing there at the end of the beach day and locked out of your room that the reason is you had two reservations. Not the customer's problem. Sounds like it may not be a unique issue to this property, so consider it more an open comment to Starwood. Other comments about Maui: Hana -- hmmm...we felt it was a little overrated for a full day commitment. However, the saving grace was that circling around the back of Haleakala (as opposed to doubling back on the Hana Hwy) made it all worth while. In our opinion, that is where the views were the best - yet, hardly any takers. It was gorgeous. You CAN drive the unpaved road as seen on the map but just be careful and be sure you do it by light of day. Surfing -- it's Hawaii - you should try it. Goofy Foot Surf School in Lahaina was terrific. We loved our instructors (Mark and John!) and think everyone should take a few hours of their trip for this. My husband knows how to surf so for him it was just a great opportunity to get out there and enjoy the waves. For me it was a first, and I was thrilled to be able to catch a few waves. Pay the extra for the photos unless you have someone onshore with a good zoom taking pics for you. Snorkeling -- we did our trip with the crew of the Teralani who were terrific (Budd, Linda and Keri) but there are tons of boats who do trips. A snorkeling trip is fun because you get to enjoy Maui by water, they provide food (many are 5 hr trips that include some breakfast and a lunch), and they can read the conditions and take you to the best place for the day. That said you should also explore other sites by land. Black Rock is great so being at the Sheraton and having that right outside your door is a treat. We saw turtles, rays, and tons of tropical fish. Dining -- best restaurant ever is Lahania Grill. The menu and wine selection were terrific. My husband had a veal chop and I had the osso bucco and we barely spoke during the meal except to express our love of the food and wine. Other notable choices: Pacific'O, Spago, Tropica (at the Westin) and Kimo's. Spa -- the Heavenly Spa at the Westin is just that - heavenly. If you really want to treat yourself you have to try it. Go early or stay after your appt to take advantage of their steam room, sauna, whirlpool, and showers. The Sheraton has a very nice spa so maybe for a manicure/pedicure, or if you just can't be bothered with the 10 min walk to the Westin, it's a very nice option. It's just not as plush as the Westin. Luau -- Old Lahaina Luau is terrific and probably the most friendly staff we've ever encountered. Great sunset pics, nice buffet and very talented entertainers. Try traditional mat seating (unless you have a bad back -- can get tiring). We wish we had more time to explore and hope we'll have an opportunity to return. If we do, we'd stay at the Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “Large Property, get the right building the first time”
Reviews.Author: noid2
Reviews.Content: As the title states this is a large property 600+ rooms. We booked through Costco and got a great deal. Upgraded to a deluxe ocean front room which was well worth the extra tarrif. The deluxe ocean front rooms are in building six which sits right on top of Black Rock. We were on the fourth floor (room #6526) which sits about 60' from the edge of the cliffs north of black rock. What a great view. We could see both Molakai and Lani. We could see turtles swimming from our balcony and the sunset slightly to the southwest. We were disappointed that we couldn't see the torch lighting ceremony from our building however. I would also recommend building #3 which also has ocean views but set much further back from the shore with the view being mostly of the strip of hotels. Check the prices on both buildings then deciede. The only challenge with building #6 is that you have to take three elevators to get to the beach, lobby or restaurants. It's bit of a trek ,but you will need to walk off your meals any ways. With the Costco package we received the daily buffet breakfast which left a lot to be desired when comared to the buffet at the Hyatt. Service was marginal, the staff didn't seem to be very happy or excited to be employed. We also recieved a $100 dining credit at the Black Rock restaurant on property. Unless you get the complementry credit as part of your package skip this restaurant as it is over priced and the food is unexciting. Eat at one of the nicer restaurants in town. The room itself wasn't bad, like most rooms in Hawaii you are paying for the location. The bed was extremely firm and the wicker chairs were not comfortable but the decor was pleasing. We snorkeled at several locations only to find that the best snorkeling was right out our back door at Black Rock. We saw and swam with multiple turtles all but one day. They must have taken that day off. I would deffinately stay here again but for a few more dollars the Hyatt is a nicer property. The pool on site is much more extensive the the web site shows. The web photos don't really do the pool justice. But again the pool at the Hyatt is much more elaborate. You are within walking distance to Whaler's Village which really had nothing to offer us. Mostly high end tourist shops. All in all a very nice place to stay. We would stay here again just for the view.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Mary5327616
Reviews.Content: We spent our first 4 days here and it was perfect. The room was nice. The pool was great. The nightly cliff diving ceremony was awesome. The beach was great. The HH was great.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location - decent rooms at good price”
Reviews.Author: SunnySanDiego
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton for 14 days in early Sept. He is a SPG Platinum member so we did expect to be able to utilize some of the perks (upgraded room, late checkout, etc.) We booked a garden view room for 4 nights and used points/free nights for the remaining nights. We were happy to be upgraded to a deluxe ocean view room in building 2 w/ a king size bed â€“ even for the free nights. This was very generous of the hotel since they typically assign some of the worst rooms when you book free nights. We had a few minor problems which didnâ€™t really impact our stay: â€¢ Neighboring property jack-hammered concrete after midnight one night. I guess they had a major plumbing problem since they worked on it for several nights. Was very noisy but not the hotelâ€™s fault. â€¢ Asked for additional king-size feather pillow. Brought me regular pillow so had to call again (not a big deal). â€¢ Smokers on balcony a few times. Complained once and was told they would send a security person out. Donâ€™t know if they followed up or not. Saw several people smoking on their balcony (but I was walking by, not sitting on my balcony) so didnâ€™t complain. For the most part, people were good about not smoking. Only saw 2 people at pool. Occasionally, someone would walk through w/ a cigarette. Overall, it was a very refreshing change to not be crowded on the pool deck next to smokers all day (like in Vegas!) â€¢ Bkfast in restaurant was decent, didnâ€™t love it, didnâ€™t hate it. Westin has much better bkfast for only $1 more (if not incl in your room rate). Still it was $26.95 pp. Better eat a lot. This is fairly typical of Hawaii hotels. You can find much cheaper eats at local places like Java Jazz (ate there 5 times in the 2 wks!). â€¢ Part of SPG deal is getting a free movie. We didnâ€™t watch it until we were technically on our â€œfree nightâ€� so we were billed for it. Didnâ€™t realize that we should have watched in when we were using the paid nights. Asked front desk staff about it at check-out and they removed the $15+ charge. â€¢ Lunch at the pool was awful. We ordered the Hula chicken. We thought we could share it since we had such a big bkfast. Big mistake â€“ it was tiny and barely had any meat on it. â€¢ Even though hotel wasnâ€™t crowded, pool chairs in the shade went very fast and VERY early in the morning. Some people would just put a towel down and disappear for hours. Pool staff never removed any possessions as their policy indicates. As a consequence, we would have to get up early too to snag one in the shade. Plenty of loungers in the sun at all times. â€¢ Only had 3 cabanas to rent (wanted shade). $75 for day was reasonable but they were in terrible locations. One faced the pool, not the beach and was right next to the massage table. It was a very busy area. The other 2 were right in front of the beach path so people walked by all day long. Plus they were close to the smoking section and the wind always blew the smoke towards the cabanas. Here are my impressions: â€¢ Love the no smoking policy (see above). â€¢ Nice check in service. Bellman took us straight to room and pointed out hotel highlights along the way. Very nice guy. â€¢ Housekeeping staff was very nice. â€¢ We had no problems w/ the front desk staff. Only interacted w/ them a few times and they were always helpful. â€¢ So many fabulous restaurants in Lahaina and Kapalua that we never ate dinner at the hotel. We bought some lunch stuff (fried chicken, lunch meat, etc.) and had lunch in our room on the days we stayed at the pool/beach. Much better than eating at the pool. â€¢ Pool waitresses were very friendly. Didnâ€™t nag you all the time if you werenâ€™t drinking â€¢ Wonderful snorkeling right along black rock. Unfortunately a 43 year old man drowned there on our first day. Seeing him dragged out of the water (dead) wasnâ€™t a view I want to remember. It was an awful sight. So please, donâ€™t snorkel alone! â€¢ Building 1 â€“ believe this is all family suites. Interior corridors. Close to pool, garage and lobby. Only 2 floors and set back in front of large lawn so even though all rooms face the ocean, you donâ€™t have a great view. Very few rooms in this bldg. â€¢ Building 2 â€“ 5 floors all facing ocean. Exterior corridors. Bldg is â€œLâ€� shaped. Large lawn in front of building. Very close to garage (didnâ€™t experience any noise from it though). Excellent ocean views from upper floors. Balconies do get a bit smaller as you go up the bldg, but our room was on the 4th floor and I thought the balcony was adequate. 2 chairs and table (no lounger). We couldnâ€™t sit out there during day since our unit was in the sun and way too hot. Rooms on the other side of the â€œLâ€� had some shade and looked delightful. But you would have to look sideways to see the best ocean view. So itâ€™s a toss up. Looked like there were a few suites in the middle of the bldg. All rooms are considered Deluxe Ocean View. Bathroom had tub/shower combo, 2 sinks, separate toilet area w/ door. Fairly open floor space so we could both use bathroom at same time. Limited storage space â€“ no under sink cabinets or drawers. We had mini fridge which was handy for snacks and lunch stuff. No micro but was told we could have requested one. Plenty of closet space w/ safe and iron. 2 wicker chairs and table in room. Large LCD TV. Plenty of drawers in dresser. â€¢ Bldg 3 â€“ This bldg faced the pool/ocean on 1 side and mountains/pking lot on the other. Interior corridors. We had a day room in this bldg on our last day. Rooms are considerably smaller than Bldg 2. Only a single sink in bathroom and no separate area for toilet. So only 1 person could really use bathroom at once. Believe rooms would be considered garden view, terrace view and ocean view. Some rooms are pretty far from pking garage. Balconies get MUCH smaller as you go up. Some looked barely useable. â€¢ Bldg 4 â€“ fabulous views of pool and ocean. This bldg is closest to pool (right over it). Spa is located on ground floor. Some interior, some exterior corridors (depends on which floor you are on). Think it was 5-7 floors tall. Built right up against Black Rock. Rooms and balconies get smaller as up go higher up. Rooms are at a funny angle and are MUCH smaller than Bldg 2 and 3. Didnâ€™t see the bathrooms but believe they are like Bldg 2. The end rooms have wonderful wrap around balconies. Furthest from pking garage. â€¢ Bldg 5 â€“ Didnâ€™t see any of the rooms here. I think they are all suites. There is a separate pking lot (outside pking only) for Bldg 5 and 6. Far from pool, but great ocean views. Gym is in this building. â€¢ Bldg 6 â€“ Built on top of Black Rock. Furthest from pool â€“ multiple walk-ways/elevators to get to room. Room layout similar to Bldg 2 but balconies all appear to be the same size. Grassy lawn in front of bldg and you are on top of the ocean â€“ not the beach, so you donâ€™t really have a white water/shore-line view. I doubt you would be able to see much of the ocean from the lower floors. Believe all rooms here are Deluxe Ocean Front rooms. They were offering a promo of $150/night including $25/day resort fee, bkfast for 2, guaranteed upgrade to Bldg 6, discounts for dinner and a few other small amenities. If we didnâ€™t have free nights and werenâ€™t upgraded to a room in Bldg 2, I would have definitely jumped on this offer. The bkfast and resort fee account for about $80 so you are really only spending $70 to get such a good room. If they still have this promo when you book (think you need to call, I didnâ€™t see it on-line), I would recommend booking the cheapest room (terrace view) and ask for upgrade. Not sure if it can be booked in advance or is only offered if available upon check-in. Worth checking into though.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous honeymoon- didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: MollyPaws1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week on our honeymoon in Maui. We booked a deluxe ocean view room online (we were able to get a fantastic rate with our AAA card). The room did not disappoint. Beautiful view of the ocean with a front row seat for spectacular sunsets. The pool was wonderful, but we tended to go in the morning or late afternoon, it was very crowded during the day. We did not eat in any of the restaurants there, but ordered food and drinks by the pool a few times. Hotel is in a great location, close to everything, can walk to Whaler's Village along the beach. We had a wonderful time here and were very sorry to leave! I would recommend it to anyone (we enjoyed it even more than the Four Seasons!)

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING!”
Reviews.Author: cardello
Reviews.Content: The resort was amazing. We were upgraded to a family suite for our honeymoon stay and it was great. It was beyond spacious, two flat screen TV's, huge bathroom, large TV room and on the ground level near the pool and beach. The beach was amazing, the snorkeling was second to none. Black rock is the place to be if you like to snorkel, I would have paid good money to swim with the sea turtles like I did for free staying at the resort. We spoke to people who said they took a Hawaiin cruise three years ago and Black Rock was an actual excursion offered on the ship, that is how good it is. The resort is walking distance to Whaler's village which is a nice shopping plaza and has a great restaurant called Hula Grill. The resort is also not far from Front Street. I recommend Longhi's as a place to eat on Front Street. The atmosphere, staff, and pool were all great. We had breakfast included in our package and it was great. The fish and steakhouse at the resort served very good food aswell.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maczyn
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Sheraton Maui twice, once in Oct. 2004, and New Years 2005. The first time was with me sister and we booked an Ocean View room through AAA, and Pleasant Holidays, and was upgraded to a Deluxe Ocean Front room, which was wonderful, the view was spectacular. There was a bit of a walk to the beach from our room but we did not care because we loved to walk through the gardens of the resort. The second time was with my son, and booked a partial ocean view with AAA, and Pleasant Holidays. When we arrived our room was directly over the tennis courts, with just a sliver of and ocean view, I went to the front desk and told them that I did not like the room, They promptly upgraded our room to an ocean view which over looked the grounds and ocean, it was beautiful. Well, I have booked another trip for Aug. of 2010, I am sure the Sheraton Maui be just good as they were the last two times where there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon stay.”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker0904
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Maui for 6 nights during our honeymoon and loved the hotel. We were able to book an ocean-front room in Building 6 - HIGHLY recommended for honeymooning couples or others who want a quiet room with a beautiful view. It was a bit of a walk from the pool/beach area, but we didn't mind at all. Buildings 5 and 6 also have their own parking lots so you don't have to hike back from parking after dinner. Room - beautiful lanai with a great view of Black Rock. Really comfy bed and plenty of space to unpack clothing. Only slight complaint was the bathroom was a bit out of date (older tub, etc.) and nowhere to store toiletry items - other than I can't complain. Meals - we had coupons for free breakfast buffet during our stay, which was great - we stuffed ourselves. I recommend trying the Westin's breakfast buffet just a couple resorts down the beach. Great coffee. Probably not worth it to pay for the buffet if you don't get it for free though - just go to the hotel restaurant or a nearby cafe for a pasty or another breakfast item instead. Didn't eat at the other hotel restaurants so can't comment on those. Pools/beach - we loved the pool and traveled during non-peak season, so it wasn't crowded at all. Just get downstairs early (8:00 a.m.) if you want a chair in the shade - otherwise you'll be in the hot sun all day. We grabbed towels to reserve chairs before breakfast. The beach is AWESOME - and the Sheraton has the best slice of Kaanapali for sure. Great snorkeling around Black Rock, even just 10 feet off the beach. Nice clean bathrooms down by the pool area, too. Spa - I only got a manicure there, so can't comment on other services. My manicurist was really friendly but I have to say the manicure wasn't the best I've had - and it was VERY pricey ($45 without tax or tip). Maybe massages or other services have better bang for the buck, though. Other comments about staying on Kaanapali/Lahaina - definitely go to the Hula Grill for lunch just down the beach. They have a new menu item, a goat cheese BLT sandwich, which I loved. Tons of other beach activities are available everywhere if you want to parasail, snorkel, surf, boogie board, etc. Also for meals outside the beach area, try Mala in Lahaina at the end of Front Street - really great burgers. Also Sansei for sushi (near the Ritz Carlton, a 10-minute drive from Sheraton). Overall we had a great trip and would definitely stay at the Sheraton again!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations...perfect for snorkeling!”
Reviews.Author: luv2fly77
Reviews.Content: It's not often that I am 100% satisfied with a hotel, but we just returned from 8 nights at the Sheraton Maui Resort and Spa and this place did so many things right I felt compelled to write. This despite being welcomed at check-in to the news that our King size requested room wasn't available and we'd be starting our 20 year anniversary trip in two double beds. So, how did things get better...here's the list. First, they upgraded us at no charge to a partial ocean view and a room 100 square feet larger. We also had the option to move to king size room 3 days later. We decided against moving after the second night because the bedding was so comfortable and room size and location fantastic. No noise leaking from rooms next door or other floors...at all. In fact, I assumed the rooms were unoccupied and the only reason I know they weren't is that I later saw dirty plates outside the rooms awaiting pick-up. The best pillows we've ever had. Good enough that I took off the covers and checked the brand to purchase at home (Pacific Coast Feather Company). Best breakfast bar we have ever seen. Breakfast is in a beautiful open area looking out at palm trees, a koi pond, beautiful lawn area. A partial list of items available each day includes: made to order omelets, pancakes, Belgian waffles, HUGE table of the best fruit I've ever had (watermelon, pineapple, papaya, honeydo, cantelope, strawberries). Bacon (solid meat no big clumps of fat), sausage, scrambled eggs, eggs benedict, large selection of fantastic pastries whose type varied each day, breakfast items that I think were geared to Asian travelers (rice, meat items), cereal, toast and more... We saved a lot of money because our breakfast would last us until dinner, or require just a small lunch. The BEST location. The first day we went into the water I was shocked to see tropical fish swimming around my legs and I was only in about 4 feet! My husband literally ran into a sea turtle in just 3 feet of water. The amount of tropical fish around Black Rock is incredible. We did not limit ourselves to this location because we figured there had to better spots...this is too easy. Right? Wrong. We took a wonderful catamaran out to two different snorkeling areas and tried out two other beaches on our own and although we enjoyed exploring various areas, the spot right at the hotel had by far the greatest number and widest variety of sea life. I can't imagine staying anywhere else if I intended to snorkel. This is the first hotel where the provided hair dryer was good enough for me to leave mine packed. In the future, that's one less item for me to carry. It was a Conair 1875. Lots of hangers, very large closet. Plenty of light in the room. Nice flat screen TV. Separate toilet room from sink/tub/shower. Two full length mirrors inside the bathroom, facing the main bath mirror which allowed you to easily get a back-view when doing hair. (not necessary, but a nice touch) A large additional mirror in main room with electrical outlet below so I could easily do hair and make up outside the bathroom. (Also a rare option these days due to other hotels never thinking to put the bedroom mirror near an outlet.) Fridge and coffee maker in the room. We haven't used a concierge much in the past, but since we were new to Hawaii we stopped by three times and each time were provided excellent information. These folks really know the area and we saved a lot of money and frustration when they advised us to pass by one of the popular Molikini tours and go with a Teralani catamaran to different spots. We had fully intended to go to Molikini , but the concierge told us the fish population had dropped dramatically in that area and it was packed with tourists. As we stood in line to board their recommended tour of the Teralina we heard another couple talking about how they were now taking this tour because their trip to Molikini had been a complete bust the day before...NO fish and just tons of people to contend with. It had been a big waste of money. I felt quite bad for them and very grateful for the advice we had received at the Sheraton! There is free Wi-Fi throughout, but we didn't take our laptop. They also had two computers to use for free for any internet access. In addition (and this was a GREAT help!) they had a third computer and printer dedicated for guests to use to confirm flights and print out boarding passes. There was no wait to use this computer as folks weren't spending a lot of time on it for other reasons. I have never seen a hotel offer this option, I'm always stuck waiting for sometime to finish with their email. Every staff member was very polite and friendly. It was a real difference from folks we usually run into on the mainland. I know maintaining a hotel isn't easy or fun , but you wouldn't know it by the consistently friendly reception we received each time we passed a hotel employee. Thoroughly enjoyed the Luau at the hotel, paid $10 premium to get front row seating. Definitely worth it. If you want a bit more of an exciting luau, go to this one. If you want a purely traditional luau (no fire dancer), almost everyone recommends the Old Lahaina Luau. We were willing to put up with a bit of a cheesy announcer to get a more exciting show, no regrets. We never got around to getting in the pool, but it was beautiful and lots of folks were enjoying it. There were also daily activities provided, such as lei making, hula lessons, snorkeling lessons, etc. We booked through Costco which had a terrific package deal that included a $100 dinner credit for their steak house, $150 credit to use on anything at the hotel, and free breakfast each day. This was a bargain compared to package travel agent came up with or what I could put together on my own using the internet to buy separate hotel/air/car options. When we return to Maui we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location......that allows you to overlook the rest"”
Reviews.Author: jadubya
Reviews.Content: Amazing location.....can't be improved. We loved our time there....however.....this is an old hotel with very dated rooms. If not for the beach, this place would be a 2 star property at best. BUT the beach is outstanding and that is where you spend the most of your time. Great service from valet staff, Randall, was oustanding getting our trip started. Front desk was ok on the way in......and kind of gritchy on the way out. Do better, Sheraton. Pool staff was great. Rooms are just plain old. Dated decor.....ancient carpet.....and complete lack of normal furniture. No desk....only chairs available are 2 HUGE crappy wicker things that take up a ton of space. No wifi in rooms? Seriously. Internet accesss is available via cable....that is too short and keeps you tethered to the wall. Great vacation....i may check out the options in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best on Kaanapali beach!”
Reviews.Author: Advisor07
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Maui was our first stop on our two week island-hoping Honeymoon. The hotel is lovely, with well-kept grounds & in a prime location on Kaanapali beach. We very nearly booked our stay at the Hyatt Regency, which came highly recommended & I'm certain is very nice too, but after our pleasant stay at the Sheraton I'm glad we chose it. On our first day we took a leisurely stroll along the gorgeous mile-long beach (which I admit is probably THE nicest beach I've ever been to, with soft golden sand & not a single cigarette butt in sight!), right from our end at the Sheraton to the Hyatt Regency at the other end. I noticed that the beach area in front of the Sheraton was the widest part of Kaanapali beach, and got progressively narrower the further along we walked (hence, the beach is not very wide at the Hyatt Regency end). We had booked a garden view room via hotels.com, and despite requesting 1 king size bed, we got 2 queen size beds. Hardly ideal for honeymooners! Still, the room was nice & clean with plenty of room & a 32 inch flat wide screen high-def TV (nice!). But the room had one major flaw - we could literally hear every single word from the guests staying in the room next door. I don't know if it was due to the fact that we had a connecting door between us, or just that the walls were thin, but it was an issue for us (for anyone, I'm sure). They really need to sort this out. So, we went to the front desk & asked them politely if they had any other rooms with a king size bed. They told us that there was none available at the time, but offered to move us the next day which they did. BOY was the new room nice! It seemed they had kindly upgraded us to not only an ocean view room, but an ocean front room! And a large comfy king size bed! Plus, no noise from the neighbours! Perfect! The pool is a nice size & was never crowded during our stay. And the beach had lovely private cabanas that you could rent daily (for a fee). The snorkling by black rock was amazing, especially when a group of sea turtles came by to feed amonst the rocks, one of the best experiences ever! Every evening at sunset they have a touch lighting ceremony at black rock, which is a nice little touch. There are a couple of restaurants at the hotel that for the most part are fairly quiet. If you take a short stroll along the beach walk over to Whalers Village, it's a little more lively & have a couple of nice restaurants which are always busy (so be prepared to wait!). The shops at Whalers Village stay open fairly late, so you can always do a bit of evening shopping if you wanted to. There's also a shuttle from Whalers Village to Lahaina, which only costs $1 each way (although the last shuttle is at 9pm, so if you're out late you'll have to catch a taxi back). There's plently more choice of restaurants & shops in Lahaina, so it's worth a visit. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone, it's in a good location on the beach, is well kept, nice rooms. I'd definately go back. One thing to point out though - we took a taxi from the airport to the hotel, which cost us over $80!!! I think we were ripped off a little, coz the taxi comming back cost us $60, which is still a lot! The hotel is about 30-40 mins drive from the airport. I think there are a couple of alternative methods of transport (I think there's a shuttle bus to the hotels, but it's still something like $50), or you could rent a car (although this wasn't really an option for us as we were didn;t intend on travelling around much).

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Gibbi72
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at the Sheraton during mid-September. After seeing many of the negative comments about the Sheraton, I would like to address (in our view) the pros and cons of staying there. The Sheraton is in the best location in Maui for being right on the ocean. We had a Deluxe Oceanfront room that was on BlackRock where you could throw a rock into the ocean from our balcony. The sounds of the ocean crashing into the rocks while you are on your balcony or have the balcony door open is amazing. It is a walk though or a couple elevator rides to the lobby of the hotel or the pool. If you are in any shape it all, its not a big deal, and the scenery walking through the breezeways overlooking Black Rock isn't bad either. The quality of the rooms is good for an island/beach area. They are nice but you're not staying at the St Regis NY, don't expect to be. I would recommend printing out the property map off the hotel's website which shows you the locations of the different types of rooms before you book: Deluxe Oceanfront means "Oceanfront". The Oceanfront category really doesn't mean "oceanfront", it appears that it means first level in the main building. I do think this is a little misleading but by printing out the map, you'll know before you book. You're also going to be charged about $26 a day for a resort fee. Just accept it, and use your free internet service that you get for it and you're free parking. The beach has arguably the best snorkeling on Maui. We've been to Maui several times and snorkeled in many places, but the reef off the Black Rock is as good as it gets. Not a bad thing to have at your hotel. You'll see many people coming down the beach from other hotels/public parking to snorkel at Black Rock. The beach is also fairly well protected from large waves, so you'll see more people in the water than at other beaches. Food and drink prices are high. We rarely eat at the property. There are many restaurants along the Boardwalk and there is a highly-rated, reasonably priced restaurant, with the best wine list in Maui (per Wine Spectator) about 1/3 of a mile north of the hotel on the beach -- called Castaway Cafe -- it's on the ocean, very laid-back and the food and wine are great -- go there! The pool area is nice, but (from reading the complaints) expect to see a lot of kids if you go during the summer or during holidays. We were there in September, there was hardly a kid to be seen. In general September through the end of the year aren't that busy in Maui except for during the Holidays. If its busy, poolside service can be slow. Instead of complaining about it on TripAdvisor, walk a hundred feet to the bar, you'll generally be served immediately. The spa is expensive, if you don't want to pay the high prices, go to a day spa in Kaanapali, have a local provider come to your hotel room or wait til you go home. Overall, we love staying at the Sheraton. It's not perfect, its not cheap, but it provides what is important to us -- great location, great beach, great snorkeling, wonderful oceanfront rooms. We'll take that anyday.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds and location....room service -- bad experience : (”
Reviews.Author: AnewMunsterfan
Reviews.Content: Great location and beautiful grounds...........banquet services very well done. I called an ordered room service on the recommendation of another guest.... at 6 am ( continental breakfast and fruit) to be delivered at 8:15 am. I called at 8:30 am and was told there was a backup in the kitchen. If someone had called me and told me there was a delay, I would have been able to make other plans. The pleasant morning I looked forward to was ruined. Trevor with the hotel staff assisted in getting my bags. Very nice young man. Bars and grill on the grounds were nice. New and beautiful Spa was to die for!!! Ask for Linda ( massage) and Shawn ( manicure and pedicure)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, had the best vacation ever..can't wait to go back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ErnieBC
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel from September 5th to 15th, 2009. We were not dissapointed (there are some improvements that could be made and will list at the end of my review)....not sure why there are so many negative reveiws because it really is a lovel property and all the employees, (EXCEPT THE FRONT DESK STAFF) were exceptional and could not do enough for us during our stay. We started our first day by chatting with the Conceriege down at the activites booth at the pool....she could not have been more helpful...we booked the following with her after her reccommendations and were thrilled with all of them: Snorkling Sailing Adventure on Teralani..amazing from start to finish. Old Lahina Luau, spectacular and the shuttle will drop you very close to it. Surfing Lessons with Maui Wave Riders, Adam was our instructor..amazing experience. She also arranged our car rental for 3 days...drove the road to Hana and also visited the Surfing Goat Dairy....make sure to go there..looks are deceiving it is well worth the $7 tour and tasting. We ate at the breakfast buffet twice and it was very good and fresh. On our last night we ate at the japanese, food was excellent although the atmosphere a bit clinical. Off the property try, Hula Grill at Whalers Village and in Lahina, Pacific O, Leani's, Cheeseburgers in Paradise. The Sheraton really need to improve on some things though...first and foremost the chairs at the main pool...seriously the so called rule of not leaving your chair for more than an hour is not enforced...we watched a gentleman ask one of the pool staff about this as there was a couple who had two chairs and an umbrella in a prime spot for the whole day but sat in them twice. They even left to go snorkling for 2 hours and nothing was done about it. One has to book in for the beach chairs etc. and they are tagged..if you leave for over an hour they remove the tag....they really need to enforce this rule. Front Desk Staff..I only had to approach them 3 times and OMG, rude...and i talked to 3 different ones. I really thought i was in another hotel...it is like they were doing me a favour and i was putting them out. One girl did not even look up from what she was doing to speak to me. Our only other complaint is that it would have been nice after coming back from dinner to have a quiet drink....but after 9:30, forget about it...everything closed....we were not the only ones, we met plenty of people wandering in the evenings wanting to have a nightcap...Surely one bar could stay open until 11pm at least. Overall, a fantastic holiday at the Sheraton Maui but I really do urge the management to come up with some sort of an enforcable system for the pool chairs allocation. And maybe send all your front desk staff for some Customer Service training or even job shadow the staff that are exceptional at customer service, the conceirges, the wait staff, greeters and the chamber maids....all of these employees quite obviosly love their jobs and enjoy dealing with the public everyday!! Mahalo:)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great views, average staff”
Reviews.Author: Calling_In_Sick
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Sheraton Maui for 6 nights, Deluxe Ocean Front with convertible through an Expedia deal which equated to $225/night. This was an amazing deal! Next time we return to Maui, we would stay here again but only if we get another amazing deal. The service and amenities at this hotel does not warrant their full price during high season in a normal economy. Hotel Location: This is their redeeming grace! Black Rock has spectacular snorkeling and was never too busy when we were there. The part of Kaanapali Beach fronting the Sheraton was wide and even though was on probably the most popular part of the beach, never seemed too crowded. If I recall correctly the cabana rentals were $40/day. The Maui sun gets HOT so the rental rate was very well worth it. These are true cabanas w/ "convertible" shades. If you rent early (before 11am) you are pretty much assured a front row and hence no blockage of view of the spectacular beach. It was also nice that the hotel was so close to Whaler's Village which had a decent selection of restaurants (sit down and food court) and an ABC store for supplies. As far as the hotel in general, I liked how it was never too crammed. Lots of space and very simple but nice vegetation all around. Room: We had a room on the 4th floor of building 6 which provided a spectacular view of the ocean (100% unobstructed) and sunset. The lanai was a good size and absolutely comfortable. The view was so great that we ended up ordering in 2 nights for dinner! I also like the fact that those staying in Bldg 6 had their own private parking. Aside from the location and view, the bed was comfortable enough. I find Hilton beds to be much more comfortable, but Sheraton's was good enough. The bedding was rough but livable for the short amount of time we were there. The bathroom was large enough and the room was in pretty good condition. No cracks or mildew as stated in some other reviews. The towels in the bathroom were a bit rough. All in all, they bill this as a 4 star property, I would rate them more at 3-3.5. Service: This is perhaps my biggest gripe about this hotel. The housekeeping staff was fine, but front desk was perhaps the worst I have ever dealt with. When we arrived we were assigned to a room w/ double beds due to over booking, however they did switch us the next day. This wasn't the problem. The problem was that I had to call them 3 seperate times to remind them of what they promised the first day. We were not the only ones who had this issue. 2 couples ahead of us had to deal with this as well. Anytime I called and asked questions they never seemed to know the answer and just randomly made up a response.
