For example, Starwood offers a shuttle into Lahaina so we decided to go this route the night of our luau and the front desk gave 2 different end times, none of the correct. Our a/c went on the fritz the 3rd night and they forgot to patch our call to maintenance the first time around. We didn't eat at the restaurants on the resort but did drink at the bars. The bartenders were great, but we did run into 2 waitresses who were SLOW...and at times when they were not even that busy. It is unacceptable to have empty drinks for more than 15 minutes. Another gripe was the $25/day resort fee. Not bad if they actually provided good amenities, but they didn't even offer wifi in your room. To me, its silly and unacceptable in this day and age to not have wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location for a hotel in Maui!!”
Reviews.Author: AtomicQ
Reviews.Content: We went to Maui for the first week of our honeymoon & stayed at the Sheraton Maui hotel. This hotel is right on the Kaanapali Shores. The hotel itself has a nice atmosphere where there are "Breezeways" instead of "Hallways" and everything is open. The pool is AWESOME. Modeled like a meandering lagoon it goes around the patio area of the resort where there is a nice bar, plenty of room pool side. Right from the pool you can walk 5 feet to get to the beach. The beach here is great because it is near the "Black Rock" which is an awesome Snorkeling spot, if you are so inclined. One thing though is do not rent the snorkel gear from the hotel, it's overpriced and you can get it from dive shops in Lahaina much cheaper. The hotel was in a short driving distance to downtown Lahaina which was the nicest little downtown area I explored in Maui. I would definitely stay here if I came to Maui again. The ONLY problem was that there were little ants in the room (which apparently cannot be helped in Maui) and the layout of the hotel was a little confusing as far as getting to the work out room. But everything else more than made up for that. The breakfast buffet was also pretty good. They had an omelette station and a breakfast burrito station. That was definitely yummy The staff was also really friendly and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: BreakawayNOW
Reviews.Content: We had the most amazing holiday, the hotel was faultless. We loved it. Gorgeous, location was perfect, the beach was incredible - best holiday :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort, clean room, but...”
Reviews.Author: ddffpp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for the Labor Day weekend, capping our vacation to Oahu-Kauai-Maui (2 adults, 2 teens). Check-in was a breeze and everyone was friendly and helpful. Our room was quite a walk from the main lobby but had a nice view of Black Rock, the lawn, and the ocean. As we got in around 8:00 pm, we went to the restaurant for dinner. My husband and I had the seafood buffet. It was pretty bland and had a lot of fried food. The kids had pizza appetizers, which were good. We had an early snorkel trip the next day so really did not get to explore the resort until about 4:00 pm the 2nd day of our stay. The pool was quiet so we enjoyed a swim. My husband went to the room first and opened the sliding door. The rest of us arrived about 20 minutes later and the room was reeking of cigarette smoke. Hawaii has some pretty tough smoking rules and guests are not permitted to smoke within 20 feet of buildings, that includes balconies. We closed the door and called the front desk. They verified that smoking was not allowed and said they would speak to the guest in the next room who had been smoking on his balcony. We left for the evening. The next morning, the same thing happened from the same guest. Again, I shut the door and called the front desk and got the same story. We finally leaned over our balcony and explained to our neighbor that one could not smoke on balconies - he did not know. We were gone for the day and evening again. The next morning, I got up early, made coffee, and went to sit on my balcony to enjoy the morning - 7:00 am. There were 5 preschool children running and screaming and dismantelling a hammock. The adults stayed in their ground level rooms. All around I could see other guests getting up to go back into their rooms, close the door and have their coffee inside where it was quiet. I'm not sure why I paid for an ocean view room that I was unable to enjoy without peering through the glass. We stayed at 4 good hotels on this trip and only at this one were the other guests so intrusive. At the others, there were written policies about smoking and quiet times. When I said something at the front desk upon check-out, the clerk could not care less. If you are looking for serenity, the Sheraton is not for you; if you have young kids, apparently this is the spot for you. Included in the resort fee was a shuttle bus to Lahaina. We took advantage of it, but it was not necessary. We haven't been to Maui in 11 years and this time, Lahaina was a ghost town and plenty of parking was available. We had a 9:00 pm flight home and enjoyed snorkeling and swimming during our last day. Upon checkout, we were given a key to the fitness center so we could clean up before we left for the airport, a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable foom”
Reviews.Author: ksanybody
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Maui for 4 nights at the start of our Maui vacation having booked a package with a flight and car rental. We booked a king room with an ocean view, but got upgraded to a deluxe double with an ocean view. I have no way to compare the trade-off, but it was a large, apparently newer room, with a very large bath room and entry area, and a balcony with a view of Black Rock and the Ocean. It was a good base for the first leg of our trip to Maui. We did not eat at the hotel restaurants as they seemed too expensive, but we did attend the Sunset Luau, which we enjoyed. The pool bar at happy hour was very nice with good service. The best part of the stay was being on the beach at Black Rock. The snorkeling around the rock was very good: lots of turtles, fish and rays off the point.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed...”
Reviews.Author: rythefly1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with Costco package. Got a free room upgrade with the package and according to the staff, one of the best rooms they have, 2521. This was on the top floor (5th) of building 2 on the end with a huge wrap around balcony. The room and view were excellent. Breakfast was included and wasn't too bad for buffet style (although not a lot of variety). Dinner wasn't shabby at the Black Rock Steak place. Swimming and snorkeling were amazing. Saw sea turtles, eagle rays, eels, and tons of fish in the waters around black rock. If the rest of the rooms are anything like the one we stayed in this is definitely a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, great location”
Reviews.Author: gatorwedsnole
Reviews.Content: We got a great package deal on our trip to Maui. We really liked the Sheraton Maui. I had seriously considered the Westin as well, but decided to go with the Sheraton after reading the reviews on TA. I walked by through the Westin one afternoon, and really liked the luxe look of the hotel. But it seemed like there were SO many people so close together. The Sheraton is much more spacious and we loved that about it. Very airy and open. We had an ocean front room in bldg 4. Gorgeous views. Breakfast buffet was pretty good. Not the best ever, but certainly better than most. We also ate at the outdoor restaurant near the pool one night, the Black Rock Restaurant one night and room service one night. Service was always great, though a tad slow. But who's in a rush in Maui anyway, right? Stay away from the "california" roll on the room service menu though. I called to say that it wasn't anything like I expected and they promptly removed it from my bill. There were some ants in the bathroom which I quickly took care of with my hair spray. Try to take advantage of that "go green" promotion where skipping house cleaning service will get you $25 - $40 credit at dinner! Snorkeling was awesome. It's nice to know that the best snorkeling on the island is behind YOUR hotel. :) The sand was super soft and water crystal clear. Heaven. being in the ocean and looking at the mountains isn't something you get to do everyday. We never took the shuttle to Lahaina. We did walk to Whaler's Village and drive to Lahaina. We took advantage of the $5 valet everyday, b/c there aren't very many places with such great service at such a low price. We considered spa treatments, but they seemed really pricey. P.S. Saw a lovely wedding while we were there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Grounds - Great Location - Outdated Rooms (3.5 Bubble)”
Reviews.Author: pcsanity
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton on the last night of our ten night Hawaii Trip. On Maui we were staying in Kihei to be near the dive boats in the morning. (Maui Coast Hotel is Wonderful!) The last full day of our trip we were doing the zipline in Kaanapali and the Luau in Lahaina so we decided to move to Kaanapali. We also wanted to have a nice beach and pool to chill on the final day before we departed. The reviews of the Sheraton were positive and we found a reasonable price. Upon arriving they have a strange checkin process where you check in with the valet - that is unless you need to do anything. Our room was not ready so we asked for another room - then you have to go to the main front desk. They did however get us into the room at 3pm and upgraded us to a mountian / partial ocean view. (let us check in one hour early.) The grounds are absolutely gorgeous with a nice pool area with a lazy river connecting the pools. They are right on the beach with a nice beach and snorkeling available at Black Rock. You have to pay extra for loungers at the beach....kind of chintzy given the $26 per day resort fee. To their credit that resort fee did include parking and high speed internet. I found it odd, they made you wear wrist bands at the pool. My take, just close off the pool area and ask for proof of your stay to get in.....do not make me wear a wrist band. There were nice grassy areas and plenty of loungers. The bar at the pool made good drinks and the special of the day was pretty good. I really liked that the buildings were not high-rise and did not dominate the landscape. The public areas were very nice. Bell staff was very efficient. As for the rooms, well....they were very outdated and Housekeeping could have done a better job. The room smelled fresh, but they just cleaned the carpet when we got there. The bed was short sheeted (a pet peeve of mine!), and it was not a great bed. The room had small scratchy towels, and a tiny dark hot bathroom. You could not watch the TV from the work desk. The iron and blow dryers were very weak. The room had a nice LCD HDTV, the air conditioning worked well, and you could leave the blower motor on for white noise. The balcony and chairs were very nice to sit and have a muffin for breakfast. We had no problem with noise during our stay. The hotel provides free (well, paid for in your resort fee, so not free) scheduled shuttle service to Lahaina Town and the Westin. This was very nice so that we did not have to drive or take a taxi to the Old Lahaina Luau. (Open bar....no point in driving â€“ Excellent Luau) The hotel was an easy walk to Whalers Village. The staff was professional but not particularly warm. (with the exception of the concierge who was very nice.) For the rate of $183 per night I felt that we got a good deal, especially for Kaanapali beach. Much higher than that and I would question the price. Hanging out at the pool the final day was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: bamafunAlabama
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui for 9 nights for our 25th wedding anniversary. We booked the trip through Expedia and got 9 nights with breakfast included, rental car and airfare for $3500. We booked a partial ocean view room, and were put in building 4 with a great view from our balcony! Also had a bottle of champagne and chocolates waiting for our anniversary. We loved having breakfast every day - made it very easy, and the room was great - a bit older, but our king size bed was so comfy, great flatscreen tv (didn't watch except as we got ready in morning and got ready for bed), and bathroom was fine. I definitely recommend bldg 4 - close to pool and beach, and great views!

Reviews.Title: “Been to Maui 3x. Stayed here 3x. Nuff said.”
Reviews.Author: barefoot_drummergirl
Reviews.Content: I am a water bug. I love playing in the ocean, swimming in the pool, lounging in the jacuzzi with an umbrella drink, and when I'm in Maui, I love the snorkeling. This hotel has it all. Let's start with the snorkeling. Black Rock has awesome sea life. Last trip we saw a white tipped shark (not dangerous), a school of white spotted manta rays, squid, shrimp, and of course a maginficent array of fish. The previous trip to that 3 large sea turtles were swimming right by the beach, so close that I almost accidentally stepped on it (but avoided to, as you're not supposed to touch them). We have our own snorkel mask and snorkel, and rent our fins from Maui Dive Shop for $3/day (versus renting fins for $15/day at the hotel). With that $3 a day we go snorkeling every day for free. It's just lovely. When not snorkeling, the poolside is wonderful, or you can hang out at the beach. The cabana rentals at the hotel are $40 a day which I think is reasonable when you consider it's $5 an hour if you stay the whole day. You need some cover from the relentless Maui sun, and occasional sprinkle. The long white sand beach is great to walk, where you can visit the other resorts along the way, or even stop at the Whalers Village mall (which is expensive to park at if you drive there). At sunset, they do a cliff dive off Black Rock, but people also jump off Black Rock all day. *As an aside, please be careful in the water! There are no lifeguards on this beach. Snorkel with someone else if at all possible, and stay away from the rock jumpers. Also, the current can be strong around the coral, so don't get too close to the shallow coral areas as you could get scraped. I would not recommend dining at the hotel, with the exception of the Lagoon bar which is open at lunch time. The $11 ribs and $13 nachos (as big as my head, and that's saying a lot) are really well worth it. The Lagoon bar also has good Happy Hour drink specials. Our room was an Ocean Deluxe, which we were upgraded to for free (our rate was $225 a night, plust the standard $25 a day resort fee). Usually when we ask, if they have an upgrade availalbe, they give it to us. We had Macadamia Chocolates waiting for us when we arrived, and the room had a microwave and fridge, perfect for storing leftovers and drinks. The room was spacious, clean, and tastefully furnished. There aren't as many families with kids at this hotel than some of the others along the Kaanapali strip. In addition, there are less rooms at this hotel, so the beach and pool area seem less crowded and not so sardine-y. *grin* I always look forward to staying at the Sheraton, and especially for my Starwood points to add up so we can start getting some free nights. *another grin*

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: funseekers88
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Sheraton, we were upgraded to a room in building 4 that had two lanais and a spectacular view. The beach in front of the hotel is amazing, we snorkeled with turtles and swam in the gentle waves everyday. The hotel is within walking distance to restaurants and shopping at Whalers Village or a short drive away from Lahaina town where we ate most of our dinners.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade? Not!”
Reviews.Author: aiea96701
Reviews.Content: Sheraton said they overbooked and gave us a so called upgrade. It was NOT. We cannot understand how they could take our payment in full 2 months ahead of time and then say they don't have a room for us in the catagory that we had reservations for. A very dishonest practice by a big hotel chain. I guess this is standard practice????!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our Sheraton Stay - On a Budget and w/ Kids”
Reviews.Author: WunderLand
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay at the Sheraton after I found a great package deal that made this place less expensive than the Kaanapali Beach Hotel...woo hoo! We didn't get a great room, but we didn't pay for one either, so I won't hold that against them...especially since we found a tree full of limes outside our balcony that we used to make our own tropical drinks. As others have said, it's a beautiful hotel on the best beach with wonderful snorkeling. We rented our snorkeling equipment at Snorkel Bobs in Lahaina, where you can rent cheap equipment for a whole week at the price you pay to rent it for one hour at the Sheraton. It was amazing to swim with the huge sea turtles! For small kids, don't bother with fins -- the fish are close to the shore and it just makes it difficult for them to walk. We opted for the less expensive luau at Royal Lahaina. Got a great price on last minute tickets at Local Experts in Lahaina. It's not obvious from any of the maps, but it is an easy walk north of the Sheraton to get to this hotel. We were impressed by this luau (after all the bad reviews here) and it was nice not to have to drive after all the mai-tais! We participated in a lot of Sheraton's "free" (included in the resort charge) activities. The lei-making was fun and we got to wear our beautiful orchid leis the next two evenings. We also enjoyed our ukulele lessons -- there were only two other people in the class! The backyard jam had a nice live hula/ukulele show that my kids loved, but there was a huge line for the free appetizers, and they ran out of the good stuff by the time we made it to the front of the line. We also went to movie night, where they showed Surf's Up on a large outdoor screen, very fun too! For amazing (and free) excursions, check out the Nakalele Blowhole (our favorite, be prepared for a hike down to it!) and some of the waterfalls on the road to Hana. Rooms come with a fridge, so we got yogurt/cereal/snacks at the local Safeway. Sheraton's. Happy hour was between 4 and 6 PM -- most drinks are a reasonable $5 with mai tais at $7. One splurge -- my husband and I took a surfing lesson and we left our kids at the Westin Kids Club for the day. The kids loved seeing another hotel/pool w/ real waterslides, plus the birds and koi fish at that hotel. Westin is a partner hotel with Sheraton so we received the lower full day rate of $130 for two kids, including lunch. It was a great program and it was nice to have a little break from all the family togetherness :) We would love to stay here again (if we find a good deal, of course :) ).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay-attentive service, ok rooms but location is the best!”
Reviews.Author: QueensNYtraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 days and loved it. We thought the staff was terrific, and all were especially attentive to our seven year old. The rooms were fine, although the bathrooms could use updating. The main reason we loved it was the location. It is on the nicest part of the beach, and we loved just walking out of our rooms and onto the beach. You could also walk to Whalers Village and other hotels for dinner and not contend with dark roads and traffic!!! Tip: the hotel's mai tai's are the best!!

Reviews.Title: “UN...wait for it..BELIEVABLE Perfect location, Great service, Amazing Trip”
Reviews.Author: psymn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Maui Sheraton hotel to celebrate her 30th birthday. This hotel is situated on top of Black Rock, which probably would not be allowed today since it has historical importance to the people of Hawai'i, but this presents incredible ocean views from most rooms, especially building 6. Check-IN & Room: The hotel staff was extremely friendly, and very helpful with our requests. We were greeted with complimentary champagne for my wifeâ€™s birthday and the in room check-in was an especially nice touch. It works like this: you are greeted at the curb with complimentary valet (it costs a few dollars after the first day), and escorted to your room where they explain a little bit about the hotelâ€™s offerings and give you a check-in package (keys, vouchers, etc.) and later you can go by the front desk to have them run your card for any incidental charges. We arrived right at sunset, an especially nice treat. The rooms have been nicely updated to modern expectations; you can hardly notice the hotel is 50+ years old, except that the walls are solid concrete. This makes the rooms seem more isolated than they are. They have good comfortable beds, similar to Westinâ€™s heavenly bed, LCD TV, nice bathroom and beautiful views. Iâ€™m very conscious of the bed because of a bad back, but I had no trouble from the bed at the Sheraton. The walk from building 6 to the main area of the hotel took about 3-5 minutes, but along the way there is an amazing open air atrium (used to be the lobby back in the old days) that has a constant breeze and direct view of the ocean and black rock, plus free wifi. We felt like this was our private room because there was hardly ever anyone there, and itâ€™s a great place to enjoy everything the beach has to offer without any crowds, sand or heat. Dining: Our package included free breakfast, which normally cost $28/pp. The buffet spread was varied and quite good. Iâ€™m not sure if it was $28 good, but the offerings were so different that I was never bored in 7 days of dining there. They typically offer an array of fresh fruit, smoked salmon bar, about 6 hot items, several cereals and yogurts, a breakfast burrito station, an omelet station, plus several fresh fruit juices including pineapple, guava, and orange. The dining room is open air and mostly situated outdoors (watch out for the birds that seem to converge on plates when they abandon their table). There is a coffee cart located above the breakfast buffet that serves Starbucks drinks. We didnâ€™t find this until our 3rd day. The breakfast restaurant transforms in Black Rock Steak and Seafood at night. This was the only negative experience of our stay. We had a $100 credit to the restaurant in our package, so we reviewed the menu and made reservations for the following night. Once we arrived the menu had been restricted, apparently they offer a dinner buffet some night and the menu is pared down accordingly. Not a huge deal, but it would have been nice to know before we made our plans. The dinner was ok, but nothing inspired or exceptional. In fact, this restaurant needs to be completely rethought, new theme & new menu. While the pricing is normal for Maui, there should be more effort put into a hotelâ€™s signature restaurant. Activities: The grounds are beautiful and their age really shows in good ways. There are numerous open grassy areas between the buildings with hammocks and palm trees, which you will not find at any other resort on Kaâ€™anapali beach (we looked). Black rock has some excellent snorkeling and other water activities. There is a rental place located near the pool that has everything from SCUBA equipment down to boogie boards. You can rent the same equipment at far lower prices by going to a Boss Frogs or Dive Maui (both are about a 5 minute drive). The pool is huge and winds through the grounds with many places to sunbathe, shade-seek and relax, plus it has a proper deep end. There is always a waitress nearby with cocktails (order a drink inside a pineapple or coconut for a kitschy treat), and there are two poolside restaurants. We watched the Luau from a distance and it looked like fun. There was the normal hula stuff, and a fire knife dancer, which looked pretty cool. We decided to go the Old Lahaina Luau instead and had a great time there. Iâ€™m sure that Iâ€™ve left something out, but overall our trip was fantastic. I have to imagine that some of the other negative reviews have been read by hotel management and the problems addressed. Compared to some older negative reviews, I canâ€™t believe this is the same hotel. We enjoyed every minute of our vacation, and the Sheraton was a wonderful location place to relax and unwind after a full day of activities.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, great location, great value, 4 stars!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelman33123
Reviews.Content: What a trip, the Maui Sheraton was a wonderful resort. My wife and I went for our anniversary trip for some rest and relaxation, the Maui Sheraton delivered. A beautiful 40 minute drive from the airport will bring you to the hotel, driving through the wonderful town of Lahaina. The hotel has a great pool with a deep end, a small slide, a few waterfalls, and a shallow end for kids. The beach is pristine, white sandy beaches, light surf, and water that is blue as it gets. The hotel offers multiple rentals right on the beach, things such as snorkel gear, body boards, rafts, and chase lounges. Our room was the standard king and it had plenty of space for two, standard accommodations, and a great view, the room and resort were a great value for the cost. The Sheraton offers a shuttle service to the downtown area of Lahaina, this is where we spent our evenings. Front Street has many different kinds of restaurants, shops, art stores, and entertainment. I love seafood and my wife hates it, we did not have any problems finding a compromise on where to eat, and we did not have to repeat. Finally a few pointers, first we felt the drinks were overpriced at the resort (typical) but if you check the weekâ€™s calendar in your room it states â€œhappy hourâ€� when drinks are half off. We had lunch twice at the outdoor bar/grill, again overpriced, $18 for a chicken wrap with tip and tax. I am not the kind of person that minds spending money on a good meal but not much value to lunch, dinner in town was 20-30 with a salad, fresh fish, side, and a drink. Also skip the Luau at the Sheraton, we watched the show and were not very impressed. We booked the â€œOld Lahaina Luauâ€� for the same price, the food choices were much larger, drinks were included, they did the whole buried pig thing, and the event lasted 3 hours. Over all this is a great resort for a great value I would recommend this to everyone and anyone interested in Maui. Mark -Chicago, IL

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui is nice resort.”
Reviews.Author: clarks10
Reviews.Content: This is a nice resort. We pulled up about 3 hours before check in and while our room wasn't ready yet they gave us free drink coupons and 35% off at the pool lounge to have lunch. Nice start! When our room was ready they called my cell phone, which it was ready a few hours early and they had upgraded us from ocean view to ocean front deluxe, which was in building 6 up on top of black rock. Nice room, great view, but really long walk, 3 elevators to take. We didn't mind though, we were on vacation and didn't have to be anywhere in a hurry, and found the trip back to the room to be amuzing and pleasant at the same time. Most of staff was excellent and helpful, except one at the bar that was not very "service oriented" and ignored our needs. Other than her though the rest of the staff was pleasant and friendly and very helpful. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “1 more thing I checked of my bucket list”
Reviews.Author: mom1954
Reviews.Content: I was a single parent and had difficult times with my son. I would tell him when I die spread my ashes in Hawaii. This past June he took me on a SURPRISE vacation to this little piece of Heaven on earth. This beautiful resort was ideal for this wonderful time of our lives. The location was beyond anything I could imagine. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Thanks to all who made this a trip of MY lifetime especially my son Harold. He really knows how to pick special spots.

Reviews.Title: “Location..Location..Location..Easily the best hotel on the island”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaRampage
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Maui the 3rd week of August for seven days. I read all the reveiws before we hit Hawaii for the first time. I will help you sort out the fact from fiction. If your looking for a 5 Star pampered treatment you will need to head south to the Four Seasons $$$. The Sheraton is perfect if you set your expectations reasonable and can appreciate all they have to offer. Room- Deluxe Ocean Front...Its only a few bucks more to wake up to the sounds of the ocean and a beautiful view of Lanai. I would say how great the view of the sunset is from the room, but we were outside every night seeing who made the best Mai Tai's. Yea it was three elavators to get to the pool, but it was no problem. Pool(s)- I found no problems finding a beach lounger by one of their numerous pools. I scratch my head why I read so many complaints about the pool area. Food/Bars- Sheraton has numerous Bars and restaurants. We only ate poolside and the food was excellent. Ocean-Black Rock.....Great Snorkling right at you hotels beach.

Reviews.Title: “Trip of A Lifetime”
Reviews.Author: dc46
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home after a week long stay at the Sheraton Maui. I can not say enough about this fabulous hotel and the tremendous service we experienced during our entire stay. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and the grounds are spectacular. The pool and the beach were the best we encountered on the island. The on-sight dining at the Sheraton, including the breakfast buffet, was good and the location of this hotel right at Black Rock can not be beat (best snorkeling on Maui). A short walk down the beach walk takes you to the Whaler's Village and great shopping and several wonderful restaurants. The hotel is also only five minutes from Lahina, with its many shops and fine and fast food options. There are also a lot of excursions that leave from this city, so it is very convenient for meeting those as well. We booked this hotel on the recommendation of our travel agent, Kay Ryan/aka Maui Kay (kay@mauikay.com) who lives right on Maui only ten minutes from this hotel and who met us personally at the hotel to deliver excursion tickets and to answer all of our questions about the island and the things to see and do there. Kay helped us book all of our activities and made us feel like insiders on Maui and helped us make the most of our short time there. We can not recommend her services enough for anyone who wants to make the most of their trip to this beautiful island. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui : a Fabulous Resort !”
Reviews.Author: markav99
Reviews.Content: Wow...my husband and I spent a week at the Sheraton (August 15 - 22, 2009) and it greatly contributed to our wonderful time on the island of Maui. Our ocean front room in building 6 had a great view and the bed was so comfortable - great mattress, pillows, and sheets. The grounds are so pretty - every color of plumeria you can think of ! We loved the layout of the pool, bar/restaurant, and beach - we could switch from one tho the other with ease throughout the day. The beach, Ka'anapali, is gorgeous, and has direct views of the islands of Moloka'i and Lana'i in the distance. We met people all over the island who said they had hoped to catch a glimpse of a green sea turtle while snorkeling at various beaches, but had not. Well, at the Sheraton these turtles swim right out front , near Black Rock , so close that I could reach out and touch them while snorkeling ! We had great service during the whole week we were there, and everyone we dealt with was genuinely friendly and helpful - we really felt the "aloha spirit" from all the employees at the Sheraron. The guys at the poolside-beachfront bar were especially fun and friendly! They have happy hour there for three hours every day, and the drinks are half price - a great deal that we made sure to take advantage of ! Some people have compained that the restaurants at the Sheraton are too expensive...well, we couldn't afford to have dinner there every night either, so we didn't - but don't these people want to get out and about in the evening, anyway ? We would enjoy great, reasonably priced burgers or chicken or mahi mahi for lunch at the Sheraton beach bar, and then go off the property for dinner. There is a mile long beach path with several good restaurant you can walk to, or you can hop into your car and drive 5 minutes to Lahaina town for great food and nightlife. In summary, my husband and I were thrilled with our experience at the Sheraton Maui, and we will ALWAYS stay there when we return to Maui !

Reviews.Title: “first day here”
Reviews.Author: Asiavistor
Reviews.Content: first day here and spending a lot on the room. upgraded and a free drink when the room was not ready. very good. a couple draw backs: resort geed of $25 per night excludes beach chairs, snorkel equipment or anything a resort charge should have. The way they charge seems like they should have a bggage charge and a fuel sur-charge. very strange. By the way the staff is fantastic, the location is great and the welcome bottle of champagne was a goo touch. Right now I would suggest people stay but be realistic on the costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Kids, great beach”
Reviews.Author: cturk
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews about hotels on kanapali decided on sheraton based on location next to black rock... my son who is a beginner swimmer wanted to join me snorkeling and I felt the water around this area was calmer than others... what a great idea... he was able to swim with me completely confident up to the tip of black rock and back enjoying all the fish...our room was in the hale ka moana area (a free upgrade) but it was 2 hallways and 2 elevators just to get to the beach and pool. If you don't mind the walk the sunset views from the room are spectacular...the room is pretty basic with 2 full beds, refiregerator, microwave, seating area, plasma tv and safe. We ate a breafast at the buffet on the terrace and if you do just eat indoors cause the birds can get VERY annoying. The pool is nice it is like a lazy river without the current and a small splash area for the kids. Since the grounds are so big... if after a day you are too tired to walk to room just go to the lobby and ask the valets to drive you to room in their golf carts. Also check in was really easy... you check in curbside and follow the valet in your car straight to your room and then he unpacks it for you and parks your car. It really is a great place for kids and adults will like it too.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhh...sweet relaxation!!”
Reviews.Author: Chapin10123
Reviews.Content: We booked our 5-night stay with several other couples through Costco Travel and had a very nice time. The grounds are impeccably kempt, quiet and very relaxing. The beach in front of the hotel was easily accessible and very nice, although a bit small. As other reviewers have noted, snorkeling around black rock is good...we saw sea turtles nearly every time we went out. My wife and I enjoyed taking a morning jog along the walkway that winds between the beach and the rest of the hotels that line the beach. We went to the luau and it was nice but not the best we've seen. The rooms were nicely appointed albeit a bit dated. We used the fitness center nearly every day - free weights, several tread mills, circuit machines, etc. I thought the breakfast buffet was excellent. We tried the buffet at the Westin as well (came with the package) and it was very good as well. Overall, we really enojoyed our stay and would recommend the resort to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Competent, but lacks style and elegance.”
Reviews.Author: susan4mat1946
Reviews.Content: We just completed a week's stay at the Sheraton Maui. Overall, we enjoyed this hotel, but it definitely lacks the style and elegance of other Sheraton and Westin properties that we have visited worldwide over the years. We used our Starwood points for this stay (we are SPG gold), and that made it a good deal. Six nights for five nights worth of points, and we took the Moana Program upgrade for $150 per night which we enthusiastically recommend. This upgrade included a prime ocean front room with lanai in building six (Moana), turndown service every night, late checkout, 35% off food in the restaurants, and best of all, it covered the $26 per night "resort fee" (parking, internet, etc.), the breakfast buffet for two every morning (regularly priced at $26.95 each), and one hour of free cocktails at the poolside Lagoon Bar. A glass of wine is $12 at this bar, so it's easy to run up an expensive bar bill quickly. Excellent bartenders at the Lagoon Bar! Our room was large and included a small refrigerator, microwave, safe, and a large bathroom. This hotel did not have the special resort themed toiletries that we enjoyed at the Princeville Westin Resort two years ago. Instead the toiletries were the same as every other Sheraton, and lacked a shower cap (provided promptly once we called guest services). The lanai was furnished with a table and two chairs, so perfect for the two of us. The room furnishings were very low quality, with several drawers on the dresser and nightstands off their tracks, and substantial damage to the exterior wood. The large flat screen TV worked well, but at least one of the cable stations had audio problems for several days. Maui was very hot (temps around 90F every day) and 100% humidity during our stay, so we appreciated the good air conditioning system in our room. Housekeeping service was fine, and we skipped one day's housekeeping as part of the hotel's "go green" plan, which earned us a $40 credit towards dinner in their restaurants. We also reported a slow draining sink, which was promptly fixed, and we received a $15 coupon towards lunch or dinner for our report of this problem. Turndown service included fresh towels and a quick straightening up of the room. Overall we found the staff to be friendly and mostly competent. We agree with other reviewers that the hostess system for breakfast makes no sense. The hostess had to write down our info in three separate places, and if you asked a question during this process, she got off track and became flustered. One hostess was grim and unfriendly. We were surprised that Starwood does not have more robust automation and procedures for restaurant queuing. The pool area is well designed. Be aware that this hotel has franchised-out management of pool services. Pool towels are shabby and falling apart. You are given one plastic pool card per guest upon check in, and you must use this card to obtain a towel at the pool. You get a card back when you turn in the towel at the end of the day. The front desk will give you more pool towel cards upon request, cautioning you that there is a $15 charge if you do not turn all your pool cards in at check out. Unlike other Starwood hotels, this Sheraton does not have a separate adult only pool or pool deck area (we understand that the Westin Maui down the street does have an adult pool). Our visit was during family season, and there were many children in the pool splashing and diving into the water. You must get to the pool deck early in the morning (by 7AM) in order to get pool loungers under one of the stationary umbrellas. We did rent a beach cabana for two, which was $40 for the day, and would recommend this over renting beach chairs and an umbrella. The pool staff gives each guest a wristband each day so as to keep the pool areas for hotel guests only (the beach, like all Hawaiian beaches, is open to the public). Pool service for lunch was competent, but not outstandingly attentive. We found that splitting a $15 wrap was more than enough for a light lunch. It was our overall impression that except for the Lagoon Bar, the restaurants and other food outlets are understaffed. We enjoyed two wonderful dinners at the Tropica restaurant located in the Westin down the beach. You are permitted to charge to your room account at several of the hotels on the Kaanapali beach strip. We used the concierge desk to book one dinner. It was nice that on one day at the beginning of our stay, a concierge came around to everyone lounging at the pool to enquire if they could be of service. Note that this was the only day that we saw a concierge poolside. Do not confuse the concierge staff with the Starwood Vacations staff that tries to sell you a timeshare! They are friendly and will leave you several voicemails until you drop by their desk. There are many events at this hotel such as a barbeque buffet night, a luau, and a movie night. We did not go to any of these events, but they appear to be popular, especially with the many families staying at this hotel. So we would recommend this hotel to families looking for a good Starwood value. If you are adult travelers looking for elegance and style in Hawaii, then look instead to the Princeville Resort on Kauai.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: LSBurdett
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to do a full review as I agree with the general impression given by the most recent reviews. This resort is over forty years old but greatly benefits from some intelligent initial planning and respectful repurposing over the years. Being right next to the Black Rock gives this area a picturesque setting, protection from the ever present winds and one of the best, easily accessible snorkel sites you'll find anywhere. On multiple occasions we saw sea turtles and rays within easy 10 minute floats from the beach. On the negative side there was some peeling paint above the shower in our room and you need to be on your toes to keep track of all the fees you may be charged. Here are some examples with commentary: $ 9 state tax $ 18 occupancy tax $ 26 resort charge ($25 plus tax. The industry needs to get away from this one. Can a guest opt out if he spends the day outside of the resort?) $ 70 amount charged each night for a rollaway bed. They tried to charge $80 but I pointed out it says $70 on the printed card that came with the bed. $ 3 state tax on the rollaway bed per night $ 7 occupancy tax for the extra bed per night When you add it all up it came to $133 daily extra charges on our $220 room rate. I'm not surprised by most of these but I wish that we could have a system where guests get full disclosure on these items prior to booking their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special to write home about...”
Reviews.Author: BeckiTravels
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth trip to Maui - our first (and last) stay at the Sheraton. For a Four Star property, it certainly fell short of our expectations. Check-in was smooth, but our room was hardly "ocean front". Ocean VIEW maybe, if you looked past the grounds, the pool and palm trees, the growth that separated the pool and the beach and THEN, you could see the beach and the ocean beyond. The bed was comfortable, but that was about all I have to say on the positive side. No turn down service with a flower on the pillow (like we've had at every other hotel we've stayed at on Maui), the meals were OUTRAGEOUSLY expensive ($60 for breakfast for two) and weren't even that good. We were charged for water, that we did NOT open or take (didn't notice this until we were going over the bill on the flight home) and we constantly had notes that one thing or another was being tested, cleaned or killed during the week we were there. Bug sprayers came one day and that left a dozen 2" long dead cockroaches on our balcony... VERY enjoyable when you want to sit out and enjoy the sunset. There was only ONE chair on our balcony, so my husband and I coudn't even sit out together to enjoy the morning breezes. The pool was often so crowded that you couldn't get a lounge chair and if you wanted a lounge chair on the beach, you had to pay extra for that. When my husband made the reservations, he requested a late check-out. When he confirmed the reservation, he made the request again. When we checked in, he again made the request and the day before we're leaving, we're told we can't get it. Oh wait... IF we want to pack up, move to another room and stay THERE, we can get the late check-out. What a serious pain in the backside. We never went to the Luau, so I can't comment on that one way or another and we never ate dinner at the hotel (with breakfast costing $60 for the two of us, we figured we'd have to take out a second mortgage to afford dinner). We ended up eating most breakfasts at The Plantation House in Kapalua for half the price and the food was much better. Overall, we were terribly under-impressed with the Sheraton on Ka'anapali Beach in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Quality”
Reviews.Author: Corban80
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week in this hotel. Pros - good location, close to ocean, nice snorkeling Cons: In the room: furniture is old, towels smell chlorine, poor drain system in the bathroom, closet doors which suppose to slide - just don't slide, bathroom is old and uncomfortable Outside: pool stinks with chlorine (not a best place for kids), $10 for beach chair per day per person, another $10 for umbrella, beach towels are very old. Basicaly, here you are paying for everything. Water in your room $5, breakfast - $60 for two, dinner will be more expensive. They have free internet, although slow Its not that we cannot afford to stay in places like this, but even 3* hotels in Turkey or Egypt have more ameneties and quality services than Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but eat elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: docmatt
Reviews.Content: Out of all the hotels on that stretch, the Sheraton wins hands-down on location. Great beach and good snorkelling views around the rock. However, the queuing system for breakfast is a joke and the evening meals are overpriced. we had a 3 course al a carte meal at the Hyatt 1/2 a mile away for the same price as the normal evening meal we had at the Sheraton. Bringing the main course plates to our table whilst we were only finishing our starters causing us to move plates around did it for me, we didnt eat there again. Overpriced place for what it is. As long as you eat elsewhere you will enjoy the Sheraton. If you are not a frequent traveller you will enjoy it. If you only do 5 star then have a good think before you book.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Wonderful views.”
Reviews.Author: kleetaylor
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for our trip. I got married in Maui and had about 16 friends and family join us. We all stayed here and had a great time. In fact , my husband and I moved after we got married to a more expensive resort in Wailea and hated it compared to the Sheraton. The snorkeling here is very good and we saw tons of fish. The beach is big for Maui with plenty of room and long enough to have a good walk. The pool is sufficient for the hotel with a nice kiddie pool. The black rock is stunning and the diving ceremony is fun to watch. You can even jump off the cliff yourself. The resort is within walking distant of whaler's village and many restaurants. It is across from a golf course, and not too far from Lahaina (you can get a shuttle). Best of all the resort looks very Hawaiian which is good for first-timers. The rooms were all very clean with nice tvs and bathrooms. We only ate at the bar which was good but the food and alcohol is overpriced. But it's like this at all the resorts (the breakfast buffet is 25 dollars but this was cheaper than all of the buffets in Wailea). They do have happy hour every day from 4-6. And every room has a fridge which means you can buy your own alcohol and some snacks and breakfast. There is a little Starbucks coffee hut in the lobby. You get a lei at check-in. All of my family was very pleased with this resort and location. The only negative is that the resort has a lot of buildings to stay in. If you are in building 5 or 6 it is complicated with several elevator rides to get to the pool or anywhere else. So ask to be in building 3 or 4.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: MishChicago_Illinois
Reviews.Content: This review is for the Sheraton on Kaanapali Beach which is right by Lahaina. First of all, this hotel is stunning! A bit pricey, but the location and ammenities are wonderful.The hotel is very pretty with it's open air lobby and floors. Great location to restaurants and shopping on Front Street in Lahaina. The grounds are beautiful and the pool area and beach are lovely. We didn't have our kids with us, but they would of truly loved the lagoon style swimming pool and the snorkeling around the black rock that the hotel sits on and is next to. The stretch of beach that this hotel and others sit on in Kaanapali can't be beat. Nice walkway located oceanside of all hotels and restaurants so it makes it very easy to get from place to place.

Reviews.Title: “First and last stay at the Sheraton Maui”
Reviews.Author: OperaOnTheTurnpike
Reviews.Content: Following an impeccable and sublime stay at The London West Hollywood in the L.A area, my wife and I flied to Maui for a week-long stay at the Sheraton Maui Resort & Spa. It was our second time in Maui and I have to say that, although, we had a fabulous and incredibly happy time in such an unbeatable island so full of beauty and Hawaiian charm, the Sheraton Maui wasnâ€™t responsible for those magical moments in any way. This resort is obviously way too expensive for what you get. As other traveler wrote in a previous review, perhaps those who usually donâ€™t travel or travel very little will love the place â€œjust-be-cause-weâ€™re-in-paradiseâ€�, but if youâ€™re a frequent traveler, you will feel pretty unimpressed (to say the very least), as youâ€™ll soon notice that nothing really works as you would expect from a four star property. You get unnatural smiles and words all the time, artificial and hackneyed "repeat with me: ALOOOOO-HA!!" sentences, constant tedious messages in your roomâ€™s phone voicemail, and everything to pretend they are so devoted to your comfort, when the reality couldnâ€™t be further from truth. In the practice you get a 2-star attention in a 4-star environment with five 5+ star prices. And they constantly pretend that theyâ€™re giving you so much when the truth is that this place is nothing more than a money eater!! Simple as that!! Even when you ask just for a drink they put you a small accompaniment appetizer, like it or not, and they charge you for it!! The grounds are wonderful, as itâ€™s the breathtaking beach & the Black Rock area where the place sits. But thatâ€™s all. The rooms are little more than â€˜simply goodâ€™, and in certain buildings the hotelâ€™s architecture makes them be laid out in an almost anti-democratic way â€“ rooms that are theoretically of the same level are not in the practice. For instance, in building 3, the higher floor, the smaller room or balcony you get. As a result, you may have reserved, letâ€™s say, an â€œocean frontâ€� or an â€œocean viewâ€� room with a private lanai, and find yourself in a quite run of the mill room with an extremely tiny outdoor space which doesnâ€™t even deserve the name â€˜balconyâ€™ because it has only space (barely...) for an extremely compact table and ONE ONLY CHAIR. Wasnâ€™t it a room for 2 people? I simply cannot understand how a four star property can have so stingy and shabby touches (sometimes you may even not get lanai or balcony at all. I remember one guest complaining because, based on his reservation description, he and his girlfriend were supposed to have a room with a lanai and they didnâ€™t get one. Simply surreal! But what I get even less is how, for example, in building 3, someone who is staying in an â€œocean viewâ€� room can get a bigger balcony/lanai than someone who is staying in an â€œocean frontâ€�, which is a more expensive room. Anyway, the views in the so-called â€œocean front roomsâ€� from building 3 are simply to guffaw (to help you make an idea, Hilton Hawaiian Villageâ€™s ocean view rooms have clearer views of the ocean than Sheraton Mauiâ€™s building 3 ocean front rooms). The service was a joke, and a very bad one, by the way. A good part of the staff was rude and seemed to be constantly pissed off (namely some restaurant hostess) and some were really unpleasant or even rude (particularly a lady called Jacqueline), another part (namely the restaurant waiters) worked a lot and was good and kind in general, but seemed to feel helpless all time, maybe because of being too few employees for a big resort as the Sheraton is. And then there was the front desk staff, which was simply completely incompetent and inefficient. It constantly failed to answer the guests most basic questions, including those related to hurricane Felicia (that was in those days about to reach Hawaii). Regarding hurricane Feliciaâ€™s evolution, there was a very young girl at the front desk, whose name I cannot remember, but for whom the job was obviously far too big. She gave answers like â€œwell, we donâ€™t know anything about it...â€� followed by a frivolously wink-peppered and absurdly obvious â€œ... I would say watch the newsâ€�). The breakfast tableâ€™s designation system was absolutely bizarre. First you had to register at the hostess stand, where someone would write down your name and tell you to seat by the hall sofas and armchairs and wait (â€œa couple of minutesâ€�) to be seated. Then the party immediately behind you would go through exactly the same process, and so on... As a result, you could see all these ready tables completely empty and a fairly good line of people waiting to be seated. It was terribly clumsy, slow and sense-lacking system. The housekeeping was nothing to write home about. Our bath gel was never replaced, so we had to ask for it every day by phone calling the guest service. One day, little after we had found out (once again...) that our gel hadnâ€™t been replaced, we suddenly ran into the maid and asked her for it. To our surprise she told us that they only provide your bathroom with bath gel â€œby requestâ€�. Incredible!!!! Something as basic as the bath gel!!! Shame-on-you... That wasnâ€™t the only absurd thing from the housekeeping. That very same day we had left our towels in the floor, obviously meaning that we needed new ones (thatâ€™s what hotels services guides indicate guests should do, and the Sheraton Maui one was no different). To our surprise, the maid picked them from the floor and returned them to the bathroom, where she didnâ€™t even fold them and placed them in the towel rack, but she instead placed them hanging on the bath curtain pole. No further comments. The food prices are simply outrageous. Given the breakfast buffet costs $26 (plus tax and service tip) per person, for a good selection (but not even close to being the best or the most varied ever seen, anyway), you can imagine the prices of the mediocre dinner buffets, the not-exactly-mouthwatering â€œa la carteâ€� menus, or the plain and pretty standard snacks and drinks at the pool bars. I donâ€™t mind being charged that way if I feel Iâ€™m being given a service to match. But that definitely wasnâ€™t the case... And what about that bad taste joke called $26.04 daily â€œresort chargeâ€�? What a cheat!! The Sheraton Maui tries in vain, with all its usual sham of â€˜somersaults, trapezes and fireworksâ€™, to convince its guests that it is a â€œpersonal touchâ€� (with such â€œpersonalâ€� touches, Iâ€™d rather prefer the â€œimpersonalâ€� ones) that â€œadds value to your resort experience by eliminating several indicated charges in favor of one daily assessed resort chargeâ€�. Those theoretically indicated charges are from things such as hula lessons, scheduled shuttle service to Lahaina (the only thing from the hotel that worked 100%), or the slowest in-room internet access Iâ€™ve ever seen in my life. Sorry but, still having in mind the magnificent London West Hollywood Hotel larger-than-life rooms and the super-fast complimentary (yes, completely free) internet access, I have to laugh. And to cap it all, the hotel grounds are, of course, plagued with unbearable kids. Some of them were amongst the most irritating and worst mannered Iâ€™ve ever seen, although watching their parents, one perfectly understands where that ugly attitude comes from... Summing up, Maui is a wonderful island. It has lots and lots to offer, with its various microclimates, incredible beaches, breathtaking landscapes and so on. Although very commercialized, it lives up to its reputation of having been considered many times â€˜the best island in the worldâ€™ by the readers of Conde Nast Traveler magazine. But the Sheraton Maui, Iâ€™m sad to say, is far below the level of the whole place. It could be a great place, but it lacks adequate attitude and has a great surplus of cash-greed, which tries to disguise with false smiles, â€˜aloha-to-everyoneâ€™ boring sentences and so on. Do you feel scared at the risk of sharks when going to the beach? Now you know where they are! Enjoy the "true $pirit of Aloha"!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1dts
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The snorkeling was superb and it was amazing to walk out of our room and have such a great beach and snorkeling just a short walk away. We had garden view rooms. We decided to not pay for the ocean view and we were happy with our rooms. We sat on the chaise lounges at night and listened to the ocean and there are cute sitting areas on every floor that have ocean views. The rooms are basic but a good size with a nice size lanai. We liked that the hotel was elegant but not "snooty". The workers were all amazingly helpful and friendly. The grounds are beautiful. We loved the swimming pool. We enjoyed the free entertainment at the bar. The prices at the hotel were outrageous but Whaler's Village is a short beautiful walk away and has great more reasonably priced food and fun stores. We discovered that if we walked north of the hotel there were also a number of grill type areas to eat. We also loved eating in Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: JellisenNC
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from my Honeymoon. Overall the hotel was great. We told them that we were on our honeymoon and were therefore upgraded to building 6 which overlooked the ocean (plus a free bottle of champagne). We called a couple weeks ahead of time to request king size bed since we were on honeymoon. Yes, the building is approx 3 elevators from the pool, lobby and restaurants (you can make it in less if you take short cuts) but I didn't mind being a little distance from stuff as it was our honeymoon. It was quieter over in building 6. Plus there are bathrooms all over the hotel so if we went to the pool, it wasn't like we had to trek back and forth to our room. The view was great from our 1st floor room. The sunset was beautiful from our patio. We watched it several nights and took lots of photos. There was nothing spectacular about the room or decor. It was clean. Sheets were a little rough. I did think the food was overpriced but that was expected. We ate at the prime rib buffet. It was ok but nothing spectacular. We only went because we got the special $25 discount for not having our room cleaned that day. The pool bar food and drinks were decent but still a bit overpriced. We shared the nachos for $15 which was a good sized lunch for both of us. I got a massage at the spa with Bob. It was awesome. I have been having some minor back pain for a few months and have not had any since my massage a week ago. I also got a free gift and a 20% discount at the spa from talking to the concierge one day. Location of the hotel was great. Beach was nice area. Close to Lahaina which was good for dinner, shopping, just walking around. It was also near where our Trilogy boat tour left and the Old Lahaina Luau. Pros-Beach, pool, location, view, not the most expensive of the resorts I looked at, spa was nice, nice free shuttle that went to lahaina (right near the luau we went to), liked landscaping and the openess of the lobbies and restaurants Cons-rooms not spectacular, strange smell near one of the elevators, overpriced and not great tasting food

Reviews.Title: “I wished I booked elsewhere - our honeymoon ended upon check-in.”
Reviews.Author: spokeydokey
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotel experiences ever...and on our honeymoon too! Zero customer service. We felt like were were treated like a number. Even though we reserved a room with a king size bed, they gave us one with two double beds. When we asked if there was something else available since we were on our honeymoon and had requested a king size bed, they simply said they were sold out. I asked if they could check with another Starwood property like the Westin down the street, and they said they'd get the phone number for us. Gee thanks. The room wasn't too good either. The fixtures were cheap, there was mold in the shower, and the door hinges were almost rusted out. It was also very loud in the hallways and from the balconies. The food was overpriced for the quality. (One star for the bread pudding at breakfast - that was good.) We got much better meals at the Westin down the street. The flat screen TV was nice, but we didn't got to Maui to watch TV.

Reviews.Title: “A trip we'll never forget”
Reviews.Author: Lauriot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for a week and that's the place to stay in Kaanapali! The hotel is right on the beach and what beach! Black Rock is right there, put your head in the water with regular glasses and you'll see turtles. The hotel has a swimming pool adjacent to the beach, it's very practical when you have kids, you don't spend your time running around between the 2. The hotel itself could use some updates in the bathroom but everything is clean. The grounds are unbeleivable. The breakfast buffet is a must: take a package that includes the breakfast. Otherwise it's about $30/person/morning! The only down side of the hotel is its Luau, it's pretty lame, only 8 dancers total and a show host that talks more than the dancers dance.

Reviews.Title: “Good Customer Service, but probably won't be back”
Reviews.Author: Sheil21
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a very pleasant stay at the Sheraton-Maui I will just go over the pros/cons list with you all: Pros: Beautiful, absolutely amazing views of the beach and Black Rock from just about (I will get to that later) everywhere on the resort Great happy hour at the lagoon bar with very attentive bartenders/servers All the staff was very welcoming Small fridge in room Easy and short walk to Whaler's Village (there is a shuttle available too) Great housekeeping services We had a late flight and they let us stay on the property (we had to check out at 11) and shower in the fitness center Nice greeting with shell leis at the desk Easy in and out parking (we were in a Deluxe Oceanview in Building 2) Great snorkeling at Black Rock Cons When we arrived we were told we had an "upgraded room" in building 6 on top of Black Rock, getting to the room we realized that we were on the ground floor meaning no real view and that we could not even see the beach, only the ocean. Because we arrived at 10pm we didn't change that night. The next day we went to the desk (at 8AM) and they changed us back to the room we originally booked. If you are in building 6 you literally have to take 3 elevators to get to the pool/lobby area. We stayed in Building 2 on the 5 floor which was perfect but we still lost a day waiting for the room to be changed. Don't stay in Building 6 unless you have to. The pool area is very weird, didn't like it at all. There are a lot of kids and no adult pool area. The meals were way too expensive. We never ate on the property. Overall not too many complaints. The reason we won't be staying there again is because there are better options close to this area and on Maui in general.

Reviews.Title: “25th Anniversary trip--perfect week”
Reviews.Author: skimom5
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel after much research on maui 4 and 5 star hotels. It was great. Our room was really nice, comfortable bed, ocean front balcony, micro and refrig in room. Pool and beach wonderful. Sunsets here are beautiful. Close proximity to many other resorts and shopping. Walking path both directions. We spent a day in Waillea looking at their hotels and were glad we had stayed where we did. More to do on kaanapali. Plan to come back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “I expected so much more.”
Reviews.Author: jd5066
Reviews.Content: We stayed for seven nights as part of our honeymoon. The hotel and grounds are beautiful. Our room was in building six and was a "deluxe oceanfront." The view from the room was gorgeous. The bed was very comfortable. The hotel gets a three for several reasons: -The bathroom in our room could use a remodel. The tiles were old and the sink was peeling. - The chairs on the balconies are chair height and not bar height. As a result, the horizon at eye level is squarely behind the railing. Super annoying. - Building six is a long walk from the main portion of the hotel. It takes three elevators just to get to the pool. - The breezeway between buildings five and six smelled like garbage every day, despite the front desk telling us there were no dumpsters around. - Food - is- EXPENSIVE!! The breakfast buffet is $26.95/pp. Sandwiches at the pool are $14+. A small Starbucks coffee at the coffee cart was $3.74. - The "resort fee" is a rip off. $26.04/day gets you parking, wi-fi (in hot spots), and a few telephone calls. Nothing else. - The spa is not relaxing. It is tiny and loud. - Too many kids at this hotel. The pool was filled with them. - There aren't enough chairs at the pool. Guests throw down towels mighty early to reserve their spots. Those of us who didn't make it down at dawn foght for what was left. - Drink/food service at the pool is a joke. Get it yourself. I would recommend this hotel for a family vacation. For a honeymoon, I'd suggest something a little more secluded. Maui itself is lovely. The fish is delicious. And pork is a specialty. Would I go back to Maui? Yes, tomorrow if I could.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: redheadsoccermom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Sheraton, this was our third trip to Maui our first time staying at the Sheraton. We got there early around 11, our room wasnt ready, they gave us free drink coupons and in about an hour our room was ready. Nice room upgraded to a mountain view, which you could also see the ocean. We had our breakfast included, which we could chose either the Sheraton or the Westin. The Westin had a better breakfast. Nice way to start the day! On the third day we moved into our own ocean view room while our kids stayed in the old room. Loved the room had a great view! We hung out by the pool and snorkled at Black Rock. Loved the open feel of the hotel and the torch lighting every night. Any complants,there were alot of little kids in the pool, even though there was a kid pool on the other side. But we were on vacation so you got use to it! Great hotel, service was great! The valet guys were the absolute best, always smiling and being helpful!! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui - Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Jeepgirl179
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the Sheraton Maui at Ka'anapali beach when it was recommended by our travel agent. We absolutely loved it. The pool is ideally located right on the ocean -- you can enjoy the comfort of the pool while still able to look out at the beautiful ocean. The only drawback to the pool was it was a little crowded with deck chairs (probably for busier times) and so good spots were definitely at a premium. There were a couple of traditional Hawaiian classes offered, like lei making and hula. I took a hula class, which was short and fun. The concierges were absolutely wonderful -- we booked some really cool activities, like surf lessons, parasailing, and zip lining, through them. They were so friendly and welcoming. One really nice feature was that there were concierges in the lobby, and also down by the pool. Russ was our concierge and he was sooo great! The only way he led us astray was sending us into Lahaina for "Warren and Annabelles Comedy Magic Show" which was $200 worth of just plain awful. Do NOT go to that show! Some friends from back home had recommended it to us, I can't believe they actually liked it. The only meals we ate at the hotel were the breakfast buffet (we had coupons for it that came with our travel package) and it was decent food, but more importantly it was in an awesome location with an ocean view. I would skip the poolside lunch at the bar and grill down there...it was mediocre and expensive. But the poolside waiter/waitresses and drinks were awesome! The room was comfy...the bathroom was fairly updated, the room was good but not spectacular. We did have a deluxe oceanfront room with a view though, and the view was definitely worth it. The hotel is not too big, and the grounds are just lovely. The staff is happy, friendly, and helpful. At night, they have a torch lighting ceremony and cliff diving at sunset, which was very cool. The reef they dive off is a great place to snorkel in the daytime -- there's sea turtles and cool fish to see. When I go back to Maui, I definitely want to stay at this Sheraton again! I don't think it's necessarily a great place for kids if you're looking for a family vacation, I think there are other hotels in the same area that are more geared towards that and have kids activities. But it was abolutely perfect for our honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “great for couples”
Reviews.Author: gp366
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned to the sheraton maui for our 5th wedding anniversary. We don't have any kids and the sounds of kids are like chalk on the chalkboard for the both of us. We decided to choose this hotel because we had a great time on our honeymoon 5 years ago and also we knew that there weren't a lot of kids. When we booking maui hotels, we stayed clear of any hotel that labeled themself with "family-friendly" or "kids-program" etc. If you are looking for a honeymoon or a romantic getaway, the sheraton is for you. I've heard that the Hyatt is nicer, but they have tons of kids programs...not what i want to hear if i were on my honeymoon. We love the hotel. The valets know our names and the staff is very friendly. The pool is nice and not overly crowded, considering the hotel is full and it is peak season in late july. Basically, you're in maui...you only stay in your hotelroom to sleep, bathe, store your stuff and check the internet. You shouldn't be spending more than 2 hours during the day in your room...IT'S MAUI !!!! Great location by the Black Rock for snorkeling also. The only complaints that I have are the wait staff by the pools are complete morons and we had an issue with housekeeping. Basically, we need to get our own drinks ourselves...we put in orders and wait 10 minutes and NO DRINKS! We got into our room and noticed the full-length mirror was dirty. Took them 3 days of complaining to get it clean.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Kensi1212
Reviews.Content: After spending the first part of our Honeymoon on Oahu and Hawaii, we hit Maui to relax. We arrived a little early and our room wasn't ready. We were given complimentary drinks at the pool bar. When we returned from our drinks and touring the property our room was ready. We were in building 6 deluxe oceanfront, and that came with very convenient self parking. The room and view were breathtaking. Out our patio door was a view of Molokai and Lanai. We overlooked black rock and saw sea turtles swimming below. Sunsets were gorgeous. The room was clean, roomy, and the bed was very comfortable. Hotel staff was always friendly and full of Aloha. Food was VERY expensive. We skipped the $30 breakfast buffet and waited for lunch at the Lagoon Bar. I had the pork sandwich and fries, my husband had a cheeseburger and fries, both had drinks . . . for a grand total of $63. The pool was crystal clean and the chairs were comfy (although a little too close together). The beach was spacious and my husband enjoyed snorkeling at Black Rock. Don't miss Lahaina. It's not far away and the plethora of shops and restaurants were great. Cheeseburger in Paradise was a favorite. And don't miss the ABC stores.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Veronika78
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon. We had a fantastic week here. The hotel is lovely - fantastic grounds, very clean rooms and decorated nicely. The beach was great with white sands and clear blue water. We especially enjoyed swimming closer to evening when there were more waves, making the experience perfect. The black rock right at the hotel is great for cliff jumping and it gets lit up at night. The hotel's reception is one of the largest and spacious we have seen in a long time and was great for relaxing with a coffee and pastry whilst watching the sea. Breakfast was a little expensive at $25 dollars per person so only did this thrice or so. There was a lot of food to choose from though. We had breakfast next door to our hotel but it did not live up to standards so did not do that again. There's a coffee cart near the reception where you can get cheap coffee and pastries from 6am or so. We had dinner a couple of times at the restaurant and dined in the town the rest of the time. Don't expect to find plentiful seafood in Maui - meat is their main dish! Live music is played at night whilst dining and hula dancing performances every night. There's a luau once a week where you can eat lots of meat and vegetables - all very traditional. It's a must for Hawaii - you will see the slow cooked in the ground pig!! There's another luau in Lahaina once a week too so check that out too. The hotel is very close to the town of Lahaina so exploring the local area can be done by walking. We rented a car for the week so we could experience more of the island. Wasn't too expensive to do. The staff at the hotel were great and we had champagne in our room on the first night. The pools are very nice too and the sunset from the hotel is spectacular. Never enjoyed watching the sunset like this experience. Walk along the beaches at night and enjoy the entertainment in the bars along the beaches as well as Whalers Village Mall. Surfing is very common in Maui and locals are up and surfing as early as 5am. If you enjoy surfing, join in! I splashed out on a pair of Maui Jim sunglasses, which are fantastic for the sun and glare. The view you get is postcard perfect! Hawaii is generally expensive so don't expect any bargains. Explore the island and enjoy the beaches. We would definitely stay at the Sheraton Maui again. It was a great experience for us and we have very fond memories of being there.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great, but Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: Indymom37
Reviews.Content: We've been to Maui several times. In the past (when we were childless), we stayed at the Westin. Now that we have a 3 yr old, I thought we should move over to the Sheraton because its quiet, has big lawns, and a kiddie pool. I travel quite a bit, so I see alot and expect alot. Unlike some of the other travelers, it's not "just enough" to be in paradise. Upon check-in, we found a line of about 10 guests. They were not checking in but rather unsatisfied with the room they'd been given and were all back at the front desk complaining - not a great sign. We were given a top floor room in building 3, but opted for a bottom floor room in building 2 so that our child could run out the door onto the lawn. If you are traveling with children, it's a smart move. They put most of the families in building 2 and 3 and then try to put the honeymooners in #4 & 5. That makes sense. Our room was spacious, clean, and the bathroom has been recently remodeled. No complaints. My biggest problem was with the service. First of all, they only do room service for breakfast and dinner, so you're out of luck on lunch. That's fine, but most people are out by the pool or beach during lunch and don't want to get dressed and go to a restaurant. There was only one server out by our pool and they were very hard to track down. If you're planning to have someone bring you drinks all day - forget it. I placed orders with them, and then they'd never arrive. I'd have to drag myself up to the bar and redo everything. Again, not a show stopper but not great service. I also went to the "new spa" to get a massage". It's not worth the money. Go down to the Westin for spa services. I was promply greated at the front desk and put in the waiting room. Then I was taken directly to the massage room (no locker with snuggly robes and flip flops). My masseuse was great and got right to work, but for $135 I expect to be pampered. The massage room was partially open to the outdoors, so instead of quiet music I heard an endless stream of guests talking about dinner plans, etc. The beach is spectacular, and the evening activities cannot be beat. We love to have an early dinner and then come watch the cliff diving ceremony each night. We did not attend the luau, but did watch portions of it. Everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. Bottom line: If you don't travel a lot and this is your first time to Maui, you'll love it but will be shocked at the food prices. If you do travel a lot, you'll be unimpressed with the service but the location is great for small kids. In comparison with the Westin, they are two very different hotels. The Westin has better service, smaller but nicer rooms, and has a lot more to offer. It's also a lot busier. If you really want to unwind, you can do that at the Sheraton, but don't expect to be pampered. Ultimately, we decided not to let the cons ruin our vacation, and we just embraced the positives because everything (except the food) is better in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, but with a split personality”
Reviews.Author: vegaslover73
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Maui has great potential as a four-star resort at one of the most beautiful locations on Maui. But itâ€™s a hotel with a split personality.... Some members of the staff are very helpful and friendly (the restaurant breakfast & poolside servers were particularly professional and always fun to be around). On the other hand, front desk staff is consistently snippy â€“ not much of the â€œAloha spiritâ€� to be found there, unfortunately. The hotel benefits from a spectacular location at Black Rock. The beach here is pristine â€“ one of the best beaches Iâ€™ve ever experienced on trips to five different Hawaiian Islands. The pool is also nice. Yes, it is smaller than the pools at the Westin and Hyatt, but the backdrop of Black Rock makes it a very relaxing, sheltered spot. I would recommend that management at this resort articulate a clear vision that ALL of the staff can rally around. The Sheraton Maui ought to be a four-star resort with consistently friendly and professional service to match, but this is not the case. The good news is that it can be fixed. Hereâ€™s one suggestion: Have the front desk staff shadow the breakfast or poolside servers for a couple of hours â€“ they would learn a lot about customer service and how to make the guest feel welcome. As for the room itself, we found our â€œgardenâ€� view room on the first floor of building 2 to be quite nice (perhaps recently remodeled?).
