VERY comfortable bed, great flat-screen TV, etcâ€¦ all of the amenities one would expect at a four-star hotel. Our room (#2109) was ground level right on the lawn. One step out the sliding-glass door and we had a sweeping view of the beautiful grounds and ocean beyond. This is our second Priceline stay at this resort and it was a great value. That having been said, the nearby Westin and Hyatt seem to have a bit more of a resort atmosphere and it may be time for management to rethink how well theyâ€™re competing with their neighbors. All in all, our stay was very enjoyable and weâ€™d be back in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid place for a wedding”
Reviews.Author: rlpolobear9
Reviews.Content: My brother in-law was married here in Sept '08 right out on the first floor of the hotel out back over looking the ocean. It was a really nice ceremony set up by the hotel they let two doves go at the end and people where out on the balconies crying and taking photos (strange people to take shots of someone they don't knows wedding) The hotel is awesome the views stunning great swimming, snorkeling and easy access to all activities on the island. We stayed for another week at the Westin Resort & Villas which was equally as nice After a loooong 13 hr flight from NJ being driving up to this place was like waking up in heaven. You'll need a car while here but to go out at night it's nice to have the option of the free shuttle to Lahaina as the resort is a little more towards Kanapalli. It's also a really confusing hotel to navigate for all its beauty to get the ocean side you had to do up to x floor walk across up again and then down which was amusing after drinks all day. The onsite food is really expensive but pretty good I'd recommend saving the money and heading into town and going to McD's at least once to get spam and egss for breakfast lol.

Reviews.Title: “Maui is heavenly....”
Reviews.Author: TravelinEvertonian
Reviews.Content: We spent a tow days here after flying in from my sisters in Oahu. (I work for an airline so I'm at the mercy of standby and it was easier to get out of Maui). We checked in very early (1000) and I was pleasantly surprised they let us in so early. We had a garden view room in building 3 which was nice. Close to the lobby, beach, parking, etc. I could definitly see some issues if you were in another building. The Sheraton is spread way out over 5 buildings. We spent most of the day at the beach and enjoying the fantastic snorkeling. Black Rock is incredible. Skip the tours and just enjoy this spot. If you go just around the corner of Black Rock you will see some incredible sights and you can be back in your room within five mintues. We spent $20 for an umbrella rental which was a life-saver cause it's very hot and sunny. For lunch I drove out to the Lahaina Market which is just of HWY 30, the main drag from Lahaina to the airport. They had great fresh food and the prices were very, very reasonable. The hotel food, drink is a rip-off, way too pricey for my liking. We did stop at the K-mart by the airport for water, beer, snacks which will save you quite a lot also. The K-mart also has some very reasonably-priced souveneirs that are about half what you will pay in Lahaina or the hotels and it's the same stuff. At night we did the luau at the Royal Lahaina resort which is an easy walk from the Sheraton. It was about $130 for the four of us (kids free) which was ok except the food was pretty plain. We all enjoyed the dancers and fire performers so all in all, a good day out. The next day we just hung out at the beach and relaxed. I would recommend the hotel but they do charge you for just about everything. You get a $26 resort charge which I'm not sure what that covers. They don't have any computers in the lobby for internet usage although they have wifi in the lobby. (I don't like to carry a laptop). They charge $4 for a cup of Lion coffee which was good but nothing to shout about. On the balance though just enjoying the beach and it's FANTASTIC snorkeling makes the price seem worth it. The staff was very helpful and very kind and friendly. Hope this helps.....

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice for the best spot in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: alau925chicago
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Sheraton...for it's great location, concierge and staff, and simple yet plesant accommodations. The location and grounds alone make the Shearton a great choice. If you want an all around great choice, book the Sheraton, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: Donnal1230
Reviews.Content: Ka'anapali is a bit dated as we drove up (I think the big money has now gone north to Kapaula), but the grounds are breathtaking, bed and towels are comfy!! Excellent snorkeling within walking distance at the historic Black Rock - some of the best I've seen! They just need more signage as we had a hard time finding the right building and elevators to get to the room (couldn't read Hawaiian)! I would definitely return. Service was nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: Canuckster
Reviews.Content: The property of the hotel was very nice. The beach, pools, snorkelling were terrific. We liked the location of the hotel on Kanapoli beach and the proximity to the Whalers Village and Lahaina town. The room was fine, nothing spectacular but no issues. We were in building 4. The breakfast buffet was very good. We only ate once at the beach bar for dinner which was very expensive and unimpressive. The caesar salad dressing came in a package. The kobe beef burger came with a bag of Maui potato chips. Not cheap either, just appeared that way! We ate out at the other fine restaurants in Maui as the prices at the Sheration were very expensive and we felt the quality of the food was better elsewhere. They did upgrade us to a better room due to low occupancy and provide a bottle of champagne for out anniversary which were both much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: a2diaz
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Sheraton Maui and we were very pleased with our experience. The hotel is in a perfect location to shops and to access of Black Rock; we were able to snorkel w/ the turtles and still be steps away from the pool. I was a bit disappointed with our room. We reserved an Ocean Front room but it was more like ocean view. We were in Building 2 which was pretty far from the ocean and the pool. The rooms were nicely updated but the tubs were stained. Also, I think the $25 resort fee per night is outrageous along w/ the fee to rent chairs at the beach. The food at the Sundowner Bar looks more appealing than what it taste. Luckily we only ate there one day and ventured outside of the hotel for the remainder of our stay. Our package came with the Breakfast Buffet which was pretty good. I wouldn't pay regular price for it, but its nice to have it included in the package. Since our flight left late at night we were able to extend our stay 5 hours with a $100 fee. This was worth it since we had extra time to lay out by the pool and enjoy the ocean. Overall we were very pleased with the hotel. We didn't find too many problems and would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort but make sure you get what you've paid for”
Reviews.Author: soccermomonvacation
Reviews.Content: Checked in early for 2 nights with my family of 4 and one other family. Made reservations for Building 4 (Nalu) due to it's close proximity to the beach. My husband has knee problems and researched which building had the best access. My friends got called about 2:15 saying their room was ready, even though they checked in after us. At 3:15 we went up to the front desk to inquire about our room. She told us she was putting us in building 3. I said that was unacceptable since I paid for building 4. On Expedia it was almost $800 for my family for 2 nights. she wouldn't put us in building 4. She said our friends had been given a complimentary upgrade to building 5. I told her I just wanted what I paid for. After I became visibly upset she said she would give us a complimentary upgrade too. We got to our room and it was a view of the parking lots in back and the beach in the distance. This ruined one day of our trip for me. I'm kicking myself for not insisting we be moved. The room was pretty standard with 2 double beds. Others have mentioned but we didn't know about not having your room cleaned and getting money back. Our friends knew about it because there was something in their room. The grounds of the resort are very nice and the snorkling at Black Rock is great with lots of turtles. It is very crowded at this beach. We enjoyed drinks and appetizers at the Sundowner bar. Towards sunset the torch lighter comes through here and lights the tiki torches then jumps from Black Rock. During the torch lighting they have live music with a hula dancer. That was very nice. Used the fitness center twice. It was very close to our room. It's very small with only 3 treadmills and a couple bikes and a few weight machines. Food is expensive but we expected that. Appetizers were very good but $18 a plate. Happy Hour is from 4:00 to 6:00 with $5 drink specials. We checked out the buffet breakfast one day and it was $26 per person for nothing special. The lady in the parking attendant booth gave us coupons for CJ's Diner which is close by in the Fairway Shops and it was a great breakfast. About $30 for 4.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to relax”
Reviews.Author: localbeans
Reviews.Content: We were here on our honeymoon and the experience was wonderful. The partial ocean view room was beautiful and allowed us to see quite a bit of the view without the extra price for an upgrade. Though if you are sensitive to noise make sure you are located at least three rooms from the elevator - the dinging of the bell is pronounced. Additionally if walking is difficult for you talk with the desk to make sure you are situated close to the part of the hotel you will use most - it is a big hotel. The concierge staff was the most friendly, educated and welcoming that I have EVER encountered. We stayed at the Sheraton Kauai right after this and did not experience even close to the same level of service we did here. The staff was more than happy to make or cancel reservations and even stayed beyond closing time one day to help us out. The poolside staff were friendly and helpful. The only staff we thought were not top notch were the front desk staff. They barely spoke to us - which was odd - but the rest of the staff was amazing. Try to get breakfast included in the room - it is fairly expensive otherwise. The omelet stand was nice and the whole hotel was actually easy (comparatively) for vegetarian food. The pool is great. It is close to the black rock which is good for snorkeling. The proximity allows you to snorkel at will and then come back to the pool area for fresh water and to rinse off. There were also free yoga classes (among other types). I'm a yoga teacher and I thought the teacher they have at the hotel was very good. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Staff, Location, and Price!”
Reviews.Author: akkhaircuts
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a two week honeymoon in Hawaii. We spent the first week of our trip on the island of Maui. We stayed at the Maui Sheraton based on a recommendation from a friend. We were not disappointed in the least! We felt that we got an amazing deal. Upon our arrival, we were upgraded from a standard ocean view room to a deluxe ocean view. There was a bottle of Champagne chilling in the fridge with a note of congratulations from the manager. The room that we reserved included a breakfast each morning while we were there. I would definitely recommend this. Their breakfast buffet is loaded with fresh fruit as well as many hot and cold breakfast items. It also included coffee, milk, and choice of several juices. The hotel also has a promotion going called Go Green. If you decline to have maid service for your room, the hotel will credit you $40 toward their restaurants or their affiliated restaurants if you are willing to eat between 5:30 and 6:00 p.m. otherwise the credit is $25. The hotel grounds were immaculately clean and well kept. The pool is huge and is a combination of a large swimming pool with a winding river around the poolside restaurant and connecting to another smaller pool. The beach is located right behind the pool area and has amazing snorkeling. We saw numerous sea turtles, colorful reef fish, and amazing corals right off the beach. Don't miss swimming out around the Black Rock into the lagoon. The snorkeling there is among the best I have ever experienced. All the way around, this hotel is fabulous. The staff couldn't do enough to make sure all of our needs were met. Our room was very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. We were very sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place, I think about it every day”
Reviews.Author: tinanj120
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing! It is a huge resort. We stayed in a double oceanfront room. We had a balcony with a table and chair great view of the beach and the ocean. The room had a fridge and a microwave and Kona coffee. The bath room was very nice and the give you Bliss Spa Products in your room. The pools were nice, we were there in March and we did not find them cold at all (as some reviews stated). They serve chilled pineapple while you are sitting by the pool. The beach is gorgeous and the best part is the snorkeling there is a reef and TONS of fish and turtles. There is a shopping village that you can walk to, there is a small ABC store that has everything you can think of food, alcohol, souvenirs. There is a trolley that will bring you to all the local stops or you can just ride around and the driver kinda gives you a tour. There is a car rental agency right in the hotel (we rented a mustang to drive around in) and a gift shop that we got some very nice things in. The food was good. We ordered room service a few times, and there is a bar by the pool that serves you drinks in hollowed out pineapple. Maui is wonderful, how could you not have a good time?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing introduction to Maui”
Reviews.Author: cantakavita
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Sheraton Maui last year and felt compelled to write a review. We booked the hotel through the Starwood Preferred Guest website (it is free to be a member) and were pleasantly surprised to receive an upgrade upon arrival (we had booked a Garden room and were upgraded to an Oceanfront Deluxe Suite)! We had a great stay, enjoyed the food at the restaurants, and the incredible location at Black Rock. We didn't realize beforehand, but Black Rock is one of the premier scuba/snorkeling destinations on the island, and the beach right in front of the Sheraton is among the best on the island. Also, in your price is included a bunch of activities, and I enjoyed taking advantage of some of those (e.g., yoga, pilates, ukelele lesson). The rooms were spacious and the beds very comfortable. The staff was overall quite helpful (e.g., we stayed for 5 nights at the beginning of the stay, and I had left some clothes in the room and they held it for me and were helpful in making sure I got them back when we came back for one night at the end of the stay). The oceanfront room we had during our 5-night stay was impeccable, but then we stayed at the Sheraton at the end of our 2 week trip in Hawaii for 1 night, and the room we were in (Another oceanfront room, but this time in Building 6) seemed like it was a bit older and parts hadn't been cleaned for some time (e.g., saw some cobwebs in the corner of the ceiling). I guess we were so pleased by our stay up until then that this didn't bother us too much. The location in West Maui is also great -- a great spot to explore the island from. West Maui is a lot lest touristy than South Maui and there is a lot to see and do (we used the Maui Revealed guide which had lots of insider info) - e.g., natural lava pools, hikes, some blowhorns... Overall, don't hesitate about staying at the Sheraton Maui. Try to stay in building 4 if possible - it has the best views.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: csclayton1966
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui from 6/13-23 and had a wonderful time. By far the grounds were far superior to those hotels nearby. Our room was located in blg. 4 and we had a double balcony that overlooked the pool and ocean.=, which was gorgeous. It's worthwhile to tell ask them for an upgrade if you're celebrating a special event or occassion as we were celebrating our 10th anniversary - they will work to accommodate your request. The service was quite good, staff very firendly, rooms clean but a little on the small side. We did encounter a couple of minor problems (room keyes didn't work on arrival and pay per view did not work for 3 days) the hotel offered us free drinks and a discount coupon for food for our inconvienence. Self parking is easy and free, they do offer valet for $5 per day. Food is expensive on site but there were plenty of local restuarants offering good food and lower prices. There's a local cafe nearby called CJ's that has the best breakfasts and burgers you've ever had. Make sure to do a few things while there: 1st, get a car as there's lots to see, bike down Haleakala, take the rd to Hana tour, see warren and annabele's comedy/magic show, and the old lahaina luau. [--]

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Disappointed - No Aloha Spirit”
Reviews.Author: sdislandgirl67
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 7 nights stay at the Sheraton. We are frequent travellers to Hawaii going to different islands and this is our 3rd visit to Maui. We have stayed at the Hyatt, Marriott Ocean Club, and the Kannapali Beach Club and thought we would give Sheraton a try because of Black Rock snorkelling. Boy, are we so diasppointed! This is the 1st ever Hawaii vacation where we experienced absolute no Aloha spirit. Upon arrival, we were being moved back and forth 3 times between the bell hop and the front desk just to check in. The front desk told us we will be welcomed by the bell hop with leis but there was none. We were really surprised that there was no music in the lobby, no flower center pieces like the other hotels we have stayed before, no friendly smiles, and staff were not at all interested to help. It is like we were left to find our own way to our room with absolute zero service. It was such a let down! The room we were given had an air con vent issue which the front desk could not resolved but they were decent enough to assign us to another room. The room was drape and old, definitedly needs updating and better decor. The swimming pool had algae growing on the sides of the black rocks and there was a musky smell. This is also the first time where we noticed that the garden ponds had no fishes throughout except for some tadpoles and 4 small koi fishes. It was very disappointing as we are so used to seeing beautiful botanicals and koi fishes swimming everywhere in the ponds. Would definitedly not come back even if it is free. This is a 4 star hotel but feels like a 1.5 star. I would highly recommend staying at the Hyatt, Marriott or Westin which is also on the same stretch of Kannapali beach.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely grounds but some Noise issues”
Reviews.Author: trvldoc
Reviews.Content: There are over 700 reviews of this place on TA so I will just make a few unique comments: 1. There is a loud droning noise (presumably the A/C) eminating from building 1 at all hours of the day and night. If you are noise sensitive or would rather hear the birds and waves rather than the sound of an engine, then request a room not facing building 1. esp. avoid building 2. 2. There is a luau a few times a week on the front lawn. It is enjoyable the first few times. After that, it becomes a pain. Next time I would look for a quieter part of the hotel. 3. MOVIE NIGHT. All I can say is UGH! Imagine being in a tropical paradise and just as the sun is setting loud music begins to blare, and then the whole place is transformed into a drive-in movie theatre. The movie (not that that mattered) was Charlie's Angels. Ick! There were all of 8 people watching the movie (I counted) and for that, scores of people endured the intrusion that lasted 4 hours! 4. They charge $70 per night for a rollaway bed!!!! OMG. We were there for 10 days. For that price I could have bought a bed. What a rip. So if you have 3 kids you are totally out of luck! 5. There are many non-guests at the pool. It is plainly obvious. They show up with their bath towels from home and their picnics from Safeway. Two groups were seated next to us under the umbrellas last week taking up a totally prime spot by the kids pool. An employee came over to speak to them at one point. They admitted to being non-guests. The employee told them they were not allowed to swim but no one made them leave. As far as I could tell, they (and their 6 kids) swam all day. Not a big deal but it makes the place feel more crowded and hey, I would have liked the umbrella and I was a paying guest. 6. The tennis courts and the tennis staff were awesome. An absolute wow. Every day we had these amazing facilities all to ourselves. The pros were very accommodating and super friendly. If for no other reason, we would return just for the tennis. 7. The breakfast buffet is good if you get the free coupons with your room as part of the package. Otherwise, it is hardly worth $26. Avoid the evening buffet. The quality is just not there. 8. Wifi is very patchy Lastly, the grounds are lovely and the beach is the best in the area. The surf was high while we were there so the snorkeling was not what it could have been. I went out every day and found the fish count and visibility a little disappointing compared to years past. Better snorkeling up in Honolua is you are serious about it. And if you have teens, they will probably like the pool at the Hyatt better. The Sheraton pool is pretty sleepy. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Just average overall”
Reviews.Author: TJbuffalo
Reviews.Content: Nice grounds and pool. Older hotel that has been renovated. Good cleaning staff. Some restaurant staff were helpful. Door latch was broken. Dresser was old and showed its age with many dings. Had a disagreement with management - I think they missed the class in ethics and common sense. Dispite our disagreement with management we still enjoyed our 25th anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheGil
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife, and our three year old son just returned from a six night stay at the Sheraton. The hotel is visually stunning, with beatiful grounds and a great beach. We were greeted promptly by the bell staff and were quickly put in our room. We stayed on the fifth floor of building three and had a great view of the beach and pool area. The room was average and had a small bathroom. The bed was comfy, but the pillows were TERRIBLE! I scrunched two together and still barely had any support. Breakfast was included in our package and we ate daily at the buffett. We enjoyed breakfast there and found the food to be good and the service was nice as well. Since I didn't pay for it directly, I can't comment on the value. We all LOVED the pool area and did alot of swimming. With a three year old, we hung out exclusively at the kiddie pool side, but we were always able to find a spot to sit. The beach area was great, with excellent sand, but the waves were quite rough during our stay. We only played at the beach for maybe two hours the whole time. We did attend the luau at the Sheraton and we all enjoyed it. I have read negative reviews about the Sheraton Luau, with the negatives primarily centered around value. Yes, it isn't cheap (nothing there is), but I found the food to be good. I had previously been to a luau on Oahu and found the Sheraton Luau far superior. We booked some off site excursions with Monica at the concierge desk and I would recommend her. Our big trip was over to Pearl Harbor. If you make it all the way to Hawaii, you must go to the Arizona Memorial and the battleship Missouri. The Arizona Memorial doesn't take long, but is a touching place. My three year old LOVED the Missouri and climbed all over the ship. We visited the Whalers Village daily. It is a nice area to go and we ate down there several times. My favorite sit down place was Leilanis. I found the price to be equal to the product and would recommend it. My least favorite was the Hula Grill. Our meal was mediocre and it was quite expensive. We also ate at the food court several times (Nic's pizza is good). The hotel also has a "free" shuttle that goes to Lahaina. We took it one day and it was convenient for us, but I would just rent a car. We got one from Enterprise at the Sheraton and had it for three days and really enjoyed it. I found driving on Maui to be very easy. We drove to the Ocean Center and also drove to Hana. Ocean Center is an easy drive. Hana is a touch harder! Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton and would recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton was ok.”
Reviews.Author: newlywed611
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Maui Sheraton Kaanapali in June of 2008 for our honeymoon. We had a wonderful time in Maui and at the resort. The grounds of the resort are absolutely beautiful! Our room had a wonderful view of the grounds and the ocean. The downside was that there were little ants all over the armoire where the tv sits, and the a/c did not seem to be working very well as the room just did not seem to cool down to comfort level. Also, there were stains on the sheets on our first night and we had to get housekeeping to come to our room in the evening to change out our sheets. They also came to vaccum the ants, but they were with us the entire trip as they never totally went away. The a/c never did fully cool down our room, and although we had a fabulous time in Maui and enjoyed every minute there, we were disappointed in the lack of quality of the actual room. For as much as we paid a night, we expected a more luxurious and comfortable room. We would probably stay at the Westin which is a sister property the next time we are there. You also have dining privileges at both hotel properties, so you can check both properties out. The beach was amazing and the snorkeling at black rock was phenomenal. We saw several honu (sea turtles) while we were there. The best thing to do is to rent a cabana on the beach for the day ($40 at the time) and just lounge on the beach and enjoy the ocean. Afterall, you are in Hawaii, you want to get as much sun and beach as possible. Also, the luau that the hotel throws once a week was great. We thought it was better than the luaus that we had been to in Honolulu.

Reviews.Title: “Proceed with caution”
Reviews.Author: Chris2518
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews of this and other hotels in Maui before making my selection. Based on the great reviews of the beach, we decided to go with the Sheraton. As reported the beach is lovely and is certainly a great site for snorkeling. The hotel however was a big disappointment. We booked a deluxe oceanfront king for $500 per night for the view. As reported by others, the view is fantastic. The room, however, was a major disappointment. The bathroom is dated, the glass tops on the furniture were chipped, lamps had burned out bulbs and are currently painted brown but the chips in the paint reveal were once green. All in all pretty shabby. The worst thing was the smell. It appeared that a previous guest had left food to spoil or had vomited in the closet. Obviously I couldn't put my clothes in there but the smell also permeated the room. We complained and housekeeping was sent to spray a deodorizer which served only to temporarily mask the smell. On day 2 our air conditioner quit working and it took some time for the repairman to show up. He advised us that there would be an unpleasant odor from the burned rubber hose when the unit began to function again. Sara in guest services agreed to send an ionizer to the room to hep with that smell. She also offered to removed the $25 per day resort fee from our bill. Later that night while the repairman was still working, he advised us that the broken hose had leaked water all over the carpet on that side of the room and that it would likely mildew and smell for several days. He advised us to request a room change. Sara in guest services agreed to move us but indicated that we would have to wait for a room to be cleaned. At 9:00 that night we were moved to our new room. Sara offered to let us have a late check out on our day of departure to compensate us for the inconvenience. We were happy about this as our flight did not depart until 9:00 p.m. The rest of our stay was fine. The second room was clean and odor free. However, upon checkout, we discovered that the $25 per day resort charge had NOT been removed from our bill. I called guest services and spoke to Brandy who indicated that we could have EITHER the credit for the resort fee or the late check out. Since it was 4:00 pm and we had already used the late checkout, we could not have the credit for the resort fee. I explained the conversations I had with Sara reagrding the various problems with our first room and that the resort fee credit was offered for the original complaint and that the late checkout was later offered for the broken air conditioner/impending mildew problem/room change. Brandy refused to honor this agreement so I had to spend 45 minutes at the front desk explaining all of this to the assistant manager, Brandon, who ultimately did honor the agreement. All in all, the Sheraton does not seem concerned with providing pleasant or even functioning accomodation nor do they feel compelled to honor the compensations offered by guest services (unless you are willing to insist). I recommend that you stay at the Westin or another property in the area. Avoid the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: werealreadythere
Reviews.Content: Here is why the Sheraton Maui was the perfect place for us: THE ROOM - We stayed on the 4th floor of Building 6. I cannot imagine there is a room in Maui with a better view and closer to the sounds and sights of the ocean. Vast ocean view and nightly sunsets in front of you, a view of Black Rock just barely to the left and another rock formation directly belowâ€¦so you get the wonderful sound of waves gently crashing. And water so clear that we could see yellow fish and turtles. Clearly these rooms must be better than those in the other buildings (based on â€œcomplainyâ€� reviews) â€“ it was not outdated, nicely appointed, was spotlessly clean and had great housekeeping services. If you want a Ritz Carlton 5-star room â€“ stay there, but then youâ€™ll be about Â¼ mile from the ocean. Or good luck at any of the other 5 stars upgrading to a room with this view/proximity to the ocean/beach. At night, the torches on Black Rock stay lit until about 10 and provide a beautiful, peaceful sight from your lanai. You cannot convince me that there is a better location with nice room on the island. If you complain about the walk to the rest of the resort, you clearly have done no research about where you are going. We found the walk to the rest of the resort to be short, easy and probably the light walk we needed a couple of times a day to walk off some (not many) calories. Quiet, peaceful, lovely.â€¦.bliss. THE BEACH â€“ When you are staying at the only resort where you can walk down from your room, sit on a beautiful sand beach and either play in some waves or snorkel around a black rock and see tons of fish and turtles everyday, is there anyplace better?? People from other resorts walk quite a way to come to this beach. It deserves the great reputation. Really terrific snorkeling. THE POOL â€“ Ummm, who cares when you have that gorgeous beach??? If you want a magnificent pool go to Vegas for crying out loud! Seriously, there is a separate pool for kiddos so the main pool was pretty quiet and laid back. It was lovelyâ€¦not grandâ€¦but lovely. The Westin pool is definitely better in looks, but, again, if you want a really good pool, head to the Bellagio. Plus, we did not see nearly the amount of children, or crowds for that matter, at the Sheraton as we did at the Westin main pool. DINING â€“ While we were there the Lagoon Bar was undergoing renovations so only the Sundowner was available during the day. You must go here and ask for Claudia. She had what we like to call the â€œyes faceâ€�â€¦â€¦a genuinely delightful, cheerful, cordial person who wanted nothing more than to make your stay perfect and accommodate youâ€¦.a quality rarely seen anymore within the service industry. The veggie wraps and grilled veggie plate were both outstanding for a lighter, healthy lunch. Had one of those two everyday for lunch so canâ€™t speak to the other more fattening choices (remember, youâ€™re in a bathing suit!). We ate at Black Rock Steakhouse our first night for convenience sakeâ€¦.it was okay but nothing to write home about. . Skip it and take the short walk to Whalers Village and eat a Hula Grill or Leilaniâ€™s (see separate Trip Advisor reviews). I guess it all depends on what you are looking for. Our priorities were: a 4-star or above room with not just a full ocean view but one right on the ocean (as close as we could get); a resort with a great beach for sun tanning, swimming and snorkeling; a resort within walking distance of activities, dining and shopping; beautiful grounds; friendly, gracious resort staff. So, we got it all here. I wouldnâ€™t even think of staying anywhere else when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “In one word... aaaaamaaaazzzzing!”
Reviews.Author: FijiBornCAGrown
Reviews.Content: I can't even begin to fathom how anyone could give the Sheraton Maui a bad review. This resort was amazing... My husband and I got married Memorial Day Weekend in California (May 23rd weekend) and directly left for our honeymoon at the Sheraton Maui. We were there from May 27, 2009 until June 2, 2009. We booked a great package deal through Expedia and were fortunate to get such a great resort and round trip airfare for the price we paid. From the moment we arrived in Maui (our first trip), we knew we were in paradise. We used Speedi Shuttle to get to our resort from the airport. I recommend this shuttle service as they are affordable and quick. We swiftly arrived at the Sheraton Maui after a gorgeous drive and stopped at the lower level lobby of the resort. There we were greeted by a young man in a golf cart. We told him we were checking in. He put all of our luggage into his golf cart and called someone at the front desk from his walkey talkey. They told him we were all checked in and he could take us straight to our room. WOW! What service. We didn't even have to step foot into the lobby, he took us right from the road to our room. There was when we got our second surprise. Expedia had told Sheraton Maui that we were on our honeymoon and they upgraded us from an Ocean View Room to an Ocean Front Suite (Room 6313). WOW! This room is immaculate. The room overlooks the beautiful ocean and with a great view of the infamous "Black Rock." Our beautiful balcony provided us with immaculate views of the ocean, and two of the other islands (Molokai and Lanai) as well as daily views of turtles and dolphins swimming by. In short, the room was amazing and the service was beyond our expectations. Our stay only got better. The service at Sheraton Maui is impeccable! We were treated amazingly throughout our stay. A knock on the door and someone was there with a complimentary bottle of champagne to welcome us to the Sheraton. This resort is all in all, the ONLY place I would ever stay in Kaanapali. We were able to take a stroll on the beach and check out the other hotels from the sand banks, but never felt the need to go in and look around... we were way too happy with the Sheraton to even care about any of the other properties. Plus, to be honest, I'm sure the other properties are nice in their own way, but there's NO way they can compare to the exterior of the Sheraton. All of the other hotels on the strip look like high rise hotels... the Sheraton does not... it looks like a RESORT and you constantly feel like you are in paradise. The pools are gorgeous as well as the entire ground. One complaint is that that you kind of have to go on a journey to get to the beach from our suite as we were on the top of the cliff. But a five minute walk through 2 different sets of elevators was well worth the final product... and it gave us the opportunity to walk off our consumption of way too many goodies. The only other complaint I have is that the hotel is ridiculously pricey, but what do you expect from a five star resort? We avoided eating and drinking much at this hotel or any other hotel. In fact, we brought a lot of our own alcohol from home and visited a nearby Safeway in Lahaina town for lunch foods. We were able to pick up sandwich meats and breakfast foods. Often we hung out at the beach in front of Black Rock ALL day, so it was nice to have a picnic basket packed with goodies and just hang out on the beach. We did this mostly everyday so it saved on our cost of food. We treated ourself to dinner each night in Lahaina town. My husband and I are into eating local food, so we stayed away from chains like Bubba Gump. Mixed Plate was delish, so was the pizza at Gabby's... but I seriously loved Cheeseburgers in Paradise. Their food was delish and everything was super affordable, not to mention their view was the best out of all the restaurants in Lahaina town! Make sure if you stay at the Sheraton you go to the Old Lahaina Luau in Lahaina town. It is well worth the $100 a person. And from what we saw of the Sheraton's Luau, it is far more "authentic" and traditional. I highly recommend it. The food is to die for and its all you can eat and drink, plus great live entertainment. One more tid bit of advice... rent a car. We thought 'we won't need a car much' and we were wrong. We went to Lahaina town each night for dinner. A round trip taxi ride can run you $30... but so can a rental of a car for the entire day. So you are far better off getting your money's worth if you rent a car for $30-40 a day rather than paying that much for ONE roundtrip taxi ride. Rent a car, believe me, you'll thank me. And make sure to take the road to Hana... I can talk about the Sheraton Maui for days, but I won't. I'll end with this... make sure you swim with turtles (it is a memorable experience), snorkel, and parasail... all things we did and enjoyed. If you have any questions, feel free to message me. Whatever you do, make sure you stay at the Sheraton in Maui.... you will not regret it! We will DEFINITELY return to the Sheraton Maui, hopefully for our one year anniversary! PS: Photos coming soon!

Reviews.Title: “Really THE Best Hotel in Lahaina...loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: LeiaRx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Maui for business, then extended my trip into a vacation. I do meeting planning, and the Sheraton was an excellent locaton for business meetings. Wonderful concierge, wonderful planning team and wonderful employees. Usually we get some complaints, but none during our meeting. Only praise!! The resort is large enough, that you can definitely hide at one of the pools. A journey to the beach is just as easy. I did wonder to other hotels further done the beach, and they seemed to have more people going through them. This is a very private resort, as it is built into the cliffs and at the end of the row of hotels. Every evening they do a ritual ceremony at sunset, and a man jumps from the cliffs into the sea. Some evenings there are activities and fun things to do at the resort. The rooms were immaculate, and loved having a terrace in the morning to sit on, watch the sun rise, reading the paper and drinking coffee....but a little less of reading the paper because of the gorgeous views. I saw dolphins and turtles swim by at least 5 times. It was easy to go into Lahaina and enjoy the shops. The staff was wonderful....suggested places to go and things to do in town. I was able to book a snorkling trip to Kaui through the hotel....concierge was wonderful. Food at the hotel is pricier then in town, but that is true at any hotel you stay at. The food is delicious, but definitely go in town to enjoy a more social dining experience. Hawaii is never a cheap trip, but reading some of the reviews some seem to expect it to be....those who are pinching their pennies, can go to fast food restaurants just 3-4 hotels away. Also there is a grocery store closer to in town...easy cab ride there. Overall, I do use this hotel to benchmark other hotels in other locations. Really the BEST hotel along the beach. I spent a total of 18 days at this resort, and had a lot of time to look at the other hotels. If you are interested in a private, scenic resort with the option to easily go into town....this is truly the best one......

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better...”
Reviews.Author: christiewi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 days/4 nights at the Sheraton Maui at the beginning of February. We spent countless hours researching the options in the area, and had narrowed it down to the Sheraton, Hyatt, Westin, or Marriott Wailea. We finally decided on an oceanview room here (got an amazing 24 hour deal online) and truly could not have been more satisfied. The room was perfect...comfortable bed and tasteful decor; the property immaculate (stunning grounds, largest and nicest sandy beach on this strip of Maui, FOR SURE); the activities ample; the staff friendly and knowledable. Somehow we even got lucky enough to get a room with a double balcony as big as our entire room! The location is incredible: short drive or shuttle ride into Lahaina (where we did most of our dining/activities), quick and easy walk to Whalerâ€™s Village with wonderful shops and restaurants (LOVED Aloha Grill), and the snorkling at Black Rock is great. Plus, being at the end of the strip, it is much less crowded than other hotels and beaches in this area. We walked the beach path many times during our trip, researching the other hotels we had been decided between to see if we made the right choice, and we are 110% confident that we did! The Hyatt and Westin were RIDICULOUSLY crowded, with no sandy beach to lay out on, and lawn chairs crammed on the grassy lawns for guests to sunbathe. And though Wailea is a nice area, it is a bit of a drive from Lahaina, and much better suited for those who really donâ€™t plan on leaving the hotel area at all. I will say that we didnâ€™t eat at the hotel once: the food is SO overpriced! We often went to Whalerâ€™s Village or Lahaina...and even ate at the Westin twice, which was a bit less expensive. That is our only complaint though...and it doesnâ€™t even come close to changing our minds about this place. We will stay here everytime we return to Maui. Itâ€™s absolute PARADISE.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Mctcfitz
Reviews.Content: At this point we have stayed at many of the resorts on Maui. This trip was our first stay at the Sheraton and we were a little nervous about it. On paper it doesn't look all that great. The hotel is an enigma is some ways. First off the hotel itself is not that nice. It is a standard 3-3.5 star hotel. The rooms are clean but not fancy. The restaurants at best are just ok. So, why the 5 star rating. Quite frankly this hotel is located on the best location on Maui - either Kaanapali, Kapalua, or Wailea. We stayed in Building 6 and the view from our room was absolutetly stunning - we had whales (even in the off season), turltes, Molokai, Lanai, and even Oahu at night. We could see up the coast as well. The walk to the beach from Building 6 is NOT a big deal. You walk across a bridge, take an elevator up and walk thorugh another building that has absolutely stunning views back towards Kaanapali and Lahaina and then down an elevator. Not a problem at all and we had 4 kids - 8,7,4,2. Having your own parking right in front of the building is great. The layout of the hotel is nice but simple. Lots of open area with grass surronding the pool. I really didn't think my kids would like the pool area that much as there are no slides but they loved it (Not as much as the Grand Wailea but really liked it). I think because of all the winding narrow river like channels they really enjoyed it. We rented a cabana every day and that was great. Excellent service, not Four Seasons level but very friendly. Please note that they do NOT allow you to walk down and use the Westin waterslides and pools anymore. This used to be a perc but is no longer available. Turned out not to be a big deal but the Westin does have the fantastic pool area (We've stayed there 3 times before).. The beach in front of the Sheraton is fantastic. My kids could swim in the sandy area or just move over a little and get out into the snorkle area. Even our 4 year old who couldn't swim could do that. They saw sea turtles every day, which was the highlight of thier trip. We bught a boogie board with a clear glass lens in it for the kids to paddle out and see the fish and it worked great. It wasn't one of the ones they rent with the big plast bubble in it, which don't work. We had to go to the Maui Dive Shop to rent or buy one and it is very worth it. The restuarants were only adequate so we did the quick walk to Whaler's Village most of the time. So, in summary, a complete average hotel on an absolutely stunning piece of property. Absolutely the best location on Maui. Why they didn't upgrade and put a St Regis , W, or upscale Westin on this property is a bit mind numbing becuase if they did it would be one of the nicest tropical hotels in the US. The Sheraton, though is certainly nice enough for us to return and we give it high marks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Start To a Great Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Paradisegirl01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first part of our honeymoon last month. and it was perfect. we had booked a partial oceanview and were upgraded. Our room had pool views, mountain views AND oceanviews. IT WAS GREAT!!!!. We were in Building 4 and i think that was a perfect location, close to pool, lobby, beach, everything. Everyone was soooo nice. The everyone called us by name and the valet was on the ball. The resort fee is stupid and it doesnt even cover the valet :( Food is REALLLLYY expensive and not worth it go to whalers village (5 min walk) to eat. We also drove to front street and they have a lot to do and eat also. There really is soooo much more for a wonderful stay/hotel i could go on for ever. Any questions just ask.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located resort with fantastic perks, but all at a price...”
Reviews.Author: Darlox
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Maui is a huge and beautifully sculpted resort in one of the best locations on the West Maui coast. They offer just about anything a vacationing couple or family could want, but it occasionally comes at a rather stiff price. This was our third trip to Maui, and we liked this property the best of any major hotel where we've stayed previously, though the hospitality maybe wasn't quite as personal. Read on for details... LOCATION: The Sheraton Maui is about 10 minutes north of downtown Lahaina, just off of Route 11 at the end of the Ka'anapali Parkway. Since Route 11 is only 1 lane in each direction heading around the southern coast of West Maui, travel time to/from the main airport in Kahului will vary based on when you go. At best, maybe 40 minutes, and at worst 60 minutes each way. The hotel is about 25 minutes from the boat docks at Ma'alaea, where you can catch fishing, scuba or snorkel boats. Finally, the hotel is about 2.5 hours from the summit of Haleakala -- so if you plan to do the sunrise summit tour, plan on leaving by about 2:30 AM (in the summer) to be sure and arrive before the sun does! PROPERTY: The Sheraton Maui has just about anything you could think of from a beachfront resort. A wide expanse of white sand beach, an enormous rambling freshwater pool (with a mini waterslide), a jacuzzi, a watersports center, a fitness center (up on top of the hill - somewhat hard to find), fantastic snorkeling at Black Rock (lots of turtles), nightly entertainment, multiple restaurants, an outdoor bar, a twice-weekly luau, a huge roster of daily activities and more. The hotel is laid out in a somewhat unusual configuration with buildings 1-4 on the main area around the central pool, and buildings 5 & 6 up above Black Rock. Building 6 does have a very isolated and private feel, but you'll be a rambling walk through other buildings and through at least 2 elevators or stairs to get to the pool area -- it's more than a 5 minute walk to the lobby! The hotel does have many self-park lots, but the lot by the tennis courts (for buildings 3-4) and the lot atop the hill (for buildings 5-6) are almost always full if you pull in after about 8 PM. Valet parking is available, but there is an up-charge of $5 per night after your first (check-in) night. If you're in buildings 3-6 though, it's almost worth it though, because the walk to the larger parking garage on the main road is a ridiculously long one. ROOMS: We had an "Oceanfront Room" in Building 4. It must be said that the distinction between "Oceanview" and "Oceanfront" is a blurry one at best. Oceanfront means that you'll be about 100 feet closer to the beach than Oceanview, but since only a handful of their rooms (on the end of buildings 4, 5 or 6) are actually ocean front, most Oceanfront rooms are just a "little bit closer ocean view". Unless you're springing for the Deluxe Oceanfront rooms in Building 6 (with their commensurate long walk), save your cash and go Oceanview -- you'll probably not even notice the difference. The rooms themselves are clean and well-appointed, each with a private lanai. The "sweet sleeper" beds are cushy and comfortable, though those with back problems might lament the softness. Pillows were a little thin and pretty much required stacking two together to get a good soft pillow with any kind of neck support. Each room has a wide-screen TV, an alarm clock, a dresser with drawers, a large digital safe, a small refrigerator and wired Internet. Closet space is ok, but in our room it was in the bathroom right behind the door, so accessibility was occasionally annoying. Water pressure was ok but not exceptional. The "low flow" heads are environmentally friendly, but they make it a little hard to rinse off the scum of sunblock, bug spray and ocean grit. AMENITIES: FIrst, it must be mentioned that the resort has the now-ubiquitous "Resort Fee", which comes to $26.04 per day, including tax, applied daily regardless of what your room rate was, and applicable even if you're paying for part or all of your stay with Starwood points. They claim that this covers amenities that would otherwise be charged for, but this is one of those times where you can pretty much chalk it up to resort extortion. Self-parking is included, but valet is $5 extra per day. Wireless Internet is available in certain public areas, but only wired in the rooms. There is a single computer in the lobby, primarily for airline check-in, but no business center to speak of. There is a watersports activity center on-site, but it is operated by an independent company, and none of the beach activities are included. Most annoyingly, none of the beach accessories (umbrellas, chairs, cabanas, etc...) are available to hotel guests, and must be reserved and rented at a separate charge through an independent company, who will break it down and take it away at the stroke of 5:00 PM, even though beach activities run until about 7. So, effectively, the hotel offers NO beach amenities whatsoever, despite their beachfront location. Poolside chairs and umbrellas are available free to hotel guests, but there is an up-charge for reserving poolside cabanas. Towels are available poolside, on a "towel card" system, which means only one towel per person -- so anyone with long hair will want to pull a towel from their room to supplement the poolside offering. The fitness center is well appointed, but was pretty much dead empty the entire time we were there. The likely reason for this is its location in the back of Building 5 atop the hill, which just about nobody would ever find unless you're staying in Building 6. There are tennis courts, with equipment available. In general, just plan on being nickel-and-dimed for anything that isn't a very basic hotel amenity, even after your mandatory resort charge. FOOD: As of May 2009, the Lagoon Bar is currently closed for renovations, though the larger Sundowner Bar is open daily. The terrace restaurant offers a large buffet breakfast each morning from 6:30 through 11:00. The only lunch option is bar-style service at the Sundowner Bar poolside. Dinner is a choice of the Black Rock Steak & Seafood restaurant, or the Teppanyaki restaurant, where Japanese chefs grill the typical soy sauce-heavy hibachi fare. Honestly, if you must stay on-property, you'll do fine with any of these options. But you're better off leaving the property, since there are FANTASTIC west maui restaurants such as Roy's Kahana Grill or Kimo's in downtown Lahaina, where you'll get better food at the same (or less) price. Twice a week, the hotel offers a luau on-property. Avoid it! For a couple of bucks more, you'll enjoy significantly better food, all-night free alcohol, and a better show at the Old Lahaina Luau 10 minutes away on the north end of town. Drinks at the poolside bar are mixed stiff, and are pretty tasty. However, the $12 price for a Mai Tai is a little hard to justify in any way other than "resort prices". Have a drink poolside when you're being social, but stop at the local Safeway for drinks or mixers, keep them in your room fridge, and mix your own on your private lanai if you plan to tie on more than one or two! STAFF: The hotel staff was adequate. The room was cleaned daily, requests were handled with accuracy if not amazing speed. I think the hotel is perhaps a bit understaffed, because everyone from the front desk to the poolside bar seems disinterested in personal contact with guests. It's a very mechanical feeling of "just get it done and move on"... On the one night where we arrived very late back on-property and the lots nearest our room was full, we'd decided to just valet the car for the $5 charge. The valet was clearly NOT interested in valeting the car for us, and instead spent 5 minutes talking us out of it, and telling us to just park along the driveway in the upper lot, and ignore the "No Parking - Fire Lane" signs, since they weren't enforced... Great that he saved us $5, but this sort of encouragement to "do it yourself" seemed pretty common among the staff. While they're technically part of a separate company, the on-property watersports and beach equipment vendors were about as UN-accommodating as they came, with little interest in anything other than packing up at the stroke of 5:00 PM. Don't expect overly-personalized service anywhere here. CONCLUSION: Even with all of that said, we really enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton Maui, and would come back in a heartbeat, if the rate was right. For the prime location and on-site amenities, there is always a cost. If you plan to spend most of your time relaxing on-property, the Sheraton is a top choice. But if you plan to spend most of your time exploring the rest of the island, and spending minimal time on-property, you might want to consider saving the cash and going for a slightly less opulent resort somewhere other than Ka'anapali. For those who do remain, however, your days will be full of sparkling freshwater, crystal blue seas, white sands, huge sea turtles at Black Rock, and all the hula and ukulele you could want. The Sheraton offers great rooms in an unbeatable location.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Nino84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shertaon Maui for 9 nights in May. We have travelled extensively - but this was our first time to Maui. The Shertaon Maui is an average hotel (3.5 to 4 star). The rooms are very basic. The bathrooms are dated, as is the room decor. We were staying in building 2 - there is a lot of walking involved if you stay at this resort (especially if you are parking your car at the hotel parking lot). The staff were always very friendly and helpful. Housekeeping is not the best (if you are neat freak, you will notice that the bathroom isn't always cleaned properly etc.). The food is not good and very overpriced. If you come from a city with lots of good food (with flavour), you will be disappointed with your food choices at this hotel and in the neighboring area. Don't do the breakfast buffet. It is $25 per person and not worth it. We had it included in our package and wish we hadn't . The buffet at the Westin is much better - so if you do have the breakfast package - eat at the Westin instead. The beach is beautiful - but crowded. You also have to pay for beach chairs $10 per chair and $20 for an umbrella. This is a total rip off. If you are choosing between the Westin Ocean Villas or the Sheraton - choose the villas. The villas are different than the Westin hotel - we didn't see the rooms at the Westin hotel, but I assume they are bit better than Sheraton. We did see the rooms at the Westin Ocean Villas and wished we stayed there instead There are only a few pool chairs with the option of shade (so get there early). Also, pool is small compared to other hotels - Hyatt, Westin etc... If we go back to Maui, we will not stay at Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: ldedelstein
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from our 5 year anniversary trip to Hawaii. We visited Maui (5/12 â€“ 5/16) and stayed at the Sheraton. We had a fantastic experience starting with check in; it was a breeze. We booked our hotel through Costco Travel and were supposed to have an Ocean View room but were pleasantly surprised when we learned that they were upgrading us to a Deluxe Ocean View room in building 6. After reading many reviews on Trip Advisor, I was going to request building 6, due to the location and quite factor (especially since we were on our anniversary trip). One perk of being in building 6 is that it has its own parking lot. We were easily able to find parking throughout our whole stay. It does require a long walk and a few elevators, but the views are breathtaking and worth it. Once we got to the room we were surprised to see the size and view! As a nice touch, the Sheraton had a nice bottle of champagne waiting for us! We had a king bed and the rooms looked to be recently renovated. There was a separate toilet room for shower and vanity area. We also had a microwave and refrigerator. In addition, we had a great balcony area that overlooked nothing but ocean. We watched a fantastic sunset from our balcony one evening! We ate the breakfast buffet at the Sheraton two of the four mornings and it was good. There was plenty of variety and we were seated at the end of the patio with a great view each morning. One morning we took our breakfast at the Westin because we wanted to check it out. The buffet was definitely comparable to the Sheraton, maybe just more spread out. Both were enjoyable, but we probably wouldnâ€™t have paid for it if it wouldnâ€™t have been included in our rate. The pool at the hotel was great. We lounged around the lazy river and had a blast. The beach is the best in Maui! Black Rock has great snorkeling. I hate to say it, but we saw better fish at Black Rock than on our snorkel trip to Molokini (Maui Classic Charters: Four Winds II morning snorkel to Molokini â€“ nice boat, but we got seasick). We saw several turtles and a variety of fish â€“ right there! As mentioned in separate reviews, we ate at local places around the island. Some highlights include the Hula Pie at Leilaniâ€™s on the Beach, Mamaâ€™s Fish House, Feast at LeLe, Aloha Mixed Plate and sushi at Sanseiâ€™s (see individual reviews for each in detail). Another tip that we got from Trip Advisor and guide books (Maui Revealed is a great resource) was to stop at Kmart and stock up on drinks and snacks. We did that and also got a fun Hawaii cooler to bring back home with us! We were able to save a lot of money on drinks and souvenirs. There is so much to do in Maui we would recommend staying at least a week and thoroughly exploring the island. In the five days/four nights we were there, we were able to drive the Road to Hana, snorkel at Molokini, snorkel at Black Rock, and explore Lahaina and cruise Front Street a few times. In summary, we really enjoyed our stay and would absolutely return to the Sheraton Black Rock and Kaanapali Beach!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Idyllic”
Reviews.Author: letsgoNC1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was AMAZING! I truly enjoyed every second of my relaxing vacation - and the hotel played a large part in that! The pool had plenty of chairs and never felt overwhelmingly crowded. The staff was incredibly friendly/accomodating. The greates part of the hotel was the location. You could walk right out of the hotel onto the beach (which was large in comparison to some of the other hotels on Kaanapali Bay) and go snorkeling. We snorkeled multiple times a day because the best reef was just a short swim from the shore of the hotel. The hotel was also located near a small shopping area which was convenient! Our room was "mediocre"-nothing frilly or fancy but it had a nice view!! We didn't feel that we were cheated however because we were only in our room to sleep and change clothes-we really spent NO time in there. Perhaps if you were looking for a room you knew you were going to spend a lot of time in you might request an upgrade? The hotel is something I would surely recommend to others looking for a fun getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Gets a solid B”
Reviews.Author: sofie123
Reviews.Content: First Impression/Check In Experience: I think the Sheraton is a nice 3.5-4 star resort for those who are wishing to visit Maui and donâ€™t want to break the bank quite yet. We were shown to our room by one of the doorman who was nice enough to give us a brief tour of the resort. We stayed in building 6 which are their â€œDeluxe Ocean Frontâ€� Rooms. We requested a specific range of rooms because we wanted our view to be of the black rock, but we were not given a room, in that area, nor were we given a reason as to why we could not be in that area. We found that to be a little unprofessional but it was no big deal as we saw that the room that we had been given had an amazing view and was nice and clean. The hotel also gave us a complementary bottle of champagne which was a nice gesture considering this stay was for our honeymoon. The Resort: The location of the Sheraton Maui is incredible. The beach is pristine, the grounds are perfectly manicured and the general environment is just beautiful. For those who wish to stay in building 6 the walk is not too long if you are relatively young and in good health. It was however a little confusing trying to get to the â€œmain resort areaâ€� because you have to go across, and then take an elevator down. It was a little much but I think being in a room that is â€œaway from it allâ€� is worth it. The Restaurants: Our first morning there we ate at the Kekiâ€™s Terrace for their breakfast buffet. It was pretty good, no complaints at all about the foodâ€¦however, the BIRDS were just too much for me. I am sorry but at one point the birds were just jumping on our tables and fighting for food. The staff there at the restaurant must be pretty used to this but I was really shocked at the number of birds that were just flying all around and scouting for our food. We also tried the Black Rock Restaurant. It is funny because while we were looking around the resort the first day, I wanted to see the restaurants because I can be quite a â€œfood snobâ€� lol so I like to get an idea of how a restaurant look before I dineâ€¦but as much as we looked around I told my husband that I noticed that we did not see the Black Rock Restaurant. I did not think much of it until the next evening when we taking a stroll, we decided to go back to Kekiâ€™s Terrace and to our surprise after we were seated we were given a menu that said Black Rock Restaurant! Basically this one restaurant doubled as a breakfast spot in the morning and a Steakhouse at night under different names. Anywho, the food was just ok. I ordered a Filet Mignon and received something that looked like a glorified skirt steak. I am from Chicago and I know a good steak. For what we paid I would have rather grabbed a fish taco (which are divine) from a fast food restaurant. We also tried the TeppenYaki Dan which was really good with great presentation. Tips/Misc. Info I would definitely rent a car for Maui. We were able to explore the island which saved money when compared to paying for a tour bus excursion. Make sure you see the sunrise!! We actually set this up through the hotel because the roads can be very winding and itâ€™s very dark up there but it was sooo worth it. We took pictures that look like something youâ€™d see on a postcard! If you take this trip, dress in layers and warmly. Itâ€™s very cold and windy up on the mountain which youâ€™ll be over 10,000 feet above sea level. My last tip would be to get in your rented car and go to the abc store or better yet the local grocery and buy some water, juice, pop, fruit etc. This saved us a bundle. Overall I would recommend the Sheraton Maui although next time, Iâ€™ll probably stay at the Four Seasons or Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon, just do a little prep”
Reviews.Author: AGirlCreative
Reviews.Content: First, the hotel is great. It's beautiful, it's clean, and if you can get in building 5 or six, you probably have some of the best views on this side of the island.. it was OUTstanding. We went with very high expectations of the hotel, and the vacation in general, and almost all of them were exceeded. The ONLY reason they got 4 out of 5 for me, was a combination of two things.. the beginning when they booked my husband and I in a room with double beds, and when they in our opinion, didn't do a great job with coordinating events on the lawn, which prevented us from finishing watching "The Dark Knight" on the lawn for their movie nights do to too much sound overlap and the movie having to be turned down to a level only dogs could hear in order to accomodate the other "paying" events. Our room was booked through Travelocity. Now, we're not sure if Travelocity made the error or the hotel did. I found myself annoyed primarily with the hotel simply because I had called them a month in advance to confirm that our hotel reservations had made it there, and to let them know we were honeymooners (sometimes they do special things for honeymooners). Obviously they got the info, cause we got shell leis when we arrived and there was a box of chocolates and champagne waiting in our room. SO, to put us in double beds seemed ridiculous and annoyed me. The front desk woman's indifference to my being upset didn't help matters. To their credit, we were upgraded a room, and on the 3rd night got moved into their first available room with a King in building 6. It's a building that takes a little walk to get to, but it's well worth it. There is a trash facility on the walk, so that can be a little downer, but the rooms over here are BEAUTIFUL.. and by that I really mean the view out of them. It's just amazing, and quiet. Building 5 is located on this same side of black rock, and I imagine the views there are nearly as good. (Clearly, ours will always be the best). All in all, we loved it. Take advantage of the on site activities. It was one of our only regrets was that we didn't take more advantage of the resort, and the beautiful beach it is on. (PS, the snorkeling here truly is great.. and right off the hotel beach..)

Reviews.Title: “Beware of "resort fee"!!”
Reviews.Author: df9354
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a stay at the Sheraton Maui and wanted to warn others who are unaware that they charge an extra $26.04 per day for a "resort fee" on top of already high rates. And the fee is barely disclosed on any of the booking informtion. I am fully aware of resort fees and have avoided hotels that charge them. The Sheraton Maui tricked me though. I disputed the charge and have been given the standard corporate lines about what extra services I am receiving for that fee and that the fee is mandatory. They are services that used to be included in the regular rate. So it really is just an extra hidden fee. My unhappiness with this fee overides whatever other review I have of this hotel. I would encourage others to join in my protest of this questionable resort fee practice.

Reviews.Title: “Leid only once at Sheraton, Maui”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuruGomez
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton in Maui this May and had a great trip! First trip to Hawaii and can't wait to return! Maui is so great! The Sheraton is "okay". The rooms were fine with dated decor and bathroom. The resort is huge and requires a lot of walking so if you have a hard time walking this resort will be a literal pain. The food is too expensive for what you get and the drinks are crazy expensive. We went to the local market and bought Grey Goose and made our own drinks. The beach is crowed and for 40.00 you can have a beach cabana for 20.00 an umbrella. The snorkeling/diving is great and sea turtles came on a daily basis to greet swimmers. We stayed away from the pool for the most part because the amount of poorly behaved kids. (Lots of kids at this resort :( ) We spent a lot of time out of the resort diving. Pacific Divers on Dickenson is amazing and they will hook you up if diving is your thing! We took surfing lessons from Nate (Goofy Foot Surfing) who is a regular on Front street beach and had a great time- He was a great teacher and made sure I got up on the board...He even took our camera and took some great action shots! We ate on Front street a lot and especially enjoyed Kobe sushi and Kimos. We did try the breakfast buffet at the resort one day and paid 25.00 pp. It was "okay". Please make sure you rent a car! The valet staff is amazing and give you great tips on where to go. They pointed us to CJ's and we had great breakfasts there! If you are into clubs and nightlife Maui is NOT for you. My husband and I eat late so when we saw all the restaurants were closed at 11 we were highly disappointed. There was one "Bar" that was open late but we could tell by the music they were playing it would not be fun. The Sheraton Maui seemed to be the best resort in our location. The surrounding resorts were very dated and seemed crowded. I based this review after being to several all-inclusive resorts in Mexico. The resorts like The Royal in Playa Del Carmen and Riu Cancun put resorts like this to shame. However, the location and beauty that Maui offers cannot be found anywhere in Mexico. Overall I would recommend this resort to couples and families. This is not a resort for young singles. Maui, Lahaina in particular, is an amazing place and I cannot wait to return!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: reenie1128
Reviews.Content: The property is gorgeous and in the best location for snorkeling on black rock. Our rate was not too bad.....ocean and pool view with daily breakfast buffet (thank goodness-it was $27.00 pp). Snorkeling was fabulous - turtles, coral and colorful fish. We even saw a whale on 2 different occassions. I do have to note that the rooms are a bit dreary and our bed was not heavenly as expected. The room size was acceptable - it just needs updating; new carpet, beds, paint etc. The bathroom was large and roomy - again, a bit dated, but very clean overall. The lagoon type pool was nice but a little dirty - we were disappointed that there was no poolside music. Overall, a beautiful location and proximity to one of the best snorkeling spots.....also, within reasonable walking distance to Whaler's village and shuttle offered to Lahaina every hour. Don't go near dinner time however, we caught full shuttles a couple of times and had to wait another hour. If I was travelling with my family, I would rather stay a little North at the Westin Villas....comparably prices, nice rooms, BBQ grills etc. The only downside is the 1/4 - 1/2 mi walk to snorkel.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: paper11
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time! First I'll begin with all the positives. Every Single person/staff member we talked to was SO friendly. This really made our vacation wonderful. Everyone was very helpful and kind. The hotel grounds are beautiful. Although we had lots of slugs on our porch every night (so therefore didn't want to be on the porch then) and a cockroach on the porch, we did enjoy seeing the other critters like toads etc. that weren't part of our room/porch. The grounds are beautiful. We took our little one and participated in the lei making class and hula classes which were so much fun. The gentleman who does these was WONDERFUL. We really enjoyed talking with him. The concierge was Great. They booked a whale watching trip for us and everyone we talked to was extremely knowledgeable. We had a wonderful time at the Luau on the grounds as well. For the not so positives now. When we first checked in we noticed a gross hair right on top of our bed sheet and the room was very muggy, we immediately got another room, thankfully. Our room was fine. Like I mentioned, we would have loved to sit outside at night on the porch, but there were always several slugs crawling around. The bathroom was pretty dingy. The grout in the bathtub was black in several places. Part of the shower head was rusted and there was what looked like black mold spores on the ceiling above the shower. So we took showers and tried not to touch anything while in the bathroom. We also felt like there wasn't much reasonable food options at the hotel. We ate by the pool a couple times for a quick snack and everything was very expensive and the food really was not very good. I had a salad that wasn't very good and a sandwich another time that had stale cold bread. Overall, we really had a great time other than trying to move around in the bathroom trying not to touch things and trying to keep our daughter from touching mildew or mold in the shower. Also our bathroom was tiny with the bath tub and toilet so close together and the door right next to the tub. Very crammed feeling. We would stay again since the staff was so wonderful and the location is superb if we had a room with a much bigger bathroom and one that has no mold if there is one. We really loved the vacation overall.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mc005i
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton for 3 nights in late April. I booked a last-minute paid in full rate through their website and paid $220 for a basic room. When I got there I was upgraded to an oceanfront room, and it was beautiful! It was very clean and spacious. The bathroom was great, with double doors leading into the vanity area, the shower to the right and the toilet in a separate room to the left. There was plenty of closet space and an in-room safe. My only complaint as a business traveler was that there wasn't a desk, although there was a table next to the internet cord. Not a big deal, I know this is a vacation hotel. There is a mandatory $25/day resort fee which includes self parking and high-speed internet and a bunch of other stuff. Towel service by the pool/beach is easy, they give you towel cards when you check in to exchange for the towels each day. Check in/out was very easy and everyone was friendly enough. The activities people kept calling and leaving messages at my room, which was a little annoying. Again though, I know this is a vacation hotel. The gym is small but sufficient. I went in one morning around 6:30 and there were only a few other people so it was fine. I stayed out in the far building (something or other Moana, I believe), and it was very quiet. My only real complaint is that room service was RIDICULOUSLY expensive. I arrived late in the day and really needed to catch up on work, so I decided to order room service instead of going out. All said and done, I paid $77 for a club sandwich and a 1/2 bottle of cheap wine. The sandwich was fine, but definitely not worth the price. Thank goodness for expense accounts! Overall it was a good enough experience and I would definitely consider the Sheraton for a vacation stay. If you can get a good rate, I would recommend considering this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Double Upgrade to a Sea View - Best on Kaanapali Beach!”
Reviews.Author: Mugenmadness
Reviews.Content: This place is such a lovely hotel, so much better than your typical high rise hotels down the strip of Kaanapali. Located in in the corner of the strip and wraps around the rock side of the Black Rock where sunset dives occur daily (tide permitting). Upgraded from garden view to a mountain view then finally to a sea view and a free bottle of champagne for our honeymoon! Rooms are big and spacious and balcony was top notch. Also one a handful of hotels to have a gym! Nice to do an early workout or free yoga or pilates class before sleeping by the awesome pool (with hot tub). Beach towels renewed for you when ever you like and the beach is just a few steps away! When we were there we actually had big sea turtles swimming in front of our beach side hotel, brilliant when you buy a $6.99 snorkel kit and do not have to go far to be swimming next to a 1 metre long turtle! Service charge of $25 a night is a bit excessive but it covers free parking, free wi-fi, towel service, gym, gym classes and shuttle service to Lahina! Staff very friendly and will recommend places to go and eat without trying to sell you the in house restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: munchkinhead_9
Reviews.Content: After the stress from moving to another hotel, this was what we were after, pure relaxation! The hotel is huge, the way the hotel was built is beautiful, very airy unlike the tall, skyline hotels. The pools are great, with a hidden hot tub! Brillant staff on hand whenever you need. Great resturants, parking, activities and 24 hour gym. Everything you need! and a few feet away from the beach!

Reviews.Title: “mediocre”
Reviews.Author: kumon1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and 2 daughters ages 12 and 16 just returned from a 7 night stay at the Sheraton Maui. The hotel is located at the end of Kaanapali Beach, ending with Black Rock. We elected to upgrade our reservation to an ocean front room on top of Black ROck. The room itself was spacious for 4 people and had a fairly good view of the beach and the ocean. Service was fair. On one occasion we returned to our room at 4pm to find that we had had no maid service at all. When I phoned to find out why, I was told that they probably had not gotten to our room "yet". We felt the resort went out of there way to add additional charges, for example to use a covered lounge chair on the beach the cost is an exorbitant $40 per day.
