We had one meal poolside-again the service was poor, waiting 45minutes for a very dried out, very small hot dog-the prices were way overpriced for the quality. Overall, we were disappointed with our stay at this hotel. We have traveled over many parts of the world at Starwood properties and are usually not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Nice Grounds, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: dave007j
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton in March 2009. The Good: very nice room, upgraded to ocean view; good service (not great); beautiful grounds; the best stretch of the beach in Ka'anapali that there is; good restaurants and amenities; walking distance to Whaler's Village. The Bad: no spa on the property; large property, so you have to walk alot and we were somewhat far from the front desk/lobby; no moderately priced dining option. Overall we enjoyed our stay and will stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: redquasar
Reviews.Content: The hotel property is well maintained, clean and aesthetic. The rooms are great. We had an ocean view with a balcony so that helped. The pool, poolside area and bars are wonderful. The proximity to the beach and snorkeling by black rock was awesome. The time period when we went (april), wasn't a summer holiday for kids, so we were spared of unruly and annoying children. Might be different during the summer, although by comparison, Sheraton was much more calm and peaceful compared to the nearby Westin which was a circus. The on-premises restaurant was fantastic for breakfast (but we had a deal for included breakfast buffet with our stay). We never at the hotel otherwise, so can't comment on the food for lunch or dinner. The Westin hotel breakfast was also nice, and a bit more expansive, which was included as an option with our breakfast package. The fitness room is nice. We had convenient parking right by our room. The staff is overall very helpful and responsive. The concierge was average. I wanted to find some surfing lessons, and of course, she was steering me towards the business Sheraton had a link with. I might've found someone cheaper had I searched on my own. I also asked her about Italian restaurants, and she didn't even know about the italian place nearby! Well anyway, I guess any hotel is going to steer you towards their preferred vendors, so always a good idea to do your own research. Our internet was out for an hour and they gave us a $25 certificate, which was nice. Timeshare reps are lurking but not particularly aggressive. We opted for this place instead of a 5 star property such as Grand Waileia or Ritz....it had everything you would want, it was well maintained property, and substantially cheaper. Also the proximity to the town of Lainai for nightlife and dining was a bonus. Renting an umbrella on the beach is pricey, but seems to be the case at all nice hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and relaxing, well worth the money spent”
Reviews.Author: SanMogal
Reviews.Content: First off, how can you not love getting leid upon check in. beautiful orchids! The grounds are gorgeous! Lush vegetations, and flowers. We had a partial ocean view, but mostly faced the garden and mountains. The mountain view was actually very stunning. You can relax , grab a drink at the bar on the beach, and watch the cliff diver at sunset. Really romantic. The restaurant there is great. I love being able to wear my bikini top to a nice dinner. The rooms are very nicely appointed. Just like the picture on the website. The lanai was bit small, but fine none the less. The location is great too as it is in Ka'anapali and close to Lahaina town. You can go shopping at the mom and pop shops or go to the bigger "boutiques". Lahaina town also has tons of restaurants, os you'll never go hungry. Must try the Old Lahaina Luau, just make sure you get a seat on the mat. The have the best lava flows around! The staff was fabulous, they even packed a lunch for me because for our road to Hana.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui-So Great!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: We just got back and loved this Hotel. It was our anniversary so we were upraded from Partial Ocean View to Deluxe Ocean View. The room was large,clean,well maintained and beautifully appointed. The view on the balcony was beautiful-The resort was simply "out of a postcard". They sent us snacks and Champagne on the house to help us celebrate. Heather Yap at the front desk made us feel so welcomed. The pool was very clean and at a nice temperature for swimming-it was like a big lagoon with waterfalls-we liked the hot tub too. The beach was the best on Maui and we swam and snorkelled in the clear water every day. We got a great deal with Daniel at Great Hawaii Vacations for $840 for three nights including taxes and fees and that included breakfast for two daily. We were able to eat any any of the Starwood properties. The Westin had an amazing buffet and we ate there twice-The Sheraton buffet was OK but nothing like The Westin. We did like the Friday dinner buffet at The Sheraton in fact it was my favorite meal of the trip-the buffet server was really nice too. The service at the restaurant was slow and inattentive (but they were nice) it wasnt really up to par with the rest of the resort though. The bed was very comfortable and the huge flat screen TV was great too. The internet never really worked right though. We walked into the other hotels on Kaanapali and the only other one we liked was the Westin which was very upscale though it felt more crowded. The KBH and Hyatt looked run down and I am glad we chose The Sheraton which had a real Hawaiian feel that was elegant yet simple and unpretentious-it was so relaxing. The Sheraton is on the best beach too. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone-We LOVED IT!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent beach location, beautiful grounds and pool.”
Reviews.Author: Lucky_LA
Reviews.Content: Liked location because it is at the "end" of the beach and gets less pedestrian traffic. Grounds were very nice. Food is a little pricey but good. We really enjoyed out stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to start our Hawaii vacation”
Reviews.Author: chuckawala
Reviews.Content: We had a tough time choosing a hotel to start our trip. We were not dissappointed with the Sheraton. Check in at night was quick and friendly. Our room had a superb ocean view on a high floor. Some other feedback on the property; valet parking was used and $25/day, the spa was closed, the walk to the lobby was far, check out was bit lengthy. The Whaler shopping center nearby was obnoxious since the merchants would not validate your parking ticket if you did not spend say more than $35 at a store.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: surfingshopper
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton has the best location on Kaanapali. An easy walk tothe Whaler's Village shopping area and a short drive to Lahaina. Rooms were clean and bathrooms were fairly large and very clean. We were upgraded to a deluxe oceanfront room. We had booked oceanfront through Expedia. The view was amazing. Saw whales and turtles right under our balcony. The whales were so close you could hear them blowing from inside the room.. We did have to use several elevators to ger to beach and pool but the walk was enjoyable. The hallways are open air and the views on the way were spectacular. Pool is gorgeous but was cold. The ocean was warmer. We were there after a period of iffy weather and did notice that once the sun came out the pool water began to warm up. Drinks and food by the pool were yummy if a little pricey. The waitresses there were very good and super friendly. We ate breakfast and dinner away from the resort as prices for those meals were high. We booked a whale watching trip and a helicopter van trip to Hana through anita at the concierge's desk in the lobby. She was super helpful and followed up promptly on our questions. Both trips were awesome. We had a wonderful time at the Sheraton and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed There Twice and Would Do It Again!!”
Reviews.Author: AngLovesHawaii
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this hotel! it is in the best location on Kaanapali. The service is great, the space is very open and the beach is the best in this area. I did a spa day with my husband 2 yrs ago at the Hyatt a few hotels down, and the beach was so much smaller and that area is super congested. The Sheraton is the only hotel on the beach that has so much space. Love everything about it!! The Sheraton in Wakiki has an awesome location as well.

Reviews.Title: “W-O-W !!!”
Reviews.Author: Mista-go
Reviews.Content: Last, but not least, stop of our Hawaiian Honeymoon. Points of strenght of the hotel: - elegant hall - luxurious gardens - tasty food (both in restaurants and grill/bar) - free of charge super-fun activities (we learned how to play ukulele, how to dance the hula and how to make flower leis) - very nice staff and high quality service - wonderful view from the room lanai - pools - very good luau - ideally located near a very nice shopping arcade/restaurant area What we disliked: there was no business centre! how come??????? Anyway...we miss Sheraton Maui!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon stay”
Reviews.Author: SFRolla
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I went to the Sheraton from 2-18-09 till 2-22-09 and overall we had no complaints and everything was simply fantastic. Check in was an absolute breeze, we drove up to the main lobby they took my name and escorted us to another part of the hotel. What you have read about staying in "ocean front rooms" is true, building 6 is quite far from the lobby and takes quite a bit of walking and 3 elevators to reach. But since we were on our honeymoon we wanted the quiet and that is what we got. The view from the balcony was amazing! but be warned it is quite windy up there on top of Black Rock and we didn't sit on the balcony too much. The room was nice and clean, I called ahead and made sure we got a king size bed, there was also a bottle of champage waiting for us which was nice (American Express might have told them we were on our honeymoon). We didn't use the pool but it did look amazing, I am more about the beach and snorkling was outstanding. We did eat breakfast 1 day which was pretty good, sitting on the terrace looking at the ocean was great. I wanted to splurge on our honeymoon but $7 for toast and $8.50 for an english muffing through room service is just crazy. Lahina town is great for food and for shopping, Whalers village was pretty nice but a little pricey. We wanted to use the spa but it was not open at the time we went so the concierge got us a couples massage at the Westin (just down the road) which was wonderful. For an nice dinner I highly recommend The Lahina Grill, the concierge made our reservations and told them it was our honeymoon, we got some "extra" service." Overall a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Relaxing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: livinlife20
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late but I just got into using trip advisor to help plan vacations so I thought I would try to give back with a review from my honeymoon. My husband and I are in our late 20's and we were looking for a relaxing vacation to unwind after the big wedding. The Sheraton was just that. First of all the location of the resort was right at the very end of the main strip of resorts. The tourist foot traffic was almost non existent by the time you got down there which made for a very peaceful environment. In my opinion the beach space in front of the Sheraton was by far the best out of all the resorts. It was definitely the largest as some resorts barely had room to set up a chair in the sand. Also there was a jetty of large rocks that formed off to the side and I heard there was great snorkeling right in front of the hotel by the rocks (I wouldn't know personally because I am a bit afraid of the ocean!) A "Tikki Man" also did a charming traditional performance every night by lighting torches from the hotel to the end of the jetty, and then cliff diving off of it (see pictures!). The rooms were nothing too special. However they were clean, beds were comfortable and bathrooms were covered in granite and very large which is always a plus. We actually checked into a room with two double beds (not the most ideal set up for a honeymoon!) so we went right back to the front desk and were changed to a different room with a King no problem. The Sheraton Pools were really nice, they had a couple big ones with fun little river channels that you could swim through to get from one to the other. Service at the pool was very attentive, our Mai Tai's were always filled! Even though we were looking for some relaxation for the most part - we are in our 20's and we did want to seek out some additional action once we were rested up. I will say that the Sheraton becomes a ghost town around 8pm! There is absolutely nothing to do or see so we had to walk down to the other resorts and Whalers Village if we wanted to hear any music, or find entertainment of any kind for that matter. I highly recommend the Hula Grill (right next to Whalers Village) they had live music every night and their tables and chairs sat right in the sand! Once you get your fill of the resort strip a trip to Lahaina is a must. The Sheraton had a very nice free shuttle that went to and from the town on an hourly basis. Lahaina is such a charming place right on the beach with a ton of restaurants and shops. I used to live there and Kimo's is hands down the best place to catch a drink and a bite to eat! Make sure to make a reservation! So if you are looking for a nice, quiet, relaxing location with a fantastic beach front yet you don't mind walking a mile or two to find some action then I would recommend the Sheraton as the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui for 9 nights the latter part of January. At check in we were upgraded to ocean front and our accomodations were wonderful witha great view right from our room. The snorkeling at Black Rock ranked among some of the best snorkeling on the island and we even saw sea turtles. The water is protected and entry is very easy. If you were new to snorkeling this would be a great place to start. We ate the breakfast buffet every morning and enjoyed the fresh made omeletsand variety of food. The breakfast buffet was included in our package or we probably wouldn't have paid that much every day. One thing that would be a negative was the price of the drinks. $10 for a margarita by the pool which is served in a plastic cup seemed overpriced to me. I would definitely return to the Sheraton Maui and thought it was a great location on a great beach. I wish we were still there!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation in paridise”
Reviews.Author: jeffypoo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are from Michigan and we love to get away from the cold and snow. I love to look for deals and really get into the vacation months before we actually leave. I did a lot of research on the resorts in Maui and made resevations at the Sheraton Maui resort and spa. I am a Starwood member and I used their website to book our stay. At the last minute I found a internet special that gave us an partial ocean view for $240.00 a night, so I changed our reservation. When we arrived it was late and we were upgraded to a ocean view in building 3. It was dark and we were tired so we went straight to bed. I woke up to my wife opening the curtains and the first thing she said was " its beautiful". I knew then that I made the right choice. The room looked to be newly renovated with a flat screen T.V. and new carpet. The lanai was very narrow but the view of the grounds, beach, and ocean made up for it. We broused the room service menu and had to laugh at $18.00 for a bowl of cream of wheat with brown sugar and raisins. Needless to say we never ate at the resort. We did run into many people who had the breakfast coupons and loved the buffet in the mornings. The resort employees were never rude and always helpful. We chose to pay the extra $5 and use the valet service. We never regretted it. We noticed that every morning people from the other resorts would carry there things down to the beach in front of the Sheraton because by far its the best beach. I snorkeled at black rock and saw turtles, many fish, squid. It was very beautiful. Our best meal was shared with a couple we met at the resort. We ate at Kimo`s in Lahaina town. We made our resevations so that we could enjoy the sunset. All in all I loved the Sheraton and I loved Maui. We have stayed on other islands and we thought this would be our last trip, but after staying at the Sheraton and enjoying the island of Maui I' m already planning next years trip back to the Sheraton Maui Resort and Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui - Wonderful Hawaiian Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Mauicalling
Reviews.Content: Seeing is believing! My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton Maui for 8 nights at the end of January, 2009 for our 25th anniversary. We booked a vacation package through Pleasant Holidays that included the daily breakfast buffet (I recommend getting breakfast vouchers included in your package) and an upgrade to deluxe oceanfront in building 6, on Black Rock. We parked our rental car in the private lot for building 6 each night. (Note: "Building 6" is actually a string of 3 attached buildings. We were originally placed in the third building (6318) which had a beautiful oceanfront view of Molokai. However, after 1 night, we requested and were graciously given a room in the first building (rooms 6301-6310) on the tip of Black Rock, in clear view of the cliff divers from our balcony. EVERYDAY we could see Molokai, Lanai, many whales, a rare monk seal, sea turtles, many ships, sunsets, etc from our room. It was stunningly beautiful. We had had a relaxing and scenic 6 minute walk from building 6 to the pool and dining area each day. The breakfast buffet included fresh fruit, eggs, meats, numerous pastries, a made to order omelet bar with a chef, pancakes, oatmeal, fresh pineapple juice, and much more. It was a great way to start the day. The Resort was not crowded this time of the year, so we rarely had to wait for a table. The service was commendable. We had one piece of luggage that was lost - the airport staff drove it to our hotel and the the Sheraton staff had it in our room by noon the next day! Our room was cleaned daily, and the resort staff was very friendly and accommodating without exception. The Sheraton has a large amount of acreage, and has expansive lawns with tiki torches, palms, a coi pond, a large pool with a long, meandering floating river with waterfalls. It is not heated, but great for sunbathing next to and taking mid-afternoon dips. Dining is expensive, so we mainly ate our free breakfast there. However, we had one evening dinner there that was delicious, and we were given a complimentary dessert pie for our anniversary (the chef wrote our names on the plate and Happy 25th Anniversary with frosting.) The bar offers happy hour from 3-5 with live music each night, and has good burgers. The resort offered free weekly: stargazing (great), pilates, hula lessons, ukalele lessons, free scuba/snorkeling lessons, family movie night, nightly ceremonial cliff dive off Black Rock (we saw it twice). The resort is relaxing and has a feel of true, lush Hawaii, more so than the more opulent, upscale Hyatt or hotel-feeling Westin. Kaanapali Beach is a great beach during the winter. The water is more calm and area is less windy than Kapalua. The snorkeling at Black Rock is very nice, and the beach is long with lots of fine sand to lay on. You can rent a chair or cabana on the beach, but most people opted for the good ol' towel to lay on, and sunned on a free lounge chair at the pool. In winter, we had no problem getting a lounger by the pool at anytime. We ate a few meals at Whalers Village, just a short, relaxing walk on the concrete boardwalk along the beach. Leilani's has a dinner special from 5-6pm nightly that was $15 per person for the main course. Everthing in Maui is a la carte, so we added a dinner salad for $8. We ate at the Hard Rock cafe in Lahaina - Lahaina was a great place to shop and browse during a day we had rain. We took the Teralani Whale watch tour from 4-6pm right off Kaanapali Beach - we saw many whales - a group of four right off the side of the boat. We drove the road to Hana with Valley Isle Excursions. The tour guide grew up there and knew her stuff! We saw many waterfalls and beautiful sights (it rained some, but the 7 sacred pools were flowing!) The road around the back of the island was open, so we traveled around the entire south side of the island and back in 12 hours! They offered a continental breakfast and a nice chicken lunch. I recommend you take a tour the first trip to Hana - the road has some very dangerous, narrow spots over cliffs, so the driver MUST focus on the road and not sightsee. Plus, the guide knows the best spots to stop, and does not waste time finding them. I would feel comfortable driving myself the second time we go to Hana. I did golf at Kapalua - Plantation Golf Course, a real highlight of the trip! They have a half-price twilight rate after 1:30pm. Reserve your tee time well in advance online. The Plantation GC has a great restaurant with a great view and reasonable price for lunch. My wife had a manicure and shopped at the Westin while I was golfing - the spa at the Sheraton is being remodeled, and is almost finished. We did relax by the pool at the Sheraton and hang out on our lanai often. We did not pack in too many daily activities - we were able to unwind and relax a lot on this trip with a true sense of being in Hawaii - that is what the Sheraton is best for! It was the perfect anniversary vacation for us - don't hesitate to stay there - it is paradise. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Sheraton Maui”
Reviews.Author: looper63
Reviews.Content: Just returned after 3 wonderfull nights at the Sheraton Maui Resort. I gave it an "above ave." rating rather than "excellent" only because we also stayed at the Four Seasons, and that gets an "excellent". Great stay at the Sheraton. Had a double room in bldg.2 with my wife and 2 daughters. Room was nice size, big bathroom, and spotless. Housekeeping was prompt everyday. Had a refrigerator that we stocked with drinks, and private balcony to watch the ocean from. Check in was a breeze, we arrived late and were lei'd and in our room, bags and all, within 5 minutes. Parking lot was close enough, but for $5 a day we opted for valet. The grounds at the Sheraton are beautiful. Great pool/beach layout with plenty of room for adults and children. The Sheraton has the best, most expansive beach on this side of the island, its more private than further down the strip towards the Hyatt. With the bldg.'s set back the way they are, there is a large lawn and garden area that gives a wide open feeling to the resort, great for lounging and relaxing. Plenty of options for dining both in the hotel and along the walkway on the beach. The breakfast buffet at the Sheraton has everything you want, it might seem a bit pricey for adults, but my 4yr.old ate free, and the 12yr.old was half price. Ate lunch at the pool cabana, fresh grilled fish, chicken, etc, you can talk to the chef as he grills right outside. We never ate dinner at the hotel, instead opting to eat at the Hula Grill just down the beach(very good), the Old Lahaina Luau one night and in Lahaina another night. You can walk to the Hula from the hotel. Now, I have to say that I was a bit apprehensive after reading some of the reviews on this sight. We stopped by the Sheraton last year to check it out and thought it looked fine, but some of the reviewers really trashed the hotel and staff. We didn't find any of those problems. The hotel was immaculate, the staff was wonderful, always helpful, never rude. Not only do I highly reccomend the Sheraton Maui, I plan on returning for a longer stay next year!

Reviews.Title: “Best location on Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: coloparkers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed five nights at the Sheraton Maui after receiving a mail offer last summer. Our offer was $739 for 5 nights in a garden view room, $75 in hotel certificates and $185 towards an Avis rental car. When we checked in, we were upgraded to an ocean view room for no extra charge. However, when we checked out the room (3134 on the ground level of building three), we heard an elevator noise and opted to switch rooms. We ended up paying an additional $75 per night for a higher level ocean view room in building four (4036). Definitely worth the extra money for a superb view. The front desk also threw in a complimentary bottle of champagne. I'll briefly list the positives and negatives of our stay to help anyone out who may be considering staying here. This was our 6th trip to Maui and probably our 15th trip to Hawaii so I feel I have a fair amount of other experiences to compare this one with. Positives: 1. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION! The setting in front of Black Rock is stunning. You've got fabulous snorkeling and diving right there. In addition to colorful fish, we saw octopus, eels, turtles, squid and a white tip reef shark all around Black Rock. Since the Sheraton is the last hotel in the string of main Kaanapali hotels it feels a little more peaceful and less busy than some of the other hotels. However, it's no more than a ten minute walk to Whaler's Village for restaurants and shopping. 2. Beach: The beach is wide with plenty of sand for everyone here. In front of the Westin and parts of the Marriott Ocean Club it's eroded significantly. In fact, the concrete walking path has washed away, too, in parts. The water in front of the Sheraton is free of sea grass and debris, beautifully clear. The water in the eroded areas was murky looking and very churned up. 3. Employees: I'd read a few reviews of the Sheraton where people complained of apathetic or even rude employees. Not our experience at all. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Even the cleaning staff gave a smile and an "Aloha" greeting when we'd walk by in the hall. 4. A timeshare invite, but no pressure: We were offered a 90 minute presentation for an additional $100 in certs and 7,500 Starwood pts. We declined and that was the end of it. 5. Fitness Center: Clean, new equipment. Space was roomy and clean. 6. Sundowner Bar at the pool: Happy hour daily at 3:00. Lunches we ordered here we're really good and fairly generous portions. Fish and chips was delicious. 7. A1 Scuba: I got my open water certification at the resort through A1 scuba. Super communication ahead of time to set it up, and my instructor was patient and a great teacher. Highly recommend them. Room for Improvement: Check in: The hotel is currently remodeling the check in area so check in was at a makeshift desk with two employees on laptops. Employees were friendly, but the computers seemed very slow and I felt bad for others who were waiting behind us for probably 10 mins. 2. Rooms: Looking a little tired. First room they put us in had a big splotch of paint on the bathroom counter. Blowdryer in bathroom was very dirty with dust, makeup, etc.. Bed was comfy, but they put a down comforter on the bed, no blanket. Why would you want a down comforter in Hawaii? We requested a blanket instead which was perfect with the AC on. 3. Pool: Seemed a little small for a large hotel. We enjoyed it, but if they ever do another major remodel I'd suggest expanding the pool area and using some of the lawn area for pool instead. 4. Wow Factor: The Sheraton is a nice hotel, but if you're looking for extravagance you won't find it here. The Wow factor for me is in the location, not the property itself. 5. Soundproofing: If you're sensitive to noise, I'd bring earplugs for sleeping. The hallway outside our room backed up to black rock and I think the acoustics are such that you hear people walking, wheeling their luggage, etc.. Also, the people in the room above us seemed to be moving furniture one night...very noisy. I'd recommend this property to anyone looking for a hotel with the best location on Kaanapali. If the beach is not a priority for you, and you'd prefer a better pool, consider the Westin instead. Last, we were into inexpensive dining on this trip so we could put our money into activities. I'll post separate restaurant reviews, but definitely look into the following restaurants for tasty, inexpensive (by Maui standards) food: Honokowai Okazuya, Gazebo, Cilantro, Barefoot Grill (at Hula Grill), and even the food court at Whaler's village. We shared a pizza and a Greek salad there that was pretty decent for a food court. Overall, fabulous experience at the Sheraton and a great value for the money. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “A honeymoon in paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Kiggins
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Sheraton Maui was the second part of our three part honeymoon. Booked to have a relaxing week in the sun, away from the British rain! We absolutely LOVED the Sheraton! We arrived early evening and as soon as we checked in (short wait) we were congratulated on our wedding and were given beautiful leis. A lot better than the ones we paid for at the airport! Within minutes of arriving in our room a bottle of chilled champagne and flutes arrived to help us celebrate our honeymoon. A lovely touch. We booked a garden view room, which was private, not overlooked and we had views of Maui mountain and banana trees. The room was very large with 2 Queen Size beds, a nice bathroom, large wardrobe, a fridge and a safe. Everything we needed. It was air conditioned and controlled by us which was great. The balcony was quite small but big enough for what we needed. Who goes to Maui to stay in their rooms?! The hotel and its grounds were spotlessly clean and tidy. There appeared to be an army of gardeners our in force everyday, there wasn't even a blade of grass out of place! The pool was very quiet, we swam daily, faultless. The beach in front of the hotel was again very clean. We rented snorkels (very expensive to do from the hotel, cheaper in Whalers Village) and swam with Turtles at Black Rock. Photos of which our friends and family all think are postcards they are so close and so clear. There is a very strong current at this beach which could be dangerous for weak swimmers and children. The restaurants and pool bar at the hotel were adequate. We ate at both and were not disappointed. But it was ideal that Whalers village were only a short walk away to eat in different places. Also the free shuttle bus into Lahaina every hour was brilliant and we really took advantage of it and ate locally. We heard a lot of American tourists complaining about the prices of food and drink, but being British we found it all quite reasonable, actually cheaper than expected considering most things are imported. We booked a number of trips with the poolside concierge, service was excellent. A must was the Waterfall Hike, absolutely amazing! I would recommend the Sheraton Maui to anyone who wants an amazing honeymoon, I have already had a promise from my husband that we will return for a big anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “A True Paradise”
Reviews.Author: wingwen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton for the last 3 nights of our Hawaii trip. I purposely planned it so that our last days will be at the best hotel so we can relax and do nothing. As we hopped from one island to the next, Maui was our last stop and we certainly felt we needed the time to relax. We arrived at the hotel less than an hour before 3pm and was told that our room was not ready. However, we were offered complimentary drinks and food coupons at the bar and would be notified when our room was ready. They even had complimentary first night valet parking! What great service! We enjoyed our cocktails by the pool and were notified that our room was ready just before 3pm. We got someone to help us with our bags (which they already took out from the car and put on the cart for us) and we were given fresh leis which made me feel so special and Hawaiian. Not only that, because it's our honeymoon, we got a bottle of wine! We had booked an ocean view room and the view was just spectacular from the lanai. I can just go back any minute! The room was very nice with a flat-screen TV and complimentary high speed internet. The cool thing with the TV is that you can order room service, set up the alarm etc. The only minor issue we had was tiny ants in the washroom. The hotel also offers shuttle buses every hour to Lahaina which is great because it would be hard and expensive to park in town. We also visited the concierge and received a free package of postcards! Remember also that there are activities during the day. We learned to make our own leis which was fun. The cliff dive at the Black Rock at sunset was very unique and special as well. One day, we were locked out of our room despite trying a few times with our electronic key so we called for help. Someone came within a few minutes to open the door for us. Apparently, the "key" that we had was the parking key and not the room key. However, we were never told. The other thing I'm impressed with the hotel is that they allow you to use their facilities after check-out. Most flights out of Hawaii is at night and ours was at 11:30pm so we had a full 8-9 hours after check-out. We stored our bags and then we chilled by the pool, beach and the lobby and took showers in the fitness centre before leaving the hotel. We really enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton. Although this was the most expensive hotel we paid on our trip, it was worth every penny. And because we booked it at a special deal (Cdn$242/night), the value was even greater!

Reviews.Title: “HEAVEN on Earth”
Reviews.Author: TLC23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our two children (5 & 7) to Maui for Christmas. I found this hotel on Tripadvisor. This hotel is absolutely GORGEOUS! The staff are friendly and so helpful. I never felt the pressure to tip (as other reviewers have noted). We were more than happy to tip because the service was outstanding. The valet service was quick and always offering directions. The food service was utterly fantastic and concierge services were wonderful. We were greeted with smiles every day. The grounds are kept up beautifully and the general appearance of the hotel is lovely and VERY clean. Our room was immaculate and well taken care of during our entire stay. The pools and beach were excellent. I have nothing negative to say. If you are looking for a discount holiday - this hotel probably isn't for you. We wanted a deluxe holiday and the Sheraton fulfilled our dreams. Our holiday was pure magic and we owe it to the staff of the Sheraton. THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Paid for "Special," got "Just OK"”
Reviews.Author: SDSUGRAD
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a week in Maui - all but one night of which was at the Sheraton Maui. This hotel, while acceptable in most ways, left my husband & I disappointed. It wasn't such a bad experience that it ruined our vacation, but we did frequently find ourselves talking about just how disappointed we were with our hotel. Not exactly what you want in a vacation! The Sheraton is listed as a 4-star hotel. As such, I didn't expect every amenity and luxury imaginable, but certainly expected more than what was offered, especially in light of the daily "resort fee." It was apparent that this hotel wasn't quite the same quality as other 4-star places we've visited. It was mostly the little things that they didn't get quite right. For instance, I continue to feel a little annoyed that it seems every other hotel in Hawaii, except this one, greets guests with a flower lei! The staff seemed fairly average in terms of helpfulness or local knowledge. The car valet was fairly slow and front desk was inefficient. There were some stand-outs, however. The bellhops: unlike many other places, these didn't have their hands out at all times. Also, the woman who presented the night-stargazing with a telescope did a nice job (if you do stay at the Sheraton, be sure to go down to the lawn for that). We paid for an upgrade to an Ocean Front Room. We expected a better view and nicer room, or at least one that was, well, in FRONT of the OCEAN. Instead, it was in front of a large lawn, which was in front of a pool, in front of a cabana, in front of a hedge, in front of a beach, in front of the ocean. Yes, the ocean was probably in front of us but not exactly the view to the ocean I had in mind. The room did have a mini-fridge, big TV, safe, and fairly comfy bed. The bathroom wasn't well ventilated and was kinda small. Our patio was tiny - not even enough space for us both to sit there,and no privacy. The internet access in the rooms was wired only. At least the lawn was pretty - lush green like everything else in Ka'anapali (and most of Maui, too). Parking was not really adequate, and spaces were really tight. The grounds are laid out oddly, so we walked a lot (and got lost a bit, too). We didn't try the pool (seemed to have more kids than expected) but did enjoy the hot tub. Several other reviewers have commented on the beach and the sunset torch-lighting at Black Rock. Both of those are nice (though we actually didn't ever swim at this beach -- the beaches in South Maui seemed better for swimming). But, remember, ANYBODY can go to the beach and view the sunset ceremony - even if you stay at another hotel! Also, if you are a member of the Starwood guest program, be aware that if you book thru another website (we booked thru Expedia), you won't get any points for your stay. We probably should have known that, but the conceriege wasn't exactly helpful when we asked, either. The hotel is on a nice part of Ka'anapali beach. Ka'anapali is very pretty with good views to off-shore islands, but we found ourselves driving a lot (at least into Lahaina, if not much farther) for meals and activities. Overall, there weren't tremendous problems with this hotel - things seemed a little old but in good repair, adequately cleaned, etc. Our main complaint that it wasn't the quality we expected. We paid for "special" but got "merely adequate." When we return to Maui, we won't stay at the Sheraton. It doesn't live up to other 4* Hawaiian hotels, nor other Sheratons we've stayed at. Ka'anapali is a decent location, but if we choose that area again, we'd definitely pick another hotel - and maybe one with a better price tag (saving some of our vacation money for 2+ nights at the Hotel Hana-Maui).

Reviews.Title: “One of the best beaches in the islands and a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tahoskibum
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on five different occasions and was shocked to read some of the recent negative reviews. The fact is that this hotel sits on one of the best beaches on the Hawaiian Islands. The only other beaches that fit into the same category would be the Mauna Kea Beach Resort (the best hotel in the islands, and the Royal Hawaiian). We stayed in an Ocean Front (which doesn't mean that you are right on the water, rather just that you have a view from both the bed and patio). It was very nice, the bed was very comfortable (although not a pillowtop) and the furniture was in excellant condition. The room comes with a small fridge which is nice because you can stop at the Costco right next to the airport and buy drinks/water (which saves you from having to pay for drinks every few hours at the hotel). The staff were delightful (with the execption of only one concierge member). I think that the people writing negative reviews aren't used to the high prices of the islands versus what you get in the islands. The same could be said of Americans who first travel to Europe. Most Americans expect that if you are paying $300+ for a room that you should get one of the most unbelievable rooms you could ever imagine. This is true of most places in the mainland U.S. But in Hawaii if you want a "knock your socks off" amazaing room then you are going to have to spend in the $600 per/night range. $300-$350 gets you a very nice room and experience but its not going to be anything close to ultimate luxury. That's just the way it is on the islands. I am a realy brat and demand a nice, clean room with good amenities. But I'm also realistic and know what things cost in the areas that I'm traveling. The Sheraton Maui is a beautiful resort and I guarantee that you will have an amazaing "beach" experience. If you want a truely deluxe experience then you might be better off at a Four Seasons or Wilea Resort where you will pampered and spending a lot more. The snorkling at this beach is amazing and when you go around the Black Rock point in the morning you can almost always expect to see at least 5 large turtles. At about 3-4pm each day many of the turtles actually come right into the beach and swim right next to the beachgoers. As far as building #6 rooms, its true that they are a little walk to the main building (which you really don't need to go to too much anyway). But they have amazing views and are much quieter than the main resort rooms. Much more romantic if you are on a honeymoon. They are not at all far from the beach/pool area. I am a real brat when it comes to getting a really nice room and having an amazing beach. If this is what you are looking for then you're not going to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great snorkelling but extremely overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Cazywaz
Reviews.Content: We had a good size room with a king bed and a sea view. For the price we paid we expected a fantastic room but it was adequate with a tired looking bathroom. The hotel did not seem to have any atmosphere, even in the bar area. Breakfast was expensive compared to the local shopping area - a 10 mins walk away, and we filled up with food at the local Safeway. So we spent nothing at all at the hotel. We are still not sure what the resort fee covers and were not told what it was for. We used the hotel's bus to Lahaina every evening but the local bus would have only cost $1 each way or we could have driven. We did not find the staff overly polite (except for the poolside staff), in general they were quite disrespectful, the worse culprits being the welcome staff when we first arrived. On the plus side, the snorkelling was great outside the hotel and we saw turtles most days. The pool area was very nice and as the hotel was farily empty it was easy to get a sunbed. It also took us 2 days to find the gym, its miles away from the main lobby and gave up onthe first day!

Reviews.Title: “3.5 stars at best”
Reviews.Author: adventurfaux
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel before and had very fond memories, which is why we chose it again for our honeymoon. It would have probably been better to leave those fond memories alone because our recent stay was just average. We were hoping for an upgraded room given it was our honeymoon and my husbands gold starwood status. We got our wish - an oceanview room. However, oceanview was really garden view by my definition. We were in the building just north of the lobby on the second floor. It overlooks the restaurant and the garden, the pool, and way in the background is the ocean. Beautiful, yes. But not enough of a reason to sit on the lanai. The room was also a double. Not exactly a recipe for romance. The only single they could offer us was oceanfront, which by their definition of views most likely means you have to lean over the balcony to see any water, and was also on the first floor. I recalled from my first stay, geckos really like to get in the rooms, so we declined the first floor and went with the double. The bathroom was a pretty tight fit and I felt claustrophobic in the shower. Plus the tub looked like it could use a recaulking. But it was clean and otherwise very average. We splurged on valet. At only $5 a night it's a steal compared to how you'll be gouged by the rest of the island. The valet service was pretty great. Fast and friendly. The wireless internet NEVER worked in the room. Ok, that's a bit harsh. It would work for about 15 seconds. Long enough for me to connect, but not long enough to open a webpage. We weren't able to connect using the ethernet cable either. Housekeeping was the worst I've experienced in a while. We stay a total of 9 nights and only once did we receive new soap. And I'm certain that one time we did get soap, it was because our regular housekeeper took Christmas Eve off and we had someone new. I had to resort to robbing the housekeeping cart for a bar of soap every other day. Dirty dishes also sat in our room for three days until Christmas Eve. They also cleaned the rooms pretty late. A few instances we would leave early in the morning (6-8am) and return late in the afternoon (2-4pm) and find the room still had not been cleaned. Black rock was the main reason I had loved this hotel the first time around. There was nothing like starting out the day hopping in the ocean for some snorkeling. Unfortunately, the snorkeling was not as good this time around. There are not nearly as many fish, probably because feeding is no longer allowed. Plus, it's far too crowded and with people jump off the cliff every couple of minutes, I kept getting paranoid I was swimming to close and was about to get knocked out by a cliff diver. If you like to snorkel like I do, stay in Wailea. The hotel was not terrible. It was clean and provided the standard comforts you should expect from a Sheraton. But it was not a luxury hotel. It was priced far less than other options, so I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: newcomel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton the week before Christmas. We were in building 6, oceanfront room. The hotel is very nice, but huge. We loved our room and it was very modern and comfortable. The fridge and microwave area they give you is very large and handy for a run to Safeway to stock up on breakfast items and water. The walk to the pool is a bit far, but not too bad. The only negative thing about being in this building is you do feel isolated from the hotel lobby, pool and restaurants. But, this could be a good thing. Our room felt private and we didnâ€™t really see or hear anyone else. The parking was easy as the key to get in/out of the lot was used. The pool was nice. People do start reserving chairs early- 8 AM or sooner. The pool staff does come around with wristbands each day to signal who is a hotel guest. This is good in theory, but also makes you feel like a Springbreaker with the bracelet. The pool was nice, but the water is COLD. The beach is just steps away and we enjoyed renting a cabana for one day. The hotel staff was great at setting this up and in picking out a great beach spot. The rental is kind of pricey-- $40 a day. The only restaurant we ate at was the Sundowner bar for lunches. We found the food to be decent, although a little expensive but very convenient. The portions were huge so we ended up splitting a lunch. The coffee stand in the lobby area also serves excellent Kona coffee. There is so much to do in the area. The Whalerâ€™s Village is a short drive away- if you are in building 6 a drive is a must! Then the town of Lahaina is great for shopping and eating. We enjoyed our meal at Kimosâ€™s with the oceanfront view. We also went to Mamaâ€™s Fish house- which is about 45 minutes away but worth it. The food was amazing, although on the expensive side. We also went to the Old Lahaina luau which was good. The show was excellent as were the food and drinks. All in all the Sheraton is an excellent choice. I was able to get an excellent rate online and the room was under $200 a night!

Reviews.Title: “Tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: goreengo
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton has a great location, but the rooms are in need of an overhaul. They upgraded us to a corner ocean front room for free, which was awesome. It wasn't ready when we got there so they gave each of us a free drink. The bathtub clogged each use even after we had it fixed TWICE! The showers are tiny, the toilet seat was pealing and the toilet was loose. There was no desk in the room and no light on the balcony so we couldn't read out there after dark. However, the balcony was wonderful and had a great view-see pics. It's located right at the end of Kaanapali beach at black rock, which is a lot of fun to jump off of. It's also just a short walk to Whaler's Village. They offer "free" parking, internet, and paper, but charge a $20 per day resort fee. They also charge for a beach umbrella and chairs, which is so ridiculous! We just went to the ABC store and bought our own. I've stayed at the Westin before and would probably stay there again if I return to Maui. They have an amazing pool and their gym is at least twice as large as the Sheratons.

Reviews.Title: “horrible service”
Reviews.Author: mamake
Reviews.Content: If you plan to stay in this hotel, please read my review before you make a reservation. we stayed in Sheraton maui around thanksgiving for a wk. we booked the oceanfront room which is very far away from lobby area. I don't recommend for a family with small children to stay in oceanfront room. It takes about 3 elevators and at least 10-15 minutes walk to get to lobby. The next day after arrival, the weather was freezing cold. We came back to our room from swimming pool and found out that the room key was not working. I called the phone on our floor and no one answered. So, I have to take my two kids and walked all the way back to lobby. We had only swimsuits on and it was very cold. When we finally got to hotel, and there was a long line at the front desk. So I asked for help to a lady sitting at the information desk. This lady didn't even bother to get out of her desk. All she told me is that only the front desk people can help. I just have to wait in line for help. There I was with two small freezing kids. My kids were so freezing, and their lips turn purplish. The water from my swimsuit dripping down to the floor in the lobby. People passing by me were staring at me. None of the workers in the lobby offered to help us. I turn to look at the lady sitting at the information desk. She was staring at me, too. This was the most humiliating experience that I ever had in a hotel. I don't know how the people working in this hotel is trained in terms of customer services. I didn't expect this when I first booked the hotel. All I can say is that I will stay away from Sheraton Maui. We will come back to Maui for sure, but Sheraton Maui would definitely be the hotel that we avoid next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeckyBloomwood
Reviews.Content: We checked in to the Sheraton on 12/13/08 and departed on 12/19/08. I am 26 and my husband is 31. This was our first trip to Maui and we are Starwood Preferred members, so we booked directly with SPG for a rate of $330/night for partial oceanview (breakfast included). We have stayed in 5-star resorts before, but also do just fine in a Hampton Inn. My opinions and reviews are usually based on if I think the property was a good value for the money and if it met our expectations for the price we paid. Overall, I do not think the Sheraton is worth the money. If you want the luxuries, I would suck it up and pay the extra $100/night to stay at Fairmont Kea Lani. If you do not need the extra luxuries, I would save the extra money and stay in a condo. I would have been happier doing either of these options instead of the Sheraton. I will go into details below. Check-in: We were greeted with leis and check-in was seamless. We were upgraded to deluxe oceanfront (building 6). I read complaints about the commute from building 6 to the beach, but we decided to give it a try. The staff was very friendly. Rooms: We were in room 6410. It was really quiet and the walk to other parts of the resort was really not bad. However, I could see it would be a pain if you had kids or had mobility issues. The room was well-appointed and quite large. There was a mini-fridge and microwave. However, the mini-fridge was not on when we checked in. We did not find this out until we went to put a few items from Safeway in the fridge. It took more than 12 hours to cool down. I have never stayed in a hotel that did not have the refrigerator turned on for guests. This was annoying. When it finally did cool down, it never really got cold. We had deli meat, a pack of cheese, a small bottle of mustard, 2 bottles of water, and 2 beers. It was not full by any means. I would not keep milk in the fridge. Housekeeping was good and they replaced coffee and shower amenities daily. The view from our balcony was gorgeous! But, there was not an outside light. This was also another tiny negative, but it became a little irritating when we wanted to enjoy the view in the evenings. Sunset was between 5:45 and 6:00 pm. There are robes in the rooms to use, which were great Breakfast: Breakfast was included in our room rate and we were given coupons for each day we were there. The buffet offers a wide variety, but it pretty much stays the same everyday. I was a little disappointed in the fruit, because I thought the fruit would be really fresh with a good variety of tropical fruit. It was not that great-pineapple, cantaloupe, papaya, and strawberries. However, they had a great selection of fruit juices- I especially loved the guava juice. The pastries were really good, especially the banana bread. On the first day, they said they alternate the special stations every 3 days- omelets, waffles, and crepes. However, they only had the omelet station for the 6 days we were there. The buffet was around $23.95 and I would not have paid for it if not included in the rate. I would have kept a box of pop-tarts or pastries in the room. Pool/Beach: The pool and the beach are both great. We always got good seats at the pool, but we were usually down there by 8:30 am, since we were on east coast time. The resort was only 60% full and I bet it is a pain to get pool chairs when it is busy. The servers were friendly. The drinks and food were expensive, but that was expected. The cheapest thing to order for lunch was a basket of fries ($8). Tropical drinks were $10. Happy hour was 3-5 pm and they had pretty reasonable specials ($5 margaritas, $4 beers). We only had lunch by the pool once and we split the chicken parmesan wrap. ($15) It was big and pretty good. We usually had a couple drinks a day and they were always good. They only had one Jacuzzi, and I think a resort this size should have more than that. Also, the floats for the lazy river were $5/hour or $10/day. We did not rent them. Resort Charge: I knew about the resort charge in advance and was ok with it. However, I think they still nickel and dime you. I do not think you should have to rent a float for the lazy river if you are paying a resort charge. I think they need to pick one or the other. Also, there is not a computer to use with internet access. They have free wi-fi access included in the resort charge, but we did not want to lug our laptop to Maui. I think it is ridiculous to say they are a 4 star resort and not offer a computer with internet access. They do have a Mac in the lobby to print off boarding passes. Other: The shuttle service to Lahaina was always prompt and the driver always friendly. The grounds were beautiful. The spa was still not open, even though their sign says Sheraton Maui Resort & Spa. You can use the one at the Westin, though. Overall, the Sheraton is nice, but not worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Location”
Reviews.Author: BostonTravelers123
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that the location is unbelievable! The beach is cozy and beautiful, with wondeful snorkeling. The first day we arrived, we entered the water and were greated by turtles and flocks of fish within steps. For those braver and willing to swim a little further out around the rock, you will be rewarded with additional varieties of fish and even squid. The beach was definetly the best part of the resort. The parking valet guys were also terrific, and were always ready and willing with recommendations and/or directions. The staff at the front desk though, was another story. In particular, there was this one short and stout woman with shoulder length brown hair that appeared to really hate her job and made it clear that it was like pulling teeth if you presented her with anything but a credit card. On our first day, they had accidently given us an incorrect room (double bed instead of king), and she indicated that no king beds were available for the duration of our entire stay and to call Travelocity if we were dissatisfied (How strange? What hotel sends you back to a booking agent?). Being that we spent alot of money on the trip to Hawaii and were there for a romantic getaway, we were naturally confused and upset - especially since it was a slow period (between Thanksgiving and Christmas) and didn't know how they could possibly not have excess capacity or offer to upgrade us if need be to honor the bed type in the reservation. Nonetheless, we trucked up to our room and the valet brought our bags. I think he noticed our dissapointment, bc he asked us what was the matter, and within minutes he had the correct room. So moral of the story, most people are nice and willing to help. Avoid the jaded employees (and really..by jaded..i mean specifically her) and you will have a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller28London
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful location and we had to keep pinching ourselves that it was real and not a filmset! When you arrive, they give you real beautiful flower leis for free, which is a nice touch! The open air lobby gives spectacular views of the clear beach and cliffs. It really is like paradise. The snorkelling is a must with a sea-turtle just 6 ft off the beach! The pool is great for adults and children with great surroundings and a bar. There are lots of sunbeds to go around. Everynight at sunset, a native goes and lights the torches on black rock and gives an offering to the gods and then dives into the sea, definitely watch it and see the magnificent sunsets! We ate in the hotel for breakfast buffet and you couldn't want for anymore! So much choice. Definitely take advantage of the courtesy bus into Lahaina for restaurants/shops/souveniers etc. Go to bubba gumps and ask for a seat by the window! The whalers village is also just a short walk along a very picturesque ocean view path and has lots of shops and restaurants. Make sure you don't get a room by an evelator shaft as it can be noisy. The suites are very nice. The gym is a very long trek away from where our room was and isn't the best, you're better off running along the boardwalks! The luau was really lovely but you may be better off at a traditional one. Very friendly staff and everyone is accomodating!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Sheraton Maui!!”
Reviews.Author: hockeydad29
Reviews.Content: We had a FANTASTIC time at the Sheraton Maui! My wife and I went for our 15th anniversaryâ€¦ first time to Mauiâ€¦ and we were not disappointed. From the time we arrived, everyone we dealt with was extremely friendly and helpful. We had a deluxe oceanfront room in building 6. Yes, it is a bit of a hike to get from there to the restaurants and lobby, but it takes no more than 5 minutes at the absolute most, and who caresâ€¦ itâ€™s a lovely walk and youâ€™re in Maui!!! Our room was perfectâ€¦ it had a beautiful view (we saw the sea turtles swimming below our room each day), lots of space, and was very quiet. They maid service was impeccable, and the turndown service each night was very nice. The concierge desk was greatâ€¦ we booked parasailing (a must-do), a sunset cruise, and surf lessons through them, and they were extremely helpful with times and directions. Had the breakfast buffet each morning and loved itâ€¦ excellent variety and great service. Is there much better than enjoying your pancakes and Kona coffee outdoors in the sun with a gentle breeze? Had supper at the lagoon grill one evening, and the kobe beef burgers were really good. They donâ€™t normally serve fries out there, so our server made a special trip to the hotel kitchen for a basket of fries for us! The beach was really niceâ€¦ easily the best stretch along Kaâ€™annapali (sp?)â€¦ relatively calm, and pretty good snorkeling right around black rock. We swam with the turtles each dayâ€¦ very cool! Didnâ€™t eat much at the Sheraton other than breakfast, but Hula Grill, and Leilaniâ€™s down at Whalerâ€™s Village were both quite good. Our best meal out was definitely at the Lahaina Grill. You must goâ€¦ the lobster & crab cakes, and Steak Jolene were amazing, and the triple berry pie was quite possibly the best dessert Iâ€™ve ever had! If you are going to the Sheraton for a â€œromanticâ€� trip, do yourself a favour and book the â€œRomance In a Boxâ€� packageâ€¦ it included the sunset sail, a cabana rental, welcome champagne and nice robes, room upgrade (which we didnâ€™t use, but got them to throw in breakfast vouchers instead!), and a â€œdinner under the starsâ€�, which was the highlight of our trip. A private dinner with your own butler, at a moonlit and candlelit cabana just off the beach. The food and atmosphere were amazing!! I highly recommend it!! All in all, we had an amazing time, with absolutely no complaints. Even before we arrived, several staff members went out of their way to accommodate some special requests and ensure that our stay was all that we hoped it would be. I highly recommend the Sheraton Mauiâ€¦ we canâ€™t wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Pool was great!”
Reviews.Author: t_m_geelong
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui for 3 nights earlier this month, we booked a package with Expedia which included filghts at about 40% off. The Sheraton was good, not fantastic but nothing to complain about either. If I had have paid full price I probably wouldn't have been so happy. Coming from Wyland Waikiki where we received excellent service, the service at the Sheraton was average. I emailed the hotel to let them know that we would be early, when we arrived the receptionist looked at us like we had two heads! After a few hours of wondering what to do, we went for breakfast. This was lovely, however, was the most expensive breakfast of the trip at $25 each. This was a buffet, lots of variety and good service. I defenately agree with previous comments not to eat in the hotels surrounding. Catch the free bus into town, where prices are reasonable and there is good variety. The room was spacious, as was the bathroom. We had some ants in the bathroom but seemed to disappear without having to contact anyone. The pool and view were defenately highlights.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: sunflower12
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Sheraton as part of our honeymoon trip to Maui. On the first night we were disappointed as were given a handicap accesible room on the ground floor which was not very nice at all even though it was supposedly a "deluxe" ocean view room. When we asked to be switched to a regular ocean view room which is what we had reserved we were told by the front desk manager that none were available and that the only option would be to downgrade for a lower price to a mountain view room. We ended up doing that and found the mountain view room to be much nicer than the "deluxe" ocean view handicap accessible room. The following day we were switched to an oceanfront room in Building 6 which was lovely. As others have noted however, there is no direct access to Bldg 6 from the main property. You have to take a series of elevators and breezeways to get there. The views however are lovely, and there is a separate parking lot with key card access that is right in front of building 6. The breakfast buffet is wonderful, I would highly recommend it as there is a variety of food choices, including omelettes, fresh fruit, and rotating hot items. The room decor is very traditional Sheraton, not overly plush. The property grounds however, are beautiful. There is a large beachfront area, beautiful pools etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and environment”
Reviews.Author: TCarlton
Reviews.Content: A notch better than many sheratons by picking up the island feel quite well. Convenient location to shopping and restaurants. Very nice grounds, pool, and ocean access. Concierge staff is typical of most chain hotels they get about 80% right and mess up the rest in their haste to get to the next customer. Hotel restaurant and on premise food was average at best. Room was good with a great balcony. Pool was large and meandering. Beach/Ocean typical Maui - hard to get it wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled”
Reviews.Author: frequentdiner84
Reviews.Content: I spent months planning our honeymoon. Lots of time on the internet, going through reviews, books, websites, you name it, I did it. And boy, was I fooled into thinking that this hotel was going to show us a great Hawaiian experience. The website makes everything look great, with their majestic lighting and "evening cliff dive ceremony." The truth about that - anyone can, and will, jump off that cliff and its not as high as it looks. As far as the hotel....no spa, food isn't great, coffee bar closes, and staff isn't as warm as the other resorts we stayed in. Our room was small and we found bugs twice. Our "ocean front" room was on the other side of the resort, in which we had to travel up the elevator, over the breezeway, down the elevator again, around the resort, and back up the elevator, in order to get there. And by the way, there was a chain link fence in between our "unobstructed view" of the ocean.... Tons of kids, and the hot tub and swimming pool were not very great either. My biggest regret was listening to the reviews on here and not picking the Westin - with their beautiful landscaping and plush beds. Oh well, there's always next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but...”
Reviews.Author: reino80
Reviews.Content: My husband and I do a lot of traveling and have stayed at numerous Starwood hotel brands (Westins, Sheratons, etc). In our opinions, here are a few pros and cons about our stay at the hotel. Great location â€“ it seems the hotel has the largest area of beach (the other hotelâ€™s front a much narrower stretch of beach) and they have great snorkeling right off of Black Rock. Additionally, it is a short drive to Lahania (5 minutes). Nice pool â€“ pool was clean and offers both a kid friendly area and an adult friendly area. There is no swim up bar, but waitresses make rounds around the pool area. Food Quality â€“ the food is expensive, but we were pleased with the quality. The mixed drinks were good as well. The fish and chips by the pool is really tasty and can be split because it is such a large serving. Itâ€™s about $15. Room Balcony â€“ the balconies are very spacious and we had a wonderful view of the ocean from building 2. Resort Charge â€“ the resort charge is about $20 per day and we felt that this was fair given the fact that we had a car the entire length of our stay and we used the internet. If you donâ€™t use these services, though, you still have to pay it. The Staff â€“ they did not seem to be very helpful and were very short when answering most questions (except for the waitresses by the pool and a few of the bell men). They seemed bothered when we talked to them. Service on the Beach â€“ you are not allowed to drink on the beach so there are no waitresses. Also, lounge chairs on the beach must be rented ($10 per chair, $20 for an umbrella, and $50 for a cabana style lounge seating). Beds â€“ we were expecting a nice plush heavenly bed or something similar, however, the bed seemed really hard.

Reviews.Title: “Great first half of honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: polorun17
Reviews.Content: Overall we really enjoyed our 6-night stay at the Sheraton Maui. The lobby and grounds are all lovely and the beach and snorkeling area by Black Rock were first rate (though we must have snorkeled the one morning that the turtles weren't out! disappointing!). Our room in building 3 was adequate--no frills, no marble bathroom, 1 sink, 2 double beds, but it was oceanview with a pleasant balcony. We were prepared for the maze-like layout of the resort and appreciated that building 3 made for convenient access to the pool (but a rather long walk to self-parking garage). Room service menu was a total joke ($31 for a club sandwich!) and we didn't eat at the resort other than breakfast buffet which was included in our rate and had enough variety to keep it interesting for the week (highly recommend the coconut syrup on the pancakes!). Loved the location, 10-minute drive to Lahaina for shopping, dining, sightseeing, and Old Lahaina Luau; easy walk along pathway to other Kaanapali resorts and Whalers Village (where there's a handy ABC store for sunscreen, snacks, toiletries, etc.). Only a few criticisms and they were minor: having to swipe the magnetic card at the self-parking garage every time you enter and leave--this was a pain and we appreciated the Hyatt Kauai later in the week where the parking lot is card-free! For a resort as large as the Sheraton we felt there could be more restaurants on campus. There is no internet access at all at this resort (except to print out boarding passes); they sent us a few resorts down to the Westin where there are computers you can use with your credit card. (Westin is a totally different atmosphere--very cool and trendy, which was a nice change of pace.) Note that there is construction to building 4 where there is a spa going in on the first floor, but it was never an issue for us. We were pleased with our decision to stay here on the first leg of the trip and end on the high high note of the Grand Hyatt in Kauai. Would have probably been disappointed if we had done the order in reverse.

Reviews.Title: “Highly overrated, choose another hotel”
Reviews.Author: swizzlest
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui for our honeymoon for 10 days and it was a huge disappointment. We booked a King Room, they gave us a double with a view of the service walkway. They finally moved us 4 days in to a King with a partial ocean view, which was nice. The staff really seemed like they could have cared less, except for the valets, who seemed to be having a lot of fun. Nobody else really made any effort to make the trip special for us...employees frequently acted bothered to be there. I booked a special Dinner Under the Stars for my new wife and I, which was good, but the restaurant manager I booked with dropped off the face of the earth a week before the dinner and left me with no indication of what I needed to do to proceed -- it created added stress I did not need. The usual Maui tourist truisms hold here...the food is overpriced, mostly underwhelming, and the whole place is very expensive. It's a great location, though, and you can walk down to Whaler's Village for some SLIGHTLY cheaper alternatives. I usually stay at Marriott properties, and will definitely be returning there after my Sheraton experiment. I was very disappointed in the hotel and our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Other places in Maui are much better. Not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: CHRISTYHONOLULU
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my girlfriendâ€™s birthday retreat. The worst customer service I've ever encountered anywhere. Hotel staff incorrectly billed my rooms after multiple attempts of explanation on my part. Staff is incompetent, not polite, and unapologetic about their mistakes. I live in Hawaii for many years and have stayed all over Lahaina area, but this is not worth the $350 a night I paid. Very disappointing. Small room, rude staff, and I did not feel like I was in paradise at all. There are many other amazing hotels in the area worth the amount you pay. Please look elsewhere before booking. Don't make the mistake I did, equating price with value. I won't pay more than $100 a night to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK....except for the roaches”
Reviews.Author: mtnbikerScottsdale
Reviews.Content: The sheraton is a nice resort, very big. Not very Hawaiian. I booked an oceanfront room online --in bldg 6 which was supposed to have unobstructed views-- we were on the first floor with a fence obstructed view. Room needed dusting and we had roaches. We were moved the last day to another room. Bldg 6 is far from everything, but quiet. Don't expect the front desk to tell you how to get from bldg 6 to the rest of the resort or where anything is located (restaurants etc) as the staff are way to busy. You would think that they would .......and there was no staff to valet or help when I got there...had to park half way down the hill as the front circle was filled. Location is good. I didn't eat or drink there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location, bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: nyctraveler300
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton in mid-October. The hotel is beautiful. We were greeted by leis and were upgraded to ocean view in tower 4. We didn't have too much luggage so we decided to make our own way to the room and got completely lost! Getting around is a bit tricky until you get used to it, so definitely take advantage of the bell hop your first day. Valet parking was complimentary the first day, self parking was super easy and right next to our tower. We had a corner room with two lanais which was nice. The resort is quiet and has an amazing pool and beach. The only thing that was really pricey was the cost of renting umbrellas/lounges on the beach. You'd think the $20/day fee might cover that. Drinks and food were tasty, def take advantage of their drink specials. Snorkeling was amazing in the morning. The view from the 8th floor is breathtaking as it is everywhere from the resort. Nice distance to Lahaina and Whalers Village - the shuttle was pretty convenient. We also enjoyed the luau on the property. The time share calls were a bit annoying. We loved the Sheraton though and found leaving the property pretty hard!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but expensive”
Reviews.Author: defiant_angel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Maui resort with a group of about 75 people as part of a recognition program through work. The hotel was beautiful but everything there is very expensive. $10.00 for a beer, $15.00 for a burger (and you pay extra if you want fries). I stayed in building 6 which has its pros and cons. The ocean view cannot be bat. I saw the "ocean view" from buildings 2 and 3 and it was good but you had to look over the grass, trees, and pool to see the ocean. Building 6 is a true ocean view, looking over 10 feet of grass and then ocean. The big con to building 6 is that it is a long walk to get to the beach or lobby or anywhere else. From the lobby you need to take 3 elevators and walk quite a bit, I would still say the view is worth it. We were there in MArch which is mating season for the humpback whales and we would sit on our lanai drinking coffee in the morning and watching the whales play, amazing experience. The short walk to whalers village is well worth it a neat little place with some great shopping! The snorkelling at black rock is terrific and there are several sea turtles that hang around so you are sure to see them! Just be careful when you get to the tip of the rock as the rocks look far away when you are looking under the water but when you pop your head up they are right there and the waves will push you into them...ouch! My only complaint is that they do not allow you to smoke anywhere other than the beach which causes lots of cigarette butts on the beach and is also a pain. Smoking on the lanais should be aloud but a small price to pay for the beautiful resort!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Sammk
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 night in mid-October and had the best time. They were kind enough to upgrade up to an Ocean Front suite from an Ocean View standard. It was our 20 year anniversary. They gave us a bottle of champagne and a corner room with a view of Black Rock, the Luau and the Ocean. Whaler's village is wonderful. Cheaper foods (i.e. McDonalds, Pizza, Taco's etc), plus Hula Grill and Leilani's. We did the UFO Parasail and those guys (and girl) were terrific. I would recommend that to anyone in the Kaanapali area. Wyatt and crew were great to work with on the boat. Snorkelling in the breaking waves at Black Rock was great. Adults and kids were having a blast. Turtles and fish were easily noticed by all. Food and drink were expensive, but I was aware of that before we left. Make sure you have a couple of extra bucks for the Lagoon bar or the main restaurant. Lahainia is a 5 mintue drive and has shops galore if you need a souviner or two. We didn't stop by the hotel shops. I would love to come back and spend all my vacation here instead of splittling it between islands. We rarely left the location as the beach and people were the best.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for first time in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Applejax
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Maui so the Sheraton's location was the best choice we could've made. It was nice to stroll along the paved pathway into Whaler's Village or take a short drive to Lahaina for more options. Being an SPG member definitely got us some good treatment. This resort is couples-friendly, which I appreciated. The adult pool is calm and peaceful and the beach is extremely easy to access. Pros: - Ample parking close to our tower - Well insulated rooms, very quiet - Couples Friendly - Fridge was a life saver - Location, location, location - Breakfast Buffet was our best meal on the island - Friendly bartenders made great drinks - Discreet Housekeeping Cons: - Annoying daily call to visit the Starwoods Vacations desk (timeshares) - Coffee stand was a total ripoff ($4 for a Yoplait Yogurt?!) - Poolside food was expensive and quality was blah - Could use more pillows - Beach Cabana service should include Ice Bucket If we stay in Kaanapali again I would definitely consider the Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: collins26050
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sheraton Maui 9/27 - 10/4 and loved it. We've previously stayed at Kaanapali Beach Hotel, Westin, Sands of Kahana and Aston Kaanapali Shores. The Sheraton is now our favorite. Second favorite is Kaanapali Beach Hotel. After an initial problem with our reservation, my husband had a talk with the manager and they upgraded us to an ocean view. We were thrilled as this was a special trip for us. We were renewing our vows on our 15th wedding anniversary. They send a bottle of champagne to the room when we told them about the special occasion. The room was very nice - large, with a very comfortable bed. Lanai was also pretty good size. Yes, the food is pricey. We only ate one meal there - the Prime ib dinner buffet. The dinner was okay - no great but not bad either. The pool was fantastic - it had a long winding river from an upper pool to a lower pool and a small slide. Lots of space around the pools for the loungers. Large grassy area next to the buildings was nice and gave an open feel to the place. The Lagoon Bar was good with good food and drinks.
