The first night we sat at the bar, watched the sunset with the cliff diver lighting the tiki torches on black rock. After he dived off of Black Rock, a fire dancer danced in front of us at the bar. Black Rock which has excellent snorkeling if right in front of the hotel. We sat on the beach frequently throughout the week. You can rent a cabana for $40 or umbrella for $20 & lounges for $10 each. After 1:30, the rental is half price. It is also a very close walk to Whaler's Village where we went several times for lunch and dinner. The Sheraton also has a shuttle to Whaler's Village and one to Lahaina as well. The location can't be beat with Lahaina in one direction and Napili and Kapalua the other direction. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CCA083108
Reviews.Content: We booked our room and flight using Expedia and encountered many problems with them, including the airline loosing our luggage because of the flight we were given (they booked us an illegal transfer to our connecting flight, so our luggage didn't have enough time to get on the other plane). It was bit of a bummer when we checked into our hotel room to find out that the bed we requested for was not available. They said nothing is guaranteed through Expedia. Again, Expedia's fault! I would have rated excellent for this hotel, but we didn't have a King size bed right away. We requested a King size bed, but they only had a room with 2 double size beds available for us. It was either we take that and get upgraded to the Mountain view from the the Garden view, or we pay an additional $300 plus a night for a room with a King size bed. What was even more frustrating, we were on our honeymoon, and they weren't the least concerned with our situation. So, we had to stick it out with the double beds for two nights. It was nice, but too small for us to sleep comfortably. Finally, we were put in a king size bedroom but downgraded back to the Garden view room. Sooooo much better! Not only was it bigger, it was closer to the beach (we were on the bottom floor), and closer to the parking garage (we rented a car so we were constantly in and out). After that, our stay in the hotel was much much better =) We went to the Kaanapali beach everyday (so convenient) and snorkling right next to Black Rock. We even saw very huge and friendly turtles! They just practically swim right next to you. We went to Lahaina to eat. Cute town. It's about a 10 minute drive or less away. Try Aloha Mixed Plate (great local food and reasonably priced) and Cheeseburgers in Paradise (sooo good). Also, if you love sushi, you definitely have to go to Sansei Seafood Restaurant in Kihei (make a reservation first because it gets really packed in there during their 25% sushi, appetizers, and entrees hour). We also went to the Old Lahaina Luau (worth the money...great show and great food). Just please don't use Expedia! Too many problems with them and pointless. No guarantees and poor customer service! I called the night that we encountered or problems, and they blamed us instead for not checking with the hotel to make sure we have the room requested as well as not making sure we have our flights confirmed. How are we supposed to know that it's an illegal transfer... Overall, had a great Honeymoon and loved Maui! I used TripAdvisor to book this hotel, and all the reviews I read were true and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The best Anniversary & Vacation ever.. Will be back soon!!”
Reviews.Author: vacatyme
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 1/2 week stay here & was ABSOLUTLEY AMAZING & WONDERFUL..arrival was great, check-in was great. Everyone at the resort that we dealt with were kind & helpful with any need. We had gone here for a vacation & since it was around our anniversary, we made the best of it. My husband planned 3 days of anniversary dinner celebrations for us, one was a "Romantic" dinner for 2 under the stars outside. It will be one dinner nite I'll never forget. Our server was on top of everything that he had to do to make the nite special. this resort offers these type of dinners for that special day, if you think thIs will be good for you, i recommend you do it, you wont be disappointed. A lil pricey though.. As for our room, we had the best view of the sun rise & sunset. Looked right out at Black Rock and the beach. Could see the pool and down the beach from room too. Please give this place a try if you really want a do-nothing vacation. THIS IS PARADISE. We are planning to return very soon cause we didnt want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Escape from Ike”
Reviews.Author: blyle
Reviews.Content: We booked this property a year in advance and the prices dropped 2 weeks before we left. We called and they reduced the price but unbeknownst to me my hubby upgraded us since it was our anniversary. We were lucky enough to get a Jr. Suite. Little did we know that Hurricane Ike was on its way to our home in Houston. The hotel was very helpful in getting us up to date info so we could monitor the situation. I kept telling everyone that they told us to evacuate so we did, TO MAUI!!!!! Upon arrival we were greated with flower and shell leis, car was valet parked ( complimentary the first evening). We were personally excorted to our luxurious suite! The resort was spotless! We saw some tiny ants, called and they were gone within the hour! Comp coffee was delicious! We had a huge bathroom , double sinks, separate tub and shower, Double Lanai w/ table chairs, lounge and small table with doors to bedroom and living room, oceanfront view, microwave, extra murphy bed in wall, huge closets, safe, robes, iron & board and wonderful toiletries. Each night there was entertainment including the cliff diving ceremony! Many came to watch it every night. We snorkeled Black Rock and it was great! We also did a Trilogy snorkel trip but not to Molokini. We did the 2 snorkel trip and it was some of the best snorkeling we've done. Everyone at the Sheraton was so kind, welcoming and friendly. Everyone is so happy it's contagious! We could have earned extra starpoints if we went to the starwood properties presentation but we chose not to. Since we had a refrigerator we bought muffins and pastries and papaya juice to eat on the lanai every morning before be ventured out sightseeing. We loved the coffee and tea selections in our room and did not need a big breakfast! We ate most meals on Front St. in Lahaina, De longhis, Bubba Gumps, Lahaina fish co and others! There is every type of food you desire at all prices. The location is great! The Sheraton was renovating the laundry area to be the new Spa. We originally booked a deluxe OF room on Black Rock and because we upgraded, our suite was closer to Whalers VIllage. I must admit that the when we walked to Bldg 6 (our original room) I understood why some felt it was far away! It is!! The rooms would be lovely during whale season! Apparently there is an abundance of whales off the Lanai's of Bldg 6 and that would be worth the walk . Our car was self-parked in the parking garage very near our room. When we opened our door in the AM we saw sunrise and at night on our Lanai we saw sunset. It was Perfect!!! We drove to every other part of Maui and viewed the hotels in all price ranges. We really like the Kaanapali area because you are close to everything! The Wailea area was off the beaten path and it seemed it would take a while to get anywhere! You would have to have a car! Gas is now $4.69 /gal so being near everything was a definite plus. We rented a car and did all the drives including Hana to the end!!! It took us 7 hrs total but we stopped and saw many sights!!! We drove to Haleakala for sunset and then stopped at Mama's Fish house for Lunch!! We also drove the winding road from Wailuku to Kapalua and that was an unexpected treat. We stopped at the Art Gallery and then at Julias for Banana Bread and Lorraines for Shave Ice and good conversation. It was worth the trip!!! We visited many out of the way beaches and snorkeled everywhere we could! There isn't enough room to tell everything we did! I would stay at the Sheraton Maui in a heartbeat! The property is lovely, the entertainment is wonderful! They have a luau that is heavily attended on the lawn and we had a great view from our Lanai. It seems everyone wants to attend the Old Lahaina Luau but the Sheraton's right on the beach looked wonderful!! We hope to return again to Maui and will definitely stay at the Sheraton! Note: they now issue different colored wristbands to prevent non guests from taking up all the poolside chairs. They do a great job of policing their property and we appreciated the fact that we always found a lounge chair poolside! We had a wonderful Annversary and our home survived Hurricane Ike with only a few minor repairs needed! I highly suggest that everyone evacuate to the Sheraton Maui if they can!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love Sheraton Maui”
Reviews.Author: bri11164
Reviews.Content: We are 43 and have stayed in the Caribbean 11 times: Aruba, Bahamas, Cancun, Playa del Carmen, Dominican Republic, and Jamaica as well as a couple of cruises. We stayed at the Sheraton Maui hotel September 9, 2008 â€“ September 14, 2008. AIRPORT- no issues. We flew Hawaiian Airlines from Kona, Big Island to Kahului, Maui international. 20 min flight no issues, comfortable plane, on time. HOTEL â€“ Located in Kaanapali 40 minutes west of Kahului airport (easy drive) and 10 minutes from Lahaina. It is in a hotel zone Kaanapali Parkway which has 7 hotels all within walking distance of each other. Hyatt, Marriott Ocean club, Westin etc. Also, in this area is Kaanapali Golf Course and the Whalers Village shopping center. This is all connected by a cement boardwalk that follows the beach all the way from one end Hyatt to the Sheraton Maui. If you have ever been to Aruba it is like there hotel zone. Grounds were very picturesque and immaculate. Pool area is free form and winds throughout the property approximately 100yds long. Starts at deep end (8ft) which is adjacent to the Sundowner bar and winds its way to shallow end (with kiddie pool level) and the Lagoon Bar. Even has a little slide to bring you from one level of pool to the other. Hidden along the way is a Jacuzzi. Beautiful pool area. Unfortunately due to layout of pool not enough chairs if hotel is at high capacity. Hotel was fairly busy and if you were not out to pool early you would probably not get your preferred spot. Some chairs had umbrellas. Waitress service at pool was excellent. Can even have lunch brought right to your chairs. Food was pretty good. ROOMS â€“ Paid $500/night which included breakfast buffet for 2 each morning ($46/day value). This was top room ocean view in building 4 directly in front of black rock. We were on 3rd floor. Nice room, roomy, king bed, flat screen HDTV, refrigerator, safe (free), bathrobes, and small bathroom with funny sliding door (like a patio door). Plenty of drawer space but not much closet space. Closet is in the bathroom. Good size balcony with 2 chairs and table with great view of ocean/beach. They have rooms as low as $250. When you check in, which you do right at the valet desk, they give you 3 extra key cards in addition to your room keys. One is for the self park area (canâ€™t get in out without it) and the other 2 are towel cards. You trade them in at the towel hut (by pool) for towels. Then when you bring towels back you get the cards back. They will not give you towel without card. You can ask for more cards at front desk, which we did as we got 2 more cards. Valet is free first night then they charge you daily after that. DINING â€“ We only ate the breakfast buffet at the Kekaâ€™a Terrace (part of our package) 4 of 5 mornings we were there. Breakfast buffet was excellent. All the usual breakfast options with a Omelet station every day, pancakes, waffles, ham, hash, fajitas, fresh fruit and breads, juices etc. This restaurant is open air and has a number of table on patio. There are always birds flying around as the open air design does not prevent them from flying around. If this will annoy you do not eat here for breakfast. We had lunch at Lagoon bar a couple of days and food was good. Too many choices nearby and down in Lahaina town to eat at hotel (which was pricey). At Whalers village, 5 min walk from hotel along boardwalk, we ate at the Hula Grille 2 nights. Once at bar and once in dining area. They have different menus. Both times food was very good and service was good. Also had a late night snack at Leilaniâ€™s, next door to Hula grille, which was good. Both of these are beach front restaurants most of seats being open air. One night took in the Old Lahaina Lua which was fun. Entertaining and buffet food was pretty good, drinks were plentiful. . BEACH â€“ Very nice beach. This hotel has the biggest beach of all the hotels in this Kaanapali Parkway area. In fact the closer you get down toward the Marriott and Hyatt the smaller (narrower) the beach gets. Unfortunately hotel charges $40/day for 2 chairs and umbrella. They will only charge you a half day rate if it is 1pm or later. My advice is to go to Snorkel Bobâ€™s in downtown Lahaina and for $35 you can rent 2 chairs (short chair style), umbrella and a collapsible cooler for the entire week. Unless you need to have the chaise lounge style chair this is better way to go. This is a public beach so there will always be people here who are not staying at Sheraton as it is well known for some of the best snorkeling in Maui due to Black Rock. Snorkeling is fabulous. They rent gear right at pool or you can rent that at Snorkel Bobâ€™s as well (cheaper). Donâ€™t even need to go on snorkeling cruise as you will see all kinds of fish right here. There is even a family of 4 turtles which feeds on the coral off Black Rock in about 3-4 feet of water right off the beach. They swim within 1 foot of you as you are watching them. Maui was the perfect combination of relaxation, beach and night life for us. Downtown Lahaina has about a 1 mile (Front Street) stretch of shops, restaurants and bars for your entertainment. If you have never been to Maui definitely get a car to explore the island.

Reviews.Title: “Words and photos will not do it justice!”
Reviews.Author: Gugeen
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Maui is fantastic beyond words. We had an Ocean View Room on the Black Rock where the sun set just in front of us. The room was spotless and really big with a large balcony, and the kingsize bed was very comfortable. The staff were so friendly and very obliging. The breakfast is class and the food in the evenings is delicious. The amenities are brilliant and it is so tranquil and relaxing. A brilliant honeymoon destination and cannot recomend it highly enough. Photos do not do it justice. Johnny and Lisa

Reviews.Title: “Loved Living in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: 2ferfun
Reviews.Content: We Loved our first stay in Maui aka Paradise. We loved our 8 day stay at the Sheraton and would go back in a heart beat. Even with the few "notsoperfect" things. We had originally booked a King size bed and rcvd 2 queens (but after seein the amazing view we had didnt want to risk a worse view) and we were charged vallet for 2 days we actually didnt use it, but after such great service specially by the vallets we didnt even bring it up. We took the Teralani snorkel cruise and LOVED it, but were a bit spoiled with the amazing snorkeling right at black rock. We saw several turtles and sting rays and it made all the money we spent well worth it. We didnt eat at the Sheraton other than breakfast and a few drinks. Loved Leilanis just down the beach at Whalers village. We cant wait to go back and hopefully this time during whale season, tho we are a bit leary of having to deal with crowds of people which we heard about from other travelers that had been there during that time. But we loved the Sheraton and would definately recommend it to a friend!!

Reviews.Title: “Not sure why this place gets all the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: bkp21
Reviews.Content: As a Starwood Gold member, maybe I got a little more attention than the average tourist may have gotten, but overall, this property does not deserve all the negative press it has received on this website. Overall, the staff was courteous, friendly and helpful. I can honestly say that we didn't have a single negative experience with the staff during our stay. The pros: great location, nice property, well maintained grounds, nice rooms, great views. The cons: pricy restaurant and drinks. I would highly recommend this property to folks looking for a good time in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Offhand staff cause a downgrade”
Reviews.Author: winnoSydneyAustralia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are experiencing some of the surliest, unhelpful staff we have come across in 50 years of international travel. Initially no action was taken after I pointed out that the refrigerator was unnecessarily noisy. After I approached the reception staff 8 hours later the refrigerator was replaced. The breakfast is no more than 2 star but the petit filet on the dinner menu was superb both times we selected it. The room is good, has a spacious balcony and overlooks the pool and gardens. But our 11 night stay here is spoiled by the poor attitude of ALL the service personnel. That attitude "this customer is interfering with the enjoyment of my day" seems to have filtered through to most other aspects of the hospitality industry here. Little wonder that the tourist industry in Hawaii is in a downturn. This is our 20th trip to the U.S. and our 6th to Hawaii. We have just returned from 3 weeks in China , a week in Singapore and a week in Indonesia. In all those destinations service with a smile is normal and the customer, who ultimately pays the wages of the staff, is made to feel welcome. We will not be returning to the U.S.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon dissapointment at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Lazarazu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui last week for 5 nights as part of our honeymoon. We had only booked a garden view room due to cost and after reading the many reviews on here from people who were upgraded for free, we thought we'd try our luck too. After all we were on honeymoon and it doesn't get more special than that! We arrived around 11:30pm and when my husband asked about the possibility of us being upgraded as we had just got married we were told flatly NO, that there wasn't anything available. We went to our garden room which was pleasant enough but it had 2 small double beds in, not exaclty what you want on honeymoon! The next day my husband went to reception to say he wasn't happy with the room and wanted one with 1 larger bed. He was told he could upgrade to a oceanview room with a kingsize bed but it would cost him $50 per day. We decided to upgrade and whilst I know that we only booked a garden view room and we shouldn't have expected anything different without paying, I feel very dissapointed that so many other people seem to have received special treatment. It's not even like the hotel was busy and they didn't have room to upgrade us for free. I heard many people say how quiet the place was. We found the breakfast buffet expensive compared to other places and didn't really like the fact that the bar's closed at 9pm. Overall the hotel wasn't bad at all. We had a lovely relaxing time there. The upgrade business just put a bit of a downer on it for me though. I would love to return to Maui one day although sadly I don't think I'll be staying at the Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Pure Paradise, Tick on the "before you die list"”
Reviews.Author: chazzman111
Reviews.Content: This resort is an unbelivable place. Clean, Fresh and very well maintained gardens, rooms and buildings in general. We stayed here for our Honeymoon in August 2008. 10 nights and were lucky enough to have breakfast thrown in the form of a voucher. Not sure how but glad we did as it would of been $25 each other wise. I emailed the sheraton before our arrival, this was to say we are coming on our honeymoon what can you do to make our stay magical. This i think is where the breakfast came from, also two bottles of champane they put in the room helped! We stayed in building 6 room 6518, building 6, floor 5, room 18.. wonderful room, large, very clean, bathroom well stocked and clean and a view to die for. From our balcony you could see a turtle every morning around 8am swim past, we would say hi every morning.... The walk from building 6 is not far, yes 10 minutes up and down lifts but i feel this makes the holiday, there are a number of ways to go and you can loko at wonderful plants and animals en route so all the talk on here is just down to lazy people i feel... we loved the walk. Pool was nice although chairs are gone under umbrellas by 6.30am... beach is a must, BUY A SNORKEL you wont be dissapointed and take the free shuttle bus to Lahina town, go to Kobe steak house,.......amazing... We will stay here again, the place is fantastic and the locals are very polite....

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Vacation”
Reviews.Author: pnaj
Reviews.Content: Had a really nice 10 nights at Sheraton Maui Aug 29 - Sept 8. Resort is located on one of the best beaches on Maui, definitely best beach of Kaanapali resort. Room (oceanview, 4th floor, bldg 3) was clean and had excellent view. Housekeeping did a nice job at about the same time (9am) every day. Our room was not the absolute most quiet as we could hear (on occasion) people in the rooms upstairs/adjacent as well as building (HVAC?) noise at night but in general we slept fine. Waking up at dawn to the blue and pink streaks of light out over the water in the distance made up for small amounts of noise. (However, not sure what the fuss is about regarding the Sweet Sleeper Bed. It seemed like nothing more than an ordinary, many-times-slept-in bed.) Food at the hotel is dull and pricey but convenient. Ask for "Old Style" Mai Tai if you are looking for the original Mai Tai with a little kick rather than the fruitier modern version. Breakfast buffet was $19.95 for cold buffet, $24.95 for hot buffet. Alternatives for breakfast are the other hotels on Kaanapali (Westin, Marriot, Hyatt Regency) or going to the ABC store at Whalers Village for individual serving sizes of cereal, milk, delicious papaya, yogurt, etc. Nice mini fridge in room. The biggest draw for us (late 40's-early 50's couple traveling alone) is the beach. Beach cabanas (double wooden chaise lounge with fabric hood as shown on sheraton-maui.com) are $40.00 per day. Swimming is perfect in normally calm, crystal clear water. For a few days there was an increased swell and actually some 3 foot breakers but the usual calm gentle rolling water returned. It's an absolutely wonderful place to do nothing: get up in the morning and have breakfast of some sort, go to the beach early, have lunch poolside and then back to the beach, cocktails at the end of the day while watching the sunset with the cliff diving ceremony. We did not even get a car on this trip. A cab to Kapalua ($60 r/t with tip) or Lahaina($40 r/t with tip) is a fine way to go when we felt like going farther afield for dinner. We figured the cost was about the same as renting a car for the day and was much easier than driving. This is our 3+ stay at the Sheraton after having stayed at the Kapalua Bay Hotel (no longer there), Kapalua Villas, Marriott and Maui Prince (in Makena/Wailea area) and it was the best vacation we've ever had. Lots of families with small kids, lots of couples (young and older) and just a great time for everyone. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, expect a lot of walking.”
Reviews.Author: jh1223
Reviews.Content: The gounds are very spacious and beautiful. We stayed at the Ohana Suite and our ocean view was spectacular. Ohana suites are very close to the Keiki pool so it worked out well for us. We came to stay at the Sheraton because Westin was a bit too commericalized (timeshare promo) and very crowed. The buildings( 1-6?) at Sheraton are very separated so you might be doing a lot of walking. Watch out if you are going with a large party, make sure everyone is in the same building. The hotel took out the previous coin operated laundry room for the future SPA so plan accordingly. Expect to pay $$$ for Sheraton dining. We lucked out because kids eat free under 12. We probably will go back again. I just wish they would upgrade the rooms a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Stay in Maui”
Reviews.Author: MDJDenver
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 nights at the Sheraton. Overall the stay was above average. We paid $350 plus taxes and $22 resort fee for a deluxe ocean front room. The room was well sized with a large lanai overlooking Molokai and Lanai islands. The room was equipped with double sinks, separate WC and standard tub/shower combo. The products are Bliss (same as used in other Sheraton properties with spas). A small fridge and micro were available. The bed was very comfortable (sweet sleeper standard in all Sheraton properties) and sheets were soft. The room was clean and an excellent value for Maui. On several mornings we watched dolphins and turtles from the lanai. Housekeeping was spot on every day. The grounds and pools were beautiful. Chairs were hard to come by most mornings at the main pool due to those "reserving" and not using the chairs. The pool attendants were quite good about moving belongings if the chairs were unattended for more than 30 minutes. Service at the pool was hit or miss and quite expensive. They do have iced lemon water available at the pool side bar. Shade is at a premium so get there early and plan to not leave for more than 30 minutes if you want to keep it all day. Cabanas can be reserved (book very early - prior to arrival) at $75/day and double loungers/umbrella on the beach for $45/day. The beach is very nice but crowded due to the black rock location which attracts many who want to snorkel and jump from the cliff. There was an activity shop near the beach to rent snorkel or other gear such as boogie boards. Room service is very expensive (eggs benedict, french toast, two juices and coffee was $95). Win or tropical drinks were $10/per and up. The location is a quick stroll to Whalers Village for spots to dine (at reasonable cost) and a few higher end stores and boutiques. Once of the best meals of the trip (we didn't venture further than where we could walk) was at Tropico at the Westin. Imaginative food with an excellent and well priced wine list. We enjoyed the quiet atmosphere of the lobby location with limited tables (more intimate and quiet). A short 10 minute drive will take you to the Cannery Mall with a Long's drugstore (gifts at a fraction of the cost of the hotel gift shop) and a Safeway. There is a Costco near the airport which we will use on our trip in December. We enjoyed our stay and would return for the right rate. We will be spending 10 days over the Christmas and New Years holidays but won't pay $700/night (high season rate for same room type) for the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but with some problems”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysUp4Travel
Reviews.Content: The hotel property is very nice, but not very well planned. If you stay in an ocean front view room in building 6 or farther, plan on a ~15 minute walk to get to the lobby, restaurants, pool. The buildings on the property are not connected by one consistent floor. From the 5th floor on building 6, you have to take the elevator down to the 3rd floor, walk through the breezeway connecting to the next building, take an elevator up to the 8th floor, walk down a long hallway, take another elevator to the 1st or 2nd floor, then walk through another long hallway and breezeway, just to get to the lobby area. It's really ridiculous and should have been planned better. The view from building 6 is great if you want an ocean front view. If you book an ocean front room, be sure to not be placed in building 4......those rooms seem more like pool view than ocean front, though you can see a bit of the ocean beyond the pool area. Also, I did see a mouse in the hallway when returning to my building one night. The luau held on the property is very nice, better than expected and worth seeing. The concierge desk stayed pretty busy, so prepare to wait a bit. The spa was closed for renovations, so I went down the street to the spa at the Westin, which I highly recommend! The Westin looks really nice, maybe consider staying there. The Sheraton was OK, but there are other hotels along the same street, and if I were returning to the area, I'd try a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A trip to Paradise”
Reviews.Author: ktkmPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived in our room at the Sheraton Maui Resort, we felt like we were in paradise. The staff was wonderful, making us feel very special. The blue water was breathtaking. We could not imagine a more magnificent setting and plan to return as soon as we possibly can. We can't stop talking about our dream vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay was great”
Reviews.Author: Hmbdude
Reviews.Content: My family and my brother's family just completed a week long stay at the Sheraton Maui Resort. Overall, it was excellent and we had a great time. I am a half full rather than half empty person and roll with the punches but even so, we like to stay in nice places and this was definitely a nice place. The rooms were fine, the grounds and pool were great, the snorkeling was excellent, the people were nice and competent. There were a few minor issues, like there was some construction going on in a neighboring building, a gift basket didn't get delivered on time, a local flipped me off for waiting a minute for a parking space (which happens anywhere in our country) but what the hey, we were on vacation in a beautiful place. Why spend your time whining about little things when you are in paradise ;-) I have no hesitancy wanting to go back and strongly recommend the resort. We ate one meal there, it was ok, nothing to write home about, as we preferred to eat elsewhere. The only thing I would probably do is not go there during a peak period, just because I heard it can be crowded then.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: estone1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Sheraton for our honeymoon. It was the perfect place to stay! Right on the beach, food was good, an a very helpful staff when it came to organizing excursions on the island. We had not rented a car, and the concierge helped book us for snorkel trips and bike adventures that had transportation from the hotel. We were also at this hotel when the earthquake struck, and the hotel lost power for most of the day. The staff was very helpful with food, etc- and it didn't seem like we even missed the power at all! Everything was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Summer05
Reviews.Content: After a wonderful stay at the Sheraton Maui last year, I am sorry to say that this year's stay was stressful, to say the least. Let me start off by saying that the grounds, pool, and beach are very nice. The rooms are just average (in need of refurbishment), but I knew that already. The housekeeping, restaurant staff, and bellmen were all great. However, the management team that we dealt with were VERY poor. I am a Starwood member and use Starwood hotels 2-3 times per year on vacations. I have always been very pleased with the treatment at their hotels. Last year, I booked a gardenview room at the Maui Sheraton and received an upgrade to Building 6, which is deluxe oceanfront. This year, I booked a gardenview at a discounted rate and knew that we may get an upgrade, but also knew it wasn't guaranteed. This is what happened. We arrived at noon and were told to come back at 3, as our room wasn't ready. No problem. We gave our keys to the valet and were told to leave our luggage in the car, lock it, and it would remain in the lot by the valet desk. They also told us that we would be in building 6. Since we hadn't expected that, we were very excited! We returned to the front desk at 3, only to be told that our room STILL wasn't ready. Hard to believe, since we arrived at noon that they couldn't get ONE room ready for us by 3pm! We were then told that we would be in building 3 in a mountainview room (which is same as gardenview, but on 3rd floor). I asked why we had been told that we were in building 6, then changed, and was told by Brandon, the Asst. Man., that they had the right to do that. We then went to find our car, but no one knew where it was! Finally, we were told that it had been moved to the parking garage with ALL of our luggage left in the car! Very upsetting, as we had been told it would stay in sight of the valet desk. Went back to Brandon expressing how upset I was about the room being changed, room not being ready, and now car being moved with our things still in it! He said he sympathized, but could do ABSOLUTELY NOTHING about any of it!! I asked if we could just get a room in building 3 that faced the pool, but he declined. Funny, I had just heard them tell a lady that just checked in that she had been upgraded from gardenview to oceanview, but he coudn't do anything for us, who had been there at NOON! I told him that I was going to call Starwood, as we had never received such poor service at a Starwood facility before. Went to our room, called, and was transferred to Sheraton Corporate Headquarters. Robert acknowledged our many stays and said he would contact the hotel. MIRACULOUSLY, within 30 minutes, Brandon phoned to say that he had just had an opening in Building 6 that we could be moved into. We were then moved. Keep in mind that I wasn't upset just because we didn't get Building 6---I didn't even ask for Building 6. I was upset that we were told we were in it, then changed, in addition to the room not being ready and the car missing. I thought that once we moved, things would settle down. WRONG! Next day, my friend called and asked if I had received the gift basket she had ordered from the Sheraton. No we hadn't. She called and spoke with the manager of that department, who was also not very well trained on dealing with customers. What if she hadn't called? She may have been charged and never known we didn't receive it! He told her that it had been sent to our first room in Building 3 BEFORE our arrival, but we had switched rooms so didn't get it. NOT TRUE, because we WERE in that room and there was NO gift basket. When she asked him for the name of his superior, he refused to tell her! He did tell her he would send an additional gift basket with the one she ordered. The additional basket ended up being 2 waters, 2 cans of pop, and 2 small bags of chips. Why bother? The first basket that she had ordered came first with NO card even attached! My friend then spoke to Allison, another manager, who did acknowledge the error and removed the charge from my friend's credit card. Day 3, I went to talk to Allison and thanked her for taking care of my friend's situation. We had a brief conversation about the events at check-in and she made SURE to remind me that I had booked a gardenview and should not have expected building 6, even if I had been told I had it. She also had an excuse for everything I had complained about. Her objective, clearly, was to make sure I understood that I was in the wrong and didn't acknowledge any wrongdoing on the part of the hotel. The main reason I went to see her was to see about staying another night, since our first day had been ruined by the lengthy and stressful checkin. She was gracious about giving us another night at the rate we already paid. I told her I would gladly change rooms, but she kept us in the same one. In retrospect, I wish we just would've left when scheduled, because her attitude toward me was one of scolding a little child, NOT of trying to make a guest's experience more positive. This is a minor detail, but I had also been assured when I booked that we would have an acknowledgment of our anniversary, but that never happened either. Needless to say, I won't be back to the Sheraton. I have read online and in the Honolulu Advertiser about how Maui has been making tourists feel unwelcome, lately. The management at the Sheraton did a GREAT job of making us feel that way! Summer On the up side, we had a wonderful stay at the Outrigger Waikiki for the 4th time and were made to feel welcome by all of their staff!

Reviews.Title: “Astounding!!!”
Reviews.Author: jbose2727
Reviews.Content: I was married at the Sheraton on top of black rock in their Ali'i suite October 27, 2007. We also rented an additional 10 rooms for our guests and family. This resort is the most magnificent place I have ever been. It's location, serenity, beauty and friendliness of staff is unmatched. The beach is huge, uncrowded and the water is relatively calm because of black rock. Excellent snorkeling is literally right outside your room. Whaler's village is a 5 minute walk on the beach and getting to Lahaina is 5 minutes in a car. Rooms- The rooms are comfortable, clean and spacious. All the normal room amenities are avaialable. I have no complaints whatsoever about the rooms, however I really didn't spend much time in the room. When on Maui the only time in your room should be sleeping and changing clothes. Beach- Best spot on arguably the best beach on the planet. Enough said. Pool- The pool is nice. It is not a gargantuan with waterslides and swim up bars but it is pleasant. It is great for kids and there is an adult only area as well. Food and drink service at the pool was great too. Dining- This is the only area that I feel the Sheraton needs a little work. The food is good but limited. Service is great!! For more food choices take a short walk to Whaler's Village. Staff- They treat you like Ali'i (royalty, chief). Every staff member at this hotel was remarkable. Check in took about 5 minutes and we were on our way. Our bags were brought up very shortly after we got in to our room. The pool/bar workers are very nice and quick to get you what you need. I do not recall ever having to wait long for a drink. Concierge, valet and every other staff member was helpful, insightful and very pleasant. Price- The Sheraton is the same price as any other decent hotel in all of Hawaii. I have stayed at the Hyatt on Kauai and Kaanapali and Grand Wailea. Ignore any review where people complain about money. Hawaii is expensive and people complaing about this should just go to their local lake or river and skip the islands altogether. I highly recommend the Sheraton for anyone. Adults will love the ease of vacationing there and kids will expecially enjoy swimming with turtles. I have already booked my one year anniversary there at the end of October.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Maui Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: GypsygirlMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Maui Sheraton. It is our favorite Hotel on Maui and we have stayed at The Westin, The Hyatt, The Kaanapali Beach Hotel, and others. The Sheraton wins out due to their perfect location on Black Rock with some of the best consistent snorkeling in Maui. We stayed for 10 nights and were upgraded from a Deluxe Ocean Front King to a Deluxe Ocean Front Suite. We truly felt like Rock Stars and will never forgot how well we were treated, how much we enjoyed the facilities and the perfect location on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: markbene
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel isnt for everybody, It has a great location, and great price for what it offers. The beach is a really nice one whether you like swimming, sunning, or snorkeling (although crowded later on in the day). The hotel also has a nice pool (one of the better ones on the island), though chairs can be scarce after 9am. The hotel is built up and around Black Rock so we had to take 3 elevators to get from our room to the lobby or restaurants, but it does cut noise and crowding a lot and gives the whole place more of a resort feel imo. The spread out nature of the hotel can be a problem if walking is tough for you. They upgraded our room from a garden view to a deluxe ocean view overlooking Black Rock. We spent a lot of time watching the turtles from the window. Some construction was ongoing, but the hotel is pretty spread out so that wont bother most rooms. The resort is walking distance from Whalers village if you need to do some light shopping. Overall best value in a hotel on Hawaii I have seen in a long time

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui No Ka Oi!”
Reviews.Author: ebehrendsen
Reviews.Content: I don't care what any of the others who have stayed at the Sheraton say...this is truly one of the best places to stay on Maui! I speak from lots of experience as this was my 20th trip to Maui over the course of the past 33 years. I've stayed at most the properties up and down Kaanapalii beach and the Sheraton is truly a gem. Location, location, location! Nothing compares to how really good their location is being right there on Black Rock. The staff from the minute we pulled up was exceptional. Talk about a great valet system. Call the valet desk a few minutes before you want to use your car and it's there, top down and ready to good. All the staff members we had the pleasure of working with were amazing. This hotel rocks and others should really take note of how they run their hotel. I do have to agree with some about the noise from the construction, but all in all this is where you want to stay on Maui. Examples of service: upgraded to ocean front room right there overlooking the beach at black rock...priceless! Call ahead for car from valet desk...makes you feel like a movie star! Recommendations for breakfast, lunch and dinner...always great and never once did they mention a restaurant at the Sheraton Resort. Stay here, period! You will really enjoy yourself, whether for one night or a month, it's that good!

Reviews.Title: “The best location, and a lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: marycray
Reviews.Content: Like another recent poster, we were in building four where the construction was occuring, but it didn't bother us at all, as we were rarely in the room. We did notice the tv was out, and we actually were comped by management for, I believe, the resort fee and valet parking. Oh, and a $15 dining certificate. So we're quite happy with that. Now, onto the more fun stuff. The location of this resort is absolutely the best. Ka'anapali beach is phenomenal; black rock offers excellent snorkeling; it is a short drive to Lahaina; and only a ten minute walk to Whaler's Village, where there are restaurants and many nice shops. The grounds are beautifully maintained, and very pretty. The pool is fine, very large, very clean, and I think kids would love it. I preferred the ocean. Our room, which was considered ocean view (different to ocean front) looked over the gardens and pool and then the ocean beyond that. The view was phenomenal. We could also hear the waves from our room. The room itself was very basic, especially considering the high cost of this resort. However, the bed was SOOOO comfy! Both hubby and I slept well. The bedding is high quality, but the sheets are crisp, which is great until you have a sunburn, and then they scratch! Housekeeping services were excellent; we always brought back loads of sand with us, and each day it was cleaned up perfectly. There were some tiny bugs (ants, I think) in our room, but they didn't worry me enough to do anything about them. We only ate at the poolside bar once, and not at any of the restaurants. The food was okay. Very expensive for what it was. There were long waits at the other restaurants when we checked them out, and even for Maui, the prices were high. Check in was a breeze, as was checkout. We used valet parking every day, and I think it was worth the extra $5. One thing to know about this resort is that if you are in building four or a higher number, you will be walking a LOT! I actually counted, and it was 400 steps from our room to the front of the hotel where we picked up the car. That's okay until you come home late, either sunburned or exhausted or trashed or any combination, and then those 400 steps feel like a mile!!! The lobby and common areas of the hotel are really lovely, open to the outdoors, with breezes blowing through (and rain too, on a couple of the days we were there). The total Hawaii experience! All in all, we loved our time at the Sheraton, would recommend it to anyone, and would happily return there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but pricey for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: onemite
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed 8 nights. The Sheraton truly has in my opinion, the nicest nook of beach on Ka'anapali. The water is clean and clear, and we didnt have to go diving to find tropical fish or sea turtles. It only took a mask to look right under wherever we happened to be swimming. The turtles generally swim all around Black Rock- even while locals and tourists alike dive off the cliff, but they certainly did not limit their swim to the reef. We saw them all around us, along with Butterfly fish, Pufferfish, and oodles of Unicorn fish. I got the hang of using a snorkel because I didnt want to lift my head and miss a thing. We had originally confirmed an upgraded room, but upon our arrival, they had no record of it. The following day after speaking to the manager our room was upgraded and we were moved a few nights later. Both rooms we occupied had a fridge that we could stock- which is always a good thing. The beds were comfortable, and the pillows nice. The bathrooms were not as clean as I would have liked them to be. For the price of the room we hadnt expected them to nickel and dime us so much. While one would expect to pay for valet parking daily, there is also a charge for daily self parking, a 20$ daily hotel fee over your daily rate, and regular ammenities are another 20$ They didnt greet us with a lei, and we didnt find the hotel lobby staff to be pleasant or helpful, although the waiters and cocktail waitresses and housekeeping were very friendly. The pool closed very early- but we found that most of Maui closes early. :) One great perk besides the good location, was that every thing you need from shopping to food was just a beach boardwalk walk away- literally. From board rentals to parasailing to banana boating. All within five minute walk. Some of the hotels right on the walk also had bars that stayed open a bit later that ours and hula.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, but had some issues”
Reviews.Author: sammybaka
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that the resort and the Ka'anapali beach are absolutely beautiful. The water is clear, and the Black Rock is unique to this property. Service in general was good too, but I did run into some issues. I stayed at Building 4, which was not much different from the other buildings except that construction work was going on on the first floor building a Spa section. Construction work would go start from 9:30am to 5pm Monday to Friday, and all the noise from drilling to hammering propagated through the walls as if they were coming directly next door. It was so loud that I was awakened from sleep once at 9:30 in the morning. I called immediately to complain, but they couldn't relocate me to a different room because the resort was fully booked. The service manager called me back to apologize, but the situation didn't improve. The same thing occurred on the next day, and at around 10:30am, I noticed the signal to the TV disappeared. As suspected and later confirmed by hotel personnel, the Spa construction managed to cut the digital TV cable. TV was out for almost two days. Admittedly, watching TV was not the top priority at beautiful Ka'anapali, but I wouldn't mind watching local news and weather reports. At the end of the third day, after some more complaining, the service manager was able to find me a new equivalent room in the neighboring building three, which didn't have any of the noise issue, and I was compensated $50 for the TV outage. I must give credit to the hotel front desk though as they were always polite, and I'm sure they weren't thrilled about the on-going construction work either. The did try to make my experience better by finding me a new room, and while $50 wasn't much, it was a nice gesture.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton Maui”
Reviews.Author: oneterrificshopper
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maui and stayed at 3 seperate hotels during our time there. We started the trip off at the Sheraton and loved it! It's very peaceful and quite and the staff is very friendly. There are great activities for kids and families each day that do not cost extra, the pools were great, the beach was amazing, and my son and husband loved the snorkeling at blackrock. We ate at the pool side bar a couple of times and the food there was high, but very good. We ate at the breakfast buffet once and it was wonderful. Kids under 12 eat free so all three of us got to eat breakfast for $55 which is still high for breakfast, but since our son was free it helped offset the cost. Those are the only 2 hotel restaurants we tried so I can't speak for the others. We did try several restaurants in Whalers Village down the path and enjoyed all of them - the proximity is very convenient. Valet parking was nice - only $5 a day, free the first night. I'm a Gold SPG member and we were upgraded to a deluxe ocean view room in Bldg 2. Great location and view! The room was a nice size, the balcony was large and the bathroom was very big and nice. The room was clean and must have been one of the recently remodeled rooms since we had no complaints on the room itself. The in room refrig. could have been a little colder, but I'm sure it was an older one and just did not get very cold to begin with. We stayed at the Westin down the beach after we left the Sheraton and wish we had just stayed at the Sheraton the whole time. We did not care for the Westin at all but I'll write a seperate review on that one. The lounge chairs with cabanas were a good deal for $40 a day and we enjoyed that one day while we hung out at the beach. I highly recommend doing that. We plan to return to Maui and will definitely use our SPG points for another stay at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: JPHO
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Maui from July 23-26th, 2008. We had a garden view room, but we still had a view of the ocean from our balcony. The room was very large and the bathroom large as well. We had the breakfast buffet the first day b/c we wanted to enjoy the resort, the buffet is good, expensive but good. We rented beach chairs for the morning, they are $10/pce and there were plenty available. The pool is great, it winds around and there are lots of chairs. They make sure you are staying at the hotel if you are in the pool area. There are 2 bars in the pool area. Overall we loved this resort, it does have the best location on the beach, a lot of guests from other hotels come to this end of the beach so it gets really busy in the afternoon. There is a shuttle into Lahaina from the resort every hour which is great if you want to have drinks in Lahaina. There is also Whaler's village about a 5 min walk, we ate at both the Hula Gril for lunch and Leilanis for dinner , get a reservation for dinner b/c it gets very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: travelmom28
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights, before moving to a private residence rental. We were at the farthest point of the resort, rooms 6102, 6103. The hotel was very accommodating regarding inter-connecting rooms, with children. We were suppose to have a deluxe oceanfront room. The room was oceanfront as long as you walked out your patio door and looked over the bushes. There was black mold around the perimeter of the room where the carpet met the baseboards. The beds were comfortable and as we requested, one king, two doubles. The bathrooms were very clean, with very adequate water pressure. The food served by the pool was adequate, expensive as would be expected. If we were staying for a longer period of time, we would choose another hotel. This hotel is conveniently located to Whaler's Village for restaurants and shopping. The concierge service is limited, always a 15 minute wait to ask a simple question.

Reviews.Title: “A superb resort with just a few faults.”
Reviews.Author: russellcoombes
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I spent 9 nights at the Sheraton for our Honeymoon of August 2006. Having travelled from London via LA, we were exhausted when we first arrived. Our Bellboy noticed were booked into a room that was a twin, obviously less than ideal for two newlyweds. The hotel could not do anything for us that night and instead chose to move us the following day which we were happy to do. Both rooms we were given were modern, well decorated, extremely comfortable and clean. The following morning, we experienced our first proper Hawaii experience - breakfast! Breakfast was prepared buffet-style, with a large amount of cereals, fresh fruits, cooked breakfast US and Mexican style, and with waffles or pancakes available. Fresh omelettes or fried eggs were cooked to order. We ate outside in the morning sun overlooking the palm trees in the complex and the ocean in the distance. It was fantastic, and it was the same for every breakfast for the rest of our stay. The hotel was well located within a group of other hotels. It's possible to walk to many other hotels and restaurants in the area, some of which are very good and some are distinctly average. However, if you fancy staying at the Sheraton, you can order from a limited menu or choose the Buffet where a choice of very good (but not excellent) meals can be chosen for a reasonable price. If you wish to book one of the sun-loungers on the beach next to the hotel, then you need to do so *before* you arrive. Most tourists from the US know this and ring the hotel to book in advance. There are plenty of sun-loungers by the pool though, and we were able to book a gazebo for a day. There is a waitress service outside, so you can obtain food from the BBQ and beers from the bar without having to move. Marvellous! The pool at the Sheraton is worthy of a mention. There are large areas of the pool, a deeper area for a little swimming and a childrenâ€™s area. But the pool is mostly made from a series of small 'channels' that navigate their way around the front of the complex i.e. between pathways, foot-bridges, seating areas and bars. I thought this was really well done and enjoyable for adults and older children. What with this, the small waterfall and hot-tub, and you've got a great way of breaking up the continuous sunbathing/eating/drinking! Out stay wasn't without problems though. Firstly, our toilet broke and couldn't be used until repaired. It took 3 separate complaints, (the final one to the manager) to get it sorted which took over two days - very poor. Plus, our bathroom suffered from small cockroaches. I complained about this on numerous occasions, and despite pest-controls best efforts, the problem was never resolved. Our final problem was that my Wife's bikini-top was stolen from our ground-floor balcony. When reported, reception staff could not have been less helpful. One final note: I would recommend car hire if you plan to do any exploring. There are some trips that can be booked through the Concierge, but for ease of getting around even the more local parts of the island, a car is useful. Overall, we had a great time at the Sheraton. I would have given this hotel the full 5* rating if not for the few problems that we experienced. As it is, the hotel fell a little short of our expectations. True, the hotel is only a 4*, but it's a pricey one and I feel that the hotel should try a little harder to sort out customer's genuine problems. But those problems aside, the great breakfast, superb complex and decent rooms make for a very enjoyable hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: RedSox678
Reviews.Content: We chose the Sheraton Maui because our friend had recommended this hotel over the Westin. We were using our SPG points to stay the whole time. As soon as we got there, we politely asked for an upgrade and they placed us into Building 6, room 6308. Our bellman helped us get to the parking lot and helped us bring all our luggage to our room. Not only that, he gave us some great advice on dining and adventures. I thought he was an excellent bellman. Our room was amazing!! It was a dream come true and if you are on your honeymoon, definetly suggest building 6. We got to see the cliff dive ceremony from our balcony and we got to see all the snorkelers in Black Rock. We had a large Kind size bedroom, with a large shower tub, separate toilet room, and a granite top sink. We had a LCD TV which was a great bonus. If you are travelling with small children, I would recommend the other buildings in the main area, not building 5 or 6. We had to take 2 elevators which we did not mind because we got to see our cute stray cats that said hello to us. By the way, if you are there, please take care of these sweet kitties with some water and food. Not only us, other guests were bringing them water as well. They are very friendly!! The beach was amazing right in front of the hotel. Other beaches were rocky, however, this was the best beach. Snorkeling at Black rock was the best place. We went on the Teralini throught the Sheraton, which stopped at 2 places to snorkel, however, there were more fish at Black rock. We saw turtles hanging out twice. My husband followed the turle for about 10 minutes and he didnt seem to mind. The teralani cataraman was ok, but owuldnt recommend it. The BBQ lunch was very stingy and not generous at all. The hamburger meat was thinner that a MacDonalds cheeseburger. The crew was friendly. They stopped to see Dolphins and turltes on the way. But for $119 per person, I would not recommend it. Black rock was the best place to snorkel. We ate at several places, however for breakfast, we recommend the Black rock grill for their breakfast buffet. It is priicey at 25 per person, however, they have a very big selection. Food is very pricey in general in Maui. We went to Roy's for dinner one night and even though it was expensive, we highly recommend it. The service and food was excellent. WE also enjoyed the Aloha Mixed Plate. Very cheap and good! However, we dont recommend Kimo's, China Boat, and Giovanni's. As far as the road to hana, we did not attempt. We were terrified with the drive up to Julia's banana bread (recommended by the Maui Revealed). The bread was great, but we did not expect anything like that. Do not attempt with kids!! It was a one way road, off a cliff, with no gaurd rails!! We stopped to see the Olivine pools and the blowhole. Great sights to see! Overall, we recommend this hotel to everyone. The Westin was boring and average, Everything was great, except all the restaurants in the hotel closed early. Also, the maids were extrememly rude. And lastly, the SPG sales people were kind of annoying. They called us 3 times in the room and twice on the cell phone! We just ignored them. Don't fall for the gift thing....its not work postcards for a 20 minute speech. Definetly stop at Costco's and get drinks before going to the hotel. Everything is very pricey!! Have a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views!!”
Reviews.Author: winediva
Reviews.Content: I have been to Maui many times but never stayed at the Sheraton. An impromtu two-night trip with mom, I booked the hotel directly with reservations who gave me a great Kamaa'ina (resident) rate for an ocean view room. We received a fresh orchid lei upon arrival and although valet parking is something like $15/day (can't really remember), it is free the first day which is great. The view from the room was amazing and the room size was large with two double beds that were very comfortable. Amenities: Pool was great, there is a gym (didn't use it) and there is a nightly show (cliff diving, torch lighting) and entertainment while having dinner. Few service negatives: We were missing slippers in our room. Then none of our lamps worked. Then I noticed that there was black mildew all over the shower head. All were fixed with calls to housekeeping but it was annoying that I had to call 3 times for unrelated things. Food: Restaurant is very expensive and the food is very average. We had prime rib and lobster and although prime rib was good, lobster was a bit overcooked. I sent back french onion soup that was so salty that it was inedible. We were just too tired to leave the property so we chose to eat there. Snorkeling: It is amazing! Snorkeling just by the rocks, I saw 2 turtles the first day and 3 turtles the 2nd day! It was really great. I would stay there again but wouldn't eat dinner there - maybe lunch or breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ,but crowded”
Reviews.Author: amiedfw
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome Ocean View room on the back side of Black Rock, away from the rest of the hotel. It had an amazing view of Molokai and Lanai. Because we were away from the main area, it was somewhat of a trek to get to the lobby/main wing, beach, and pool involving 2 elevators and a lot of walking. Also, daily activities were posted in the main areas, but not in our wing, so we didn't know about a lot of things until it was too late to participate. This property is on a public beach, and the other two Starwood properties in the area have access to the hotel facilities, so midday was very crowded and a bit rowdy. Unsupervised children and teens were jumping off the rocks onto snorkelers below. We paid a lot of money for our vacation and felt like with the public access it wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite paradise but fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: The_Renders
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for tranquil paradise this place isn't it but that's down to the the resort not the hotel. The hotel is big so it's not a romantic honeymoon location. In terms of the resort, the hotel is in a fantastic location, pool area is nice, the beach is beautiful and the black rocks provide great snorkelling opportunities. The rooms are comfortable with nice decor. The breakfast is amazing, we looked forward to it every morning. Our deal included breakfast which I'd recommend as I wouldn't want to pay $20 plus every morning for it. Amazing selection on offer...anything you want. The staff are attentive and really friendly. Not a huge choice of great restautants in the resort but we thought the food in the hotel was pretty good if you didn't want to venture far. If you pay cheap money here, the food isn't that great, so it's worth spending more. Needless to say, we got through some cash during our week here, I wouldn't like to think we were on holiday when the pound was weak against the dollar. Nice to walk along to Whaler's Village which has a couple of restaurants and some shops. There's an ABC supermarket to stock up on water etc. We found the resort quite limiting (but we do like to explore) so we'd highly recommend hiring a car and exploring the rest of maui.

Reviews.Title: “Best Beach”
Reviews.Author: nadavena
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Sheraton Maui Resort was very pleasant, fun, and relaxing. The hotel grounds are beautiful (if not a little confusing to navigate; this is a big complex, be sure to read and follow the directional signs for the long trek from your car to your room. And remember, the lobby is on the third floor.) The staff were pleasant and very helpful. The concierge was great and booked a fantastic dinner at the Old Lahaina Fish Co. for us. (Book at sunset.) Our room was clean and well decorated. The beds were very comfortable. The beach here is the best. This is the place to stay if you want to spend your days lounging at the beach or pool, boogie boarding, snorkeling or scuba diving. Be sure to reserve the beach cabanas in advance, if that's what you want. The snorkeling is good, but I found the depth a little too deep. There are shallower beaches elsewhere with a wider area to explore. That's why I think this area is best for beginning scuba divers.(You can rent snorkel gear at the hotel for $20 a day, or you can go to Snorkel Bob's in Lahaina on Dickenson St. and rent for a week for about the same price.) Still, I did see a green sea turtlle, and the snorkeling was fun. The bigger kids enjoy jumping off the Black Rock cliffs. We had to go back to our room, as we forgot something, and the housekeeper was there. She asked for our room key and made sure that it opened the door before allowing us to go in. That made us feel very secure and that the hotel had our best interests in mind. We only ate one time at the hotel and that was at the Kekaa Terrace for breakfast since our child could eat free. The breakfast for two of us was $54. I thought that was a little pricey. For comparison, breakfast for three at the Sunrise Cafe in Lahaina was under $30. For dinner, I suggest a nice stroll down the beach to the Hula Grill. Make reservations. On the way to the hotel, be sure to stop in Lahaina at Safeway (use your Vons card), Longs Drugs, and Snorkel Bobs to stock up on food, drinks, snacks and supplies. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel-give it a try!!!”
Reviews.Author: SUZIELOU
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel after staying in Waikiki Sheraton and the difference is amazing. When we arrived we parked in the main entrance parking. We went to book in and were told we had parked our car the wrong way round as cars had to be parked front of the car facing the front(dont ask why!!!!!) and could we turn it round! (by the way you really do need a car to travel round as the hotel itself is 1 hour drive from the airport and what shops they do have in Maui are quite a drive and public transport is almost non-existant). We were booked into an ocean front room in the infamous building 6 where we were driven to by buggy! The building itself is somewhat detatched from the rest of the hotel and is in a quiet location which we liked. If you prefer this it is ideal for you. You do have to take 3 lifts and have a walk to the pool, restaurants and beach etc but after a while you get used to it. The room itself was spacious and clean. We had a small balcony with a view out on to the ocean. At night there was nothing to see- just blackness- maybe they could have used some lighting. I have to mention the bed. It was king size and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in- I slept like a log whilst I was there!! The lagoon pool was great. However if you want a sun lounger get there early as seating was limited and most people seem to dump a flip flop and a towel on a lounger and go off scuba diving, shopping or go to breakfast and leave it. The business centre was opened at limited times and internet access was pricey ($8 for 10 minutes) although there was free wi-fi access for lap tops. If you wanted to go to the beach you could hire cabannas, chairs and umbrellas from the pool center but this was also pricey - 2 chairs and an umbrella was $40 and you were limited to where you could sit. In building 6 we had a 'light breakfast' which we could attend for $12 each. The word light was right - avoid if you are slightly hungry as this consisted of bread, pastries, cereal and a few bits of fruit. The main breakfast buffet itself was fine. On the 2 days we did use it we generally had to wait for around 20 minutes to get a seat but there were no complaints on the quality of food although there could have been slightly more choice for such a big hotel. We tried the evening buffet once and it was fairly adequate. The lunch pool menu was great though although I thought the cocktails and beers were expensive. The main desk staff were unhelpful and slightly condescending in my opinion but the pool staff were great. Our room was given a clean once a day and also was tidied up and given clean towels in the evening. There is a free shuttle bus every hour from morning till around 10pm that drops you off at 3 stops in town. This is handy as apart from the hotels and Whalers Village (a 10 minute walk from the hotel) there isn't an awful lot of places to eat nearby. Overall we enjoyed our stay and had no major problems with the Sheraton Maui - give it a try!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved EVERY minute at the Sheraton!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maui_Bride_08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I actually got married at the Sheraton, and it was the most gorgeous setting I could have ever imagined!! I would recommend it to everyone even considering getting married there!! You will be provided a coordinator, who will take care of pretty much everything! Flo Sanchez, my coordinator, was FABULOUS!!! I looked at reviews for the Sheraton many times before going there myself. I have to say that I am shocked by those who wrote negative comments (especially about building six)!! We stayed in that building - and it absolutely breathtaking!! It is also away from the lobby and pool noise - which we loved!! Since the spa is being renovated at the Sheraton, we were able to go to the Westin for a couples massage. It really was heavenly! (the Westin's slogan) However, the Westin feels more "closed in" and crowded (kids EVERYWHERE!) - which also made us appreciate building six!! The Sheraton feels more "spread out" - which makes you feel like you have the place to yourself!! Or at least more relaxed - like you have "room to breathe". The food is delicious! Never a problem - large portions and the cost isn't too high. (your on MAUI!!) Absolutely wonderful experience - LOVED IT, LOVED IT, LOVED IT!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: DDNR
Reviews.Content: We had great expectations when booking this hotel. When paying for a four or five star resort you expect the resort to be great. We traveled with a couple whose experience was even worse than ours. At initial check in we were given no direction on where to even go to find our room. After finially finding our room we entered to find two double beds so small there is no way two people can sleep on them. (found out when you book a room they cannot give you a gaurentee of a king bed). The smell in the room also smelled like mold. We walked right out and tried to approach the front desk. At first they were not very helpful and actually quite rude. After one night in the room we both woke up with severe allergy symptoms and my entire luggage next to the bed was wet. Come to find out the AC was leaking and a four foot patch on the floor had drenched my luggage and was causing the "mold" smell in the room. Our friends room was not much better but at least did not have the mold smell. Finally we were moved to a different room that was much better. When you stay plan on spending that 21 dollars a day in resort fees for no clear reason. Your have to pay for beach chairs, wine galsses, covered spots by the pool, rooms are average, and the internet is not even wireless. The resort grounds are great and offers excellent views but the women at the front desk support staff made us never want to stay at the Maui Sheraton again

Reviews.Title: “Not thrilled with the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Salisbel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not what I expected from a 4 star hotel. My main issue was that there was only one gift shop and two restaurants for the whole hotel in one location. This hotel is massive and sprawling. We had to take no less than 4 different elevators and a set of stairs and breezeways just to get from our room to the main lobby, store, restaurant, etc. Very inconvenient and poorly laid out. The chairs and table on the balcony were terribly uncomfortable and dirty. They were mad of a hard black metal with only a cushion on the bottom so every time you tried to sit back and relax the bars would cut into your skin. The cushions on the bottom were ratty and dirty. We moved the wicker chairs from inside the room out there so we could be comfortable while looking at the ocean. The staff was not overly friendly, the only one who greeted you every time he saw you was the hotel "aloha ambassador". The one restaurant turned into 3 by the end of the day which got old after awhile. The pool was okay, not much to do, just swim from one side to the other. No activities like volleyball net or swim up bar. The boardwalk in front of the hotel is nice. This hotel is at the end so it's a bit of a walk to get to the other things but not bad. Watching the nightly cliff dive was nice the first 2 nights but after that it wasn't as exciting. Overall, I won't stay there again, I will go down to the other end of the boardwalk and stay at the Hyatt which was much more modern and comfortable looking. And for food, the breakfast buffet was great, lunch menu was okay but very pricey and the prime rib dinner buffet was good but they only have that one night a week.

Reviews.Title: “Don't think we'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: rr1954
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton was actually quite a disappointment for us. We reserved a deluxe oceanview room for 8 nights and were placed in a room in building 6 that did, in fact, have views of Lanai and the ocean, but since we were only on the 2nd floor half of the view was of a green chain link fence over the rocks. Building 6 is also a 10 minute walk to the lobby area and requires using 2 separate elevators (1 in building 5 and 1 in building 4) to get there. We finally moved to an oceanview room in building 3 that was smaller still than the "oceanfront" room but the view was nicer and it was close to the lobby and pool area. The rooms are very small compared to comparable hotels nearby that we have stayed in (Marriott before it became condos, Hyatt). The bell staff was quite friendly and helpful as was the pool staff. The pool is fairly nice but chairs are hard to come by and there is very little shade anywhere. However, we did not have much use for the front desk staff. They were quite unhelpful each time we dealt with them. Other issues - if you want laundry or dry cleaning done you must drop it off at the front desk. There is no internet access through the hotel's business center after 5pm, Club Sandwich on the room service menu - $31! No spa. The hotel does not have as many restaurants as it advertises. They merely change the signs on one restaurant and serve a different menu certain nights, the Japanese steak house is not open every night either. The breakfast buffet is great, however, and kids under 12 eat free. The poolside food is good and is where we chose to dine at the Sheraton. The location of the Sheraton is fabulous and the snorkeling out front at Black Rock can be great (but crowded). However, the service and rooms are not worth what you pay. One pet peeve, the Sheraton, as some other hotels, will place a large "hold" on your credit card if you charge to your room and it may be 2-3 times the amount you actually charge. The hold will not be lifted until you check out. We will not stay at the Sheraton again and do not recommend it if you're picky about service or the size of your room.

Reviews.Title: “Careful of what building your room is in.”
Reviews.Author: hootstir
Reviews.Content: great location and grounds, probably the best beach on this end of the Island. However beware of where the give you a room. Buildings 1 &2 are renovated and great. Buildings 3 & 4 are old and building 4 is undergoing renovations on the first couple of floors now. Stay away from building 6 unless all you want is a view. You have to drive from your room to the hotel to eat, swim, go to the beach etc. They initially gave us a room in blding 6 and there was no bell man to be found, also no valet parking so we lugged our stuff to the room, called to change the room and lugged it all back to the parking lot. The front desk staff was not real helpful, didn't explain we had to have vouchers for breakfast or that the tip was included. Maybe they were new but seemed use to having people request room changes. The second room we had literally had no patio space. Couldn't even put a chair outside. Found out certain rooms at the end of the building have this issue. We finally got a nice room in blding 4 where they were doing renovations but it also had its quirks. The clothes closet was in the bathroom and only held about 6 hangers. Maybe 2.5 ft. wide. Pool staff was outstanding. Still have to vie for lounge chairs, there are never enough. Another anoyance was the "glassware" in the rooms. Styrofoam for coffee cups, flimsy plastic glasses and no wine glasses. Motel 6 has better glassware in their rooms. Called room service to get wine glasses as it was a special occasion for us and we had brought a nice bottle of wine. Unfortunately room service is closed between 2 PM and 5:30 PM so I had to go to the bar and bribe the bartender to let us have 2 wine glasses. Overall I would stay there again just be aware of where they try to put you when you check in.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Would Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: hid5children
Reviews.Content: Used the reviews from this website to pick this hotel, so figured I should give feedback. We were there for only three nights, wish it could have been more. We were there for our 15th wedding anniversary and because we checked in late were put in a room with 2 double beds. Tried to work it out and the front manager insinuated that we should have booked through their hotel directly in order to get our room choice. Did move us the next day, but into a room with construction below. At this point it was beginning to affect my vacation, so talked with another front manager who totally worked it all out. We ended up in a doulbe upgraded room with double beds. But, our view was so fabulous and we were so secluded that we did not mind. Totally recommend the rooms on top of Black Rock. It was really nice. The snorkeling was great and the area on the beach was really nice. Walking distance to shopping and spas. Overall we would go back to this hotel. Found the service workers very pleasant helpful and efficient. Moved our luggage three times with no problems. For Maui getting a convertible was a great idea and we loved the evening show Warren & Annabelle's lots of laughs and clean.

Reviews.Title: “great vacation”
Reviews.Author: sfcvacations
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Sheraton Maui. Great, but don't pay the price for dinner at Blackrock steak and seafood. Very average food at very high prices. Also the gazebo rental is weak no services provided. No fruit or water offered. Other than that great location, great grounds, great service. Especially the vallet and bell staff. Can't wait to return, but off property for dinner. Also, for a great snorkle trip call Maui Magic, great crew.

Reviews.Title: “Top 10 Reasons Why We Loved the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Barbara-AZ
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7-night stay at the Sheraton, and absolutely loved it, for the following reasons (in no particular order): 1. Room and View: Had ocean view room in bldg 3 (not deluxe ocean view or ocean front), close to everything plus loved the view the best because you see beautiful grass and palm trees, pool, beach, ocean. Room had flat screen TV (although I understand other buildings might not have these yet), amazingly comfortable bed, bathroom okay and balcony small, but oh what a view! 2. Grounds: Seems to be the largest property on Kaanapali, and the grounds are beautiful and well maintained. 3.
