Pool: Nice size, perfect temperature, winding rivers throughout, several bridges, secluded Jacuzzi. Tiny waterslide for small tots; if you want more water slides then go to Hyatt or Westin (but then you have a tiny beach area). Never had a problem getting lounge chairs. 4. Beach: Largest beach on Kaanapali, protected by Black Rock (not as big waves, great for kids. 5. Black Rock: Beautiful backdrop to beach, plus great snorkeling right there. Swam with a turtle! 6. Fun family activities: Had BBQ and movie night, other kid-oriented activities covered by resort fee. 7. Buffet Breakfast: Had this included in package, and to my surprise they didnâ€™t charge me for child even though we had adult free coupons. Buffet large, great variety, main entrees changed daily. Ate there every day and never got bored. Also loved talking with Kaleko, who is their â€“ get this â€“ Ambassador of Aloha. 8. Service: Drinks by pool, breakfast, housekeeping, all staff had excellent customer service. 9. Whalers Village: About a 7-minute walk, couple of good restaurants, nice shops, Whaler Museum. Nice to have this in walking distance. 10. Not a high-rise: Only hotel on Kaanapali besides Kaanapali Beach Resort (lower end) that isnâ€™t a high-rise. Buildings have only a few floors (we were on floor 3 and never took an elevator!). If, like me, you prefer not to be in a high-rise, then this hotel is the one to stay at! Only negatives: Parking: Kind of far from buildings 3 and 4 (buildings 5 and 6 have separate parking), but nice walk with beautiful views of grounds. By the way, about free valet parking on day 1â€¦ you have to move your car on day 2 otherwise you get charged. Fitness Center: Okay, but itâ€™s in building 5, kind of far unless youâ€™re in building 5 or 6. They are building a new spa on 1st floor of building 4, not sure when it will be ready to open. Room: Only can choose 2 double beds or one King, and with a very tall husband, we went for King bed with rollaway for child. Also, as previously mentioned, balconies are small, bathrooms nothing special. High cost of equipment: We went to Boss Frogs on way back from airport on first day; got snorkeling gear, beach chairs, and boogie board for whole week at same price hotel charges for one day. Also about Boss Frogs, if you rent snorkel equipment for a week then you get free afternoon snorkel cruise (with $7 charge for fuel).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Wonderful Beach”
Reviews.Author: AZtravelpeople
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Maui in June of 2008 for 5 nights for our honeymoon. We had an "ocean front" room and we loved it. The Sheraton definitely has the best beach location on Kaanapali. Venturing further south, you'll realize that the other resorts have barely any beach at all. We walked (and jogged) several times as far south as the Hyatt and I was always struck on how little beach-area the other resorts had. The pool was not huge, but not small. There are a couple of little bars poolside and it makes for an absolutely beautiful place to have a couple of drinks and watch sunset. We only ate a couple of meals at the resort -- lunch pool side at the Sundowner Bar, and a late lunch at the Keka'a Terrace (we were given a coupon at check-in). As you would expect from a oceanside resort, the food and drinks were expensive. The only disappointing aspect of our stay was our lunch at the Keka'a Terrace. The service was terrible. It appeared that we showed up just before a shift-change, so our initial waitress took our orders, delivered our drinks, and then disappeared. After the food was delivered, I thought the place had closed -- literally no service for over 10 minutes. I had to fetch my own ketchup from an adjacent table and I really wanted another drink, but no such luck. When you're paying $20 a plate, you expect better than that. Whaler's Village is a great place to shop and eat -- and it's only about a 5 min walk along the beach. We absolutely loved our meal at Leilani's On The Beach and the ABC Store was great for getting supplies for our hotel room (bottled water, sundries, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the right price”
Reviews.Author: RKMLosAngeles_CA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 7 nights in May, and we had a great time. The hotel is on a stretch of beautiful beach in the heart of the Kaanapali resort area. It's a 5-minute walk to Whaler's Village, which has cute little shops and restaurants, and it's about a 10-minute drive to the heart of Lahaina, where there are tons of great places to eat. The resort itself is nice, although it could use a little rehab. Hallways needed new paint, and the rooms are okay, nothing spectacular. But we got a fantastic deal on our room - $179/night with the AAA rate on a garden view, and when we got there, they had upgraded us to a partial ocean view. Don't know if I'd pay extra for the partial ocean view, since the balcony is so narrow and not very functional, but it was nice to have the upgrade. Do yourself a favor and enroll in the Starwood program before you go - they give you all sorts of free stuff, and I think that's why we got the upgrade. Hawaii is very expensive, and within the resort, you'll feel like you're getting ripped off at every turn - $4 for a small coffee? $50 for two people for a breakfast buffet? (yes it was a very nice buffet, but better to go into Lahaina and eat at the Sunrise Cafe or Pioneer Inn). This isn't a 5-star hotel, and I wouldn't pay more than $250/night including the $20 resort fee, but for the deal we had, it was well worth the money. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “More overdone motel than resort...”
Reviews.Author: SouthPasRef
Reviews.Content: Other than the cockroaches in the rooms and the largely incompetent staff, this hotel has an enviable location with larger, motel feeling rooms and magnificent views. The pool is smallish but looks bigger due to the layout. That's okay because it never seemed too crowded due to the adjoining Kaanapali Beach at Black Rock and the fact that the over-chlorinated and cloudy water in the pool made many people choose the beach over the pool altogether. Maui has for years been rated as the top island destination in the world, and it's beginning to show. The infrastructure is struggling to keep up with crowded roads, overly busy restaurants, and too much clutter. For instance, the Sheraton looks across the channel at the island of Lanai, just 8 miles away. Five years ago, when we stayed at the Marriott timeshare just down the way from the Sheraton, the view was magnificent. Now, it is cluttered with buoys, water platforms and markers for the competing parasail, boating and surfing businesses that fill the sky and the channel all day long. It's a rare time during the daylight hours when there are not at least 3-4 parasails in the air all at the same time, and the boats really clog the view. If the environmentalists could block offshore oil platforms, you'd think they'd do something about this, particularly since so many whales pass by during the migratory periods. The Sheraton suffers from the hype, with noisy machines going many nights to support the luau on the property, as well as the other activities. As a result, instead of hearing the waves at night, we heard the machines humming with sounds not unlike an RV generator, sometimes for most of the night. What is more, the amenities have a decidedly bolted on feel rather than being integrated into the property. For instance, the thin LCD TV is not hung on the wall; it sits on a table taking up space, and all of the movies we tried to watch were very digitized and jumpy, so much so that the management readily credited our account and acknowledged that others around the hotel had raised the same complaints. In short, the place is not what it once was, the gem of Kaanapali Beach; instead, it has fallen victim to its own success. Even the grounds have a minimalist feel, not quite up to par with the Marriott or the Hyatt down the way. The staff seemed not quite to get it either. We were there on vacation, not to work with the schedules of the maids or the exterminators. When we spoke to the manager about the inconvenience of having to leave our room for a few hours to allow an exterminator in (it was on a day when we were trying to avoid getting too much sun), he offered us a free movie. Of course, we couldn't watch it until we could re-enter our room, but that seemed lost on him. Other times, we called to speak to someone, and we got no answer or were quickly transferred and placed on hold for an extended time. I felt like I was back at the office, not on vacation in Maui. Finally, a bit about the bugs. I killed a decent sized cockroach in the bathroom one evening. The next morning, a smaller one met his maker on the bedstand. I took the dead varmints wrapped in tissues to the front desk to prove I wasn't lying. I was promised my room would be sprayed so as to be bug free for the remainder of my stay. It was sprayed alright, but that did not keep two more of the critters from scampering across the floor that night. Not quite what one expects at Sheraton prices. Go for the view, but be warned, this place is not up to the level of the travel brochures.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed our expectations”
Reviews.Author: lulou77
Reviews.Content: We would go back to the Maui Sheraton tomorrow, if we could. We had a deluxe ocean front king room in building 6. We loved the location. Yes, we had a bit of a walk to the pool, beach, etc, but it was never a problem. The view from our room was beautiful. The lanai perfect for coffee and breakfast every morning. We were on Maui for our marraige and honeymoon and can honestly say we would not change a thing. We didn't do any of the on site activities, but had we wanted to there were plenty. The grounds and pool are perfect for relaxing. The temp of the pool water was not too cold as others have written. It was quite comfortable. We didn't eat on site only because there were so many options in Lahina for dining. There was plenty of on site parking close to building 6. We would highly recommend this property without hesitation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KristininMD
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! The west coast of Maui is beautiful, and this hotel sits right in the middle of it all. Our room was right on the corner by the Black Rock, where they do their nightly cliff-diving ceremony. It was fantastic to sit on the balcony and watch the tiki torches being lit and then the cliff diver do his thing. The snorkeling all around the Black Rock was amazing! It was great to walk out of my hotel room right out onto such a great site. The staff was super-friendly and always went out of their way to greet us. Just FYI, there is a $20 "resort fee" per night that is charged - but that is in lieu of parking fees, internet fees, and stuff like that. Its really worth it to take advantage of the amenities. Also just a short walk down the beach to the Whalers Village area with lots of shops and places to eat and drink. Overall a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Property”
Reviews.Author: Linnsey26
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Maui from May 27-June 3 for part of our honeymoon. We had booked a simple gardenview room and were pleased to be given a free upgrade to a ocean view room. Our room was in building 3 and from the balcony we had a clear view of the cliffdiving ceremony. Since it was our honeymoon, the Sheraton also provided free champagne and strawberries for us the first night which was nice. The grounds of the hotel were gorgeous and kept immaculately clean. The hotel is large (6 buildings) but never seemed to be crowded. We could always find a chair at the pool easily or get seated right away at the restaurants on property. The restaurants on the property are too expensive for the quality of food but that's normally true with all hotels. I would recommend going into Lahaina for some of their exceptional restaurants instead. The location of the hotel is very convienent for all activities in West Maui. The beach it is located on is wonderful- the surf is not very rough and the sand is soft. There is also fantastic snorkeling around the Black Rock on the edge of the beach. We saw four sea turtles there one day in addition to lots of fish. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: irene08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Maui to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary, and our first vacation without our child. This was our 5th time to Maui and our 2nd stay at the Sheraton. We booked an oceanfront room and stayed in building 6, which was absolutely wonderful! It was quiet, romantic, and the view just could not be beat. The 5 minute walk to the lobby and pool really wasn't that big of a deal, plus it was such a scenic walk to enjoy every day. We love the grounds of the Sheraton - it's expansive, beautiful, well maintained, and does not feel crowded in the least bit. We considered staying at the Westin or the Hyatt, and while newer, the grounds just were not as expansive as the Sheraton. We rarely left the resort, since everything we needed was on site. Yes, it's pricier but we knew that going into this vacation and were perfectly ok with spending a little more for the convenience. The breakfast buffets ran $24.95 a person, but considering that it was essentially brunch for us, it was well worth the price. We loved going to brunch then laying out by the beautiful pool or the beach all day. This was the extent of our relaxing and wonderful anniversary trip and exactly what we were looking for. Around 4 or 5 every day we would head back to our room to shower and then sit out on our lanai to enjoy the views. Sometimes we would watch the sunsets or walk down to the pool area again to have a few drinks, listen to the musician, enjoy the sunset and watch the cliff dive. We would then walk over to Whaler's Village for dinner and then stroll back to our room afterwards. All in all a wonderful stay at the Sheraton. We will be back again but next time as a family vacation (in a different building other than 6, since it was really intended for couples and not for young children!).

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: dmh306
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent a week at the Sheraton Maui in May. We absolutely loved it! The Sheraton was perfect for us. The grounds were beautiful, the service was excellent, and we also really enjoyed the food on property. The hotel did not seem overcrowded which was nice - there were plenty of chairs to choose from at the pool, and often times we could find a quiet corner to set up camp for the day. We spent a couple days on the beach as well - the snorkling was great right off the beach, and the private gazebo we rented for the day was worth the $40 (ouch) believe it or not. We knew the place would be expensive so we just tried to suck it up and enjoy ourselves. We took a walk down the beach and checked out the other properties nearby. We had originally planned to stay at the Westin, but then I read reviews on trip advisor that the Westin was really family friendly and there would be lots of little kids running around. Not that we don't love kids, but when we walk past the Westin it was VERY chaotic and loud and crazy. Walking back to the Sheraton reminded us we were staying at the perfect resort. We signed up for the luau at the Sheraton one night - it was cheesy as to be expected, but the food was spectacular and the weather was perfect! that's all you really need for a great evening. I would definitely recommend the Sheraton to couples looking for a quiet, relaxing resort in Maui. We can't wait to go back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: ss77
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Kaanapali beach is great! We were upgraded to a mountain view room and it also had an ocean view. I would think mostly all rooms would have a great view based on the design of the hotel. Would definitely stay here again although the best beach (Makena, aka Big Beach) and snorkeling (Ahii state park) were near Wailea. Makena BBQ has the best fish tacos, although don't expect large portions for the money. I highly recommend the "Maui Revealed" travel guide, however do not fall into the trap of going after the "best banana bread on the planet". The road to get there is litteraly life threatening. It is a one lane road with a rock wall on one side and a sharp drop off on the other (no shoulder in parts). And the banana bread at Julia's was not that great.

Reviews.Title: “Too Many Time Share Sales People”
Reviews.Author: Ron92648
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here May 6-11. Within 12 hours after checking in, we were accosted by 3 different time share people which were hotel staff or dressed as hotel staff. What seemed to be nice and friendly staff were just attempting to lure you in to their presentation, wasting our valuable vacation time. Our rooms voicemail also started filling with lures and hooks to visit their hunter-gathers. By day 2, we basically stopped responding to staff (except for housekeeping, valet etc as they were the only normal people there) and stopped listening to voicemail. It was a very annoying way to start our 15 year anniverary vacation. We were also offered the "free upgraded room". Read the review on "Nice, but be wary of a free upgrade" as it is totally accurate. Luckily my friend informed me of the "up on the cliff" rooms before I went, so I cancelled and downgraded my room. Excellent call on my friends part. Room was good. The room safe kept breaking, but maintenance came out everyday to get my stuff out. View from the standard ocean front was spectacular. Beach: Awesome. In previous trips, we stayed at the nearby condos and other hotels and walked to Black Rock. Grounds: Great, but we've been to better.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy With the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: AZTraveller26
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton from May 4th through the 11th, for our anniversary. We booked a garden view room. When we arrived we found that we had been booked in a room with two double beds rather than a king. We requested a king and was told that there were none available until the 3rd night of our stay. Ok. So they moved our stuff when they said they would and everything was fine. The rooms are pretty basic although the beds are exceptionally comfortable and there is a nice TV. The housekeeping service was great, kept everything spotless and were never intrusive. I absolutey loved the grounds and the pool! We practically never left poolside, we had everything we needed! The concierge was also very helpful as was pretty much everyone we encountered. Valets were awesome and overall everyone was super polite. Went to the spa at the Westin and had an ok experience. Got a massage and facial, with the facial being fabulous and the massage was so so. We walked to the Westin and the Hyatt and the grounds are so much more elaborate, but I was very happy with the sublte elegance of the Sheraton. It also had the perfect location. The snorkeling right in front of the hotel was great! I really cannot think of any negatives, other than the price of everything, which I suppose is common on Maui. Overall we had an absolutely wonderful time at the Sheraton and would stay there again. Hope this helps, I read these reveiws religiously prior to booking a hotel and find them invaluable so thanks to everyone who posts.

Reviews.Title: “A real Wowie on Maui!!”
Reviews.Author: Spokane203
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week at the Sheraton. It truly was a week in Paradise. Great room (bldg 4), fabulous food, amazing snorkeling right off the beach (sea turtles, all sorts of beautiful fish), service was amazing, beach is wonderful, grounds and pool are nothing short of breath-taking. Every detail is taken care of. We will be glowing and smiling about this week for months to come! Food expensive? Yes, just like any other resort. But there are some other very good options just a short walk away or a few minutes away by car. I looked at some other resorts on Maui while we were there. For a romantic get-away, no place beats the Sheraton. We WILL be back and won't even think about anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Optimus-X
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel from May 18 to May 25. We got a nice discounted rate for a garden view room. We were pleasanly upgraded to a deluxe ocean view room at Building 6. The room was very nice and clean. Carpet looks new. The bed was comfortable. The view from the balcony (4th floor) was breath taking. We could see the ocean, the islands of Lanai and Molokai. The hotel grounds are well-kept, as well as the very big swimming pool. The black rock area of the beach is very good for snorkeling. The staff are courteous. There's a complimentary shuttle that will bring you to Lahaina town, where there are more shops and restaurants. During our stay, the guest laundry room is not available. I'm not sure why. It's good we have enough clothes for our stay. The food at the restaurants, as expected are pricey. So we always go to Whaler's Village, about 15 minutes walk, where the restaurants at the food court are cheaper. There's also a grocery where we could buy some supplies. You have to go to Westin for the spa as well. The rentals for beach activities like the cabana, snorkeling gear, umbrella is also a bit pricey, but hey, this is Maui. It's a bit of a long walk from our room to the beach, pool, and the lobby, but we don't mind. We have a very nice view. Besides, it's a vacation, so we actually like the stroll. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay at the Sheraton and would not hesitate to book there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui Tennis Club's Best Pro - Yaz Yamanoha”
Reviews.Author: LetsGoBaxter
Reviews.Content: Yaz Yamanoha @ the Sheraton Maui Tennis Club is the BEST! My husband and I were looking for tennis lessons at a reasonable rate, thus, we asked around and more than several people recommended that we ask for Yaz Yamanoha @ the Sheraton Maui Tennis Club. (I think he is affiliated with Royal Lahaina Tennis Ranch too.) WOW, did we get excellent instruction, a great workout, and individual tips to take-away with us. Better yet, we got it all at a SUPER-REASONABLE RATE! Top reasons to take your lessons at the Sheraton Maui Tennis Club: The courts were in great shape The Pro, Yaz Yamanoha was able to hone in quickly on what we each needed...no waste of time! Super reasonable rates (much lower than what we pay in Sacramento, CA, for far better instruction). Yaz has a great personality, fantastic sense of humor coupled with good teaching technique that makes you get it right away! We cannot wait for our next Maui vacation so we can take more lessons with Yaz at the Sheraton Maui. Hope your game inproves while your're in paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Best SPG property - nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Boraxo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of years ago on our honeymoon using SPG points. Arrived 9pm and requested building 6. Received a nice room overlooking the beach/ocean. As other have noted, this is the perfect location if you are looking for peace/quiet and don't mind a short walk to the pool and the rest of the property. The grounds are amazing - among the best in the area. Our room was good sized, recently renovated, with a large bathroom, refrig, good a/c, and robes. We found the staff and valet to be exceptionally nice. We enjoyed the pool and never had a problem finding a chair - the drink service was great and there was no annoying muzak which is common in many resorts. However, we complained about the 2 hour leaf blowers (was this really necessary during prime pool time) Minus points: Crappy towels, stains on buildings and lounge chairs, old 19" TV, no DVD/CD players, no snacks or drinks in minibar, ridiculous room service prices. The fitness room was rather mediocre for a resort of this caliber. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely choose the Sheraton over the Westin (see our other review) as the rooms and staff are just plain better. P.S. Anybody complaining about the $20 resort fee obviously didn't read their reservation and just doesn't get it as this is SOP at almost all north american resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Resort was Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Mafiozo
Reviews.Content: I had the time of my life at the Sheraton Maui Resort. It was beautiful! Clean, big, fun and entertaining. The pool water was amazing, the setup was just outstanding. Excellent customer service and great care of the gardens. There wasn't a single speck of dirt anywhere, amazing. We woke up at 4AM one night to walk around and the resort was being cleaned and ready for the next day. Great food and drinks at the bars and awesome, awesome scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Opiddy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Sheraton in Maui. SUPERB! After a horrible start to our vacation (flight delays, changes etc.),we finally arrived at the hotel in the dead of night. Here everything changed. We were treated with the utmost courtesy and even a little empathy. To our surprise , we were upgraded to an "oceanfront" room which was absolutely perfect. The room was huge, the view was spectacular, the decor was recently updated, the location close to everything, yet quiet. We really couldn't ask for better. Upon check-in the "resort fee" was mentioned again, so there really was no reason to be surprised at all. Let's face it, it is just a marketing gimmick to show an artificially low price (like freight/dealer prep., on a car), so simply add it to the room rate to get your total. This fad will soon fade away like all bad ideas. The beach, pool, and service were all outstanding. The charge of $40 per day for the cabana's was just silly (another bad idea). The buffets were very good while the pool side snacks were poor and pricey. The location of the hotel is fantastic, with shopping and recreation close by. The snorkeling was great. We were sad to leave the Sheraton and wished we could have stayed longer, ah well, maybe next time. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: liss2
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is a great hotel. We stayed there on our honeymoon and loved it! Everything was perfect. It's a great location and snorkeling is right there! The only complaint that I have is that they charge a $20 surcharge for every night. It includes some perks, but we never even used them. It did make us mad. We stayed at the Marriott on Kauai and they did not have a charge like that.

Reviews.Title: “Secluded yet near everything”
Reviews.Author: Westshore
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in early May in a deluxe ocean front room. The room was huge. We saw a turtle from the balcony almost every day. We requested building 6 and as other reviewers mention, this is set a ways off from the main hotel. Beautiful view of beach and other islands. Very easy walk to Whalers Village where the restaurants had more reasonable prices than the hotel restaurants. Staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Anne_and_Scott
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for a week for our honeymoon and just returned. We loved it! Upon check-in we were offered complimentary valet parking our first night. Check-in was fast but we got to our room and noticed we were given a handicap room. It wasn't a huge problem but the shower chair was kind of odd. We originally booked a garden view king. We went to to the front desk and asked if we could possibly transfer to another room and they kindly upgraded us to a top floor partial ocean view, no charge. They also found out it was our honeymoon, and when we returned from dinner champagne and glasses were waiting on us. Anita and Monica were excellent at the concierge desk. Sam at the Starwood desk also helped us because we assumed she was concierge and didn't figure it out until we had everything we needed. They were all great and so nice! We ate at the Lagoon Bar (multiple times) and at Black Rock Steak and Seafood. Everything was excellent! We both highly recommend the Lava Flow beverage! The one problem we did have was that we never figured out the shuttle service to Lahaina and the Whaler's Village. We only tried it once though. Westin shuttles kept arriving to pick up and one driver told us he couldn't take us and finally another Westin guy told us to hop on after we waited 45 mins. We found the 5 min back walk to the Whaler's Village better anyway. It is paved the whole way. Lahaina you cannot walk to. At the Whaler's Village, we recommend Hula Grill and Leilani's (sister properties). The same owner also has Kimo's in Lahaina which was great too. We had a rental car for the week and found it well worth the cost ($160 compact with Hertz) even though it sat undriven for a few days. Parking was never overcrowded and we always found pool chairs but never bothered with beach chairs. Snorkeling was the best! We went two days for an hour ($8 a person) and saw sea turtles both times. The turtles tend to eat between 2 and 3 p.m. You don't have to go our far either. We never even passed the end of the Black Rock. Do your souvenier shopping at the Lahiana Cannery Mall. As far as other great places: 1. Cruiser Phil's biking down Haleakala. We loved our guys and they were safe with us. It was pricey though. Our disappointment was that we never got to actually see the crater. We were one of the first groups to arrive and it was so overcast and rainy that nothing ever appeared. It was very cold up there as well! 2. Air Maui helicopter ride over West Maui and Molokai. We went with the less expensive tour for 45 mins and thought it was great. We bought and DVD of our ride ($40) which we should receive any day. We also were able to request the front seat due to our weight (both of us about 130 lbs). 3. Road to Hana. The road was long and tiring, but beautiful. I think our problem was that we just didn't get up early enough because we arrived at the Seven Pools and the rain started coming down. We were pretty bummed after our day drive. Soaked and dirty, we drove down to Charles Lindbergh's grave which was very nice. It was quiet and very pretty. Sheraton exceeded our expectations and after being back at home for one day we are trying to figure out how to move. Thanks to all! Anne and Scott

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: GOPHERATRIP
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 6 night stay at the Sheraton Maui. We had been somewhat concerned in December and January about the reviews we had read on Trip Advisor when we were deciding on a hotel with our travel agent at AAA. After much research we decided to have our travel agent book the room for us using our AAA discount rather than booking online. We had her request building 6 because we had read good things about the view as well as the peace and quiet. She was told that they couldn't guarantee, but they would do what they could. We got to the hotel from the airport just after 3:00 in the afternoon. We were met by the bell staff and checked in very quickly at the front of the building. We didn't even need to go in. After a beautiful flower lei greeting for both of us, we were shown to our room in building 6. It was a ways away from the main lobby and front of the building, but that was the point. We had booked a deluxe ocean front room and the view didn't disappoint. It was absolutely beautiful. There was a full view of Lanai'i and Molokai'i. We saw whales a couple of days, and people jumping off Black Rock when they dared. The room was plenty big with a king size bed. It was clean and cleaned well every day. The furnishings were fine but starting to show the signs of age and wear. It could have used new carpet or at least a carpet cleaning and maybe some new dressers. The pads on the lanai chairs were worn as well. But this was the only issue we had with the room. The only issue we had with the hotel itself was one day it was very windy and blew all the "Do Not Disturb" signs on the ground. (There are open air hallways throughout) When we came back from snorkeling for the day, a sign was on our door saying they had attempted to clean our room but the "Do Not Disturb" sign was on the door. We had not put it there. Ours was still inside the room. We called housekeeping and they arranged to come clean at 3:30 after we had left again for the evening. They apologized for the inconvenience, and the room was cleaned when we returned. The bulk of our stay was fantastic. We didn't have to fight to find pool chairs. We were always able to find two together when we wanted them. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The concierge was extremely helpful and patient in helping us book a dinner cruise for our anniversary. The Black Rock Steakhouse and the Lagoon Bar had very good food that was not priced any differently than comparable bars and restaurants here. The banana margarita at the Lagoon Bar was yummy! Don't order a lemonade from the Sundowner Bar. It's bar gun sweet/sour. Yuck! We didn't mind the 5 minute walk from our room to the pool/beach area. It helped burn all those extra calories that you eat on vacation. Besides, we were away from the action and that kept the room itself a little quieter. (There was no problem with noise in any way, shape, or form.) We had a rental car but maybe wouldn't have needed one. There was transportation available to bring guests to Whaler's Village and Lahaina. Whaler's Village was close enough to walk to, but Lahaina was not. The regular trips were convenient, but sometimes very full - standing room only on the shuttle. We also walked to the Westin one evening for their Luau. Highly recommend that.. The food and drinks were fabulous and the entertainment was very good. Besides, there was no buffet line! Everything was served family style at the table. Overall, my husband and I thought the extra money spent to get the view and the quiet away from the main part of the resort was well worth it. The 20.00 per day resort fee seemed a little much. We didn't use any of the services it paid for, but we knew about it ahead of time and made the decision to stay there despite that. So no complaints from us. The staff was great, and even the check out process was simple. We reviewed our charges which were correct, they printed a statement, took our keys, and we were on our way! The only bad part was that our vacation was over and we had to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GMullins
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Maui for 5 nights in April. The Sheraton Maui is a great mid priced hotel in a great location. The walk to Whaler's village is nice, where you can find three resturants and a mall like fast food court, along with several tourist and high end retail shops. Lahaina town is a short 5 minute drive. Front street has lots of great resturants and shops. I would highly recommend the Lahaina Store and Oyster Bar. It is a raw bar that suprisingly has the best prime rib I have ever tasted. Nice atmosphere, not too bad on price. Now for the Sheraton. Our room was in building 4. It was larger than your basic hotel room, and had a large bathroom and balcony. Housekeeping was great everyday. The view is amazing. Snorkeling at the resort is great. Snorkel equipment is available at the resort, but is much cheaper if you rent in town. I cannot report on the food at the resort, as we mostly were out exploring Maui during the day and had dinner in Lahaina or Whaler's Village every night. I did get a pineapple smoothie the last day we were there and although it tasted great, it was in what I would call a small cup and was costly at 9.50. The best thing about this resort is the beautiful beach, great rooms and location. Basically, if you are in wanting to go to Hawaii because you just want to go to Hawaii, stay at the Sheraton Maui and you will not be dissapointed. It is really great. I really believe that Maui probably has to be one of the most beautiful places on earth. If you are looking for only a beach vacation somewhere, anywhere, I would look toward somewhere else based on cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lele4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Maui Sheraton for our 10th anniversary in December. Maui had just had a huge storm the day before and so we moved rooms at 2 times until we got one that did not smell like mildew. A lot of the rooms facing the ocean direcly had been flooded. Our friends had a nice room too. The beds were comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. The pools were beautiful but way too cold to swim in. We rented snorkel equipment at a hut down the boardwalk (the hotel's were more expensive) and used it every day at Black Rock (fair snorkeling). I would definitely stay at the Sheraton again if I ever went back to Maui in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Maui”
Reviews.Author: pismore
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton for a week and enjoyed every minute of it. The grounds, room, service and staff were first-class. We opted for a package that included breakfast which was fit for everyone's appetite. Our deluxe room (about $600 per night) had a direct view of Lanai; we had never seen so many whales - it seemed as though you could reach out and touch them. Since we checked late in the evening a king bed room (that we thought we booked) was not available but the hotel did move us to one the next day. In addition to excellent hotel dining, there are plenty of great restaurants in Lahaina; Longhi's, Kobi's and Kimo's to mention a few. If you like fresh seafood Maui is the place for you. We found that the helicopter ride up to the volcano was exhilarating. You've got to try it. We had rented a convertible car but rarely used it with the top down. Pretty much all attractions can be viewed within a 60 minute drive except for the infamous Road to Hana. We passed on it but did view the remote area on our helicopter excursion. Note that most helicopter operators heavily discount their fares if you call in and make your reservation after 5:00 pm. You may have to get up a little early but it may be worth the savings.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Time at the Sheraton Maui”
Reviews.Author: DoubleD1969
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui in January 2006 for four nights in a ground floor room that was spacious and about 50 yards from the Black Rock beach. We liked our room a lot. The only improvement I hope they have made was the little worn out carpeting. Other than that, we really enjoyed the room which had a living room separate from the bedroom. The facilities were beautiful and had fantastic views of the ocean and Lanai. There were multiple buildings on the property, and each seemed to have great views. We had breakfast at the hotel one time, and thought it was very good though a little pricey. From the hotel, it was an easy walk on a paved path to Whaler's Village for more dining options and shopping. The staff that we dealt with were great -- the valet guys and concierge who helped us booked some snorkeling excursions.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Aloha Spirit at the Maui Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: mccmrs
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Maui at Black Rock is the best hotel on Kaanapali Beach. I've stayed at the Hyatt, Marriott and Westin in Kaanapali and the Sheraton is by far my favorite. Not only is their property on the best snorkeling spot along Kaanapali Beach, the Sheraton is a beautiful property with a true Hawaiian feel. Unlike the other hotels - the Sheraton is a low rise property that blends beautifully into the surroundings. The pool is very nice - it meanders through the grounds giving the guests spectacular views along the way. One big plus is the availability of deck chair and shade - unlike the other Kaanapali hotels where one has to arrive early in the morning to stake out a spot. The staff was very welcoming and everyone had a true Aloha spirit. Everyone we talked to - from the valet, to the bellman, to the pool staff, to the maids - they were all genuinely eager to do what ever they could to make our stay special. Our stay was indeed special and I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Cheddywig
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 7 nights (checked out May 2nd) at the Sheraton Maui and this resort was great. This resort seems like it truly belongs in Maui and was not one of the high-raise hotels so it fit perfectly on the beach. The pools were great with lagoons connecting the two pools. The beach was great as was the fire cliff diving which occurred nightly. The breakfast menu was fantastic, although a little pricey. Fresh pineapple and other fruits daily. Truly a great resort in paradise. For a day trip consider flying to Oahu (only an short 45 min plane ride) and take a drive up to the North Shore.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in Maui to Stay !!”
Reviews.Author: Suzy5
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a beautiful resort ! i took my best friend to Maui for her 50th birthday. We had a wonderful time from start to finish. We had our room up graded upon arrival. The whole staff was exceptional. The beach area was terrific ! The breakfast buffet was so delicious every day. We are already planning to go back in 2 years to celebrate my 50th birthday. The trip of a lifetime--stay at the Sheraton Maui, for sure !!! It can't be beat !!!!!!! BEST PLACE TO STAY !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Location for a Resort”
Reviews.Author: talkinmonkey
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 5 nights in april, 2008. we found a great deal on a garden view room on the starwood website ($199/night). and before we arrived, i called and told them that my wife was pregnant, and that anything they could do to make her more comfortable would be super, so they signed us up for "starwood preferred guest" status (free), which entitled us to a free room upgrade. we ended up with an ocean view room at no extra charge. the room was nice, with a private balcony and a king-size bed. the bed was outrageously comfortable. lcd tv and minifridge. the hotel is enormous and the grounds are very well-kempt. we're used to more...rustic...accomodations, so this was a change for us. so much concrete and landscaping! the staff was very nice, our "personal concierge" gave us a fairly standard list of stuff to do and see, and they set up a surf lesson for us without hassle. the location is good, about 10 minutes north of the town of lahaina, in an area called ka'anapali, on the western coast of maui. lahaina is a neat little town full of restaurants and shops. lots of tourists. there's also a concrete "boardwalk" that runs along the beach from the sheraton south to the hyatt (or the westin, i forget), giving easy access to the other hotels' restaurants and services. the hotel beach and pool were VERY crowded (again, not what we're used to, i guess), and there were LOTS of kids around all the time. there is excellent snorkling RIGHT off the hotel beach (black rock), which was neat. i went late afternoon and was the only person out there. they do a nice cliff diving ceremony each night, which all the kids seemed to get a kick out of. we didn't eat at any of the hotel's restaurant options (there was too much to check out elsewhere). speaking of elsewhere, that side of the island has some really cool things to see, including some "secret" beaches and some great sights. i HIGHLY recommend--no, i INSIST--that you get "maui revealed" by andrew doughty. it's an excellent "insider" tourist guide, where to go, and more importantly where NOT to go (but keep the book in your bag as much as you can, as the locals might grumble at you if they see it). not sure i'd go back, because there's too much else in the world to see, but it's a really, really nice property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it”
Reviews.Author: Canuck123
Reviews.Content: Aloha. We just returned from our stay at the Sheraton Maui. Andrew, our valet was full of information about the resort and the area. We were upgraded to an ocean view in building 4 and all I can say is it was heaven. To be lulled to sleep with surf sounds at night and have coffee on the lanai in the morning. The fridge is great in the room for all the snacks that we got at Longs and Safeway in Lahaina. We took in two beautiful sunsets at Black Rock. Whalers Village was great and within walking distance, so we could have a few drinks with any dinner. LOVED the ABC store at Whalers Village for getting all our knick knacks and drinks for our balcony. Snorkelling was great but we also took in some other areas around the island that had clearer views. It is quiet and gorgeous and you will love it if you book.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Chitownee
Reviews.Content: I'm really not sure how you can have a bad time in Maui but I guess that you can always have a better one. The hotel lobby, bar, pool was gorgeous! Beautiful views of the ocean from most of the rooms. The carpet could have been replaced. It had lost all of its cushy-ness and had some stains. I found a great deal on priceline but it took weeks of trying to find one. The location cannot be beat. I was snorkeling in the area by the hotel and saw a baby turtle up close and personal. Lahaina and Ka'anapali are where the action is! So stay here for the great location. Yes, you should rent a car to drive to Hanaa and get up at an insane hour to go to Haleakala for the most beautiful (and coldest) sunrise ever.

Reviews.Title: “The best loacation on Ka'anapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: readytogogram
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sheraton in the deluxe Ocean Front rooms. Beautifully comfortable, lanai that faces the ocean with cliffs directly below. Saw several Sea Turtles from our room. We booked through our travel agent, and our stay included the breakfast buffet that otherwise would have cost $30 each. An excellent buffet. The hotel restaurants were very good also, and we recommend all of them. Especially enjoyed the beach access, sunset views, cliff diver, tiki bar at the beach for light meals and drinks, pool and garden areas. The walkway down to the other hotels, and Whalers Cove shopping and restaurants was very convenient. The surf can be rough, so be experienced or cautious. The staff was very Aloha friendly, and corrected an big error when upon arrival we ended up with the wrong bedding. One night was sacraficed. Overall an excellent stay, and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: ChristyLS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 night stay @ the Sheraton. We loved this property and will stay here next time we visit Maui. First of all the grounds are breathtaking ....We ate lunch at the pool daily and were always happy w/ the service as well as food quality (yes it was pricy but paradise will cost you.) The free snacks and fresh pineapple slices in the afternoon poolside were a nice touch. The property was very quiet @ night but we loved this. It was perfect to walk for drinks or dinner elsewhere and return to the relaxed Sheraton atmosphere. The only reason we never ate dinner @ the Sheraton was we liked to walk off property at night. The Sunset torch ceremony was a great way to start every evening while having a cocktail and a appetizer...Very relaxing... We enjoyed the pool complex and didn't feel crowded even though the hotel was booked to capacity (we asked the staff). The pool staff monitored lounge chairs and removed towels if left unattended for more than about 30 mins. We liked the fact we did NOT need to reserve chairs at the crack of dawn like other hotels we've visited. Many other near by hotels had larger pool areas but had a "spring break" type of feel to them (too crowded & very noisy.) Our one and only complaint was the actual room. Like the next review we felt the room was very tiny --- and we were in building 4 having a deluxe ocean view... Also the room wasn't clean upon arrival. We called housekeeping immediately and they arrived within 10 minutes. They recleaned the bathroom and put new sheets on the bed- The first comforter was all stained, the bathroom had hairs, & EVERYTHING was covered by a layer of dust when we first walked in.. After waiting poolside to check into our room (we did not rush the front desk for our room) we were very disappointed that we couldn't even use the bathroom immediately. This might sound bad~ but after the room was "recleaned" we had no further issues. The beach area is large and we were pleasantly surprised that we were charged 1/2 price when we rented 2 beach chairs & an umbrella after 1pm. I don't know if this is standard procedure or not but we were happy to only pay $20 vs. $40 as you can only rent them until 5pm. Bring your snorkel gear if you plan to snorkel in Maui. One more small thing -- The concierge was very busy so get there early or be prepared to wait in line. If you choose to valet it was only $5 per day. We came from Oahu where it was $20 per day. There was a fridge in the room which came in very handy for keeping water/ juices/ beer etc. No coolers are allowed @ the pool area but if you're headed to the beach or Hana it was very helpful. Overall we felt you can't go wrong staying here- after all you're in Maui- Aloha !

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Sheraton - great value but not the best”
Reviews.Author: rlsnyc04
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our experience at the Sheraton for the second week of our honeymoon. The location cannot be beat - if you are going to stay on Kanapali Beach (spelling?) then this is the best. The property is the most resort-like of all of them, spread over 20+ acres with the deepest sandy beach of the stretch so it actually makes the pool and other areas more roomy since more people move down there. The pool was very nice though not the nicest I have ever been to - but they did have an area that was 8 feet deep right next to one of the open air bars which tended to be more adults which was good for us. The staff was very friendly as well, as was everyone we met on the islands. However, here are the downsides - there is no nightlife on the property itself. We were on our honeymoon so were not looking for much, but their 'lounge' was basically the breakfast terrace converted into a restaurant with a bar at night, so it totally lacked any ambiance. Some of the little touches were missing that would be at other hotels of the same price range, but not many complaints there. The room was one of the smallest hotel rooms I have stayed in (not in a major city) - and we had three weeks worth of luggage so it was particularly tough. Overall, we much preferred this to the Westin where we originally checked in (and immediately checked out of since it was basically three high rises built around a very crowded pool area). If I go back to Lahaina, I would choose this again, or maybe the Hyatt Regency but there is very little beach here. However, for a honeymoon I would check out Wailea since there seem to be more resort-like properties there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Resort”
Reviews.Author: TravelTrogs
Reviews.Content: Fast check-in at curbside. Was upgraded from ocean front to a deluxe ocean front room-located in bldg 6. Very quiet but requires an interesting walk to get anywhere on the property. Resort was very clean and well maintained. There is as much or little to do as you want. Nice to see that guests are not allowed to snag the pool chairs the night before or leave them for more than 30". They had champagne waiting for us, nice touch! It's also very pricey!! First night we were tired from a day of travel so ate at the Lagoon Bar-2 drinks apiece plus a fish sandwich and a cheeseburger plus tip was $92! Better to walk down to Whaler's Village or take the free shuttles into Lahaina. The beach is clean and Black Rock is good for snorkling when the water is calm but can get crowded with snorklers and jumpers from the rocks overhead. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and accommodating and our room was always clean. Our big complaint was that the beds and pillows could be of better quality for the price you pay and being a 4-5 star hotel. Otherwise, it is a beautiful resort and probably one of the best locations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: titangrrl05
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Sheraton Maui for a week in November. We arrived the day after Thanksgiving, and checked out one week later. We specifically booked this hotel because it is the last hotel on Ka'anapali Pkwy, and we specifically booked building 6 becuase of its remote location from the rest of the resort. We had a top floor room, with a perfect view of Molokai. Looking north, we had a great view of the resorts on the "other" side of Ka'anapali, and there was no view whatsoever of the rest of the resort (which was great for us). My boyfriend does not eat breakfast, and enjoy a light one. The mini-fridge was perfect for my yogurt. We went to Safeway in Lahaina and stocked up on yogurt, granola, and a case of water. We ate in the restaurant twice for breakfast (once it was raining and I wanted French Toast and the other day we were going on a 4 mile hike and needed to properly fuel). The prices were not great, but expexted. We ate one night at the Teppan Grill, and that was fun...about the same price we would pay for benihana's here in California. We ate one day at the poolside cafe, and teh quality was acceptable. I spent the $40 one day on a beach cabana, and for me, it was well worth it! We spent a lot of time relaxing in our room and on the lanai, so we feel we got our $$$'s worth. The housekeeping service was great. We didn't really interact with the front desk except when checking in & out. We didn't use the valet at all, but the bell desk was great the day we checked out and stored our luggage. All in all, the Sheraton gave us what we wanted: a perfect view, a clean, comfortable room, and to be left alone! Also, we booked a full package on Travelocity (air & hotel) and spent nowhere near the rack rate!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuzyQ8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in October for 9 nights and had a great time. The grounds are gorgeous, the beach is incredible (both my 7 & 4 year old snorkeled there and saw turtles day after day), the pool is HUGE and they even have a toddler pool area. By the way, do go to Molokini to snorkel...We all enjoyed that day and the snorkeling was great (turtles, dolphins & a shark - very cool). We went to the Luau which was the best I've ever seen (pay the extra dollars for preferred seating), then saw it again from our Lanai a few days later while dining from room service. Couldn't have been nicer. We ate several times at the b-fast buffet and had dinner several times to watch the hula dancers and live music. The tiki torch lighter even took my boys to help him light the tikis. They LOVED it. What more could a mom want but so much attention for her boys! The staff was so friendly and helpful and seemed to really go the extra mile for us. The only thing that went less than perfect was the day we arrived, we found our room to be very dusty and the bathroom needed a little deep cleaning. They sent staff right up to clean it, the housekeeping supervisor called the next day to be sure everything was satisfactory, and then they had free breakfast coupons delivered for the inconvenience. How can you complain when a hotel works so hard to please the customer? That's service at it's finest! As far as I'm concerned, this hotel is highly recommended!!! We will definately return

Reviews.Title: “You Won't Go Wrong Here”
Reviews.Author: Maramu
Reviews.Content: We went for Spring Break (March 21 - March 28th) because it was recommended in Trip Advisor and by some friends. Booked a partial ocean view with breakfast included. We were upgraded upon arrival and weren't disappointed in the room: decent size, comfortable beds, functional bathroom, great lanai with view, and a welcoming gift. The best things about the hotel were the openness (stayed in bldg 2 overlooking the huge lawn and ocean), beach (size and features including Black Rock for scuba/snorkeling/jumping/turtles, size, and cleanliness), attentive staff, proximity to other facilities (5 minute walk to Whalers Village, half hour jog along the beach, 8 minute drive to Lahaina, 8 minute drive to Kapalua resorts and beaches), the activities (hula lessons, pilates, yoga, chef lessons, etc) and the overall feeling of not being too crowded even though the hotel was full. What I liked the least were the expensive drinks and restaurants (paradise will co$t you), the well documented chair charge and hassle of beach umbrellas and chairs, and I guess the $20 convenience fee (valet parking was $5 - c'mon, let that one go). Best place to have a meal nearby is the Hula Grill; best breakfast is the banana-mac pancakes at the Gazebo restaurant in Kapalua, best expensive and overall meal is Mama's Fish House, best sushi is Sansei's in Kapalua. We took the Keralani excursion because Trilogy was full - it was great. We did a beach scuba at Black Rock with Maja and it was pleasant (turtles, octopus, schools of fish, needle fish, heard the whales). Pointers: get the package with breakfast included, stay near the south side of the hotel (rooms in bldg 6 have a great ocean view but they are isolated from the action and a small hike away), reserve chairs facing the beach near the pool if you want to avoid the $34 charge for 2 chairs and 1 umbrella, don't call for the meeting & "free gift" - condo sales, sit by the bar near the pool at 5:30PM while having a drink and watching the sunset and torch ceremony, and just enjoy being in a beautiful and relaxing place.

Reviews.Title: “Only problem-free hotel I've ever been to”
Reviews.Author: flapjack30
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Sheraton Maui during New Years 2007 for a week, as part of a two week trip to Hawaii. The other half of our trip was on Lanai (you can guess where), and this half at the Sheraton was definitely the most fun part of the two weeks. The welcome you get at the front of of the hotel is very warm. Greeters are on-hand to give you the obligatory lei and a smiling "Welcome to the Sheraton Maui", the valet is right there, ready to take your car, and the bell boys whisk your luggage away faster than you can say "Where's the front desk?". The conceirge service is second to none. They have 4 conceirges working all the time, doing anything they can to help you book activities. We booked a helicopter tour, a snorkeling tour of Molokini, and a Luau at a competitor's hotel when the Sheraton's Luau was full (don't ever do a luau, by the way, as it's a huge waste of money, and incredibly cheesy. Spend your $150 a person on something constructive like.......well, anything else). Basically, everything up at the front part of the hotel worked perfectly. The rooms are pretty standard fare, nothing super special. The safe was nice, as my girlfriend had some jewelry she wanted kept out of the open. We had a mountain view (i.e. not ocean view) room, but we could still see the ocean out our window, and we were not at all subjected to seeing ugly condo highrising when we went out on our balcony. Staff service was superb. It wasn't the incessant "What can we do for you, Sir?" that you get every 5 seconds at some hotels, but was a nice, medium amount of helpfulness that gave you some privacy, while still enabling you to get help when you needed it. Room service was very quick, and the food was great. The breakfast buffet was incredible (I still dream about it). The pool was one of those circuitous river-like pools, which was fun. The poolside bars were also supremely satisfying. I fondly remember eating a seared Ahi sandwich, drinking a malt beverage, and watching a bowl game all within view of a beautiful horizon. Oh yeah, that's one more thing: you can see the island of Lana'i perfectly almost all the time. It's like looking at a postcard every single day. I'm usually am hyper-critical of hotels when I feel like there's something incredibly annoying and/or easily fixable about them, but with the Sheraton Maui, I really can't find anything that gets my goat. Probably the most negative thing I could say is that it seems to be incredibly popular, so you'll probably have to be on your toes to get a pool chair, or a beach cabana.....but even that's not very hard. Oh yeah, if you want to park your own car, you can do that too (I hate hotels that are valet-only). We would park behind the Sheraton, near the tennis courts, and leisurely walk into the hotel. Very nice. You don't want to have to deal with tipping valets, and talking to front staff people, and encountering the throngs of new, disoriented tourists every single time you reenter the hotel, so this relaxed parking option was perfect. Go here if you're looking for somewhere to stay in Maui. You won't be disappointed. No disclaimers, no warnings are necessary; just go!

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: tooka
Reviews.Content: my husband and I just returned from Maui. WOW! Here are some hints/suggestions travelers need to know when staying at Sheraton and Maui 1-be prepared to pay big bucks. good ocean view rooms are expensive, resort fee of $20/day is crazy, pool side food/drinks are over priced. This is all part of the experience. when your at the pool you cant really get up and go eat anywhere else. close by places are also pricey. you are in Maui, not Mexico or Cuba 2-rent a car! there is no transit system and cabs are VERY expensive. Parking is free and plenty @ the hotel. Directions are easy to follow. With the car rental, you can get a GPS system for ~$60. 3-chairs, cabanas, and umbrellas at the beach will go quickly and you have to pay for it. This is the only thing i didnt like about this hotel. Pool side chairs are a better alternative, free, and available. You do have to be an early riser to get them too 4-Go for the room deal with buffet breakfast included. This is so worth it and breakfast is great 5-If you arrive after 11pm, there is NO FOOD at the hotel or close by at all. You will have to drive to Safeway, ~10min drive from the hotel 6-GO TO FRONT STREET. it is so nice, full of shops, art galleries, and great restaurants. While there, for high end dinning worth the high end price, try Lahaina Grill. Make reservations. For casual dinning, way less expensive, try Cheeseburger in Paradise. Long line-ups, cannot reserve but great 7-Whalers Village: Great little shopping/dinning location. Food is good, prices high for what you are getting...but again, remember u r in Maui. 8-Try Roy's in Lahaina. Great food and yes slightly pricey. Try the Thai Shrimp entree. overall, this was a great vacation. Be prepared to spend your money, there is no way around it. The Hotel is wonderful. The pool and beach great. Grounds are nice. Staff and service great. ALOHA!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location--everything else could be better.”
Reviews.Author: anksharma
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton was the original resort in West Maui and the location is great. The beach at Ka'anapaali is wonderful for all age groups. In our parties we had a pre-schooler and teenagers and all loved it. The Sheraton pool is pretty good, although it does not compare to some others we have seen in Hawaii such as the Hilton properties on Oahu and the Big Island. The property is very clearly a product of the 60s, although they have done a good job of keeping it fresh and updated. The restaurants are all pretty average, although in Hawaii even average is incredibly expensive. The breakfast buffet was uninspired and remained exactly the same throughout our entire stay. There are quite a few dining options in Whaler's Village, which is about a 10 minute walk. I am a Starwood Platinum, but I have found at resorts it does not have too much sway. Our "deluxe" view room had what in most places is called a partial ocean view room. There are no suite upgrades offered for platinums here during spring break. My 2nd room was on points and was a garden view, amazingly the garden view was right next door to the the deluxe ocean view. The check in is pretty easy with the bellman having your packet ready to go. The location is very good for what West Maui has to offer, great beaches, shopping and dining in Lahaina, and the attractions like the Nakalele blowhole. Hana and the Haleakala crater are 2 hours plus by car. The main negative of this place, and many other Starwood proprties in Hawaii is the ceasless flogging of timeshares. They do not let up ever. Every "Aloha" from a seemingly friendly staffer has some sort of timeshare hook attached to it. If I were to come back to West Maui I would probably try another property. For variety mostly and to try and find somewhere really memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: aliasalias
Reviews.Content: What a heavenly experience in paradise! Beautiful location, first-class service in every aspect, spectacular accommodations in room and out! Sunsets, cliff divers, snorkeling, and hammocks on the beach. Ahhhhhhhhh! It's our 3rd stay at this resort in 6 visits to this island.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton Maui!”
Reviews.Author: hrhsoleil
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a ten day vacation. We stayed the first three nights down in Wailea at the Grand Wailea resort (highly recommend) and thought we'd be downgrading by spending the rest of the trip at the Sheraton. WRONG! When we arrived at the Sheraton, we found we were upgraded to an ocean view in building 2, where we had an incredible view of Black Rock. The room was lovely...large, clean, reasonably-priced and tastefully decorated. The lanai was private. The Sheraton is at the north end of the beach walk, so it's easy to walk south past Whaler's Village and explore all the other hotels. Their lobbies may have been more impressive, but no way could they match our view. We'd read some negative things about the Sheraton and really thought we'd be "putting up" with something less luxurious by staying there. Boy, were we wrong. I highly recommend the Sheraton Maui Resort and would definitely go back. It's a quick walk to the Hula Grill (excellent, reasonably priced-food, popular with locals) and a short drive to the grocery store. The Sheraton gives you a fridge, so use it. Just be sure to sign up for a customer courtesy card at whatever grocery store you decide to shop at. (Instead of saving 3 or 4 dollars, like you would at home, you'll end up saving 13 or 14 dollars a visit.)

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton not for us”
Reviews.Author: MinneapolisBetty
Reviews.Content: For those who would like to experience Hawaii and not just a row of high rise resorts that could be anywhere- we recommend avoiding the whole Ka'anapali Beach area, which is a strip of high-rise hotels and nothing else. That said, we also did not like the fact that the Sheraton feels huge and very corporate (the rooms gave no real indication we were in Hawaii)--and not suited for anyone with mobility issues (lots of walking and stairs, few elevators). Most of all there was hardly any of that "aloha" feeling and everything was over-priced even for Maui. You pay for chairs at the beach. You pay a resort fee. You pay way too much even for Hawaii for restaurant food. And the room service menu? Don't get me started. And the personal touch we did have- at the beach services kiosk- was just trying to sell us more stuff. They rudely suggested my husband buy their $180 sun glasses to replace the ones he was wearing. And he observed one staff person suggesting to a woman that her chest area looked dry and she should buy the lotion they were selling. Truthfully I feel sorry for the staff here who are probably trained to do that sort of thing. Also, while I appreciate the need for efficiency, the fact that you can do everything via tv (you can check out that way) means no personal touch at the hotel. The one person I felt sense of the Hawaiian aloha from was the gentlemen in the business center. Luckily even the row of high rise hotels cannot ruin the view (though I'm sure black rock and the amazing snorkeling there would be better without the addition of the hotels here). Even our 12 year old did not like it here. And forget getting a seat by the pool here unless you mark your spot by 9 am! Crowded beach etc. Definitely would not return.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: goudagirl
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is a great combination of relaxation and luxury. It doesn't have the uptightness and chaos of some of the other resorts, yet still retains a high level in room quality, customer service and pool area. And this particular part of Kaanapali Beach is the best in West Maui--exceptionally clear waters, no seaweed, and great sand. Plus, they have the added benefit of having exceptional snorkeling right on the property. Although our experience was very positive, there were a few setbacks. 1.) The expense of snorkeling equipment on-site. If you plan on snorkeling more than an hour, it's wise to rent your equipment in Lahaina on the way to the hotel. Equipment in town is $5/day and $15/week, versus $8/hour at the hotel. This isn't so much a drawback specific to the Sheraton as it is typical of all the resorts. 2.) The pools close earlier than other hotels on the strip, so no evening swims. The spa, however, stays open late. 3.) Because the beach is so nice, it can get crowded with guests from other hotels. Snorkeling in particular is a bit of a madhouse between 9 and 3. Best to go early morning or late afternoon. Valet is only $5/day and, frankly, worth the price. Beds are very comfortable. Rooms seemed to be relatively soundproof--we never heard our neighbors. Flatscreen TV was nice. Room service is outrageously overpriced (versus the usual just extremely overpriced.) Go down to the pool and bring it back up to your room. All in all, a great experience. And we wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but only if you want to be a tourist. Don't expect quiet relaxation”
Reviews.Author: kewMapleValley
Reviews.Content: The staff friendly , but pushed hard to get us to upgrade our room. We did for one night and then moved, too noisy. Moved to a garden view room again, nice, but we heard every conversation from the neighbors and they had small children and ababy. Cost of food and drinks too high even for Maui and it was just too busy for relaxation. Not sure I'd even consider staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous View..Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: scot0529
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our 5th anniversary in Feb. of 2008. We orginally booked a garden view becuase it was approx. $150 cheaper a night, but when we got there they had an ocean view available and they gave it to us for only $75 more a night. It was SO worth it. We stayed in building 4 which I highly recommend. The unit was small, but very nice and well furnished. (who cares how big a room is when your at the beach all day) The resort itself is gorgeous. It is very open and the grounds are extremely well maintained. The pool was great as well. (You better get down there early if you want chairs). Although we didn't hang out at the beach that often, it was very nice. Unfortunately you have to pay for beach chairs which i think is a bit ridiculous. The service was top notch. Everyone was really friendly and they always had a smile on their face. The location of the property was great. It is pretty well centralized between Lahina and Kapalua. Overall it was an amazing stay, just be prepared to spend a few bucks on the food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: lmanna
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure our honeymoon @ the Sheraton Maui was perfect. The service was impeccable. We stayed in building 6 "Hale O Ka Moana", in a Deluxe Ocean Front. I strongly suggest putting in a request for the building you wish to stay in. The buildings are spread out over the property and building 1 and 2 are not in the best location on the property. The food was very good, especially the breakfast at Keka'a Terrace! The Sheraton is in the best location on Ka'anapali Beach! There is music every-night, and you are within walking distance to other local restaurants and a quick taxi ride (3 minutes) to town. We also rented a car and explored the island, absolutely gorgeous! We loved it so much that we already booked to go back for our 1 year anniversary!!!

Reviews.Title: “can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: mauitravelerOhio
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 8 days at the Sheraton Maui. It was fabulous. The staff was wonderful and very friendly. The resort itself was beautiful. It was also so clean.. The view from our room (building 3, fifth floor oceanfront) was like a postcard. When we go back to Maui this is where we will stay. We also loved the location. Close to everything we wanted to do, including driving to Hana.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: moncherrie
Reviews.Content: All I can say is excellent! We were there with the Mercedes Benz golf tournament and everything was more than we expected. Beautiful room, beautiful view. Customer service was great. Food was fantastic....and it was all free!

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed the sheraton very much”
Reviews.Author: jmuamy
Reviews.Content: we honeymooned here for the second half of our trip. we were given a beautiful welcome bag upon check in that had nice snacks. we were upgraded to an ocean view room. you can watch beatiful sunsets right from your balcony. the room was nice and updated. the pools were nice, though a little cold. sometimes finding the perfect chair was a little tricky, but we could always find something. we got massages oceanside, which were very nice. the snorkeling is great right at black rock. there are many great restaurants nearby. we enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful honeymoon experience at Sheraton Maui”
Reviews.Author: jackiemick
Reviews.Content: We spent the first half of our honeymoon at the Sheraton Maui, and it was absolutely wonderful. We were welcomed by friendly hotel staff with fresh flower leis and there was a complimentary bottle of champagne waiting for us in our room. The room was not large, but it was clean and comfortable with a heavenly bed and an amazing view. Our lanai overlooked the Ocean, the pool and the mountains. There were yoga and pilates classes held in our building each morning in an open air room and you could hear the waves crashing as you worked out. The pool area is crowded, but there are plenty of lounge chairs and the poolside staff keeps the cocktails coming all day long. The beach is less crowded and the ocean water in front of the hotel is relatively calm. We saw whales almost every day, and snorkled with small fish and turtles. The food is just OK and expensive for what you get (but that's frequently the case in Hawaii, we found). For other lunch/dinner spots, Lahaina is a 5 minute drive away, Whaler's Village is a short 10 min walk along the boardwalk, but not right next to it like some other hotels that are packed with noisy children (ie the Westin). Overall, we loved the Sheraton Maui and hope to return some day!

Reviews.Title: “Great Snorkeling”
Reviews.Author: Phyllis10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 10 days at the Sheraton. The hotel was beautiful, all of the staff was so pleasant. At sundown on each night you are treated to a wonderful cliff diving ceremony. But I have to say the best thing about this hotel is that you are always guaranteed great snorkeling. If you like seeing turtles, you will love this. Every day, you can go into the water and find a number of turtles! It is truly amazing! The rooms were a nice size, much bigger that the Westin a few doors down. Parking is a litlle bit of a hassle, but not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing beach- snorkelling, whales, dolphins, turtles!”
Reviews.Author: camehometosnow
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 day visit to the Sheraton and had a terrific time. The beach is AMAZING! It never felt crowded (in fact at times we were the only ones there) and the snorkelling/scuba at the black rock is fantastic. I saw 8 sea turtles, lots of reef fish, eels,etc. while on a scuba dive around the black rock. I snorkelled with a sea turtle about 30 feet from shore. The pools are very, very cold. It was rare to see anyone brave enough to take the plunge. However, the pool areas and grounds are very beautiful and well maintained. The hotel rooms are average. The gardenview/mountain view rooms were old, small and not very inviting. We ended up upgrading our room to a Oceanfront Suite (at a significant charge) to gain some extra floor space, microwave, etc. The Oceanfront suites (Bldg 6) have terrific views, we watched the whales/dolphins/turtles for hours. The hotel restaurants are OK. They are very expensive ($22 for breakfast, $14 for a chicken wrap, $10 per drink) and I found the tastes very bland. However, there are many good restaurants in Whaler's Village (five min walk) and in Lahaina (5 min drive). Giovani's, Hula Grill, Napili Shores Gazebo and BJ's were all favorites. We used the shuttle many times- it was especially useful when going to the Old Lahaina Luau so that we didn't have to worry about a Designated Driver. There was a mix of people at the hotel- many young familes, retired couples, and a few conventions going on. We found the hotel very accomodating for our family which included a 11 month old infant. I would recommend this hotel to people that enjoy being close to a good beach/snorkelling. I would also recommend upgrading your room to an Oceanfront Suite, it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but pool is COLD in November!”
Reviews.Author: tkkjstw
Reviews.Content: Our room was in building 6 on the other side of Black Rock from the lobby area. We had a beautiful view and the room was comfortable and clean. You will get some exercise on the long, confusing walk to he pool/beach area from this building, but the views along the way are spectacular. Food was overpriced but very good. The breakfast buffet was delicious...we ate it all 7 days of our stay...definitely try the coconut syrup at the pancake and waffle station. The beach is large and clean, but if you want a beach chair you have to rent it. The pool area is gorgeous, but watch out! The water temp of the pool was, I would guess, around 65 degrees. FRIGID. Painfully so. I realize it was November, but the air was warm so the pool temp was quite a shock. Our group had several young children (ages 0-8), who had plenty of fun playing on the beach and on the large lawn between the hotel and the pool area. They also enjoyed the hula lessons. Several in our group snorkeled right in front of the hotel by Black Rock and were very happy with the experience. It's a short 10-minute beach walk to great shopping and several good restaurants. One last comment...the wind was fierce for the duration of our stay. We had read before our trip that this section of the island could get a little windy in the afternoon, but it was windy all day, every day. And we live in Oklahoma so we know wind!
