I did ask a hotel employee if it was always that windy, and she said no...I guess we caught a stretch of unusual weather. Still, something for which we weren't prepared. Overall, a very pleasant stay. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: PinkPanter1
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews on Trip Advisor we were reasonably happy and decided to book into the Sheraton. I would definatly recommend this hotel to family and friends, it was very clean, nice pool, friendly staff, however being room only we did spend a fair bit of money on food and drink. So i would just say make sure you take a fair bit of spending money. Trips were also expensive, however if youre going all that way you have to see some of the island. We did a holicoptor tour of the North of Maui - amazing experience and hired a car for a couple of days so we could explore. Overall the holiday was amazing and loved every minute of it, would definatly go back (if i could afford it).

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: cobra59
Reviews.Content: We were here for a week on our honeymoon and stayed in a junior suite, it was beautiful. The beach is the best on the island. Any problems we had were taken care of right away. The only thing negative about the resort is the food. The food was good, but very overpriced. The Teppan Yaki Dan Restaurant was very good, but the other ones were very overpriced, especially for breakfast. The drinks are also pretty spendy at the bars, but they do mix them pretty good. I would recommend going into Lahaina or Whalers Village for meals. There are many more options and you get more bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lala3atl
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel cannot be beat. Black rock is your backyard and the snorkling/scuba is awesome. The beachs are sandy and long which makes for great walks along the water. The hotel felt a little dated to me. Our room smelled musty upon arrival which we fixed by opening the sliding door. The bathroom was probably my least favorite part. Sink, toilet, and shower were all kind of on top of each other. Also the tub curtain looked like it had never been scrubbed at the bottom. But you know what, we really didn't spend too much time in our room so got over all of the negatives pretty quickly. The restaurants were good and Lahaina is a fun quirky town to wander around in. Don't miss the The Old Lahaina Luau, so much fun. All in all my husband and I had a wonderful time, even though the hotel felt average to me.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Sheraton in Maui”
Reviews.Author: sunsurfandsand
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Maui located at Black Rock is a large property that has been updated and remodeled. Finding your room can be a challenge if youy do not learn the the layout of the hotel. It is well worth it. We had a beautiful oceanfront room. We could see whales from our terrace. The room has coffee, refridge, and microwave. We mentioned it was a special anniversary and were given a beautiful basket filled with champagne and Maui treats. Our room was upgraded also. Sunsets are spectular. The hotel does a great torch lighting ceremony, hula dancing, and a diver off Black Rock at sunset. The gym is great and the hotel offers yoga, pilates, and other fitness classes for free. The instructors are professional. The beach is beautiful., better than most other hotels in the area.The pool is a problem as there is a webcam that others can view you on the computer. Invasive of privacy, but we did enjoy talking & waving to our daughter in New York. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: gahearne
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from our honeymoon. We spent 4 days in NYC and then 7 days in Maoi, where we stayed at the Sheraton. We had no drivers license with us so arranged a shuttle from the airport, they have a stand beside the taxi rank and cost about half as much (think it was $45 ish for 2 of us to Sheraton). Journey took about 1 hour but we hit rush hour traffic, normally the journey is more like half an hour. The sherton has an excellent location (right on nice beach with snorkelling possibilities), friendly staff, great breakfast (which we had included in cost) and decent restaurant. We had an ocean front room in building 4, 5th floor, the balcony gave us a great view over the Sherton grounds/gardens/pool, and beach/sea. Room wasn't the largest considering the cost but was clean, comfortable and did the job nicely. A free shuttle runs from the hotel every hour to the nearby town, lahina and whalers village which provided lots of options for us. Also, we booked lots of activities with the concierge, including: - Ultimate whale watch: Excellent, many close up whale sightings, v good staff - Atlantis submarine: Prob good for families and staff were v good but didn't see anything really cool - Sunrise and downhill bike ride: Good fun, I found bike ride a bit timid though - Helicopter ride and Road to Hana tour in limo van: Good fun, road to hana is best with guide as we had, they make it interesting, still, it is a long windy bumpy trip, be prepared - surf lesson: went for lesson at 11am and it was rush hour, v busy, i'd try go at offpeak time if possible, instructor good though and got us up on the board looking good - old lahina luoa: definitely do this, worth it Re eating out: - Cheeseburger in paradise in lahina is the very best no nonsense good tasting burger joint around, definitely worth a visit - old lahina storehouse, we weren't impressed - hula grill, we weren't impressed - leilanos (across from hula grill), we went to the dining part, good experience - rusty harpoon, good experience One thing to note, seems it might be cheaper to book tourist activities in lahina on front st rather than via concierge Overall, we loved Maui, ppl v friendly, esp natives, places in general are v popular but still have all the charm you would hope from a trip to Maui. Recommend the place to anyone for honeymoon or family holiday. Just a little on the expensive side but you get what you pay for I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location, Great Service in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: lovin-2-travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights in early Oct 07. We had a mountain view room in Building 3. The room had 2 queen beds in and was perfectly acceptable and comfortable. This was right in the centre of the hotel - near to the main lobby and wi-fi area, and a couple of minutes walk to the pools and restaurants. We had a wander over to the other buildings to watch the sunset one evening and it was a few minutes walk, but wasn't that bad. The views of the sunset over there were amazing - right over Black Rock. We ate in the restaurant one night for the buffet which was nice, it wasn't gourmet food but was lovely. Everything in Maui seems to shut down and go to sleep at about 11pm, so that's a warning if you like your nightlife! If you go to a restaurant much after 8.30pm you'll find you'll be eating on your own most of the time! The snack bar by the pool did great lunches like Nachos and Burgers but was typically overpriced. The pool and surrounding lawned areas are beautifully landscaped. The beach was lovely - we went snorkelling nearly every day and swam with an amazing family of turtles who got so close to us all the time! I would recommend this to anyone looking to chill out, but remember the daily resort fee and expense of eating out in Hawaii!

Reviews.Title: “Great Winter Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Ca_natives
Reviews.Content: We had a great winter getaway at the Sheraton. We were hoping the weather would get better (it was rainy & cool the previous weeks) & we lucked out! The weather was warm, with a few showers & breezy evenings (nothing a light sweater couldn't fix). We had last stayed here in August 2007, so it was nice to return for the holidays. Our room was nice, the staff were all very wonderful & the hotel was very festive. We always enjoy snorkeling & sunning at Blackrock. We love to watch the sunset torch lighting & havie a drink of the day & appetizers. The hotel is a quick walk to great shopping at the Whalers & good restaurants with waterfront views like the Hula Grill, Leilani's & the Rusty Harpoon. It's a short drive or shuttle ride to Lahaina for more great waterfront restaurants like Kimo's & the Lahaina Fish Company and lot's more fun shopping. The Pacific Whale Foundation snorkeling trip to Lanai was very enjoyable with a lovely boat ride to and from Maui, good food and lot's of historical facts about the islands. We, also, got to see numerous whales close up showing off & putting on a wonderful show. We had a great time & hope to return next year!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfactory stay at Sheraton Maui”
Reviews.Author: jffyaroundworld
Reviews.Content: My wife and I with our 3-year old daughter stayed at Sheraton Maui for 9 nights in December 2007. We were in building 3 ground level with ocean view lanai. The room is clean and the beds are comfortable with white linens. Other than the new flat panel TV, furnitures and facilities in the room show some aging, for example, shower head is usable but the spray pattern ring is broken, the toilet got clogged once (they fixed within 10-minute of call and gave $50 dinning credit to the account, nice). Sheraton's grounds are the best in my opinion among all Ka'anapali resorts, very open, large and well maintained lawns, great beach right by the Black Rock, no artificial gardens or fancy water falls, or imported animals in pseudo-zoo like settings to crowd the ground like Westin and Hyatt, creating an airy and laid back atmosphere best suited to the beauty of natural surroundings of West Maui. My daughter happily ran around the huge lawn chasing the real birds rather than the "artificial" flamingos (which she can get at any mainland zoo). We feel more like in Maui at Sheraton's setting than in other resorts. My daughter also loves the Keiki Pool. Sheraton has some OK restaurants, but the room services suck - tasteless and expensive even at Maui standard. However, the convenient location (5-10 minutes walk along the beautiful beach path leads to Whalers Village and adjacent resorts including Westin of the same chain) offers abundant dining choices (plus shopping/grocery). An easy stroll along the beach or the path at dawn or dust also set the perfect mood for breakfast or dinner. I can't stress enough that Sheraton has the best (most convenient ) location in West Maui. Sheraton's services are great - quick and attentive. Once my daughter in her new Croc slipped in the lobby, after we picked her up and before her crying stops, out of nowhere came a manager offering tissues and a stuffed whale (the resort souvenir easily sold for at least $20 at the gift shop), which not only calms her down but also cheers her up for the whole day. To this day that stuffed whale with Sheraton's logo on it is still her favorite for some reason. Overall, we have very satisfactory stay at Sheraton, recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Storms and Waves”
Reviews.Author: AndrewCA
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to the Sheraton on Maui which we think is one of the best locations in Kaanapili, unfortunately for us the weather was not in compliance with our vacation plans and we experienced some of the worst weather that Maui has seen in years. I think the sign of a well run hotel is when things really go wrong are they able to handle the situation and in this case I am happy to report that they did. I would like to say we had an amazing time however mother nature interfered and what should have been amazing was just "great". The staff & service where excellent in "extreme" conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Property - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Jeff2086
Reviews.Content: This is a top notch Sheraton Property and is highly recommended by this reviewer. This resort hotel was outstanding from start to finish. I only stayed at the hotel for one night as I was just passing through on my â€œHawaiian Tourâ€�, however will definitely stay there again. The property is absolutely beautiful with a great pool/beach area and outside Gazebo bar. When you think of a resort property that is lush with pools, open air lobbies etc, this would be it! The room was great, the view was great, and the service was great â€“ all good here and you will not go wrong. The hotel is located on a street where there is great golf and just a couple of miles away from the downtown area with great shopping and many restaurant choices. The hotel concierge was particularly outstanding with her help and advice. I wish I could remember her name to compliment her service to hotel management. She assured me it was ok to eat at the nearby Ruthâ€™s Chris Steakhouse in shorts and a golf shirt. Canâ€™t go wrong here folks, highly recommended!!! Real nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: carolinagirl221
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband the week of Dec. 2-Dec. 9th. We had absolutely horrible weather so we were around the hotel quite a bit. We were very pleased with our stay at the Sheraton, we thought visually it was nicer than the Westin or the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel which we also considered staying at. We were upgraded to an oceanfront upon arrival and then when our room flooded from all the rain we had they promptly moved us and upgraded us once again. Everyone was very friendly especially the front desk and bellhops. The grounds are beautiful and they have a very nice pool area, though the pool was pretty cold. I recommend eating elsewhere as we did feel the meals available from the hotel were very overpriced compared to other options. I highly recommend the Sheraton and if we plan another vacation to Maui we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: slctravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui from December 8 - 14 and had a marvelous time. We were upgraded to an ocean deluxe room in building 2 and our only complaint (very minor) was that a palm tree somewhat obstructed the beautiful view. The room was spacious and updated with new carpeting and a flat screen tv. We didn't mind the $20/room/day resort charge as we utilized the fitness center (very adequate), pilates and yoga classes (lovely with view of ocean), internet hookup, and self park. We had coupons for the $20/pp buffet breakfast, which was very good and not at all crowded. The beach in front of the Sheraton is great for swimming and snorkeling. The sunsets are gorgeous with a hula every night as well as the cliff diving off black rock. The Sheraton is certainly a more low key resort - not glitzy but friendly and comfortable. We are in our 50's and love walking. We visited all the other resort in Ka'anapali and were satisfied that for us Sheraton is the place because of the beach and ambiance. We also did not have any problems whatsoever in finding our way around it. We didn't eat anything but breakfast there and didn't buy many of the expensive drinks. It was a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton - comfortable, laid back, quiet”
Reviews.Author: TheRealMC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Maui at the end of November for 5 nights. We let them know in advance that it was our anniversary, and upon arrival, they informed us that we had been upgraded to an ocean view room (from a garden room). We were able to get the keys for our room at the greeting desk next to valet/bell service, which was nice as we didn't have to wait to check in. We just went from the greeting desk straight to our room. We were in building 4 on the 3rd floor, and our king room had a wonderful lanai and view of the ocean and down the beach. The room was a good size and in good shape - nothing was stained or torn. We appreciated having the small fridge, as we went to the grocery store to buy snacks and drinks. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was fine - the only complaint I have there is that the drains in both the sink and tub were slow and when we finished showering, there was typically enough water left in the tub to cover our feet. Maybe that's from the years of sand building up, but it should have been better. The room, bathroom, and lanai were all very clean. We rarely ate at the hotel because it was quite expensive. We did have mixed drinks by the pool - around $8-$10 ea - and we did eat one night at one of the pool lounges, which was reasonable. However, room service is outrageous - $25 for a hamburger. Even though the hotel was completely booked, we found the Sheraton to be so comfortable, relaxed and quiet. The grounds are just beautiful and so large, which we loved because we felt pretty secluded. We never heard noise from the adjacent rooms. We have stayed at the Westin previously (just a few hotels down from the Sheraton), and there was always this crazy energy, and a bit of chaos at the Westin. The Sheraton was completely different (even though there were many families and kids) - it was very laid back and serene. The beach in front of the Sheraton at Black Rock is the best and widest stretch on Kaanappali Beach. One thing - if you want lounge chairs on the beach, you have to rent them (along with an umbrella) from the hotel for around $30/day (I believe that's the price). If you would like to rent the small cabana-type thing (wood platform with cushions and awning), those are $60/day. We felt that was pretty outrageous - you already have to pay the resort fee of $20/room/night - couldn't they at least include beach chairs in that fee? They are free at the pool, so we felt they should be at the beach as well. One thing about the pool - there were a lot of people getting down to the pool early (8:00 AM) to get their towels, and then just putting them on chairs in prime sun locations to save the chairs. Many times, the people wouldn't come back down for hours, and in that case, the pool staff would pull the towels off the chairs and leave a note stating that the towels had been left for more than 30 minutes and no one (or any other items) was there, so the towels were returned. We saw this happen quite a bit, and it did cause some commotion as those people who "claimed" the chairs at 8 AM finally came back down at 11 AM and found other people occupying their chairs. We did see a few people get upset and complain to hotel management. I've never been to a hotel where they have been so proactive about removing towels - however, they never removed towels from chairs that had other personal items as well (books, etc). My husband and I thought this was an excellent policy. If the staff didn't adhere to this policy, the majority of chairs would be taken by 8:30 AM, and this is a vacation - we shouldn't have to play that towel game! All in all, we really loved the Sheraton. The purpose of our vacation was to relax, and we definitely did that! The location is excellent - at the far and of the beach and within the restaurants and shopping along the beach. Black Rock is the best stretch of beach and has the best snorketling. Hotel staff was very friendly. We would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “total disappointment- really poor experience and never, ever again”
Reviews.Author: marbellasanfrancisco
Reviews.Content: My family stayed for 7 nights at this property and will never, ever go back. First Day: Room not ready upon check-in (at check-in time), made to wait over an hour and a half (with two small children after a long flight). Had to wait behind man who was already yelling at the check in person for shoddy service and amenities. Very telling. Ate lunch ($10 PB&J that was pre-packaged/frozen for the kids, $18 packaged salad and packaged dressing for the adults). $70 with tax and tip for cafeteria food. After check-in, sliding glass door windows clouded over with some sort of substance that couldn't be cleaned off. Shower head was removable nozzle that kept falling off the holder and spraying the bathroom and us in the face (very Benny Hill) Foul brown liquid periodically back up into our bathroom sink and then mysteriously drained out after a few minutes. Loud pounding mechanical noise constantly heard while in the bathroom. Must have been next to some kind of generator. Ensuing problems: Asked the concierge for a restaurant recommendation for fresh fish in the area. She said, "Just walk around town and find someplace that you like" and shrugged her shoulders. Outdoor beach showers not working for 4 days which resulted in having to track loads of sand back into our room to wash off, clogging the bathtub and creating a mini-beach on the bathroom floor. I called for housekeeping and was told they are at dinner and only work until 4pm. Parking garage in disrepair, elevators not working, limited spaces to park, difficult access. Was walking through a hallway behind valet with my 6 year old daughter and passed a young, blonde male valet who was having a heated conversation with his mother on his cell phone and was saying loudly "Jesus, Mom, what the F*&ck are you doing. I'm at work, F&^K!" So glad my young daughter can pick up such a lovely vocabulary from the staff at the Sheraton Maui. Would be seated for the rare times we were stuck at the hotel for whatever reason for lunch and would be ignored at our table for up to 15 minutes (after milling around the hostess station trying to get someone's attention) after asking to place our drink orders to some other passing waiter Would generally be told that our waiter would be there soon and he would saunter along after another 10 minutes. This is when the lunch restaurants was 5% full. Very slow and inattentive service. Asked for a rollaway bed... was told we would be charged $70 per day for one, said no to that We requested wine glasses... $5 per glass per day. Outrageous add on hidden charges galore (already on top of a $21 per day "resort fee"). Oh, and part of the resort fee was to take care of "free shuttles", which sadly never came the two unfortunate times we waited for it. The pool was full of sand (no working beach shower) and ice cold. The hot tub smelled like "hot broccoli", my daughter commented. I travel quite a bit for business, stay in lots of hotels (Starwood and others) and consider myself pretty reasonable when it comes to expectations. I always give the benefit of the doubt. Still, this place was pretty horrible and when one pays for a particular kind of experience (again, pretty basic standards were expected), this hotel and staff failed miserably. I would never stay here again and will stay at a Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons property next time. You pay more upfront, but at least you get the service and experience you would expect from a higher end property and aren't incrementally charged constantly for it (and still a substandard experience).

Reviews.Title: “Expensive & a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: PinkSurvivor
Reviews.Content: After a week on Kauai, we went to Maui for a week. The Sheraton Maui is VERY over priced for what you get. We had a very small ocean front room. The room was so small we didn't have a place to put our 3 suitcases. I'm an Gold SPG guest so we asked to be moved. For it being a Sheraton hotel, they did not know what an SPG was. After 2 days, we were moved to a larger room, but the ocean view was through the palm trees. Enjoyed the pool even though it was cold. Don't bother with the breakfast buffet, its very expensive & not much of a selection of food. Whaler's Village is a nice walk down the beach, but don't expect to find "bargain" food - you're in Hawaii. But at least its better than the hotel. Good location in an area of up scale hotels, if that's what you're looking for. We've stayed on Maui before & if there is a next time, we'll head to Wailea!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at the Sheraton for Maui Invitational”
Reviews.Author: ostatedeb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton for 7 nights in November for the Maui Invitational Basketball Tournament. We booked through a travel agent (Aloha Travel--very positive experience) for a package which included transfers and tourney tickets. Granted we paid more this way, but we needed tickets for the tournament and transportation to the games. After MUCH research, we selected the Sheraton, primarily due to its separation from the other busy resorts and the prime beach. We considered the deluxe ocean front (buidling 6) but booked ocean view instead, going for the view of the beach and Black Rock as we thought it would be more fun to see a variety of views rather than just ocean. We asked for Building 4, and we were upgraded to an ocean front room. We were on the 5th floor with 2 lanais, which was fabulous. The rooms are small but clean and the bed and pillows very comfortable. The bathrooms and closet are small. The fridge was large enough for drinks and a few food items. Housekeeping service was good. The snorkeling at Black Rock is fabulous and we took advantage of it daily. The beach is so clean and spacious, especially compared to the beach in front of the other major hotels. We ate one lunch at the hotel with a buy one, get one free coupon, and two buffet breakfasts as we had vouchers included in our package. Otherwise, we ate off property. Our favorite restaurant was Kimo's. We did not rent a car but took the hotel's free shuttle into Lahaina and walked the boardwalk to restaurants and for exercise. The pool water was colder than the ocean, but hey, you're in Hawaii, and it's not that hot this time of year just sitting at the pool!! Plenty of chairs available too. After all the research I did, I concluded that the negative posters forget EVERYTHING is higher in Hawaii--that's just reality. We would definitely stay at the Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: manda33
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from a 4night/5 day stay at the Sheraton and we loved it. The grounds and pool area were beautiful. They have the best spot right on Kaanapali beach. The snorkeling right outside the hotel at black rock was amazing. The last day were there, the water was extremely clear and it felt like you were in an Aquarium. We swam right next to 3 sea turtles. The pool area was really nice and the pool was shaped sort of like a lazy river with small waterfalls, a small slide and lave rock everywhere. We were upgraded to a deluxe ocean view and stayed in building 6. It was a bit of a ways to walk to get to the pool/restaurants but we didnâ€™t mind. The staff was very friendly and helped us out when the airline lost one of our bags. The rooms were a little old and a bit outdated but we spent so little time in them that it really didnâ€™t matter. We did the breakfast buffet once and there was a good selection of breakfast items. The lunch served by the pool was fairly good but nothing spectacular. I would definitely stay in the Sheraton again if I get a chance to make it back to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend the Sheraton Maui!”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiGirl01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui Resort from Nov 10-16. This was our 5th trip to Hawaii in the last 7 years. We have stayed at many hotels in Hawaii, including the Ritz Carlton in Maui, and this was one of our favorites. This hotel is fabulous! The grounds are immaculate, the pool is beautiful and the beach is probably the best we've seen. I only have one complaint that I'll get to at the end. First of all, we had a deluxe oceanfront room in Building 6. Anyone who complains about the walk is just a complainer. The walk is not that bad and the views on your way to the beach/pool are beautiful. You do have to take 2 elevators, but they are very fast and it's not that hard to figure out. We had it figured out after the first time. It's absolutely worth the walk to get to Building 6. All the rooms are literally oceanfront with nothing to get in the way of your view. There is the island of Lanai to one side and the island of Molokai to the other side and you can see the lights of Oahu in the far distance. The waves are crashing on the rocks right outside your window. The rooms were pretty good, could definitely be upgraded a little. For the price you pay you expect a walk-in shower, not a shower curtain. It needed a little paint and carpet refresher, but nothing you couldn't live with. We had trouble logging into the high-speed internet in our room, so we called someone to come fix it. We never once complained about it and still we got two food vouchers for $15 a piece for our "trouble" to be used at any restaurant on the grounds. The pool was beautiful, very clean and refreshing. Lots of chairs and plenty of room. The resort was pretty dead this time of year, as was the entire island. This is definitely a "down" time for them. It was a prefect time of year to go. The beach is amazing. It is all sand bottom with great snorkeling by Black Rock. No big waves this time of year. The beach infront of the Sheraton is the best on Kaanapali. We spent a day exploring the beaches over in Kihei and Wailea (Four Seasons Resort) and the beach at the Sheraton is so much better. We loved that it was a short walk to Whaler's Village area - we ate at Hula Grill twice. We would walk down on the beach and then walk back on the path that is right at the top of the beach. You can walk on the path all the way from the Sheraton to the restaurants in about 5 to 10 minutes. The entire staff was very friendly. The grounds, pool and beach are some of the best we've ever seen. The one BIG complaint I would have is the price of the food at the resort restaurants. We ate dinner our first night at the Lagoon Bar - my husband had an Ahi Sandwich, I had a burger and we each had a Lava Flow drink ($10 each) for a total bill of over $60. We just couldn't believe it. The drinks were not that great and were in small plastic cups. You get twice the amount and better quality at any other restaurant in town for about $7.50. A small plastic cup of soda is $3.75 (no refills). The quality of the food we had was mediocre at best. We only ate at the pool bar once to use our free meal vouchers, otherwise we wouldn't have bothered. Whoever is in charge of running the restaurant portion of this resort doesn't have very good business sense. They would get so much more business if they would lower their prices even a little bit. We're all about relaxing and enjoying drinks, but even we couldn't pay $10 for a small plastic cup of a watered-down drink. We went to Safeway right down the road and stocked up on soda, water, wine, beer and snacks. We would take a small collapsable cooler with water and soda down to the beach every day and fill it with ice and it stayed cold all day. The location of this hotel is perfect. It is a short 5 minute drive to Lahina where there are a ton of amazing restaurants on Front Street. Overall we would recommend this resort to anyone, but would clarify that with making sure not to bother eating there.

Reviews.Title: “On a Budget at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: IndianaTraveler25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Maui for two nights in November. Our stay was completely paid for with Starwood Points. The trip to Hawaii wouldn't have been possible for us without points, so unlike most who could actually afford to stay at the hotel, we were seriously on a budget. It is a beautiful resort in a very beautiful location. We were upgraded to a Deluxe Ocean View room due to our Starwood Preferred Guest status. The room was spacious and in excellent condition. We found the prices around the resort to be extremely high. It was impossible to eat or drink cheaply. Parking was $20 a day. Prices are high in the Kaanapali area, but we found that the prices at the Sheraton were higher than most. We spent the next four nights at the Westin just down the beach, and found that we got a lot more for our money at that resort. The Westin has slightly more affordable food and beverage options, free bottled water replenished in your room every day, free self-parking and $10/day valet parking. The Westin also has a better pool area and a daily schedule of free activities for both children and adults. Ultimately, we thought that the Sheraton was a beautiful place. If you have money to spend then you shouldn't have a problem. However, we thought the Westin was altogether a better resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Honeymoons! Great for anything really”
Reviews.Author: yo-eleven-yo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 10/31 - 11/4. It was our honeymoon, and we couldn't have picked a better location. Our room was in building 6. Yes, it is far from everything, but if you dont mind a short walk, its not bad at all. There are 3 elevators total you must take to get to the beach/pool. We triped the "dinner under the stars" package, and WOW! It was probably the best dinner we had in all of Hawaii for our honeymoon! (We stayed in Oahu for a few days, and also 1 night in the Westin Maui). The personal butler is exceptional, and they ask you every bit of detail on how you want your food to taste. We loved the beach, and snorkeling @ blackrock. Saw some turtles, my wife saw a whale. (from the horizon) I highly recommend this place. If you are on your honeymoon, I highly recommend bulding 6. Not only is it far from it all, but there are also spectacular views of our room. I will post pictures of some of these breathtaking views. Also, there are less kids in buildings 5 & 6. I actually didnt see any kids in those buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Location”
Reviews.Author: RUFUSTFIREFLY26
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Maui Resort was the first stop on our Honeymoon in Early Sept 07. We had received an upgrade to an ocean front suite upon our arrival, and had some champagne + strawberries sent to the room(courtesy of a friend sending a gift). Amazing views, courteous staff, great locationi in Lahaina. Beautiful beach + pool areas. Expensive ammenities (ie: beach chairs/cabanas, on-site restaurants,shopping). Look to book a day excursion(snorkeling,diving,etc.) on your own if possible. Very expensive to book thru the hotel staff. Although it was convenient (right in the lobby). Would still highly recommend this place for a great location in Lahaina, Maui as its prices are pretty much in line with others in the area of that size.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly disappointed on our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: harley75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights of our honeymoon at the Sheraton and to say the least, we were pretty disappointed. Given the high prices (although fairly reasonable compared to Westin Maui, Grand Wailea, Fairmont and Four Seasons), location in Kaanapali (near the BlackRock), simply the fact that it was a Starwood property, and strong reviews on Tripadvisor (4 to 5 stars) we came into the stay with rather high expectations. Positives: 1) Gym - not crowded, new machines, several TVs, clean 2) Breakfast buffet - fairly priced, wide variety, great service 3) Location and beach - Hotel is nestled up against BlackRock and is the last hotel on Kaanapali Pkwy, so there is a feel of privacy. Walking distance to and proximity to other hotels, several restaurants near the wate, and semi-upscale mall (e.g. Westin and Whaler's Village) 4) Rooms were decent and we were satisfied with the furniture, quality of the bathrooms, etc. 5) Hospitality at check-in. They gave us a lai and checked us in pretty smoothly and quickly. 6) Concierge woman (Lori) was very helpful. Negatiaves: 1) Room location and overall layout of the hotel - If you do make it to the Sheraton, be prepared to navigate through a maze of corridors and depending on your building location, *several* elevators. Imagine this: We were in Bldg. 6, and to get from our room to the concierge, for example, we had to walk one flight of stairs up, walk down a 30-yard corridor, take an elevator up a few floors, walk another 50-75 yards to another elevator, take it down numerous floors, and then walk another 2-3 minutes. Then the same walk on the way back. We'd do this round-trip begrudgingly 4-5 times a day. If not for this, I'd probably rate the Sheraton at 3 out of 5 stars. 2) Cleanliness - We were "upgraded" to a deluxe, which placed us into a first-floor room, which opened up into a semi-private lawn on the ocean. Negatives-- View is partially obstructed by hedges. Millipede and other small bugs constantly coming in and out of the room. 3) Too Big. And this isn't just the maze layout of the hotel, but we felt that b/c of the size, mgmt could not effectively manage the place. Was not a cohesively run resort to improve the overall experience; felt like a bunch of loosely assembled buildings and restaurants combined to form one Sheraton. 4) Starwood Vacation Ownership (aka Starwood's timeshare program) kept leaving vmail daily. Annoying. 5) Internet. If you want to get online, bring your laptop. But who wants to lug their laptop on vacation? Be prepared to spend $0.40 per minute, which is $2 per NYT article you can read -- computers are nice...at least you'll get to use computers with flat panel displays! 6) No Front Lobby. As of mid-October they were renovating their front lobby. So there was no front lobby. Be sure to call them to see if they're done (they said it'd take a "few" weeks). 7) Scarcity of Parking. Yes, they do charge extra for parking, but the other 2 hotels we stayed at during the honeymoon did too. The problem is that at the Sheraton, the lots don't fit the # of rental cars that have to park there, so each night people had to park in fire lanes.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton Maui”
Reviews.Author: sunbeachsnorkel
Reviews.Content: We booked our wedding group at the Maui Sheraton in November 2007. Our room rate for the group was unbelieveably cheap. The rooms were cleaned twice daily by housekeeping. We never had to ask for more towels. The staff addressed us by name which made everything so personal. The staff was so friendly, from front desk to janitorial. The pool area was clean and tidy everyday. The beach was nice and the snorkling at Black Rock is amazing. We saw turtles and all kinds of fun colorful fish. This is by far the best resort I have stayed in on Maui and even Oahu. We had a wonderful trip and are making plans to return. November is a perfect travel month to Maui. No Crowds! Very Memorable Trip!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but.....”
Reviews.Author: cats12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the Sheraton and Maui as part of a convention trip. The hotel is nice, clean and has lovely grounds. The snorkeling just off the beach in front of the hotel is awesome. If you're going to Maui I can recommend this hotel but for us on the East Coast, Hawaii is a really long trip and is very expensive once you get there. For my time and money I'll stick with the Caribbean.

Reviews.Title: “Seaturtle heaven”
Reviews.Author: shrinkwrap
Reviews.Content: After planning our honeymoon for a year and a half- stayed the majority of it at Sheraton Black Rock. Placed in building 6 for the deluxe ocean front. Upon arrival we were unhappy with the view as it was ocean front but you looked out on no beach, just lawn and then water. We requested a change and were immediately placed in a room on the same floor but closer down to the point of Black Rock. We were thrilled with the new room because we were able to see sea turtles swimming directly below the balcony and had wonderful surf sounds. The room was very nice- be sure to specify a queen or king- the doubles were not queens, rather small. The room was clean, and maintained well over the week. Service from when they switched our room thru the rest of the week was awesome. As noted in other reviews, the walk from building 6 to the rest of the resort is a long one, but the views from building 6 are worth it- plus they provide a parking lot right behind the building- don't have to valet it- very convenient. Snorkeling around Black rock was lots of fun- sea turtles hang out in the area and it was a blast swimming around them. It was a wonderful week there- highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful...but boring”
Reviews.Author: Aloha07
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed 5 nights at the Sheraton Maui 10/29/2007. We stayed in building 6 which we acctually didn't mind because the view was spectacular! The grounds were beautiful and well kept. The food was also very good and just a tiny bit pricey. Our only complaint was that there was no nightlife what so ever there at the hotel. The bar closed at 8:30. We are a couple in our late 30's and we were looking for some fun and entertainment but that didn't happen there. It was a very quite resort. Even though it was beautiful and the service was excellent we were disappointed. I dont believe it was the right place for us. I would definatly recommend this hotel but only if you like peace and quite!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui Is The Perfect Place For Honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: Leland_Bulldog
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a 10 day honeymoon to Maui, Hawaii. From October 21- October 26th we stayed at the Sheraton Maui. From October 27th-October 31st we stayed at the Grand Wailea. We loved the Sheraton Maui, and we absolutely despised the Grand Wailea (you can type in Grand Wailea to read my review). Our rooms were supposed to be ocean view rooms. When we arrived at the front desk, we informed them that we were on our honeymoon and asked them if there was any way possible for us to get a room upgrade. The front desk clerk said that since we were on our honeymoon, if I promised to take care of my wife and be nice to her the rest of my life, she would upgrade us to a deluxe ocean view room for FREE!! The valet quickly came and led our rental car to our building via his golf cart. We stayed in building 6. He unloaded all of our bags for us and showed us to our room. He offered to take my wife and I's picture from our balcony. He also said that because we were honeymooners, the front desk had arranged for someone to go to our room before we got there, and they had placed a complimentary bottle of champagne in our refrigerator. Our view from building 6 was awesome. We were in room 6208 which is on the second floor. The distance from our balcony to the ocean was less than 20 feet. Everyone at the Sheraton Maui bends over backwards to kill you with kindness. When my wife and I were out walking on the grounds, it did not matter whether we passed the housekeepers, the maintenance men, the pool workers, the restaurant workers etc. everyone ALWAYS said hello and ALWAYS asked if there was anything they could do to help us. We ate dinner our first night there at the Reef's Edge Lounge. The food was decent for the price we paid, but we were provided with Hawaiian musical entertainment while we ate. We ate breakfast the majority of the mornings we were there at Keka's Terrace. While $23 per person is more than I would spend for a breakfast buffet on the mainland, the food was well worth the price considering we were in Hawaii. The concierge staff is first class, and they too are very friendly as well as knowledgeable. They set us up with our daily excursions which included: 1. Sunset Luau at Black Rock on the grounds of the Sheraton. 2. Zip Line Tour with Eco Adventures. 3. The road to Hana with Blue Mountain Tour s(4 hour van ride to Hana, and a 45 minute helicopter ride back). 4. Snorkeling Adventure with Safari Boat Excursions Of these, the snorkeling adventure was by far our favorite. This tour was a 6.5-hour snorkel trip on a boat that goes all the way around the Island of Lanai. We were able to experience shipwrecks, remote beaches, cliffs, caves, lava pinnacles, waterfalls, and of course Dolphins..The driver of the boat sets the entire tour to music, which was AWESOME. He anchors the boat at three different locations and allows you to get out an snorkel. Before I ever went to Hawaii, I was terrified about getting into any kind of sea water. This tour made me fall in love with the ocean and with sea life. The least favorite was the road to Hana. Everyone told us this trip was a must see, and do. To my wife and I, it was a waste of money and time. The trip consists of 600 sharp curves in the road, and trips over 50 one lane bridges. You do get to see lots of natural waterfalls and beautiful flowers along the way. The best part of this tour was the helicopter ride back where we got to see natural waterfalls within the mountains that you could not normally see via an automobile. Unless you are just into sharp twisting roads, and just have to see a waterfall, I would suggest skipping the road to Hana. It was not worth the money we paid. We did enjoy the Cliff Dive ceremony that took place on the grounds at the Sheraton every night at sunset. At sunset every night, a young cliff diver honors his heritage each evening by re-tracing footsteps in the sand on Kaanapali Beach. A chant of old Hawai'i begins the progression of our warrior; the echo of the conch shell announces his arrival. He leaves a trail of glowing torches surrounding the lagoon as he makes his way to Black Rock. Upon reaching the summit, he offers his torch to the ocean below, casts his flower lei into the sea; and finally takes the breathtaking dive from Black Rock into the rolling surf below. After his dive into the ocean, he swims to the beach and takes pictures with bystanders. The pool was nice and big. We never had trouble finding a lounge chair. The only thing we disliked about the Sheraton was the maze we had to get through to get from our room to poolside/the restaurants. We had to walk out of our room, take an elevator up one level, walk about 100 yards, take an elevator up the 8th floor of an adjacent building, walk another 50 yards to another set of elevators, then take those elevators to the first floor. It took an entire day to get that figured out. The $20 resort fee is misleading in that we thought we had free Internet access. We went to the business center to check our e-mails one day, and were charged $20 for our 30 minutes of usage. Internet usage is only FREE if you have a laptop, the business center is not free. The rooms at the Sheraton are average hotel rooms. Nothing special at all. I would give them 3.5 stars. But the friendliness of the staff, the cleanliness of the grounds, and all other misc. amenities are 5 star. This is the place to stay for anyone. Hawaii is like any other major city. You can go to all the tourists traps to eat and pay outrageous prices, or you can find out from the locals/concierge where the best places to eat in town are, and you can go there and pay reasonable prices for great meals. I do recommend getting a rental car for transportation needs. The island of Maui is easy to navigate, and for the first time in my life, I found a city where everyone knows how to drive. A friendly tip, do NOT blow the horn at anyone. That is considered rude in Hawaiian customs. If you want to see me rip a hotel to shreds, please check out my review of the Grand Wailea. If that hotel is "5 star luxury," I would recommend staying at the Motel 6 or Red Roof Inn, you would get better service.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: mrs_slink
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Maui is set in a beautiful location amongst the Kaanapali beach resorts. What makes this special is the commanding position on Black Rock, giving great sea views for the ocean grounds. Staff were friendly, grounds and room clean and beautiful and we had a fantastic stay. We enjoyed drinking cocktails in the bars and a wonderful meal in Teppanyaki Dan (book to reserve here!) The main restaurant was nothing special though. the location is romantic, the service is great - what more could you ask for? We didn't want to leave after 10 days....

Reviews.Title: “Love the Sheraton Maui - Do be aware of a couple items”
Reviews.Author: rockykirb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Maui back in February, 2000 and loved it so wanted to go back. I booked a garden room this time because I loved the lawns at the hotel and thought it would be fun to walk right out to the pool. When my husband and I got to the room, it was nothing like the ocean view deluxe that I had stayed at last time, not nearly the same room, we felt like we were in a Best Western. Perplexed, I called the front desk and asked if maybe I had imagined a nicer room for my last stay. They immediately looked up my stay 7 years ago and said that they would upgrade me to the Ocean View deluxe room and that it would be ready the next day. I am a Platinum member. The Deluxe rooms are worlds different, which much more high-end decor and beautiful views. Resort Pros: Great pool bars Awesome snorkeling and off-beach scuba diving Proximity to beautiful beach Great location, private at the end near black rock The Ocean view deluxe room is a great true ocean front room Free Yoga and Pilates in verandas WiFi Internet hotspots in Verandas Free Internet access in rooms Beautifully manicured lawns Resort Cons: People now dive off of blackrock and I almost got smashed by a jumper -- be careful! There was a long walk to the main area of the hotel from the deluxe ocean-front rooms and you have to pass an area that smells like it's near dumpsters, but you cannot see them. Resort Pro/Con: They don't have a spa, but since they are a Starwood hotel you can get a hotel shuttle to the awesome Westin Heavenly Spa or walk there (which I did). You will not get the 20% discount on spa services as Westin guests do. They also did not tell me that I could use the facility all day the entire day of your service, which might have been nice. I would return to this resort, My husband and I were able to relax and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel rocks! Best beach and oh the turtles at Black Rock!!”
Reviews.Author: trippintheworld
Reviews.Content: I booked the Sheraton Maui by what I read on Trip Advisor. It had been over 20 years since I was in Maui last and I had no idea where to stay as there are so many choices and many different areas to stay in. I must say I picked an awesome hotel. We were more than pleased with our choice. The beach is big and beautiful. The black rock right out in front of the hotel is the best place to snorkel. My daughter swam with turtles most days. They are very friendly and come into the snorkel area a few times a day to look for food on the ocean floor. It was fantastic. The rock is also where they have a nightly cliff diving event. There is this guy who lights all the torches around the property. Then he proceeds to the black rock and lights the few torches there. When he is done and the sun has almost set, he dives off the cliff into the water below. It does not look that high, but it is a neat thing that happens each night at sunset. The hotel pool is endless. At first you think that it is just one large pool, but then you realize it wraps around the property sort of like a lazy river. It is peaceful and beautiful and my kids had the best time in the pool. Outside the property we found lots of food choices. Lahaina is close by. About a 5-10 minute drive. Lahaina is the cutest area with lots of restaurants and blocks and blocks of shops. We did not eat at the hotel. We had a car and found food in Lahaina or near the hotel. We paid a AAA rate of 305.00 per night plus an 18.00 resort fee. Our room had a great view of the pool and the ocean beyond that. We were pleased with our room (nice flat screen TV) and also were very happy with the hotel's valet. It was only 5.00 a night and the valet guys were very fun and helpful. Our favorite island has always been Oahu, but now we are in awe of the Sheraton, it's black rock, the turtles, Lahaina and the island of Maui. Without a doubt we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome honeymoon experience!”
Reviews.Author: Gregs_Butterfly
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton was a wonderful place to stay for our honeymoon! We had a very comfortable and clean room with a great view. The staff was extremely friendly, helpful and courteous. We spent countless hours relaxing on the beach and poolside. The service and the Mai-Tais were fabulous by the pool. The snorkeling was incredible near Black Rock. We drove all over the place to find the best snorkeling and quite frankly, it was right out our hotel room door. There is plenty of shopping nearby at Whaler's Village and you are close enough to Lahaina to pick up anything you need. We did go to the spa at the Westin (also highly recommended) and we never did eat at the hotel restaurants (SanSai sushi was just too good!) but other than that, we had no reason to leave the tranquil, relaxing environment of the Sheraton. (Try the hammock!) When we return to Maui for our anniversary, we will definitely stay at the Sheraton again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, OK Rooms, Very Good Service”
Reviews.Author: bmelter
Reviews.Content: The previous reviews of this property are spot on. For those used to staying at higher class resorts, you will be dissappointed with the rooms which sadly, are just ordinary and are beginning to show their age from their remodel 10 years ago. Beds are firm (not the Sweet Sheraton Sleeper), pillows are flat, furnishings are worn (scratched here and there) and the bathroom could be taken out of any middle of the road chain. What you get here are great grounds, a wonderful pool (not too big though) and a location along Black Rock which is wonderful. Here is a summary: Pros: - Location along Black Rock is perfect for snorkeling right off of the beach. Good swimming, good views and the rock provides a natural break to other properties - Service. The people here actually seem to do a fairly good job with things and are attentive to your needs (although see cons) - Rooms with ocean views definitely do have ocean views - Rooms with partial ocean views are along the back corners of buildings so you need to be on your lanai to see the ocean - Self parking at no charge is always appreciated and is available next to building 3 and in a parking structure - The pool area is nice and has quite a few chairs scattered about - Nightly , there is a cliff diver along with the torch lighting ceremony at sunset which is fun to watch - The location in Lahaina is good for getting around to other areas. Cons: - Rooms are ordinary. Nothing special here, not even in the same league as the big boys, but Sheraton is Starwood's middle of the road chain, so this is what you'd expect - Food choices. Despite a "new" menu at the restaurant when we arrived, there is a gap in food choices. The Lagoon Bar has burgers, nachos, and other greasy bar food (average price $18 for a burger or sandwich), while the main restaurant has your choice of steaks, or fish, or steaks, or fish (average price of $35). The main restaurant does have a prime rib buffet on Friday and Sunday which looked OK. The main bar has about 5 food choices, non of which looked great (although we cheated and ordered some of the starters from the main restaurant menu) and the Japenese restaurant has hibachi style dining which may be OK for bigger groups. What they are missing is something in between the greasy $18 burger and the $40 filet for folks who just want some "real" food in a casual setting. - Service. While overall service was great, there were some lapses. Hats off to Jeremy from the bell desk who does a great job in going through everything that the hotel and surrounding area has to offer. Some lapses detracted however. One morning we realized that housekeeping forgot to leave any new towels in our room (just a washcloth). Other items like food taking a bit too long to get despite an empty restaurant were not that great. - We did see the hotel manager (Chip) wandering about which was good to see as he seems to have a good rapport with the staff. Overall, a great stay in a great setting. Since I used StarPoints for the stay, you cannot beat the price. Some recommendations for those coming here: - Hit The Gazebo for breakfast. It's up the coast a bit, tucked away in the Napili Shores condo complex, but is right on the water and has huge breakfasts that are wonderful at great prices. Come early (they open at 7am) though as the line grows and grows and grows. Try a banana mac pancake with their coconut syrup. - For those looking beyond fish and the normal chains, the Thai Chef is a great spot. Bring your own bottle of wine however, as it's a BYOB. - If you are heading to Hana, stop at Charley's for breakfast on the way in Paia. Great food at a great price and right on the way (they open at 7am as well). Enjoy paradise!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved this resort”
Reviews.Author: SherryHa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year on an invitation! Loved it then, love it even more now! We are Starwood Gold Card members so we cashed in points to stay. Starwood has a policy when you stay 4 nights, get the 5th night free, so, we cashed in enough points for 10 days! Wohoo! When we arrived, late at night, there was only the garden view room we booked. I fussed, and fussed, so the next morning they cashed in more points and since an ocean view wasn't available, put us in an awesome ocean front room with 2 balconies! This room wasn't as large as the garden room, but who cares! It had 2 balconies overlook the ocean! The room was nice, it had a mini frig, coffee maker, plasma tv, normal everything else, but the bed was so comfy! We slept exceptionally well! The room temp. controls were difficult to figure out, but, oh well, we were in paradise. There is now a free shuttle service that takes you to all the Starwood properties in the area and into Lahaina, for free! (It's included in the resort fee). It comes once an hour and drops off at several places. Bring your room key to identify yourself! They drop you off at the cannery mall (there's a Long's drugstore, Safeway and food court and shops and air conditioning), and they drop off at 2 places in Lahaina besides the other hotels! It's great! Anyway, just got back last night, loved the Sheraton. Yes, some of it is in need of renovations, but it's not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Must stay for honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: Kong1981
Reviews.Content: After countless inquires through tripadvisor in regards to the Sheraton, I must say we were not dissappointed. The reviews are eerie accurate and depending on your style, the Sheraton will be average to more ritzy type travelers, or minimum "Above Average" for travelers just lookin for a nice place to relax with some style. We went to the Sheraton for our honeymoon and it lived up to the hype. My wife and I have never been on a vacation and thought this was the perfect "First Time" place. . Here are some pros/cons and in betweens to consider. PROs: *Immaculate grounds *Friendly staff * Excellent location. Whalers Village in walking distance, end of beach next to Black Rock, the sand was baby powder soft! *Nice rooms (nothing to write home about, but who stays in the room all day when your in Hawaii!), w/ spacious lanais. *Great housekeeping and concierge service, *Beautiful wrap around style pool, wasnt cold for us, and we are from Southern Cal. Cons: * As some who stated, the pillows were too soft for my wife and I. Our mattress at home was more comfortable. (The Sheraton claims they are King size, they are not. They are the larger types of a Queen) *Daily Resort fee along with pricey food/drinks Although that is to be expected in Hawaii guys, stop complaining about it, there is no way around it. Its Hawaii! *Microwave in room extra charge (Available upon request) *Fridge was very small ( Chill a 6 pack and a few bottles of water, a pack of lunch meat. Try anything more and your fridge will not cool properly) *No Smoking. Our lanai had a perfect view, perfect for a nice stogie and cognac, but dont try the stogie/cigarettes. As enticing as it may be to light one up, $300 charge! not worth it folks! Beware: If you charge anything to your room (ie room service, food/drinks, cabana rentals) They will place a hold on your card right then and there! I was unaware and called the front desk, I was told that it as a hold on the card to ensure that funds will be paid. Some guests run up a bill and then dont have enough on their card to cover the cost upon check out. That put a damper on us as we had to scramble and have family back home deposit money into our account! There is no Washington Mutual, Bank of America anywhere near this hotel! We wanted to deposit some of our honeymoon money into our accounts and could not. Tips: With an exception to eating at the hotel, the breakfast buffet is well worth it ( $20 per person). You will not find a better deal on all you can eat fresh made omelettes, oj, crepes, etc.. Its def worth it in our opinion, food was very very good. Go anywhere else for breakfast and you could easily shell out more. Walk down to Whalers Village and eat at the Hula Grill, Lelanis. Prices are reasonable, there also is a bar with a good happy hour (Mai Tais are top notch, and more importantly, cheap!) Arrive an hour early to put in a reservation, walk around the village, plenty of stores for souveneirs. Pack light! Guys especially, depending on what you are there for, a few basketball shorts and a cut off T with some sandals/shades/ and a visor is all you need. The weather and casual atmosphere requires nothing else. Ladies, you can get away with a skirt over your bathing suit and blend right in! Call ahead! I called ahead to confirm our reservations and told them we were on our honeymoon and boom!, free upgraded room upon arrival (garden view upgraded to partial ocean view) With that being said, ifyou book online as we did, book the cheapest room which is usually the garden view, and they will upgrade you for free if there are rooms available to do so. We were in building 6, by far the best building as I have read from other tripadvisor guests. The view on the lanai was amazing! Just open up the lanai and doze off to the ocean waves and birds. Overall we would def go back, just make sure you have enough money in your account to immediately cover expenses if you do decide to charge to the room. Enjoy the paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: adg79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had an amazing time at the Sheraton Maui! I booked a king ocean front room through American Airlines. Upon check-in we were originally given a room in bldg 5 with double beds and a partial ocean view (although they told us it was technically ocean front because you could see the ocean from the bed). The room was nice, but not what I had booked. We asked to switch to a different room and the front desk quickly accomondated our request. The second room was in bldg 6. The view was amazing!! Building 6 is on the cliff and looks directly out into the ocean. Some reviews complained about the location of bldg 6, but we thought it was great. It really is away from the rest of the resort and is very peaceful and quiet. We didn't mind the walk to the pool and beach. It's not as bad as some of these reviews say. The old lobby area in bldg 5 was one of my favorite places. It has a great view of the beach and black rock and was a nice place to watch the cliff diving ceremony. Our vacation package include breakfast vouchers at the Keka'a Terrace each day of our trip. We started each morning with a fabulous breakfast buffet (especially loved the fresh pineapple and mango). The buffet is $20 per person if you don't have the vouchers. I was happy we stayed in the Ka'anapali area. It's a great location. The Sheraton was within walking distance of Whaler's Village and a quick drive (5-10 minutes) to Kapalua or Lahaina. There are a several restaurants and shops in Lahaina. There is also a Safeway where we stocked up on beer and wine (drinks at the Sheraton are quite pricey). The pool and beach were nice. It never felt crowded and we didn't have trouble getting lounge chairs poolside. But I'm sure this depends on the time of year you go. October is between the two peak seasons of summer and winter. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone and would absolutely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: richnmiche
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon for 7 nights on October'06 and were very impressed. We were upgraded to a fantastic room with an amazing sea view. The location is great, the beach is amazing -we loved this hotel. We had just been to Sheraton Kaui before that and thought this hotel was by far better.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: onemoretime
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in the middle of our 15 night 3 island vacation and were very pleased with our choice. We had stayed at the Hyatt many years ago and moved to Wailea for our last two trips (4S and Kea Lani) The prime reason we wanted this hotel was for Black Rock snorkeling and we were not dissappointed. Every day was started with a snorkel (except the day they closed the beach because of a shark siting!) The snorkeling was excellent, turtles everyday, an eel or two and an eagle ray even blessed us with her presense. If you are experienced definately go around to the other side. The hotel was nicer than we expected. We wanted, and recieved a room in building 6. Amazing view and could watch the torchlighting everynight from our lanai. The sunsets were to die for. Yes the walk is loooooonnnnggg, but what a wonderful walk! It is crazy how they designed the building but after about a day you can figure it out (up 1, walk , up 8, walk , down 7 etc...) Didnt bother eating at the restaurants here except for one breakfast, bar food and room service which was all good. Loved having our car parked in the lot by building 6 so when we went out exploring it was right there. When we checked in a bellman drove a cart up to our room and we just followed in our car. To save time we brought our own bags out when we left. We really enjoyed our stay here and while we are not sure if Kanapali or Wailea will be where we stay next time, we will return to the Sheraton some day.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive - Watch the extra charges”
Reviews.Author: kab16
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations when booking this hotel. It is expensive and for that you expect quality. Our room was very nice with a partial ocean view from the 5th floor. The balcony was nice with a pleasant view. The bed was firm which suited me but my partner found it too hard. There is a fridge which is handy. The room was very quiet which was good because the outside entertainment in the evenings can be very loud. Once you close the windows it cuts it all off. It was a long walk to our room from the car park but that seems to be true of a lot of the rooms here. The hotel pool is nice but it's layout means that there isn't much space for sun loungers. Few of these have shade and most of those 'booked' with towels by 7:30. Later in the day the beds are packed with people shoulder to shoulder. It becomes clear why once you venture onto the beautiful beach next to the pool. Cabanas are $40, sun loungers and an umbrella $35. This can get expensive very quickly. We were there for 10 days and lying on a towel was not how I imagined my trip. This nickel and diming spreads to other things about the hotel. You pay a resort fee for parking of $20 per day despite the fact that pretty much everyone has to drive to get there. This includes internet but that is not something we used at all. The restaurants were very expensive and not very good quality. We ate there twice and thereafter walked to Whalers Village which has more choice, better quality and much lower prices. Lahaina is nearby and that has many choices too. Sheraton do not seem to spend much effort on the restaurants. I have had bad experiences elsewhere too. The snorkelling is goodbut it does get very busy at times because a number of hotels share the same beach. That said I did swim next to a turtle my first morning which was fun. I wonder how long the reef can survive with the volume of people though? In summary - Expensive, Nice room & view, bad restaurants, wish it included everything and I didn't have those extra charges.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: mngo2000
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a week long stay - we really enjoyed it! The hotel was nice and clean. The location was great - we were in an ocean front room in Bldg 4 on the sixth floor (top floor for hotel rooms). Here are the pros: * Pool and beach were very accessible from our building * Close walk to Whaler's Village (could get there in under 7 minutes - nice shopping and decent restaurants - Rusty Harpoon has HD TVs for NFL games if anyone's interested) * Various options for self-parking - number of different lots, the one by the tennis courts was closest to Bldg 4 * Gym was in our building as was the Rotunda where they hold pilates and yoga classes each morning * The Rotunda, located on the 8th floor of Bldg 4, is a Wi-Fi hotspot, has couches/chairs, and a view to die for. * Kaanapali Beach and Black Rock were steps away - golden sand, warm waters, amazing snorkeling (we swam with hundreds of fish and at least 3 sea turtles every day) * Cliff diving ceremony every night is cool - the sunset as a backdrop makes it even more special * Close to Lahaina (less than a 10 min drive) - Front Street, the Lahaina Cannery Mall which has a 24 hour Safeway and a Longs Drugs as well as a very good food court * Friendly and helpful staff * Laundry facilities ($4 a load) were located in our building * Each room comes with a fridge - ours worked really well. * 45 minute drive to Wailea Cons: * Luau music/bar music at night can be loud * Coming back to the hotel after 8pm - hard to find self-parking in the smaller lots (near tennis courts and Rotunda) but we could always find a spot in the main parking garage * Food was expensive but that's to be expected (resort prices) Overall, we had a great time and would definitely go back there. We miss the clear blue waters of Kaanpali Beach already and we just left yesterday.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE - Motel-Style Bed, Bad Location, Dirty Rooms, Overcharged $2000 !!”
Reviews.Author: Hockeygrrl863
Reviews.Content: Where do I start with this place? They have put all of their money, it seems, into keeping the outside nice. Our first night in town we stayed at the 3-Star Royal Laihina next door which we liked. The trouble started when we checked into the Sheraton for our week-long stay. 1. Terrible Location - When we checked in, they told us we had to DRIVE to our Deluxe Oceanfront Room facing Black Rock. There was NO VALET for this wing. Very remote: to get to the lobby, restaurants, pools, etc it takes FIVE ELEVATORS and a very long, hot walk. They offered to drive us back in a Golf Cart to our room, but that wait was 20 minutes. 2. TERRIBLE BEDS - Hotel advertises comfortable "Sweet SLeeper" beds. Our bed was HARD AS A ROCK. Plain mattress, no pillowtop...motel-like. Like sleeping on the ground. I've NEVER complained about a mattress in a hotel & couldn't believe I was doing it at a 4-star Sheraton! We called to see if we had the SWEET SLEEPER that was advertised & on our confirmation... NO ONE knew! In our Guest Directory, a Pillowtop was offered on request. When we asked, they brought a thin comforter. The staff never heard of a "pillowtop" listed in the book. Our 1st night was SLEEPLESS..the bed was SO HARD & pillows gave no support. Spouse had to sleep on the chair. I envisioned 5 more nights, and told my spouse I couldn't handle the back-ache from the bed, long, hot walk with 5 elevators to and from the lobby, pool, etc. and NO valet while lugging our cooler, beach stuff & souvenirs to and from our room. NOT relaxing or worth $400 a night! 3. OLD, BROKEN ROOMS - Motel-style mattress, broken dressers didn't close, fridge broken.. pee stains on bathroom walls. Not clean. 4. STAYED ONE NIGHT, CHARGED $2000 - Checked another room to salvage our stay. The bed was no different in another room. 1/2 a day dealing w/ all of this..upsetting & stressful! Finally nicely asked if we could check out without penalty. They said that it would be no problem. WRONG! A $2000 charge was waiting for us when we got home! Was told by 2 reps that we'd never checked out! The rep who checked us out credited $400 but charged us $2000 for one-week stay. Finally the charges were straighted out after several phone calls...but it was a huge hassle. 5. HUGE relief to get AWAY from Sheraton's broken dresser, uninformed staff, hard miserable bed, 5 elevators and no valet service. We checked BACK into the 3-star Royal Lahaina next door and was given an amazing view (way better than the "Black Rock" view" at Sheraton) along with a newly renovated bedroom (just like we'd had the first night). Our bed there was to die for... amazingly comfortable. The rooms were updated, modern and WAY cleaner and in WAY better condition that the Sheraton. Valet gladly helped us with our "stuff" after long days out and about..and in 2 seconds we were up the elevator and in our room. Everything is convenient at the Royal Lahaina...snorkle shack, pool, amazing Ice Cream and dining room for lunch. ( breakfast buffet at Royal Lahaina buggy & NOT recommended._) Will NEVER stay in a Shertaon again. Underneath all the pretty well-planned landscaping, there's not much to desire.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms and very nice”
Reviews.Author: highloyo
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised that we were able to get a nice room as we were using a 3 day 2 night charitable coupon won on a silent auction. Although the room was a garden view, we were located on the 1st floor of bldg 2. The lanai was a patio area adjacent to the grassy area. We could from walk our lanai an onto the grounds. There is an ocean view from here if we sat on the patio chairs looking out. Good points: rooms are very large and clean; The grounds itself and convenience to Whaler's Village was very nice; Entertainment in the outdoor bar area was a bit strange. One would think she might listen to Hawaiian music instead of a lone guitarist playing rock songs, badly I might add. Bad points: Self parking garage has only one exit to walk out there. Our room was at one end but we had to double back to exit the garage, strange design. Since we stayed only 2 nights, didn't really see much of the hotel's other features.

Reviews.Title: “A let down.”
Reviews.Author: SPGryphon
Reviews.Content: Our final 5 days of vacation were in Maui at the Sheraton. I was really looking forward to checking the property out after having stayed at the Westin 2 years prior. I have never in any of my past travels actually gone through the trouble to ask for a different room. I am typically just happy to be on vacation. =) We had 2 rooms at the Sheraton before we finally landed in Building 6. I really think the rooms need to be re-evaluated as to what their view/description should be. Our first Ocean View was on the second floor and there were multiple plumeria trees growing taller than our balcony. We could only see the beach after standing on one of the chairs on the balcony. I called to explain the issue and they checked into available rooms. They called me back and gave me my new room number in another building and on the top floor (high above the plumeria). We arrived at the new room to find that the view was actually worse. The palm trees were completely obstructing our view of anything (resort, pool, beach) and there was no balcony in this room. This time I went to the desk to talk to them in person and explain that if I was going to receive a garden view room, I would like to at least have my rate adjusted to the garden view rate. We ended up speaking with the evening manager and getting upgraded to building 6. I was a little upset that we were not offered the upgrade prior to spending an hour dragging our luggage around that maze because of our SPG gold status. There was no acknowledgment of our SPG status at check in. Speaking of the Maze... =) I don't know who designed that property but they should have to stay in building 6 just for punishment. It took at least 3 elevators to get anywhere. There were people wondering around holding these little maps they give you at check in. Everyone was lost. It takes a day or two just to figure out what floor or elevator you are supposed to be on to get where you want to go. If it weren't for the snafu on the first day, the resort probably would have been an average stay. The rooms are nice enough though there is only wi-fi in selected public spaces and the pool. The bathrooms were large and clean though they seemed to stop at the tub when they renovated. There is great snorkeling from the beach (great for those leery of snorkeling from a ship in the open ocean). Most of the staff were great. Food prices were typically out of control. We ate in Lahaina quite a bit. They were changing out the lounge chairs around the pool while we were there. The new ones are much nicer and have a cushion. We did have a difficult time finding two chairs together. Lots of people tossing towels on them and then going to the beach. We saw at least 20 chairs in the immediate area that had no one come back to claim the towels. We will be returning to Maui but will not stay at the Sheraton. We found the Westin to be much more accommodating and easier to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Average Experience”
Reviews.Author: crazy4hawaii74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Maui twice before (once for our honeymoon in 2002 and we loved it so much that we managed to go back in 2003 for our 1 year anniversary). Both times we stayed in Wailea (we stayed at the Outrigger which became the Marriott and we loved it!). We decided to come to Maui one month shy of our 5 year anniversary for my husband to run the Maui Marathon. Because all of the marathon events were taking place in Kaanapali we decided to stay in the area, as opposed to Wailea. From our experience on the island we knew that there was a walking path all along the Kaanapali beach area so we chose the Maui Sheraton because we knew it was at the end of the path and we wouldn't have as much tourist traffic going past the hotel or our pool. Of all the hotels in the area, I am glad we chose the Sheraton. The location cannot be beat and for the money, it is a solid, dependable resort (for the most part). From my prior experiences I would have to rate the Maui Sheraton as average. It did not sweep me off of my feet. The bed was okay, the shower was a little less than average. I agree with many other Tripadviser reviewers when they complained about the mildew smell in the bathroom. We were in building 3 with an â€œoceanfrontâ€� room and the bathroom was very small and had a mildew odor. I have mold allergies so I was a bit reluctant to stay in the room but it wasnâ€™t HORRIBLE so I decided to deal with it since it was only for 5 days and it was so late at night when we arrived. The bathroom did have Pantene shampoo and conditioner so it was nice to have a well known brand to use. The room was nicely decorated and I am glad they had a refrigerator in the room so we could keep some drinks and snacks cold. The lanai was VERY small. And although we typically donâ€™t spend a lot of time in our hotel room when we are in Hawaii, it is nice to be able to sit out on the lanai and take in the beautiful scenery.
