We did not have that opportunity at the Sheraton. However, the lower rooms seemed to have a larger lanai (we were on the 5th floor). The prices at the hotel's restaurants were beyond outrageous. We have been to Hawaii before and are used to the resort prices but I have never seen a place charge $20 for a breakfast omelet (just the omelet - no bacon, no breakfast potatoes, no toast - nothing else with it!). I must say, however, that we had the same waiter for 2 different meals and by the 3rd time he saw us he remembered our names and even came from another area of the restaurant to say hello and ask how our vacation was going. So we were very pleased with the service. We tried to eat off of the hotel premises as much as we could. We really enjoyed our pasta dinner at Longhiâ€™s (my husband had to carbo-load before the big race) and we had a typical outstanding dinner at Mamaâ€™s (this is most favorite place to eat on Maui). Another minor disappointment for us was from the first day we arrived we received messages from someone in the Sheraton Vacations area (basically looking to sell us a timeshare). They left messages saying they had a â€œwelcome giftâ€� for us. By the 3rd day of messages I went to the Vacations office just to get them to stop calling. When I arrived I found out that I could not just go and pick up this welcome gift but I actually had to speak to the actually person (sales rep) who had been leaving the messages. I never did go back to pick up my welcome gift. If you are looking to save some money, it is very easy to become a Starwood resorts member on their website (you can sign up for free). If you do this you have an opportunity to save 35% on your meals and to get a good discount on your room rate. Thankfully the hotel allows you to check your bill before you check out (through the TV menu). We found charges to our room that we did not make. I am glad the staff was very responsive in removing the charges â€¦ it just makes me wonder how many people do not review their bills when they check out and pay for food or drinks that they did not order. I know I have mentioned several negative things but all in all we did have a decent experience at the Maui Sheraton. I just wanted to bring up the less-positive things that I went through to hopefully help someone else make an informed decision.

Reviews.Title: “Overall experience was very good”
Reviews.Author: JetSetOC
Reviews.Content: I've been to Hawaiian islands 9-10 times. The last time I was in Maui, I stayed at a bed and breakfast and also a condo. I didn't enjoy those experiences very much so we decided to stay at a resort. The Sheraton was fairly empty this time of year so they were kind enough to upgrade us to an ocean view room. The only down-side was we had 2 double beds instead of 1 king. We had the option of having a garden view with a king size bed, but why would we? The double was fine and the view was beautiful! They also sent up a complimentary bottle of champagne and we had an unexpected lei greeting at check in. Overall, our experience at the Sheraton was very good. My only complaints are the following: The bathroom had a lot of black mildew on the shower tiles and it smelled very strong. The cleaning lady was very nice, but really didn't do a very good job during our stay. Overall, the staff is very nice, but they do not seem at all happy to be working there which is kind of a downer when your on vacation and in such a good mood. Also, the level of service is really not there for a 4 star hotel. The staff who are transplants to the island really do not cater to the guests as you would expect at a 4 star hotel. After visitng the islands many times, I've learned not to expect great service unless your at the Four Seasons or equivalent so in spite of the service, I would still rate this hotel very good.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: SR718
Reviews.Content: We loved the Sheraton!! As soon as we got there, they notified us that we were being upgraded to a partial ocean. Then, we didnâ€™t even have to check inâ€¦ They immediately brought us to our room. The room was very clean and there was a flat screen tv. Our balcony was extremely tiny but whatever, that was of minor importance to us since we were hardly in the room. The pool was nice and the beach was awesome. The water was not cold, very refreshing and the Sheraton is located next to Black Rock. Great snorkeling. We booked the cabana for $40, definitely worth it. You should get down there early and book it right when they pool concierge opens. As for activities, we loved Warren & Annabelleâ€™s Magic Show in Lahaina. The Road to Hana definitely was worth the time!! It was very entertaining!! We had a nice meal at Pacificâ€™o and Hula Grill. This was the perfect start to our honeymoon and would recommend this place to all our friends and family!! One last thing, if you can, book the room with breakfast includedâ€¦ Saves you a lot of $$!

Reviews.Title: “Shertaon Maui is the Perfect Honeymoon Location”
Reviews.Author: Shoshana143
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton from 9/3 to 9/10 for our honeymoon. The location on black rock is what made the hotel stand out. We walked the boardwalk on many occasions to view the other hotels, but felt we chose the best hotel for our honeymoon. Check-In: We checked in at 10pm it was hassle-free. They offered free valet parking for our first night. Then we opted to self-park the remainder of our honeymoon. There was always parking in the garage and the $18 resort fee covered this parking cost. Valet would have cost another $5 per day. Our room was in building 4 on the 5th floor. We had a spectacular view of the resort and ocean. The room was newly renovated with a nice size balcony. We spent time relaxing on the balcony listening to the waves. The sunsets were to die for. We spent most sunsets at the hotel watching the cliff diver and enjoying a beverage. We would take pictures of the sunset on the beach and then head out for the evening. The beach was beautiful and we rented a cabaÃ±a for two days. It was well worth it. The snorkeling was superb and we saw many large sea turtles and colorful fish right next to black rock. The pool was relaxing and not too crowded. The nearby town of Lahaina is very active, full of tourists, and a fun place to visit. I wish we were still there. Take time to look in the art galleries. We ended up purchasing a piece of art and it was well worth it. The staff at the hotel were helpful and friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and the next time we return to Maui, I will choose to stay at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel on a stunning beach”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoChick78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton from 9/5 until 9/11. This was our second trip to this hotel and it was great to come back to it after 3 years. We were each greeted with a lei and check-in was quick and smooth. I got a 4:00 late checkout for a $150 fee but it was worth it since our flight wasnâ€™t until 9pm. The hotel grounds are immaculate and very pretty and lush. We had an ocean-view room and it was a nice size and was clean and comfortable. The balcony was very large and perfect for looking at the stars at night. The workout room was clean and nice with some cardio and weight training equipment, but no free weights. It was a little small but we had no trouble with crowds. The pool is really something and it wasn't crowded at all this time of year, no school-age children were around. I donâ€™t recommend spending too much time at the pool â€“ the Sheraton is on the most beautiful section of Kaanapali beach. Itâ€™s right by the black rock which is a great spot for snorkeling and the water was warm and calm, you can be an ocean novice and still enjoy swimming on this beach. The hotel grounds are sprawling, so I could understand why folks complain about it being a long walk to the pool and lobby, but we didnâ€™t mind in the least â€“ we were on vacation and it was beautiful outside! We ate at the breakfast buffet a few times - Of course itâ€™s a bit pricey but thatâ€™s a given on Kaanapali. The breakfast food at the hotel was pretty good with a nice variety and you get frequent coffee and juice refills. If you donâ€™t want to pay a lot, go out to Lahaina and try Moose McGillicuddyâ€™s breakfast. I recommend not eating at the hotel for dinner â€“ venture out and go to some of the local restaurants such as Leilaniâ€™s, Hula Grill, David Paulâ€™s (pricey but delicious food and outstanding service), or Sansei in Kapalua (excellent sushi). While the hotel is a little more rustic than the Westin or Hyatt, the location is fabulous the service is great. I highly recommend this hotel and we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gaadowell
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for a week and we have been to Maui several times and this is our first time at the Sheraton. We loved it. The service was great and the food was outstanding even the room service food. Our bellhop remembered our name after a week upon leaving. Everyone there was so helpful and they gave us a great room. We love staying in kaanapali since is so close to everything. We will definitely stay here on our next trip. Can't wait to return...

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Resort, Perfect Place to Relax”
Reviews.Author: luckyjade77
Reviews.Content: We had a Garden Room View, which actually had a decent view of the black rock and ocean beyond. We got a deal, we received in the mail through Starwood (trying to sell us a timeshare), 5 nights, and it was well worth it for the price we paid. - Great Location - Right by an excellent beach, snorkeling (saw lots of cool fish and sea turtles), and close to Lahaina (great restaurants, shopping, grocery store) - Decent Hotel Room - Clean, nice balcony, fridge, it's a hotel room - Friendly Staff - Great Pool - Had kid pool area on one side then on the other side there was a more adult area - Okay Food - Food was expensive (as expected for HI and Resorts) but wasn't worth it (especially for dinner). Food wasn't bad either. - Self-Parking is free for guests and convenient Recommendations: - Get a fruit smoothie/Pina Colada by the pool - Watch the sunset from the beach - Go snorkeling by the black rock and surrounding area - Get food in Lahaina - Rent Snorkel gear from Lahiana (only $3 to $5/day vs. $8/hour at the place at the Sheraton) - If doing a Luau, consider the Sheraton's, less crowded, right at the hotel and we enjoyed it. Had a fire thrower.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: RinaA
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay at the Sheraton and we had a great time. We had a very comfortable and picturesque ocean front room at Building 6, away from the hustle and bustle but still close by enough to get a quick bite to eat or a drink overlooking the pool and beach. Our balcony made it seem like the island of Molokai and the Pacific Ocean was our own backyard. There was nothing bad to say about this place. The food was okay, but we had more than enough alternatives by just walking down the beachwalk to Whaler's Village where Leilani's and The Hula Grill and other fine dining places and shops are so conveniently located. Plus, they have free shuttle service to places at closeby Lahaina Town. The bars at the Sheraton, and the nice pool, as well as the nice staff, especially housekeeping, restaurant staff, bar staff, and snorkelling people also made our stay very comfortable. And above all else, the beach and Black Rock are reasons alone to stay at the Sheraton, but I would definitely stay at this place again. It's holds one of the best locations!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton Maui”
Reviews.Author: notrub98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for the second week of our honeymoon and were very happy with our choice! We were upgraded for free to an oceanfront room which was a nice touch. The hotel itself is massive and very nicely kept. Our bed was very comfortable, and the staff were very nice. The only negatives were food - not good and incredibly expensive - and valet parking was too pricey for little service. VERY EXPENSIVE to stay here, though, which we were not wild about (we paid $600 a night). The location of the Sheraton was perfect - within walking distance of Whaler's Village. All in all, we loved this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “it's a beach”
Reviews.Author: yu4ick
Reviews.Content: I should start by saying I am not a fan of Hawaii--I've been there several times and find it to be very touristy, overpriced and kind of dirty. Any beach resort has beautiful views, snorkeling and diving, gorgeous underwater reefs, etc, many have rain forests and mountain hiking nearby and all give you the atmosphere of the place--wherever that is. So does the Sheraton. Having said that, I will say that the what the Sheraton Maui does, it does very well. It is basically a Vegas production with loads of fake palm trees, pools and waterfalls and a beautiful beach with great snorkeling right from the beach. The rooms are clean and the views are to die for. There is shopping nearby at the Whalers Village and lots of activities going on during the day and the early evening. The bars at the pool area all close by 8PM--so early evening is the keyword. Yes, they have a luau production with hula dancers and fire dancers, as do most of the other hotels in the area. The food at the hotel and in the area is pretty good. It is hard to find any real local food--except the Aloha Mixed Plate, which is really a small lunch place. The biggest problem at the Sheraton is that some rooms are VERY, VERY far away from the main hotel--we were in building 6, which we had to drive to get to. We had a fantastic view of Black Rock, but it took almost 10 minutes to go from our room to the pool--we had to walk to another building, take 2 elevators and a cross walk to get there. it was another good hike to the restaurant and forget about the lobby. God forbid if you forget something or need to go back to your room. There was no transportation available and many people were very unhappy about being "upgraded" to this lonely outpost of building 6 and 7. The other problem is that there are very few staff people around to help with directions or other questions. Two good restaurants that I highly recommend are Basil Tomatoes--serves amazing local fish and Italian fish and a place called Fish and Poi which is up the road at Napili Resort. This place had the best local food we had. All in all--if you are on the west coast, Hawaii might be a great trip, but for those of us on the east coast, it's a long way to go to get to a beach and nothing there that you can't find in Mexico or the Caribbean.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: DanDiego7
Reviews.Content: The room was nice for our family of 3; we had two double beds. Everything was clean and nice. The breakfast buffet was about what you would expect. The best aspect was the location. Close to black rock where there is excellent snorkling. It is nice just being able to walk out your hotel room, and into the water. Also it is just a short walk from Whaler's Village where there are a couple of options to eat on the cheap side in the food court. The bottom line is I would go back without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, but lacking in service and food choices”
Reviews.Author: sara1327
Reviews.Content: The resort was beautiful, the rooms were clean, but rather small for the price. The pool was great and the beachfront area was gorgeous with great snorkeling. However, it was $40 to get a cabana on the beach and you also had to rent chairs and umbrellas...with a $21 a day resort fee, I would have thought they would have at least given chairs complimentary. In addition, the snorkeling gear was $20 for the day. At another resort we stayed at in Oahu, the snorkeling gear was free for up to 2 hours. The breakfast buffet was good, but that is where it ended. There were not a lot of choices for food and the food was mediocre at best. I would suggest planning to eat off of the resort for most of your stay. I would go back to the area for the views, but would probably choose another property in the Kaanapali area.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations Were Met, and Then Some!”
Reviews.Author: CLKL
Reviews.Content: I had to talk my husband into the offer we received to stay at the Sheraton Maui, but it was worth it. We had a fantastic 5-night, 6-day vacation. I would really recommend at least 2 weeks if you can afford it. The hotel was beautiful, clean, and our room was also upgraded from a garden view to ocean view; the building 6 closest to Black Rock. Yes, there was a long walk to the pool or beach, and we had to carefully remember our way back to our room the first couple of times. We ate at the breakfast buffet one morning. Expensive but very tasty. I would avoid ordering drinks at the bar by the pool because of the cost ($7 for a small beer). The room did have a small fridge and microwave and there is a Safeway a mere 10 minute (at the most) drive away so you can stock up on snacks. We did get a pitch from a Starwood employee (who gave helpful tips on places to visit) to go to a timeshare presentation; we chose not to go and they didn't pester us. (Thanks again for the upgrade!) We could watch snorkelers early in the morning (and all day) from our lanai, and also saw a group of dolphins swim by. Our one scare was that a hurricane blowing by the Big Island would affect us. It did only because a boat tour to Molokini was cancelled. We went the following day and the water was quite choppy. I wish we had just snorkeled off of the assorted beaches instead. The nearby town of Lahaina is very active, full of tourists, and a fun place to visit. I wish we were still there.......

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, bad place to eat”
Reviews.Author: jdpollaro
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here the last week of August for 5 days. In short, we loved our trip and are glad we stayed at the Sheraton Maui. Our room was clean and had a nice view of the black rocks and the ocean. The pool area is nice - a couple of times, there were a few too many kids (ages 8 - 12-ish) around and making noise. But it wasn't too bad. The beach is awesome - definitely the best among the resorts in this area. Only complaint of ours is the dining options. You have to expect high prices when in Hawaii - so no surprise there. However, the food did not match up to other resorts in the area. The nicest restaurant at the Sheraton is not good for dinner -- the food is just not good. They have your typical Japanese hibachi, which we did not visit. Other than that, there are no other dinner choices outside of the poolside bar. Breakfast choices are either a $20 buffet (which was ok) or standing in a long line at the one coffee stand on the resort. After our first night there, we ate off the resort the rest of our stay. This actually was not a big deal as there are plenty of good dining options a short walk away. One other recommendation - if you're comfortable staying on Kaanapali Beach among the six or so resorts there, you do NOT need a car here. Everyone will say you do, but you don't - you can walk everywhere. If you want to explore Maui (road to Hana, other beaches, etc.), of course you will need a car. But if you're just staying in the area, you can walk everywhere. Overall, we would recommend the Sheraton Maui and would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and facilities”
Reviews.Author: hhyamamo
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay at the Maui Sheraton via Hotwire and upon arrival was upgraded to an oceanside deluxe room because of my Starwood Points reward status. The room was fantastic as it overlooked the famous black rock at Kaanapali. As a previous poster noted, the resort is large so things are spread about the property and it does require some walking to the amenities. However, the best rooms are furthest away from the lobby and restaurants and therefore much quieter and secluded. On the upside you get your own separate parking area for the better rooms. The service was exceptional and everyone was friendly and helpful. We spent the first day lounging around, but had active days the two other days we were there so we weren't at the resort. The beach on Kaanapali is perfect if you're looking for calm, warm waters on a nice stretch of sandy beach. You'll do no surfing here for sure. The snorkeling just off the beach by black rock is awesome and sea turtle sitings are common. If you're going to stay here, I'd recommend getting the free SPG rewards card because you never know when they'll be a better room to upgrade to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, great snorkeling beach”
Reviews.Author: milku
Reviews.Content: It is very nice of them to upgrade us from a garden view room to a ocean view room. We were in building 2 and very close to the ocean. Our balcony was facing the black rock, can see the nightly dive at sunset from the black rock right from our balcony. The best part of the resort is it is right at one of best snorkeling beach of Maui. I am not a swimmer and I did my first snorkel at black rock. It was easy and just a few feet away from the beach, you could see lots of fish, and many different kinds. I even swam with a turtle, also just a few feet away from the beach. It is definitely good for beginner. Don't rent your snorkel gear from the hotel. They are expensive. Rent from other store off site. We rent from Maui Dive Shop at Whaler's Village because of their close vicinity. We watched sunset almost every night there. It was very beautiful. Also try to walk to Hula Grill Barefoot restaurant on the beach for dinner. It was a hit for everyone in the family. It is a long wait though. So get the pager and then go shopping at the Whalers Village. We loved the food so much that we ordered take out again another night and enjoyed it on our balcony. Their Luau on site is in the open area. If you don't want to eat the Luau food, you can still see the performance from the lawn. We had a good time there and liked Sheraton a lot more than our last stay at Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and Dime you to DEATH; Good Resort”
Reviews.Author: kingofbytes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probably the most beautiful hotel in Lahaina. The beach (which is public by the way) attached to the hotel is TERRIFIC! Our concierge was nice but not that knowledgable about Maui. The Front Desk behavior was strange...no one is in a hurry for anything. They give you a complimentary Valet Day of parking and then charge you $5/day for the service...don't forget that the valet's are expecting a tip on top of that. Further, you must tell the front desk that you don't want the valet otherwise they automatically charge you....and expect to stand in line for about 15 minutes to do this. The resort is full service and what they don't have they've networked with other hotels up the road (spa for example). My biggest complain is they charge you FOR EVERYTHING. You want a beach chair, $10/per....you want an umbrella, $20/per...you want a cabana, $40/per. You want to sit by the pool, you MUST wear a wrist band regardless of the tan line it might give....may sound like a minor thing, but the security is gestapo-like. We preferred the beach anyway. The bars outside are exorbitantly priced $10/wine in a small plastic cup found at children's birthday parties and $6.00 for beer again in a plastic cup. Do yourself a favor and go into Old Lahaina and stop at the grocery and pick up your own drinks for 1/10 the cost and stock them in the hotel fridge. The hotel menu prices are exorbitant as well. There were TONS of kids wandering around making all sorts of noise. More kids than I would expect at an upscale place like this. Also, the whole place is supposed to be non-smoking; I had to call the hotel security three times. Just sitting out on the lanai enjoying an adult beverage and the fresh air and then "smokey" a few rooms down decides to smoke for 2 hours....and you bet it will ruin your fresh air. The hotel grounds are meticulously kept and the views from up above are AWESOME. The water is the clearest I've been in. The problem with Maui in my opinion is that you have to drive EVERYWHERE from the hotel. Contrast that with Waikiki where you can walk everywhere. If you don't want to have to drive to everything, then head to Oahu (Waikiki)....if you don't mind driving, then you'll like Maui. One more thing...the hotel "gym" is quite hard to find...you have to go to a particular building, and go to the 8th floor. Once there, you must walk down a hall and take a different elevator down to the 7th floor. Then you must exit the elevator and walk a bit more and you might :>) find it. Plus it's only got 2 ellipticals and 2 treadmills. Sure, they've got about 4 token nautilus machines, but for a place where the room minimum is $500/night, you'd think they'd have a much better facility. All in all we'd choose to stay somewhere else due to the fact that they nickel and dime you for everything and the service isn't up to par with the price you're paying.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: mandc777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui Resort for the first part of our Honeymoon and sadly we didn't feel like we were on a vacation much less a Honeymoon at all. The property is beautiful however beware when you book your room because the entire property is Very spread out, so if you want easy access to the pool and beach and don't want to walk 15-20 min. one way then don't stay in building 6...that's where our first room was and when my husband checked in we were told that it was an "upgraded room" however that just meant further away from the pool, lobby, dining room, etc. So we get off an 8 1/2 hour plane ride with No Luggage and walk all the way to our room (a good 20 min. walk) then both of our keys didn't work. We called the front desk and they assured us that security was on their way, but after waiting 15 min. we had to call again. Then when we finally got to our room we discovered a large fan/humidifier that had been placed by the beds due to the flooding and carpet damage. Hence our room smelled terribly of mold/wet carpet. We requested a room change but it was so late ended up waiting until the morning to switch rooms. The second day of our Honeymoon consisted of No Luggage still however we found out that the airport had delivered our luggage at 9pm the night we arrived and at 1pm the Next day the hotel had failed to tell us they had our luggage and we were forced to sleep in our clothes. After complaining/commenting several times to the manager on duty about our frustrations the only thing we were offered were 2 drink tickets and they had to be used between 5:30-7:30pm and were only good for One day. We were Very disappointed in the customer service at this hotel and will Not be staying here again. However we really enjoyed the 2nd part of our honeymoon at the Grand Wailea and for $50 more a night was totally worth it. The Sheraton needs to re-think how they treat their guests, especially for the price. We actually called back when we got home from our Honeymoon and asked to speak to a General Manager and again all we got was an apology but we assured him we would spread the word about our disappointing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, less crowds”
Reviews.Author: jerseygirlCincinnati
Reviews.Content: Arrived July 31. Departed August 7 Upgraded from an ocean view to a deluxe ocean view in building 6. Nice size room with incredible view but in remote area far from pool and the action. With 2 kids wanted to be closer to the action. Changed rooms after 1st night to building 3. If you have kids, this is the building to stay. Located directly in front of all the activity (pool, night-time music you can enjoy from your balcony, oceanfront room). Of all the hotels on the strip, the Sheraton has the most open space (i.e. walking paths, grass playing area). The Sheraton also has the widest beach area. Even though building 3 is located in the center, their open space makes it feel very comforable. We walked over to the Westin and it was jam packed with people because they do not have the same open space available. Postive-Room location, mini-fri, pool, beach, snorkeling, buffet breakfast ($20/adult, kids free), unlimited number of beach towels you can use at the pool and beach. Negative-Rooms could of been updated, especially the bathroom, there was a mildew smell and that really bothered me. The bathroom in our first room, (building 6) was newer with 100sq feet more space and that was in the bathroom. Rental cost for beach chairs. Sheraton Reservations - recommend to make your hotel reservation directly through Sheraton. We had the 5 Nights for 4 package. We had the 5th night free and 35% off of lunch or dinner at any of their restaurants. This was a deal. Eating at the pool restaurants worked out to be reasonable with this discount. Recommendation: Stop at Walmart at the airport. Buy snacks, beverages, beach chairs ($10/each) and boogie boards ($13/each) and snorkel eqiupment. A big savings compared to renting these things. Take on your trip a soft cooler for beverages and snacks, we hauled it around and again saved money. I give the Sheraton a rating of a 4, not because it was bad, but because there are other hotels that would be more deserving of a 4.5-5.0 rating (i.e. Hyatt, more upscale). We chose the Sheraton based on the Fodors recommendation. Also, we stayed at the Marriott Waikiki for one night and this hotel is a definite 4.5 so I felt I had to rate the Sheraton lower since the Marriott room was far superior to the Sheraton. When we return to Maui again, we will not even stay in Kannapali as Wailia is far more elegant, more of the Beverly Hills of Maui. We visited the Grand Wailia and can see why the room rates are higher. This is where we will stay the next time

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: bercre
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to Hawaii. We stayed 6 nights at The Sheraton in Lahaina and 3 days in Hilo, visiting family. The Sheraton was even better than all the glowing reviews I had read on this website before I booked the trip. We have a 7 year old son so we did not want to stay at a place that would frown on kids playing at the pool or running on the beach. The Sheraton, while still a perfect spot for honeymooners, was full of families with kids, and the hotel staff was quite adept at dealing with children and helping them to feel so relaxed and welcome. The accessibility of all the activities at The Sheraton made it so easy to do whatever you want without any effort or hassle. The snorkling was excellent right off the hotel beach and, if you want to take a sunset cruise, like we did, the concierge can book it for you and the boat takes off five minutes from the hotel. This is a great way to get a view of West Maui from the water on a 60 foot catamaran, with an open bar and hors d'oeuvres on a 2 hour boat ride. Also, the pool is so much better than it appears on the website. It is a long winding relaxing pool with so many areas to swim in it never feels crowded. I would definitely recommend this Hotel to my friends and I would come back here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “They took great care of us!”
Reviews.Author: DavidCrescentCity_CA
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Maui about 6:30 pm only to find that the one and only road from the airport to our hotel was closed due to a massive fire. After sitting with hundreds of other travelers on the road, waiting to see if the road might open, we finally gave up at midnight and ended up staying at the Maui High School gym, which was staffed by the local Red Cross. What a night! After not sleeping the entire night, we were fortunate to get through on the road when they opened it briefly at 6 am. We arrived at the Sheraton front desk at 6:30 am, tired, dirty and frustrated with how our vacation started out and were treated wonderfully by the front desk staff. Some of them had gotten off work the night prior, only to find that the same road closure prevented them from getting home, so they had a rough night also. They checked us in at that early hour, gave us snacks and water and didn't charge us for the missed night. And, to welcome us to Hawaii, they upgraded our room from a courtyard view to ocean view - nice. The beach was great, the hotel quiet and comfortable, and our vacation turned out just like we had planned. I'd stay there again, given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Resort”
Reviews.Author: Lew829
Reviews.Content: We were in Maui from 7/16-7/22. My wife and I celebrated our 30th Anniversary. The check-in was smooth but we were given a handicapped room(4301). I went back to the front desk to complain and got moved to 3506--much better. I guess they try to give the less desirable rooms to Expedia(Hotels.com). The staff at the Sheraton was outstanding ---from Trevor(bellman) to Monica(concierge). The food at this resort was great. My wife said that the burger at the pool was the best. We got to dine at Mama's Fish House, Mala Ocean Tavern, David Paul's and the Pinnapple Grill--all outstanding. I paid for a compact car with hotels.com and got an economy Chevy. I called customer service but got no help. Hotels.com lost a customer. The car really came in handy. We had the chance to visit the Four Seasons at Wailea. While there, we had dessert-maui pinnapple and apple crisp--unbelievable!. Overall, the Sheraton was very good. My suggestion would be to do away with the resort fee and open a game room(ping pong) Although we liked the Sheraton and the great beach, I think we'll try the Hyatt or the Four Seasons next year. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, Wow, Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: bourgeoisBakersfield
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton was absolutely the most beautiful hotel ever. We had a perfect view of the pool, ocean, and the immactulately landscaped grounds with swaying palm trees and many tropical flowers . I loved the way the hotel was open versus closed in with walls, as it allowed perfect summer breezes to cool us off and endless photo opportunites of its many beautiful views. Sheraton's Black Rock offers the best snorkling. I saw so many varieties of fish - even saw a huge sea turtle munching on the ocean floor. BTW, took one of those snorkling trips by boat towards Molokini - Black Rock was much better. The breakfast buffet at the hotel is expensive but worth the money - just do it once. Really enjoyed the lagoon style pool almost every day I was there. It's not just for kids - I'm 49 years old and swam till I wore myself out. Also the pool bar(s) - they have 2 - have great poolside service, although very expensive. I can think of no better way to relax than to have a pina colada near a cascading waterfall pool on a hot day. The trip was the very best.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Norgetroll
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 8 days at the Sheraton Maui. We would have been at the Ritz Carlton but they are closed for remodeling. The Sheraton is a fine property, nothing special. It does have a great location on a wonderful beach. Pool was nice. The hotel was remodeled but that was some time ago and it was just cosmetic. The room/bathroom styles are very dated. Suites seemed small. I think it is due for a real up date. Food on property is very expensive even for a hotel and even for Maui. Kids eat free at the 1 restaurant so that helped. Breakfast buffet is 19.00 and really nice. A great deal as you will pay far more off property. DO NOT order room service, prices are the highest I have seen and the quality low. The Ritz and Four Seasons have kids choices that are priced alright. Sheraton charged 15.00 for a peanut butter and jelly sandwich! Be warned, if you are on the ground floor you will have bugs in the room as they them come in the sliding doors! All in all a good trip. Staff was very friendly. If we stay here again I would ask to be in one of the bulidings nearer the beach, not near the rear of the property.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Sheraton Maui”
Reviews.Author: julieSanDiego_Ca
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the Sheraton Maui - great rooms, best beach in all of Maui, awesome snorkeling right out front of room, courteous staff, gorgeous grounds. We will definitely stay again! Lots of kids programs during the day...kids movies at the pool at night, live Hawaaiin music at night... very relaxing. This was my 7th trip to Hawaii and this has been the best resort we've stayed at :) Can't wait to go again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Anniversary/Birthday trip to Maui”
Reviews.Author: samerga
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Sheraton from July 4-9 2007. This was far the best resort. It is a beautiful property and spread out nicely. When we arrived we all got a nice lei greeting and given free coupons for drinks and a discount for lunch. Our room wasn't ready and that was fine as we got lunch. The lunch in Keka a terrace was great. We really appreciated the front desk in giving us the drinks and the food coupon. We met the manager and he escorted us to our nice upgraded room. We had booked a garden view, but got a deluxe ocean view room. We were in building 2 and that was in a good location to the beach and pool. After being in our room for a short time there was a knock on the door. Chocolate covered strawberries, Champagne and a gift bag were delivered. It was for our Anniversary/Birthday trip. It was the best. Our son was so impressed and excited. We all had a strawberry and they were great! A nice letter came with the gift bag and it was full of cookies, chocolates, nuts, etc. We thought this was top notch for celebrating our 20th Anniversary and my birthday. The area was very nice. The pool was really different. They had waterfalls and a small slide for small children. It was spread out and people really enjoyed that. The beach was great and we all enjoyed that so much. We roamed Whalers Village and ate at the Hula Grill. That was great. Also went to the town of Lahaina and enjoyed a ride on the Sugar Cane Train. The only downside in Maui is all the developement going on. All the sugar cane is gone and we missed seeing that on the train ride. It seems progress is going strong in Maui. That is a shame since it is taking away from the Hawaii we know and love. Other then that we enjoyed our trip and the Sheraton Maui. We would return in a heartbeat. Enjoy and Aloha!!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Gabrielle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a one week trip at the Sheraton Maui.We were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary.Upon arrival,we knew we had made an excellent choice.We were greeted with a lovely lei, told that valet service is complimentary the 1st day and that we had been upgraded to an ocean front room ...wow !!! We went to our room and within 5 minutes our luggage arrived.There was a bottle of champagne chilling in the fridge. The view from our room(4405) was spectacular !! We could see the ocean, the hotel pool and the beautiful property as well as views of Lanai and the mountains.The property is immaculate. We ate breakfast at Keke twice and it was delicious.We also had dinner there twice and it was also delicious.The service was always courteous and efficient. I think the Sheraton,has, by far , in the best location on Kaanapali beach. WE are golfers and we were blown away by the beauty of the courses.We played Kaanapali Kei course and the Walaia blue course.It was hard to concentrate on our game with all the breath taking views at every hole. Our room was cleaned by 11am every day.We would find it difficult to find fault in any aspect of this hotel.We.would highly recommend it to any one .We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the beach and location!”
Reviews.Author: Kate1607
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the Sheraton while on our honeymoon and it was a wonderful experience. They have a very nice lei greeting and then they also provided champagne and glasses for us! The only thing I was a little disappinted about was we were not able to get an upgrade as the hotel was full but we had a great room nonetheless. We stayed in an ocean front room but it is definitely not necessary to spend that much money on a room there. Their hotel is beautiful so a garden view room would suffice. You spend so little time in your room it's not worth spending the money (except on your honeymoon :) ) There was a hidden cost that we did not know about and that was the $18/day charge for self parking, cable, newspaper and a few others. Even if you have your car valet parked you still have to pay the $18/day. I believe a lot of resorts have that daily charge. The beach is absolutely perfect in front of the Sheraton; people walk from their hotels down the beach to hang out at Sheraton's beach. The snorkeling is great due to the hotel being right on Black Rock but it is a bit busy at times. You do have to pay to rent chairs and umbrellas but it's worth it. The pool is wonderful; the resort does a great job of keeping nonguests out of the pool so it is not busy. There are two bars by the pool and they make great drinks; just be ware of the strong mai tais! The food is a bit expensive on the resort so we only ate a few meals there, mainly breakfast, but the nice thing about the location of the resort is that you can walk to Whalers Village which has nice, reasonable restaurants and shopping! Laihana is a wonderful town and is a short car drive and there is wonderful restaurants and shopping there also. There are ABC stores every where so that if you forget something they have it; contact solution, towels, alcohol, beach mats etc. I would definitley stay at the Sheraton the next time I return to Hawaii!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui - Paradise in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii6
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed at the Sheraton Maui from 03/05 - 09/05 and had a fantastic time. Upon check in we were each given a beautiful flower lei and led to our deluxe ocean front room in building 6 at the top of black rock. The views from these rooms are truly amazing, your outlook is just the ocean and neighboring islands. The rooms in building 6 also have their own car park so you can park quite close to your room. This allows you to come and go without having to walk all the way back to the lobby. We loved how quiet and peaceful this area of the resort was but some people might find all the walking a nuisance. We ate breakfast each morning at the resort and just loved the buffet. We also had dinner there one night and it was probably one of the nicest meals we had on our trip. The gardens are well laid out and beautiful. Make sure you make the time to just walk around the entire resort and admire them. Whalers Village is about 5 mins walk away and there are lots of places to eat and shop there. Try both Hula Grill and Leilanis for great food. There is also an ABC shop there so you can stock up on the essentials. Sheraton Maui is located on the best part of Kaanapali beach, the snorkling at Black Rock is awesome, you will see lots of fish and maybe even spot a turtle or two. At sunset there is also a cliff diving ceremony. As the sunsets in the distance a hawaiian dives off the end of black rock. (great photo opportunity) My mum and I both love the Sheraton Maui Resort and one day hope to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Gotta love the hammocks!”
Reviews.Author: Dez317
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Sheraton the last week of June. The resort is very large so be prepared to walk. We had to walk through 3 different buildings and take 2 different elevators just to get to the pool. But, it is so beautiful here, you do not mind the walk. The pool was very fun for our two boys (age 11 and 12) and the beach area is one of the best on the island. It is located at Black Rock and our oldest son even jumped off of the rock. It was fun watching all of the people who were daring enough to make the jump. They also have hammocks throughout the resort. There is nothing better than laying on a hammock and feeling the nice Maui breeze. I never had a problem finding an empty one. The buffett is EXCELLENT! You get a lot for your money (by Maui standards). It is always nice to eat a late breakfast and then skip lunch. The rooms were very spacious with large bathrooms. They are a bit outdated and could use some sprousing up. The carpet was very worn and the beds were uncomfortable. But the room was quiet which seems rare for a hotel now-a-days. I would be inclined to give this hotel a perfect rating if they updated the rooms a bit. The staff is friendly and kind. They acted as if we were their most valued guest.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise 25th Anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: ldw1982
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton Maui Resort Hotel had everything we needed to make our 25th wedding anniversary trip to paradise a trip to remember(late June 2007)! This was our first time to Hawaii. The Sheraton Maui is about 50 minutes from the Kahului airport and its a very scenic drive when you get to the mountains and see the ocean. You must take highway 380 to highway 30 to get there. We were told not to go the northern way because of very bad roads. Kaanapali Beach was a great location for shopping, restaurants, activities, etc. without being commercial. We booked a garden view room for 6 nights but received a complimentary upgrade to an ocean view room. The ocean view room just made our trip! We were at the top of the cliff on Black Rock in building #6. The room was great and the king size bed and bedding were heavenly! We were on ground level so we had a great patio where we spent alot of time just staring out at the beauty of the ocean waves and boats passing by. Everything was superclean. The room location was quiet and private but a little confusing getting to the main parts of the hotel. We had to go on two or three different elevators to make it to the beach level or lobby but we laughed about it. The walk through the hotel had breathtaking views and wonderful Hawaiian breezes because of the openness of the halls. The resort grounds were beautifully landscaped and staff were constantly working to keep it that way. We'll never forget the smell of Maui! Flowering shrubs everywhere! The staff always greeted us with an "Aloha" and all staff were dressed very professionally. We ate lunch a few times at the outdoor hotel restaurant near the pool where you can dine casually at an umbrella table in your beach attire with a great view of the beach. There was a fantastic singer several evenings singing contemporary Hawaiian--I think he said his name was "Mondo". The relaxing music and tiki torches glowing made it a wonderful atmosphere. The beach was great and my husband said the snorkeling was great around Black Rock. He saw a sea turtle and many large, beautiful angel fish. (Wear flip flops on the beach because the sand gets very hot!) There were very nice people vacationing at the Sheraton--couples and families. We always felt very safe. Our part of the beach was the best. We rented an umbrella and chairs so we could be closer to Black Rock. Definitely have dinner at the Hula Grill and Barefoot Bar behind Whaler's Village. Just a 5-10 minute walk down the sidewalk from the Sheraton. Great food, atmosphere, Hawaiian entertainment! We attended the top rated Old Lahaina Luau (book several weeks early) only 10 minutes by car. You do need to rent a car. Lahaina is a great area to spend time. My husband took a surfing lesson there and we had a great breakfast at a corner blue open-air restaurant called "Longhi's". One morning we drove up to Kapalua for breakfast and drove around the beautiful area. We also drove half of the Hana Highway and back and went on a 45 min. helicopter tour of the Hana area and Haleakala volcano. Take Dramamine if you have any least bit of motion sickness problems before either of these activities. I thought I'd be ok but the helicopter ride wasn't for me. My husband loved it. Blue Hawaiian Helicopters are the best. It was very smooth and beautiful views. The pilot, Dave, was a great tour guide. While we were in Kahului near the airport, we stopped at a great little museum called the Bailey House. A very kind lady named "Lani" gave us alot of historical information on Hawaii. It is definitely worth the time -about an hour-spent. We flew Hawaiian Airlines to Oahu for a whole day to see Pearl Harbor, Waikiki Beach and Diamond Head. Pearl Harbor is a must see but we were happy to get back to Maui. We hope to go back to Hawaii in a few years and we would definitely stay at the Sheraton Maui again. The Hawaiian culture and people are just beautiful. We wish we would have stayed a few more days. We needed more time on the beach but thought we needed to see the other sights while we were there, too. (Ten days would be great if you're going to do it all. Read Frommer's book on Maui and get Maui magazine to get ready for the trip.) The weather was in the low to mid 80s the whole time and the ocean was a perfect temperature. I can't think of a better place to spend a romantic vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: joh103
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for 5 nights during our honeymoon. As gold preferred guests we were upgraded and ended up with an unbelievable room in building 4. We had 2 balconies, one overlooking the pool the other overlooking the beach. What a view, what a room! The whole resort was run very smoothly, the beach was outstanding (especially the snorkelling) the only disappointment was having to leave. Given that it's Maui you will pay premium for everything (esp food & drinks) and the resort is no different. We were happy at least to have had great food. If you want to save a few $$ here and there head to Lahaina which is a short drive on the complimentary westin shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: bemuum3
Reviews.Content: I'm a little late in my review, but I wanted to be sure to give the Sheraton credit where credit is due! Not only was the hotel and hotel grounds beautiful, but the staff was fantastic. My wife and I went for our honeymoon last year and were blown away by the sights, smells, and experience at the Sheraton. We were upgraded to a king ocean view from a queen garden view at no cost. There is also a lot to be said for the location! Close to Whaler's Village you can dine at the food court there or grab small snacks at the mini store located there if you're trying to save some money. Sir Wilfred's there has fantastic coffee! We only ate at the restaurant one night and while it was ok, we would much prefer to have dined another night in Lahaina at David Pauls. The location next to Black Rock also makes for wonderful snorkeling at all hours of the day and in such close proximity to your quarters! Snorkeling gear can be expensive if you rent from the hotel so my wife and I went through a third party. My only qualm with the Sheraton, and I imagine any hotel, is that in order to get a good beach chair near the pool you must get up no later than 5:15am. We're from the Midwest so we were thrown off on our sleep anyway and were waking up that early but saw "squatters" who would wake up place towels on the chairs and then go back to sleep until 8 or 9. Extremely frustrating b/c we did not see the hotel staff do anything about it. All in all we loved the Sheraton and would return to it in a heartbeat! Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Property, Great Pool, Pretty Good Room”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiRose
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this property. We had an ocean view room that included a pretty view of the garden area. The doors and hallways are outside, but that is a wonderful thing in Hawaii with the beautiful tradewind weather. The room was nice enough although there was a ton of dust behind the head posts. The carpet, bedding, and bathroom, however, looked and smelled clean and fresh. The comforters and linens were soft and comfortable, but my husband and I felt the mattresses and pillows were too soft which made sleeping uncomfortable for us. We woke up every morning with sore backs and necks, but it really depends on what type of mattress a person is used to sleeping on. We are just used to firm beds. They have a decent sized mini fridge and a small, but clean bathtub with a detachable showerhead that can be set at two height levels. The pool is a lot of fun - my kids loved the little mini slide and my husband and I loved the way we could travel from one area to another without ever getting out. It is a nice little excursion to swim from the kiddie pool side to the deeper end by traveling through narrow waterways under little bridges and past miniature waterfalls. The beach was also very nice, but it was a little windy during our stay, so little sandstorms kept stinging our skin. The staff was friendly and helpful and they left messages to pass on bits of information regarding problems with some services and to remind us of our checkout time. It was quite a hike to our room, but we love walking, so this was not a problem for us. if you have difficulty getting around, however, you may want to request a room closer to the lobby and pool area. Overall, we had a good experience at this hotel and would recommend it to others. Maui is such a gorgeous island and Sheraton Maui in Ka'anapali is a great place to stay to take in some of the the island's vast beauty.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Rouget
Reviews.Content: I am a very fussy traveler - strictly a Ritz Carlton/Four Seasons kinda gal, but even I balked at the room rates for those resorts in Hawaii. For a family vacation with kids ages 10 and 12, I sought out a more affordable choice and selected th Sheraton Maui because it seemed to have the best beach. I figured I could live with a less than fantastic room since I wouldn't be spending much time in it. I was pleasantly surprised with the Sheraton and would certainly return. We received a warm welcome at check-in and I immediately liked the lay-out of the property. While surrounded by highrise (ugly) condos and hotels, the Sheraton has low, sprawling buildings surrounded by a large lawn. I liked the relaxed, open feeling provided by the low-slung architecture. Our rooms (two connecting ocean front - not deluxe) were perfectly fine. They were clean (freshly shampooed carpets, too), not particularly large, but pleasant. Bathrooms were a bit tight and no separate shower, but fine. Views of the ocean, Black Rock, lawn, were beautiful. The beach was fantastic. My children had never snorkeled before. We took advantage of the free snorkel lessons poolside (extremely helpful for beginners with info on fitting mask, breathing, hand signals and pool practice). Then, we took to the ocean and immediately found ourselves surrounded by hundreds of tropical fish, within 15 feet of shore. This is a great snorkeling locations for beginners and kids - the Black Rock extends underwater into a coral mass that attracts all sorts of beautiful fish and sea turtles. We saw several large sea turtles during our stay - the kids swimming right alongside them. (Don't touch the turtles - they are a protected species and we were told it is against the law to touch them.) We rented a cabana for $40 a day - well worth it to keep the sunburns at bay but it does add up. We did not eat dinner at the resort so cannot comment on the restaurants beyond the breakfast buffet (good) and poolside sandwiches and salads (serviceable). Our best dinner by far was at Gerard's in Lahaina. David Paul, also in Lahaina, was excellent as well. I'o was good, not great. Sansei, a sushi place in Kapalua was noisy and crowded but pretty good sushi. Plantation Inn, also in Kapalua has a beautiful room and views of Molokai but very expensive and merely good - not great - food. Overall, it was a fantastic family vacation. The threadcount could have been higher on the bed linens and the bathrooms could have been roomier and spiffier, but we were comfortable and well taken care of. By the way, no mini bars in rooms but you do get a mini fridge and there is a Safeway 5 min. away for those wishing to avoid the expense of resort breakfast/lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Most fun in Maui ever - we loved the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: eatuza
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Sheraton Maui in October, 2006 and loved every minute of it. When we arrive, the staff was warm and welcoming, greeting us with flower lei's and upgrading us to an ocean front room that was beautiful. The grounds are spectacular and room was beautiful and spacious. Very comfortable bed, nice large lanai overlooking the beach and the best location in Kaanapali. We spent a lot of time on the sandy beach, right by Black Rock, perfect for beginner snorkelers. The rest of the time we floated in the Sheraton's unique pool that was just wonderful. The only thing that was a little disruptive were a handful of teenagers using the pool in the middle of the night and nobody cared to tell them to keep their voices down. The restaurant onsite is only marginal, you are better off saving your money and going elsewhere in Lahaina. The ambiance is wonderful though, just the food was nothing out of ordinary. Overall, we had a wonderful time and cannot wait to go back again. We're even considering getting married at the Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Kids”
Reviews.Author: Familyof07
Reviews.Content: Recommend for Families. SPG Platinum member using free points for six nights. Evelyn, senior front desk clerk, upgraded to preferred Tower 3 w/2 ocean view rooms (The 3 suites were booked). Easy pool & beach access. Food pricy, but frankly everywhere is too, so why complain. Kids eat free per paying adult. Minor complaints w/running toilet, faucet, closet rollers off track, but all were personally fixable items. Resort's location nice at end of Whaler's Walk. Easy walk to Whaler's Village to hit Hula Grill. McD's for cheaper quick meal. Got pool passes for the Hyatt which I like better for our five kids. Great Slide. Had inside connection, but Sheraton needs to update their kiddie section.

Reviews.Title: “Casual yet elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: rebsrx
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the highlights of our trip. It has a casual yet elegant atmosphere. I felt like I was in a 5 star hotel but without the stuffiness of the Ritz.. The grounds are very open with beautiful palm trees and tropical flowers. The pool is much nicer than it appears on their website. It is very large and has different sections. We had no problems finding chairs. They also had a bar and grill poolside that was expensive but convenient. We got upgraded from a garden view room to ocean front. Our room was much larger than I was expecting and had a great bathroom. It was very clean and had a refrigerator and coffee pot. We ate the breakfast buffet almost every morning at their open air restaurant. The food was very good and we were entertained by the many birds that frequented the outdoor dining area. For dinner, the restaraunt had a delicious menu and provided music and hula dancing for entertainment. We also tried the Japanese restaurant, which I would rate as average. It was the same quality as our local Japanese restaurant, but three times the price. The beach was very nice and had great snorkeling just a few feet off the shore. You could rent all the equipment poolside (including prescription goggles). You could also rent covered beach chairs, but you needed to book these a day in advance. I read many reviews from this website before deciding on the Sheration Maui. I was very pleased with my decision and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon on Maui”
Reviews.Author: PaisleyDublin
Reviews.Content: I have just recently discovered trip advisor while planning a trip to Aruba and decided to write a review of my honeymoon in Maui. It was a year and a half ago but we loved it so much I felt strongly about sharing my experience. We absolutley loved the Sheraton Maui. The best thing about it is the location. It is on the very end of a small strip of resorts on an amazing beach with excellent snorkeling. There is a cliff on the property that has cliff diving shows at night. Our room was clean and comfortable (love those beds). We were on our honeymoon and were upgraded and received a wine and cheese basket. The view from our oceanview room could not have been more beautiful. I would recommend staying on the main area (not up on the cliff) so you are closer to everything. I wouldn't say the staff was overly friendly though. Not rude or anything but not exceptional. The resort is very expensive, especially the poolside snack bar but everything is expensive in Hawaii so we expected that. The formal dining room wasn't bad but we much preferred going to into town in Lahaina to have dinners at one of many excellent restaraunts. You must have Hula Pie which is made at Kimo's but you can also get it at some other places. The Sheraton is on beautiful grounds with open air common areas and with a nice boardwalk that connects it to all of the other resorts/hotels on that beach. Some of the other hotels had more dining/shopping options which was convenient but we were glad to always go back to our quiet end of the beach. We never felt crowded on the beach. Lahaina is just a quick less than 5 minute drive and you can shop, eat, and go to the docks to catch dinner cruise, etc. Beautiful place. Love the slow pace of life. I never wanted to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel!
Reviews.Content: We paid for an Ocean View Room but were upgraded upon arrival to an Ocean View Deluxe Room. The room was modern, nicely furnished and most important clean. The staff were all very courteous and in good spirits (except for one person at the Front Desk...see below). The grounds were well kept and lovely. Compared to other hotels on Kaanapali Parkway The Sheraton's grounds are not as lush but they are still beautiful. The pool area was very nice as well. We rented a beach cabana from the hotel one day. Very much worth the $40.00! Highly recommend renting one if you plan to visit the Black Rock Beach. This beach is the largest of all the Kaanapali Parkway hotels. It is clean and offers great snorkeling around Black Rock. We did not eat in any of the hotel restaurants so I cannot comment on them. My only complaint is that they automatically charge you for the valet regardless if you use it or not. We valet parked our first day yet we were charged for the entire week even though we used the self parking garage. I had to call the Front Desk twice to have these charges removed. They did remove them but I was questioned for about 5 minutes first. I was very surprised by this and the fact that they don't track when their guests actually use the valet. Overall, we had a great stay and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: taxistarfish
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. The pool was absolutely fantastic and the accomodation was excellent. There was a problem checking in and they took a while to sort our room. When we were shown to our first room it was a partial ocean view and we had a booked a full ocean view. To anyone thinking of booking a partial ocean view it looked a great room and was exactly the same as a full view room. However we had booked a full view and asked to be changed. They had trouble sorting this out and we ended up having our first night in a deluxe ocean view room (I'm just putting this to explain why we saw so many rooms). This was very nice, but actually quite similar to the standard room. It had a bigger bathroom (but the standard one is fine) and a longer room with an extra chair. The down side of the deluxe rooms is their location which is a long way from the resturants and pools. Also I preferred the view over the beach to the deluxe view which is over the cliff and straight out to sea. However it was very quiet. We finally ended up in our actual room on the second night and it was fantastic. It was located at the end of the building and was right on the beach opposite black rock so we could see them lighting the torches and doing the cliff jump each night right from our room. The location of the resort on the beach at Black Rock is great. The beach is lovely and the resort opens right on to it. You just step out into the water and snorkel off. I had a turtle swim right past me just off the beach. Amazing. The swimming pool was excellent. Very big with lots of room for all the guests. The pool service was also excellent. We thought the food and drinks here were much better than the Sheraton Moana at Waikiki. Overall we had a great break and loved this resort. We will definetely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: pw540
Reviews.Content: We just returned from seven wonderful nights at the Sheraton Maui resort. There were six of us utilizing a Murphy suite (1105) and a garden view room which they upgraded for us. The suite was ground level and worked perfect for 5 to sleep. I do have to say, their beds are extremely small consequently if you two people were of large stature this could be a problem. I do not know if any of their beds are bigger. Everyone at the resort were more than accomodating. Any requests including pulling up our car to valet were always promptly met. Just know that this is Maui hence if you choose to eat there, you will drop some bucks. Their breakfast buffet is very good however with tip plan on adults $30.00/person. 6 of us ate burgers by the pool with one drink each, $150.00. Obviously dinner is no cheaper. There is a fantastic book I highly recommend called "50 Thrifty Maui Restaurants" which is an amazing book. We utilized this book each day. The pool is great and fun for the kids. There is competition for the chairs around the pool. We kept our towels instead of turning them in each day so that we could put them on chairs early in the morning. There is great poolside beverage service as well as a food menu. Again, it is not cheap but then again relax and know it is vacation! The concierge was quite helpful in booking out Blue Hawaiian Helicopter ride along with parasailing. Both were a blast. Go as early as you can to avoid the wind. There is a great little coffee stand in the lobby which is opens at 6:30 am until 10:30. Great coffee. Each room did contain a refrigerator. We went to the store and bought sandwich meat, water and extra food for the room. Also; you can rent snorkling equipment in Lahaina. The beach chairs rent for $40.00/day (2 covered). This is truly a great place so go have fun. Oh yes, the boardwalk is great especially early am! Whalers Village has alot to offer from eateries to art to shopping. Good luck!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mikss1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this resort in Lahaina on June 7 and 8th. Hotel appeared to be in great shape and well maintained. Staff was very friendly and helpful in finding deals for dinning in nearby areas. The room was like ordinary hotel rooms, beds were comfortable and the bathroom decent size. Housekeeping was good and very courteous. The resort itself is in a great location and the lay out of the property is superb. The pool is very comfortable and relaxing and the beach is just a step away from the resort. Pool staff very helpful and accomadating bringing towels without even asking. The food at the hotel was decent but nothing to rave over. Hint, don't eat breakfast on Front Street...way too expensive. There are a lot of other small places to eat near by. In all a very decent resort for the price no real complaints. I definately recommend this resort if you can get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii50
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Sheraton Maui during May. Wow, this resort was absolutely fantastic!! We arrived on Speedi Shuttle (airport transfers) which can only drop you off at the bus stop at the bottom of the hotel drive-way. We were greeted with bellhop/porter staff who quickly picked up our luggage and took us to the check in area at the top of the driveway on a golf buggy...pretty cool!! We received fresh flower orchid lei's on arrival and were escorted to our room by the porter, who gave us a very informative tour about the resort as we walked to our room. We were in building 4 (which I had requested) near black rock, overlooking the pool & ocean towards Whalers Village. I could not have been more happier with the room when we arrived, the view was amazing, the room was clean and had beautiful Sheraton sweet-sleeper beds with fluffy soft pillows!! We noticed that Building 3 rooms were being renovated while we were there. The hotel is spread out so you have plenty of room without being on top of other buildings. The lawns & garden grounds were immaculate and there were hammocks around that you could just relax on. We had breakfast each morning in Keka'a Terrace which was a beautiful buffet with freshly squeezed juices, freshly made omlets & pancakes ...yum!! Breakfast was about $20 each, not too bad price for a 4-5 star hotel. We also had room service one night on our balcony. There was nightly live entertainment at the restaurant and pool bar which you would watch or just sit back and listen from your balcony. We went snorkelling at Black Rock one morning, hire equipment available at the water sports desk for reasonable hire charge $20 a day or $8 per hour. The fish at Black Rock were beautiful and just swim around you as if you are not there. The hotel pool was fantastic with plenty of lounge chairs available and not being overcrowded. We also had cocktails and snacks from the pool bar while sitting by the pool...very relaxing!! You can sign out pool towels free of charge to hotel guests instead of having to bring your own. It is only a 5 minute walk along the beachfront to Whalers Village which has restaurants, shops, convenient ABC shop etc so anything you need isnt far away. The hotel also has a small souviner shop with some convenience items (sunlotion, snack food etc). My sister & mum were staying in building 5 which is right at the top of rock. This is also where some of the suites are located. It can be a bit of a walk to get there, catching 2 or 3 lifts. My mum who is getting a little older some days found the walk a bit much, however if you like tranquility & peace then building 5 is good. It doesnt have the sounds of general hotel guest sitting by the pool etc and has gorgeous oceanfront views. The rooms in building 5 are also slightly bigger and there is also separate car parking for guests staying at the top of the rock in building 5 & 6. The hotel also has a self coin laundry which we found great as you dont have to send out for dry cleaning. The Sheraton Maui is a fantastic hotel, the staff and service were exceptional & friendly everywhere we went and I cant wait to go back to this resort again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable and awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: rtep
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Maui is brilliant. The hotel has a beautiful garden and an awesome pool area. The stuff is very friendly and the rooms are great and comfortable. But the best is the wonderful beach with it's fantastic panorama. Surrounded from lava rocks and an incredible coral reef which is ideal for snorkeling you will have a really great time. Also in the evening there is life Hawaiin music and you sit at the beach bar with an unforgettable view on Lanai. Very good is that the Sheraton Maui is located at the end of Kanapaali Beach where it is more quite and the beach ends. The Sheraton Maui can be recommanded especially for Honeymooners as we were and for families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui - May 2007”
Reviews.Author: Candlelady222
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Sheraton Maui and was highly disappointed in the quality of the food, for two hamburgers and pina coladas paid $55.00 at the beach barbeque grill. The hamburger I saved to feed to the fish. I complained to the manager and he gave us a free breakfast buffet and that was not much better. The service at the restaurants is extremely slow and I we had to wait to get into our room over half an hour after 3:00 PM after they told us they would call us, I had to go to the front desk just to wait in line all over again . i have stayed at several of resorts on this beach and never experienced this service problem or quality of food on top of the food being very expensive. Our room was nice and big with balcony and flat screen tv. The resort fee was $18.00 per night and you got a paper and parking, that was a big high especially for people who were on a buget (I was not, but it still seemed high). The beach and the snorkeling were great right outside the hotel at Black Rock. It is a very clean beach and I would highly recommend the snorkeling to everybody. We seen eels, turtles and all kinds of tropical fish including puffers. I would definitely recommend if you stay there do not eat there go to Whalers Village or Lahaina and do not go to the Luau it s expensive and the food was cold and not very tasty, do Old Lahaina Luau. If you snorkel do not spend money on snorkeling boats just rent the snorkels from Boss Frogs which is much cheaper. Overall the experience at the Sheraton did not compare to the experience at the Westin and service was no comparison. I would definitely chose the Westin over the Sheraton anytime even though the rooms are quite small at the Westin our experience at the Westin and other hotels were pleasantly memorable, not at the Sheraton it was a bad hotel experience not enough workers on hand and overly priced food with low quality. I would definitely check around before I stay at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: InSearchofSunshine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a week at the Sheraton Maui and we really loved it! It was our 3 year Anniv. and we are SPG and we were upgraded from partial ocean view to ocean view. The room was fine - nice new, large flat screen TV - and the view was great. The hotel ground are absolutely gorgeous and you cannot find a better beach in Maui. The sand is beautiful and clean. The water is beautiful and clean as well - no rocks/seaweed etc at all. You can run right down into the water with no reservations at all. We walked to all other hotels on Kaanapali Beach and also drove to those in Wailea and still felt that we had made the right decision with the Sheraton. The weather was perfect - mid 80's in the day and upper 60's at night. Ladies - take a sweater for the evenings. But it is perfect. Trade winds make it cooler than it would be other wise which is a gift during the day and still nice at night. It also helps with humidity - we travel to the Caribben alot and always feel like we need a shower after dinner because you sweat so much there - not true at all in Maui (in May anyway!). Bugs were also very few and far between which was a nice difference form the Caribbean. Hotel food was good and service was great. We walked to Whaler's Village for dinner several times and really enjoyed it. Leilani's was our favorite. Try the Hula Pie!! Old Lahaina Luau - fun! Have the professional photographer take your picture. We did and we ended up buying all 4 of them...when else will you have such an amazing backdrop?? Food was just ok to us but we are from Texas and really like our steak and potatos...others seemed to really like it. The show was great. Sunset Catamaran Cruise - VERY ROUGH. I have done these lots of times before but it was never this rough. I asked the captain if it was always this way and he said "This is nothing!"....ok I have never been seasick (I grew up on boats) but I came very close. 10-12 feet swells and many people got drenched and or fell down on the bow. I would suggest this only for the adventurous. The beachside loading was also a challenge. It is all ok I guess if you have on your bathing suit, bring several towels, and DONT bring anything valuable because there is a good chance it will get wet. The upside - after the beating we took at sea we came in and just cruised up and down the beach to watch the sunset and this part was nice and romantic....and the sunset was amazing...but I am still not sure it was worth it. So overall we really LOVED Maui and the Sheraton. We had an 8 hour flight but I am certain that we will still return. It's a nice plus that everyone speaks English and drives on the right side of the road too! :) Aloha!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ronsray
Reviews.Content: Just got back Maui & stayed at the Sheraton. It is a gorgeous hotel, the staff are friendly, the pools are great and the room was comfortable. ..a few suggestions ......snorkel at the beach next to Black Rock....great ......the hotel restaurants are good, but very expensive. Instead, enjoy the pools, beach, room...etc....but eat at Lahaina Town...Bubba Gumps, Cheeseburger in Paradise (good breakfast too..overlooking the ocean), Moose McGillicuddys, etc.... ......Book the Old Lahaina Luau 2 months in advance..... ......Book the Zip line 2 months in advance.... ......Check for specials on Travelzoo Have fun...we loved it...

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth!”
Reviews.Author: h2okc5
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton for 5 days to celebrate our 5 year wedding anniversary from May 2-May 6. Booked a package deal through Orbitz with their Hawaii sale and opted against car rental. This trip was a little over our budget so we researched all the ways to cut corners and have a great time without charging up the credit cards. Took a cab from the airport to the hotel-was $90 plus tip each way-an airport shuttle would have been cheaper but we didn't set up in advance. Upon arrival to the resort we were told we had been upgraded from our garden view room to a partial oceanview room with 2 double beds if that was okay. We agreed and then found out that room was not yet clean so an available deluxe ocean view with a king bed was offered and we jumped at the chance. We were in building two room 2420 (fourth floor) and the room was immaculate-no mold or old bathroom fixtures. This room appreared to be recently remolded because the carpet was in excellent condition and the entire room was squeaky clean. Our mini fridge was super cold and our balcony had a great view of the property/pools/black rock/ and the ocean. We never ate or ordered drinks from the Sheraton. We immediately walked over to Whalers Village and purchased snacks from the ABC store. For breakfast and lunch we ate at the food court in Whalers Village and for dinner we ate at the Whalers Village restaurants. Our favorite meal was suprisingly at the Hula Grill (excellent filet and porterhouse steaks), we did not enjoy our meals at the Rusty Harpoon, and although we got a great oceanview on the second floor of Leilanis, I felt their filet mignon was not nearly as good as the one I had at the Hula Grill previously. One night we took the complimentary Westin Shuttle into old Lahaina for dinner at Moose McGillyCuddys. The shuttle drops you off at Kobes, and there is Kimos, Bubba Gump Shrimp, Oyster Bar and Cheeseburger in Paradise all there on front street along with shopping.
