The shuttle also will drop you off at the Lahaina Cannery Mall right by a safeway grocery so you can really stock up on food. The beach is public but the cleanest I've seen-no seaweed or debris. The snorkeling at Black rock is amazing, but watch out for the crazies jumping off the cliff above. My husband saw a porcupine puffer fish, dog face pufferfish, and a giant sea turtle among other tropical fish. We opted not to rent the beach chairs ($40/day for a double chair with a pull up shade). Instead we headed early every morning to the pool for a shady spot and unlike the other rude guests who laid out towels and then left for hours, we napped by the pool in the shade and enjoyed paradise. We had a wonderful time and were glad we hadn't booked a condo at the Whaler-which was plan B. We were a little timid about the Sheraton due to the cost, but it was well worth it. We had absolutely no complaints about the service or resort. The $18/day resort fee sucks. The beach was not as good as Cancun, but more comparable to the Carribean. The water was mostly clear and the sand is more golden and very hot. The pool was very cold and takes some getting used to. There is a heated jacuzzi and waterfalls/small slide along the lazy river connecting the childrens pool with the adult deep pool. I am not sure why this resort is rated so highly for families with small children on this review forum. We are a young couple celebrating a romantic anniversary and thought the setting to be perfect. After walking the beach walk and seeing all the other properties you will find that none compare to the Sheraton. With the best beach, blackrock, amazing pools and close proximity to Whalers Village-the Sheraton misses nothing. We will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Really Happy with the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: GlenRock111
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Shearton (Building #2) from April 29th-May 6th. it was/is a really nice place to stay. The resort is huge, however we did not find it a problem to walking around. Perhaps the only problem was the multiple elevators you must take to get to the gym, but that's it. Getting around the property was easy. Room: We were upgraded from a Garden view to an Ocean view...what a great suprise...although if the hotel has the rooms available, I don't see why they would not do it as it really goes a long way in your impression of the hotel. thank you Sheraton. the room itself was quite big with a comfortable bed, flat screen TV, large bathroom with seperate room for toilet. My only complaint was our particular rooms shower was a bit old and in need of an upgrade. Everything else in the room (TV/BED/TOILET/SINK/FRIDGE/CARPET) seemed to have been upgraded in the last year or less, so it's weird that the shower did not get any attention yet. Pools: Pool and service at the pool were great. Really fun to swim the canals. Beach: Excellent location next to Black Rock and great snorkling. the Sheraton even has free snorkling lessons for all guests. Dining: My wife and I did not eat here because there are so many great options around the island so I can't comment on the food. Grounds: Very well maintatined...granted, we did see some areas that could use attention, but nothing that out-of-the-ordinary. A cigarette butt here and there and some torn up grass. Again, the place looks fantastic!!!! If you are thinking of staying in West Maui, I would highly recommend the Sheraton, we strolled to the other resorts along the beach and while we did not actually go IN them, most of the major resorts have similar pool areas and beaches...although the closer you get to the Hyatt, the smaller the beach becomes. In sum, I would GLADLY return to the Sheraton...it was a great place to stay for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanaOshawa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights of our 9 day stay in Hawaii. We loved staying here. The location cannot be beat. Black Rock, the beach, Whaler's village; its all there. And Lahaina is just a short drive away. We were booked for an ocean view room and when we arrived, we were told we were upgraded to an ocean front. I was excited until I actually saw our "upgraded" room. It seemed to me to be ocean view because it was very far from the ocean. It had a very narrow lanai and was in need of upgrading. The bathroom fixtures were old, the pictures on the wall had mildew in them, the carpet needed replacing. It wasn't an awful room, just less than what I expected for the money. The service at this hotel was top notch. The seamless check in was fast and easy. The grounds are beautifully taken care of. Pool area and spa are perfect. The beach is great, although its expensive to rent the beach chairs. Fitness room has new equipment and pilates class was enjoyable. The resort is very large and there is a lot of walking to get to the parking and fitness center. Every staff member we encountered was pleasant and helpful. They were very nice to store our luggage and let us use the hospitality suite since our flight was late and check out was 11 am. Snorkling is good at the Black Rock but better just 15 minutes north in Honolua Bay. I cannot comment on the dining. We usually went into Lahaina or Whaler's village. Hula Grill is great for lunch and Leilani's is nice at sunset. Overall great resort, but expensive (as everything in Maui is!). I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but the pool was cold”
Reviews.Author: AngelDust2
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Maui and this was our first stay at the Sheraton. We loved our room in building 2. It had a great ocean view and the room came with a mini-fridge. Lots of grassy area for kids to run around. There were lots of young children at the hotel -- we brought our 3 year old with us. The only negative was that the pool was kinda cold. We had to stand in it for a while until we could kinda get used to the temp. The ocean actually felt warmer than the pool! If you stay at the Sheraton, you also get use of the Westin Maui property, which is about 4 hotels down the walkway. The Westin pool was definitely warmer, so it might be worth the walk to hang out at the Westin pool if you intend to stay poolside all day.

Reviews.Title: “paradise lost”
Reviews.Author: nwf
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Maui, Hi people, Just a few opinions I want to get off my chest about what was intended to be one of the greatest hotels in the Pacific Ocean. !st the Good--This place was obviously designed by a modern day Archimedes who got it VERY right. The rooms are spacious enough and the views are resplendent to the eye. There is nothing better than well kept grounds and the team who are in charge of this commitment should be congratulated,. The clean rooms are a credit to the staff. The luggage people do it well. The bed and furnishings are OK but those extra soft pillows cause more problems for a sound sleep than otherwise. . Not so good..... The bath/shower set up is poor as is the really hot water supply The "fridge" could not chill a bottle of drink in 3 days. The room was draught ridden and with the cool Tradies I never needed the air conditioning at any time which saved electricity The nickle and diming[we call it penny pinching] is really sad. A bottle of water $5 each sells at the ABC shop for 99c The $56 fee earnt me 2 local phone calls and a reminder call When I checked out at 6.30am I enquired about a pro rata refund and was given a blank look.Not to be mistaken for a blank cheque..A lot different from the Waikiki hotel I went to next. The front desk was professionally polite and zero else.. I stayed in the Ocean View which is adequate for my needs. All in all I was not impressed with the in depth penny ante . antics of the powers that be. ". .Would I have another shot at the title as you people put it?? NO!.....

Reviews.Title: “incredible”
Reviews.Author: wownewjersey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing, just breath taking. I loved it!! Just gorgeous. The rooms , amentities, staff all superb. A small shopping center in walking distance (whalers village), visited that everyday. I cannot wait to go back. It is a must stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton Maui”
Reviews.Author: katsohal
Reviews.Content: Great location at Black Rock on Kaanapali Beach, the Sheraton's atmosphere is elegant, yet relaxed. I had booked the cheapest room (garden view) for our family of 4 during Spring break and was pleasantly surprised that we were upgraded to an ocean view on a cliff in building 6 (Hale O Ka Moana). Another bonus was that this building, though a distance from the pool and beach, had its own free parking close by. It had the convenience of a small hotel with the amenities of a first class resort. Although we had to walk and take a couple elevators to get to the pool/beach, the walk was a pleasure with beautiful views everywhere and a peaceful lobby on the eighth floor, open and airy, overlooking the ocean. There was a "kodak moment" at every turn. The pictures that the Sheraton has on their web site do not do justice to the pool which is a beautiful flowing river type made to appear as though it is carved out of lava rock. We appreciated the ambiance of the Sheraton even more after we took a tour of the Marriot timeshare property down the beach. Although their units are very nice, the architecture of the towers has a prison feel and their pool, which is also very beautiful, was so crowded that it gave me a very tense feeling when we were led through it. I was a bit concerned that a regular hotel room would feel cramped and that a condo unit may have been a better choice, however I felt the room we had was spacious enough with a wide entry, ample closet space, microwave and refrigerator. I would recommend that the Sheraton replace the double beds with 2 queens, but the beds were comfortable and not rock hard like most hotel beds. Although our room was on the second floor, it was actually the ground floor due to the cliff. I really preferred this ground floor location since our lanai was not enclosed and we were able to walk out onto the lawn area; it added to the open feeling and we were able to whale-watch from our lanai. The Keka'a Terrace restaurant at the Sheraton had a nice setting but the food was not great and the menu limited. There are much better restaurants nearby at Whaler's Village. I recommend the Hula Grill barefoot area for value and quality and the Lahaina Fish Company on Front Street in Lahaina for very casual dining set over the water and great food. If we get the chance to return to Maui I would not hesitate to stay again at the Sheraton, although it is an older property the style of architecture with multiple separate buildings is far superior to the modern box-like prison structures of most large resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: lizbonne
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton was a great resort. The grounds were beautiful and in a perfect spot along Ka'anapali Beach next to Black Rock. We stayed in building 5 and had a great view of the ocean. I couldn't believe when we snorkled at Black Rock that we only went out about 4 feet and dunked our heads under the water and saw two big puffer fish right by us! It was very convienent just to go from the room down to the beach and snorkel. The pool was huge, yet still had a relaxing feel to it. We ate lunch one day at the Westin Hotel and the grounds were nice too, but seemed more hectic. The Sheraton was beautiful and exceeded our expectations. We are looking forward to returning there again someday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kingsandi
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for a week in late March and early April 2007. We got a really good deal, so I went with few expectations. We were very pleasantly surprised. Staff members were courteous and attentive. The property as a whole was very well kept with nice common/pool areas. My room was relatively clean and well maintained. I'm a gold member with Starwood, so they even upgraded my room after the first night. (If you can, ask for building 2) Both rooms had minor trouble with plumbing...slow drainage. Otherwise, I can't complaint. The hotel is in a great location. Sitting under an umbrella 10 yards from the beach drinking a Pina Colada....It's the closest thing to heaven on earth. Don't forget your snorkling gear.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: dairyq
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Maui from April 2 - 5, 2007. We had a blast there. The resort is beautiful with breathtaking scenery and landscaping. We truly felt like we were in paradise. We were upgraded to an oceanview room upon check-in. The views of the ocean and of Kaanapali beach were unbelievable. We had hot sunny weather during our stay. Most of our trip was spent in Whalers Village, in Lahaina town, or on Kaanapali beach. The snorkeling was great at Black Rock, but we had to get to the beach by 7:30am every morning to beat the crowds (even at that time, there were already people snorkeling in the ocean). We saw many varieties of fish (trigger fish, angelfish, tangs, pufferfish - but unfortunately, no sea turtles). The ocean was quite rough, but that didn't deter people from having a good time. The only drawback was we witnessed a woman having a cardiac arrest right on the beach, and although the paramedics tried CPR on her for 45 minutes, she didn't make it. That was the only negative part of our trip. Dining: We had dinner at Leilani's on the first night and watched the beautiful sunset, it was absolutely gorgeous. We also had lunch at Bubba Gumps in Lahaina (a great experience - we had a window seat by the ocean, and fed fish with the crackers provided at our table). The food was excellent - that was probably our most memorable meal of the entire trip. We also had dinner at Hula Grill twice (also very good food). Try the lava flow drink, it's to die for!! The mandatory resort fee was a rip off to us, as we didn't have a laptop to use for the free internet, and since we took a shuttle, the free parking was pretty much useless to us. Also, if you don't want to pay for the beach chairs and umbrella, you should get to the beach early in the morning and just find a spot on the sand to sit on. We were at the beach by 7:30am every morning, and would leave by 10:00am to go do some shopping in Whalers or in Lahaina. By 10:00, the beach gets very crowded, and the sun can get pretty intense!! Overall, the Sheraton is a great resort, with excellent service and friendly staff. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone looking for a nice place to stay in Maui!!

Reviews.Title: “Picture Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StevieSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We have just gotten back from a wonderful stay at Sheraton Maui. We were there for 4 nights beginning March 29, 2007. I purchased a garden view room and they said they'd upgrade to mountain view free for our anniversary. We actually upgraded to oceanfront instead. Worth it for 1st timers. Everything was beautiful. Concierge was pleasant. We walked along the beach and definately decided this hotel was the prettiest around. Right on the beach. Entertainment was pleasant. I'll have to say we waited twice at the bar a little too long. And the dinner was not good a Ke'Kas, but we still will go back. We'll stay at Ritz Carlton next year because of golf, even though it's not right on the beach. Golf and hotel package is cheaper and hotel is a little more ritzi.

Reviews.Title: “sheraton maui was nice, but...”
Reviews.Author: marccsusm
Reviews.Content: stayed at the sheraton maui in late march 2007. grounds were nice as is expected from most beach front hotels in hawai'i. rooms were recently upgraded, so that was a nice surprise. i had kinda thought the hotel would be dated due to its old age, however, this was not the case. all aspects of hotel were in good shape and clean. restaurants were a ok. ate at all 3 restaurants, nothing to write home about. lots of other places to eat that have nicer atmosphere and better food, all are pricey though, but hey its hawaii. all in all the sheraton is one of the better places to stay. nice hotel, great beach and pool, convenient to all. the only negative is that the daily resort DID NOT include beach chairs. chairs poolside were free of course and we never had a problem finding a place lay out. i don't mind paying a resort fee, as this is the trend to extract extra money from travelers, but give me something for it, the resort fee only provided a daily paper and for $18 a day i would have liked a little something else maybe a mai tai, or use of a beach chair. see the beach chairs are not provided for hotel guests. if you want to sit on a chair on the beach YOU HAVE TO RENT them for $15 a day. i found that insulting, to pay as much as one does to stay at this hotel and to have pay to sit on the beach really irked me, enough so that i personally would not here again. i'd rather pay more somewhere else and get to sit in a chair for free. nothing is worse than when a nice hotel nickles and dimes you. charge me more and stop these lame charges.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Go Back”
Reviews.Author: Divarenee
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at the Sheraton Maui and had a great time. We booked an ocean view room and got upgraded to an ocean front room in building 6. This was a mixed blessing. The long, convoluted walk to get to the restaurants and pool areas was a pain, but the room was lovely and the view was amazing. One morning I sat on the lanai eating breakfast and watched a whole pod of dolphins frolic off of Black Rock, while there was a rainbow--talk about paradise! Next time I think we will request building 3 or 4, though. The pool area was great. We didn't have any trouble finding chairs, and enjoyed the poolside dining (although $14 for a hamburger without fries is pretty ridiculous.) The beach was much nicer and less rocky than in front of the other big hotels, and of course Black Rock has great snorkeling. (We also went to Honolua Bay and also out to Molokini Crater on the Four Winds II, which were both better, but Black Rock is RIGHT THERE. We rented from Maui Dive Shop and were very satisfied with the price and quality of equipment.) My one complaint about the hotel is that the room service breakfast menu is limited to fresh fruit, cereal, oatmeal or pastries. I guess they *really* want you to visit the buffet. (Which we did our first morning and was ok, but nothing special.) We ate in the terrace restaurant one night, which was ok, and also at the teppanyaki restaurant, which was also ok, but nothing special (neither as elegant as one we went to in Kyoto nor as fun as Benihana). We went to the hotel luau one night and had a fine time. Gotta love that kalua pork. Other places in the area we enjoyed included Kimo's and Aloha Mixed Plate in Lahaina, and Leilani's patio at Whaler's Village. The magic show at Warren & Annabelle's in Lahaina was awesome (the parlor show was so-so), and the astronomy program on the roof of the Hyatt was fun, although maybe not quite worth the $55 per couple charge. Surf lessons from Island Scuba & Surf in front of the Marriott were great. After walking up and down the beach and seeing the Hyatt and Westin I was very satisfied with having chosen the Sheraton and would stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it!”
Reviews.Content: Aloha! We stayed here last July and at the time we booked this property (about a year ago) the reviews were so-so. But we felt like a majority of them were from people who sounded like they wouldn't be happy ANYWHERE! We wanted to stay here for the location / snorkeling. The walk down the beach to Whaler's Village in the evenings took no time at all and the room was great. We really didn't eat on the property tho except for lunches by the pool - which were all very good - just pricey! The views were great & the beach was nice, although it did get crowded at both the beach and the pool - we got fresh towels the evening before & went out & snagged our lounge chairs early in the morning. This seemed to be the thing to do - or else you wouldn't have a decent spot later. But overall, we were REALLY PLEASED with this property and would stay there again (this was my 4th trip to Maui).

Reviews.Title: “Paradise! Beautiful Expansive Grounds”
Reviews.Author: paradisedoc
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 enjoyed 8 nights at the Sheraton. The pool and beach were perfect for our 4 &18 month-old! They had a blast spending every day at the pool. We stayed in building 2 on the first floor. This was a perfect location for a young family. When our daughter napped, we would set up our baby monitor, and head to the pool, or hang out with our son on the lawn. If we used our walkie talkie to extend the range, we could go to the beach. Advantages of this hotel: Beautiful expansive and peaceful grounds, that never felt overcrowded despite staying on Kaanapali Beach, Black Rock - with exceptional snorkling - I saw several turtles, a shark, and beautiful fish, great jogging path along the beach, If you like to jump from heights as my husband...black rock is the place! Close proximity to great restaurants, and beautiful beaches. Watching the fire dance and black rock cliff diver at sunset was enjoyable. The restaurants had average food, and the morning buffet was much better at the Westin, and a great deal because kids eat for free. I recommend stocking up at a local market, and going out to some of the premier dining establishments; Sansei for awesome sushi (per my husband), Roy's in Kahana, and David Paul's in Lahaina (We love!). A great plus for us was the guest service manager Ben, who provided wonderful assistance prior, during and after our stay. Our last day as we headed to the airport, we were turned back due to a fire, the airlines put us on the following days flight (at no additional cost), and Ben arranged a room for us upon our return! We were clearly not ready to leave, and how fortunate we were to spend another day in paradise! Can not wait to head back for some quality time with the family and a little relaxation (a little challenge with kids under 5!) Lastly, I would return here without the kids for some R&R, given the quiet and layback feel at the Sheraton in comparison to the hectic, frenetic pace at the Westin, and Hyatt (both beautiful places as well, just not our style.) Another favorite of ours is the Princeville on Kauai (however, last time there in 2004 - it was in dire need of a re-do, and was in the process of new ownership.)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: jule3913
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks in Hawaii in January celebrating our 25th wedding aniversary! We were in Ohau for 2 days mainly to see Pearl Harbor and then we drove around the island. The rest of our stay was at the Sheraton Maui Resort. The grounds were beautiful. Our room was in building 6 on the cliff. Our accommodations were beautiful and the building was very secluded which is what we wanted. You could hear and see the whales from our Lanai. The pools were absolutely beautiful and the beach was the best location along Kaanapali Beach. Snorkeling was great at Black Rock. We saw several sea turtles and lots of fish. They had send champagne up to our room and the concierge was very helpful in giving recommendations and also making reservations for us. The walk along the beach is beautiful. You can walk all the way to the other end and back which takes about 45 min. It is just a real short walk to Whaler's Village where there is a nice shopping area and a lot of restaurants. Our favorite restaurant in Whaler's Village was the Hula Grill. It was fantastic. The town of Lahaina is only a 10 minute drive and there are also several wonderful restaurants there and lots of shopping, art galleries. Would recommend Cheeseburger in Paradise, Pacifico's, Mama's Fishhouse, Hula Grill, Bubba Gumps, We did the Feast of LeLe Luau. Five course meal served by our own waiters at a table on the beach. It was very romantic and more personable. Highly recommend. Book ahear online as it fills up quick. Rent a car and do the Road to Hana trip on your own. What lovely views. Definitely eat at Mama's Fish House! Make reservations. Recommend taking the Trilogy Excursions day trip over to Lanai. Leaves from Lahaina Harbor. It was a great trip and the food was wonderful. Make reservations ahead. The Sheraton has the best beach on the Kaanapali strip area! The staff was wonderful and the resort was very clean. Great Black Rock Mai Tais by the pool! We would definitely go back. Not a lot of families there either which was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location; small room”
Reviews.Author: XPig
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly large resort hotel with a lot going on. We opted for one of the least expensive rooms, but still had a view of the ocean. Asked for adjoining rooms way six weeks ahead of time, but request not honored, apparently because hotel was booked solid. Our room was SMALL, both sleeping area and bath. Pillows much better than average. Nice wide screen TV, but not yet hooked up to HD for network programming. It seemed like outdoor private parties were going on almost every night... no complaint because other guests could see and hear the entertainment. This is a good hotel for families, as there is nice swmming area, a place in the ocean for beginning snorkelers. Beginning hula class. The hotel has its own luau twice a week for extra $. We paid 10$ extra for priority up-front seating. Worth it. Pulled pork from roasted pig was outstanding. Great fire dance. Still suffering from Hawaii sticker shock.

Reviews.Title: “Watch for Whales”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravel1973
Reviews.Content: If you've got the money for a fancy place, there was no better place to stay in my mind than the Sheraton. I was there on business, and it had everything I could need. The room was very well kept, the gym was nice, if not a bit of a challenge to get to, and the staff were very nice. If you're on a budget, this is not the place for you as it was expensive for a water view. But it was worth it since I was there on business.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, nice room, busy pool, busy beach”
Reviews.Author: mbholland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the resort for 3 nights, and must say the room and the buildings in general were good shape. Location is good for walks along the beach, and to do some limited snorkling. Also, there are enough restaurants in walking distance, and enough entertainment without minutes driving distance. The only issue I has was with the overcrowded pool and 'private' beach area. If you were not out by say 10.00 am, it would be very hard to still find a spot at the pool, or a chair at the beach. We might have been there at a busy time, but more likely these facilities are a bit undersized for the size of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing oasis at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: McMax
Reviews.Content: What a terrific place! We had booked the hotel through American Airlines Vacations, and somehow, someway, someone at the hotel figured out we were there for our anniversary. We were upgraded into a deluxe ocean-view room with a balcony (not quite a suite, but it was large). The hotel's facilities are impeccable, and are well-maintained. The pool area, with its lagoons and bridges, was wonderful and very relaxing. The service, from each and every staff member we encountered, was very professional, yet maintained that Hawaiian charm they are famous for. The hotel's location next to Black Rock made it ideal for snorkeling. The water was not the calmest (because of a week of storms), but there were plenty of fish to see. And, the sunsets were amazing. Each day, many people gathered on the beach or near the pool to watch the sun set directly into the sea. This was immediately followed by the cliff-diving ceremony and the lighting of the torches on Black Rock. What was nice was the extra touches the resort had. Each day, they had some Hawaiian cultural offerings. One day, two locals made fishes out of palm fronds. Another day, they had ukelele lessons. One day, they had hula dancers. We didn't try many of the restaurants at the hotel (they were a bit pricey), but we did have a couple lunches at the Pool Bar. The food was good and somewhat reasonably priced. The only (minor) criticism I would have is that the hotel needs a bit more shopping. There's really only one store, and it sells sundries and souvenirs (at somewhat high prices). However, the hotel is within walking distance of the Whaler's Village, and there are lots of restaurants and shops there. Leilani's (the upstairs restaurant, not downstairs bar) has great food, and so does the Hula Grill.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: basketbh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for 2 weeks in February. It was wonderful. The breakfast buffet daily was incredible. We could see whales from the pool area daily. There was a sidewalk along the beach that was a mile and a half that we walked daily. The hotel offered Palates and Yoga and had a good fitness center. We booked the hotel luau that was very good and more intimate than some of the other larger ones. We also booked a 2 hour whale watching cruise and saw numerous whales breaching and blowing and lots of moms and babies. The snorkeling off the beach had turtles and lots of fish. I would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare offer? Take it.”
Reviews.Author: rogerj1
Reviews.Content: This is a great location. We'd been offered half price rooms in conjunction with a promotion from Starwood for the timeshare they're building just up the coast from the Sheraton. Apparently, my family meets the demographics of someone who might buy a timeshare. You pay for the room in advance, they give you $185 off an Avis rental, and gift certificates to use at the restaurants, gift shop, and activity center. Same at the Westin. To get the certificates, you meet with the Starwood rep in the hotel. I met with Christine and she was very enthusiastic and professional. I set an appointment to go see the timeshares and was given $175 in certificates. We didn't make it to the appointment as my wife didn't want to take the time. Had we gone we would have received half of a week stay at any Starwood property in the world. A friend who went said that the presentation was reasonable. They were there about 2 hours. The timeshares offered were priced at around $40k a week. No thanks. I understand the timeshare property is quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: FromNorthJersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a coule of nights using our Starwood points. Overall our experience was just average. First the good things: Its right at the beach, and the views from the central pool area are just awesome. This is pretty much true of all the resorts and hotels on the Lahaina & Kaanapali area of Maui. The rooms were clean, adequately sized and the property had the usual assortment of restaurants and nearby high-end shopping places. Perhaps the best thing was their daily sunset cliff dive celebration - we will remember for long the diver lighting the torches and diving off the cliff, while there was live Hawaiian chants and beautiful dancing on the beach. Now the not-so-good things: We have stayed at many Starwoord properties before, particularly Westin branded resorts. This lacked the "wow" factor. The front desk and other staff were, well, not rude, but clinical. And its a fairly large property with lots of rooms and guests, so you feel kind of crowded. The bathrooms were smaller than other similar resort properties we have been to, and the rooms were a bit old. (We stayed in section 3 in a gardenview room, which basically means that its the cheapest room with views of a walkway.) And there's a increasing tendency of properties to add resort charges ($18.00 per day here) - why cannot they add it to the room rate and be transparent about pricing initially?

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Maui”
Reviews.Author: cttraveling07
Reviews.Content: Spent seven nights at the Sheraton on Maui. We stayed in a standard room overlooking the ocean and grounds. Excellent views, clean, and comfortable. Most of the rooms overlook the ocean, pool, and grounds. Well kept and definately as nice as most of the hotels in the area. Staff is extremely friendly and accommodating which adds to the pleasure of being in a resort-like atmosphere. We agree with several previous reviews that dinners are best had off property and there are several good choices at Whaler's Village or at a few local establishments within driving distance. We did have breakfast daily (as part of our package). Food was very good and the staff did an excellent job as well. The beach is one of the best for swimming, walking and is easily accessible. The hotel is more expensive than a few others but we felt the overall experience was worth it. We would staff there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: josh1231
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton for 1 night in February. It was a pretty nice hotel, but definitely in need of some updating. The staff was very friendly and the grounds were well kept. The pool seems a little small, however the beach is great, way better than the beach at the Hyatt, and for significantly less money. Also the room service was fantastic, although a tad expensive, $120 for a steak, chicken and 2 deserts. Overall a great hotel, if you're looking for spending a little less than the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: pebblebeach46
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights Jan 20-26 and loved the property. This is our 4th visit to Maui and have stayed at the Hyatt previously. While the common areas of the Hyatt are nicer, the views out of the premium ocean front rooms at the Sheraton are far superior than anything found at the Hyatt or any other hotel in Maui. The whales were literally within 150 yards of your deck. The pools and beach were nice, with the best snorkeling right off the beach of the Sheraton. The rooms were fine though nothing special, and restaurants were fairly typical, though we had a great experience at the Japanese restaurant. The only downside(but only because we were in premium ocean front rooms)is that it was quite a hike to all the common elements of the hotel(down an elevator, up a walkway, up an elevator and then walk to go down another elevator). Will definetly go back for the views!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great value (for Maui!)”
Reviews.Author: dogstar88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August of 2006. Had a registration problem at check-in but after that had a very pleasant 4 night stay. Had an oceanview room with a balcony overlooking the pool area and lush grounds. Pool area is great for kids and lounging with a drink. We enjoyed the access to snorkeling here the most with plenty of fish and sea turtles frequenting the Black Rock area just off the beach. Proximity to beach, resort areas and restaurants made this a great value compared to other hotels and condos in the Lahaina area. Would not recommend dining in the hotel restaurant, just walk down the beach to the Whaler resort area for some great restaurant choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: SteveMavsFan
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, best spot on the beach. There a number of hotels along this stretch of beach but this one is has the best spot. It is right at Black Rock which is a lava flow going into the ocean. It makes for excellent snorkeling right there. The hotel itself has very nice. Rooms where a good size and had free internet. They has had affordable valet parking ($5/day) but plenty of free parking if you wanted to walk some. Food was overpriced but you are in Maui so thats true everywhere but $25 for a burger and fries is still silly. Service was slightly slow but thats life on paradise.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: littlett
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Hawaii. Stayed at the Sherator Maui. Great location and wonderful beach. Can snorkel from there. Just a few problems. When we arrived we were told that we had been upgraded, however the room had 2 double beds-not a king as requested. Told them it was unacceptable. They found us a king room, but no lanai-only 1 1/2 ft wide balcony, but with a great view-mountains, golf course and ocean. The bar has nothing going on and the music was terrible. Staff very friendly. Would stay there again if I can be assured of a lanai.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Happy King
Reviews.Content: We stayed the prime week at the Sheraton Maui (Dec 22-28) and I must say I was VERY pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Starting from the check-in through the rooms, concierge, pools, beach - everything was great. ROOMS: We had a regular garden view room booked and upon check-in tried to upgrade with no luck. Although, the check-in desk did try and do their best (for 15 mins trying all floors and buildings) to get us upgraded - hey, it was holiday season!! PROs: Spacious, comfortable, clean, well-appointed. Small empty refrig., two double beds (Sheraton Sweet Sleeper but I still prefer the Westin Heavenly beds), spacious (but not very private) balcony. Marbled bathroom was also large and in good condition. Room service was responsive. CONs: View (was not really garden). Entertainment (TV) was not up to par. POOLS: The pool itself is large and divided into small sections - all connected by "rivers". Waterfalls and a small 6 ft. slide are to be found while you meander the waters. There is a children's (Keiki) pool on one side (1.5 ft) connected to the larger pool, which is where we camped every morning. There is also an "adults" section (although it wasn't restricted to adults) with an 8ft deep end. PROs: Large pool hence uncrowded, ample lounge chairs under sun and shade, courteous and friendly pool attendants, enough supply of towels and swim rental equipment. CONs: Cold water (approx 68F), pool service desk closes by 5 PM (gets less busy - at least in the winter, so don't blame them; pool open until late), swim rental equipment pricey (be sure to bring your own snorkeling gear and inflatables), lounge chairs - although enough - were the regular strap type (Westin had cushioned with pillows - ah!), beach chairs and umbrella rentals pricey ($35/day) and always booked, ditto for poolside cabanas ($75/day) - so book in advance of getting here. BEACH: The beach is beautiful. There is some erosion, but it was fabulous. Black Rock (Lava runoff into the ocean) is right off the Sheraton on one end. The snorkeling at Black Rock is really nice - don't have to take the boat to Molokini and waste time driving to the pier and all of that. It's available to you right here. I rented a window boogie board (had a clear plastic see-thru window on the top end of the board) and took my little kids over to see the fish and sometimes, turtles. It's literally 50-100 ft. out where the fish are plenty and visible. And water is MUCH warmer than the pool - not Caribbean warm, but was probably 75F. OTHER HOTEL SERVICES: KIDS ACTIVITIES - although there was no Kids' club, there were enough activities around the pool to keep the kids busy. Hourly lessons varied thru the entire week - Ukulele (hawaiian guitar) lessons, hula dance, coconut husking and weaving, painting, coconut leaf crafts. There were also pool races and treasure/scavenger hunts, etc. with some very nice prizes. LUAU - every Wednesday. $80/adult, $40/child 6 and over. Would rate it B or B+. But get there at least 1 hour prior to just stand in line else you end up sitting at the back. Ample buffet style food and set drinks for open bar (no martinis available!) CONCIERGE - very helpful and the two of them are also very busy. Also found the vacations desk in the lobby helpful with information on the island. TENNIS - two courts behind building 3 - stay here if you plan on tennis. GOLF - Kaanapali Golf course offers discounts for Sheraton guests - must show room key. Golf course grounds (2 of the tees) opposite hotel. PARKING - $5/day for valet (1st night free). Ample free parking but parking structures near entrance to resort and behind buildings 1 and 2. Smaller parking lot near bldg 3 and 4 - very convenient. Not sure about the other buildings. GROUNDS - Well-kept and immaculate but not as much flora as you would expect. Koi fish ponds near the main building (housing Kekaa restaurant and lobby, shops, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Better location than the Hyatt and Westin”
Reviews.Author: STC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui November 26 â€“ 29, 2006. The Sheraton has the best location because itâ€™s at the end of the walk way, adjacent to Black Rock. That means you donâ€™t have all the guests staying at the Hyatt, Westin and the condominiums walking by all day. The Whalers Village shopping center is about two-hundred yards away by beach sidewalk, which is very convenient and a lot of fun. The Sheraton seemed less crowded than the Westin and Hyatt because it has more land on the beach. And, because of Black Rock, the beach is better protected so thereâ€™s more sand. The food and service was fine, but nothing really special. We were on a tour, and they are very good handling tour groups. One day, we took the launch over to Lanaâ€™i. We saw both the Four Seasons â€œLodgeâ€� and the Four Seasons Manele Bay. Weâ€™ll go to Lanaâ€™i on our next Hawaiian vacation. Honolulu and even Maui are too crowded for us.

Reviews.Title: “The right choice for the right kind of travelers”
Reviews.Author: AGoldie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 nights nights at the Sherton in October (during the earthquake). Prior to making our reservation directly with the hotel (a better $ deal), I read about all the properties on Kaanapali on Tripadvisor. In the end, I narrowed it down to the Hyatt, Westin and Sheraton. Overall, I was very happy with my selection. The Sheraton clearly has the best beach of all the other resorts in the area. Large, clean, plenty of space for playing both in the water and in the sand. Located at the end of the Kaanapali walkway, there weren't a lot of people constantly walking buy, giving you a sense of being close to the action, but not in the middle of it. The Westin is located right next to Whalers Village, but the constant foot-traffic and narrow beach take away from the Maui feel. The Hyatt property looked amazing, but it was located at the other end of the Kaanapali walk-way, on a very narrow strip of beach. You'd have to take a walk with all of your gear each day if you wanted to spend it out on the beach. In the end, if you plan on being on the beach the majority of the time, the Sheraton is the ONLY choice for you. If you plan on spending all your time at the pool, the Sheraton is still a great choice, but the Westin and Hyatt have superior pools. (Size, detail, etc.) While the Sheraton's pool isn't the most dynamic, the location away from the walking trail gives you more privacy than the other two hotels I mentioned. As previously mentioned in other posts, buying the book "Maui Revealed" really is the best first step toward planning your vacation. We stopped at KMart as soon as we landed and picked up water, beer and other snacks to keep in our hotel. With the high food prices at the resort, we were very happy that we did this. We also rented our snokle gear at the Maui Dive Shop in Whalers Village for about $25 a week - MUCH cheaper than the prices as the resorts and very convenient location for pick-up and return. So in the end, as a young couple (not on our honeymoon), we truly enjoyed the Sherton. While the rooms (and gym) were just average (and we didn't get an upgrade, even as Starwoods Rewards members) the expansive grounds and ideal location create a peaceful Maui getaway, just minutes away from all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach!”
Reviews.Author: nuanda
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights @ the Sheraton last week and enjoyed our visit. Like other reviewers, we were also upgraded upon arrival to an ocean front room. The hotel isn't extraordinary, it's a Sheraton. The rooms have nice furnishings and a convenient mini fridge. The bathroom is a little small and lacks a fan. They had recently painted the hallway, and the baseboards were missing and the carpet was a bit dodgy. There is a mandatory $18/day resort charge which covers self parking, in room internet and daily newspaper (Maui News?). A bit of a scam really. Beach chairs/umbrellas are $30/day. Also bummed to discover the "fun" introductory scuba lessons mentioned in the newsletter were $100. The beach is fabulous; large, clean, and has a great view. You can easily run/walk along the beach for a good mile-plus. Morning yoga in Bldg 6 overlooking the ocean was excellent. The pool was cold, but beautiful as it meandered through the grounds. Around 3pm each day, a singer/guitarist serenaded everyone from a poolside hut. Nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME hotel; on the best part of the best beach in west maui”
Reviews.Author: ADSFCA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the sheraton 12/3-12/9/06 and got an incredible deal on the hotel's website. $199/night for a mountain view room, but we were upgraded to an ocean FRONT room upon check-in...I have no idea why. Drive-up check-in took all of 15 seconds. The room was great, the view amazing, the grounds of the hotel beautiful. We were in building 6, and our room faced a small island off the coast of maui, as well as a beach just north of kaanapali...building six is in a more secluded location, and just a bit of a walk to the other parts of the resort, but really no complaining here. The hotel's beach is gorgeous...which is really what matters most. The Sheraton's beach has the widest expanse of sand of all the hotels of the kaanapali resort area, plus it has black rock, which was great for snorkeling. Good mix of honeymooners, families w/kids, and other guests. Very mellow atmosphere. At around 3/4pm they have live hawaiian music which they pipe out to the beach...awesome way to see the sun go down. I did not check out the shops or any of the restaurants, but I did drink and eat at the outside bars. Good fish 'n chips, but the wraps are a rip-off. By law, no alcohol's allowed on the beach, but no one on staff bugged us when we took our my mai tai's and beers there. I took the path that goes down the length of kaanapali by all the other hotels/resorts, and the sheraton's location and beach is truly unbeatable. I would go back here in a heartbeat (especially if I could get that same price).

Reviews.Title: “Treated like family”
Reviews.Author: MusicTraveler
Reviews.Content: I'm a Starwood Platinum member, so I expect to be treated well at their properties, but the Sheraton Maui went way beyond what we expected. Joanna at the front desk was marvelous, as was Vince at the bell desk. We were settled in quickly, taken care of graciously, and very satisfied with the amenities and location. My only two minor negative comments would be that charging for beach chairs is not something we've experienced at other resorts, and for golfers I'll tell you to avoid the Kaanapali South course if you're after a true Hawaiian golf experience. The course has been upgraded, but the holes along the highway are noisy and have overhanging wires. That isn't really related to the Sheraton though, that property is one I will definitely return to and my family loved it! The beach and snorkeling were great, and we ended our final day swimming with the largest green sea turtle I've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Honeymood at Maui”
Reviews.Author: Grija01
Reviews.Content: We saved up for a couple of years so we could go first class to Hawaii, most every common man's dream vacation (I mean that in the generic sense). Well we (my wife and I) did go first class, and the Sheraton was no exception. When we arrived, they told us that our original room (partial view) was not ready, so they had upgraded us to a water view suite. Right off the bat they impressed us. The pool was wonderful to swim in, around and under bridges, bars, etc. Great fun for kids too. We ate in a number of the restaurants, from high-end to sitting at the bar. Food was excellent, albeit a little on the pricey side. Hawaii is not the place to think cheap. Cliff diving was extraordinarily beautiful with the sunset. The warm tropical breeze made the beaches comfortable - we spent hours there just letting Hawaii wipe away all our little problems, concerns, and everyday obstacles. I had an open air massage, wonderfully calming and only $80 plus a generous tip.

Reviews.Title: “felt very special here -- will return”
Reviews.Author: SherryH
Reviews.Content: We traveled here on an invitation! Wow, we loved this resort. It is "the awesomest". The gardens are spectacular, the views from the rooms are great, it is right on the best snorkel beach on the West side of Maui, shopping in Lahaina is closeby. There are grocery stores closeby (have to drive a few minutes). The staff were extremely helpful. We didn't like the double bed they gave us, they told us they were full. But, next day, they accommodated our wishes and put us in a room with a king bed. The rooms are clean and beautifully furnished. Each room has a little mini frig too besides the normal coffee maker etc... The hotel also has lots of coin-op laundry facilities for guests! The food here is expensive in the restaurant, but definitely worth the experience. I bought some plastic bowls and spoons, cereal & milk and oj at the grocery store nearby and had breakfast on our lanai every morning!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: jlutzky
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Sheraton Maui resort for a week around Thanksgiving weekend. My wife and I have two daughters, ages seven and four. Because of this we booked an Ohana Suite. When we got to the Sheraton and Valeted (first day free, $5/day thereafter) we were directed straight to the bell desk where they had our check in materials already ready even though we were there slightly before check in time. We were taken straight to our room. All the Ohana suites are in building one, which is the closest building to the lobby. The Ohana suites are perfect for families with young kids. The bedroom has two double beds, and the main room has a family room area, and the Murphy bed is comfortable and easy to pull down from the wall. Plus the room has a medium sized refrigerator, plus a microwave. The main room has a large walk in closet, so there's plenty of room to store your bags once you unpack. The bathroom is huge, with a separate toilet , plus a bath with shower and a separte solo shower. The location is also key. The rooms are right next to the kids pool, which our youngest loved. Our room was on the ground floor, which meant we were roughly 20 feet from the pool, and we had an ocean view also. The pool is nicely set up with the kids pool on one end, which leads to a winding "river" which ultimately opens to the main large pool. This way most of the guests with kids are on one end of the pool area, and anyone who wants to avoid families can. The Sheraton's other main selling point is the beach. They probably have the best beach on Kaanapali of any hotel. The water was actually warmer in the ocean than at the pool, although both were plenty warm. We rented a beach cabana one day to try and stay out of the sun a little, and that worked out great. Food was only OK at the hotel. We had the breakfast buffet most days. For just two people it's a little pricey ($22/person) but since kids eat free for a family of four it's a decent deal. We also ate at Tappan Dan's for dinner one night, which is basically a Benihanna type of restaurant, and was pretty good. For lunch you can get burgers, hot dogs and sandwiches pool side, although they're a little expensive. Whalers village is only a short walk down the beach, so we spent a lot of time there. Bottom line, the Sheraton is a great option if you're planning on spending some time on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Just Keeps Getting Better!”
Reviews.Author: 2TropicalDivers
Reviews.Content: Before I get into the review, I urge anyone planning a trip to Maui to buy the book "Maui Revealed." It will not steer you wrong and you will be so happy with your trip to Maui...even if it's not your first visit!!! It will be the best $16 you'll ever spend on getting ready for a trip! Now the hotel review: This was our 4th visit to Maui and our 3rd time at the Sheraton. We decided to try a different hotel on our 3rd trip and were so disappointed that we went back to the Sheraton this time! If you love the beach, snorkeling, or diving and can splurge, then this may be the resort for you! You cannot beat the location--it's right on Black Rock on Ka'anapali beach...amazing snorkeling and diving basically right outside your door. The lagoon-style pool is fantastic too (and there's a nice children's area as well). The resort is pretty spread out so you end up doing a lot of walking, but the grounds are absolutely gorgeous, and my husband and I enjoyed our strolls through the grounds and on the beachfront sidewalk down to Whaler's Village. Try to get an ocean front room in building 4 (Hale Nalu)...you will not be disappointed! The rooms are very spacious and the beds are very comfortable--they have upgraded the mattresses since our first trip in 2000. Eat there only if you must--the food is OK, but there are so many other places in Maui to get a fabulous meal (hint, hint...get the Maui Revealed book!) that it would be a shame to spend your money at the Sheraton any more than is absolutely necessary. The Sheraton is pricey overall, and there is a ridiculous resort fee of about $17 a day...but hey, you're in paradise! We'll be back again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can I give this 6 stars??!! THE BEST HOTEL IN MAUI!”
Reviews.Author: MelinDallas
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best ALL around hotel on the entire island of Maui. We go once a year to Maui and have stayed at the outrigger, westin, kaanapali alii, and the ritz, but Sheraton Maui is the best hotel! We always wished we stayed here. The location is awesome. It is situated near black rock which is where you want to be. Snorkeling, beautiful waves, great piece of sandy beach. People from all over the island know to come to this beach! The pool is nice too... It's quite large and there's a lazy river that runs throughout the pool area. You have to fight for chairs sometimes, but just wake up early - dont sleep your vacation away! Lahaina is by far the best town in Maui for shopping and food. The Sheraton is so close and there's even have a trolley that will take you the mile or so down the road. Also, they upgraded us to one of the two top suites for only $100 more a night. This room is usually nearly 1k a night, but we only paid $400 for it. This is a bargain if you know how expensive other average rooms cost. We were right on top of black rock! We are owners at the Westin Ocean Resort & Villas, but we have a very nice place in our hearts for the Sheraton. It is ideal for everyone. Don't screw up and reserve somewhere else--you will end up coming to the Sheraton and wishing you had stayed there. Also go to Bubba Gump and go to Lanai with Trilogy Tours. [--] Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: rain2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maui where we celebrated our 1yr anniversary. I had purchased the nights through Priceline, and paid $210 per night. Since we had checked in late in the day, the only room available was a mountainview with two double beds (even though I had requested a king previously). We were told to check back in the morning, which we did, and they were able to upgrade us to a ocean view king room for the remaining four nights. The room had a great view and was nice, but in my opinion wasn't super clean. The resort grounds are beautiful and the Sheraton is in a great location. We had a geat time, but my main two complaints would be the carpet in the hallways and the pool. As people have previously noted, the carpets are gross and really need to be replaced. The pool is nice and big, but had gross stuff floating in it everyday. I would only put my feet in. I think when we go back I would rather stay at the Westin. Their grounds are smaller, but the rooms are newer and the pool chairs are the cushioned kind. Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon heaven”
Reviews.Author: clio2006
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel having read the reviews on this site, and I'm glad we did. There is a bit of pressure to make sure your honeymoon is your best holiday ever or you feel a bit cheated - but this hotel lived up to it! We got upgraded on arrivial to a beautiful ocean view room. The staff are wonderful, and extremely genuine and helpful. In fact they are the best kind of American's I think we've ever met! The people on Maui are just as nice. We took trips to the ABC in the Whalers village daily as a cheap alternative to hotel food (bit expensive) and had breakfast on the balcony every morning. The local town is a $1 bus trip away and definately worth a trip if only for the restaurants (food at the resort is pretty bland and tasteless) and bars. A truely relaxing visit, its only a shame its unlikely we will get the chance to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: From-the-desert
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui in June 2006, to celebrate our anniversary and my husband's 40th birthday. From the moment we pulled up to the Sheraton, we were treated to the best service. The Sheraton staff unloads your car, whisks your bags off to your room, and checks you in within minutes. Use the valet service - it is worth the $5 daily charge to not have to walk to and from the garage, and they are very quick to bring your car. Our room was fabulous, the bed comfortable, and enough space to stretch out. I cannot say enough about the staff at the Sheraton - always a smile on their face and an aloha. Remember - you are on an island in the middle of the Pacific Ocean - it is going to be humid and a bit musty - it's paradise, not the desert. The beach is breathtaking, and the views are spectacular from every room (even the mountains views). The best deals can be found at Whalers Village a short walk down the beach path - breakfast at Rusty Harpoon is delicious, the view incredible, and much cheaper than the buffet at the Sheraton. For sandwiches and casual dinner, eat downstairs at Leilanis. YUM!! The burgers and fish tacos are amazing. Keep your receipt and the next day you get a free slice of Hula Pie (huge - enough to share)!! If you're looking for cocktails, there are several happy hour specials at the Rusty Harpoon and Leilanis that can't be beat. There is so much to do on Maui, but we can't say enough for just taking it easy and relaxing. Overall, we would go back to the Sheraton over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Been Happier”
Reviews.Author: KAJ7481
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 nights at the Sheraton as part of our honeymoon. We had booked a mountainview room and when we checked in, we were told they had us in a room with 2 separate beds...not exactly what 2 honeymooners want to hear! The staff right away helped us and we wound up getting upgraded (at no extra cost) to an ocean view delux room. The room was beautiful and very clean. The view was breathtaking. The pool is very nice; almost like a lazy river, complete with waterfalls. The daily buffet breakfast was fantastic and the grounds of the hotel are beautiful. We were both extremely happy with the Sheraton and would recommend it in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “We thought the Sheraton was terrific!”
Reviews.Author: Slix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton between Oct 21-28, 2006 and loved it. We had an oceanview room in building 2 that overlooked the ocean lawn, as well as providing a lovely view of the ocean and the island of Lanai. Check in was simple, right at curbside. They even wished us a happy anniversary! We were given leis and escorted with our luggage to the room, the bellman stopping here and there to point of things of interest. The Our front door faced the West Maui Mountains, and below us was the self-parking lot which made things easy for us when we wanted to go somewhere. A few minutes after checking in, the bellman returned with a bottle of complimentary champagne to celebrate our anniversary. Inside the room we had a good-sized safe, coffeemaker with Kona coffee, and refrigerator. There were complimentary robes for our use while we were there. The bathroom was nice. The king-sized bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in! The lanai wasn't large, but there was plenty of room for the table and two chairs there, and sitting there in the morning, listening to the birds, the rolls of the ocean and whisper of the palms became one of my favorite things to do. Housekeeping was good. Never had a problem with them at all. On the morning of our anniversary we left very early to see the sunrise at Haleakala, and when we returned, they must've noticed the anniversary cards on the dresser because they draped our leis nearby in the shape of a heart--a very sweet touch. The grounds are lovely, right on Ka'anapili Beach, at Black Rock. Great snorkeling there. We rented a cabana one day and a gazebo by the pool another day. The pool is a lazy lagoon, beautiful and relaxing, with separate areas for the kiddies and adults. The meandering turns often left you in secluded spots where you felt like you were the only ones there. Plenty of lounge chairs, though if you want a particular spot, you'd best go down early. Poolside service for the bar and food was good too. The cliff diving ceremony at sunset is a wonderful touch. We managed to catch it twice during our stay. Our package included the breakfast buffet, which turned out to be a good deal since it normally runs about $23 a person. Since it was included, we took full advantage of it--and to be fair, it was very good. The restaurant where you sit is open and right near the Koi pond, with more beautiful views. The only thing we didn't like about the Sheraton was having to go home. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Stay”
Reviews.Author: TexDudL
Reviews.Content: In short, this hotel was not tolerable. Our room was not cleaned until late each evening. We were forced to hang clean clothes outside (even clothes we had not yet worn on the trip) because the humidity in the room was so bad. Couldn't get away from the stale smell and overall dampness. Our neigbors could be heard snoring through the walls at night. The staff was not particularly friendly. The pool area and beach were overoccupied, especially with locals. (The hotel allows non-guests to use the resort). I felt uncomfortable with the staff. No one seemed to care about making us feel welcome. My husband and I actually left after two nights and stayed elsewhere for the remainder of our trip. Needless to say, the Sheraton would not refund our money for the days we had payed for in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to get Maui'ed”
Reviews.Author: Matt-Reviews
Reviews.Content: Our stay was in late October 2006. We got a terrific deal due to a special package offered by Starwood Vacations. They lured us with an incredible price in the hopes that we would take the tour of their new Vacation Ownership (aka TIMESHARE) resort up the road next to the Westin. We were under absolutely no obligation to do so, but did anyway since we got some great additional incentives. The package was for 5 nights, but we added an extra night at regular rates because we wanted more time on the island. There was absolutely no hassle in doing this. TIP: Join the Starwood Preferred Guest Program (for FREE!) and you will get a discount on the room rate! When we arrived, we were told that we had been upgraded to an Ocean View room, but it had two double bed, and there was no way they could find us another room that night (it was 10:15 PM). We took it the first night, but decided that we really wanted to share a bed since this was a romantic getaway. We were moved to a garden view room, which was fine since we live near the beach in Southern California and didn't care about seeing the water. Unfortunately, there was a problem with the air conditioner in this room (3129) which left the room very humid and smelling of mildew. We were moved to our final room (3501), which had a problem with the air conditioner staying on 100%, making it way too cold, and the toilet SCREAMING when the water was filling the tank. A call to maintenance got both the problems resolved within the two hours that we were out of the room on a shopping trip. TIP: Stock up on drinks and snacks at the 24 hour Safeway in Lahaina, 10 minutes away. The only problem that couldn't be solved was the fact that we were right next to the elevator, so starting at 5:45 AM it got noisy. Also, we could hear water running in adjacent (above and below) rooms through the pipes all hours day and night. All of the staff members were extraordinarily nice except for the front desk person who made our last room change. We stated our problems with the room very clearly and without making any demands whatsoever, but she acted as though she was doing us a great favor ("Someone else that is arriving today is supposed to have that room, so you had better go check it to make sure it is ok." - why even tell us that we were taking someone's room?). As we walked through the halls and walkways we were always greeted as we passed by staff members. We definitely felt like guests, not customers. The quality of the room was excellent. The bed was very comfortable. The showers have adjustable massage or spray action and the water pressure is more than adequate. The bath is a shower/tub combo. In the standard rooms the toilet is in the bathroom, as well as a single sink. The bathroom was always well stocked with towels, soaps, and shampoo, and is equipped with a makeup mirror and hair dryer. Missing from the bathroom is a ventilation fan, the addition of which would reduce steam and other bathroom problems. The furnishings were adequate in number and quite comfortable. The closet was large enough for our needs, but since we brought too many articles of clothing, we had to call down to order and extra dozen hangers, which were delivered quickly. The in-room (in the closet) safe mounted to the floor was huge - I stored my 15.4" widescreen laptop and digital SLR camera comfortably with plenty of room to spare. On our small lanai there was a small round table with broken glass and only one chair. The higher you go in floor, the smaller the lanai (the ground floor room lanai was big enough to host a small party). The grounds of the hotel are beautiful and for the most part well maintained. Honestly, we didn't have a chance to experience them much since we were always out enjoying the island. On our last day there we laid out by the pool, actually on a lawn between the pool and beach access. We were able to have a bit of room around our lounge chairs, but we felt very lucky to find any in proximity of the pool. TIP: Get to the pool by 10:00. Be warned that while you can place personal articles on lounges to reserve them, the staff may remove the articles if the lounges do not look like they have been used for more than two hours. This is to be fair to other guests. As noted by others, the hotel tacks on an additional $17.77 per night resort fee for things that should be included anyway - local phone calls, the privilege of self-parking, and high-speed internet access (via a network cable in each room; it works well, by the way. I found one open WiFi access point but never got it to do anything interesting.). Valet parking is an additional $5 per day, first night free. If you are going to self park during your stay BE SURE TO TELL THE FRONT DESK or you will be charged the daily valet fee. We ate dinner in the Keka'a Terrace hotel restaurant one night, and we a bit taken back by the $78 tab for appetizers only, plus one $7 glass of wine, especially since we didn't think the quality was particularly good, definitely not good enough to justify the price. The dinner entrees are also quite pricey. We had lunch at the same restaurant on our last day and were VERY happy with the food and the price. TIP: Eat dinner elsewhere (unless you are going for the prime rib buffet, which we didn't try), but do try lunch, especially the Hawaiian Plate Lunch. My mouth is watering just writing about it. There are entertainers all around from mid morning until late evening. You will find a variety of activities including family-friendly outings and nighttime SCUBA dives right off the beach in front of the hotel. Snorkeling off Black Rock is FANTASTIC. TIP: Don't settle for looking at the fish where everyone else is floating, Swim out past the point where the crazy kids are cliff diving and go around to the right. You'll thank me. Note that it can get a little rough out there, so don't try it if the surf on the beach is high or if the waves seem somewhat violent on the shore. TIP: If you are not going to snorkel but want to swim in the ocean, move at least 100 yards down the beach from Black Rock to avoid some of the big rocks in the waist-deep water. The only real downside to this location is the loooong drive to get to activities on the rest of the island. Honolua Bay, 25 minutes. Kihei (great place to leave for SCUBA or snorkeling at Molokini) 45 minutes. Starting point of Hana Highway, 35-40 minutes. Kahului Airport 35-45 minutes. Haleakala, 1 hour 15 minutes with minimal traffic. Snorkeling from the beach in the areas south of Wailea, 60-90 minutes. Ok, enough of that. What you should expect: Clean, comfortable accomodations on beautiful, mostly quiet grounds at a price that can stretch some budgets but is easily justified. Rest and relaxation. Classic Sheraton service. What not to expect: Leaving with your wallet full of cash. :o)

Reviews.Title: “Reliably good”
Reviews.Author: JLongo
Reviews.Content: Just back from our third stay at the Sheraton. As a Starwood guest, we debate each visit between the Westin and Sheraton. Being at the end of Kaanapali beach, the Sheraton has a bit less foot traffic than the Westin. There are a lot of people who trek to the snorkeling at Black Rock, the beach at that end was VERY crowded one day when we were there. But the Westin is closer to Whalers Village and people always seem to be wandering around the pools. The walk down to Whalers Village is nice, and the Hula Grill is a great place to get acclimated to the island cocktails and food. The staff at Sheraton were great during the recent earthquake and power outtage, they maintained as many services as they could. This is a great family resort and honeymooners. We ran into several who loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, almost all good...!”
Reviews.Author: worldtripper
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Sheraton at 9:30 PM Oct. 14, and had booked on Priceline. I emailed the hotel and inquired about an upgrade since it was our 20th anniversary trip. ROOM: Perfect location for us: Third floor in building three. Our balcony over looked the lawn, pool and ocean. We loved it! The had chilled champagne in the room, nice! The room was nice, the bathroom was just "ok". The corridor carpet was so dirty! It looked like a bus terminal. I was so surprised. POOL: Nice and cold! They might have just filled it since they worked on it recently. We loved floating in the 'lazy river' and listening to the Hawaiian music. Lounge chairs were very crammed together. We didn't like how close and tight this was. Food, we had dinner one night there, it was nice. EARTHQUAKE: Our first morning we awoke to the earthquake. The hotel did not tell us anything, or warn us or tell us to get out of the building. The electriciy went out and we dressed and went down to breakfast. We watched for a tsunami....we couldn't watch CNN or did we know anything!!! No one came around and told us anything. Cell phones didn't work for about an hour. I thought the hotel could have been more helpful. Second night: At 2am? over the loud speakers we were told to leave our rooms for an "emergency". We dressed quickly and filed out of the hotel along with 300 other guests. No employees were around. We all went to the hotel entrance in front and waited. NO employees were there to tell us the Emergency! NOTHING. My husband and I and three others walked back up to the lobby and my husband demanded that the hotel tell us what was going on! NO employee came out and told us anything. This was horrible. All of these women with crying babies and old women in their robes scared to death. We just walked back to our room and went back to bed. Just as we drifted back to sleep over the loud speaker, "Please return to your rooms". The next day a letter from the hotel appriciated our 'patience" and did NOT apoligize. The Sheraton TOTALLY lacked any leadership in these two emergency situations. I might stay here again if the price is right. The beach location was great, but you have to pay for chairs on the beach. Overall, not bad, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: janeavril
Reviews.Content: We were in Maui to get married and start our honeymoon, and we stayed at the Sheraton. Everything was great. The hotel was very nice, the grounds were beautiful, the pool was great. The location of this hotel simply can not be beat. Very convenient to the other hotels, restaurants and shopping on Kaanapali Beach, and absolutely the best spot on the beach to swim and snorkel. We saw sea turtles right off of the beach! The food was good, although expensive ($23 pp for a breakfast buffet seems extreme to me), and the drinks were great. We used the pool bar a lot- excellent place to grab a drink or a light lunch. The rooms were very nice and clean. The resort did not seem overly crowded, which was nice. I would love to stay here again, given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great experience, I would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: gjako
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton Maui for 6 nights from Oct 13 through Oct 18 celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. I had reserved a deluxe ocean front room, requesting a king size bed through Costco Travel. Calling the hotel direct I was given the impression that a deluxe ocean front room would be in building 6 on the black rock overlooking the ocean, but when we arrived we were given room in building 5 with two double beds with our balcony overlooking part of the building 6 parking lot with the ocean visible beyond. I called the front desk about our room and they indicated that the king size bed was just a request and that they would see what they could do. They were able to move us the following day to a room in building 6, with a king size bed. In our opinion the room in building 5 was not comparable to the buiild 6 room. In fact it looked like our room was meant to be a kids room that was next door to a larger room, where there was one door to access both rooms, and each room had also had its own key access. Once move to our new room we were satisfied, we we on the second floor and had a great view of the ocean and could hear the wave crash against the shore. We kept the balcony door open at night and the waves were almost too loud. Our room was nice and clean with a refrigerator and microwave. Note that it takes a little to get oriented at the Sheraton with its large property layout. From our room on the second floor of bldg 6, we had to go up one floor take a walkway about a 15 yards, take an elevator up to the 8th floor, and walk about 20 more yards to another elevator that we then took down to the first floor to get to the pool, beach, or breakfast across the lawn. We were in our room when the earthquake hit at about 7am, and everytining shaked quite a bit for a few seconds, but nothing fell off the wall or off a table. The hotel lost power immediately after the earthquake and didn't get it back unitl about 1:00pm. While power was out our electronic room keys still worked and the elevators worked. I thought the Sheraton handled the earthquake and power outage fairly well, as they we able to still serve breakfast. We had the breakfast buffet included in our hotel package and though it was well worth it (the normal charge was $25 per person). It included; the ability to have a custom made omelet, pancakes, waffles (some days), french toast (some days),scamble eggs, sausage, eggs benedict, pastries, fresh fruit, and more. In though the food was very good. We did not eat at any of the other hotel restaurants. We ate our first night at the Hula Grill, had a great view (which you pay for since almost all the entrees were over $30 and the food was only ok.). We also went to the Old Lahaina Luau, whose entertainment was great, but I thought the food was only OK. We ate at the I'O restuarant on 505 Front street in Lahaina which has a good ocean view from the outside patio, and the food was fantastic, but the bill for me and my wife was over a $100. We also ate at BJ's Chicago Pizza in Lahaina and had a great time; the food was good and reasonable, they had good entertainment; someone playing a guitar and singing mostly oldies with the rest of the music synthesized. I also was initially informed that half of the hotel pool was going to be renovated at the time of our stay, but was pleased to see that all work was completed. We though the pool was great., with its lagoon design connecting the adult pool area with the childrens area by a winding river passage. The Sheraton is on the widest part of a nice beach, but it is not the best swimming beach for kids, since the depth drops off pretty fast and the waves can be pretty big that break next to the shoreline. Overall my wife and I had a great time at the Sheraton, enyoying the pool, beach, and the spacious property layout.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 3 nights!”
Reviews.Author: kristybrules
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Maui is all they say it is - its a great property and a good quality Sheraton. The grounds are beautiful - the only downfall was the pool was under contstruction over half was blocked off - but when it is completed it will be awesome. The staff was very friendly and helpful - no one ever judged you should you not leave a big enough tip or no tip at all. The rooms are nice - clean and roomy. We were upgraded to a oceanview deluxe suite and the view is to die for. The jump off the black rock at night is well worth seeing. The beach area can be really windy and medium waves - enough to knock you off your feet if you are not expecting it. I would suggest to take beach shoes if you are squeemish at all about whats touching your toes in the ocean...The walkway down the coast from the Sheraton takes you to a bunch of other properties and a shopping plaza inbetween them all - its a nice stroll along the ocean. Its a good quality resort and I would definately stay here again. I wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: MauiAug06
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 days at Sheraton for our wedding/honeymoon in September. We had an ocean front suite in building 6. It's the top floor corner suite facing both Kaanapali beach and Malokai with Black Rock right below our balcony.
