The suite came equipped with one giant bathroom plus a second bathroom, living room, and a sink area. On the balcony, we have two deluxe lounge chairs (in which we spent a few nights sleeping outdoor). The hotel is clean, but everything is expensive as expected at a resort. The downside of our stay is the remodeling of pool. One trade-off with building 6 is the long walks and multiple elevator changes to get to, but you get your privacy for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tingram16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui for our honeymoon. We had reserved a garden view room and we were upgraded to an ocean front king suite. It was amazing! The staff at the front desk was very friendly. We didnt even ask to be upgraded. The hotel was clean, the pool was great...the beach was terrific too. We stayed here for half of our trip and at the Westin Villas for the other half of our trip... Sheraton was my favorite. If you are not sure if you want to book a room here or not....I would say just do it. Before my trip I read good and bad reviews and wasnt sure if I would like it or not. I must say....I am glad that I didnt pass it up.

Reviews.Title: “overrated”
Reviews.Author: jason97045
Reviews.Content: I was unaware of this site until recently. I wrote a lengthy review of this hotel after our stay there but Expedia never posted it, so I'll try it here. First the good part. The Sheraton Maui is one of the best locations there is. The beach is awesome and the snorkling right in front of the hotel is better than almost anywhere on the island. We saw more fish and turtles there than we did on the snorkling trip we paid for. Its also great to be able to walk to whalers village for shopping and restaurants. Now the bad part. This hotel is over priced for the quality of the rooms and service you recieve. When we checked into the hotel I noticed the service was lacking. No one offerred to take us and our luggage to our room, we were merely given directions. When we got to the room, which was dated and worn, I went to the bathroom. While standing at the toilet I saw pubic hairs stuck to the wall. Not something you expect to see when your paying as much as we were. When we left the room I stopped by the front desk to tell them of this and the clerk was rude. I attempted to explain where the hairs were and she ignored me, simply calling housekeeping in the middle of our conversation. No surprise, when we returned to the room we found the hairs still there. Later in our stay we saw someone had left a dirty plate of food and their pool towel on a planter box by the stairs we used daily. We thought that was poor behavior by someone but were more shocked when it remained there for over two days. It wasn't like it was hidden. It was right there. How could housekeepers and groundspersons just leave it sit there for two days? Any quality hotel has managers that walk the grounds and would catch something like this. The attitude with the staff at this hotel appears to be they don't have to care because they have the best location. But when you are paying over $400 a night, you expect better. We recommend renting a condo nearby for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: WhiteZinfandel
Reviews.Content: My husband and i checked in to the Sheraton Maui on the 6th September as part of our honeymoon. We were greeted on arrival with a smile and two fresh flower leis, we had booked a garden view room but we were upgraded to a deluxe ocean view room which was a fantastic room with a wonderful view of the beach and pool. We had such a relaxing stay at this hotel and wouldnt hesitate on returning. We ate at the pool snack bar which was nice food for lunch and reasonably priced. Maui is renowned for being expensive but if you come from England the prices are very similar.The only other meal we ate at the hotel was the buffet breakfast which was really nice with lots of choice. All our other meals were eaten at Whalers Village or Lahaina, can recommend Leilanis and Hula Grill at Whalers and BJs Chicago Pizziera in Lahaina. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Just average....”
Reviews.Author: mschmidt
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our honeymoon in Maui, Oct 6th, 2006. Our stay at the Sheraton was was a little less luxurious then we expected. Our first night as honeymooners in Hawaii was spent is separate beds! We did not receive our proper room. 2 double beds sounds cozy for newly weds, sure, but not after a 12 hour flight and no sleep. So we started with a very nice view of the front gardens, but then we were moved to a lovely view of the rear parking lot and tennis courts to obtain the proper king size bed. (if you use a travel agent, they will use the guaranteed bedding excuse...) So, with that, DO NOT book a Mountain View room, its not an upgrade. The standard Garden Views are much better. Besides the rooms being very average, the food was also. Restaurants were just OK at best. All of the great places in Maui to dine, the 2 restaurants here do not even compare! That and hotel charges for everything.... I mean EVERYTHING. The coffee, newspapers, the safe in your room.... 18.00 per day, which is not included in the cost of your room?!?! I understand Hawaii is expensive, but that is why you stay at a Sheraton, correct? Hospitality? They charge you gratuity on top of your gratuities! Also, if you would like a nice glass of wine as an evening cocktail.... better do it before 7pm or bring your own. The bars and lounges outside close at 7?! Black Rock is very nice to have, but it draws large crowds to your "home" beach. With that, we found the Sheraton to be a nice hotel, but average resort. The grounds were very nice, pool was great, bartenders outside were awesome.... but the rooms, front desk service and overall value fell short. I know this contradicts most of the reviews posted, but we honestly were not impressed for the almost 400.00 per night honeymoon stay. Go down to the Hyatt! We spent our last 3 nights there and it was fabulous. Everything! Restaurants are wonderful, shopping area.... lobby is beautiful! If your planning a very special trip, the Hyatt is the place to stay. You cant avoid cost in Hawaii, so its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Akcay
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Sheraton in Maui and it was fantastic all the way! Location, location, location, this property has it all. The beach is great, pool is great, lazy river without the currents, just got renovated. We were a family of 4, 2 adults 2 children. We got upgraded to building three with an ocean/grounds/resturant view. It is a very clean hotel and very open and airy feel throughout. We did check out the other hotels around the area, Westin/Hyatt but I found their lobby very busy looking and very tropical with birds and felt like you were in a jungle, if you are looking for that go with them. I prefer my surroundings to be uncluttered which is what the Sheraton is. Rooms are nice and clean, hallways need to get redone. Get the book Maui Revealed, it is awesome, it shows you every hotel in detail with a aerial view so you know for sure if the hotel is on the beach or away from the beach and how much of a beach they have, this is how I chose the Sheraton, I would of probably picked the Westin if I did not see the arerial pictures of the property. We will definitely go with the Sheraton next time we are in Maui! Went to Mama's Fish resturant on the way to the airport for lunch, very expensive $135.00 without drinks but worth it to try once, great food and ambiance. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: Detailed_taveler
Reviews.Content: My wife & I celebrated our 20th anniversary at the Sheraton from Sept 20 to the 28th. I researched for 9 months prior to making my choice. After considering 20+ hotels across Maui I narrowed down to the Westin & the Sheraton (Both on Kaanapoli). I chose the Sheraton for the larger rooms, beach and better chance for a free room upgrade. We were not disappointed! The beach is large with the best snorkeling on the island. I saw turtles and hundreds of varieties of fish.... The Westin does have a super pool, but the beach in front of the Westin is too small - Also the Westin's rooms are small... Our room at the Sheraton was large the refrigerator was great - the Bathroom was plenty large. The room as well as the property in general was in excellent shape. The grounds were exspansive with grass trimmed much like golf course fairways. Take my word, you cannot get a better combination of beach, pool, ambience, and location than the Sheraton (especially if you are a "beach " person. If you are stricktly a pool person and do not mind smaller rooms, the Westin is very very nice - Newer building nicely appointed but grounds are a little constrained - The grounds are very ornate! and on a whole, nicer and newer than the Sheraton. The Westin is right next to Whalers Villiage an up-scale shopping and moderately priced dining destination (The Sheraton is a 5 minute walk away) I was very impressed with the shops and the prices for food at the 3-4 restaurants was not out of line.... I wish I knew how some folks get better rates at the Sheraton than $250 per night - I spent 6 months shopping rates - I do know that some conference rates are lower but there is little chance for a room upgrade... I think I might have paid $20 to $30 more a night but the room upgrade was awesome and not as probable at the lower rates - I talked to several folks who did not get an upgrade - I think my agent and broker helped to get the upgrade. Our room overlooked the grounds and the beach - buildings 3 and 4 are the absolute best locations - the even number rooms face the water. We visited the Grand Wailea in Wailea - It was a magnificent place, probably 3 times more rooms than the Sheraton...(many more people put in about the same size property) But Wailea is isolated and there is very limited dining and good shoping on that part of the island.... Kapalua is even more of a micro destination with nice accomodations but limited beach and dining etc..... Kaanipali is the absolute best destination on Maui with Lahaina only a 5 minute drive Great shopping food and nightlife! Finally I wish someone would have told me about the book "Maui Revealed" a blue soft bound book - a wealth of information - a must to get before your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton and Black Rock!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Damattster770
Reviews.Content: The hotel and location is awesome. The people are great there. The beach and area is outstanding. We loved the Kannapali area and Whalers Village. It was so nice to be able to walk to dinner when we didn't feel like driving anywhere. We ate at the hotel Prime Rib buffet and were pleaantly suprised at the price and quality. We got there kind of late so they were running low on somethings, but we were completely happy. The hotel grounds and location is what makes it key. The design is awesome and it is lovely maintained. I loved seeing the geckos or lizards running around the outside of the buildings at night. They were oh so cute. Check in the lights on the outside of the buildings and you will be bond to see them, they must like the heat of the lights. The hotel's pool is awesome and so relaxing. They were working on part of it and there was still plenty of space. Never did we feel crowded there at all. There were a lot of fellow honeymooners at our hotel. The beach and snorkeling around black rock lives up to what they say. I saw 2 octupus, 1 sea turtle and plenty of fish. I would say not as clear as Molikini, but well worth the cost = free. Molokini is cool, but not enough activity other than fish and it cost $94 or so. Local offshore snorkeling is comparable for free. I booked the most basic room and we were given a king room with garden viewand of the tennis courts. Hotel was sold out, and they were remodeling one whole building so upgrade options were hard to come bye for free. We asked on day 3 of 7 and they had a 2 double bed room with deluxe ocean view which we took and loved despite the 2 sep. beds. We made it worked and loved the sunsets nightly. It was in building 2 level 2. I think it was 2218 awesome room. Room and bed were great. You pay for Hawaii and the location. I think I paid approx $200 a night with tax included. Service charge was not part of the deal. Our only complaint was the some of the guest services people seemed as if they had no brains. My wife asked some simple questions regarding hours of hotel shops, etc. and they were not sure. Then I called regarding something else and they were great. Valet staff is great and well worth the 5 bucks extra a night. Any bad ratings should be looked at with caution. I often think people are unhappy with themselves which causes negativity in all aspects of their life. Matt

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: WxGuy1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved the ambiance, and the pool is nice. I was not impressed with Ka'anapali Beach, food was overpriced, and the walk from the room to the parking facility was very long. The hallways looked a little worn and unclean.

Reviews.Title: “Sherton, Maui”
Reviews.Author: Emsy3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for 1 week during our honeymoon. The hotel was of a good standard. I would recommend asking for a sea facing room as the view from our room was fantastic. The room was of a good standard and cleaned everyday. The hallways could do with a bit of a clean and disposing of the carpet as this is very stained and looks tatty. The breakfast is great and well worth the money. I would highly recommend booking a havanna on the beach as the beach gets very very busy at the hotel end due to the black rock and the excellent snorkelling. We were warned that Maui was very expensive so saved quite a lot of money to take with us. We were pleasantly surprised at the prices when we arrived. Lelani's restaurant in Whalers village is excellent value and well worth queing for a table. Also there is a bus from Whalers village which takes you into Lahaina which is a lovely town with great restaurants and shops. All in all the Sheraton is one of the best hotels and we would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: AlohaRJW2006
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Maui for the second half of our ten-day Hawaiian honeymoon. After Oahu (with a Waikiki city room), it was nice to feel relaxed in Maui. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a Deluxe Ocean Front room. We were in building 6 on the cliff overlooking Black Rock, a spectacular ocean view from our ground-level lanai, and the islands of Lanai and Molokai. The location of this hotel is wonderful. We spent our days snorkeling (excellent snorkeling at Black Rock), relaxing by and swimming in the pool (wonderful pool by the way!), and lying on the beach. We also did some traveling around the island - The Road to Hana - a must see if you're adventurous, Whaler's Village down the road, and went to the Maui Ocean Center - great place - especially for kids. One suggestion is to stop at Long's Drug Store on the way (near the Lahaina Cannery Mall) and buy snorkeling gear/food/etc. there. It's much cheaper to buy it than the 20+ dollar per day rental - then you can use it all week! Long's was a lifesaver - we bought snacks, drinks, and coffee there - room service is expensive and so are the restaurants. Save your money for dinner. We ate at Canoe's down the road - great food, great view on the patio. Positives: Good location, beautiful room, outstanding view, well-kept grounds, great/large pool, excellent beach and snorkeling, and close to the Royal Lahaina Luau - book it - the food and drinks were GREAT and the show was really neat! Concierge desk will order pineapples to send home, too - definitely worth it) Downfalls: Getting around the hotel can get confusing at times - but worth it if you're in building 6. Pool and beach can be crowded at times. Will send pics for review soon.

Reviews.Title: “we wanted to stay longer”
Reviews.Author: JKJK1234
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night following a 7-day cruise. We really wish we could have stayed here longer! The hotel grounds are gorgeous! The beach features Black Rock, and it was fun to watch the teenage locals jump, dive, and flip off of it into the ocean. The hotel pool is fantastic, with lots of coves for solitude and privacy. There was some pool construction going on whie we were there, so a portion of the pool (including what looked like a small water slide) was closed. But the pool area is so large it did not matter. Our room was spacious with a large bathroom. The small refrigerator did make a lot of noise, but we simply unplugged it and got our peace & quiet back. In addition to the goregous hotel & beach/pool features, we were very pleased to receive a room upgrade. Even though we booked through a disccount travel website and were supposed to get a mountain view, we were given an ocean view room upon check-in. We recommend this hotel - an absolutely fabulous stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in paradise”
Reviews.Author: Liza9
Reviews.Content: My husband, neice and I stayed at the Sheraton Maui for 10 days in June of this year. I could not have been more pleased. The resort was beauitful and the landscaping flawless. We go to Maui every year so we were less compelled to be on the road sightseeing everyday. For the first 3 days we barely left the resort, opting for relaxing at the pool. The resort has 2 pools, one for children/families and the other for adults. One recommendation about the pool. If you want a lounge chair in the shade get up early (about 7AM) and go down to the pool and claim your chairs! That sounds early but with the time change you will probably be awake anyway. There are plenty of lounge chairs, however few are in the shade. The room was very clean and the bed comfortable. They also have a mini frig in each room, which was a very nice touch. If you are going to Maui for your honeymoon or for your first visit to paradise do yourself a favor and stay at the Sheraton. You will leave with the Aloha spirit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Location”
Reviews.Author: Doggy32
Reviews.Content: Spent the first week of our honeymoon at the Maui Sheraton before heading off to Kauai. We received an ocean front room upgrade when we checked in and spent our days mostly relaxing by the pool and strolling the beach. The grounds, room, pool, and service, were all very nice - not spectacular, but more than we needed. The best thing about the resort is the value and location. The resort fronts some of the best snorkelling on Maui, its just a short stroll down to Whaler's Village, and a short drive to Lahaina. We strolled the walkway that fronts all of the Kaanapali hotels, and while some have nicer grounds and more "grand" pools, like the Marriott, Hyatt, and Westin, it didnt seem that the increased price for those resorts (as compared to the Sheraton) would make it worth not staying at the Sheraton. In our experience, you can't go wrong with the Sheraton, and in fact, we will not stay anywhere else in Kaanapali when and if we return. Feel free to e-mail me with any questions - ckawas22@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: DavidandKim
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Aug 30- Sept 4. Our room was clean and nice. The hotel is a little confusing getting around because of all the different elevators. The pool was fun but there wasn't enough shaded areas. The beach was great and there was great snorkeling. The exercise room was very disappointing. Just the very basic machines and not very many. We only ate at one of the restaraunts for breakfast one day, we preferred to go into town or the Whaler's village to eat. We enjoyed our stay but might consider the Westin next time down the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton!!”
Reviews.Author: Mauichick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton August 6th-August 12th. We were in Building #2 and had a beautiful ocean view. We could see the sail boats and parasailers through the many palm trees and the sunsets each night were amazing! The gounds are beautiful and well kept. Many plumeria trees on the grounds and even saw banana trees! The boardwalk runs from the Black Rock all the way past the Hyatt. We could take an evening walk right to the Whalers Village and it only took about 10 minutes. The roon was very nice and I had only one complaint. On our last day, we had spent the afternoon at the pool and went up to our room to change. The maid 's cart was parked outside our room, so we decided to give her a few minutes. After a few minutes, my husband needed to get inside to use the facilities and he peeked into the room. The maid was rooting around in our refridgerator! Once she saw him and let us in, she told me she took a bottle of our water because she was thirsty. I said "Ok", but thought all she had to do was ask! After she left, we noticed that was not all that was missing. Some other waters and sodas were also missing. So that is about the only thing I have to complain about. Needless to say, we did not leave the tip she would have gotten if she didnt do this to us!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and Great location”
Reviews.Author: Walkman1677
Reviews.Content: We came to the Sheraton for the first time this trip. We normally come to Maui once a year, but usually stay at the Papkea Resort. This time however we were on our honeymoon, and decided to stay at a resort near Whaler's Village. The price is expensive, until you remember that you are staying at the hotel that is at one of the most popular attractions, Black Rock and it's beach. You are a five minute walk to Whaler's village, and a 10 minute drive from Lahaina. We got a junior suite in building 2 on the 4th floor. The view was amazing. Our large balcony looked across the lawn area to the beach and a full ocean view. Each night we watched the sunset from our Lanai, it was beautiful. The view stretched from the lawn area on the left, across the pool area on the right, and we could see Black Rock and the whold Sheraton beach. The restaurants were clean and average price for Maui hotels. The buffet breakfast was good as usual. The room service was a bit pricey, even by room service standards, but the service was quick at least. Housekeeping staff were very pleasant and had the room cleaned within an hour of when we left, no matter what time we left it... it was amazingly timed. We rented a car and had to park int he parking garage, which was a little bit of a walk, but not too bad. The pool area was great, water was clean, plenty of chaise lounge chairs, but not much shade. If you want to be pool side, but be in the shade, you better go down early to stake out your spot. One day we rented umberella and chairs on the beach, which worked out very well for $15.00. Especially since you could move the shade as the sun moved, very nice. I also did a basic scuba lesson one day, which was fabulous. It started in the pool for about 45 minutes... then went to a beach dive for another 45 minutes. The instructor was very nice and reassuring. I had never been diving, and she made the first time very pleasurable and I felt very safe. All in all I would stay here again even at the prices.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Best in Maui”
Reviews.Author: bigivy
Reviews.Content: For my recent two week trip the Islands, we planned to spend one week on Maui and one on the Big Island. After arriving at the Shearton Maui on Kaanapali, we never left. We were made to feel so comfortable with the view, the open space, the service, the food, the drinks, and the ambience of the plance, that to leave Paradise for another island was unthinkable. We cancelled the Big Island and stayed two weeks at one of the most beautiful, restful, comfortable, refreshing, and enticing, resorts I have ever visited. We were made to feel at home. We became part of the local community and Lahaina Town is never to be forgotten. If anyone plans to visit the Islands, see them all, but you'll stay forever in Maui and stay at the Sheraton. Paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect except for the employees at the Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii_traveler200
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at the Sheraton Maui. The room was beautiful (in building 6) with a breathtaking view, the property was perfectly manicured, the beach was nice although crowded, the pool was perfect for older kids, and the location near Whaler's Village couldn't be beat. The food we had (mostly breakfast) was great. The only thing that detracted from our stay was that each person we talked to at the Front Desk, every single one, was rude, condescending, unsmiling and nasty. Maybe we just saw all of the bad ones and the nice ones were on their days off. Once we tried calling so we wouldn't have to put up with their rudeness face to face, but they (of course) don't answer the phone. We shouldn't have been surprised, but at check-out we were overbilled by $500 and it was quite a feat when one of them admitted to making a mistake (mumbled a barely audible "I'm sorry about that"). I hope someone in importance sees this and sends them to Customer Service training. All other staff we encountered were excellent, friendly and helpful. We ate dinners off site and great meals were at Sansei in Kapalua (25% off from 5-5:30!), and Blu and Kimo's in Lahaina. The sushi bar at the Marriott down the path is excellent. The Sunset Cruise on the Trehlani was awesome. The luau at the Hyatt was OK because of the fire juggler at the end, but otherwise it was crowded (it took 1 hr to seat everyone!), the food was just OK, and the show was entertaining but not awesome. The Sheraton luau looked better, since it was less crowded and the show was longer. Just avoid the Front Desk (the bellmen check you in anyway) and you will have the best vacation ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: scottyedog
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from Maui and stayed at the Sheraton Maui in Ka'anapali. Upon arrival, we were greeted at the front of the hotel and our hotel room was upgraded to deluxe ocean view. We booked our hotel through Hotwire for $230 a night and were there for 9 nights. The bell captains gave us lei's and then provided a tour of their facility. The facility is quite large, which is somewhat of a drawback, if you are at the other end of where the pool and beach access are, but it is still a great place. They could do better on the housekeeping, however that improved while we were there. The food at the hotel was so-so. The drinks were good and some were quite original. The beach access was great and it is right at the Black Rock. The snorkeling and diving there are great. It is pretty easy to swim out to the reef and the aquatic life that can be seen by snorkeling parallels that of diving. Overall, I would stay at this hotel again. I highly recommend it, especially for the price that we paid.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon in Maui”
Reviews.Author: bigbassguy1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for honeymoon at Sheraton Kaanopoli beach. Let me first say that Maui is awesome. So much better than Oahu. If I went back, I would try to fly into Kapulua airport rather than Kuhuiui. The main reason is proximity and getting from airport to hotel. From Kuhuiui it is a beautiful drive on a two lane road, but bumper to bumper making the 25 mile drive take well over an hour. Kapulua airport would have been 5 minutes! Not sure on the price difference though. Room location was #4313 right against Black Rock and on the beach, beautiful views and accessibility. Room was small and very much outdated. Really needs remodeling. Due to its aging, it did not appear very clean. Really not what I expected for $420/night. Most of the hotel for that matter was in dire need of renovations. If I rated Maui alone, it would be a 5 of 5. The Sheraton however is a solid 3. Breakfast buffet was free (promotional deal when booking), but not very good. Same crappy food everyday. Service was not very desirable. In addition, the birds flying in and attacking your plates and table when you got up to get something was very displeasing. It was almost Hitchcock like. Pool and beach were amazing, yet crowded. Snorkeling was awesome right off shore, but as with anything in Hawaii, get there early to get a spot. Restaurants we ate at were as follows: Plantation House (Kapaula golf course) enjoyable 15 min drive north. - Best food during stay bar none! Scenery/food/service was second to none. Hula Grille (whalers village Kaanapoli) dinning room area, not barefoot bar: Excellent dinner and service. Very much recommended. You will end up buying a bottle of the Hawaiian vinegar for bread dipping to go! Rusty Harpoon (whalers village Kaanapoli) Meals were okay, but nothing to brag about. Service was good. Ruths Chris (Lahina) I've never been disappointed about Ruths before, but this time I really was. Very overpriced and steaks were lousy. Not what I expected from such a prestigious chain. Longhis (Lahina) This was very advertised, but food and service was far from good. We should have known since at 7pm there was hardly anyone in the restaurant. Dinners were overpriced and really blah. Service sucked. I paid $32 for a small fish fillet with nothing more than a wine sauce on it. Veggies/Potato/salad were ala carte which ended up costing an additional $25 to the meal.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Travels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon and I was a little disappointed with the room. Checkin was rushed and since I heard about everyone getting fresh leis on arrival I was disappointed when we didn't!! We had to find our way to our room ourselves because we were waiting ages for assistance with bags and just decided to go find it and get settled! Our room was a mountain view room and they had no upgrades available. It was a basic room, small bathroom, the bed was comfy but the fridge was loud and kept hubby awake some nights. Air conditioner unit was also old and noisy. The resort is fantastic, the pool is amazing and the view to the beach is something else. We loved every minute of our trip but I was disappointed with the room in the hotel because I had heard such good things! Maui is beautiful and we had a ball but I would think about staying at the Sheraton again or else pay for a better room, we paid Â£200 per night for mountain view room and it wasn't worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Roach motel”
Reviews.Author: blinky5
Reviews.Content: We went to Hawaii to see the wedding of a friend. The wedding took place at the Sheraton, so we booked a room there, expecting it to be central. It was, and the wedding was fine, but our room was not. On the second evening I discovered the first two of a series of roaches that invaded our room during our week long stay at the resort. Needless to say, I immediately phoned the front desk. They sent someone up to kill the roach I could not reach (the one on the ceiling), but seemed completely nonplussed by the event. As they explained, it is a tropical climate. Fine, I understand the tropics. Having lived in Florida, DC, the Carribean, and Africa, I have had more than my fair share of the tropics. But there are standards, and my homes do not have this many roaches. We found one or two every night of our stay and the hotel just didn't seem to care at all. At check out, the manager comped us two breakfasts -- this was definitely not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui is THE BEST on Kaanapali Beach!”
Reviews.Author: jlefief
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights in July 2006 for a second honeymoon at the Sheraton and loved every second of it!!! We arrived at the Sheraton at noon, 3 hours before check in. We were greeted with fresh leis but our room was not ready so we were given 2 free drink tickets and 35% off at the hotel restaurant. So we went and had lunch. I had the cobb salad and Kaul got Fish Tacosâ€¦..both excellent. Then we walked to Whalers Village and picked up our snorkel equipment from Maui Dive Shop. We also did a little shopping and picked up some Vodka and Guava juice for cocktails in the room. Yummy! At 3:00 our room was readyâ€¦.after a few complaints since we were antsy. We paid for a garden view room and that was what we got. Except for one thingâ€¦..there were 2 double beds, not the king we were expecting. So we went back to the front desk to complain. My hubby said â€œI am not spending my honeymoon in Ricky and Lucy bedsâ€� Well that worked, because we were upgraded to an amazing Ocean Front room in building 6â€¦on top of Black Rockâ€¦room 6218. Quite an upgrade from a Garden View room!!! Nice! The grounds were impeccable, the pool was fantastic and the great snorkeling at Black Rock was incredibly convenient. The grounds are so large and spread out that it never feels crowded or noisy..... a common feature of the other hotels on the beach. The way that the pool is set up has the kids pool at one end and then connnected by long winding portions with waterfalls, connects to the other main pool. So the kids mainly stay at their end. We walked the beach path several times and I did not see a single hotel that even compared to the Sheraton. People complain about the limited sharing at the Westin.....but I say....why would you want that? Their grounds are so cramped and crowded. At the Westin, there are 2 restaraunts right on top of the pool area. Their pool is cramped and crowded and noisy. I would've been very dissapointed if we had stayed there. The staff at the Sheraton pool were prompt with drinks and food. They also did a nice job of keeping non-Sheraton guests out of the pool area. All in all, everything about the Sheraton was an absolute paradise that exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: Datedog
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Maui Sheraton from July 8-14 and we had a wonderful time. The service was excellent and the location was the best by far. I booked the Sheraton through Priceline but I was treated like had paid the highest rack rate. We were greeted with fresh flower leis upon arrival and quickly unburdened of our many, many suitcases and car. Even though the hotel was very full we were given an upgrade from our booked garden view room to an ocean front right on top of Black Rock. The staff was very attentive and went our of their way to make sure that we got to a room early (it was before noon when we arrived) because my daughter was not feeling well. The bellman that took us over to our room (in a golf cart) was very friendly and ansewered a lot of our questions about the property. The concierge was great at getting us last minute dinner reservations and she had a great deal of infomation and knowledge to share. Our maid service was excellent and never intrusive. We only ate breakfast and lunch at the hotel but the buffett was wonderful with several stations and a huge selection of food for even the pickest eater. We stayed in building 6 which is a bit of a hike to the pool and beach area (you have to ride 3 elevators to get there) but the location is so spectacular that you don't mind. The sun sets everynight on your lanai. We walked down to check out the other hotels that we considered, the Westin and the Hyatt. While they had very impressive swimming pools, the beach area in front of each was much smaller and they Hyatt actually was quite narrow with a few rocks scattered about and not much room to actually lay on the beach (you would have to lay poolside which looked amazing too - not a bad choice at all). They are all walking distance to each other, so walking down to the beach in front of the Sheraton would not be a problem, but if you want to actually lay in front of your hotel on the beach then this is the best place. The beach in front of the Sheraton is wide with plenty of room for everyone. Even though the hotel was full it never felt crowded. The other hotel grounds looked like they were packed. We only had trouble securing chairs and an umbrella on the one day when we arrived at the beach after noon. We found out that if you can get a cabana ahead of time by reservation of if you stop by in the morning, you can secure your chairs and umbrella for the entire day. The will set it up and put a name tag on it which secures it until 5:00. The swimming pools were lovely, but not the waterpark the other two offer. They were much calmer with a "lazy river" winding under bridges and connecting several smaller pools. This would be a great place for couples or honeymooners because the other pools are very Disney like. The pools and the grounds are very relaxing and tropical with a lot of character and great plant life to make you feel like you are at an isolated resort. The other hotels are quite beautiful but they have the feeling that they are in the middle of a strip of hotels on the beach walk. If you want the beach then the Sheraton is it. If your more of a pool person and don't care about the beach then try the others. There really are no bad choices among these three on Kaanapali. The snorkeling location on Black Rock is the best and being so close to Whaler's village is great too. Overall I give the Sheraton an A and I would stay again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon @ The Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Bings2k
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our honeymoon and have lots of great things to say about the Sheraton. I often read these posts before the honeymoon and want to share our experience. When we checked in we got the complimentary valet, a tour of the hotel, and greeted with a lei. While we didn't get upgraded, we had a nice room in building 3 which was exactly what we requested (partial ocean view). No long walk to the lobby or the beach either. Even if we were in another building, come on people, a little walk never hurt...the spreadout nature of the Sheraton is what makes it great. Warning, we knew Maui is expensive so we weren't too shocked about the prices going into it. The main restaurant has a great prime rib buffet on Mondays and Fridays so if you are really hungry you can get your money's worth and they had live Hawaiian music too. Grounds were well kept, pool was great, and the ocean is just as nice with the Black Rock and snorkeling. Pool chairs weren't that hard to find if you don't need to be "right" next to the pool and we did have our room cleaned every day. Good mix of honeymooners, families, and people on their anniversary. Activity musts; the more underrated West Maui drive, don't miss the Olivine Pools (awesome!) and Slaughterhouse Beach, snorkeling, Old Lahaina Luau, surfing lessons at Goofy Foot, and hanging out in Lahaina. Got a great inside tip on free parking in Lahaina from the conceierge(sp?) and an awesome restaurant called The Lahaina Store Oyster Bar (great views!). The most overrated in our minds, The Road to Hana, maybe it was because I drove the 600 hairpin turns or the few waterfalls you can see from the road. While the Black Sand Beach near Hana may be worth the drive, the drive as a whole did not live up to they hype. Also makes for a long day. I'd say stay on the beach/pool, people watch, and have a great meal at the Terrace Restaurant on site for dinner. Overall, awesome honeymoon and stay at the Sheraton which we vow that we will be back to see again on our 10th anniversary. -Eat, Drink, & Be Maui!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressive”
Reviews.Author: annebanannie
Reviews.Content: We may have made the mistake of visiting Maui during 4th of July week, but we found the Sheraton to have quite poor service. Food service was slow, concierge service was slow, front desk service was slow, valet service took 10-15 rings before answering calls. Cleaning service was non-existent one day. Staff never came to the room to collect towels or make the bed! We did not feel that we received our money's worth at this hotel. As indicated in other posts, the pool chairs were all occupied by 9am, Black Rock beach was full by 10am. It felt like you were always fighting crowds within the resort, and this was supposed to be a vacation! The gym is also quite dilapidated. Also note that they brag about the '3 resorts in 1' deals with the Westin and Marriott down the shore. But the only 'privelage' you have with this deal is that they will allow you to charge your room for any meals or service charges you incur at these other hotels. You are NOT able to use their pools or fitness centers. The Westin fitness center charges an extra $15/day for usage. On the positive side, you really can't beat this location, especially if you enjoy snorkeling. The rooms were well appointed (bed quite comfortable) and the patios had nice views. I'm sure this hotel would be adequate for families. For couples looking for a romantic, quiet getaway, I would recommend Wailea, not Kaanapali. We visited the Grand Wailea - it was beautiful. We had dinner there as well, service and quality was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!! It could not have been better!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TTzz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui from July 3rd to July 10th 2006. From the moment we arrived on the property to the moment we left, it was perfect! The room was amazing, drop dead gorgeous view, and right in the middle of it all. We brought our 12 year old daughter and our 16 month old son, great hotel for kids. Anyone who says anything bad about this property needs to stop being so uptight....I read all these reviews before we booked and could not understand where some of these people were coming from...did they stay at a different hotel? Yes, food is expensive, your in Maui...get over it. Take a nice short walk to Whalers Village and eat at the Hula Grill. Do eat at the hotel for breakfast though, $22.95 each (kids free with paid adult) the breakfast buffet is great!!!!! If you go to the Luau @ the hotel, get down there about 5 (starts at 6) the line is long if you show up later. The snorkeling off Black Rock is some of the best we have ever done, even hung out with a large sea turtle for a while. As for the beach, it is not crowded..it's a beach. Cruise ships do use this as an excursion beach, but we did not feel as if the beach was crowded. if you want a beach cabana, book 2 days early, or just get a couple of beach chairs and a umbrella in the morning (get there at 8am to be sure you get one though). My wife and I will be booking another stay at the Sheraton Maui very soon, what a great place!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui 7/6-7/9”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I apologize for writing after the fact, but I at least want to share with you my findings in hopes of helping you in your future Maui visits or stay at Sheraton. I opt to use priceline for our "splurge" stay at Maui and reading all the reviews of the bids at $200, I did my for $195 and won the bid for 3 nights. This was for our 3rd year wedding anniversary. Upon my friend's recommendation, we signed up to be starwood preferred guest program before our trip. I called Sheraton Maui to confirm the reservation and informed them that I am a starwood preferred member and that this is our wedding anniversary trip. By doing this, we got a compimentary upgrade and my friend was right. When we check in at 2pm (usual check in is 3pm), I asked if there were upgrades available and no question asked, they offered us an ocean front delux room. This room was on the other side of the resort, which will take a good 7-8 minutes to walk to the main pool and beach. Mind you, also 3 sets of elevators to get to the pool, but when you think about where the room is, you really don't mind it. We were also greeted with a lei and a bottle of champaign in our room. As you can tell, we were very fortunate that these were available. Because the room was not quite ready, they gave us complimentary drink coupons at the beach bar for us to enjoy. In terms of Resort fees- I simply asked (innocently), is there a resort fee for priceline members? and she said no, so I said, oh, but I am being charged a fee and they gladly took that off. This also happened to our friend who stayed here a couple of days before us. So, make sure you ask, because it is possible. Sheraton is also easily accessible to the beach and black rock. The resort was filled with a lot of kids, but you see that everywhere you go. We also did the timeshare presentation at the Westin Villa and was given $100 for doing that so we ate at the Westin and the Sheraton (2 meals!) Overall, a great experience, so definitely make sure you look into all of this. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied, not thrilled.”
Reviews.Author: DJacks19
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights at the end of June 2006 for our honeymoon. Arrived about 3 hours later than planned on Sunday due to flight delays and a very long wait for a rental car (Hertz). Room class we had reserved all booked and staff very unwilling to accommodate, so we were stuck in a double for one night. The next morning they did go out of their way to get us an upgrade without an additional charge, which we definitely appreciated. Besides that, the service was very good. The concierge especially helpful with planning activities, highly recommend the sunset cocktail cruise! Brunch buffet also excellent. Rooms are nice and spacious, with a small deck, but by no means luxurious, especially for the high price. Location is A++ within easy walk to Whalers Village and 5 minute drive to Lahaina. Beach location is perfect next to Black Rock with good snorkling (get out there early to avoid crowds). Pool is above average, space somewhat limited, again need to get out there early to get a good chair (go to the Westin to experience the really lavish pool and spa).

Reviews.Title: “best 40th birthday ever!”
Reviews.Author: domain
Reviews.Content: When researching where we should stay for our 15th wedding anniversary and my husband's 40th birthday...we knew we wanted to go back to Maui! The first time we went to Maui, was on business (expenses paid) , we stayed at the Grand Wailea (not affordable now)...so where to stay? The Sheraton continuously came up as a nice place...although some of the reviews scared us a bit...we decided to book with a travel agent, and got a great deal of airfare, hotel, and breakfast for one week! How pleasantly surprised were we! The Sheraton turned out to be gorgeous! The grounds themselves were spectacular, and the views from all the different levels of open-air lounge areas were so beautiful. When we arrived, we were immediately greeted with lovely leis, and then as we checked in we were offered a room upgrade! First floor, with a walkout patio area, with a wide-open view of the ocean. The room was gorgeous, and can I tell you how comfortable the beds were? AHHHH...sweet rest! I must say that having breakfast included was one of the best money saving tips we could have done....the full breakfast buffet was enormous! So we stuffed ourselves full of pineapple, a different main dish each day, and cinnamon bread that was to die for! Because we were so full from breakfast, we never ate lunch, and then were ready to eat a nice dinner by 6pm... Our room also had a mini fridge which we stocked full of beer/sodas/water (which we bought at the Safeway on the way to the hotel) I would recommend not eating at the hotelâ€¦not that the food quality isnâ€™t good, it isâ€¦however, it is very expensive! The breakfast buffet (that we had included in our deal) was over $23 per person! And on the first night, we arrived late, and were very hungry, so we ate in the bar loungeâ€¦$13 for a hamburger! Yikes. Again, it tasted great, but too expensive for every night fare. Another trick we learned early, was to scope out the lounge chairs we wanted by the pool, then early in the am, (we were trying to stay on EST) we'd put our towels on the chairs we wanted, then off to breakfast! I highly recommend the Sheraton at Black Rock!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kingpgmr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for 3 nights and really enjoyed our stay. The location is excellent as it's on the best part of Kaanapali Beach and within walking distance of Whaler's Village. From the moment we checked in, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. They have seamless check in here, meaning that the valet takes you directly to your room without having to go to the front desk. They also give you leis upon arrival which is a nice touch. The rooms are nice but not spectacular. They also tend to nickel and dime for extras. All in all though, I recommend the Sheraton for a relaxing stay in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 1Maggie
Reviews.Content: This is our third trip to Maui and to the Sheraton. We love the location at the end of Kaanapali Beach. We had requested a room in Bldg. 4, which we think has the best views and room locations at the far end of the resort, but it wasn't ready when we arrived. Instead we wound up with a luxury suite on the 8th floor in Bldg. 5. Fabulous views of Molokai and Maui and this time of year the sun went down right off our balcony. Naturally the suite was very roomy but we've always found that the rooms here are very comfortable with plenty of room on the patio for at least two chairs. The snorkeling at Black Rock is great if the weather is clear. If there has been a lot of rain you get sufficient run off that the water clarity suffers. In the summer GO EARLY! The beach is packed by 10:00 am. That said, if you swim around the right side of the point you will almost always find that there are no crowds. The current can be stronger here but if you're a good swimmer you'll always be rewarded with lots of fish and the occasional sea turtle. Whaler's Village is just a short walk away, as are the rest of the hotels along Kaanapli so there are lots of other restaurant choices besides the ones at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton is favorable”
Reviews.Author: C-Note1021
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 10 day trip to Maui, 5 days being spent at the Sheraton and 5 days being spent at the Fairmont Kea Lani (seperate review - check for it). We arrived at the Sheraton on Tuesday, June 13th around 2PM. Upon pulling up to the valet we were greeted with gorgeous orchid leis and my son was even given a boogie board that had been left behind by another family (nice touch)! We then were told we would not be able to check in at the curb but would have to go to the front desk. My husband is a platinum Starwood rewards member so he had put in a request for an upgrade. We didn't really want building 6 as so many people rave about because we have a 5 year old son who wants to get to the pool/beach ASAP when he gets up in the morning. The girl at the front desk, kindly told us that we would be upgraded to an ocean view junior suite but it wouldn't be ready until 4 BUT she was going to contact housekeeping and put a "rush" on our room. They gave us 2 free drink coupons to have drinks by the pool. I changed my little one into his swim suit and away we went to the pool. At around 3:30 we decided to just "check" to see if our room was ready - it wasn't and we received a little bit of attitude from the front desk agent. We were only checking because she said that she would "put a rush" on things......anyway, we were checked into our room a little after 4. The room was terrific! We were in building 3 and faced the pool/ocean/grounds and we were right off the elevatore. I was a little worried about that but we didn't hear a thing! The upgrade was WONDERFUL living room with wet bar, seperate bedroom with king bed and huge bathroom (tub and toilet seperate). BUT where was our little one to sleep???? We were told that we would have to pay $65 for a roll away a day....when we made the reservations we were very clear about needing a room that accomodated 3 people. We were willing to change rooms we told the front desk but were told there were no rooms to change us to.....I think there may have been more than one convention going on.....after a short discussion with the front desk manager we received a roll away for no charge. After the whole checking in and bed ordeal things were smooth sailing! The room was always cleaned and ready for us by 2 (one day I went up to get something around 11:30 and the room was done!). They supplied us with plenty of towels and always replenished the toiletries which were Aveda and great! We had a mini fridge and a microwave so we went to Safeway and picked up breakfast items and snacks. It was hugely convenient especially with a child. We ate lunch a few days by the pool and the food was very good. The child's menu couldn't be beat except I didn't know why a burger and chips was $7 but so was a PB&J!!! I thought that was a little ridiculous. The drinks by the bar were "ok". At $8.25 a drink they should have been better.....We ended up buying wine and rum and a few mixers to keep in our room. Much cheaper! The one drink I did like very much was the "Hula Punch". We didn't eat dinners on property at all because there are so many fantastic restaurants on Maui we wanted to get to as many as we could. A couple to remember: (1) Roy's Kahana was very good - EXCELLENT service! Everyone there was so accomodating and helpful. A fly flew into my glass of wine so the server immediately removed the glass and offered me the wine menu so that I could order another glass on the house. Nice touch! (2) Plantation House Kapalua - always excellent food and awesome views but we do have a gripe about the hostess & manager. Our reservations were for 6:30. We arrived at 6:15 and there were MANY tables empty but were told we would have to wait. At 6:30 when my husband checked to see if our table was ready (we were all famished) he got reprimanded that "you were early". Now most places are happy if you arrive early especially if there are a lot of tables open. Once seated it took our server a good 10 minutes to even greet us (once she did she was great). But as we ate our meal we watched the manager go from table to table greeting the patrons - as a matter of fact he went to every table around us but ours! How strange! I thought both the hostess and the manager acted in poor taste. (3) Pacific'O's - great food, great service (we were 20 min. early and seated without a problem!). ask for a table on the beach (but wear your Off! - mosquitos!). We did take advantage of the Kid's Club for our son. We did the 1/2 day morning program which included lunch for him and we used the service for 2 evenings so we could have dinner. Our son LOVED the program there. He received a backpack & canteen on his first visit which he thought was so "cool" and then for their night program they got a disposable camera and went on a "hike" around the property and were encouraged to take pictures of Hawaii animals and flowers. Very nice touch. One thing I noticed one day was that there were a group of people from the Westin using our pool (you get wrist bands by the pool every day to identify you as a guest). I knew that Starwood had done away with the "stay at 1 use all 3" policy so I asked the pool attendant and was told that Westin guests can use the Sheraton property but Sheraton guests can not use the Westin property! What is that all about??? When making reservations the Westin and the Sheraton were exactly the same price (the sheraton even a little more expensive) so why should the Westin have priority over the Sheraton guests. We just wanted to check out the pool with our son one day. The pool attendent said she didn't agree with the policy either and that more people should contact Starwood to discuss this issue. I might.....I don't know how important it is to me...... The beach at the Sheraton is terrific but when snorkeling at Black Rock you need a traffic cop to patrol. My husband got kicked in the head once and I got kicked in the stomach. Even first thing in the morning the water is very packed with people. Black Rock is a great snorkeling spot (there are other great spots on the island too though - Honolua Bay, Cliff House, Makena beach, and Polo Beach to name a few). The beach is very crowded though with both guests and non guests so many times we got discouraged. So one day out of curiosity we wondered what was on the "other side" of Black Rock. What a treasure we found there!!!! A beautiful wide soft sand beach that was virtually EMPTY!!! THe water was Caribbean blue and calm (even in the afternoon trade winds) and the snorkeling on that side of Black Rock was just as great (without all the people). Both times we snorkeled there we were the ONLY ones in the water! We did a snorkel sail which we booked right there at the Sheraton on the Teralani 2. It was very nice and considering the boat can hold 49 people there were only 12 on it that day. It was like a private charter! The water was choppy that day so on the way out both my husband and I were a little green. I even had a hard time eating lunch! We've stayed at the Marriott Kaanapali and the Renaissance Wailea so we had something to compare the Sheraton to. The Sheraton is a very nice, clean hotel. It is on the quiet side with not a lot of kids but if you want it noisy and with a lot of kids stay at the Westin or Hyatt. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay there. We try to stay in only 4 or 5 star hotels and it's definitely not a 5 star but it is a good solid 4 star! Please email me if you have any other questions!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for 4 nights with our two yound children (4 & 5). We booked through Priceline and then we upgraded to an Ohana Family Suite. The room was huge and very comfortable. The bathroom was giant and the room had 2 double beds as well as a queen size murphy bed. We were on the main floor so we walked out from our patio, right to the kids pool. Our room was ocean front and the view was spectacular. The beach is very crowded ,however, you can snorkel right there at Black Rock and the fish are amazing. (be sure to buy some fish food- they will be swimming right up to you) The kids pool is wonderful and not near as crowded as we expected. The food is above average and service was also very good. The hotel staff was superior especially Jeremy, Todd and Evelyn. If you are traveling with small children then the Ohana Suite is for you. It worked out perfectly. Maui was much more crowded this year than in previous years I had been there. What used to be a perfect place for honeymooners has become a number one family destination. We couldn't be more pleased being that we have kids. If you are honeymooning, I would advise you to go to Kauai.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, Best on Ka'anapali, but beach is crowded”
Reviews.Author: Alw1977
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from an eight-night trip to Maui, and stayed at the Sheraton for the first five nights of our vacation. We received a fairly good room rate by calling Starwood (we are SPG) and getting an ocean view. When we arrived, we were upgraded to a Junior Suite. Our suite was nice, but it was ground level in Bldg 4. Though I liked it, I do wish it were a floor or two higher so we had better ocean views. Nonetheless, our patio was very private and the room quite large with a separate eating area and kitchen. Not bad for about $238/night. This hotel, in my opinion, is the best on Ka'anapali. The Sheraton by far commands the best section of real estate along this very busy beach. The grounds are large, well-manicured and very spread out. The views looking back towards the middle of the island are phenomenal. The rooms are just okay, but the bed is very comfortable. I liked the pool - though we really didn't use it much. No need with Ka'anapali beach right there. My biggest disappointment was the cost to rent chair and/or cabanas. $30 a day? Get real. That's why I went to a hotel ON THE BEACH - to lay on the beach in a nice chaise lounge, and you're going to charge me extra to do so? The Sheraton is great for couples - I saw far less children at this hotel than I did at the Westin, Hyatt, etc. Nonetheless, it still seemed good for families. We are from the East Coast of the US and awoke very early each morning. Therefore, we got to enjoy the beach while it was still quiet. The beach gets quite crowded by 11:00 am, especially on weekends when the locals are out enjoying the ocean in addition to the tourists. If you do get beach chairs, I strongly suggest getting them as far from Black Rock as possible on the Sheraton property. It is much less crowded the further one gets away from this area. Black Rock has good snorkeling (and very easy), but I highly advise getting there before 9:30 to get the calmest sea conditions and to avoid the crowds. Black Rock gets very crowded later in the morning and it continues all day. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Sheraton. My only complaints are the cost of beach chairs and the so-so rooms. I don't give this property a five-star rating for these reasons, and because we moved south to Wailea for the remainder of our stay and stayed at a standout property down there.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad, and the not so ugly”
Reviews.Author: familyintheoc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, and our 2 children (5 and 8), stayed at the Sheraton May 29th - June 4th. We booked the mailed invitation deal of $775 with $100 in g/c and $185 off an Avis rental car. We booked an additional night through their website, for a total of 6 nights, 7 days. We have traveled to the Big Island and Oahu several times, but this was our first trip to Maui. We never stay in less than a 4 star hotel and we love to travel, though we mostly stay on the mainland. I called the Sheraton ahead to make sure we would not have to take a timeshare tour and I was assured we didn't. We were contacted by a Starwood vacations rep and conversed with her via email several times before our trip. Keeping all that in mind, upon our arrival we were given a lei greeting at the valet and were whisked off to our room. I've read many talk about an upgrade, and the Starwood rep knew it was our 10th anniv., however we were put in their basic very tiny room overlooking the tennis courts. Literally, there was no room for a family of 4's suitcases, I had to move some furniture outside it was so small. After going to the pool that afternoon, we came back to the room to shower and the tub and floor and walls were covered in black mold. There was no fan in the bathroom so it was a breeding ground. We have asthma, so I called the front desk and they sent someone up to show me another room. The new offered room was the same size with a view of the pool and beach. Not worth the entire re-packing, so they offered to clean it up with bleach in the morning. The next morning we decided we would try to move, since the bleach may make asthma worse, and the front desk decided to show us another room, which was a little bigger and had a better view. That room # was 2411. We packed up and actually had way more room for suitcases in the new digs. After getting a message from the Starwood rep. we went to get our g/c and she sneakily tried to book us on a timeshare tour and no wasn't an option. Not wanting to cause a major scene, we left and later left her a note that we were not interested. Just our food charges were over $1500.00, not including alot of misc. and lobby store shopping, so they did not lose any money on us! Starwood could have been honest about the offer instead of telling us they just wanted us to try the Sheraton out! On a better note, the grounds were lovely, very tropical and we loved the cliff diver and firedancer. A few times the cliff diver would let our kids help light the tiki torches, he was so nice. The pool was great, never very busy and a great temp. We rented a beach cabana one day and it was fun, and the snorkeling was great, though not as much coral as expected. We loved the Kekaa's terrace restaurant, the staff were fabulous and gave us special treatment as the week progressed. My husband had a great lobster and steak dinner one evening, and their is live music and a hula dancer each night. The salad bar free with your meal was a treat and our kids always ate free. Room service was fine, though we were bummed it had limited hours. If you are hungry at an off time the pool bar is the only place to get a bite and it was mediocre at best. We needed a microwave in our room for the week and it was $100.00....should have just bought a cheap one at walmart and left it, lol. Maid service was good, and everyone around the resort were very nice. We checked out all the hotels around the area and we believe the Sheraton was the nicest. It never felt crowded and the location was absolutely ideal. Valet would have our car waiting if we called ahead. We didn't use the concierge but we did take a ride on the Reefdancer and it was really neat. We tried to talk the kids into a helicopter ride or a submarine ride but they would only compromise on that! We had lunch one day at The Four Seasons in Wailea, we are big fans of the 4 Seasons, and it was nice (though expensive- $160 for 4), but we weren't that impressed with the style of the hotel, it didn't seem Hawaiian, just modern. Waliea beach was ok, but the beach in front of the Sheraton and the Black rock was stunning and wayyyyy better. We walked to the Grand Wailea and we weren't impressed neither, their grounds were far less manicured and tropical, an the pool didn't look as great as it did online. We also ventured to Kapalua one day and the Ritz wasn't anything to write home about neither, the weather was awful there and windy, and the beach is very far from the resort. Overall, the Sheraton is truly the best place to stay on Maui in our opinions, and even with the Starwood issues and the black mold prob in the beginning, we would certainly return. We'd just be smarter next time and book a nicer room ahead of time! With all the stuff to do on Maui, it is perfect for anyone. One last note, do not visit Twin Falls on the road to Hana, the trail gets ridiculous and it is way longer than the tourist books say....kids can't make it! And don't fly Aloha airlines, we tried them for the first time and we will never fly them again. Their food wasn't good enough to feed to a dog, the service was bad, and it is basically a daycare in the air with parents who don't watch their kids letting babies and toddlers run the aisles. We can't wait to go back to the Sheraton, it is truly beautiful and relaxing! Aloha, Parents in Orange County, CA (who just booked a private getaway to the Four Seasons in Aviara to truly celebrate our 10th anniv.)

Reviews.Title: “GREAT RESORT”
Reviews.Author: I-pinion
Reviews.Content: Boy were we spoiled by this hotel! As honeymooners, we were treated to a deluxe oceanfront room in building 6. Although it took 10 minutes and 3 elevators to get to the lobby, we were in newlywed heaven! A beautiful view of the ocean with the islands of Molokai and Lanai in the distance, soft sheets and down blanket, big bathroom with 2 sinks. Quiet room, no babies crying, no cell phones ringing, we even saw a rainbow while opening our front door. There was a private parking lot by the room, at no extra cost. However, it is a HUGE resort. One in a strip of other major chains and condos. Lots of people by the HUGE pool, which winds around in a big loop. The kids all stayed at the shallow end of the pool, and the families sat on those lounge chairs. There were really no kids at the deeper end of the pool, where the adults quietly sat and soaked in the sun (no music playing until much later in the afternoon, which was pleasant). The beach, which is right in front of the hotel, gets very crowded (the beach is public and gets people from all over for snorkeling). The hotel is at the famous "Black Rock" where everyone on the west side of Maui comes to snorkel- so snorkel early or risk fins in your face. Whaler's Village, which is a 10 minute walk away on a path along the beach, is not more than an upscale mall including the teenage mall rats. We liked eating at Leilani's and Hula Grill at the entrance of Whaler's Village. Tropica (at the Westin, just past Whaler's V) was overpriced and the service was awful. Aloha plate was an inexpensive and casual lunch spot in Lahaina, a 10 minute drive from the hotel, with decent food. Everything is extra at the hotel. On the beach, prepare to pay $15 for 2 beach chairs, and $15 for an umbrella (there is no shade otherwise- not even at the pool). Bottled water in the room was $5 (even though it was free at the Sheraton Kauai). Got ripped off with a $45 manicure. However, service was excellent and very friendly. Rent your snorkel gear in Lahaina for a fraction of the price that the hotel will charge you. Make all your plans and reservations before or immediately on arrival because things book up quickly. Follow the advice in Maui Revealed. We went to a luau in Lahaina called the Feast at Lele- which was intimate, entertaining and had great food! (The Old Lahaina Luau- which is supposed to be "the" luau books up months in advance). We took a van to sunrise at Haleakala rather than drive it ourselves- which was a great idea. We watched the sunrise and were then driven up even further to the summit. Arranged it through the hotel and it included a delicious sit-down breakfast at the Kula Lodge. Barbara- the concierge we worked with- was wonderful!! Very knowledgeable and patient. (She was worth waiting for when there was a line).

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort ! Rooms Need Some Work”
Reviews.Author: HonuGirl
Reviews.Content: Aloha, We stayed at the Sheraton Maui from 5/27 - 6/03/06. We booked the Spring Fling Rate of $195 per night plus 2 nights free using points. Our room was located in Bldg 4 right next to Blackrock which was exactly what I wanted as well as the request for a high floor which was also part of my reservation notes. We had the same room all 7 nights. We received a room with 2 balconies, one which faced the beach that all the rooms in bldg 4 have but, we also had a second balcony that was HUGE. Big enough for a party of 20 people. The views from the 2nd balcony were amazing of the West Maui Mountains, beach all the way to Kahana and the beach in front of the Sheraton. The bed was comfy, however the wood furniture needs refurnishing. I almost went out and bought some Liquid Gold to cover the scratches. It would be a real easy fix and then no one would really notice all the missing paint and scratches. The room was small. The closet is in the Bathroom. The dry wall in the bathroom needed some repair. Again, an easy fit if it was your home... if you know what I mean. So beyond all the repairs, the double balcony made up for all of it. Just Amazing! We did not really spend much time in the room .... just on the balconies...so we could over look the much needed repairs. Coffee every morning on the big balcony watching the sun rise over the West Maui Mountains. Very Relaxing. Every day/ night started around 4pm there was live Hawaiian music which flowed up to our room. We were surprised with a ok bottle of Champagne for our 20th Anniversary and enjoyed sitting on the balcony with the warm trade winds and music. We had 2 dinners at Keka'a Terrace, both very good. Fish was excellent plus they have a salad bar. The music continues from the ocean bar after the cliff diving and fire torches to the outside portion of Keka'a Terrace restaurant. We ate there on our last night with hula, music and the trade winds blowing. Very Romantic. Overall, I would agree with most that the location is the best. Fun to walk to Whalers for sunset but, get there by 5:45 for a seat at any bar for 7pm sunset. Snorkeling was excellent great red coral plus lots of fish. The Maui Aquarium was fun. Mama's fish house was great and even the salads a Cheeseburger in paradise were good. Our favorite 2 restaurants were Mala Ocean Tavern in North Lahaina (good parking) and Mama's fish house. We did eat at Aloha Mixed Plate, but just next door is Mala and the views are 100% better. I eat at L&L all the time at home and the ribs at Aloha were very good if not better. In closing, we really enjoyed our trip to the Sheraton Maui. If you can get a good deal on the room, I think the value is there. Paying $450 for our room even with the 2 balconies would be a bit much since the room is really small. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds Expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got home from spending a week at the Sheraton Maui Resort, and it was absolutely incredible... we would have LOVED to stay another week. From the moment we pulled in to the hotel valet our expectations we exceeded. We were warmly greeted with fresh Hawaiian leis and a tour of the entire premises. When we went to get our room keys we were told they upgraded us from a Partial Ocean View to a Deluxe Full Ocean View Suite. The view from our balcony was incredibly breathtaking... we overlooked the black rock, Lanai, and Molokai-- stunning! We were pleasantly surprised to learn that we were just minutes away from the capital city of Lahaina, where we spent a great deal of time shopping and eating some of the local favorites! (Ours being Cheeseburger in Paradise and David Paul's Lahaina Grill) -- The Ka'anapali Beach is said to be the best on the island, so we were thrilled to have it right in our back door. Our room was spotlessly cleaned daily, the service, staff, and ammenities were far beyond what we had expected. The resort was quiet and relaxing, but for a few screaming children at the pool. Otherwise, our trip was so good we're already planning our return! For the money, YOU CANNOT beat the class, quality, and beauty of the Sheraton Maui.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PSUGEOFF
Reviews.Content: I had booked a Ocean View room for our honeymoon. I called about a week before to find out about an upgrade and they said that they didnt have one available, however, I told the lady that it was our honeymoon and when we arrived we were told we had be upgraded to a Deluxe Ocean Front room and were greeted with Champagne. This hotel offers excellent views, great food, excellent service and an excellent location. If you are going to go to the hotel the Ocean Front View is a must!! On our last day there we woke up and we walked out to our little deck an saw a couple of sea turtles. Beds are so comfortable!!! Rooms are clean. When we called to get more towels they were at our door in under 2 minutes. That is impressive since the ocean front rooms are completely seperate from the rest of the hotel. These rooms even have their own seperate gated parking lot. The only down side is that the main lobby is about a 10 minute or so walk. On the other hand that was kind of nice. You didnt really feel like you were at a hotel. We have already started planning our trip next year and a for sure planning on staying here. Cant get a better value for your money. MUST STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Stephans01
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed for 9 nights at the Sheraton Maui, in the beginning of April. It was our second trip to Maui, and we have stayed at the Westin and Hyatt before. Our room was spacious, and beautifully furbished. We even received a free upgrade to a ocean view room, so everything was perfect. The Sheraton is by far the best hotel on Kaanapali Beach, and the location on Black Rock is just perfect. If you like snorkelling the conditions at Black Rock, are some of the best on Maui. Kaanapali is a nice area with plenty of shopping nearby. Whalers Village a lot opportunity if you're looking for upscale shopping, and the town is Lahaina, with is small boutiques and great variety of restaurants is only 10 minutes away. I'll definately recomend the Sheraton Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful grounds, Crowded beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton from 5/5 - 5/10 for our honeymoon. We got a deal for an ocean view room at $195/night. The staff was very helpful, right from check-in til check out. The bell man was great. Gave us a quick tour of the place. I let him know we were there for our honeymoon and he went ahead and had room service bring us a complimentary bottle of champagne. We had an ocean view room in Building 4 which was nice. It was also very clean and housekeeping did a decent job of tidying up contrary to some other reviews. The sweet sleeper bed wasn't anything like a Westin heavenly bed, but it was still very comfy. The hotel grounds were excellent. It wasn't as lavish as the Westin or Hyatt, but it was alot more peaceful which was perfect since we were there for our honeymoon. One drawback was the beach was very crowded since black rock is right there and that's a prime snorkeling spot. Didn't have any problems getting a chair at the pool. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants at the hotel. We chose to try the numerous places that our friends suggested. And they were all great. Breakfast, try Gazebo in Napili and The Plantation house in Kapalua. Fast food take out, Honokowai Okazuya & Deli. Try the ono (wahoo) there. Outstanding. Sushi, definitely hit up Sansei in Kapalua. Back to the hotel (pardon the pun), overall it was great, especially for the price. Would definitely stay there again if we could get that same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, convenient and staff were helpful”
Reviews.Author: Rebemdee
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5/5-5/8, in an ocean view room in building 2. We got the room for $195 a night through bookit, but add to that a 17.71 daily "resort fee" for parking, coffee in the room, newspaper, and the fee isn't optional. The first day of valet is complimentary, then 5 bucks a day thereafter, plus tip, but you are already paying for parking in the resort fee. There are lots of spaces in the parking garage, and it's very close to the lobby so you aren't saving yourself a lot of time by using valet. Remember to tell the front desk you wont be using valet parking after the first day. Your room key gets you into the parking garage. The room was clean, the bed had nice linens, the bathroom had adequate towels, soap, lotions, shampoo, conditioner. There is a small fridge, and it costs extra to have a microwave in the room. There is a lot of closet/dresser space. There is a laundry facility in building 4, WAY across the complex. It's 2 bucks for the washer, 2 for the dryer, and 1 for the detergent. If you do more than one load, or have family sized laundy, you would do better going into town, or at least buying a box of detergent at Longs. The service was pleasant. I had emailed asking for a king size bed and we were not given one; I asked reception to change it and it took about 10 minutes but it was changed. The travel agent in the lobby is very nice, but you will get better deals if you look around, but it is convenient for them to do all the planning for you and print out your tickets. The food by the pool was average; we had nachos that quickly turned soggy. The breakfast buffet was expensive; 23 bucks for each adult, but we liked the variety and the food.
