A BETTER breakfast bet is driving north to Napali Shores (you'll see an itty bitty sign on the condo sign for "The Gazebo"), park, walk through the complex down to the water, and you'll get to The Gazebo restaurant. Their Big Kahuna omelet and Macadamia Pancakes fed two adults for under 25 bucks, and we couldn't eat it all. Get there by 7:15 am to avoid lines; otherwise you'll wait 30 to 45 minutes in line to be seated. The snorkeling at Black Rock is okay but crowded and you have to watch out for people jumping off the rock onto your head. You'll do better going to Makena Landing or 2.1 miles north past Office Road to the reserve. The beach at the Sheraton is lovely and perfect for families. The pool is beautiful; we got out there early and were the only people in it. We really enjoyed it. I would stay here again, but only if I got a deal. I wouldn't spend $400 a night, because I didn't think it was worth that, but I would spend $200 a night, due to the nice facility, convenient location, great pool and beach, decent snorkeling, and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: MsMaplewood
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui 4/19-4/26. It was our 3rd visit to Kaanapali and first at the Sheraton. Usually we stay at the Hyatt, which is beginning to show much wear and tear for the prices they charge. We got a great deal ($195.00 a night, oceanview room, through bookit.com) Upon check in, we were upgraded to deluxe oceanview. Everyone was nice, the room was well kept and updated. The beach at Black Rock is the best part of the strip and Whaler's Village is a quick walk. We had lunch by the pool a couple of times, service was spotty. Food was just decent. Better to go to Whaler's Village (Leilani's is consistently good), Lahaina, Pacific'O is great or for breakfast/lunch Rte 30, towards Kapalua, CJ's is reasonable, fresh, fast and good. Our only negative about the Sheraton was that our room housekeeping was substandard. We had to ask for extra towels, regularly. Plus, the room was barely cleaned daily. The rest of the hotel was immaculate. We had a great visit and would definitely go back to the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: oclife
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from the Sheraton Maui this week. We were able to get a a rate of $180/night (through hotwire) and the rate was outstanding for what we got. Upon check-in, we were automatically upgraded to a partial ocean view. I agree with what the previous poster said about the room. It was clean but nothing special to write home about. The hallways to the guest rooms are pretty dirty (torn, spotted carpet, ripped wallpaper) but once we were in our room we were very happy. Also nice was having our own personal refrigerator in the room!! The location of the Sheraton is outstanding in that it has one of the best beaches and the snorkeling in front of the hotel is amazing. We did the walk all the way down to the Hyatt and while I think the Hyatt hotel is much nicer (pools, rooms, restaurants, etc), the beach in front of the Hyatt doesn't compare to what we had at the Sheraton. My only recommendation when staying here would be to avoid eating at the Sheraton restaurants. We tried the breakfast buffet one morning and the food and service were both horrible. At $25/person, couldn't justify going back. The food at the pool is mediocre, at best. I guess that I shouldn't be complaining though when being served while lounging in the sun. At $180/night, I'd absolutely recommend this hotel..If it was $250+/night, I'd consider looking at the Hyatt or even the Westin. Overall, we had a good experience at Sheraton. I am glad we chose the Sheraton over the Ritz Carlton. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, solid four star”
Reviews.Author: maui2006
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Maui last week. At $220/night (through priceline) it was worth the price. We were upgraded to an Ocean View suite at check-in. This is a solid 4 star hotel. In my opinion, a 5 star hotel is a Mandarin Oriental (Honolulu), Omni or Palace Hotel (San Francisco) or Quail Lodge (Carmel, CA). Room: Room was clean, nice, but not luxurious. Bathroom was spacious, huge king size bed, but the tv was 19". The room was in the furthest building from the lobby/beach (building 6) which meant we had to walk through two buildings and get on two elevators to get to the beach/pool. Location: the Sheraton's location on Kaanapali beach is excellent! After seeing Wailea, I prefer Kaanapali. Both beaches are nice, but Kaanapali is wider and longer. Service: Check-in was painless. It took less then 5 minutes as we drove up, was presented with lei's and given a room key. Pool guys were friendly and the maids would always say aloha when we passed by as we made our trek towards the pool. In terms of the wait staff, we had one meal, the breakfast buffet. The server was nice but not attentive. At $20+/person for breakfast, I expected better service. Plates were not cleared and we had to flag the server down twice to get drinks. We didn't interact with the front desk until checkout. Staff was efficient but not exactly friendly. She didn't ask us how we enjoyed our stay and was not apologetic that the maid service had mistakenly taken our personal item. Overall, we had a good experience at Sheraton. I am glad we chose the Sheraton over the Ritz Carlton. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Sheraton is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sheraton Maui 04/10-04/17 with our 2 children ages 6 and 11. This hotel is fabulous, it has stunning gardens and views and is right on the beach at Black Rock. We had a ocean view in the main building and I would say this was the best location to have. The rooms are spacious and clean and you even get bath robes! We also had a complimentry breakfast each morning which included everything from cereals, pastries. packcakes to salads and hot fresh prepared bacon eggs etc. The restaurants are also fantastic, the main restaurant served gorgous food and the kids ate free! We also visited the japanese restaurant, which is well worth a visit, the food is cooked in front of you by the chef who does special knife tricks and food tricks - great for kids and adults! Black rock is impressive, the snorkling great, even for my 6 year old. We stayed on Easter Sunday, and the hotel had a couple of events on for the kids, an easter egg hunt and you could also purchase a duckie and decorate it, which then went into a main duckie race in the swimming pool, which had top prizes for the first 15 ducks that finished! It was great fun for the family. Overall I loved Maui and am so glad we chose the Sheraton to stay in, 5* all the way in my opinion!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cathybSavannah_Ga
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to Hawaii and stayed at the Sheraton for 4 nights. I am pleased to say that overall it is a lovely hotel. The location and landscaping is beautiful. We had 2 ocean-view rooms that they upgraded us to. The view was of the grounds and the ocean. Our rooms were just average as far as decor goes, but they were very large and comfortable. The bathrooms could be a little more elegant for what you are paying to stay there. We valet parked our car and found that very helpful. The concierge made several reservations for us and she definately knows her job. Everything she recommened was excellent. The luau they have there on Wed nights is very good. Great entertainment and the food was to die for. I highly recommend seeing that if you can. There were only 2 things we had problems with and one was room service. Tried calling and was told the girl who takes orders was away from the phone and would have to call me back. After a few minutes we called the resturant manager and the problem was quickly resolved.. The other thing was the temp of the pool. The pool is beautiful and would have been great fun if the water had not been sooooo cold. My children could hardly stand it and believe me they will swim in almost anything. But overall we had a great stay that we will remember forever.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton from 4/10 - 4/17. Been to Maui before and stayed previously at the Grand Wailea and the Renaissance Wailea. Got a great deal at the Sheraton for 2 rooms. We were pleasantly surprised. Upgraded to oceanview (Bldg. 3). Our kids loved the snokeling right out front. Our teenager loved walking to Whaler's Village to shop. The rooms were fine. The only thing the kids missed was having a more elaborate pool area (like at the Grand Wailea) but I did NOT miss the crowds. They were able to take a scuba lesson right out front. We would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely gorgeous! My wife & I stayed here in March 2006 and loved it. The grounds are soo beautiful. I've traveled a fair amount (domestically & internationally) and this is one of the top five most beautiful hotels that I've ever stayed at. I love the open air lobby; it has such a tropical, laid back feel. It was pretty early when we arrived in Maui and I wouldn't normally ask to see if we could check in so early, but my wife just said, let's give it shot. I was surprised to hear we were able to check in. All staff were very friendly our whole stay there. We got a mountainview room, and thought we lucked out because not only did we have a picturesque view of the mountains, but we actually had a slight view of the ocean too. It wasn't the beach right in front of the hotel, but just north of it. Since we were facing east, we saw the sunrise one morning from behind the mountains and it was beautiful! The room was very very nice; nothing spectacular, but definitely very nice. The parking garage was a hassle to get to and you could definitely get lost, so I would ask an employee for directions or just use valet. The pool was nice. The employees were pretty knowledgeable about the ocean. We didn't get to go snorkel at Black Rock, which was very disappointing; there was high surf on the last & only day we had time to go. The beach in front of the hotel is pretty narrow (from the edge of the water to the back end of the sand). It was always very crowded, so we actually walked down to the beach near Whaler's Village (a short walk); there was way more room to spread out there. We also ate a couple times at Whaler's Village, but we found ourselves driving to Lahaina alot because there were so many more dining options. For the runners out there, there wasn't really a great place to go running. The beach was fairly angled (not to mention crowded) and the path in front of the beach was full of people (but not angled). So, we ended up running on the roads (not crowded or angled), but there's only so much road before you get on the main highway, if you will, and we didn't really want to venture out on that road. So, we ran where we could and it worked out fine. Overall, we had an amazing stay!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: kemahone
Reviews.Content: - very nice accomodations in Building #6 and easy parking near our room. We found out we probably would've been updgraded there if we had booked the next level down so we could've saved $200 per night. However, we weren't disappointed in the quality for what we paid. - great snorkeling right from the hotel beach - swam with sea turtles - beautiful view of Molokai from our room, saw a whale from our room on our last day there - food expensive but good, room service food was great - nice location, easy access to Lahaina with lots of restaurants, shops, and activities - pool towels inconvenient, sales people pushing the moisturizer and suntan lotion seemed inappropriate - beach chairs, snorkel equipment should be included for guests in the cost of the daily resort fee - in general, service was good but we had one problem at checkout. There was a charge on our bill that looked like we hadn't returned our beach chairs that we rented. We did return them and there was no receipt to prove that we had. The front desk personnel tried to call beach services to clear up the confusion but no one answered, so she removed the charge from our bill until she could verify it. However, when we got home we saw that they ended up charging our credit card after we left.

Reviews.Title: “Standard, overpriced Maui resort”
Reviews.Author: jenna0043
Reviews.Content: We had to stay here for a conference. If you like this sort of place, it's great--everything you could possibly want within a few short miles. However, to me it all looked fake--manicured, covered in tourists (and especially their kids), and nearly impossible to get peace and quiet. The rooms are nice enough, average I'd say, but way more $$ than I'd ever pay myself (and we even got a deal). The hallways let in alot of noise, so you hear every drunken carousal and kid scream that goes by. They're also a bit tattered in places--worn paint, carpet, etc--but only in the halls. The snorkeling is good, if you can avoid getting kicked in the face by the crowds of people flailing in the water. If you rent a car and get out of the tourist areas, it's better, but I'd recommend the Big Island over Maui if given a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at th Sheraton Maui for 6 days for our honeymoon. We were delighted with the hotel and had a fantastic time. Maui is a great chill out place and the Sheraton is a perfect place to stay. Yes, Maui is expensive but it doesn't have to be. We ate at Whalers Village some nights at the food court where pizza, burgers, salads are available at very good prices and then most days we visited the supermarkets and made up our own picnics. If you want to eat out every night I can imagine is would be very pricey. The buffet breakfast was amazing and we were upgraded to an ocean view room without asking which was great. The view was brilliant and we could watch the cliff diving and sunset all from our balcony. We were also blessed with the weather as there had been 6 weeks of rain before we arrived. We were averaging 80-85 degrees every day. Great holiday, great hotel. Would definately go back....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place-Don't believe any negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: Spdmonkey
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I can't beleive the previous review was of the same place I stayed. I was at the Sheraton-Maui from 3/24 thru 3/30 and I can honestly say that it was one of the most fantastic resorts I've been to and in the past six weeks I've traveled the globe staying in great places. You've all read about the location and it is fantastic. Its easy to get to from the airport. You will need a rental car as its more than $60 for a taxi ride from the airport each way and that will pay for a sub-compact for the week. In any case we arrived to the free valet parking (first day) and a lei greeting and check in was less than a minute with a complimentary upgrade from the garden room we booked to a full ocean view. Note that I did not even ask-they already had the upgrade before I even said I had an SPG card. At no time were we asked to do a timeshare presentation. The hotel is trying out a new way of speeding up the check-in and arrival process and from my point of view it worked great and was super smooth and the staff was extremely pleasant. We did eat at the hotel restaurant Keka's Terrace and the Mahi-Mahi was fantastic after a long day of traveling. We were in building 3 on the top floor(6) with a view thru the palm trees of the ocean and a bit of the pool. The grounds were magnificent and very well maintained so I have no idea what the previous reviewer is talking about. Never was anything out of place even as Maui went thru 40 straight days of heavy rain and flooding. The sun never did come out fully so we were able to get chairs by the pool or spots on the beach. Always had no problems with service outside.The hot-tub is well hidden and many people miss it altogether. Pool was a little cool as there was no sun that week. This is a large property so depending on which building you were in it could take 10 minutes to get to the parking garage, but most people go to Hawaii to relax-whats your hurry? why complain. You go to Maui for some seclusion-yes it can be crowded at times, but it is a resort with what 600 rooms? on the whole the pace of Maui is perfect-very relaxed. The location of the Sheraton is great just at the end of the row of resorts and walking distance to Whalers Village shopping center. I went up to the Ritz-Carlton and down to Wailea to see the Four Seasons and frankly thought the Sheraton was their equal. The service was superior. Our TV remote stopped working and then the TV altogether and within 5 minutes of informing the front desk there was a maintenance man there to repair it (the cord had pulled out of the tv and it was covered by a plate to keep the guests out) so my wife could watch LOST. We were also entertained by the whales breaching. We saw them from the room as well as the beach. There were a few sea turtles around Black Rock too, but alot of snorkelers kind of sent them swimming away. EVERYBODY walks down to snorkel Black Rock! Surf was rough, although not nearly as rough as down the beach towards the Westin and others where there were some big waves. Although the weather was bad due to a low pressure system affecting all the islands we had a great relaxing time. There was not one thing that was bad so again I think the previous reviewer had an axe to grind. Its not cheap, but nothing on Maui is. Despite a funnel cloud on Maui and a tornado on Lanai along with severe flooding the trip was great. Dinner on our last night was at Teppan-Yaki DAN in the hotel and it was great with a great show-make sure you get reservations and note they are closed Sun/Mon. I have been home for a few days and can't wait to go back. This time we are bringing the kids too and we WILL be staying at the Sheraton Maui.

Reviews.Title: “We had a deal -- and it was delightful”
Reviews.Author: Bobbigirl
Reviews.Content: We got an offer for $750 for two for 5 nights (you did not have to listen to a presentation, but more about that later) and because it was going to be our 50th anniversary, we thought it would be a great idea to go. For starters, we had enough miles to go 1st class (with a small extra payment) on Aloha Airlines; the flight was great (we never had flown first class) and the service excellent (food sort of ordinary, but perfectly fine.) A rental car was included in our deal; we arrived at the Sheraton to be greeted by friendly people with leis, our room was upgraded (bldg. 6, first floor, opening out to a lovely lawn and a sweeping ocean view)and our room was big, clean, and had very comfortable beds. A plus for us animal lovers was that a couple of feral cats were being fed outside our room (we left some $ for the nice employees who did this) and we enjoyed watching them eat and play. They were upgrading the pool "slide" and we wondered how that would be given construction noise, etc. Not a problem. I suppose if we'd had kids along, it might have mattered -- and the reciprocity with the Westin next door had been revoked, which, again, might have been a problem with a family group, but we were content to stay where we were. Food (we ate dinner there twice) was very good. Expensive, but all of Hawaii is expensive. We went into Lahaina for more inexpensive meals which were excellent. (Took along "Maui for Dummies" which has excellent recommendations for food.) Had fabulous sushi at a place in Kanapali (spelling). Despite the fact that the place was huge, we never had that "big hotel" feeling, and fortunately our building had been renovated so the rather dilapidated carpet in some of the halls wasn't still in ours. We did do the "presentation" for a timeshare, only because we wanted to go horseback riding and the payback for attending covered that cost. We told the people before even signing up that we would not, repeat not, ever sign up for a timeshare, so we didn't feel as though we were cheating them. (It was supposed to take 90 minutes but took 3 hours, but it was raining so it didn't really cut into our vacation time.) We could never afford the usual price at the Sheraton, but for the deal we were offered, it was paradise at a very low cost. If we were to win the lottery (which we don't play) we'd go back in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, not well-kept”
Reviews.Author: abol
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a four star property. It is more on par with a Holiday Inn. If you have a choice, stay at the Westin down the beach or the Four Seasons in Wailea. The Sheraton suffers from horrible customer service, and is overrun with conventions. The restaurants are mediocre at best, the pool is average, and the property is not well-maintained. I have been to Maui over 20 times, and this is the first and last time I will stay at the Sheraton. The one plus to this property is the unbeatable location on Black Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Maui on the third leg of our honeymoon in the US. We absolutely loved it. We were welcomed by the polite and efficient staff on arrival and our room was upgraded to a full ocean front room. The room was gorgeous and we settled in whilst drinking our complimentary champagne. It was nice to get some special treatment as honeymooners. The grounds of the hotel are immaculate, beautifully manicured lawns, a lovely lagoon pool and an extensive pond with lots of koi that you can feed in the mornings with fish food from the hostess stand. The pool was lovely to swim in although it did seem as though it had a lot of chlorine in it. There are two pool bars to choose from and we found the service to be pretty good most of the time. There is also entertainment by the pool every day from late afternoon onwards ending with the cliff diving ceremony which is a really nice touch. We ate in the hotel restaurant a couple of times and enjoyed good food and nice wine. There is also entertainment on the restaurant terrace during dinner. The beach is right in front of the hotel and even if you don't like to snorkel it is so beautiful just for walking or watching the world go by. Watch out for the surf though! We found that there were not quite enough restaurants in Kaannapali for our liking unless you want to eat in the other hotels so travelled into Lahaina a fair bit. The town is nice and definitely worth a visit on the trolley from Whaler's Village. If you go during the day, visit the Cool Cat Cafe for one of the best burgers on Maui! We loved it. Overall we loved this hotel and will definitely go back again if we can ever travelling on the West coast again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mauilvr
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in March. The grounds were amazing. The rooms were very nice, with everything we needed & comfy beds. Before we went I really worried about having a room that was a long walk to everything. Our room was about the farthest you could get from the hubub, but it still was a couple minutes. Well setup. Wonderful staff, great breakfast. Blackrock gets really busy after 10:00 am.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In November we stayed at the Sheraton on a business promotion trip. Wow were we impressed! I had read mixed reviews and found them to be way off the mark. It's been 4 months now and I think of our trip all the time and can't wait to return. We took our 2 sons and we all had a marvelous time. The hotel and grounds were gorgeous and the beach was incredible. What a wonderful place to relax. Our rooms were very clean and spacious with beautiful views of the grounds and ocean. We saw lots of sea turtles snorkeling off of black rock. We also found it easy to catch the hotel shuttel into Lahaina for shopping and dinning. The walkway by the beach was also a plus. Only a short walk to Whalers Village. We are already planning our next trip back. Bigfork Montana

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kona2069
Reviews.Content: This was my 22nd trip to Hawaii and the 16th to Maui, so I can say that I have great experience dealing with all sorts of hotels, condos, b&b's in hawaii, plus I am an event planner and stay at some of the absolute best hotels all over the world. I stayed here March 1-4, 2006, just a quick side trip from the Big Island. The Sheraton Maui is an ideal hotel in about the most perfect setting on Kaanapali Beach. Close to shops, restaurants and Lahaina. The snorkeling off Black Rock is truly some of the best and you are guaranteed to see sea turtles and eagle rays on occaission, too. This was my first time actually staying at the Sheraton Maui. All other times on Maui we would spend a day or two on the beach in front of the hotel enjoying the snorkeling, sun and sand. While the hotel underwent complete rennovation about 5 years ago, it still looks great-I was on Maui in December 2005 and visited this property and they were doing typical low season house cleaning back then and it showed on this trip. The only negative thing I will say is that the pool's chemicals are awful...it smells like windshield wiper fluid so I did not spend any time in the pool, but, why would you when you have the ocean twenty steps in front of you? I will most likely not stay here again only because I have other favorites on the island that are much more secluded and more Hawaiian. However, I highly reccommend it for families and honeymooners. Keep in mind during winter months, the beach in front of the hotel almost disappears but returns in the summer for perfect beach walking! Lastly, restaurants--Mala in Lahaina & Mama's in Paia are not to be missed! Also, for the Buffalo NY's review before mine...all beaches in Hawaii are public...which is why Hawaii is so special...no one is excluded from the beauty of nature...if you want private, head to the Carribean or Mexico! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Maui, 3rd Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sherton in May 2005 and had a great time.. We went for 6 nights and didn't have time to do what all we wanted to do and see. We didn't get to do the Volcano tour, but I heard it's a must even though you have to get up at the crack of dawn to go.. The drive thru Hana is so worth it.. Seeing all of the Island and all of the lush area of the Island. The hotel itself was nice.. A bit older from what I would consider a 4 star hotel, but it was still nice. I loved being able to swim right off the beach and snorkel.. They have a big black rock right by the hotel that has tons of fish swimming all around it, so great for snorkeling. Be aware of the bugs.. I'm not sure if this is a problem at other hotels, but we saw three roaches in our room.. I had read reviews before and new this might be a problem so we didn't say anything until our last days on the trip.. The hotel was really nice and offerd to change our rooms, but we had one more day and somehow I didn't think changing rooms would help the bug problem.. they did however offer a dinning gift card which was nice. Just be aware of the bugs and leaving your slidding door open isn't a good idea because of bugs possibly getting in. The food was really good at pretty much everywhere we went. I would recommend the Macademia Nut Waffles for breakfast over at the Grand Waliea Hotel. The Grand Waliea is a VERY NICE Hotel, I've also stayed there twice in previous trips to Maui, but it's extremely expensive for a beach front room in the 500's. I would recommend checking out that area, maybe get up and go have breakfast in there grand eating area. and then check out the beach and then later drive over to Mama's Fish House for lunch.. It's been known to see alot of surfers there.. We went for dinner, so no surfers when we went. Mama's Fish House is pricey, so I wouldn't recommend it, if on a budget but it's nice and well known.. I would recommend getting a rental care, because there's so many places to go and see.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views/Location & Wonderful Service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel two vacations ago and I can't stop thinking about what a wonderful time we had and our hotel had a lot to do with it! We were going to rent a condo and I'm really happy we decided to upgrade to this hotel. The hotel was being upgraded in some areas of their property when we arrived nevertheless the construction did not get in our way of having a fabulous time. The staff greated us in such a friendly way that really made us feel welcome. The people we met at the hotel were a great group of people. Being that we were two single young ladies and this hotel was more for romantic couples, the location still made it easy for us to be able to go out to nearby nice restaurants and clubs. There's great shopping right near the hotel and the pool was pretty Fabulous as well. If we didn't feel like swimming at the pool, the ocean was within arms length and you can swim around the "Black Rock" and see some great marine life. Oh and at sunset every night a man jumps off the the Big Rock which was very entertaining. The restaurants in the hotel was great and they had some great live music in the evenings. Oh and most importantly being that we are seattleites we love our morning espresso and every morning the hotel had an Espresso stand that just so happened to be right near our room which made some great lattes! I'll definitely be heading back to Maui in the near future and I will stay in Kannapali again at the Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: katymilli
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. The location on the beach must be the envy of all the other hotels in the area. The standard of accommodation is high. We were located in the ocean view room which had a view of pool, beach and black rock. The pool was a delight, it's layout meant that it never felt overcrowded. Whalers Village is located a mere 10 minutes walk away. There a number of good restaurants situated here which in comparison to the hotel offer better value for money. We would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: toddtravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Feb 13-18, 2006. Enjoyed most every aspect, especially the "6" building (rooms directly on the sea wall facing the open ocean with views of Molokai & Lanai). The hotel layout rambles here and there and takes a day or two just to "learn" your way around. But there are enough gorgeous views along the way to distract you. Winter is whale watching season in Maui and you can't get a much better seat to watch the whales (and sea turtles) than right on your balcony!! The rooms are pleasant, roomy and well-kept. If you stay in this building (considered "deluxe ocean view"), do NOT valet park your car. Park in the lot directly at the building (very convenient). Go snorkeling along Black Rock (right in front of the hotel). It's one of the best snorkeling experiences we've had! The location along Kaanapali Beach allows you to take advantage of the many restaurants, shops and other hotels along the sea walk (Leilani's on the Beach for dinner). Be sure to walk all the way up to the Hyatt Regency and check out the grounds there (very beautiful).

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: dardan
Reviews.Content: While the Sheraton is in a great location and is a pretty resort, we felt that you could get more for your money at smaller resorts. This was our 4th trip to Maui and we love driving to visit different beaches during the day and visiting the awesome restaurants at night. The Sheraton was costly and all the add-ons i.e. $17/day resort fee, $5 valet parking fee plus tips, made it not as good for a place to sleep and have coffee in the am. I will stay up the coast a bit more in a smaller place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: RichardTN
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton has recently been upgraded and it was a wonderful place to stay. Our room seemed brand new and we had a great view of the grounds and ocean. We got a package that included the breakfast buffet - it was great. The service was good, everyone was helpful. We had no complaints. We used the pool, went snorkeling and got some sun on the beach. The hotel is located behind mountains which keeps the rain away. Even though it was raining in other parts of the island, it was sunny in Kaanapali. I would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton was okay. Nothing special. The pool was nice - lagoon like. You have to get your own towels around the pool, which isn't a big deal, but when you are paying $450 for a small room, I would at least expect towels on the beach chairs. We stayed in Waikiki at the Halekulani for $350 in 2004 for our honeymoon and we had better poolside service. The room was quite small for the money (again, compared to the Halekulani). The location is nice with Black Rock snorkeling which was very good. We did have a huge cockroach in our room the next to last night we were there. They did give us a $15 voucher, but we could only use it at one of the Sheraton restaurants or down by the pool and we had already planned our meals for the last day before heading to the airport. Asked for the $15 to be taken off the hotel bill, but they wouldn't do it. Resort fee is annoying, and it is a long walk from the parking garage. When I read the reviews before going, I noticed that most people who love it were the ones that got upgraded to a suite. I was hoping for that, but it didn't happen. All in all, it was okay, but not worth the money. I think you are definitely paying for location. Oh and the bathrooms don't have toothpaste, and other toiletries that you would expect.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful honeymoon stay - we loved the Sheraton Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Sheraton Maui on our honeymoon in August, 2005. Right upon entering we were greeted by the hotel staff - they had everything ready for our stay. The hotel staff was very friendly and unloaded our bags and escorted us to an upgraded room with a full beach view. Upon getting to our room we had been ordered a complimentary bottle of champagne and sat on our balcony listening to Hawaiian music drift into our room. The week was filled with wonderful activies. You can either go through the hotel concierge or book on your own. You will save about 15-20% if you book on your own. There is terrific snorkeling just steps outside the Sheraton at Black Rock - our favorite on the island(rent gear in Lahaina and save $$) Everything about the Sheraton Maui was wonderful - the rooms, staff, Hawaiian music at night, tiki torches, location, snorkelin, etc, etc. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: shrinkwrapped40
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton Maui from 12/28/05-1/6/05 for our 10-year anniversary. The hotel was wonderful, and we had a great time. We were upgraded from a mountain view to a partial-ocean view room upon arrival. Iâ€™m not sure what was partial about the ocean view, as it had an incredible view of the North side of Kaanapali. Not sure if we just lucked out, or if they did it for our anniversary, or if giving them our Starwoord Preferred Guest number in advance helped. The hotel rooms are of typical size. We did not have any of the room problems mentioned in earlier reviews. We stayed on the top (6th) floor of our building (#3), which made our view better, but I noticed that the size of the lanais get smaller on the higher floors. Our lanai was only a few feet deep, with room only for one chair and side table. If you want a bigger lanai, you may want to get a lower floor level. Here are some more tips based on our experience: Pool/beach lounging: When we first got there, it was during the peak season, and the hotel was full. As a result, the lounge chairs for the pool were all claimed by people leaving towels, books, and the like on them very early in the morning. There was also a long line to rent beach lounge chairs as soon as the rental desk opened at 8 am. Fortunately, I had called a week before we arrived and reserved a beach cabana for the days we planned to be on the beach, at $35 per day. Even though we noticed that other hotels donâ€™t charge quite so much for their cabanaâ€™s, we thought this was money well spent. We never had to worry about getting in line early in the morning, and the cabanas have a sun shade that you can put up or down as you like. I did notice that after January 2nd, the rush for lounge chairs decreased quite a bit as peak season had ended, so the rush on pool chairs and rentals might only be an issue during peak seasons. Activities: The Teralani catamaran snorkel cruise was excellent, which I highly recommend. Driving to Hana was also well worth it. Hana itself is okay, but itâ€™s the drive there and the stops along the way that are the real attraction. Snorkeling at Black Rock is excellent, but can get crowded. Lots of people come from other areas to the stretch of beach in front of the Sheraton, as it is probably the best stretch of beach along Kaanapali. The pool at the Sheraton is nice, but some of the other resorts have pools that are more like a water park, such as the Westin, the Maui Ocean Club, and the Grand Wailea on the south side of the island. If you are bringing the kids and they want the water park experience, you may want to consider one of those hotels. If you want the best beach, go to the Sheraton. Restaurants: We ate at many great restaurants while we were there, but also had some disappointments. In general, the restaurants located at hotels were less appealing than the stand-alone establishments. Hula Grill was my favorite. Just about a quarter-mile walk along the beach path from the Sheraton in the Whalerâ€™s Village (a very nice outdoor mall). Both their dining area, as well as the â€œbarefoot barâ€� were excellent. I also enjoyed Leilaniâ€™s in Whalerâ€™s Village. Lahaina has many great restaurants- we ate at Ruthâ€™s Chris because my wife had never been to one, which was great. We also ate at Mamaâ€™s Fish House on the east side of Maui, which was excellent with an incredible view and grounds, but they try to up-sell you on everything, the most ridiculous being coffee after dinner â€“ you can get the house coffee, but theyâ€™ll try to talk you into the premium coffee for even more $! The breakfast buffet at the Sheraton was very good, but way overpriced at $25 per person. Tepanyaki-Dan was also very good, but it took 45 minutes before our tableâ€™s Tepanyaki Chef to begin cooking. The Sushi restaurant at the Mariott Ocean Club was good, but way too understaffed with their servers very overwhelmed despite their best efforts. The most disappointing meal was at the Tropica restaurant at the Westin. We singed up for their New-Yearâ€™s Eve Gala Dinner for $95 a plate, and had terrible service. They were completely unorganized. Meals on your own: Everything is expensive on Maui. Tropical drinks at the Sheraton go for about $9 each, and dinner for two is usually going to run between $70-$140 or more very easily. Because of this, we decided to do most breakfasts and lunches on our own, and then order as many drinks and go to as many nice dinners as we wanted. We stopped by the Safeway in Lahaina to stock up on breakfast and lunch groceries, and made use of the refrigerator in our room. The ABC store in Whalerâ€™s Village also has some grocery items. We also picked up a travel cooler at Longâ€™s Drug store in Lahaina to take lunches with us to the beach. This worked out very well, so if youâ€™re trying to stick to a budget, this helped out a lot. In all, we had a great time. While some of the resorts in Wailea might be a little more luxurious, the Sheraton seemed to strike just the right balance between being a beautiful upscale resort while having a laid back atmosphere. We would definitely stay at the Sheraton Maui again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely site lousy deal”
Reviews.Author: NeglectedCustomer
Reviews.Content: Anyone booking this hotel is well advised to double-check what they will be paying for. A resort charge of $17 daily is levied on top of occupancy and state taxes. Our quoted room rate of $405 became $460. The resort charge was supposed to cover 'extras', most of which did not apply to us (ie free kids meals, car parking) and in any case are provided by most hotels as standard. In addition, although the external environment is good, the rooms and corridors were not of high standard. Balconies are too small to take more than one chair. Tea/coffee making facilities are a joke. The restaurant was no better than others on the beach, but the price of breakfast was actually double! The quality of information available was limited to whatever the staff could sell us, and even misleading at times. We felt we were being ripped off the whole time, and very quickly took to using restaurants and facilities off site. We would revisit Maui, but next time we will stay down the beach at the Hyatt Regency, and only visit to look at the beautiful Koi carp in the ponds. The Sheraton is not good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paradise location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fabulous stay at the Sheraton Maui from December 24-30, 2005. The grounds and pools were immaculate and so inviting. The views from the hotel are the best, especially with Black Rock, which gives the hotel a feel of privacy. The food was very good at both the pools' bars for lunch and the breakfast at Keka's Terrace. Our room was large, comfortable, and well-appointed with a roomy lanai to sit out on. The location on Maui is the best, and our family has made reservations for next Christmas, even though it is a crowded time to go to Maui. With the sparkling clean blue pools, great snorkling just steps away, and the friendly unpretentious atmosphere, the Sheraton Maui is the place to stay for a fairly quiet and relaxing vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Pool is so cold!!!”
Reviews.Author: mmstar1
Reviews.Content: We visited with our three children, ages 4,9 and 13. We thought we would be spending lots of time in the pool, but it was too cold even for the kids. Why would a nice resort skimp like this? The first time we stayed at the resort, I thought that it was just an anomaly. After the second visit and reading many reviews, I'm confident that the management knows about this problem but still chooses to keep it cold.

Reviews.Title: “great spot for young ones”
Reviews.Author: Fraze09
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton for 1 week in November with our little guy(22 months). The room we had was great (oceanview) with a nice King size bed , fridge and crib.(Microwave would be nice). Safeway is close by for stocking up on snacks, and the Outback Steakhouse in Napili was very good.Whalers village is exceptional. Can be affordable with some good planning on meals etc.(reviews are very helpful) For our little one , the Kids wading pool was fantastic. There were folks from the Westin using it as the pool there is a little deep for the small kids. The service poolside was great (activities co-ordinator and waitresses were constantly close by.) The beach and black rock area is well kept and seemed to be the main beach snorkelling area for most hotels in the area. November was a great time to go , was not quite as busy, and the weather was great. Looking at the Westin Oceanview Villas as an investment. This was my 3rd time in Maui. Many more on the horizon.

Reviews.Title: “Basic,not upscale”
Reviews.Author: FUO
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Sheraton Maui. We were there 12/24-29. I chose this hotel as the prior reviews said this was the best on Kaanapali beach. Well I beg to differ. The hotel was not at all upscale; very basic with no pizazz. The beach had a big drop off to the ocean which took most of the lounge area away. One day my daughter could not even get a chair as they were gone by 8Am. The next day she went at 7:30 and got chairs and umbrella. The pool was without any character. If you don't stake out your chair by 8AM, you won't have one. I found the staff fine and had no problems. We visited the Hyatt and the Westin-both upscale places. The best was the grand wailea, but we couldn't get a reservation. Now that's a nice hotel! The one advantage of the Sheraton was its closeness to Lahaina. We ate there several times. I would not recommend Longhi's-way overpriced and less than ordinary food. However, I can't complain about the price of the hotel. I guess you get what you pay for. I found it quiet, while the other hotels were buzzing.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: dm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the first part of our trip to Maui. When we were there, the staff was not very friendly. Snorkeling around the black rock and watching sea turtles from our balcony were the highlights of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel but way too crowded!”
Reviews.Author: GinaTay
Reviews.Content: We just got back. I love tripadvisor and always come here to decide on hotels, destinations, and activities. Because of that I want to tell you about our trip to Maui from December 23-29th, 2005. I traveled with my husband and two sons, 12 and 15. Check in was great. The valet was ready to help with our bags and the front desk check-in and check-out was a breeze. They were friendly and top notch. They gave us a lei and helped us get familiar with the area and our room. We got upgraded from a ocean view to an ocean view deluxe. Our suite was great. We had 2 queen beds, 1 Â½ baths, a family area, a beautiful view of the ocean on the nice sized deck, and a small refrigerator, sink, and microwave. The location (building 5) was right by the beach and pool. I really enjoyed the yoga classes in the morning. They really didnâ€™t have many activities for my family. They offered yoga twice a week while we were there. They also had two aqua-aerobic classes twice but the pool was too cool for me. I would have liked a little more organized activities. We loved our room and the area. Here is the problem. They have way too many people to accommodate at the beach. They lounges were rented out when we checked. There wasn't even much room to throw down a towel--we ended up right in from of the path leading from the pool area to the beach (right in the way!). That was the only day we spent at the beach because every day we tried it was the same situation. The pool chairs filled up quickly also. That isn't a problem because we are from the Midwest and getting up early and throwing a towel on the chair isn't a problem. What was a problem was that the pool was cold!! It isn't heated. For me and my family when it is in the lower 80's we need the pool to be lukewarm at least. It was icy. I am surprised that more people don't mention this. We went to the pool about 4 times and every time there was less than a hand full of people actually in the water! We tried but just couldnâ€™t enjoy it. Also, I felt guilty saving a spot for my family when people around me are trying to get a lounge and there aren't any! But if I didn't hold one my husband and kids wouldn't have one when they would come to join me. That just isnâ€™t right. I thought the Sheraton did a lot right but they were crowded and the pools need heated. Also, the pool side food is not recommended. Really because we planned on doing one fun trip a day and spending the rest of the time at the beach or pool the lack of beach accommodations and icy pool really made our down time complicated. We struggled with knowing how to spend that time. We love people but we donâ€™t like crowds. The beach was crowded. The walk on Kaâ€™anapali was crowded. Whalerâ€™s Village was crowded. So, unless were had an excursion planned we didnâ€™t know what to do. It really made it difficult at times. The laundry facilities are perfect. There is a little table outside so you can wash your clothes and still get out in the sun. All of the employees were kind and helpful. Especially the valet and the front desk. If the pool were heated and had more seating options and the beach were less crowded and there were some affordable dining options I would highly recommend the Sheraton Maui. With out that I can only tell you that I wont go back. Sorry Sheraton! I really want to give you a great review but just canâ€™t.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Stay at Sheraton Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this Sheraton property one night and immediately checked out the next day due to the total lack of cleanliness in the hotel. We had been staying in Wailea for a few nights and decided we wanted to check out Lahaina...big mistake. The carpeting in the hallway outside our room was disgusting with huge stains everywhere. The door to our room was dirty and the paint chipped. There was a giant roach crawling on the wall in the hallway. The bathrooms were 2 star quality at best and the buffet breakfast in the morning was totally sub par for the price. We could have stayed at the Ritz Carlton for $20 more...I would not recommend this hotel to anyone for the prices they are charging. This would be ok at half the rates they are charging.

Reviews.Title: “it was alright”
Reviews.Author: bubbas8
Reviews.Content: this hotel was alright, I found the location to be perfect and the hotel rooms were great but I found the front desk staff not that pleasant. I was on my honeymoon and we didn't get the room we booked, also my trip included breakfast and they forgot to give me the coupons so I had to pay for the breakfast, even though they reinbursed me at check-out it was a hassel. Other then that the beach was great and the restaurants were amazing especially the hula grill at the whaler's mall.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, but....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For a Sheraton property, which has a corporate standard, I found this place barely met my minimum expectations. Although the problems didn't deter me from enjoying my stay, problems we experienced were: 1. broken in-room safe 2. filthy wall air-conditioners 3. room service order was incorrect 4. room was left ajar by the room attendant 5. hairs were found in our bed The staff were overall friendly and you can't beat the location--which I think is why this property can command the high room rate despite these problems. We did address all the problems above, we merely got an apology, which is fine by us. I totally disagree with their 'resort fee' which is now $17.71 per day; you get like free coffee (which is only 10% Kona coffee and its disgusting), free local calls, free self-parking. Places to eat which is less expensive and delicious are: Mixed plate next door at the Kanapali hotel (buffet with prime rib), CJ Deli, Whaler's mall--pizza, chinese food, Giovanni's - a bit more expensive but worth it, and the dinner special at the Hula Grill (gotta go before 6pm). Rent snorkel gear for the week at Snorkel Bob's instead of getting it from the hotel Enjoyed the time there although a tad bit disappointed for a Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Probably just bad luck”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were at the Sheraton when it was extremely full over Thanksgiving. We are not usually ones to complain (especially in paradise) but ended up changing out of two rooms - the first was for guests with disabilities and we couldn't take a shower without all the water coming out onto the floor. This wasn't a problem in the second room because the shower didn't work at all. They very nicely offered Starwood points/gift certificate for our trouble which was appreciated. By and large the employees were very nice and the pool is great for either very small children (in the kiddie pool) or much older children. Our daughter is in the middle of that and couldn't really swim without us swimming with her up and down the river. Also the pool is very cold. This was partially alleviated by her favorite activity - feeding the koi at 10:00 a.m. Can't beat the location or the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui vs Westin Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Split our 10 night stay between Westin Maui and Sheraton Maui. For our family, Sheraton was the preferred location overall. Your opinion may be different. Read on. Westin Maui: 1. Extremely hectic feeling (the landscape is awesome with waterfalls but add a ton of people noise during the day and it loses ambience quickly) 2. Has more staff on hand to assist you 3. Keiki (Children's) Camp is awesome (especially Nicole, their counselor) 4. Ono Grill serves decent food at high price 5. Terrace serves pretty good food and great view 6. Very helpful and friendly staff 7. Very nicely equipped workout room (didn't use a minute of it!) 8. Good pools Sheraton Maui: 1. Awesome snorkeling right at your footstep 2. Relaxed and more serene atmosphere (reminds us of Jamaica) 3. Ample parking 4. Fabulous view (if you get ocean front) 5. Fairly helpful staff but minimally staffed compared to Westin 6. Restaurant food match up to prices quite well (except for the breakfast buffet) 7. Kid's pool - wading area and 3 ft area Not very impressed by both locations' rooms and bathrooms but no complains since we spent minimal time in the rooms even though we had ocean front/view rooms. If you have little kids, both places are fun but Sheraton has the kid's pool. Older kids will prefer the Westin slides at their pools. If you want to try out snorkeling and scuba, definitely pick Sheraton because it's right at your doorstep. We decided on the Starwood properties over other properties like Hyatt and Ritz (all about the same price as we received great package offers.) We checked out both locations and was very happy with our decisions. Hyatt probably has better pools but was even more crowded! The thing that pushed us to Sheraton over Hyatt was the beach. Review on Hyatt's lack of beach was the major reason we avoided Hyatt and the review was correct. To get my little ones to the beach was not as easy at the Ritz as it was surrounded by the golf course. If you decide on Maui, do get the "Maui Revealed" book if you intend to venture outside of your resort. You'll find great tidepools, beaches, activities and food recommendations. As for food, if you decide to eat at Whaler's Village, we love Leilani's (lunch and dinner). Hula Grill was quite good too. Rusty Harpoon service and food is mediocre at best (lunch and dinner). Sansei close to Ritz at Kapalua is as good as advertised. Aloha Mixed Plate in Lahaina is decent but Da Kitchen in Kihei serves awesome local food. For Califonians, you will most likely find David Paul a tad bit overrated. Wished we had time to try Pacific'O. We found no reason to try Moose McGillycuddys or Roys as they're readily available in California. Hope this helps. Definitely get "Maui Revealed" book. Enjoy your trip. We did ;)

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: cleochase
Reviews.Content: As I write this review I am sitting on our Lanai at the Sheraton Maui. While we did not get a Lei greeting, we have been total blown away by this hotel. We were a little worried about booking at a Sheraton due to past experiences with the chain, but are really glad we decided to try them again. We are staying on SPG points and were expecting to be in the lowest room available. We were upgraded to a deluxe oceanview room. It is wonderful!!! We ate at the Terrace restaurant last night and the food and service were terrific. We have been snorkeling at Black Rock in the morning with a green sea turtle. We are now wishing that we had decided to stay here for our whole vacation instead of only 5 nights. Hopefully the next hotel, the Sheraton Keauhou will be as wonderful as this one. BTW, you get free valet parking the first night. We did not know this which is why we did not get the lei greeting.

Reviews.Title: “SHERATON--WONDERFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Sealbeachgirl713
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton from November 25th - December 2nd. This was our second stay at the Sheraton and it defintely exceeded all our expectations from our previous wonderful stay. We were immediately greeted upon arrival with fresh leis. They had already upgraded us to an ocean-view room without us even having to request it. The valet attendants were really nice and helpful. The staff at the front desk was equally helpful. The view from our room was the best I've ever had. I could literally have thrown a rock from our balcony and hit the ocean. We ordered room service one night and ate at the pool bar a few times, each with good food and good service. The snorkeling right off the beach was our favorite part--it made it so easy to be able to go snorkeling whenever we wanted. The nightly cliff dive off Black Rock is a really cool ceremony that is worth checking out. I highly recommend the Sheraton and will be staying there the next time we go to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and perfect resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I remember the Sheraton back in the 80â€™s and it was in a great location but was not the best hotel on the beach. When researching to return in 2003 I narrowed it down to the Sheraton and the Westin. After seeing the Sheraton had newly renovated and built new buildings I called them and we received a great deal for a deluxe ocean front room. We got this deal after signing up for a free Starwood card. We also would not have gotten as good a deal if we had not called them directly. When we got there we were blown away by the view, the food, the service and the resort itself. We walked to the other resorts along Kaâ€™anapali beach and even asked to see a room at the Westin and after seeing the room and battling the congestion of the lobby and pool area of the Westin we knew for sure we made the right choice to stay at the Sheraton. We also purchased a vacation ownership at the new Westin Ocean Villas and returned there this year but we extended our stay in the villas with a visit to the Sheraton. I am sure every visit to Maui will include a stay at the Sheraton. Not only the best spot on Kaâ€™anapali beach but right at the best snorkeling since the resort is located on Black Rock. Had my first swim with dolphins and sea turtles right off Black Rock. The Villas we purchased are great and still a prime spot but I still consider the Sheraton a better resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good five star on a great beach”
Reviews.Author: CalBears
Reviews.Content: Sheraton's location on Black Rock (where good snorkeling can be found) is great. But Black Rock's popularity also leads to a crowded beach with lots of families, kids, and visitors from all the other hotels looking for good snorkeling. The room we had was on the 2nd floor, ocean view. Decor was nice, modern, and clean. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was a nice size. The public spaces (lobby and grounds) were well maintained and the low profile of the hotel gives it a more intimate feel and allows it to blend into the scenery a little bit better than the other taller and bigger resorts down the road. The cleaning service was excellent although the hotel lobby staff was a bit lacking for a five star hotel. Paid around $290/night. Hope you find a better bargain. Even at that price, it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Sheraton Resort”
Reviews.Author: Brightfeather
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the Sheraton Maui Nov. 2-9. We stayed in two different rooms: Room 6104, building 6, 1st Floor. This was a nice room, especially since it had a king bed, but....after flying for 5.5 hours and another 1.5 hours between luggage and getting to the hotel, we arrived at about 11 pm. only to be greeted by a little twit at the front desk, who will remain nameless. She sighed and typed, sighed and typed, rolled her eyes when we told her that I had re-confirmed our reservation the previous day, had a confirmation number and that the room we requested, and paid for already, was in building 5. She insisted that no particular building was guaranteed and that she'd have to put us in Bldg. 3 until something else came available. I told her that we had paid $550 extra for a Deluxe Ocean Front room in Bldg. 5 and that was where we wanted to be. More sighing, typing, eye-rolling, etc. This continued for about 10 minutes. I am usually a very patient person, but at about this point I was getting angry. She then said they "might" be able to put us in an Ocean View with a king, but not a Deluxe Ocean Front. Finally one of the other front desk people came to her and "helped" her find a room in Bldg. 6 with a Deluxe Ocean Front w/King bed. I really wanted to throttle her at this point, but was too tired to work up the energy. So that was our first "Aloha" from the staff. I must say, however, that she was the only staff person we had trouble with our entire stay. Everyone else was very friendly and wanting to assist in any way possible. The next day my husband called the front desk, asked for the manager, and told him what had happened the night before on our arrival. He apologized profusely and said they would have a Deluxe Ocean Front available in Bldg. 5 Saturday morning. We told him that would be fine and we did move that day. Actually the porter moved our luggage over to Room 5806 while we spent the day in Oahu. The rooms in Bldg. 5 are much nicer than in Bldg. 6. A bit bigger, crown moulding, even in the bathroom, ceiling fan, doorbell, and much bigger balcony. The room we were in was actually part of a suite. To get to our room there were double doors then our room was on the left with another door on the right that was a really big room. Next time we'll be staying in one of those! I cannot comment on the food as we ate elsewhere on this trip except for the day after we arrived we spent a couple of hours at the Lagoon Terrace, had a couple cocktails and sandwich, which was fine if expensive. The pool was very nice and we enjoyed that several times while there. It was never terribly crowded either and the hot tub was nice too. We did snorkel at Black Rock and saw some great fish. We simply rented our gear right on the beach there for $8/hr. The nightly dive into the ocean by the young man never got boring for us watching him make his way across the beach, up the rocks (barefooted of course), and paying tribute to the ocean by throwing his Lei into the water and diving gracefully into the water below. Cocktails were good with liberal amounts of alcohol in them, nicely served. Of course everything at hotels is expensive here so I won't go in to that. Being in those buildings we were able to park up near where our rooms were, which was very nice. TIP: If you are in Building 5 you can drive up to another entry area with groceries, etc. and don't have to walk all the way from the parking lot with heavy stuff.You can't park there but it is a good drop-off location. TIP: Stop at Safeway on your way to the hotel to pick up those extras you need to get. It's cheaper than getting them at the hotel or in Lahaina's ABC stores. We also brought along a soft-sided cooler that folded into my suitcase. THis came in handy when out being a tourist and it'll save you some money on drinks and snacks. We also used it to bring beverages down to the pool. Also, if you have to check out from your room but aren't leaving until later in the day, the baggage can be left at the front desk in a secure room and you can either go out and about, or stay and enjoy your last hours at the pool, etc. You keep your key-card and you can use the health facility for showering, etc. They have towels, blow dryers, lockers, and showers up there. In closing, we will go back to this hotel. We adored our room in Building 5 with our views of the mountains, grounds, and ocean. Particularly leaving the sliding door open, listening to the luau down below with the music and the warm breezed blowing. Magical!!! We loved the hotel, the room, the people and enjoyed peace and quiet when we wanted to, explored the island and fell in love with Maui, in general. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort”
Reviews.Author: ILuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Sheraton Maui with my husband and 2 children (6 & 8). We have travelled extensively and have 5+ star standards. This resort is perfect in every way! After reading several reviews on trip advisor I was worried that the rooms were very small. To our surprise, our ocean view room was HUGE with plenty of wardrobe space. The decor was stunning and luxurious. We had 2 double beds and a rollaway bed. The food was so impressive, that we ate almost every meal at the resort. Be sure to walk along the beach to Whalers Village for a great shopping experience.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui -”
Reviews.Author: grannytravelor
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and Staff. I recently spent 10 nights at the Shearton Maui Resort. After a 10 hour flight I was disappointed to not have the Ocean View Room with King Bed that I had requested, but the staff was able to promise I would be moved as soon as something was available. Since I had a special convention rate, I decided to pay extra and moved to a Jr. Suite in building 2. It was excellent - very nice and large with microwave and wet bar area and nice large bath with a separate shower, beautiful view. Well worth the upgrade. It also, had a murphy bed which came in handy when my granddaughter spent the night. The living room area could be completley closed off from the bed area so it would be perfect for families. Some of the furniture in the room needed to be re upolsterd, but overall it was very nice. Based on comments from other friends who were visiting Maui, I think the majority of the properties in Maui are in need of a interior facelift, and some are in the process of doing so. Valet Parking was very reasonable and self parking was free. There are only a few things I see that could make this an even better hotel. One would be to redo the lobby adding a lobby bar and create better views of the ocean and property. There is a nice water feature around the exterior of the lobby but it actually blocks your view of the nice streams with fish and the swimming pool below. The other change would be to have more shops. There is only one very small shop that combines sundries and gifts. The property is quite spread out, but very pretty and the beach is very nice. The staff was exceptional. I really enjoyed my stay at the Sheraton this year.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was hopefull when I booked the Sheraton for our honeymoon, but when we got there I was in awe. It was truly better than I could have ever imagined. My husband was thrilled as well. The hotel is so peaceful and never felt crowded. the pool and beach were even quiet and peaceful. Perfect honeymoon spot. The snorkling is AMAZING. We even saw a turtle our last day there. We spent 10 days there and could have spent 10 more. We had dinner at both restaurants, as well as at the Westin. All very good. We were in the back of the building 3, which had a partial ocean view, but also a mountain view with a golf course in between. Was perfect for us. We could see the sun rise and set from our balcony. Others have said the restuarants are pricey, but being from NY it didn't seem outrageous to us. Good food, so it was worth it. The only thing that could have been better would have been a bigger bathtub. A very small imperfection. When we make it back to Maui someday (hopefully) we will be staying at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: simsaluki
Reviews.Content: Place is unbelievable. Top Notch hotel in Beautiful Maui. Restaurants are pricey, but eat outside the hotel anyway. Once you spend week here, you will dream about it forever.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Jemuk1
Reviews.Content: Me and Husband stayed at the Sheraton Maui for 6 nights of our honeymoon in August. The hotel is beautiful and after checking out many other hotels on Maui it was my favourite. I even preferred it to the Fairmont and Four Seasons in Wailea as it was how I imagined hotels in Hawaii to be, luxurious but laid back. I thought the resort was an ideal size not too big or small. I loved the little lights which lit the pathways at night and the tikki torches. We were upgraded to a deluxe ocean view room with such an amazing view it really was like being in paradise. We hope to go back as soon as we can. If anyone is reading these reviews trying to decide where to stay in maui then all I can say is stay here. Its amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on Kaanapali!”
Reviews.Author: dada1
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to Maui, but the first time staying in Kaanaoali. We received a screaming deal through Starwoods Preferred Guest program, AKA Westin timeshare promotion. We were greeted with leis and upgraded to an oceanview room. The property is very nice and open as opposed to the majority of hotels on the beach, which are 70's lo0king high rises. We had the option on our deal of staying at the Westin, and after seeing the crowds of people there, we were glad to be at the Sheraton. The breakfast buffet is excellent and will keep you going all day. We ate twice in the retaurant for dinner, and found the food and service to be of high quality. As other posts have mentioned, the beach at the Sheraton is by far the best spot on the strip. Lot's of fish and great snorkeling at Black rock. One gripe I have is with the constant insipid music being played around the pool by local guitarists. OK the first day, but after hearing Brown Eyed Girl for the fifth time I wanted to scream! I will probably stay in Wailea next time, it being much more laid back than west Maui. Lahaina is a ZOO! I have never seen more Art galleries with total dreck-slop than in Lahaina. It feels more like Fisherman's warf in San Francisco each time I go back. But if you want Kaanapali, stay at the Sheraton. After five days on Maui I was glad to finish up my vacation on the Big Island.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from our honeymoon Oct 9-17th at the Sheraton Maui. It was a beautiful property with great views of Maui Sunsets and the Islands Lanai and Molokai. We had an amazing time. We were upgraded to an ocean front room in building 6 which sat on Black rock and we could watch the snorklers during the day and listen to the waves crashing at night. It was quiet and away from the evening activities of the hotel. The only problem with building 6 upfront is the long walk and multiple elevators required to get to the pool/beachside or the lobby. However, I'd still request it if I could. We're young, it was no biggie. They had parking near the building. The room was very spacious and the sweet sleeper bed is the best! The pool area that was closed off for construction as discussed on previous postings is now re-opened. The pool was great. Chairs can be slightly difficult to find pool side at times but we always found one. Drinks were pricey at the poolside bars. A 10 oz. cup of soda was $3.00. Go to Safeway on the main highway for beverages and fill your room fridge. Best investment. Snorkeling was great. Lots of fish and sea turtles. Can get busy at times. Mornings are best. The beach was busy at times but plenty of room, lots of sand and the ocean very inviting. There are some bugs at night and these red wormy things that crawled into our room a couple times. But it's a tropical island, what are you going to do. The lizards would visit us too but they were cute! We had a few cats that would hang out in the grassy area in front of our lanai that we would give water to. Get a poolside massage at the Day Spa at the Sheraton. You won't regret it! All and all it's a beautiful property. Room service was great! Food pretty good. Didn't eat breakfast there though. Maui was just amazingly beautiful. Plan activities right away. The sell out quickly. Try to book before you arrive or right when you get there. Skyline Zipline tour was painless fun. Ate at Roy's! Love Roy's Chocolate Souffle. Leilani's is a great close eat in Fisherman's Wharf. The only nightlife we found nearby was Moose McGuilcuddy's bar/restaurant on Front Street in Lahaina that was a lot of fun. Good Dj, good bar food. If you don't have the Book "Maui Revealed", get it before you go. You won't regret it. Good time, beautiful hotel in the best location on black rock, near shops, restaurants, etc. Was treated well by staff and would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonyacat
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th trip to Maui and this is the first time that we stayed at the Sheraton. It was our best trip, yet. Our room was beautiful, we had an awesome view, and the service was outstanding. The lunches and dinners was a little pricey, but we already know to expect that from vacationing in Maui. This hotel had the best beach. Some of the other hotels do not have a good beach. I usually do not like the beach, but I could not stay off of this one. And the pools were great, too.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: michelecm
Reviews.Content: The sheraton Maui was a great affordable place to stay in Maui!!! when checking in u get free flower lei's and valet is complimentary the first day only. the parking deck is free the rest of the trip. the hotel has an outdoor feel to it b/c of it's many large windows that open the length of the space to make u feel outside. the lobby is gorgeous w/ 2 sitting areas and a concierge desk, etc. for b'fast there is a coffee stand that charges $3 for coffee and orange juice and $5 for bagels, donuts, etc or at the dining room in the hotel prices start at 17 for b'fast entrees. the pool has 2 sections to it, 2 bars w/ waitresses that serve food/drink and poolside singers. there is a mini slide, bridge, pond w/ fish, etc. the hotel has everything u need, all the basics. snorkeling is also the best at the sheraton. all snorkle trips drop the people off at blackrock so save your money and just rent equipment! at sunset every night there is a cliff dive done by one of the employees, he lights the torches on the grounds then climbs the rock, offers his lei, dives in the water after the torch and lei. it's only a 5 minute thing. they also have a weekly luau on the grounds for a fee but i think the old lahaina luau is better. it's nice to get off the grounds! if you are a beach lover the sheraton has the biggest beach over the kannapali beach hotel, westin & mariot. if u are a pool person then i'd stay at the mariot or westin. their pools are much more grand. the kannapali beach hotel i wouldn't recommend, it's very out dated and shabby. stay away from the ritz, it rains more frequently b/c of the area it's in! seriously! when checking in they upgraded us from a garden room to a mountain view and after comparing both the garden room was nicer, so be aware. it had been updated w/ new furniture and it was about 50 ft from the beach and pool! most of the rooms are ocean view no matter if it's a garden view, mountain view, etc. rent a car in maui, u'll save money on trips and get to see more of the island on your own! restaurants we loved were: vinos by the ritz, rusty harpoon, hula grill lunch/grill menu, giovanni's pizza, cheeseburger in paradise. shopping - lahaina harbor and whaler's village. activities we did: atv riding by haleaka, horseback riding at ironwood ranch, road to hana, haleaka sunrise

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our honeymoon in Hawaii where we spent four nights at the Sheraton Maui. For the most part, our stay was positive at this resort and I agree with all of those that speak well of the grounds, beach, and Black Rock. The service was friendly and the restaraunt passed muster after a day of traveling over from Kauai. If you don't have to, don't eat dinner here though. Lahaina or Whaler's Village offers better options. I can't speak as to the quailty of the breakfast buffet. The pool bars are expensive, but everyone kind of knows that up front so I was not very bothered by it. When we checked in, we were shown to an "ocean view" room after receiving a free "upgrade" from our "partial ocean view" room. The room stunk of smoke. I mean, I am not usually bothered by smells and I thought I was in a steel mill. They were quick to address the concern but apologized that they had no other "ocean view" rooms with a king bed. We agreed to take a "partial ocean view" room with a king instead and to our surprise, we were placed next door in a room that was closer to the ocean. Hmmm. Kind of blows away the "free upgrade" deal that honeymooners are told they are getting. Not a deal breaker though. We would have appreciated something for our inconvenience, but received nothing. Despite all of this. we would still consider going back to this resort, though the resorts in West Maui are nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of events on the grounds!”
Reviews.Author: katerz
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that in my opinion, there is no nicer place on Maui to stay than this hotel. There is no better location, and the expansive, open layout of the property takes primo advantage of the views and ocean breezes! The staff is pleasant, the rooms are bright and airy, the grounds are lovely, and the restaurants are very nice. The Sheraton Maui *could* and *should* be perfection on earth. So, why is it not? Because there is one BIG wild card: events they hold on the grounds. Big, loud events, with big speakers pointed at your $450 lanai. We went to Maui with our little boy to get a break from our very hectic and stressful lives. To us, this hotel meant that after our son was asleep (about 8 pm), my husband and I would be able to sit on the lanai with some tea, and listen to the ocean in our very expensive ocean front room. We desperately needed and expected quiet! But for 4 NIGHTS out of our 6 NIGHT stay, there were events taking place outside our window. Our son could not sleep with the loud music! How the Sheraton can justify this is absolutely beyond me. When you complain, they're apologetic, but that doesn't help you feel any less disappointed. It's an appalling policy, and I will likely never stay there again, just because they cannot guarantee that they won't book a party/luau/wedding/corporate event outside my window.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Maui for 7 nights in Sep 05 whilst on honeymoon and resort is just gorgeous. The setting is absolutely beautiful - we had a view of the "Black Rock" and watched the nightly dive from our balcony every night. The service was excellent - nothing was a problem and the staff were all really friendly and helpful.
