The beach is just beautiful and the pool is excellent - it is really spread out so you can relax on your own without having someone right beside you. We had prepaid our breakfast and the choice was excellent. There was so much to choose from - loads of fresh fruit, pastries, hot food etc etc. The only possible down side was the prices for lunches at the snack bar - they were really pricey, but to be honest we expected that anyway. All in all I would go back tomorrow if I could!

Reviews.Title: “spectacular resort”
Reviews.Author: don_anneCapeCoralFl
Reviews.Content: we loved this hotel-view from our hilltop room looking at lanai was magnificent,resort grounds and walkway thru hotel have beautiful vistas-pool bar and restaurants have great service-everything here was excellent-the buildings are beautiful-all was worth the price-this is a fabulous hotel with unequaled views

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel by far”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated at the Sheraton Maui for 5 days before going on a cruise around the islands. We hated the cruise but absolutely loved this hotel. So much in fact, that when the ship was overnight in maui we ditched our boat and checked back IN to the hotel. This hotel felt the most in touch with nature since it is far from the other resorts. Ka'anapali beach is byfar the most amazing we have ever visited-in hawaii or otherwise. While Sheraton can't get credit for that, having a room right ON the beach sure was nice. Our first room was smaller than the second. I highly reccomend building 4 or 5, as we didn't care for the room on the otherside. We had both a full ocean view and a deluxe ocean view and loved both of them. Our room wasn't outdated at all and had the largest bathroom of any other room we have stayed in (and husband travels for work). We can't wait to go back and wil stay here again. I loved it!!!! TIPS: The pool is being rennovated so half of it was closed (it is a "river looking" type winding lagoon pool). That was a bummer since all the kids were at our end bc the shallow end was being worked on. Eat at David Paul's Lahaina Grill if you are looking for a delicious meal--a bit pricey but not ifyou are from any metro area. Lahaina is a must see!! And DON"T get breakfast in the hotel! Muffins were 5.00 and coffee 3.00. We walked to Whaler's Villiage and found a coffee shop for half.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort on the Kaanapali Beach..hands down!”
Reviews.Author: JSass
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our blissful honeymoon and couldn't get enough of Sheraton Maui. We were immediately upgraded to an oceanview room in building four just off the black rock with 2 lanais! We saw about 5 rainbows the first day. We walked the stretch of hotels on kaanapali beach every day and toured the grounds of the other hotels. This hotel has the best piece of real estate for several reasons. It is situated on 23 acres, not cramped and commercial like all of it's neighbors..their is live music almost 24/7. Although it's cousin the Westin had more bells and whistles in its pools(a.ka. waterslides, more waterfalls etc), we found the Westin not a beautiful scene. A cheesy gift shop and activities stand is basically right in front of it. It does not have a stretch of beach for swimming/snorkeling, you must walk to the front of our hotel to get that. We can't figure out why the Westin is slightly higher priced except for maybe the sheets have a higher thread count. I would recommend the Westin however for kids as their were many more of them and the pool was a virtually a kid's playground-not as suited for honeymooners. The koi ponds and swim up bar(although closed due to renovations while we were there) is gorgeous! The cliff diving ceremony makes you feel like you are really in Hawaii! We will definitely come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: peachygal2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton Maui. The resort has a very polynesian feel to it. We loved how the lobby was open air and how it became part of the beautiful grounds that surround it. We were upgraded to an oceanfront room on 3 and the view was breathtaking. The room was nice and roomy and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was a good size but had very limited counter space. We were surprised that the room did not have a closet. It did have an amoire with a tiny space to hang clothes. We enjoyed sitting on our lanai and taking in the beautiful scenery. The staff at the resort were very friendly. They went out of their way to make the guests feel at home. We had the breakfast buffet one morning and it was good but very expensive. We swam in the ocean and it was clear as glass and very calm. We enjoyed watching the kids jump off the rock. The resort is within walking distance to the Whaler's Village. I would recommend the Sheraton Maui and plan to stay there again on our next visit to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be going back.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton on Maui for the last 6 days of our Honeymoon after spending 3 days in Vegas and 5 days in Oahu. We were quite tired when we arrived and it was a bit disturbing to find that they didn't have our room listed although it was booked through a travel agent in April (we waited over 40 minutes while the female desk staff next to us checked in 4 other couples). We were booked for their Honeymoon special (upgrade to an ocean view room, champagne at arrival, etc.) but we had to ask for everything upon arrival (got our champagne 2 days later) and it looked as though they gave us a room in Building 2 that was reserved for someone else but I have no complaints about the room. The room was spacious, clean, and had a great view of the property and ocean. The staff were nice but the young woman who checked us in seemed inexperienced and led to my frustration when I asked her questions and she had to ask others before she answered me. Then the day before we checked out I had a phone message that said I didn't give her my booking voucher from my travel agent showing payment...which I had and the desk clerk had given back to me saying she had all the information she needed. (What was needed was better desk staff training). Anyway, our bed was wonderful...the best I have ever slept in and it was nice having coffee, and a refridgerator in the room...cut the cost of eating out for every meal. All the other staff we came into contact with were wonderful...we were given a lei at arrival and greeted by a very friendly gentleman who greeted us every time he saw us...made us feel very welcome. We didn't eat on the property (thought it was kind of expensive) but found nice places to eat within walking distance (the Hula Grill - their fish & chips were yummy). The staff near the reception desk gave us chocolates, helped us book a dinner cruise, and get pineapples to bring home and were able to answer any of our questions (they sit at desks opposite the reception area so be sure and chat with them). The Pool at the Sheraton was really nice even though a small area was being worked on. We didn't have any problems getting drinks and there were always lounge chairs available and more friendly pool staff around to help you if needed. The pool was clean and we enjoyed using it nearly every day...(it seemed that most people preferred to sit around the pool than get in the water so it was never crowded). We didn't have any problem parking our rental card and although you are charged a daily resort fee (of $17) it was reasonable to what we had to pay in Oahu...and so much nicer. We plan to go back to Maui in 3 to 5 years and we recommend the Sheraton to anyone...the sunsets in Maui are amazing and the nightly diving from the Black Rock is an awesome ending to each beautiful sunset. I highly recommend the Kaanapali Beach area...it has a number of hotels but I would recommend the Sheraton to anyone who's looking for a wonderful experience in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. The water is like the pictures no retouch. When you go into the water it feels like your going in to a gigantic pool. Don't forget to eat some fresh coconuts and papayas.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful 25th wedding anniversary celebration”
Reviews.Author: PADutchLady
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself stayed at the Sheraton for 8 nights from 8/29/05 through 9/06/05. We were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. We live on the east coast and decided on Maui for our celebration as this time of year can be unsettling weather wise in the Caribbean because of the hurricane season. Beyond the 6 hour time change and the 12 hour travel time, we certainly were not disappointed. We could not have been more pleased with our choice of resort. After walking the walkway along the beachfront, we felt that the Sheraton definitely had the nicest grounds and was spread out in such a way so as we never felt like we were crowded by other people. The resort was just beautiful with it's landscaping and the pool area was very enjoyable. It was not as lavish as some of the other hotel pools but it was not nearly as crowded either. We found the facilities well taken care of, the staff exceptionally friendly and accommodating, and our room quite comfortable, clean, and nicely decorated. We had a room in building 3 on the top floor facing the mountains at the north end of the building. We absolutely loved our view as we had an ocean view of the beach on the north side of Black Rock and were overwhelmed by the incredibly beautiful rainbows over the mountains every afternoon. We were surprised by how petty some guests can be regarding small complaints as we have read on these reviews before our trip. We honestly felt that for these people perhaps they just can't be happy with anything. We discovered that many people who vacation here are from the west coast and vacation here regularly. Perhaps their expectations are a bit unrealistic. We have traveled to many other vacation resorts in the Caribbean and Mexico so we felt we could objectively rate this resort. As a first time visitor to this area, we were just completely satisfied with our stay and choice of resort in the Kaanapali area. Check in and check out was very efficient. Everyone went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed and that we were enjoying our stay and made our celebration a very special time for us. Our vacation package included the breakfast buffet daily. We found the variety of food offered to be quite extensive and the quality very good. I would highly recommend this resort and we would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: MissingMaui
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently honeymooned in Hawaii. Our first stop was the Sheraton at Black Rock. The hotel was FABULOUS. We arrived tired and cranky after having problems with the airline, and were greeted with smiles and leis. The staff could not have been friendlier. We were upgraded to a Black Rock Room, which was incredible. Our room was about 30 feet from the beach-- amazing. At night we left the lanai door open so we could hear the ocean. The beach was beautiful and the water was always calm. It got a bit crowded with snorkelers from other resorts, but that's only because it's the best beach in Maui. There are giant sea turtles floating in the water who swim right alongside the tourists. We ate breakfast every morning at the Keiki's, the coffee cart. The food was overpriced (not unusual for Hawaii) but the coffee was fresh and hot and the banana bread was tasty. We ate at the pool bar and enjoyed that as well. We loved the nightly dive off of Black Rock. The Sheraton has a hula dancer and Hawaiian music to go along with the dive every night, which are viewable from the pool and from the black rock rooms. We went to Maui for the first 4 days and the last 4 days of our honeymoon, and we were planning to stay at the Maui Prince for the last leg. We loved the Sheraton so much that we changed our reservation. The second time we reserved a Black Rock room- be aware that there is a wide variety in the quality of these rooms. The second room was older and did not have as nice of a view. However, the hotel was able to change our room to a Starwood Preferred Black Rock room (much nicer) that actually had 2 lanais. I loved this hotel and can't wait until we can go back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tjp2912
Reviews.Content: We had a great family vacation to the Sheraton in Aug of 2005. We had two rooms next to each other and were in block 3 with an Ocean View and a very short walk to the beach. The hotel is fabulous and without doubt the best on Kaanapali. We had 12 days at the hotel at the end of the season and had the best vacation ever. A few tips / comments which I hope will be helpful: 1. Try priceline - we paid $150 a night for the hotel which by all accounts is a real bargain 2. DO NOT USE BOSS FROGS - please - they lie in their adverts - you can get cheaper masks and snorkels at Whalers Village at Maui Divers - they will also provide a real fish guide and de-fog - also the people they have are actually human and can hold a conversation and explain what is needed etc rather than simply be an outlet for selling trips etc 3. The restaurant at the hotel is a great buy if you have kids as they eat free and with the buffet it is a rel bargain. 4. Contrary to popular opinion (or is it just marketing?) BJ Pizza in Lahaina is awful - you will wait over half an hour for a part baked pizza with a base of at least an inch! 5. Try Bubba Gumps Shrimp in Lahaina as they do a great fish and chips and it is really good value. Other places to eat that we tried were: - Hula Grill - went there twice and enjoyed it - Leilani's - OK but not as good as Hula Grill - Food Court (Chinese) - actually quiet a nice meal. 6. There is a coffee shop in the hotel but you have to ask for the coffee to be extra hot as they barista (apologies to all Starbucks employees) does not have a thermometer and was always making cold coffee (used her hand to guage the temperature) you would have thought after being asked over 5 times she may have cottoned on to the fact that she made cold coffee?! 7. Lahaina is a great place but it is really costly to park but well worth a few visits. 8. Maui is expensive but it does not need to be - we had breakfasts in the room as Shearton provide a fridge and also had most lunches there too. From the garbage outside other rooms I think we were not alone in this. If you are going to do this then go to Safeway in Lahaina and make sure that you join their loyalty club as they have some great buys. 9. There are millions of activities that are offered and with 4 kids we could only do a few but would really recommend: - surf lessons (Royal Lahaina we used but they are busy an IF there is surf on Kaanapli I think that a more local one may be better) - Sunrise on Haleakala - it is a really great view but getting up at 2am is not so great 10. Please object to the management about the resort fee as if you don't it will continue forever and it is an abhorent practice - we had two rooms and managed to get them to waive half the fee for one of the rooms. 11. The pool is a great place and if you go to the Keiki pool (if you have kids of course) then we got beds by the pool on all the days that we went there. 12. We liked the Hard Rock in Lahaina too and they actually have something different (to PB&J, Chicken Strips, Burger etc) for Kids I hope that this is helpful Overall a realy great hotel and beautiful setting

Reviews.Title: “Absolute heaven, best hotel & location!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say - my rating explains everything!!!! My husband and I loved everything about Maui - we cant wait to return. We stayed at the Sheraton for 12 nights for our honeymoon and would recommend it to anyone. The hotel was beautiful and upon arrival we were upgraded to a Deluxe ocean-view room, little bit of a walk from the pool but we liked the idea of being away from it all, it was peace and tranquility. Rooms are spacious and very clean indeed. Staff were very helpful and friendly. A+++++++++ ... fully recommended ... anyone that has anything bad to say about this place needs help !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Summer vacation”
Reviews.Author: ellebud
Reviews.Content: My family and I have a long history in Maui. The first time I went there they were building the Whaler's Village. As a child I stayed at the Sheraton and the Maui Surf. With our children my husband and I have stayed at the Westin, the Marriott and for the first time since the remodel, the Sheraton. I booked our reservations through Starwood in May. My intention was to book at the Westin but the woman at Starwood said that we should take advantage of the Stay at 1, play at 3 offering and get a full ocean front room rather than paying the same price at the Westin for an ocean view. And we could STILL GO TO THE WESTIN POOL! Well....you know the outcome of that. Without any warning they discontinued that program. Check-in: Our first room was in building 3. Lovely room. You could see the ocean if you went out on to the balconey and walked to the far end and leaned over. I was very unhappy. It took our bellman 5 minutes to arrange to have us transfered to a lesser room in the old building. But this room had an ocean view. They did deduct $10 a night for our room. The bathroom was dirty. And being on vacation, I cleaned up the surfaces myself as opposed to complaining and pulling a princess act. (I am NOT a germaphobe or unduly fussy). The fact that we didn't get our ocean front room was disturbing, but we're on vacation. The next morning my daughter and I were in the bathroom. She turned on the shower which contains a handheld shower head. I hear a huge thud. The very heavy shower head missed my daughter by inches. By now I was furious. My daughter would have been gravely hurt and the room was dirty. I went to the Manager, at 7 a.m. and was not the happiest of clients. My daughter could have been badly hurt (the most importent issue) due to a faulty shower head, I had to clean our bathroom, and we didn't get the room we paid for initially. (I had the paperwork with me.) We did get our room changed. This time we did get our ocean front room in the far building. It was nice (not spectacular), clean, and the shower head secure. We then went on vacation. The pool at the Sheraton doesn't have the bells and whistles of the Westin. But unlike the Westin it is calm, clean and you don't have to scream to be heard. The pool staff is wonderful. We rented a gazebo for 4 days and while pricey, about $70 or $75 per day, we didn't get sunburned. They definitely need more gazebos. We would have rented a gazebo everyday, had they been available. The pool food was very mediocre, usually cold. And if you want to eat by the bar the wait was 40 to 45 minutes for a hamburger. The excuse was that only 1 side of the barbque was working...for a week. The girls who walked around taking orders seemed to bring the food more quickly. They were truly very nice. The Starwood Concierge was very helpful with dinner reservations. We knew where we wanted to go from previous visits and she suggested some additional places. The Room Dance, as I call it, seems to be a more common practice. I am tired of going to a nice hotel with confirmed reservations and being given a lesser room hoping that there are no complaints. We don't always complain (because we were able to check into our room in Italy at 10 a.m. instead of 4 after travelling for a day, we were exhausted and happy to see a shower), but I sincerely tired of what seems to be a increasingly common practice. The staff, for the most part, were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Dolphinfan
Reviews.Content: Hotel â€“ Sheraton at Black Rock. Outstanding hotel and resort area! Right from the time you check-in, the service is excellent and the staff very friendly. They greet you with leis and warm smiles, take the luggage out of your car and escort you to your room. We were upgraded to an Ocean Front room is building 4 and all I can say isâ€¦WOW! The view from our lanai was breathtaking. We were right next to the beach (in the side of Black Rock itself) and had a view all the way down the beach, the ocean, the pool, the gardens, and the mountains. The room itself was average, but the bed (Sweet Sleeper) was very comfortable with down pillows and comforter. As for the beach, it is absolutely the best location on Kaanapali (and we think the best on Maui)! The ocean was calm, which was great for snorkeling or swimming and the water was very clear. Sheraton has the biggest beach (by far) for a resort on Maui (as far as we could tell). We did check out Wailea beach (seas were too rough, seemed windier there) and DT Fleming beach by the Ritz (seas were again very rough for us and it was definitely windier there). We didnâ€™t really hang out at the pool since we rented beach cabanas ($35 per day), but the pool seemed nice too. If you want to hang out at the beach and are not used to the sun, I highly recommend getting a beach cabana. My husband and I were able to lounge on the beach all day and not get sunburned. My only complaint about the Sheraton was the poolside dining. We tried lunch at the pool bar one day and found it to be too expensive for what you got and the quality was not very good. This complaint was very minor for us because we just ended up walking down to Whalerâ€™s village for lunch. We did eat breakfast at the Sheraton buffet twice and really enjoyed it, but it was $50 for the both of us so we ended up going to Safeway for food and ate on our lanai most mornings. I am not sure why there are so many negative reviews of Sheraton, but my husband and I could not have been happier with our choice! I posted a trip report on the discussion board with some restaurant reviews and recommendations. We give a glowing, 5-star, two enthusiastic thumbs-up!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: 3Penguins
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Aug. 4-9, '05 as part of a timeshare deal so we didn't know what to expect. Turned out to be better than expected! We usually stay at 4 and 5 star hotels. I'm not sure what this is rated, but we were very pleased and comfortable. We've stayed at the Grand Wailea. The beach at the Sheraton is better than at the Grand Wailea. It's a beautiful, wide, sandy beach at the end of Kaanapali Beach protected by a cove where Black Rock is, and the water is clear at least 20' down. (We didn't go out much deeper). Snorkeling is right in front of the beach in the cove, and kids can jump off Black Rock. Snorkeling rentals are ridiculous, though, because you can buy a mask and snorkle down the street at Long's Drugstore for almost the same price. Or just bring your own from home. The swimming is fabulous, the fish and sea turtle were beautiful to watch. You don't have to drive anywhere to snorkel. It's right there! Also, here's a tip on the beach chairs. Those around the pool are first come, first serve. Be prepared to get up early if you want a shady spot. We're talking 7am to get down there and put something on the chair to save it. If you want two chairs on the beach with umbrella, it'll be $30 and the rental hut opens at 8am. Again, line up by 7:45 am. They're usually gone by 8:45 am. If you want two chairs with the attached covering thing that goes over them, that's $35 and you can reserve those in advance, but do it your first day there because they also book up fast. They also have cabanas around the pool that fit four chairs underneath. We didn't check into that but I heard one person say $75/day. The rooms have all been refurbished so they look more modern. In fact, we could still smell fresh paint in our room and lots of the rooms were still being renovated. But we heard no noise from it, so it didn't bother us. Beds were comfortable, bathrooms were modern. The grounds are huge and spread out! We really liked that! Kids can play on the grass. There's a big area at the front of the hotel near the beach for weddings and events. If you go down to the Westin, which is also a Starwood property, it's jam packed in! People were wall to wall in chairs around the pool, and the beach is not as nice. Although they'll even tell you at the Sheraton that if you want to use the spa, use the Westin's, which I did and enjoyed it. It wasn't the Grand Wailea Spa, one of my fav's, but it had a steam room, sauna, and very small jacuzzi (only two can fit comfortably). But the quiet, waiting room was beautiful with chairs and recliners overlooking the ocean and fresh beverages, tea, and biscotti. And the treatments were great - a Lomi-Lomi massage and a Tropical Scrub with Vichy Shower. The breakfast buffet at the Sheraton has just about everything, but for $22.50/person, come on, $50 for two for breakfast?! The nice thing is they have a mini frig in the rooms and we went and bought fruit and drinks at the Safeway 5 mins. down the road (near Long's). The gym was not much to speak of, just a few treadmills and a couple other machines. When we arrived, it was late at night and my husband and I were given two double beds on the bottom floor facing the mountains. We had asked for a king. So then we were taken to a king room, also mountain view, but it had an air freshener machine blowing and that can only mean one thing to us - they're trying to get rid of some odor. So we still voiced our displeasure and ended up with a king bed suite (larger room) on the 5th floor ocean view! Patio fit 2 chairs and a small table and the view was fabulous! The staff were always very attentive and friendly. You can self-park to save a few bucks over valet. There is a $17/day tax added/room. Daily maid service, daily paper. Good restaurants in town - Longhi's & Gerards in Lahaina and Sansei in Kapalua. Five min. walk to nice shopping & eating at Whaler's Village. We would definitely go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation place ever! Excellent Hotel! Will definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: ssfbabymama
Reviews.Content: We arrived to Sheraton Maui Aug 8, 2005. It only took us 40 minutes or less to get there from the airport. My husband parked at the front of the hotel and right away there was a guy who approached him and showed him where we will be checking in and had someone help us out with our bags. (The guy was "The ambassador of Aloha" for the hotel). As we were checked in the front lady greeted us with our leis. And with that we got another surprise, our "partial ocean view room" was just upgraded for free to the "ocean front room". We were going to hint to them that its our 5th anniversary but she upgraded us without being hinted. My husband even told her that we have the partial ocean view, making sure we dont have to pay extra, but she somehow just ignored that and gave us the better room for free anyway. The view was amazing. And our room happened to be nestled to the "big rock". And being on the 2nd floor was extra helpful since we have our 1 1/2 year old son with us. The balcony overlooks the entire beach front and ofcourse the room was great too, nice king size bed, great bathroom, we used the fridge alot, the cabinets were spacious, everything was perfect. The service was wonderful. I had signed up for a their Hula lessons. So my family and I was waiting by the activity tent when we noticed that the "ambassador of aloha" walked by the pool area (we are already sitting by the lounge chairs) and noticed that he was looking for someone. I just found out that he was looking for me. Unfortunately the hula lesson was cancelled since the instructor had an emergency and is about to have twins. (I totally understand that, being a mom and all) So he was looking for me since he left us a message at our room but we were already downstairs waiting for the class. So he was roaming around the hotel asking around where I am since they did not want me to be dissapointed with the hotel. (I really liked that!) Since I know how big that hotel is and I can imagine how hard it was to look for one person in such a large place. Everyone in the hotel was friendly, they will greet and smile at you at all times as you walk by them. Checking in on you if your having a great time. The free classes that they have are nice too. The staff are very friendly. The food at the Lagoon Bar was great. You have to try the nachos it fed me, my husband and our son. And ofcourse the Lava Flow was excellent. This was my family's first trip to Hawaii and as first timers our expectation was extremely high. The Sheraton Maui had exceeded our expectations. The hotel was beyond beautiful, the staffs are friendly and extremely helpful, the food was excellent, the pool is so pretty with water falls, adult section, kids section and baby section, the beach front is the best location because of the black rock. (You have to see the sunset, cliff dive, it was very dramatic) So all I can give the Sheraton Maui is 5 stars and 2 thumbs up and more. My family and I will definitely come back and I recommend for you to take your family here too and I guarantee you will have a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “best location beach, unwanted critters”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton in Maui from July 29- Aug 5 in building 3 with an ocean view. We went with family frineds and requested a room next to each other but when we got there that didn't happen. We both still got our ocean view rooms, which was even better then we expected, on the same floor. The room was very nice but had a light musty scent. The a.c worked great. We always had a nice cool room to come back to. The beds rocked! So comfy I fell right to sleep everynight and never had trouble with the beds. In past hotels I have had hard beds that feel like sheet metal. The TV was a bit small. The balcony was nice it had two chairs and a small round table. The bathroom was a good size, even for 3 girls. =) The showered worked great as well. Then the very unwanted happend, the first morning of our stay I went into the restroom to find a roach. I HATE HATE HATE bugs. After that we seen a few a day, mostly in the restroom, 2 in the safe (yes, they even got into a locked safe), another 2 in the closet, and 1 in the dresser. Not fun for me at all. Thank God my mom was there to smash them. There is a note telling you that you might have "critters" due to tropical climits but I expected WAY MORE from a Sheraton. Our family frineds did not have any unwanted visitors but they did have a really strong scent of mold. Not good at all. As far as the location on the beach its awesome!! We went snorkeling and seen so many fish. It really is a sight to see. The beach is very clean and very child frinedly. The pool is awesome too. You have to get up early if you want a chiar by the pool, they go quick. The pool is really big, its like a lagoon that children young and old will love. It has a small slide as well. The walk to Whalers Village is about 10-15 min. not too bad, plus its all beach side. I highly suggest NOT eatting at Hula Grill, not one of us liked it. They had BAD over priced food. We never ate at the Sheraton so I can't comment of the food. The parking is easy and if you valet they are all really really nice. Bell boys are very nice and helpful. The front desk girls didn't give the warmest welcome. The over all look of the hotel is really nice, clean, and welcoming. I would stay here again because of the great beach location. Oh one last thing I didn't care for was the resort fee, we were out so much of the time that is kind of a waste of 17 bucks. Other then that and the roach colony living with us it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Family of 5 (ages 11, 14, 16) Aug 1 - Aug 10. Beautiful grounds, perfect beach, very helpful concierge and excellent location to Whalers Village and Lahaina (easy 10 minute drive.) This is not Miraval or the Bellagio but I would definitely stay again. The maid service, pool service, valet and front desk were all friendly and helpful. Our room was cleaned everyday around 11:00 AM. No complaints. We were in building 2, which was close to everything. We used our key card to park in the garage, which was user friendly. Activities included scuba diving, zip zine rides, Hana picnic tour (rain forest), magic show, bike ride down Haleakala, surfing lessons and luau at the Sheraton. The magic show was amazing. Everything except scuba was arranged in advance through the Sheraton concierge (very easy) who has a list of activities on their web site. The activities for 5 people, excluding scuba, cost $2000. I recommend all the activities. Whalers Village is nice for an evening stroll. As for Lahaina I recommend dining at Cool Cats, Mala and Coolers for casual dining and above average food. Food bills averaged $75 without dessert for 5 people. All in all the Sheraton fulfilled our needs. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Beach!”
Reviews.Author: Nyobi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here July 21-25. When we arrived on Maui it took us 2 hours just to get here from the airport, traffic was horrible, due to on-lookers for a car that had been abandoned from an accident. By the time we got to the hotel it was too late to go swimming, but the hotel was having a luau and we watched it from our balcony. The rooms were prety decent and clean, and the beds were extremy comfy. The view of the grounds , beach, and ocean were truely breathtaking. The following morning we were still on Dallas time and were up by 5 am so decided to take advantage of the close to empty beach. Go snorkeling early if you want it all to yourself, by early we mean right after sunrise. The snorkeling there was great, saw many fishes, and even a few giant sea turtles, the turtles are definently not shy as they will come right next to you. This is all on the hotel's beach. We tried the hotel's breakfast buffet , while we were eating we were chuckeling about a guy's reaction when he took a look at his bill that the waiter placed in front of him, we soon had the same reaction. Be prepared to pay at least $22.50 a person for an average meal. by the way the pool is great for kids and anyone whole enjoys wading around. We would recomend going down to Whaler's Village to eat. While you're in Maui you must try the 38 mile Haleakala Volcano bike ride, while you're biking down there's a great Mexican Restaurant and many little shops. This is fun for the whole family and requires next to no physical exertion. Overall this hotel is great for families.

Reviews.Title: “Go above and beyond to get it right”
Reviews.Author: psychoscarf
Reviews.Content: We spent the second half of a 10 day vacation at the Sheraton on Maui from 7/30-8/4 and found it much more serene and tropical than the Hawaiian Hilton where we had spent the previous 5 days. Had a rental car and the self parking lot was easily accessible and never a problem to park in. We did experience a problem with our oceanview room on arrival as all of the flowers off of the lanais in our particular section were stone dead and somewhat took away from the pool and oceanview. We made the management aware immediately and they were willing to move us to another room which was slightly larger but not oceanview so we opted against that. In effort to accommodate our concerns they did wave the daily resort fee for some of the time we stayed and as well gave us a dining certificate and promised they would have new flowers planted on Monday, as this was a Saturday. Monday came and upon our return from the beach as promised, new flowers had been planted. We had a few minor problems with a lamp fixture and a broken spring in one of the beds and again they addressed them and compensated us with more dining certificates. A downside was the cost of eating at any of the resort dining facilities as well as the choices were not particularly kid friendly. We drove into Lahaina and ate a couple of evenings there. Getting a chair by the pool was not always possible, but the beach is beautiful and the sand so white and clean we only took a few dips in the pool. Had picked this place because of the recommendations for snorkeling right off of the beach and it did not disappoint us as many beautiful fish as well as sea turtles were seen without having to go through the trouble of booking one of the many available snorkeling tours. Did do the Road to Hana and in retrospect it was not worth the 9 hour trip though the road was not as treacherous as I had expected it to be. Enjoyed the helicopter ride that took us over the western section of Maui - flew on Blue Hawaiian and they were top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best part about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, 15-year-old daughter and 17-year-old niece just returned from 8 days (7/22-7/30/05) at the Sheraton. Overall, a very nice hotel in a great location. Our room was pretty average (where was the fan in the bathroom???), however, the beds were the most comfortable beds ever for a hotel; we slept great (it would have been nice, though, to have the option of getting two queen beds instead of two doubles). Our room was in building 3 with a nice view of the grounds, the pool, and the ocean. We liked the convenience of being able to self-park at the hotel, whereas at other resorts you have to use the valet service, which gets very expensive! Loved the beach and the snorkeling! On the downside, however, we tried the breakfast buffet one morning at around 10:30, got seated, had our first round of food, only to have the doors close at 11:00. It would have been very helpful if the hotel had posted the hours of the breakfast buffet; we might have gone earlier. The food itself was pretty cold and below average, and way too expensive for the basic eggs, bacon, etc. We had a much better selection of food at the Hyatt breakfast buffet and it was $1 cheaper! We were also very disappointed to find out that the "Stay at One, Play at All" was no longer in effect as of July 1, 2005. One of the reasons we chose the Sheraton was that it gave us the option of trying out the other Starwood pools. Why weren't we notified in some way that we would not be able to do so? A very bad decision by the Sheraton!! We might have reconsidered our decision to stay there. Also, our room was not always cleaned on a consistent basis. One day it would be cleaned by 11:00, other days it wasn't cleaned until almost 4:00. It's very frustrating to come back after a day in the hot sun wanting to relax in a clean, air-conditioned room, only to find out that it hasn't been cleaned. Several times we had to leave the room so the maid could clean it. I guess all hotels can't be perfect, but the Sheraton certainly didn't exceed our expectations, and we probably won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned (7/25) from our trip to Maui where we stayed 10 nights at the Sheraton. We have 2 young children and wanted to find a calm beach and a hotel with a water slide. After much research, we chose to stay at the Sheraton because of the protected beach and the advertised "stay at one, play at all" privileges that would have enabled us to use the water slide at the Westin. My son was quite excited to use the water slide and we tried to use it as soon as we arrived. However, we were terribly disappointed to learn that we were not allowed to use the pool facilities despite receiving a brochure at check-in that described the privileges. When I showed management the brochure, they said it was given to us in error and that the privileges had ended the month prior. They explained we still had the privilege of making room charges at Westinâ€™s restaurants â€“ imagine that â€“ we could still do everything that entailed getting another buck out of us. I booked the hotel 6 months in advance and complained that I should have been notified of the change so that I could move my reservations over to the Westin. The best they could do was to apologize and credit our account each day for the daily room charge. Yes, it was nice that they gave us a credit, but tell that to my son. The worse part about the whole circumstance is that they allowed the Westin guests to use the Sheraton pool. It really made us feel like second-class guests. It sure was something to sit around the pool and listen to other Sheraton guests complain about the same treatment. We stayed in a deluxe ocean-view room at the top of black rock. The three elevator rides to the beach were not bothersome as you never had to wait for the elevators, and the walk through the corridors offered some good views of the grounds and ocean. Our room was a good-sized room with a great view off the balcony. I would say the room quality was only average, and the carpet could have used a good cleaning. Our toilet started leaking from the floor and they fixed it promptly; however, it threw off the maid and our room was never cleaned that day even after we called to let them know. We really loved the beach at this resort; although it was hard to find available chairs and umbrellas to rent. Snorkeling was awesome and we always saw the turtles. The sand is nice and no rocks or shells to hurt your feet. The grounds were maintained very nicely and the kids enjoyed the fishpond. It was very nice that the hotel was walking distance to Whalers Village as we had many good meals at the restaurants there. I do not recommend eating at the Sheraton, unless you are too tired to do anything else. The food is only mediocre for the money you spend. If you have a car, drive everywhere else to eat. I highly recommend going to the Hyatt for their Luau. The entertainment and food was outstanding and the service was beyond expectations. Blue Hawaiian Helicopters also gets kudos for the first class ride we took to see the waterfalls. In summary, our trip to Hawaii was the best vacation we have had, we just wonâ€™t be staying at a Starwood property again. They just donâ€™t deliver on what they advertise.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton, a good choice”
Reviews.Author: cmfyrman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui over the past week and really liked the place. I chose this location with some reservations after reading a few bad posts but the location drew me to stay there. We arrived at noon and were quickly checked in, even though we were alittle early. We stayed in building 6, which is a full-ocean view on top of black rock. Yes, you have to take 3 elevators to make it to the beach, but it was well worth it because of the great location. I never found the elevators to me a problem, more of an amusing journey than anything. The room was basic but had a great view; the premium price is for the view of Lanai and Molokai, definitely not the room. The people were generally friendly, with the exception of the Spa. The spa people really need a lesson on customer service. The best however, were the bellboys. They were quite friendly. Not once did I feel the cheesy sales pitch of a time-share people. I saw them daily, but they were not a problem. The daily room charge of 17.50 is cheezy, but it seems all the hotels are adding this charge in. Buy water, drinks, snacks elsewhere and save some $$. Frankly, I preferred a drink I made and enjoyeed on the balcony far better than the weak drinks at the bars. One mixed thing is the location of the beach, which gets quite crowded. You must reserve lounge chairs at least a day in advance & chairs with umbrellas are rented at a first come, first serve starting at 8am. A plus is that you are within 5 minutes walking to Whalers Village where there are restaurants and shops, but if you like less people on the beach try the east side of black rock, it is less crowded. We ate at the morning buffet and found it to be good with friendly wait staff. We ate 2 times and had drinks at the bars and found it to be average. We had drinks at the bar one evening and found the service to be below average. Do watch the evening torch lighting and cliff dive; itâ€™s a great way to enjoy a wonderful sunset. Lastly, snorkeling. They charge scandalous amounts for rental of snorkel gear. Buy your own and pack it, you wont be sharing, youâ€™ll save a lot of money, will have it every day and will be able to keep it for your next trip. I saw dozens of turtles right off black rock, but it was crowded with lots of people also. If you stay on the east side of black rock in Kaanapali try the â€œold airportâ€� itâ€™s a little less crowded. Also, if you really want to see coral and lots of fish in a less crowded environment, try Honolua Bay, past Kapalua. Great snorkeling off on the right side of the marine sanctuary! In closing, you can find a lot better and a lot worse. I think the best thing as you embark on your Hawaiian adventure is to breathe deep and use a little Aloha spirit, then its all good. Even a bad day in Hawaii is better than the daily grind at home.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding place...best in Kaanapali!!”
Reviews.Author: Csack99
Reviews.Content: Let me just tell you that we had a blast! If you have a problem with this resort, I just don't understand it. We stayed there for our Wedding and Honey moon from June 21st- July1st. First of all, this is by far the nicest resort on Kaanapali Beach, hands down! They are all nice, however, they are all like Vegas style hotels. The Sheraton is an actual resort. Everything is spread out and you never feel crowded there. Their property is amazing! We highly recommend the Deluxe Ocean Front room. It was not cheap ($397, but a night for free) but was amazing! It is the closest you can get to the water on the entire beach. Our balcony is about 20 feet from the deep part of the water. Also, you have direct views of Lanai and Molekai. It was amazing! Also, we saw turtles from our room every day. It was cool! Sheraton service was awesome! They have a policy that if you have any problems or complaints, they will fix it. If they have to, they will give you a credit on your bill. Our stay was amazing! Trust me....stay at this resort. It's awesome! I was more than pleased and I will be back for sure! Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Truly the best hotel we have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: redheadshrink1
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from our very first trip to Maui 7/8- 7/14/05. There were 4 of us traveling...... myself, my husband, our 17 year old daughter, and our daughter's best friend. After reading all the usual travel books about Maui accomodations, We booked at the Sheraton because we were interested in doing a lot of snorkeling and the hotel's exquisite location, right at Black Rock on Kaanapali Beach, sounded ideal. The highest room category we could afford was an oceanfront room with 2 queen beds. However, upon arrival, the Sheraton generously and without our even asking, upgraded us to a gorgeous oceanfront suite! We were thrilled with our suite and we have never seen such an incredible view as the one we had right from the lanai of our room. Having the extra space with two teenage girls made a huge difference in the quality of our vacation. Kaanapali Beach was a mere 2 minute walk from our room and we snorkeled near Black Rock alongside tropical fish and giant sea turtles every morning. The service and friendliness of the staff at the Sheraton were unparalleled. Our room was immaculate and well stocked with amenities, room service breakfast was delivered hot and without a wait, and the concierge was extremely helpful in planning and reserving our activities. We will never forget our stay at this lovely hotel. Thank you, Maui Sheraton, for making this the best vacation we have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton was Excellent”
Reviews.Author: CTTraveler001
Reviews.Content: My family of four (17 and 18 year old) stayed at the Sheraton Maui July 16 for four nights. The hotel was wonderful! We arrived late afternoon on Saturday (after a couple of VERY long flights). We were greeted at our car by very friendly staff (Aloha! almost becomes annoying). The gentleman told us that there must be a mistake because our room only had a king size bed. Trust me that would not hold the four of us. We were told that our travel agent made a mistake. Our travel agent had booked the lowest cost room (partial ocean view), but those rooms only have king beds. The staff was VERY helpful getting this changed, we never had to complain at all. The manager came out and gave us the deluxe oceanview room. A four level upgrade at no charge. This all took maybe fifteen minutes and was handled very professionally. We were led to our room by Benjamin. He was extremely friendly and helpful and really made us feel welcome. Gave us all the info on the hotel and the surrounding area, plus sight seeing tips. My experience is mostly with Florida and Caribbean resorts, with this being our first and probably only Hawaii trip. The view from the room was certainly deluxe, outstanding view over the ocean over to Molokai, but the room was strictly Holiday Inn. Small, clean, with two double beds. I'm used to more in a 'deluxe' room, but I understand that is expected in Hawaii, we pay for the location. We did have a problem in the room. After taking a shower we learned that the bathtub was clogged. We called down to housekeeping before stepping out and it was all fixed when we got back. Not a problem for us. We used the beach and the pool quite a lot. Both were perfect. We had great weather and neither the beach or the pool was crowded. Even at 11AM we had no trouble finding pool chairs. The pool is quite large, basically a very nice sized 8' adult pool connected to a 3' children's pool via a 5' pool 'river' for about 30 feet. A 3 foot slide separates the two sections. A small hot tub is right off the center of the pool. A very nice upscale resort pool, unfortunately it closed at 8PM. No real surf at the beach, waves 1 to 2 feet, some kids trying to boogy board but not much of that. Sand was perfect for sandcastling. But watch unprotected feet! Pool deck and sand get VERY VERY hot. Always 5 to 8 kids jumping off of Black Rock, they sure were a lot braver than us. We never saw any apparent cruise ship crowds using the beach, it always looked less than half full. We ate breakfast at the hotel twice, standard buffet fare with an omelet station. It was over $100 for the four of us, but we're used to resort costs. Our first server's name was Jessie and he was excellent, talked to us about the food and Hawaii and a little about his background. Another excellent staff member who helped make this a more personal experience. When we returned two days later, we had a different server, but Jessie came over to say Hi and check on us, by name. We looked at the evening buffet, but it didn't have a very good selection, so we passed. Lots of places around the hotel to eat. I think we went to Hard Rock that evening. We also ate at Teppan-Yaki Dan's. A great chef although this experience felt somewhat like a production line with different servers and the brief appearance by the chef as he went from table to table. Food was good, but of course expensive. Our room did require us to take three elevators from our room to the beach/pool/lobby/restaurants, but only took a few minutes and was not a problem. A small price to pay for our quiet room looking over the Pacific. Our section also had a private parking lot which was very convenient. We passed by the timeshare desk every day and were only greeted with an Aloha! each time. They never tried to sell to us. We did go snorkeling once while we were there with the gear from the Hotel ($33 for 1 hour for 4 of us). We were told we could go to Boss Frog and get it cheaper, but we only intended to go snorkeling once. We saw fish and turtles, it was very nice. There were probably always about 10 people snorkeling, but there is a lot of room. One large turtle came into the beach area in about 7' of water, very cool. We never use the fitness/tennis/golf facilities so I can't comment on those. We watched the evening torch lighting and cliff dive, but after seeing kids diving from there all day, it didn't seem like much. Wonderful staff, beautiful location, great beach, great pool, not crowded. What more could we ask from our vacation? (Well, it is expensive).

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: MommyofTwins
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed for five nights at the Sheraton Maui. I purchased way in advance (8 mths) our Deluxe Ocean Front room and it came w/ a convertible car. We paid less than $400.00 a night. Upon arrival we were greeted w/ flower leis and given our room keys. Our room was located in building six overlooking the Black Rock & outer islands. It was very secluded and quiet I might add. Due to the prices, we never ate at the hotel but did have cocktails there. I recommend CJ's Deli for yummy food. We ate there twice and it was good both times. It's quite close too so be sure to ask for directions. We ate breakfast twice at Cheeseburger in Paradise and it was very good. Gotta try the Macadamia Nut Pancakes or Eggs Benedict (w/ potatoes!) The first two nights we missed the lighting of the torches and dive mostly because it didn't sound like that big of a deal. Wrong. It was beautiful w/ tradition and we made a point to catch it the rest of the time we were there. Get to the pool area about 30 min before the ceremony so you can relax and really enjoy it. For those who enjoy adult frou-frou cocktails - I highly recommend the Lava Flow; they are a tad expensive and light on the liquor but ask for an extra shot of 151 and they'll take care of you w/ a smile. We snorkeled one day and rented our equip. from Boss Frog's next to Bad Ass Coffee just a short drive from the hotel. The hotel wanted around $9 for the day; Boss Frog's was $1.50. Only a few minor issues ocurred. One was the Wireless Internet that did not work for two days and a Cafe au Lait at their 'coffee bar' was $3.00. Everyone was very nice at the hotel and no one tried selling us anything. We had a romantic time and look forward to going again some day.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui is great”
Reviews.Author: EricMedina_Ohio
Reviews.Content: Our family of four, including boys 12 & 16, stayed at the Sheraton Maui July 6 - 10 and found it to be very nice. We were in the central building facing the pool and ocean (an oceanview room) and that location was perfect. We could be at the pool w/o elevators in 60 seconds. This resort has the best location on Kaanappali beach since it does not share a neighbor to the North. Black Rock is beautful and the snorkeling right on the beach is good. We swam w/ a huge sea turtle two days in a row! The resort itself is a beautiful setting and the pool is above average though not as awesome as the Westin next door. The deluxe oceanview room we stayed in was fine...clean...functional, etc. You ARE paying for the location, location, location staying at a resort like this. Don't expect a luxury suite for $350 a night like you'd get at home where you live. Do expect a beautiful facility, a very nice pool, a terrific beach, and a convenient location just 5 minutes from Lahainia to the South. Unlike other reviewers, we had zero pressure for timeshares or any other sales-related options and the staff was friendly and competent. The resort was not overly crowded when we were there...but certainly there's a lot of people around the pool...don't be unrealistic...it IS a resort after all! In Lahainia, we loved Cheeseburger in Paradise as a fun family place but at BJs Pizza had a HUGE wait for pizza that wasn't close to being worth it. If we return to Maui, I would be happy to stay at the Sheraton Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Poor management and value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon during July. It seems that we experienced the same poor service and amenities that others are reporting. The employees and management are a joke. The internet in the rooms does NOT work and they would not admit it. Instead we moved our room 3 (THREE) times to try another internet connection only to find out it wouldn't work anywhere in the hotel. The rooms in Building 6 (Luxury Oceanfront) are filthy and disgusting for over $400 a night. Our A/C broke down and a maintenance person spent 3 hours trying to fix it from 9pm until after midnight...only to say it was over his head. Then the front desk could not move us because they had no other rooms. (A/C's were broken all over the place). We had to try to sleep in the 90+ degree room for close to $500 that night. All that management offered was a free breakfast (wow $40). Needless to say, this property RUINED our honeymoon on Maui...I would select the Hyatt or another hotel on Kannapali before even thinking about this property!!! BUYER BEWARE...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, relaxed atmosphere, smelly toilet, some bugs”
Reviews.Author: lawahoo2001
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay here. Had to wait 2 hours to be checked into our room (the room was supposedly not ready and we were being "upgraded.") Room itself was very nice (ocean view of Molokai in building 6--on top of Black Rock), except for the smelly toilet!!! It constantly smelled of the sewer! Absolutely nasty. It was nice that the toilet had its own room (a true WC), but there was no fan to air out the smell. You can tell the room had been remodeled, but it was already falling into disrepair. We were on the first floor, so we encountered a few bugs in our room, including small roaches, moths, ants, and other creatures. There was a small lizard in our room, too, but this is all part of staying in Hawaii (believe me, I've seen worse in the Hilton Waikoloa Village at the Big Island). The resort itself, though, is fabulous. The best location on Kaanapali Beach--the beach is widest here, and is so clean and beautiful. Further south is much more crowded. I stayed in the Westin in Sept. '04, and I would rather come back to the Sheraton. The room is much bigger and quieter. If it weren't for the toilet issue, I would have rated this hotel higher.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: RussMan
Reviews.Content: This was our sixth visit staying at the Sheraton Maui, once before the tear down and remodel ten or so years ago and five time since. I am SPG Gold but no room upgrade - we booked Oceanview and got it. We were in building 4 and feel that - short of a suite - it's the best location in the resort. You're convenient to the pool and ocean, and a quick walk to the parking lot past the tennis courts. Thanks to an earlier reviewer for the tip that first day's valet is complimentary. Take advantage of it, particularly if you're just coming in from a Mainland flight. The room is unbelievably small. We didn't care because we weren't there much, but they are tiny! Greeting and check-in were great, Lei greetings and helpful staff. The room has an open fridge and, other than the obligatory $5 bottles of water, was free of high priced food traps. WiFi didn't work well but we could get a limited signal; room had a wired connection that worked about 75% of the time. We came here from Kauai, and immediately noticed the change in the staff and the guests - no eye contact and very little interaction that we didn't initiate. If you're from Southern California, you'll be very much at home here. If you talked to a fellow guest about where they were from, it was almost always Marin, Oakland, Orange, Riverside, or LA county. Ditto the other comments about guests getting up at the crack of dawn to secure a shaded pool chair. We were out at the pool around 9 or so and managed to find a spot but the choices were very limited after this. We knew better than to eat at the hotel's restuarants since no food was included in our package (we had a convertable car packaged with the room). Since our flight left late, we checked with Dollar about how much more we would have to pay for a couple hours that weren't included in the room package. First hour was $25 (acceptible), 61 minutes or longer less than a day is $76 plus all the airport charges (not acceptible). No budging on this, so we checked our bags early and traded Dollar for Hertz ($42 for 3 hours of a car, but just not giving any money to Dollar was worth it). We knew where the fitness center was, but it's tough to locate for new guests (2 or 3 elevator rides) and it is thankfully open 24 hours. The equipment is in bad need of repair and looks horrible. The elliptical machine's electronics and resistance didn't work at all. Hello Sheraton, if you're going to charge us a "resort fee" and tell us that it includes this, how about popping for some maintenance? As others have said, the Timeshare ("Sheraton Vacations") were located where you were forced to walk by their desk to go anywhere from building 4. Although they weren't obnoxious other than the fake smile and "Aloha" when you walk by, come on, Sheraton. Give us a break from this junk. There were two luaus going on both nights and we could see as much as any guest (more than we wanted to see) from our room. The Sheraton had always had a great fireworks show, and that was one of the reasons for staying there over the 4th (because of our past experience). We were disappointed to find that they discontinued this, starting this year. Lahaina had a great show that was visible after a walk down the beach. The coolest side trip we took was with Kahi Sindiong - he operates Ekahi Hawaiian Canoes at the end of the walkway (the other end of Kaanapali Beach away from the Sheraton). He charged us $50 a couple for to paddle along in an authentic Hawaiian outrigger racing canoe, complete with Hawaiian sea-turtles and great scenery. Find him if you can, you won't regret it. Best food on Maui is still Mama's Fish House. It's an hour ride from the Sheraton and worth every mile. They have lunch and dinner - we made it to one of each. There is a Roy's up the road to the left and in Kihei / Wailea that would be second choices to Mamas. Also great food and service at Ruth's Chris in Wailea, Good experience at Lelanis, so-so exeperience at Kimos in Lahaina, poor experience at Rusty Harpoon, and a bad experience at Bubba Gumps. Our flight was much later than the checkout, and the hotel offered us 1 pm checkout and access to the fitness center facilities after that (showers and towels are already there). No recognition of SPG Elite status. Bottom line, this is likely to be our final stay at The Sheraton Maui. Sad, because the property is in a great location and is well maintained. Fix the fitness center, train the staff, dump the Timeshare scum, and recognize your loyal guests. You've just lost one of them.

Reviews.Title: “This property needs an attitude adjustment”
Reviews.Author: SFO-World-Traveller
Reviews.Content: We paid a very high premium at the Sheraton Maui to stay in a deluxe ocean front room. We did so hoping for some privacy away from the madding crowds on the beach and pool area. The room itself was fine - reasonably quiet, great view. The amenities were just OK, but do not expect 5-star hotel amenities in Hawaii. What bothered us was the employees. This was absolutely the worst vacation experience we have ever had and that was purely the fault of the hotel staff. Every time we turned around we were being sold something without asking - time shares, sunglasses, excursions. After paying $450 per night for the room, we did not expect the timeshare sales office to call our room to schedule a "preview" under the guise of winning an award. After being scolded for asking to check in at 11:30 a.m. and being told firmly (not asked, told) that we would have to wait 3 1/2 hours to check in, we were phoned on the morning of our departure to see when we would be leaving because they needed the room for other guests. The staff on the whole were not at all pleasant to interact with - we felt as if we were bothering them, like we had to beg for their help. Do the staff think its guests are fools? There is nothing about this property that would make me ever want to stay here again. The staff are unremarkable and their attitude made our entire trip much less romantic and special by making it a week-long sales presentation. Who wants to go to the beach at the hotel when you have to dodge 5 rude salespeople to get there? It felt like sprinting through a used car lot. I will say it again - this was not the fault of the property - it was purely the fault of its employees, all of whom need an attitude adjustment.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but crowded...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was here for 5 nights for half of my honeymoon in the end of June. In terms of locations, service, etc. this hotel is definitely beautiful and comfortable. My only complaints: because this is it best area of the beach, it tends to get quite crowded. It really filled up around the July 4th weekend. The area around Black Rock was good for snorkeling, but be warned, there are about 30 or 40 or so people snorkeling with you during all times of the day. The pool area was also crowded. It was difficult to find shaded areas, and on the beach there was no shade; if you wanted a cabana shade you had to pay some crazy price for it.... leading up to my other complaint .... it was so pricey. Yes I know it's a fancy resort in Maui, but when I'm already paying hundreds of dollars to stay a night, I don't feel like I should pay $25 for breakfast or $38 for shade on the beach, or a $16 "resort fee". As well, our room was one of the farthest from the beach area and it was quite a walk to the main area ... we had to talk 2 elevators just to get there. Personally, I would rather have a less luxurious hotel, and have a less crowded hotel and feel like I'm getting ripped off a little less.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SGV
Reviews.Content: Loved the Sheraton it has comfortable rooms,great maid service,great beach and snorkeling good pool and is quieter then the Westin. Friendly and will remember your name everytime they see you. The downsides are that when we booked there was supposed "stay one-stay all" including use of facilities of the Westin such as the bigger pool and slides there.Well they stopped allowing that on July 1st so if you booked before then with the promise of using the other hotels pool,etc think again.I booked directly through the Starwood website and never got any sort of notice that the policy had changed.I had my friends in the Westin and we were here and it could have been a BIG problem had I not used their room number to use the Westin pool.Starwood dropped the ball on this even their employees told me that the policy was changing daily on this.Starwood- bad move to do this to people who have already booked expecting these cross privelages. The poolside food is fine although you have to walk over and get food if you are not right outside the food/bar hut.The buffet was so bad I will remember it forever had it at dinner and nobody went back for seconds in our party.Servers were good. These were really minor problems because the short walk to Whalers Village or the short drive to Lahaina has a large variety of places to dine.Bubba Gumps was good food and a fun place,Hard Rock was a normal Hard Rock. It is the easiest check in ever and you are escorted straight to your room and taken on a tour on the way if you need it.I never saw the front desk checking in.Parking is easy use your room key to get in and out of structure. If I come back to Maui I would sure stay here again no problems bad enough to discourage us.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach, great view, rooms were so so”
Reviews.Author: berkeleydude
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the Sheraton Maui for one simple reason --- it was the site of a conference that I was attending. The conference rate was $160/night + 14 for a mandatory resort fee + additional taxes. Compared to their other rates, this was a bargain, but I'd have to say that unless you are very lazy, even this is not a good deal. What did we get for all this? A spectacular location. We lucked out and got rooms on top of black rock with a gorgeous view of the ocean with the island of Molokai in the distance. Not all rooms have this nice of a view. The microwave and fridge was also an added convenience. What was bad? The internet was flakey and one of the power outlets was not reliable. The beach adjacent to the hotel is also very nice --- my wife and I took many strolls along it. But mostly, we wanted to explore the island of Maui and we felt that this was a lot of money to pay for a simple home base. Later on in our trip, we shifted to a much cheaper (Hotwire rate $69 per night) motel near the airport which was just as good for our purposes, and more centrally located as well! No gorgeous sunsets out the window, but we drove ourselves to such viewpoints ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: aventurer
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here several times and loved it every time!

Reviews.Title: “Best location on Ka'anapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Sheraton Maui, everything was wonderful. The front desk staff were so helpful, and went out of their way to upgrade us to an oceanfront room since we were there for our Honeymoon. The room was basic, but very clean, and the view was fantastic. We also had a large lanai overlooking the beautiful hotel grounds and beach/ocean that we used almost every night and every morning. The hotel had a nice pool and spa area, and the location was the best on Ka'anapali Beach. Black Rock (the area directly outside the hotel) had great snorkeling. And, unlike many of the hotels on Ka'anapali Beach, there was a fairly large beach right outside the hotel. The restaurants at the hotel were nice, and they featured live Hawaiian music and a hula dancer most every night. There was also a Hawaiian ceremonial dive off of Black Rock every night at sunset that is good to see at least once. Although this hotel wasn't as big and fancy as others in the area, it definitely felt the most like Hawaii, and truly had the best location.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Sheraton after a lot research like everyone else. We got a run of house and lucked into a partial ocean view that faced Blackrock and the courtyard...Great view. The accomadations were good and we had no issues with the service or the room age and so forth. Nice housekeeping staff. We rented a car for touring and went all over. The food was not outlandishly priced if you took your time and looked at the menus posted outside of most of the restaurants. We found Mango's and Moose Mcgillacutty's several whaler shop places to eat. Lahaina was a treat and lots of places to shopMost places were $10 per person plus drinks. Happy hours everywhere $4 for beer we also did the Molokini excursion. Ok but not spectacular although we did see whales and turtles but at a distance. Boss frogs books these places for a discount. Do not rent anything from the hotel! All you need is towel at the beach....ahhhhhh the beach. Perfect for everything. Perfect sunsets ....worst part the plane trip back to ohio...

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tmac30
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three days in paradise at the Sheraton for our honeymoon. When we got the hotel we got a great Lei greeting and double upgraded to a fantastic room with a ocean and pool views just to the side of black rock. This included two balconies where we could sit and watch the cliff diving in the evening. Once we got to our room we had a basket of food and free bottle of wine welcoming us to the hotel. The resort was great the only two complaints that I would have is everything is very expensive and you need to get up very early to get a good pool seat. For example, first day we went for breakfast to the coffee bar and had two coffees and one bagel costing us more then ten dollars. The other was the lack of pool seats available. First day we got down to the pool at 7:00am and we lucked out with the last semi-shaded pool seat. I talked with the manager at the pool area and he said that some people getâ€“up at 5:00 to put out their towel, all I can say is get a life. We ate at the hotel for lunch only and it was good not great but decent. Dinners looked to be over priced so we went to Whalers Village, highly recommend the Hula Grill. All in all this is a true five star. A few tips for your trip: Valet Parking for your first day is free take advantage of it, cabana rentals are about $40 but well worth it as you do not have to rush down to the pool to get a seat. If you are not big on breakfast, go to the ABC store and buy cereal and fruit it saves you lots of money; for afternoon drinks, Hula Grill has the best happy hour in the Village.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Sheraton, but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton last week (May30-June 6)and overall I was pleased with the resort. We were upgraded to a partial ocean view which was nice since it overlooked the golfcourse as well. The Starwood people in the lobby are there to sell you a time-share, don't fool yourself. They will call you in your room every day to "check" on you or offer you a "free gift", but nothing is free in Hawaii. The beach was beautiful as was the pool. The one downfall that I have was at about 2:30 in the afternoon one of the bars next to the pool closes. This was a real pain, since you had to walk to the other side of the resort for a drink while laying by the pool. The restuaraunts at the hotel are good, but very expensive for what you are getting. All in all, I liked the resort and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for a week in May. It was a great experience. The front desk staff was awesome from the minute we got there. We had a building preference (Building 4 is by far the best folks, beg for it and beg for the side closest to the beach.) We were right on the beach on the 4th floor. Fantastic views of the beach, the black rock and the pool area and right downstairs is a nice cabana with one table that hardly anyone uses. Great to sit with a bottle of wine in the evening. The beach was very nice, a bit busy, but every beach by any resort is busy since they're public, you just have to deal with it. Any bad experience on a public beach should not reflect on the resort. They do nickel and dime you but you pretty much get that anywhere, anyone complaining about being charged for everything hasn't spent enough time in resort towns at a 4 or 5 star, they all do ! We had a package deal which included breakfast everyday and $25 dining credit per day. Definately shoot for something like that, they run the promotion quite often. The breakfast buffet is great and takes care of your morning and lunch, normally it's $23 per person. We had the buffet and just one other meal a day somewhere which was plenty. The restaurants are nice but expensive which was expected. Having the $25/day credit helped out a lot. The staff was nothing but professional with us, cleaning staff was professional and friendly also. You can use the other Starwood resorts but we were unimpressed with the Westin, pool is nice but that's it. We didn't bother going to any others, the Sheraton had the best grounds in our opinion. We looked at all the other hotels/condos on Kaanipali. The Sheraton is definately our favorite hands down. Spend some time in Lahaina. Great little town.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patty O
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is nice. The hotel is really large and it takes a while to traverse from one end to the lobby. Our room was not ready at 7PM on arrival so we were upgraded to a super deluxe beachfront room which costs $640 per night. On the downside, there were stains on the carpet and wallpaper and the furniture was a little shabby and worn, surprising for the cost. As other people have noted, it's VERY expensive for meals and other amenities. Thought it was an OK hotel but not worth the high rent

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Best Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Maui from May 10-18. We had an absolutely wonderful stay at the hotel. The rooms seemed to have been recently refurbished and the hotel grounds were amazing. We had a buffet breakfast inlcuded with our room which was well worth it and very good. The food at the Pool Bar could have done with some improvement. The location of the hotel, on Black Rock, is fantastic. The snorkelling was unbelievable with the guarantee to see fish a few metres from shore. From the hotel we were able to walk to Whalers Village which we found quite disappointing for meals and shops (except for the ABC store which is great for water, souvenirs etc). We often caught the $1 bus to Lahaina which had a vast variety of restaurants and fantastic food. Try the Fish & Co in Lahaina for a very tasty meal. Lahaina had a great range of shops, art gallery's and restaurants so it was well worth the bus trip. We also went to the luau in Lahaina (behind the Cannery) which we were advised by the locals was the best show in town. We definately were not disappointed - the entertainment and the food was great. If you are staying at the Sheraton, make sure you visit the Westin Maui, the pool there is unbelievable and the food at the pool bar is very good. After reading some reviews we were hesitant about going to the Sheraton but the beach, grounds and views are priceless.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely lovely. From the moment we pulled up in the rental car and were greeted with orchid leis to the checkout, our experience here was great. We were upgraded upon check-in (Starwood member) to an ocean view in Bldg #3 and the view was like a postcard. Nice size room close to lobby with large bath, the new Sheraton "Sweet Sleep" beds, nice (high threadcount) sheets and good size patio. It was relatively quiet while we were there (5 night stay), so we did not encounter any cruise ship folks on the beach. Spent one day snorkeling around Black Rock, walked to Whaler's Village for dining & shopping and had an all around excellent experience. The location of this hotel was great and the staff were top notch. As someone who has worked in the hotel and resort industry, I give the Sheraton Maui a big thumbs up and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Sub Standard Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from four nights at the Sheraton. The hotel is nice, in a good location. It is also great that you can use the pool at the Westin. The level of service is downright horrible. The first time I heard a "thank you" was at checkout.
