At one point we had to go to the front desk, while in mid conversation, the lady at the front desk answered a ringing phone...the only problem was she did not say anything to us, just answered the phone. Then she proceeded to talk on the phone for a few minutes while we waited for her to hang up, and then there was no sorry or excuse me...At the pool, they try to sell you on the cabana's or chairs on the beach, when we told the pool attendant we weren't interested, we practically had to beg for towels. They try to nickel and dime you for everthing at the resort. We did not eat at the hotel as the menu's were very overpriced. Also, upon checkin, they upgraded us to an "ocean view" room, which sounded nice, but every room at the resort is ocean view so making a big deal about the upgrade was not necessary. For about the same price, just over $300 a night, check out the two resorts in Lanai, they treat you like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “not up to standard.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Sheraton. Yes, it is a nice hotel but a few things put a sour taste on the trip. The big one was that the Sheraton allows cruise ships to use the beach so you get this influx of people who spent a few hours on the beach and left it looking like a pig stye! right beside our beach chairs some people left about 20 cigarette butts in the sand as well as garbage. Really low class I thought! The other was that they charge you for absolutely EVERYTHING! Don't think that the coffee and paper is complimentary, it isn't. As well as the chairs at the beach or umbrellas, everything has a high rental cost to it. The food was good but EVERY meal came to $50.00 for 2 people at the hotel! No, it was ok to go once but with the better deals of the all inclusives in the Mayan Riviera, we would suggest to go to Mexico! Oh, and if you don't like Mexico because of the "timeshare" sellers, don't kid yourself....they do it at the Sheraton as well........

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Maui for 6 days in April and it was perfect. When we arrived we were greeted with leis and they immediately gave us a double upgrade without us having to ask. We had reserved a garden view room and ended up with an ocean view. The staff was attentive and courteous. Fellow guests were polite - rooms were nicely appointed and quiet - and the pools were beautiful. The location of the Sheraton is awesme - one of the best snorkeling locations on Maui is right off shore at Black Rock. And the torch lit walk to Whaler's Village and the other resorts is a beautiful backdrop for the impressive sunsets. We didn't try the restaurant, but the poolside grill/bar was good. The hotel has a very imprssive collection of koi - and when you walked alongside the pools they would follow you! The gym had cardio and universal equipment - but no freeweights that I remember - it did have showers though which was nice. The only 2 things I would critique are: 1. on some days, there were not enough lounge chairs by the pool, and guests tended to "claim" chairs with wet towels and sometimes not return to use them. 2. while self parking was easy (and free!) there were a limited number of spots in our lot and we returned from a luau at 11 one night to find it full. But this was still one of the best hotel stays we've ever experienced and we will definitely go back with high expectations.

Reviews.Title: “A week in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Whill381
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week staying at the Sheraton Maui. The reviews here are mostly good and that's accurate. I had to register to post because I can't think of a single bad thing to say about the resort. The grounds and buildings are just beautiful, I've never stayed anywhere quite like it. Everything was wide open, there really are no "doors" anywhere, ohter than on the guest rooms. Breezes blew thru the lobby and all of the hallways. Even the elevator lobby areas were open to outside with beautiful tropical wicker type furniture. The grounds were paradise. The Sheraton really has a lot of land and is spread out...which we found to be a good thing. Walkways and tiki torches, greenery, flowers, palm trees, koi ponds, pools, waterfalls, lazy rivers...it all runs throughout the area. We walked down to the Westin one day to check it out...and while it is beautiful and the pools are something to see, we chose NOT to spend any time there. The buildings were darker and more closed off. They felt less tropical. Around every corner, Westin is trying to sell you on your next vacation with them in any and every state, plus they hit you up for timeshares. Also, the Westin is formed in a U-shape open to the ocean, so they are limited on space. Their pool area is crammed in and as one other poster noted, it's very LOUD at the Westin, with kids playing and waterfalls flowing. I know, this is not a Westin review, but I thought a comparison might be helpful to some. We went back "home" to the Sheraton fully glad it was the property we chose. We got a lei greeting upon arrival and dropped our bags off in our room. They had is in a room with 2 double beds, not what we requested. But, they said to check back in the morning. So, rather than unpack and settle, we headed out to the cabana by the pool for our first Mai Tai. Sure enough, first thing the next morning they moved us to a room on the 5th floor with a king/sweet sleep bed, with a partial ocean view. The rooms are very nice and well kept. The bathroom is large with plenty of counter space for toiletries. It's so nice to be able to set things out and leave them there. The bed and pillows were very comfy. The Sheraton is in the perfect location, it's beautiful with Black Rock right there and the snorkeling was great. It's also so nice to take the sidewalk path along the ocean to head to Whaler's Village and the restaurants down that way. Hula Grill, Lailani's, etc. Have some HULA PIE at Lailani's! Also as other reviews have posted, if you're looking for some good meals to save a buck or two, Castaways was great for breakfast. CJ's deli was good for lunch. Maui Taco's was tasty. Dinners were pricey so we tried to save some on other meals. The staff was friendly and helpful. Drinks the pool are pricey but good. We never had to hunt for a pool chair. And, we did get a late check out at 1PM the day we left, for no extra charge. I suppose it depends on who you talk to/work with for service...room upgrades or late check outs. But if one person tells you no, I'd say it wouldn't hurt to ask someone else an hour later! We had a great, laid back, relaxing, wonderful week in PARADISE and I hope to go back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised- Loved the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: SeattleFamilyof5
Reviews.Content: We were married in October 2004 on the other side of Black Rock and stayed at the Sheraton out of convenience. We loved it! Our room was out on Black Rock and had a fantastic view. The room itself was sufficient but not over the top. We sat on the lanai having breakfast and watched numerous turtles swimming by. Beautiful! We snorkled and used the pool, which were both fantastic. Swam with turtles every day! We found the staff to be exceptionally helpful with anything. We had about 40 guests for our wedding and the desk staff helped with welcome bags for all . They were willing to help us in anyway. The staff constantly greeted us whenever they saw us. The bars at the pool were used alot by all of us and were great. Watch out for the Mai Tai'! Very good, still think about them! Had an outdoor massage the day of our wedding and it was wonderful. After our wedding festivities we went on our honeymoon to the island of Lanai and expected the same if not better service at the Manele Bay Hotel but it did not compare to the service at the Sheraton. Also, I had stayed previously at the Maui Westin down the beach and loved their heavenly bed program, their rooms were great, we visited their pool one day this time and found it to be so much louder than the Sheraton. Bigger slide and all but not as relaxing as the Sheratons pool.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: LLMA
Reviews.Content: Since I rely so heavily on this site for information, I felt compelled to share our experience with the Sheraton. My husband and I just returned from a 4 night stay. We had stayed there 2 years ago and loved it so much decided that staying there again was a no-brainer. Unfortunately, it seems some things have changed in the last 2 years. We found the staff to be stand offish and not very helpful this time...the main difference is that they seem very stingy with everything. After booking us incorrectly in a double bed room instead of a king they had no other rooms available to make it right. Even given the inconvenience, they really didn't seem to care. On the last day, we requested to check out later. First, they told us it would be $50 to check out at 2:00 instead of 11:00 am and $150 if we wanted to stay until 4:00 (before it was only $50 to stay until 4:00). We agreed to stay until 2:00 and pay $50 and then the front desk told us that we could not do it, even if we paid...that we would have to leave no matter what. We worked it out and stayed until 2:00 but only after having to fight for extra time that we were paying for. The other disappointing thing was the crowds...we went at the same time of year last time and never saw the beach and pool so crowded. The last day there was not a single chair to sit in by the pool, unless you saved one by 8:00 am. We ventured over to Wailea and Makena and found those beaches MUCH less crowded (and great for bodysurfing and boogie boarding too!). Next time we return to Maui we will definitely stay on that side of the island. On a positive note, we tried The Feast at LeLe for the first time and LOVED it...better than Old Lahaina Luau in our opinion. Also highly recommend Cafe O Lei in Lahaina and Maui Eco tours for kayaking. All in all it was a great stay, but the Sheraton just left us with a sour taste.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: g8rchick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon Hawaii tour. 3 nights were not nearly enough and we wished we had a week there. Our first room was unsatisfactory and they upgraded us to a better room right away. It was a bit of a walk to the main area from the new room but we didn't mind. The beach is pretty and the pool is awesome. We would definitely stay here again. Also if you stay here you can use any of the starwood properties. We got a couples massage over at the Westin and that looked like a fabulous hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: stacie
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Sheraton. We stayed 5 nights from 4/12-4/17. We really enjoyed our stay here. We had a Garden view room which we booked through Costco. Our Garden View room was on the bottom floor so there wasn't much of a view but we still had a very large balacony and the price was right. We had no complaints with the room. We spent a lot of time at the bar overlooking the water, let me warn you the drinks are expensive. About $9 for a cocktail but the view is well worth the price. Be careful though because at $9 each the bill can add up fast We only ate at the hotel restaurant once for lunch and we had a salad and a sandwich but we enjoyed it.We had a good pork sandwich from the bar menu though. Other restaurants that we ate at that we would recommend were Kimo's in Lahainaa-this place has great fish selections and we have eaten here our last 2 stays and enjoyed it a lot. We also ate at Leilani's several times and we ate at there bar/grill menu, very reasonable and good food. We also ate at Hula Grill which was good and we also tried Sansei sushi in Kapulua. Sushi was good but our bill came to about $91 for 2 and I was not that impressed for the price. We eat a lot of sushi in California so we are kind of spoiled and not easily impressed. We tried the rusty Harpoon, also in the whalers village-we were not impressed at all and would not recommend it. Food was not goodm slow service and for the price you pay it is not worth it. Stick with the Hula Grill and Leilanis if your going to the Whalers Village. We did the Snorkel trip to Molikini for a second year in a row. We took the suggestion from the "maui revealed" book and went with the "Four Winds 2". Last year we went with the "Pride of Maui". I would not recommend the Four Winds-the boat trip to Molokini was very slow and it was a very bumpy ride. Lots of people getting motion sickness. We also got sick and we even took medicine. Last years trip on the "Pride" was much smoother and it's a larger boat. The crew seemed friendlier on the "Pride of Maui" and made you feel more welcome. Overall I would not take another trip to Molikini and would not recommend you go. If you are staying at the sheraton the snorkeling out front at Black Rock is far better than Molikini-trust me! You will see much more fish and more variety than you will on the snorkel trip. If you want to blow $80 a person on the trip you will have fun but there was very few fish and not much variety. The visibility is good but not much to look at. Save your money. You will really enjoy the snorkeling at the hotel. We saw a turtle the first day within the first 5 minutes we were in the water. Snorkel around the point and you will find more turtles, lots of fish, big schools of fish, lots of variety. This snorkeling is far better out front of the hotel than on the snorkel trip. We also played Golf at the Kaanapali Golf course, north course. I am not a very good golfer myself. My boyfriend and the other group we played with were not impressed with the greens.They all commented about the fact that they were in not that good of shape for the $130 price we paid. All in all we had a great stay at the Sheraton, everyone was very nice and friendly. We would definately recommend it for the great location, relaxed atmosphere, and the best beach and snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bruinsmith
Reviews.Content: From our late-arriving Sunday night check-in to our check-out a week later, we knew that we had made the right hotel choice on Maui. Ours was a family trip during Spring Break in mid-April with 11 and 14 year old children. The Sheraton was a hit with all of us! At check-in, our room was actually upgraded twice -- no charge. They also provided a rollaway bed -- again, no charge. This may not sound like much, but in Hawaii there is a charge for everything! We had a great room overlooking the pool, the beach and Black Rock where we could enjoy the Cliff Diving ceremony every evening right from our balcony. The snorkling right off Black Rock is one of the better places on Maui. We encountered not only many beautiful fish, but even giant Sea Turtles. The kids loved that! (note: check around to get a great deal on renting snorkel gear -- the rental at the beach is outrageous! Off-site, we rented gear for 4 of us for the week that was less than the daily charge right at the beach) The beauty was the location. Walk out of the room, through the exspansive Pool area, onto the beach and into the water. It's all right there. The staff at the Sheraton were great also. They were very friendly, very helpful and very accomodating. At times in Hawaii you can get an indifferent attitude in dealing with people. We never experienced that at this hotel. It was a great week, a fun vacation in a beautiful place. My kids didn't want to leave. My wife and I have been to several different hotels in Hawaii and this is one that we will be returning to. Just not soon enough.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Staying Here!!”
Reviews.Author: schultz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Maui for our honeymoon from Dec 13th - Dec 19th, 2004. We arrived early in the morning so we didn't get greated with a lai ;( but we did get upgraded to an oceanview room which was very nice in the building closest to the pool and beach. The weather was GROGEOUS and the hotel was quiet which was very nice. The beach was nice and I loved the pool with a mini waterfall and how the hot tub was tucked away. The room was simple and clean so no complaints there. The hotel restaurants were expensive so we had breakfast once in the hotel, learned out lesson and then went out to dinner in Lahaina, the little town 10 minutes away, or even around Kaanapali there were a few restaurants. Loved that we were walking distance to Whalers Village which offered a few fast food places to grab lunch at. ABC stores were amazing for EVERYTHING! Souvenirs to drinks, snacks..... I got alot of mixed reveiws on trip advisor and have to admit that i was a little concerned but I have NO IDEA why people would complain about the Sheraton Maui!! It was PERFECT!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Destination”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the fresh flower lei greeting at check in, to the fact that they have your car waiting for you when you call for the bellman at checkout, this hotel cares about their guests' comfort. The bellman gives you a little tour when you arrive, so you feel at ease right off the bat. The hotel is located on the best site of this area, near Whaler's village, but on the quiet end of the district. Clean, comfortable rooms with a lovely porch. We booked late but even the garden view in the back of the hotel showed a glimpse of the ocean and clffs and a nice view of the golf course. The hotel is well maintained, lovely tropical pools, good sundown entertainment on the deck bar. Our teens jumped off the 'cliffs' into the ocean; the highlight of their trip. The hotel leaves messages for you, checking along your stay to make sure that everything is to your liking. The frendliness of the staff is exceptional. It is a very nice luxury resort and you would not be disappointed if you came here. We went to Hana hwy, we went on a whale tour (go to slip 2 at Laihana, they do the best tour), shopped and ate in Laihana, shopped and ate in Whaler's village, and saw the sun rise at Mt. Halekala (we FROZE; take coats, gloves and a blanket, it's SOOO cold). Speaking of Whaler's village (within walking distance of the hotel; there is a kiosk in front of the Black & White clothing store where we bought exquisite, art at reasonable prices. The manager there is fantastic!).

Reviews.Title: “Paradise found”
Reviews.Author: recres
Reviews.Content: This website was very helpful to us to plan our trip, so I wanted to return the favor. Hope this helps your planning. You have to rent a car. We had a Sebring convertable with discounts paid $266/week, pretty reasonable. As you leave the airport you will drive by a K-Mart. Stop and buy an inexpensive styro. cooler, soda, bottled water etc. It will be a lot cheaper here than later. We wanted to go to the top of Haleakala for the sunrise the first morning. Being from WI. you will wake early. I woke up at 2:45am. The first night we stayed in a hotel in Kihei. It cuts off a lot of driving than starting from Kanapali. It was 1:45 from the base to reach the summit. An easy drive, the road is smooth and wide. The view and experience is second to none. It was truly a remarkable experience to see the sunrise over that crater. It was about 30 degrees which isn't bad for a midwesterner, but the wind was about 30 mph and the wind chill would freeze you to the bone so take warm clothes and gloves. The person taking the pictures without the gloves will suffer. That be me!! If you do anything in Maui this is a must! We then stayed at the Shereton in Kanapali. We had a oceanfront room that they upgraded to a deluxe. The room was spacious and comfortable and we were able to see whales right from our lanai. We had read some bad reviews about the rooms at the Shereton but the beds were very comfortable and we were pleased with our stay. Of course for the price you expect to be. When we arrived they gave ua a lai and had us sit down and relax while they loaded our luggage onto a golf cart for our transportation to our room. No formal check-in, very nice touch. We had read a lot about incidential charges that are aggrevating. Well, they do charge for chairs on the beach and they charge a $14.50/ day resort fee just like many other hotels. That's Hawaii, get over it or it will ruin your vacation. We snorkeled at Black Rock, right off the beach at the Shereton. We saw some pretty neat fish and four sea turtles which were neat but I would also recommend going to Molikini snorkeling if your serious about better snorkling. It is nice though to have that right off your beach. Whalers village is a short walk or drive to shopping and some dining. Get a nice hawaiian shirt at Tommy Bahama's. Expensive but very nice. Hey, it's your vacation! We had dinner one night at Swan Court in the Hyatt. The Hyatt was another hotel I thought would be very nice to stay at. Swan court is another must! The setting is second to none and the food is delicious. We ordered two appetisers and two salads and shared an entree. That way you can try a lot more dishes. They were very kind to bring our entree on two separate serving plates. (no extra charge) Service was great. Call for res. They open at 6:00pm. Go early and ask for a table by the water. If you like to dine, you will remember it for a long time. They validate your valet parking. Best dinner we had in Maui. Went on a helicopter ride with Blue Hawaiian. If you do this, this is probably the best. However, it was $400 for 45 minutes for two. Probably wouldn't do it again. The small thing that ticked me off was after the flight we had to pay $3 for parking at the heliport. You would think for $400 they would validate your parking. Again, you have to let those things slide. Took day trip south to Wailea and the south shore. A lot of nice beaches and sites and some good restaurants and shopping in the shops of Wailea. Also drove up to Iao Valley and the Maui plantation. Nothing great but nice to see. Went to the Old Lahaina Luau. My wife wanted to go more than I, but I really enjoyed it. You saw how they buried and roasted the pig; had a great variety of food; a great variety of tropical drinks, all included and good entertainment. Unless you like eating wallpaper paste stay away from the poi, no matter what anyone says, take my advise. I eat anything, but that stuff is nasty! If you go to a luau make sure you pay the price and go to this one. Others I have attended in the past for less were less! We also drove around the northern tip of Maui. I know it says no rentals beyond a certain point but it really is ok if you drive carefully. But it is at your own risk. Hey, if your one of those yahoo's that rode a bike down the volcano you certainly can do this. Make sure you have a good map with sites to see and milage markers or you will miss a lot. We went as far as Kahakuloa. There is a wonderful gallery there with very nice souveniers and a much needed bathroom. Prior to that you will see the stand with the "best banana bread". We concur, $5 for a mini loaf, a nice snack. You could take drinks and water in that cooler you bought at K-Mart earlier. You should always have liquids to drink. The views are much like off Hwy 1 in Ca. south of Big Sur. Very nice. Touring the golf courses in Kapalua are worthwhile. I would have loved to golf but my wife isn't a golfer so I spent my money in the pro shop! We took the road to Hana but were disappointed. We had high hopes because we love the outdoors and hiking but after taking that northern tip trip, the views just couldn't compare. Part of this was because there has been a bit of a drought and the waterfalls were just not that impressive. We bought the CD that describes the trip. It was probably worthwhile but the guy talks fast and I missed some because I was concentrating on my driving. It is a very winding road and I even was a bit motion sick at the end. I think its insanity to drive there and back in one day; especially when you have a property like the Hotel Hana Maui at the end. It's not a place for small kids because they would be bored but it is a wonderful relaxing property with a great spa and good food. We only stayed one night but wish we would have had two, so we could have enjoyed more. No clocks, TV's or phones; and really nothing else there, other than some nice spots you can drive to past Hana. But a couple of days of nothing but laying by the pool, a spa etc. would really put you in a good mood to travel back home. Especially if you were travelling to snow and 20 degrees. Leaving in the morning to go back to the airport is about 1:45 min. Most of the traffic is of course driving the other way to Hana. I could have written much more. We always left about two hours in the afternoons for pool or beach time in the sun. Wow, what a life. Someone ask me why I live in Wisconsin!. By the way gas is $2.66/gal, $3.16 in Hana. We bought a tank from the rental car co. at seven cents/gal below market and just went back with little gas in the tank. That way you don't have to worry about stopping at a station at the end. Have a wonderful trip. It was our 30th anniversary and we couldn't have had a better time. Maui is indeed a paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the islands busy end on our second trip. The Sheraton was a perfect choice. The room was clean, the beds surprisingly comfortable and the staff helpful. The property is larger than most so you never felt you were in a crowd---except at the pool of course. The beachfront walk to a small shopping center and several restaurants provided our evenings meal and entertainment .Will definitely return to the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Heaven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This review is going back a year, we stayed at the Sheraton Maui for 9 days on our honeymoon in Oct 2004. The other 5 we were in Waikiki on Oahu. The Sheraton Maui is a WONDERFUl hotel. We were treated like royalty the moment we drove up. From the time we got into the parking lot, we never touched our bags until we were ready to leave. The resort is spread out and depending on where you are staying, there is some walking involved to get around. However you quickly develope "routes" in your head and can get around very easy. With such a large spread, the resort never seems crowded and the air is full of the flowery smells of Hawaii. We stayed in an ocenview room right on the black rock. It was great! The room is clean and comfortable. I have read reviews complaining about the matresses. I can't speak for all the rooms, but ours was like sleeping on a cloud. It was very comfortable. The resort has a prime location for swimming, snorkeling and scuba. It also is only a short walk up the beach to Whalers Village and many shops and places to eat. We found that the pool side bar does serve lunch and snacks but seemed expensive to us. $30 for hamburgers (no fries) and chocolate smoothies for 2. Neither of us drink very often so I cannot tell you what the alcohol prices were. Better off walking up the beach to the Hula Grill. The fruit sampler platter is awesome, as well as the other food. Very reasonable and a great view. We did break down and have lunch at the resort though, we just were enjoying laying around too much to head up the beach to the restaurants. The pool is also great. I read a poor review or 2 about it and do not know why. It is very large and lagoon type. You will spend alot more time in the ocean than the pool but the pool is great. You also have pool priveleges at the Westin Maui 2 hotesl down. They have a water slide and waterfall and a grotto type area. Very nice, but very kid friendly. If you are a family with children, they will like this pool a lot better. Honeymooners or older couples will like the Sheraton pool better. Contrary to another review, there IS a hot tub. You just need to look for it. You cannot swim to it. It is on the ocean view side , screened by plants and up a few stairs. Ask someone who works there to point it out if you can't find it. The pool area is very large, with many foot bridges crossing it. Walk around it and explore and you will find the tub on your own. One thing I cannot stress enough is to use the concierge service. They are GREAT. We planned virtually no activities until we got to the resort and did it all on the fly. The concierge got us great deals, directed us where to go and took care of all reservations. They simply bill the cost to your room, so you go to many of the activities, show ID and off you go. No paying and all that at the location, it is already done. We ate most of our meals in Lahaina and never ate in the regular restaurant at the resort so I cannot rate it. There is a Japanese restaurant called Tepanyaki Dan on the resort and we did eat there. It is excellent food and a lot of fun. We sat at a table with 2 other couples on their honeymoons and had a great time. If you have never eaten in a Japanese style restaurant before, just remember to allow yourself time. You are not in and out in 30 minutes. Also you will need to make reservations ahead of time to get in. It is popular and not very large. A bit pricy but worth it for the experiance and the special occassion. The only negative I have is that the hotel (and the one on Oahu) tends to nickel and dime you. The room we stayed in was not cheap on either island. You would think coffee would be included but if you make it in the room, or tea or hot chocolate, you will be charged. They also charge you for the use of the beach chairs, NOT the ones at the pool but the ones that you take onto the sand. For what you pay for the room, I would think that would cover chairs, but Hawaii is a bit on the pricey side. Just take a few extra towels from the kiosk by the pool and you will be fine. The staff is very friendly and we did not have a single problem with our stay. Tip: If you go up to Haliakala ( I know I spelled it wrong) to watch the sun rise dress WARM. It is COLD before the sun comes up. If you have the room in your luggage pack gloves (yes, gloves) a hat and a warm coat. We had brought light jackets with us. I wanted to bring coats but my wife thought I was crazy bringing stuff like that to Hawaii ( I saw people on tv wearing the stuff before we left home...but anyway) all we brought were jackets. We took the robes that the hotel provides with us and wore them over our t shirts and under our jackets when we got there and made due. We also took towels and draped them over our heads held on by our ball caps to keep our ears warm ( you are 10,000 feet up). In addition, bring a flashlight. Inside the closet there is a plug in flashlight for emergencies attached to the wall. When you pull it off its mount it turns on, unscrew the bottom slightly and it will turn off. Screw it back in and it comes on. There are no lights on the mountain summit, the viewing area has a shelter and a map but nothing else. Everyone was crowding around our flashlight setting up their cameras, prior to the sunrise. Just remember to return all the towels, robes and flashlight to your room when you get back! ( The hotel concierge told us about the flashlight!) Enjoy the hotel, it is truly a place in paradise. My wife and I would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the property and the rooms. EVERYTHING is expensive in Hawaii so this is no different. Enjoyed being able to walk down the boardwalk and take the shuttle for a buck. Plenty to do in the area. The hotel pool was outstanding even though the chairs were sometimes full. The beach was beautiful also and the snorkeling at black rock was great. The Japanese retaurant was good but portions small. Walked to Lahaina Grill which is a must for fresh seafood. Also met a great Canadian couple that we enjoyed visiting with. Grounds were excellent also. The only thing bad about the hotel is you get nickle and dimed all the time. Daily charge, beach loungers, valet etc. It gets old when you are paying a fortune for the room. But that is Maui for you. Jon

Reviews.Title: “Overcrowded beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel every year. The hotel itself is beautiful, the rooms are always clean and comfortable, and the hotel staff is accommodating (if sometimes on "Hawaiian" time). The breakfast buffet is great, but the dinner is okay and on the expensive side. Eat at Bubba Gump or any of the Italian restaurants around. One thing that began to bother us recently is that the hotel is allowing cruise ships to use the beach. The last time we went, the beach was super noisy and overcrowded with rude cruise ship tourists, with noisy children in tow. They set up their chairs (whole families with screaming babies, food, drinks, sand toys) right in front of you, completely blocking your view of the ocean and making so much noise that you can hardly hear the surf. This takes away all the enjoyment of the beautiful scenery, and as these people walk over to the pool as well, it's impossible to get any peace and quiet anywhere but in your room. If you like kids and don't mind noise, it's a great hotel, but if you are looking for a quiet vacation, you will be very frustrated and disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, indifferent service”
Reviews.Author: oaktown00
Reviews.Content: Rambling thoughts: The best part of the Sheraton Maui is its location and grounds. It is located at the end of Kaanapali Beach. The beach is wider here than at any other point, giving plenty of room to everyone. The hotel was full when we were here, but it did not seem crowded. The Sheraton grounds are large as well, giving it a less crowded feel. We went down to the Westin to use their pool, but felt like everyone was jammed into a small space. The path that runs the length of the beach ends at the Sheraton, so there are not as many people criss-crossing in front of the hotel. The room was large enough, and well appointed. The beds were a little to soft and sagged in the middle, but were comfortable enough. Although you don't go to Hawaii to watch TV, the hotel should be embarrassed by the 19" TV. The room also lacks any kind of internet service. The service at the Sheraton is spotty at best, indifferent at worst. We did have some pleasant experiences with certain staff, but overall it was pretty bad. For example, we sat at a table at the poolside bar for 30 mins without a waitress even addressing us. It's not the type of service that I would expect from a Sheraton or a resort in Hawaii. In the end, though, it really didn't matter. At night, if you want a good, cheesy, free lounge act under the stars with relatively cheap drinks, go next door to the Kaanapali Beach Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise found but where was the entertainment?”
Reviews.Author: Lucy50
Reviews.Content: We visited in November 04, after spending 5 days on Waikiki Beach, this was just so different, perfect for a relaxing beach holiday yet close enough to visit busy Lahaina town for shopping, restaurants and sightseeing. Also, a 5 minute walk along a beach path takes you to Whalers Village where there is a food court, an ABC store and other interesting shops and 3 restaurants (although they were always crowded). Best deals? Stay 5 nights or more and get the brillant buffet breakfast included; take the shuttle which stops outside the hotel into town for $1 each way; in the evening try the all you can eat buffet at the Ka'anaapali beach resort next door then stay for the lively outdoor musical entertainment which was certainly much better than anything at the Sheraton. Apart from this, the Sheraton is a fantastic place to stay, in a great location on a beautiful beach. Staff, rooms, food all first class, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for toddlers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 6 day stay at the Sheraton. My husband and 27 month old son and I LOVED it. The spacious lawn provided ample running around for our son, although he rarely spent time there since he wanted to be in the pool the entire time. While not swimming, he really enjoyed feeding the koi in the pond and watching the hula girls dance on stage every night. The biggest downside is the expensive breakfast. If your not into the buffet, try the Westin down the block, its ala carte menu is actually less than the Sheraton's and you can still charge it back to your room. We are already planning a trip for next year with the grandparents!

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the Sun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: just got back from 8 days at the Sheraton with out 3 kids. Our room was great overlooking the pool but set way back so as not the be a problem with noise. I was expecting the sweetsleep mattresses but alas I guess they haven't made it as far as Hawaii yet! As mentioned in a prevous post the staff went around and gave you these plastic wristbands to wear showing you were a guest. These really didn't do much to keep away people who weren't guests because we were never asked our names or room numbers when we were given them...just if we were guests or not. Somedays we were given them others not. It was strange. 2 days out of the 8 the Sheraton allowed cruise ships to access the beach in front of the hotel. By 11 a.m. about 200 or so more guests were using the pool and blocking out any access to the beach that guests had! I was pretty upset with this! It was impossible to get any service from waitstaff around the pool, you were better off going to the bar yourself. Breakfast buffett was fantastic with kids eating free. Location was wonderful being right at the end of the hotel strip. Great access to Whalers Village with wonderful shops! Grounds IMPECCIBLE! Rooms OK with very small bathroom with NO fans so putting on makeup after a shower was frustrating. Hotel nice and spread out so you don't feel crowded even though the hotel was to full capacity. Would i stay here again? Probably....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrscomics
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an eight day stay at the Sheraton Maui - the resort is terrific! Great location, terrific breakfast buffet that will last you until dinner... and great place to snorkel, play tennis or lounge around. Maui is not cheap - so don't expect 1.99 breakfast specials... but, the quality is well worth the extra $. We had spent last year at Kapalua - and Kaanapali (spelling?) beach is better for walking, strolling and running. It is great to be able to walk along the beachwalk - and get to Whaler's Village (great shopping) - plus all the other hotels on the beach - Hyatt, Marriott, Westin - they're all off this beachwalk - and they're all nice as well - but this location for all the hotels is great because you can get into Lahaina fairly well by shuttle (one dollar per person) - or by taxi... the shuttle stops at most of the hotels on the beach strip. Maui is the best - and this area of Lahaina has much to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton Maui - great resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. We visited most of the other hotels and this was by far the prettiest hotel on the west side of Maui. We got a deluxe ocean view room and it was perfect, quiet, clean and nice. We even saw whales out of our balcony. Hotel is well laid out, staff is very friendly, very nice pool, right next to the best beach in Maui and there is lots to do in and near the hotel. You're not stuck eating every meal in the hotel. There's a nice walkway in front of the hotel to the other properties and whaler's village is a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Overall an excellent hotel - we were there 12/19 - 12/24 and we'd go back. Also they let you use the hotel facilities (pool, showers, etc.) after you check out in case you have a late flight. So that was very nice since we had to check out @ 11 and our flight wasn't till 11pm. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay looking to return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Celebrated our 25th aniversary here (oct. 28 - nov. 1) and all we can say is wow!!! Bell staff started everything off with great service. The room was more than we ever expected, ocean front view in build six. There was some rehab going on in one build, but it was empty and closed off, and all work ended by 500pm. i see some people complaining about the walk to the pool and beach, we were just about as far away as you could be and it never took more than 5 minutes to get there, it was a very east walk. the pool/beach staff was friendly and professional. The pool is large with waterfalls and slides, and a great kids area away from the adults. Didn't use the restaurants at the hotel, we drove into lahaina. Great night life and all the shopping you would ever need. Hard rock cafe, bubba gump shrimp, chesse burger in paradise great places to eat. also mc donalds, pizzahut and taco bell if you have kids with you. We are planning to return in the next 2 years.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort on three separate occasions. As to the quality, this resort ranks high on our list. One must know what they are expecting when they go to Maui. A relaxed, laid back type of vacation. Our first visit three years ago, we had a beautiful room overlooking the ocean. It was very clean, and the bed was very comfortable. Our next visit one year later, we booked three rooms, and took some friends. Again, accomodations were the same. Then, last year, we went with another couple. Our room was great (garden view), as was our friend's. My wife and I do travel often, and do expect to find some things that we wish were different. But at the Sheraton Maui Hotel, we would not change a thing. If you are looking for the best beach in Kaanapalli, 5 minutes from Lahaina, at a fair price for a resort, this is the pick.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and staff but needs a little work”
Reviews.Author: Toadman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the 2nd week of November 2004. We booked a package deal that included car and came with a $100 hotel credit, which was nice as the restaurants are pricey. Upon check in we were given a garden view room with two double beds in building 3, I asked if we could be given a king. They didn't have anything available but said they would move us the next day. We said fine. Next day, we were moved to a wonderful room on the second floor in building 4 that overlooked the entire beach and ocean. The front desk also gave us two free drink coupons to be used at the two bars located poolside, which we thought was very nice. Our new room was very convenient to pool and beach. We did not expect to be given such a nice room. I have read complaints about bathrooms w/ mold and tired worn furniture and beds but our room was none of those things. The bed was very comfortable. If you get building 4, the rooms closer to the beach are the nicest. Building 3 faces directly towards the beach but is set back about 100 yards. Rooms ending in odd numbers in bldg 3 are mountain/garden views. Even face the ocean. The higher up the better and the closer toward the beach, the better the views. We ate at the hotel terrace restaurant once for dinner and once for breakfast. The breakfast was $47/2 persons and was buffet style w/ made to order omlettes. It was not too bad as far as buffets go but a bit over priced. Head up to CJ Deli and Diner on Kekaa Rd, it's a left turn right after The Kaanapali beach hotel as you are heading south toward Lahaina. Best breakfast for the price plus they do box lunches for $10 that come with a cooler, so you can take it to the beach. Really large portions and very good food. I thought all the staff at the hotel were friendly. I would second the comment about the resort fee. You have to pay for the cabanas and lounge chairs on the beach. $30 for the cabanas and 15 for set of 2 lounge chairs on the beach. At least parking was included. I've stayed at many resorts with the resort fee that did not include parking. The exercise room is also lacking. Needs at least a rack of dumbells. Several exercise bikes, treadmills, stair master but only one set of machine weights. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found!”
Reviews.Author: mammadodds
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Maui many times, and have stayed somewhere different each time. From now on, we will stay at the Sheraton Maui! We found the accomodations to be comfortable, without being stuffy and "overdone". The very best part, though, was the location on Kaanapali beach--the best by far in that area. Just a quick trip out to Black Rock, where the the snorkeling was awesome. I love sea turtles, and saw them almost every day. We didn't eat at the resort much, so I can't really comment on the restaurants, but we liked walking up the beach to some great ocean front dining, or driving the short distance into Lahaina for food and night time fun. We would recommend this resort to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star resort”
Reviews.Author: wavefinder
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed in May for six days. We had two ocean view rooms. The bath tubs had mold around them in both rooms. Because it was our 30 aniversity they gave us a bottle of champagne..retail twelve dollars. The rooms were total ..$800 a night. When we went to the pool we were told we had to wear plastic wrist bands..so we could use the beach and the pool. They didn't want to have people not staying at the resort using the pool. Instead of having security to do this job ..they were having their guests walk around looking as they were at a cheap water park. When I mentioned to the pool personnel that this was very tacky..they ignored me. Their Japanese restaurant was not staffed properly. We had the first seating. No one came for drink orders. We had to ask them for them while we ordered our food. The food was good but the staff never came back again to ask if we would like another drink. They also never asked what we wanted for desert which was included in the dinner. One time I was having trouble getting into my room with my card..I went to the room one away from mine where a maid had left the door open while she was cleaning it. I yelled in for help with the door and she yelled back .."just a minute I'm using the bathroom". So if none of these things would bother you..go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great but not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been reading the reviews here over the past year so wasn't too surprised at the lack of luxury at the Sheraton. The good points was the hotel being a low rise, it did look a lot better than its high rise neighbours and also being close to Black Rock. Like others have mentioned, it was a bit of a maze to get from your room to the pool and whilst we are in our 30s was not too much of a problem but for older folks may be a bit much. The pool was beautiful and we really enjoyed swimming in it every day. The pool sunbeds though did leave a lot to be desired. A lot of the beds with the umbrellas were broken and all the beds were very gruppy. Plus they were all tied together so you couldn't move them and they were right next to each other. Another downside is many of the guests would leave the hotel towels on the beds from first thing in the morning and either wouldn't come back at all or returned at the end of the day. Very frustrating when there was such a lack of useable beds. We had booked a king ocean front and were upgraded to a 2 double bed ocean front room. Whilst a fine big room and bathroom, we did want the king size and plus it wasn't really necessary for us to have a second double bed. The room was tired but you can see the Sheraton are in the middle of renovation so hopefully this will improve in the future. We did have unusual odours in our hallway but the housekeeping sorted this out immediately. Another gripe we had was the daily $12.50 resort charge which covered free local calls, coffee sachets (two) provided in the room, daily local newspaper and free parking. Any hotels I have stayed in the past automatically provide all these services free of charge or as part of their room charge. Again, agree with our reviews that the service around the pool etc, was very poor and to try and get the attention of the waitresses was unbelievable even though you were sitting right near the bar. A few other guests also complained about this. For evening entertainment at the Sheraton, its an early affair and everything pretty much finishes by 10pm. Whalers Village isn't too bad but apart from the three restaurants and shops, does not offer much else. We used to head to Lahaina each night (about $10 in a cab) which had much more to offer. Nearly all the restaurants we ate at were of a good standard but nothing outstanding. Being from Ireland/UK, we were disappointed that there were no bars or pubs and to have just a drink, you had to use the bars in the restaurants which wasn't exactly our cup of tea. The best one for just a drink was the Hardrock Cafe. Would definitely recommend the Helicopter trips. We did ours with Sunshine Helicopters and booked it through Tom Bareback Cashback Tours in Lahania (about the only operator that doesn't try and sell you a timeshare!). We did the Hana Highway Express trip but after doing the helicopter ride, it was a bit of a let down. For breakfast, we continued past Black Rock and up to a cafe bar called the Castaway which was recommended to us by a local and definitely did great food. Plus a fraction of the price compared to Sheraton's breakfast. Whalers Village has an ABC store so stock up on your water, etc from there as the hotel will charge $5 for a bottle of water. Also, there is a 24 hour Safeway in Lahaina. Even though we had a good time ourselves and the beaches, etc were fabulous. I definitely would not be returning to the Sheraton or Ka'annapli as its a bit too touristy/commercial for me. For families though, its probably ideal as there's a lot to offer for children at the various hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great place, but a nice place.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bell staff friendly and check-in okay. Had ocean-view room as requested (and paid for) but, two doubles instead of the requested King. Wife was told no bed guarantee over internet but we were moved to a king, ocean view room the following day. Unlike the first room, this room was in the back of the complex and did have an ocean view if you were willing to stand at the rail and look around the untrimmed vegetation. I convinced my wife to not complain again as I wasn't sure how much further away we would be moved third time around. We were already much farther away from the lobby area than we had been initially. Both rooms are on the small side for this kind of money with very basic (read uncomfortable) sitting furniture but, they were clean with no unpleasant aromas. The beds were comfortable. Room staff was also very polite and friendly. We had an opportunity to endure a dinner in the restaurant. Very pricey and understaffed with slow service and a meal that was similar in quality to the 24-hour stateside chain that begins with a "D". Had gift certificates for the same restaurants buffet breakfast. (Otherwise we were not willing to spend the $50.00 not including tip for two!) This time the "D" chain restraurant had them beat hands down with a better selection and better quality food. The omellette was good considering that the chef appeared like he would much rather be doing anything else but cooking. As this is a semi-outdoor arrangement there is a problem with "guest" control. There were sparrows everywhere. You didn't dare move more than three feet away from your food lest the invasion begin. Eat with one hand, swat at the birds with the other. I'm being very polite and kind. None of this was a problem to the staff or management . It was business as usual for them. We don't intend to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay here at the Sheraton in Maui was terrific. Check-in was a breeze....and we were upgraded to a great oceanfront room. That area of the property is very secluded from the rest with a private wrap around drive to it that makes it more fun. But to get from your room to the pool.....get ready to walk. You have to take a elevator, walk, take a elevator, walk and then take another elevator and walk. Its interesting to say the least but not too huge of a deal. The pool is great, buy a couple of cocktails and walk it, don't skip the mini-slide! Right at the beach is OK snorkeling at Black Rock. Also if you don't mind walking a bit, at night its fun to walk south on the beach path down to the Whalers Village for a little shopping and they have great restaurants there. Also for a big treat, definitely take your rental car over to Paia to eat at Mama's Fish House. That place is amazing!! For other fun we did the bike thing which we recommend and we went to Old Lahaina Luau which we also recommend. Maui is great. We can't wait to come back someday. Have fun whomever is headed there next. We are extremely jealous!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: Kara
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just spent 5 nights of our honeymoon at the Sheraton Maui. I felt it was pretty good but not fabulous. Perhaps it was because we had just spent 3 amazing days at the Hyatt in Kauai. The Sheraton was excellent about upgrading us- we had an amazing ocean front view with the water about 200 feet away. The rooms however were average. Nothing special & the beds were terrible. I was really looking forward to the Sheraton sweet sleep beds that they advertise all over the place & was disappointed when we had an old king bed that sunk in the middle. The Sheraton is so spread out it took us a good 10 minutes to get to the pool & lobby every day. We had to go down the stairs, up the elevator, down the elevator & acroos the lawn. The pool itself was okay. Nothing comparded to the luxury of the Westin or the Hyatt. We walked to the Westin pool almost everyday (they are both Starwood properties so you can use both). And the service at the Sheraton was lacking a little as well. We sat at the pool side restaurant for a good amount of time with waitresses walking by us without any service. I finally got up & got our own menus. My husband & I are in our early 30's so maybe we were looking for a little bit more. I overheard a lot of older couples saying how much they enjoyed the resort so perhaps it was an age thing?! Overall it was a decent stay but I guess I wanted just a little bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Maui was beautiful! We stayed a week (Oct. '04) and couldnt have been happier. The hotel was lovely, we had excellent service, the pool was nice, the beach was great and the snorkeling awesome....saw lots of sea turtles and even a Monk Seal. We ate at the Lelani's one night at Whalers village and it was very nice with great service, we stopped in at Hula Grill often for drinks and again, great service, friendly staff. We have already booked a trip for next year. We loved Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Honeymoon at a Great Resort...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews I was a little nervious about staying at the Sheraton for my honeymoon. But from the minute we arrived on the grounds the staff made us feel at home and we willing to do anything they could to make sure that we had a great stay. I was upgraded from a Garden View room to an Ocean View Deluxe room, being a Starwood Prefered Guest and being on my honeymoon. The facilities at the Sheraton were top notch, with a great pool and a nice beach just a few feet away. Dinning at the resort is expensive, so most nights I traveled to Lahina on the bus that stops by the hotel at 10 till every hour (for $1 a person). This enabled my wife and I to eat more affordable meals along with having a much larger variety of restraunts to choose from. If you are looking for a speacial night I would strongly suggest "Ruth Chrs Steakhouse", it will be a meal to remember. "Cheeseburger in Paridise" is also worth checking out, but don't coming thinking that you are going to be haninging with parrotheads, because this restuarant isn't associated with Jimmy Buffet. My only complaint is that you are charged a $14.95 charge per day for resort services, one would think that these services would be included in the price of the room, but they are not. But this charge is not going to break your bank or ruin you time. All in all the Sheraton Maui is a great resort, my wife and I had a great 10 days there and would strongly recommend it to anyone. Don't let poor reviews scare you away from this resort, you would miss out on a great time. Plus, to you really trust anyone who manages to have a bad time in Maui? I wouldn't.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui for our honeymoon September 6 for 6 nights. We were pleased to have been upgraded to an Ocean Front room. We had a nice view. The room was an average size room. It looked like it was recently updated. The pool was nice, clean and very friendly staff. Expensive pool bar menu but it's MAUI!! get used to it! Awesome cheese burgers and nachos at the pool bar. My husband and I got a massage at the spa and it was excellant Take a walk down to the Westin Hotel and you can use thier pool if you show your room key. They have a waterslide that you have to go down at least once. The Sheraton sat on such nice property. It has the best beach location on all of Kaanappali. There is pleanty of room and chairs around the pool area. At other hotels on the beach all the guests seemed like packed sardines around the pool. All in all Sheraton was a nice stay. I would most definitely stay there again! So much to do in Maui. I reccomend buying the book "Maui Revealed".

Reviews.Title: “Double beds a drawback”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My only question is, why go through an extensive remodel of your hotel and only put double beds in the rooms? There certainly was enough space to put in queen size beds. Our family of 4 stayed for a week recently and overall loved the Sheraton Maui, the beach, pool, restaurants and staff were all wonderful. However, after the second night of squeezing into these beds, we quickly became sleep deprived. We are not large people and the kids are little. We even inquired about upgrading to a larger suite and found out that these too only had double beds. It is the only reason we will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel & activity info - Wonderful Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Maui last year in October 2003 for our honeymoon. We stayed at the Sheraton Maui and had a wonderful time. After a day of flying from Wisconsin to Hawaii we arrived at the hotel in our rental vehicle (a must have in Maui) at about 8:00 pm. We were greeted by a very welcoming staff. When booking our honeymoon through a travel agent we only booked a garden view room, but per the advice of our travel agent we asked about the possibility of an upgrade upon our arrival. The front desk stated the hotel was booked the first 2 nights but said we could be upgraded to an ocean front room for the remaining days of our stay. Our 1st floor garden view room was nice and the hotel had a bottle of champagne waiting for us too. It has a lanai/patio and was next to the croquet lawn. We got the culture/sticker shock of Hawaii when we just wanted some water and ordered 2 bottles of it from room service and it was over $11.00 (we found a pop machine down along the beach walkway that had bottled water at a great price, so we stocked up!) Also - be wary about having your lanai door open because we did find a cockroach in our room. I called the front desk and they apologized but advised those are common in the islands. The next day while we were out the hotel transfered our bags to our new room and we were set in a room with a spectacular ocean view and large bathroom (and no cockroaches!). When we were booking our honeymoon we were debating on whether or not to include the breakfast buffet in the package. We didn't, and although we did eat at it one morning and it was very good I am glad we didn't pay the extra money to have it included. Activities start rather early in Maui because by noon time it is very hot. We were usually on the road to an activity and wouldn't have had time to eat the buffet anyway. We booked our activities through the concierge desk at the Sheraton, and I wish I could remember his name because he was great! He was so helpful and helped us decide on what we wanted to do and then made the calls to arrange everything. He had great advice, especially when we were debating between options because he had done practically all of the activities so he gave us first hand advice. Things we did: *Haleakala (since we were off on the time difference it was perfect opportunity to get up VERY early and drive to the top to watch the sunrise on our first morning. There are biking tours, but we choose to drive ourselves since we had the vehicle). *Luau at the Hyatt Regency. Highly recommend it because it is Hawaii! Also nice because you can just walk down the beach to it. *Snuba & Snorkeling, through Aqua Adventures. Would definitely recommend them over the large boats that take alot of people. The crew with Aqua Adventures were great! I was nervous to Snuba but they helped me and they got to know everybody by their first names. It is a smaller boat (about 20 or so people) so you get great service. *Road to Hana, Beautiful sites! but very curvy road, but very glad we did it. Don't forget to stop and fill up with gas, buy snacks because there are no stores along the way. We also bought the Hana CD that was being sold at a stand next to a gas station and it was helpful. You play it while driving Hana and it points out things we would have missed (you also get a styrofoam cooler w/ ice too.) *Dinner cruise aboard the Teralani 2. This was great! Relaxing dinner and drinks on a boat that was casual. Can't wait to do it again. *4-wheeler adventer ride on Haleakala (then walked over the vineyard next door!) *Surf lesson. Was great fun! The Sheraton has the best beach along the stretch of Ka'annapli. The other hotels seemed very nice too (Westin, Hyatt, etc) but the beach was the biggest at the Sheraton. The Sheraton is spread out with lots of garden and walk ways/grass areas but it does not take but minutes to walk the area. The bartenders were very nice and made great cocktails. The pool area was also very nice and had many chairs spread out around it (in contrast to the other hotels where they had many chairs but were practically on top of eachother). My husband went for a quick swim while I was finishing packing and he said he say something floating in the water, but who knows. Whalers Village is also right down the beach bath and has a couple restaurants and a variety of shops. (We ate at Lelani's and can't wait to go back) All in all we had a great honeymoon and can not wait to go back to Hawaii. We truly enjoyed our time at the Sheraton but there are so many nice hotels in Maui that we may try something new.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice and relaxing environment...”
Reviews.Author: drumeister
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 day stay (9/9 to 9/14) and have to say overall were very impressed with the hotel. My wife and I (no kids) went just to get away from the grind at home and relax and that is exactly what the Sheraton is good for. After reading all the reviews on this webpage, I was a little concerned about certain things but am now very pleased that I overlooked these and came here anyway. Highlites: Upon check in, we were greeted with nice leis and walked right up to registration with no lines. We had booked a partial O/V room, but were immediately upgraded to an O/Front room on the top floor of building 3 (6th floor). The view was very nice although blocked by alot of palm trees (we are in Hawaii, right?), but you could see the grounds, the ocean, and the island of Lanai across the water. The balcony was very small which was a drag as my wife and I like to sit out in the morning with our coffee and enjoy the view. It was hardly big enough for both of us to be out there at the same time! I was told the lower the floor, the bigger the balcony so being at the top I guess that is what we sacrificed. My only other complaint about the room was the size of the bathroom, it was tiny. I could not imagine having a whole family trying to use this let alone just the 2 of us. The room was very clean though and all the fixtures and furniture seemed to be in good shape. We did not have the A/C noise problem that I have read about in several reviews, we slept well. The beds are comfortable but the pillows were not nice to sleep on. If you like a firm pillow, you may want to bring your own, these were so soft it felt like there was nothing there. Overall, the resort was very uncrowded, we found out that they were at 60-65% capacity which was great for us. No offense, but when I go on vacation the last thing I want is a crowded environment or a bunch of kids running around and screaming. It was quiet, mellow, and allowed us to really relax. I don't think I have ever been to a resort that size that was so peaceful! I kept waiting for the traditional party animals to break out in the pool in the afternoon (which usually happens at most resorts) but it never did. The pool was awesome, a large deep 8' pool to swim laps in (if you like) that turns into a floating canal of a river that winds through the property lined by lava rock and waterfalls. My only complaint would be that they need a pool bar of some kind as you have to get out of the pool every time you want a drink and go stand with the people eating their lunches to get a drink. Drink prices are way high, $8-10 a drink. Suggestion for those who like a strong drink: order the "old style mai tai". You will only need one or two of these and you are good to go for the day, wow! Also, the hours of operation of the bars are strange: there are 2 poolside bars and they are both closed by 8pm (one closes at 3pm) with an inside bar closing at 10pm, nowhere to go for a late night drink if you want to wander. You can take the 10 minute walk down to Whalers Village if you want to continue your party or a 5 minute cab ride into La Haina where there are plenty of bars and clubs. Back to the pool..if you lay by the pool the chairs are free and there were plenty of chairs every day we were there, we never had to go without. If you wanted a prime spot (like by the waterfalls) you did have to go down early and claim your spot but it was easy to do. As for the beach chairs, I had a real problem with having to "rent" these. These should be an a first come, first served basis. Paying $30 a day to sit in a chair is outrageous and I could not justify doing it. Sit by the pool for free and walk onto the beach, it is right there! Also be prepared to rent snorkel, fins, mask, rafts, and anything else you want to use in the pool or ocean, none of it is included. I brought my own mask and snorkel and figure I saved myself $75 by weeks end! You will want to snorkel at Black rock and I believe it is one of the best spots on the island to snorkel, and it is right there in front of the hotel! I took a day and went to 2 other places around the island that were recommended to me as the "best" spots and I was disappointed with both as they were not clear and the variety of fish was nowhere as good. At Black rock I swam with Sea turtles, Eagle Rays and dozens of other varieties of tropical fish. I went out at least once a day and was never disappointed. The sunset ceremony each night was a nice touch and a great way to end the day. With acoustic live music and a torch carrier that runs through the resort and up onto the cliffs, lights the torches for the evening right as the sun is setting, then dives into the water was great. We went every night we could and saw some incredible sunsets. As for food, we had the breakfast buffet a couple times and most of it was real good. The omelette bar was great and all the frest fruit and juices were nice. The preheated remainders were a typical buffet type of food. We did have dinner one night in the main restaurant and had a very nice prime rib dinner, and I also experienced an amazing coconut shrimp dinner via room service. Overall, the food was very well presented and very tasty. The staff were great. They were always super friendly, corteous, and always greeted us with a smile and asked if there was anything they could do to make our stay more pleasant. This went on throughout the entire week, we did not have one unfriendly situation. Lastly, if you are going, 2 recommendations: The sunset cocktail cruise on the Terelani 65' Catamaran was a definite highlight of the trip. Drinks, food and a cruise off the coast on a beautiful boat was a perfect end to one of our evenings and last, If you are a scuba diver, I did several dives with LaHaina Divers. It was a great experience, the crew was nice and helpful, the boats were clean, plenty of room and the gear was all up to date. I have been out with many dive companies and these guys were one of the best. Any questions at all, please don't hesitate to email me

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent eight days and seven nights from 8/17/04 - 8/24/04 at the Sheraton, Maui. We were celebrating our 40th wedding aniversery and it was also also our primary vacation during 2004. The Sheraton is a beautiful property, and our ocean front room in building 6 was spectacular. The staff is wonderful, and helped to make our anniversary/vacation a splendid experience that we will cherish forever. When we return to Maui our hotel will definitely be the Sheraton, Maui.

Reviews.Title: “needs updating”
Reviews.Author: mgiedlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton in Maui a few days. I was disappointed in the rooms. They are in desparate need of upgrading. The grout is discolored and cracked, the wallpaper stained and peeling. the A/C unit very loud. The furniture very old and worn. Fortunately the beds and pillows were very comfortable. The hotel has a nice location near black rock and walking distance to Whaler's village. The pool is lagoon style and very layed back. The Sheraton allows you to use its sister property at the Westin. That place is much nicer than the Sheraton, at least on the outside, I can't vouch for the rooms, and the pool is great. I guess it depends on what you are looking for in a hotel. The Sheraton was expensive and quiet, the westin had lots of activities and was busy.

Reviews.Title: “The Sheraton Maui really 'wowed' me!”
Reviews.Author: UnbiasedReviewer
Reviews.Content: GREAT HOTEL!! My family and I spent the last week of August here. The staff is excellent and you can tell they really want you to have an enjoyable time and come back. The Sheraton has a wonderful, one-of-a-kind location at the end of Kaanapali beach resort area. The hotel is built into a hillside like something you might see in Mexico. It was completely renovated in 1997. The vibe at the hotel is very "laid back" and unpretentious, with lots of open space. The pool is large, "lagoonlike" and hasn't been overdone. The beach is beautiful and there is good snorkeling at "black rock" in front of the hotel. The views are awesome from many of the rooms. There are many extras here: a singer at the lagoon bar in the late afternoon, the cliff diver ceremony at sunset, dinner entertainment, and a well-staffed, very helpful concierge staff. There is tennis and golf on-site, as well as a fitness center. The food at the hotel is good and a "kids eat free" program was offered during our stay. The breakfast buffet was a great way to start the day. There are also a wide variety of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel at Whaler's Village. Nearby in Lahiana, we liked Aloha Mixed Plate and Cool Cats. In planning your trip, I recommend the Pacific Whale Foundation's boat trips/snorkeling. They provide the snorkel gear and our family really enjoyed the trip. Whether you're planning to sightsee on Maui or just relax on the beach, this hotel is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Week”
Reviews.Author: Sleepy_Guy
Reviews.Content: Spent last week at the Sheraton Maui. The whole family received a nice lei from the parking valet. We checked in at the valet's desk and were immediately whisked to our room. Valet parking is free the first night. After that, you either self-park for free or pay $5 a day for valet. We were automatically upgraded to a "junior" suite. It was very nice. Being on the ground floor on the ocean side, it was very convenient to the pool and beach, but didn't have much of a view. We asked the valet to have a roll-away bed and crib brought to the room, and when we got back from dinner, both were in place as promised. The room itself had a nice "living" area with a couch, chair, coffee table, entertainment center, and a good-sized TV. Off to the side was a kitchenette with sink, refrigerator and microwave. We put these to use and saved some money on breakfasts and lunches. The living area was separated from the bedroom by a solid-core door. The bedroom was large, with a king size bed and plenty of space besides. There was another smaller TV in the bedroom. The bathroom was off of the bedroom and was fairly large. Our first-floor room was obviously meant to qualify as a handicapped room, because handrails were everywhere in the bathroom. The single sink was also the kind one could roll a wheelchair under. This was not as nice as a cabinet would have been, but understandable under the circumstances. The room was quite clean, the furnishings were up-to-date, and all the finishes were in good condition. A few very minor complaints: we were next to the self-service guest laundry and we sometimes heard the quarters dropping into the machines, the bedroom AC rattled sometimes, and I never figured out some of the light switches. The grounds were spacious and beautiful. Large open areas made for a relaxing feel. We all loved the big winding pool - we couldn't tear our three-year-old away from the little slide the entire week. The location near black rock is ideal. The snorkeling is good near the rock - we saw sea turtles, manta rays, and the usual tropical fish. The kids loved the koi fish ponds near the restaurants. Ask a waiter for fish food around 9:45 AM. The live music after 4 PM was very nice. I really enjoyed lazily floating in the pool's waterways, looking at the gorgeous scenery, and listening to the music. The food at the restaurants was generally good, but not great. Some of the hot items on the breakfast buffet were quite dry. The teppan-yaki place was fun, but most of the food tasted the same. The angus beef burger on the lunchtime grill menu was actually very good. Prices are high, but not too over-the-top when compared to the rest of the island. All the staff members were very helpful and polite. The beach concierge staff at the kiosk were kind and efficient. The front desk staff arranged for a very late checkout since we had a red-eye flight home. I agree that the Sheraton should just roll the "resort" fee into the price of the room. Calling it out as a separate line item makes me look for the specific ways it is applied. The only thing it really seems to get you is the daily paper (all ten or so pages of it). They try to say it gives you the right to park your car yourself (uh, thanks?) and have a safe in your room (yawn). If they just increased the price of the room by $15 bucks it would leave a better feeling. All in all, we really enjoyed the Sheraton and would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overcrowded; the pool needs an update; showers with low water pressure; average room; nice beach; noisy music around the pool; the cocktails were way too sweet; breakfast was nice (for every paying adult (around $20) one kid eats free); self parking. Overall feeling - disappointment. I won't return to this hotel. Last but not least - in my view the Wailea area (south Maui) is much nicer/relaxing than the Kaanapali area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the resort, grounds, people.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton for 9 nights and had a great time. The grounds and beach are the best around. Drive 5 minutes to shopping, restaurants etc. Short walk to Wallers Village with restaurants and shopping. Great place to vacation. Rooms a little outdated and could use some fixing but overall great place and would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: arlenejoe
Reviews.Content: 9 days in Maui was just what a doctor would order for our family. The Sheraton Maui is in a great location for snorkeling, jogging, and light shopping entertainment. The pool system is fun and large - not your boring rectangular shape. But Maui in early August is busy busy busy and hot. Lounge chairs by the pools are at a premium, and non-existent by 10 am. Restuarants are packed, and there are many cars on the road. The crowds are a real contrast to our November and early June visits to the island. But back to the Sheraton - additional plusses are the excellent housekeeping service, the small refrigerator in the room, and easy self-parking. The two major downsides are the quality of the in-hotel restaurant (high prices with surprisingly bad food) and the ridiculous $15/day fee for "free parking, local calls, and newspapers." In addition to the already high room prices, a rollaway cot would have cost us another $50/night. There are other excellent values in the area that I would use next time, giving up mainly the Sheraton's fun pool system. If you have cash to burn, make a reservation at Roy's Restaurant - wonderful! If you're on a budget, check out Aloha Mixed Plate in Lahaina - absolutely the best local food and service! The only other comment I'd like to make is to remind visitors to respect the culture of the islands - I saw too many instances of rude mainlanders, demanding hotel guests, and fast drivers, all acting like Ugly Americans. Hawaii is home to a gentle, low-key culture of friendly, trusting individuals - when visiting the islands, try to appreciate and become part of that culture - it does a body good.

Reviews.Title: “classy, low key and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: happyfuntime
Reviews.Content: This was the most relaxing, enjoyable vacation our family has ever experienced. First, join the Starwood Guest Program and get a free upgrade. Our room was 2nd floor oceanfront with a tranquil view of the neighbor islands. The other big name hotels on Kaanapali seemed so "overdone" -- almost Disneyland-ish -- compared to this one.
