The location is perfect and it has the best beach on Kaanapali. I loved strolling along the mile long oceanfront promenade. We stayed for six nights and were able to make many interesting day trips due to the convenient location. Additionally, the evening torch lighting ceremony on Black Rock was sooooo cool.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 night stay at the Sheraton Maui resort. What a great place to stay! The resort has beautiful grounds, and the best beach in the area. We found the resort to be well kept and very clean. We are members of the Starwood Guest program. One of the perks for members is express check-in, which was very nice after a long flight We had an ocean front room on the 6th floor of building 4. The view from our balcony was fabulous. The room overlooked the pool and beach with the mountains off to the left.The room looked to be freshly renovated, and was very comfortable and clean. The room had a terrific bed, a small refrigerator, and a large balcony with table and chairs.The pool is large, and winds thru the resort, but get there early if you want chairs The resort is close to everything, and is just a short distance down the beachwalk to Whalers Villiage. The restaurants at the Sheraton were very good, but expensive. Whalers Village also has some terrific places to eat. We were very pleased with our stay, and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Family Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: CDuerr
Reviews.Content: Just back from a six day stay at the Sheraton Maui (August 1st-7th) with my wife and two children, ages 8 and 9. To be honest, I did not know what to expect after reading so many widely differing reviews on here. Needless to say, I was very, very pleased. During our stay, we checked out every property on Kaanapali and the Sheraton fit our needs best. That's not to say that the other properties weren't nice or didn't have their merits, just that the Sheraton seemed to offer the best mix. It is a beautiful facility with outstanding location; more then that however, the Sheraton, unlike the Westin in particular, had the right mix of things going on without the overwhelming intensity and feeling of crowdedness that plagued the Westin. Getting a pool chair at the Westin was like going to war. Doing likewise at the Sheraton (a better overall pool, minus the Westin's thrilling waterslide...a must do!!!) was easy to do until late into the morning. The rooms at the Sheraton are nice enough, although we were only in ours to sleep and shower. The bathrooms had a large amount of space. The beds were decent and the decor was passable, if just a little dated. The only real issues we encountered were a toilet that was almost impossible to flush and a widely malfunctioning safe. The on-site food ranged from decent to good. The breakfast buffet was quite tasty and relatively affordable since the kids eat free with a paying adult. We ate dinner one night at Teppan Yaki Dan, which featured much better food then I expected (although my wife was hit by a flying piece of hot lobster...a casuality we overcame with the Sheraton picking up the cleaning bill) Other highlights included outstanding snorkeling every morning off Black Rock (we saw countless fish, nearly a dozen sea turtles, an eel something that looked like a barracuda and a manta ray..but sadly, no sharks) My recommendation is to go early in the morning (we went at 6:00am) and swim completely around Black Rock for the best encounters. The concierge was very helpful and the pool and snorkel rentals very good as well. My only real beef with the Sheraton was the meager facility it tries to pass off as a workout room. The Westin's was far superior and far busier. Other then that, stay here and you won't be disappointed. We certainly weren't.

Reviews.Title: “Overcrowded and Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: xcone
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our honeymoon where we stayed at the Sheraton. The beach and water was so crowded we walked away from the hotel in order to find a place to sit and swim. Also, though the room was a nice oceanfront, it was a 15 minute walk to get to the front desk and the people at the desk were unhelpful. We had many problems, like the person assigned to call us and welcome us, left messages before she met us, and then after she met us, she kept calling and saying she would like to meet us. She wasn't able to book activities nor restaurant reservations so she was useless to us. The room came with a coupon for champagne. Yet we couldn't get it before 6pm, when we wanted it at 5pm. They told us we could come and get it ourselves from room service but when we went to get it, they didn't have it ready, even though we had just called. And why couldn't we have it delivered until 6pm???? It was just really poorly organized and nothing seemed to work well from a service standpoint. This is not a top resort and it was very disappointing as we had just come from the Mauna Kea Beach Hotel on Hawaii, where there is real service and at a lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: coops822
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful stay July 27-31. Beautiful resort, nice pool area, great torch lighting ceremony on Black Rock. Fair snorkeling, sometimes rough surf which is to be expected. Upgraded to deluxe oceanfront, well worth it. Room was fantastic, views were incredible. Staff are courteous and helpful. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place on Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: Live2Travel95616
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui in June, 2004. We arrived early and had to wait until about 3:30 for a room. However, they comped us cocktails, and the kids went swimming while we waited. Nice lei greeting at checkin. The whole hotel seems to have been recently renovated--everything looks clean and fresh. Beautiful landscaping, wonderful pool. Spacious grounds and right on the beach. We had the lowest category of room (standard, garden view) but we thought it was fine. The garden view is very lush and peaceful. All rooms have a good-sized lanai and a refrigerator. Watch the "kids eat free" policy--this only applies to certain menus so ask. Food and beverage was excellent and reasonable for a luxury resort. You have pool privileges at other Starwood hotels--don't miss the Kapalua Bay Hotel--gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Great Island, Great Beach, Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently honeymooned here. Our oceanview room on the 6th floor was comfy and the view was spectacular! The water was a bit rough for snorkeling during our visit, but Kaanapali beach was great for bodysurfing. The Sheraton occupies the best location on Kaanapali, hands down. Although we usually like to sleep in while on vacation, we made a point of getting up in time for breakfast each morning because of the delicious fruits, juices and other goodies available on the buffet. POG, we discovered, is a combination of pineapple, orange and guava juice. Apparently this is something that Hawaiians commonly drink, and we can certainly understand why! Regardless of where you stay on Maui, splurge on dinner at "Mama's Fish House." It is a romantic and wonderful restaurant on the north coast of the island. The seafood is wonderful and the mai tais were the best we had the whole trip! For a very reasonable meal in Lahaina, try "Aloha Mixed Plate" (get the coconut shrimp). You MUST visit Hana and the seven pools...the narrow and winding roads are a little scary but the views are worth it! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: khaney50
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a wonderful trip to Maui. We spent 6 days and 5 nights at the Sheraton Maui. I would have to say this is probably the best vacation during our 30 years of marriage. The staff from housekeeping to the bellman were helpful and friendly and tended to our every needs. Upon check-in, I asked for an upgrade from a partial ocean view to a ocean view(SPG-free if available) and was told they were 100% booked. They suggested that I check back the next day around 1:00 p.m. Guess what, the ocean view was available. Try snorkeling around Black Rock. If you do not like the beach, try the pool. I would suggest that you get to the pool early because the choice spots are taken by 8: a.m. Although our plane did not leave until 11: p.m. and check out is 11:00 a.m., we were allowed to continue to use the pool until we left plus take a shower and change clothes in the exercise room. Keep up the good work!! I will continue to use Starwood based upon my experience at the Sheraton Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: JREISKIN
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was wonderful-the room, the service, the ambiance, the pool and the restaurant. The staff aimed to please and the setting of this hotel is the best in all of Ka'anapali. We stayed for only three days and wished we had booked it for a week. Would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at the Sheraton Maui”
Reviews.Author: heartfortravel
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Sheraton late June and early July. We used points for most of our stay and paid with the 35% special for the rest of the stay. We were upgraded to a deluxe oceanfront room for the whole stay, even though I tried to upgrade with points five days out and was told there would be no upgrades due to a sold out resort! We were in building 6 right out on black rock point. The views were amazing. The beach is very nice and the charges for beach chairs and unbrellas did not bother us since we knew about it beforehand. Also had no trouble getting chairs by the pool. They were plentiful all day. We stayed here because it was Starwood(we had points) and for the location and beach, which could not be beat in Kaanapali. We snorkeled several days and always saw fish and sometimes sea turtles. We ate the breakfast buffet twice and thought it was great. We used the fitness center and the business center(where you can download your digital pictures and they will also burn a cd for you). Also saw Jennifer Love Hewit at the pool two days. Housekeeping was immaculate. The hotel decor and grounds were lovely, as was our room. Our room had a fridge and microwave. The bathroom was very large. The staff was very friendly and did all they could to make our stay pleasant. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Cdngirl76
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Sheraton, even though I was worried from the other reviews here. The room, grounds, pool, beach and restaurants were excellent! We checked in at 1pm but our room wasn't ready yet. So it wasn't as seamless to check in since we had to return to pick up our luggage later, then check in, etc...but the staff was great and we got upgraded to a partial oceanview room without even asking (we had only asked for a King bed). The room was in building 3 (6th floor), and we had the best view! Lovely view of the ocean and mountains/golf course. The room itself was in perfect condition, very nicely decorated. I believe that this building has recently been renovated since they were painting some rooms on the 1st floor. There was a mini-fridge and safe that were very useful. The only thing we would have liked was more hooks for wet clothing/towels, and a temperature setting the A/C (if was either on or off, warmer/cooler but didn't stop automatically when cool). The grounds were spectacular, everything looked perfect, the pool was fun and never really crowded for swimming. The beach chairs (ones with a cover for sun) were reserved pretty early in the morning (8am), but some would free up in the afternoon. The drinks at the bar were very expensive, but the service was great and friendly everywhere at the hotel. The food at the buffet (morning) was very good, we enjoyed this very much, and even sat at a table beside Jennifer Love Hewitt one morning. We didn't eat at the other restaurant (or any other time), but the restaurants were very nice and partially outside. Overall, we really enjoyed staying at the Sheraton, its location and the beach were perfect and we had fun snorkelling at Black Rock (although it wasn't the best snorkelling we found).

Reviews.Title: “The best resort at Kaanapali! amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Maui Resort is by far the best hotel on Kaanapali. We loved the personal attention to service and the huge beach. The hotel was very clean and the pool area is the only one we've been to that dosen't have sandwiches molding everywhere. Our family checked in early and our room was ready. We had an ocean view Ohana Suite because I have three kids. The room was huge with a murphy bed and two queens. The room featured a dinning room, living room, kitchenete, and large marble bathroom with a tub and sperate shower. The view of the ocean was amazing. Our room was cleaned everday and the service was impeccable. What ever you asked the hotel did. The pool was great and unlike the Hyatt or Westin we didn't have to wake up at 6:00 AM to claim our chairs. My kids had a plast swimming down the laggoons and jumping off waterfalls. The pool service was perfect and we didn't have to fight for a waitor. The beach is the best in Kaanapali. The beach is literally huge and the hotel rents lounges on the beach. They also provide the pool service for those who rent beach lounges. It really shows why the hotel and beach were on the Travel Channel for best beach service hotels in Hawaii. At the hotel you can rent snorkel gear to snorkel at Black Rock right in front of the hotel. It was an amazing experience and there were swarms of fish. You can'y do this at the beaches in front of the Westin, Marriott, or Hyatt. Also my sister-in-law who was staying at the Fairamont visited us at the Sheraton and said she is staying here from now on. The hotel only is four stories and its private location at the north end of the beach makes it feel more secluded than other hotels that are 6 stories and crammed in. The food, rooms, location, and service definatly help make this a beautiful top Maui resort. There was so much my family enjoyed on this vacation and we won't ever forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice grounds - Quick spot for diving / snorkeling”
Reviews.Author: SirLunchAlot
Reviews.Content: First, I agree with other reviewers about the rooms. Worst of our 5 hotels (all resorts or 4-5 stars) we stayed at during our Hawaiin Island hops. BUT, everything else was great! But, I loved the ease of leaving the room and being in great diving / snorkeling at Black Rock within 60 seconds from my room. The Staff was the most courteous of all our hotels and we had our best welcome here, while some Hawaii hotels gave us the priceline shunning. Food pretty good and the maze of pools was fun. Nice sunsets and the evening ceremony for Black Rock was overated but cool.

Reviews.Title: “Prettiest Place I have ever been”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went for our honeymoon and had a wonderful time. Well worth every dime we spent. Staff was wonderful, the hotel was breathtaking. We loved every minute.

Reviews.Title: “Nice beach (although to crowded), but terrible rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On our honeymoon we stayed at the Sheraton Maui in Lahaina. We had booked an ocean view room, but after checking in, our view of the ocean was not at all what we had envisioned. We were on the ground floor looking at a couple palm trees and 95% green grass and the concierge's hut. After reading through the Sheraton's satisfaction guarantee, we decided to ask for an upgraded room. We were met with a bit of opposition and told an upgrade might not be possible due to overbooking. After much debate, we got our way, and we moved the following day to the 6th floor, directly above our previous room. The hotel clerk assured us that it was a much, much nicer room. Well if losing about 25% of the previous room's size and 75% of the balcony meant nicer, than I guess that's what we got! I called the front desk again and they transferred me to the manager (which in all honesty, I don't believe I was speaking to the manager). I was told that our "upgrade" was the view and that the actual rooms got smaller the higher the level of the building. The view was much better, but it still wasn't what we wanted. So, I asked for a suite and I was told they were all sold out and there was nothing else they could do. Some satisfaction guarantee huh? lol Also of note. The rooms themselves were not very clean. Our bathroom in both rooms were filthy. The light fixtures literally had a coating of dust on them. The pillows on the beds are more or less worthless. They are like sleeping on pieces of paper with the way they disperse when you lay on them. Maybe we were being a bit to picky, but when you're on your honeymoon, you want it to be absoultely perfect. Oh well, you live and you learn. The beach and water is very nice though. Perfect for snorkeling and scuba diving. Tons of activities line the beach and shopping and dining is all within walking distance. Regardless, of the pros, the cons far out weigh them. This is one hotel we will not return to.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maui is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great experience at the Sheraton Maui. The grounds were beautiful, the service was great. I really loved the pool the most. Their breakfast buffet was so good, we ate there every morning. I also visited the spa for a pedicure, which turned out great. I would definitely recommend this property to anyone headed to the Lahaina area.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, Great service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton has the best location on Kaanapali Beach. We could see Black Rock from our room and the beach and great snorkeling areas were steps from our building. We talked to people staying at the Hyatt and they were complaining about how bad the beach was in front of their hotel. The Hyatt and Marriott have incredible pools if that's important to you. The Sheraton pool is large and has a lazy river but nothing compared to the waterfalls and pirate ship at the Hyatt and Marriott. The Hyatt's grounds were incredible with lots of exotic animals and beautiful gardens. The Sheraton is one of the oldest hotels in the Kaanapali Beach area but they keep it up nicely, have a beautiful location, and have the best beds. We were lucky and had an ocean front suite with an amazing view. Our room was great but I don't know what their standard rooms are like.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Maui Hotel - Lahaina We arrived to a very easy check in complete with leis. The set up for rooms is a bit confusing but we found our room easily after the first day-the place is big and the buildings are numbered.... The rooms are older but very nice with beautiful views. For snorkling on the island, one of the best sites is right in front of the hotel . There is a mall within walking distance-you can walk on the path on the beach to the stores and restuarants. When we checked in we were to receive a king size bed. The room had 2 doubles and we were told none were available "maybe tommorrow." Despite the "sheraton guaratee "posted all over we never got our king bed or did they do ANYTHING to compensate for the problem. Great setting but don't expect much from Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck. Rooms are gross. Nice grounds.”
Reviews.Author: BWSanJose
Reviews.Content: Our vacation rental wasn't ready in time so we booked a night at the Sheraton Kaanapali. We had an ocean front room, $580 a night, TINY. The bathroom was disgusting - equiv. to a cheap apartment. This place was just really cheesy. However the grounds were gorgeous. They charged $30.00 a day to lay in a cabana chair on the beach. Lame. I would way rather stay at the Four Seasons Wailea......

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our 25th anniversary...”
Reviews.Author: Sussssy
Reviews.Content: ...a great resort without being pretentious and full of *fluff stuff*. The setting was idllyic, the location was convenient and every single staff member was friendly and helpful. Now we know what aloha really is! I researched a lot on here and the net, and it was well worth my time. We got upgraded to an ocean view, as well as champagne. Mahalo, Sheraton :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, beautiful facilities, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week long vacation staying at the sheraton. This is our second trip to maui and our second time at this hotel. we also stayed at the hyatt for awhile. I have to say that this property is still one of the best in kaanapali! One of the best location for all your amenities. Great snorkel location without having to sail to another location, great beach, and great pools. There is a section of the pool for kids but the pools are certainly not entertaining enough for young kids. No slides or diving areas. You can instead cliff dive off the black rock for your fun and adventures. Within walking distance to several restaurants, whalers village, and other properties. This property makes you feel like you're at a resort. Love the stay at one, play at all idea (you can use the facilities such as pool, gym, etc. at 3 other properties which are all vastly different). Other reviews worried me because of the room descriptions. Unfortunately, I had a great room and it was only a view of the mountain side. My bathroom could have been better but no complaints...just upgrade. Staff was friendly and attentive and the conceirge was very helpful with all events. However, take advantage of a 90-minute time share presentation and get discounts on all your activities...it's well worth the discounts. In fact, go to town and sign up for your activities there to get the best discounts. Overall, the Sheraton was an excellent choice. Check it out yourself at a virtual tour on any travel website.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to Sheraton Maui for a family vacation. Booked connecting rooms for the grandparents to tag along. As mentioned, the checkin is seemless and attentive but the rooms were worse than average. Very dated with peeling wall paper. The beds were so uncomfortable with springs poking into your back all night. It wasn't until the last night that we realized that they offered featherbeds if you called housekeeping. Helped but would have been better if the beds were just replaced. Also, we blew the circuit in our rooms whenever we used the outlets in the bathrooms at the same time. Totally unacceptable for a "resort" The pools were fun and the kids loved the little waterslide. Perfect for my 2 year old. Snorkling at Black Rock was definetly a bonus since it was just steps from our door. Overall thought the experience was less then thrilling and next time would not stay at this resort. We did spend one afternoon at the Westin and that was a nice experience (although a little more crowded).

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the Sheraton Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Daqcraig
Reviews.Content: I have traveled many times to Hawaii and after reading some of the reviews was nervous about staying at the Sheraton Maui. I have stayed in virtually every hotel on Waikiki Beach and would say the Sheraton Maui ranks right up there with the best on both the islands. My stay was in early April 2004. Our room was ocean front in building 6 on top of the black rock. I admit I am partial to Sheraton Hotels as we stayed at the Royal Hawaiian on Waikiki after we left Maui. Having said that, we truly enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton Maui and will return next year for a longer stay on Maui. Please feel free to Email me if you have specific questions. My wife and I are in our late forties and had four generations of our family join us at the Royal Hawaiian on Waikiki. Next time, we will all meet up at the Sheraton Maui. Shaka.

Reviews.Title: “Second Honeymoon at the Sheraton was Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the most wonderful second honeymoon for our 25th Anniversary at the Sheraton-Maui. The hotel's current marketing slogan is "If everything isn't perfect, just let us know". It was perfect, and beautiful, and the most relaxing week we've ever had. Our deluxe oceanfront room was in Bldg 6 on the 5th floor, which put us right over Black Rock where we could watch the snorkelers, sea turtles and whales from our lanai. The room itself was very nice and clean with a comfortable king-size bed. Didn't spend a lot of time in our room; places to go & things to see. The maze of elevators and and walks through different buildings were difficult to figure out and we laughed each day as we continued to get lost in the hotel, but were treated to different spectacular views. Everything is very open. No closed doors or windows -- the tropical breeze just blows through. Our travel package offered free daily breakfast for 2, which I believed would probably be coffee and rolls. Oh my gosh, it was a full brunch. Delicious fresh food and fruit. Omlets made in front of you from your choice of ingredients, a selection of hot food. We ate a full breakfast every morning, and were not hungry again until dinner at 7:00 or so each night. The nightly torch-lighting and cliff diving ceremony off Black Rock was moving. The entire staff at the hotel was so pleasant -- everyone says Aloha with a smile whenever we passed by. The concierge would come through poolside and ask if she could make reservations for us anywhere or book us on any tours we were interested in for the week. I know it's possible to do Maui on much less money than we spent (and you do spend alot on Maui), but we hadn't been anywhere, just the two of us without any family, since our original honeymoon, and somehow, someday, we're coming back to this island, this hotel, and if possible, our same room. Aloha to all!

Reviews.Title: “Fourteen Years Later We Made to Hawaii for our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been married 14 years and we finally made our dreams come true. We had paid for our own wedding so we could not afford a lavish honeymoon. So when we planned for this trip we went all out. The Sheraton Maui and Sheraton Kauai were both very nice resorts. The surroundings at both resorts are beautiful. We did not spend a lot of time on the grounds because we were always on the run going on tours. Although the time that we were at the resorts the pool and beach area was very nice and the staff was courteous. Overall, I would give the Sheraton Maui a 9 and the Sheraton Kauai a 8. We were pleased with our experience and maybe for our 25th anniversary we will make it back once the kids are done with college. My brother and his wife watched our kids so it was a real "honeymoon"!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Maui Stay”
Reviews.Author: cy33
Reviews.Content: We just came back from the Island, our first time @ Kaanapali's Sheraton. We'd booked 3 ocean-view rooms, and were very pleased to be upgraded to ocean-front rooms, next to the Black Rock. The setting - almost smack right on the beach - was simply stunning. We normally stay at the top-rated 4-Seasons (fully booked because of Easter), but didn't feel any worst off because of the spectacular ocean-front view from our lanai. Some of the other positive things were: being completely relaxed, good food, nice staff, excellent shops nearby... Some detracting things were: less-than 5-star quality of the rooms, and the lack of 24-hr. room service for the resort. However - comparing the two resorts - the 4-Seasons is generally "over-the-top", upscale and very "Beverly Hills". Prada, Gucci, LV, etc., fashionable wear are at home there. Whereas, the Sheraton is much more family-oriented and down-to-earth "Hawaiian". The next time I come to Maui again, I would seriously debate with myself the merits of choosing Sheraton simply for it's ocean-front rooms over that of the 4-Seasons. Also, whether I would like to be pampered & fed like a Prince at the latter, or simply be in tune with the waves & the beach at Sheraton. I just wish Starwood would spend some bucks to upgrade their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton needs to clean up their act.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Maui for 7 nights in March of 2004. When we first arrived, after a 17 hour travel day, we were taken to our room which was small, but had a pretty view of the grounds and the ocean. My husband noticed stains on the carpets, but it wasn't until we started to unpack that we realized there was only a small closet in the bathroom, and no place for our suitcases. There were also water stains on the bathroom wallpaper, which was also torn, and an air intake vent that was clogged with dust and dirt. We stopped unpacking, and called down for another room. There was nothing available until the next day. The next day we were moved to another, larger room with a beautiful view, but no balcony. Again, we called to ask to be moved. When we booked the hotel 6 months earlier, we were told that all rooms had lanai's. Again, we were told that there was nothing available until later in the week, if we wanted to move again. At that point, we stayed put, but we were disappointed. The room was non-smoking, but our neighbor next door had a lanai, and sat out there every evening smoking a cigar. So, most of the time, we needed to keep the slider closed. The staff was friendly, the buffet breakfast was okay, but there were always long lines for the cook station. We won't go back to the Sheraton. It will be a while before we choose to stay at another Sheraton (this was the second one that we found not to be as clean as it should be). We went on to Kauai for 5 nights, to another hotel chain, with a beautiful room, a buffet breakfast or room service, and a beautiful balcony. We'll visit that hotel chain again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This resort is an excellent place to stay...Don't let the few bad reviews sway you! We had some reservations about booking this resort after reading some of the reviews but after our 5 night stay (03/13/04 to 03/20/04) at the Sheraton Maui I would say that it is one of the best places to stay at if you are staying in the Lahaina area. The beach in by far the best of any of the resorts on Kaanapali Beach, you are a 5 minute walk from Whalers Village and the property as a whole is spread out very nicely...Its not overcrowded like some of the other resorts in the area. Our room was very clean and has a good size mini-fridge to keep food and beverages in if you'd like. Also, we too were upgraded to a Ocean view room without even asking. The service from the staff was excellent and everyone was very friendly. I can't comment on the restaurants since we went out for all our meals but I didn't hear anyone complain while we were there. The only thing bad thing I can say about this place is that if you want to grab a cup of coffee on your way out in the morning its $3.50, which is ridiculous. I guess you could make your own in your room but who really does that? It's a great place and we have already recommended it to many others!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - better than expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We too heard some odd reviews about the Sheraton Maui - just got back from a 5 night stay (3/6-3/11) - and all I can do is rave. were concerned based on some internet reviews - even tried to change to ritz at last moment - glad we didn't - especially since the ritz had bad weather when we visited (at the point of the island - not shield from the wind) The Sheraton was absolutely wonderful - they upgraded us to ocean view and threw in daily breakfast for two and champagne (i presume because i mentioned it was our anniversary) room was clean - pool rocked - - we just wanted a place to relax and that's what we found - location on beach is great - walking distance to restaurants at whalers village and short drive to lahaina - sounds odd - being right next to black rock was good - especially if you like snorkeling but the black rock itself shielded us somewhat from the wind and rain while we were at the pool - i imagine it might have been heavier just a couple of doors down - decent snorkeling at black rock by the way - big time thumbs up!!!

Reviews.Title: “March, 2004 Visit”
Reviews.Author: RPRINC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here March 4th to the 10th. Beautifull location and grounds. Had breakfast @ the hotel all mornings and food was fantastic. Beach is very good. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Second time and we loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Sheraton Maui. We too are Starwood Preferred Guest Members and received an upgrade from partial ocean view to ocean view. The room was nice but a little on the smaller side however the view from our balcony included the grounds around the pool and the restaurant with a back drop of Kaanapali Beach. We feel the grounds are one of the more beautfil aspects of the hotel -- it's open and spacious and maintained meticulously. Pool is nice but when we were there in mid-February 2004 the resort was at capacity and it was difficult to get a chaise by the pool. All service staff were good. Suggest you go in off season rather than in season. Our first trip to the Sheraton Maui was in the off season and service is a little better when they are not so busy. Great location and Lahaina (a great little town) is just a short drive away. There is a Safeway close by where you can pick up breakfast items, soda, wine or anything you need - they're open 24 hours a day. This helps to save you some dollars rather than paying the higher prices at the hotel for everything. All in all, we love the Sheraton Maui and Maui itself and wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some very negative comments on Trip Advisor about this hotel, I was scared to death that I was booked at the Sheraton. I had spent a lot of money on this trip and wanted it to be perfect. When we arrived, we were surprised to find that as Starwood Preferred members, we had received a double upgrade from our partial oceanview to DELUXE OCEANFRONT! Fabulous view in secluded building 5. One elevator took us to the pool, another elevator took us to the parking lot. Many people complained about that location on trip advisor, but I found it very private and enjoyable. Our room was nice, but not over the top. Bathroom was spacious and the mini kitchen facility was great. We were able to snorkel almost everyday at black rock and rented our equipment for the week at Boss Frog's in Lahaina. We also took the scuba class from 5 star scuba. They were great and we enjoyed it immensely. The pool wasn't as fancy as some, but certainly nice. Due to the layout of the pool, there were lots of areas where you could relax with some privacy and not feel like you were in a huge group. The breakfast buffet was a tremendous added value in our opinion. The food was fresh and had a great variety. Visited Momma's Fish House and had a fabulous lunch for four ($200.00). We drove over to the Grand Wailea while we were there. That was on our list of hotels and we were glad we did not select it. WAY too crowded around the pool area. Beach area was not as nice either. Lots of fun shops in Lahaina. Overall very relaxing and laid back area. Would not recommend Tomato Basil restaurant. Authentic Italian, but food was only average and service wasn't very good. Overall, I would stay at the Sheraton again. I don't know what everybody was complaining about, but our stay was great!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooned in Maui”
Reviews.Author: HopeM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I honeymooned at the Sheraton Maui in August 2003. I found the staff to be very accomodating, but I got sick of hearing about the "Sheraton Promise." The breakfast and dinner buffets in the main restaurant were not so tasty, but the food we ordered from the menu was very good. The beach was unbelievably beautiful and the snorkeling around the black rock right outside the hotel was decent. The pool was also very nice, but a lot of times it was impossible to get a chair. The set up of the hotel is a bit wacky and definately takes some getting used to, but our room was kept clean and stocked. Expect to pay for anything you want to do. It doesn't seem like anything was included in the resort fee. Overall we had a wonderful time. It would be hard to ruin such a beautiful place. I would recommend the Sheraton Maui, but just expect to spend a lot more than just the cost of your room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Awesome property!! Beautiful grounds, friendly service and the best beach in Kannapali. Spent 1 week of our honeymoon in Feb and it could not have been better. Snorkeling right in front of black rock was better than the 2 snorkeling trips I paid to go on. Crystal clear water and a ton of tropical fish. Even saw a sea turtle. The resort charges you a 15 dollar a day resort fee for newspaper, coffee and parking. Beach chair rental on the beach was 2 chairs for 15 daily. The pool area was great. Many spots to choose from along the pool area. The food at the hotel was very good but priced just like any other hotel in the world..HIGH. Take the 5 minute drive to Lahina and have your pick of many fine restaurants and shops. Take a day trip down to Big Beach past Wailea was the best beach I ever saw. Clear Blue water and white sand beach surrounded by mountains. Barely anybody else there. All in all a GREAT TRIP

Reviews.Title: “A couple of complaints”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Maui, stayed at the Sheraton for 6 nights, it is a great place, hard to find your way around in. Our complaints were with the room itself, the walls were filthy in the bathroom, cigarette burns on the carpet even though it was supposed to be a non-smoking room, the window to the lanai was so dirty that you had to open it to see the Ocean. Location, service, food was great. I think the rooms need some attention.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: rumpointsunset
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Sheraton Maui Hotel also. We checked in on Valentines Day and were very happy to find out that out partial ocean view room was upgraded to a deluxe ocean view on the ground floor of building 6 which was on the back side of the black rock. (3 elevators to get to the beach from buildings 5 and 6 but probably only 300 steps to get to the beach. I didn't think it was that bad. It was quiet with private parking.) Every morning we would watch the whales from our lanai and feed the birds. The grounds are beautiful, the beach is one of the best I've seen at a hotel in Hawaii, and the pool is fun. It meanders through the grounds of the hotel with a hot tub and a kiddy slide. The hotel staff has the "aloha" down. They are very nice and helpful. I also met several guests there that were willing to be social, it was a very friendly environment where people just went to relax. The Torch Lighting Ceremony was fun. Drinks at the pool bars are half price during the day making it almost affordable. It seemed like one pool bar had half price from 1:00-3:30 and then the other pool bar had half price for a couple hours after 3:30. The hotel was one of the first built in the area. Our room was clean and updated but the fixtures were original, which was fine. For restaurants, we went to Kimo?s. It was good but I've had better. I thought the portion of fish was small. It was one of the most popular restaurants for diner. Reservations recommended or expect to wait after 5:30. Longhi's was ok. The clams and fish were a little fishy tasting. Both are expensive. If you want a cheep breakfast & dinner & early bird specials, McGillacudy's, upstairs across the street from Kimo's. I liked Cheeseburger in Paradise also, nice view, & evening entertainment. We also liked Giovanni's, on the left as you turn towards the Sheraton off the main road. We like their pizza. If you are willing to drive a about 40 minutes, Joe's in Wailea is expensive $20-32 a plate but has great seafood. I generally don't like the Wailea area, too snobby, but Joe's is great. The Lahaina area is much nicer, friendly, relaxing. I like shopping along the ocean-side boardwalk. Other things to do, we took a day trip to Molokai, taking the ferry in the morning, renting a car there, (Try to get one through Budget if you can. The one we were given through an agency other than Budget had about 75,000 on it. It was basically an island bomb but it got us where we needed to go.) driving seeing the island, and taking the 2pm ferry back. It was nice, the people were friendly and we had huge beautiful beaches to ourselves. We took the Fair Winds II to Molikini. It was a fun trip; we saw LOTS of whales and the captain had a really funny personality. It was one of the bigger, seemed less crowded boat going there. For driving, we liked the road to Hana, several waterfalls, red sand (Koki Beach) & black sand beaches. It will take you about 3 hours to get to the Sacred Pools though. The road is a small 2 lane, most bridges are 1 lane. People drive slow and are courteous. The road north of Lahaina going through Honokowai is more dangerous, few guardrails, one lane portions that are mountain on one side and cliff on the other. The road is paved but it is a little unnerving especially when meeting other cars. Overall, the trip was wonderful and I would go back this moment if I could.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the Sheraton Maui in May 2003. Our room was spectacular, with a beautiful ocean view, and was easily twice the size of the typical hotel room. (We paid for ocean view and may have been upgraded.) Check in was seemless, with the bellman meeting us at our car and taking us directly to our room. Service throughout our stay was friendly and attentive. This hotel is one of the oldest in Maui, but was completely renovated in recent years and the public areas, while not plush, are definitely worthy of a five star resort. In my opinion, the hotel has one of the best locations on the beach - at the quiet end with Black Rock, but within easy walking distance of Whaler's Village, the Westin, the Hyatt, etc. Its pools, while beautiful, are not as elaborate of those of its sister property the Westin. Thus, there are fewer families with children at the Sheraton. However, guests of the Sheraton have full access to the facilities at the Westin and other Starwood properties on Maui. We have visited beautiful resorts around the world, and would happily return to the Sheraton Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Maui and Kauai and stayed here for a total of three days. We bid this on Priceline one month prior and ended up getting it for the rate that seems to be pretty common for it. We were getting married on Maui and were hoping to get a nice room for the stay. My fiance' called ahead and added her Starwood card number to the reservation with the hope of getting some priority but was not too optimistic based on the tone of the girl on the other end. When we checked in, the place was nearly full (Valentine's Day weekend and President's Day weekend) so we were given a garden view room on the second floor of building two facing the tennis courts and a double bed but were told that if we called them Saturday morning (our wedding day), we could probably be accommodated for an upgrade. We weren't overly optimistic since it was Valentine's day and we figured the rooms would probably be packed by then too. We were wrong. We got back late in the day after our wedding festivities concluded and we were upgraded to a magnificent ocean view room suite in the building on top of Black Rock, overlooking the ocean, the entire resort grounds and all of Kaanapali. The room had a private entry shared with one other, much smaller room and ours was about 1500+ square feet with a patio that was close to the size of the entire room we were just upgraded from. They brought up a complimentary bottle of champagne and we relaxed in the room for the remainder of the evening. The most amazing room I'd ever stayed in; easily a $1000/night plus room. All in all, the first two nights we probably could have pushed for a better room if we had wanted but the last night completely made up for it. The staff was extremely helpful and kind once we arrived, the grounds were immaculate and there are numerous things to do on site or by walking down to Whaler's Village (shops and restaurants) about 5-10 minutes down the pathway. Don't be bashful in asking them what you want...they will try to accommodate you however they can and went out of their way for us.

Reviews.Title: “paradise ruined”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: went to the Maui Sheraton in August 2002 for the second part of our Hawaiian vacation. It really ruined the vacation. The lobby was not all that impressive. When we got to our room is smell like urine and there was no lanai as promissed. We did not even let the bell hop leave and called the front desk. I was told that there were no more rooms in my category and that we would have to stay there. I told them that this was unacceptable to either find another room or upgrade me. After 20 minutes the front desk called back and said that the found another room. We went to our room and it felt damp but my wife and I said we would try it. The veiw was of the tennis courts, garbage bins and golf course. I must say though that the beach was magnificent. Although you had to pay 15 dollars a day per person for a lounge chair. That was outragoeous, so we went to the local ABC store and purchased a beach mat. The worst was yet to come, our room was infested by roaches. My wife and I were horrified. We had the creeps staying in that room. We decided not to switch rooms because we did not want to spend a few hours of our precious time packing and unpacking. When I went to see management about it they took a very cavalier attitude about it and suggested that they were some other bugs and not roaches. The nerve. The only thing they offered me was a refund on my $12.50 resort fee for the days that I spent there. I did not feel that this was right. I spent Thousands Going to this supposed First Class hotel and accept for the natural surroundings it could have been any roadside motor lodge. When I came home I wrote a letter to the General Manager and after 2 months got a reply. They gave me 10,000 Starwood points which would not even cover a night in this hotel or other first class starwood properties. My Vacation was ruined. I would not recomend this hotel at all. But stay at one close by and use the beach as everyone else does.
